texts:
Lily was a princess who loved to jump. She jumped on her bed, on the sofa, on the grass and on the trampoline. She wore a shiny crown on her head that sparkled in the sun. She felt happy and free when she jumped.
One day, she went to the park with her mom and dad. She saw a big slide and wanted to try it. She climbed up the ladder and sat on the top. She looked down and saw a lot of kids waiting for their turn. She smiled and waved at them. Then she jumped off the slide and landed on the ground.
But when she got up, she noticed that her crown was gone. She looked around and saw it on the slide. It had fallen off when she jumped. She felt sad and ran to get it. But before she could reach it, a little boy grabbed it and put it on his head. He laughed and said, "This is my crown now!"
Lily was angry and shouted, "No, that's my crown! Give it back!" She tried to take it from him, but he was too fast. He ran away with the crown, dodging the other kids. Lily chased him, but she could not catch him. She felt like crying.
Then she saw a little girl who was watching the whole thing. She had long brown hair and big blue eyes. She was wearing a pink dress and holding a teddy bear. She looked adorable. She walked up to Lily and said, "Hi, I'm Anna. I saw what happened. That was not nice of him. Do you want to be my friend?"
Lily nodded and smiled. She said, "Hi, I'm Lily. I'm sorry for yelling. I really like my crown. It was a gift from my grandma. She said it makes me look like a real princess."
Anna said, "You don't need a crown to be a real princess. You are a real princess because you are kind and brave and fun. And you can jump really high. I like jumping too. Do you want to jump with me?"
Lily said, "Yes, I do. Thank you for being so nice to me. You are a real princess too. And you are adorable."
They hugged and ran to the trampoline. They jumped and laughed and played together. They forgot about the crown and the boy. They were happy and free. They were best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his toy bow and arrow. He would run around the yard and pretend he was a brave hero. One day, Tim saw a big, persistent bug near his toys. Tim did not like bugs, so he screamed for his mom.
Tim's mom came outside and saw the bug. She knew that Tim was scared of bugs, so she told him to use his arrow to get rid of the bug. Tim thought this was a great idea. He picked up his arrow and aimed it at the bug. With a big push, the arrow flew through the air and hit the bug.
The bug flew away, and Tim was very happy. He had saved his toys from the persistent bug. Tim's mom was proud of him for being so brave. From that day on, Tim knew that he could be a hero with his arrow, even if it was just to save his toys from a bug.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tom. He had a yellow ball. The ball was round, just like the sun. Tom loved to play with his yellow ball. He would carry it everywhere he went.
One day, Tom was playing with his ball near the woods. He saw some shapes in the trees. They were all different shapes. There were round shapes, square shapes, and triangle shapes. Tom was very curious about the shapes.
Tom decided to carry his yellow ball and explore the shapes. He found that the shapes were actually pretty leaves. He played with the leaves and his yellow ball all day long. Tom had so much fun with the shapes and his yellow ball. At the end of the day, he carried his yellow ball back home, with a big smile on his face.

One day, a little girl named Mia was very curious. She loved to explore and find new things. One morning, she found a small, pretty cup in her house. Mia was very excited about her new cup.
Mia decided to show her new cup to her best friend, Tim. Tim was very excited too. They played with the cup all day, filling it with water and pouring it out. They had so much fun with the cup.
Then, something unexpected happened. Mia's mom came outside and saw the cup. She told Mia and Tim that the cup was magic. Mia and Tim were very surprised. They didn't know the cup was magic. They were even more excited now. With the magic cup, they could have even more fun and adventures together.

One day, a big cat named Tom went to paint a hedge. The hedge was in front of his home. He had a big brush and many colors to paint with. Tom was very happy.
Tom saw his friend, a small dog named Tim. Tim said, "Can I help you paint the hedge?" Tom said, "Yes, you can help me." So, Tom and Tim started to paint the hedge together. They were having fun.
But then, a harsh wind came and blew all the paint away. Tom and Tim were sad. They looked at the hedge and saw that the wind made a new picture on the hedge. It was a picture of them playing together. They both smiled and said, "Wow, the wind helped us make a nice picture!"

Anna liked to go to the beach with her mom and dad. She liked to play with the sand and the water and the shells. Sometimes she found oysters, the big shells that had pearls inside. She wanted to open them and see the shiny pearls, but her mom and dad said no. They said oysters were alive and they needed to stay in the water.
One day, Anna found a very big oyster on the sand. She was curious and picked it up. She tried to open it with her fingers, but it was too hard. She looked around and saw a rock. She thought she could use the rock to open the oyster. She carried the oyster and the rock to a quiet spot, away from her mom and dad.
She put the oyster on the ground and lifted the rock. She was about to hit the oyster, when she heard a voice.
"Please don't hurt me," the voice said.
Anna was surprised and scared. She dropped the rock and looked at the oyster. The oyster had a small mouth and two eyes. It was looking at her and speaking to her.
"Who are you?" Anna asked.
"I'm an oyster," the oyster said. "I live in the water with my family and friends. I don't want to die. Please let me go."
Anna felt sorry for the oyster. She realized she was wrong to try to open it. She picked up the oyster and ran to the water. She threw the oyster into the waves and watched it sink.
"I'm sorry, oyster," she said. "I hope you find your family and friends."
"Thank you, Anna," the oyster said. "You are very kind. Goodbye."
Anna waved to the oyster and went back to her mom and dad. She told them what happened and they hugged her. They said she did the right thing and they were proud of her. Anna felt happy and learned a lesson. She never tried to open oysters again.

Once upon a time, there was a charming lawyer. He lived in a big house. He had many friends. One day, he had to leave his house to go to work. He put on his hat and walked out the door.
On his way to work, he saw a big, green frog. The frog was sad. The charming lawyer asked the frog, "Why are you sad?" The frog said, "I lost my home. Can you help me find it?" The charming lawyer said, "Yes, I will help you."
They looked for the frog's home together. They walked and walked. Then, they found a big pond. The frog was very happy. But, the pond was not a pond. It was a big hole. The charming lawyer and the frog fell in the hole. They could not get out. They were stuck. And they lived in the hole forever. The end.

One day, a big red car wanted to drive to the park. The car was very alert and looked for friends to play with. The car saw a small blue car and asked, "Do you want to play with me?"
The small blue car said, "Yes! Let's drive and search for more friends." They drove around the park, looking for more cars to play with. They found a green car and a yellow car. All the cars were very happy to play together.
But then, the big red car saw a big hill. The big red car wanted to drive down the hill very fast. The small blue car said, "No, that is not safe!" But the big red car did not listen. The big red car drove down the hill very fast and crashed at the bottom. The other cars were sad, and they learned to always be alert and listen to their friends.

Once upon a time, there was a mosquito. He was very small and he felt ashamed because he could not stand like the big animals. One day, mosquito saw a big tree and tried to stand near it, but he fell down. He tried again and again, but he could not stand like the big animals.
One day, something unexpected happened. A strong wind came and blew all the big animals away. The mosquito was scared, but he did not get blown away. He could fly and stay near the tree.
The mosquito was not ashamed anymore. He knew that even though he could not stand like the big animals, he could do something they could not. He could fly and stay safe. From that day on, the mosquito was happy to be small and different.

Once upon a time, there was a brave little girl named Lily. She loved to play by the sea. One sunny day, Lily went to the beach to watch the waves.
Lily saw a big wave coming. She was not scared. She took a step closer to the water. The wave came and splashed her feet. Lily laughed and clapped her hands.
Lily played with the waves all day. She was very happy. Her mom and dad watched her and smiled. They were proud of their brave little girl who loved the sea.

Jack was walking in the park. As he walked, he passed by a large flag. It was big and red and Jack thought it looked really beautiful. 
He asked his mom, "What is that?"
Mom said, "That is a flag. People sell flags like that."
Jack was really curious and asked, "What does it mean to sell a flag?"
Mom said, "It means to give a flag away and get something else in exchange. For example, if I sell this flag, I can use the money to buy something else that I need."
Jack thought this was fascinating and kept walking while thinking about all the things that can be sold. He looked at the large flag with admiration and then kept walking until he reached the park exit.

Once there was a person who loved to cook. Every day she would go to the kitchen, take out her ingredients and make something delicious. She was very independent and proud of it.
One day, this person was cooking when a little 3 year old girl came into the kitchen. She was in awe of the person cooking and asked "What are you doing?".
The person replied, "I'm cooking something special. Would you like to help?"
The little girl was so excited at this prospect and said, "Yes please!"
The person taught the little girl how to measure the ingredients, mix them together and put them in the oven. Soon enough, a delicious smell filled the kitchen and the two were so proud of their finished product.
The little girl was so proud of her independent cooking skills and beamed with joy. From that day on, she would often join the person in the kitchen, learning more and more about the joy of cooking.

One day, a gray cat went for a walk. The cat saw a fierce dog. The dog was big and loud. The gray cat was scared. The cat wanted to run away.
But then, something unexpected happened. The fierce dog said, "I want to be your friend." The gray cat was surprised. The cat said, "Thank you, dog. I want to be your friend too."
So, the fierce dog and the gray cat became friends. They played together every day. The gray cat was not scared anymore. The cat and the dog were very happy. And they always said, "Thank you," to each other.

Once upon a time, there was a wise old owl who lived in a big tree. The tree was on the earth, and it was very tall. The wise owl liked to stand on a branch and look down at all the animals.
One day, the wise owl saw a little mouse. The mouse was lost and could not find his home. The owl wanted to help the little mouse. So, the owl stood on the ground and talked to the mouse. The wise owl told the mouse to follow the path in the forest.
The little mouse listened to the wise owl and followed the path. Soon, the mouse found his home. The wise owl was happy to help the little mouse. The owl went back to the tree and stood on the branch. The wise owl knew that helping others was a good thing to do. And all the animals on the earth loved the wise owl.

Once upon a time, there was a grumpy old man who lived in a small house. He had a big steel pot that he loved very much. One day, he found a tiny, talking frog near his house. The frog said, "Hello, grumpy man! I can make you happy if you let me live with you."
The old man thought for a moment and said, "Okay, little frog. You can stay with me, but you must be quiet." The frog agreed and jumped into the big steel pot to make it his new home.
The next day, the grumpy man went to a show in the park. The frog jumped out of the steel pot and started to dance. The people at the park saw the dancing frog and began to clap and applaud. The grumpy man saw the people clapping and started to smile. He said, "Thank you, little frog. You made me happy!" From that day on, the grumpy man and the little frog were the best of friends, and they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Jenny. She had a pet bird named Tilly. Every day, Jenny would give Tilly a nice meal. 
One day, Jenny went to give Tilly her meal. But, when she got close to Tilly, she saw that Tilly was dead. Jenny was very sad. 
She tried to remember why Tilly died. Then, Jenny remembered that the last meal she gave Tilly had a poison berry. It was the wrong meal. 
Jenny was very upset. She cried for many days. She would never forget her pet Tilly, and the dead meal that caused her death.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved dessert. His favorite dessert was ice cream. One day, Tim saw a big ice cream cone in the store. He wanted it so much, but he was too weak to carry it home.
Tim stared at the ice cream cone with big eyes. He thought of a plan. He asked his friend, Sam, to help him. Sam was strong and could carry the ice cream cone. But Sam wanted something in return. He wanted to eat half of the ice cream cone.
Tim did not want to share his dessert. He wanted to eat it all by himself. But he knew he was too weak to carry it home alone. So, Tim agreed to share the ice cream cone with Sam.
Together, they carried the big ice cream cone home. They both enjoyed the dessert and became even better friends. Tim learned that sharing can be fun and make you happy.

One day, a boy named Tim wanted to ride his bike. He loved to go fast. Tim thought it was fun to ride at crazy speed. He would zoom up and down the street, laughing all the way.
One day, while Tim was riding, he saw a girl named Sue. Sue was also riding her bike. Tim said, "Let's race!" Sue said, "No, I don't like to go fast. It's scary!" Tim didn't understand. He thought going fast was the best thing ever.
Tim and Sue tried to ride together, but Tim kept going too fast. Sue got upset and said, "I don't want to play with you if you keep going so fast!" Tim felt sad. He didn't want to lose his new friend. So, Tim learned to ride slower when he was with Sue. They both had fun riding their bikes together, and they became the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little frog named Tim. Tim loved to jump all day long. He would jump from one lily pad to another in the pond. One day, he heard his friends talking about a movie they saw. Tim wanted to see the movie too.
Tim asked his mom if he could go see the movie with his friends. His mom said, "Yes, but you must stay safe and be with your friends all the time." Tim was very happy and jumped even higher. He promised to stay safe and be with his friends.
Tim and his friends went to see the movie. They had a great time and laughed a lot. After the movie, they all went back to the pond. Tim told his mom all about the movie and how he stayed safe with his friends. His mom was proud of him, and Tim felt happy.

John was a very curious 3 year old. One day he saw a furry package on his living room floor. He knew it was not his, so he decided to investigate. He picked it up and shook it, but nothing happened. Then he looked around the room, but nobody was there. Suddenly, John heard a voice coming from the package. It said, "Help! I'm inside here!".
John was very surprised. He asked, "Who's there?" A small voice said, "I'm a mouse, and I was taken by mistake. Please let me out!".
John didn't know what to do. He was about to lie but then he felt bad. So he decided it was better to tell the truth. He said, "I can't let you out. This is not my package".
After hearing John's answer, there was silence. The mouse thought for a moment and then said, "Can you please hide me somewhere so I can have a safe home?".
John was happy to be helpful. So he opened the package and put the furry mouse carefully in a shoebox in a corner of the room. The mouse thanked John and said goodbye, and then he disappeared.
John was glad he had been honest with the mouse. He knew it was the right thing to do.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a little girl named Amy. She was a happy girl who loved to play with her toys. One day, she found a pin on the floor. It was shiny and pretty. Amy picked it up and put it in her pocket.
Amy went outside to play with her friend, Tom. They played with a big ball. The ball was very bouncy. They laughed and had lots of fun. Then, Amy remembered the pin in her pocket. She showed it to Tom.
"Look, Tom! I found a pin!" said Amy. Tom leaned close to see the pin. "Wow! It's so shiny!" he said. They both smiled and continued to play with the ball.
Amy and Tom played until the sun went down. They were tired but happy. They said goodbye to each other and went back to their homes. Amy put the shiny pin on her table and went to bed, excited for another day of play.

One day, a boy named Tim went to play in the park. He saw a big pile of waste near the slide. Tim was angry. He said, "Who made this mess?"
A girl named Sue heard Tim and came to see. She said, "I don't know, but we can clean it up." They put the waste in a big bag. When they were done, they saw a box under the waste. Tim and Sue were excited to reveal what was inside.
They opened the box and found a lot of toys. They were very happy. They shared the toys with their friends in the park. The angry feeling was gone, and they all had fun playing with the new toys. The waste was gone, and the park was clean again.

One day, a lazy cat named Tom was sleeping. He did not want to wake up. His friend, a small bird named Sue, came to see him. Sue wanted to play, but Tom did not want to wake up. Sue had a plan. She said, "Tom, I found a big, yummy fish. If you wake up, I will show you where it is!"
Tom loved fish, so he woke up. He followed Sue to the big fish. But there was a problem. The fish was stuck in a small hole. Tom could not get the fish out. Sue had an idea. She said, "Tom, use your thumb to get the fish out." Tom used his thumb and got the fish out. They both had a big, yummy fish to eat.
From that day on, Tom was not so lazy. He would wake up early to play with Sue. They had lots of fun together. Tom learned that waking up and being with friends was better than being lazy. And Sue was happy to have her friend Tom to play with every day.

One day, Tim and his friend, Sue, were playing in the park. They saw a big hill with a small tree on top. They wanted to go up the hill, but it was very hard to walk up. They tried to work together, but it was still too hard.
Tim had an idea. "I will get a cup of water for us to drink. Maybe it will help us go up the hill," he said. Sue agreed and waited for Tim to come back with the cup. When Tim came back, they both drank the water and felt better.
They tried to go up the hill again. This time, they worked together and held hands. They walked slowly and took breaks when they needed to. Finally, they made it to the top of the hill. They were so happy and hugged each other. "We did it! We worked hard and made it up the hill!" Tim said. Sue smiled and said, "Yes, we did it together!"

Anna likes to play with her train. She has many cars and tracks. She can make the train go fast or slow. She can make the train stop or go. She can make the train loud or quiet.
One day, Anna wants to sort her train. She puts all the red cars in one pile. She puts all the blue cars in another pile. She puts all the green cars in a third pile. She is happy with her work.
But then, her furry friend Max comes. Max is a cat. He likes to play too. He sees the piles of cars. He thinks they are toys for him. He jumps on the red pile. He knocks over the blue pile. He runs away with a green car.
"Max, no!" Anna shouts. "That is my train! You are messing it up!"
Max does not listen. He thinks Anna is playing with him. He drops the green car and chases the red cars. He makes a big mess.
Anna is sad and angry. She loves Max, but she does not like what he did. She picks up her train. She tries to sort it again. She hopes Max will leave her alone.

Once upon a time there was an ancient axe. It had been around for many generations and was used in many different ways. One snowy day, two little children were out playing in the snow.
Suddenly, one of the children found the ancient axe and started to pick it up. The other child began to applaud and gave a big cheer.
The other child said to the first, "What are you going to do with the axe?"
The first child replied, "Let's play pretend. We can pretend that this axe is chopping down a tree!"
The other child clapped again and said, "That sounds like a great idea!"
So, the two children spent the rest of the day playing pretend with the ancient axe, chopping down imaginary trees and having lots of fun.

Lily liked jazz. Jazz was music with many sounds. Lily had a jazz CD that her dad gave her. She played it every day on her pink player. She danced and sang with the jazz.
One day, Lily and her mom went to the park. They saw a band playing jazz. Lily was happy. She ran to the band and clapped her hands. She wanted to dance with them. But her mom said no. She said they had to go home soon. Lily was sad. She was restless. She did not want to leave the jazz.
Lily and her mom walked to the bus stop. Lily saw a big poster on the wall. It had a picture of her dad. He was playing a saxophone. He was a jazz star. Lily smiled. She pointed to the poster and said, "Look, mom, it's dad! He plays jazz!"
Her mom smiled too. She hugged Lily and said, "Yes, he does. He loves jazz. And he loves you. He will be home soon. He is on a tour now. Do you remember what a tour is?"
Lily nodded. She remembered. A tour was when dad went to many places and played jazz for many people. He sent Lily postcards with pictures of the places. Lily liked the postcards. She kept them in a box. She missed dad. But she was proud of him.
Lily and her mom got on the bus. They sat by the window. Lily looked at the poster again. She waved to dad. She said, "Bye, dad. See you soon. I love jazz. And I love you."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She was a happy girl who loved to play outside. One day, while she was playing in the park, she saw a tiny kitten hiding in the bushes. The kitten was so small and cute. Lucy wanted to help the kitten and make it happy too.
Lucy said to the kitten, "Come here, little one. I will pick you up and take you home with me." The kitten looked at Lucy and walked slowly towards her. Lucy picked up the kitten and gave it a big hug. The kitten started to purr, showing that it was happy.
When Lucy and the kitten got home, they played all day long. They had so much fun together. Lucy's mom saw how happy they were and said, "Lucy, you can keep the kitten as your new friend." Lucy and the kitten were so happy to be together, and they lived happily ever after.

One day, a friendly dog and a little girl went for a walk. The girl liked to play with the dog. She would throw a ball, and the dog would run to get it. They were very happy.
Then, they saw a big tree. The girl saw something in the tree. She pointed with her finger and asked the dog, "What is that?" The dog did not know, so he just shrugged.
The girl got closer to the tree. She saw that it was a big, pretty bird. But when the bird saw the girl, it changed into a funny cat! The girl and the dog were very surprised. They laughed and played with the funny cat. Now, they had a new friend to play with.

Once upon a time, there was a tiny insect named Buzz. Buzz could blink very fast. He had a friend named Hop, who was a small frog. Hop could not blink as fast as Buzz. This made Hop envious.
One sunny day, Buzz and Hop were playing near a pond. Buzz said, "Look, Hop, I can blink so fast!" Hop looked at Buzz and said, "I wish I could blink like you, Buzz." Buzz smiled and said, "Don't worry, Hop. You can do other things that I can't."
Just then, a big ball rolled towards them. Hop jumped high and stopped the ball. Buzz clapped and said, "See, Hop! You can jump so high, and I can't. We are both special in our own way." Hop smiled and they continued to play together, happy to be friends.

One day, a big cat named Tom saw a little cat named Tim. Tim was sad because he did not know how to catch a ball. Tom wanted to help, so he said, "I will teach you how to catch a ball."
Tom was very generous and patient. He showed Tim how to jump and grab the ball with his paws. Tim tried many times, but he could not catch the ball. Tom said, "Do not give up. Keep trying, and you will get better."
The next day, Tim tried again. This time, he caught the ball! Tim was so happy with the result. He said, "Thank you, Tom, for teaching me how to catch a ball." Tom smiled and said, "You're welcome. I knew you could do it." And from that day on, Tim and Tom played and had fun together.

One day, a little boy named Tim and his friend, a talking dog named Max, went for a walk. They saw a big hill. Max said, "Look, Tim! That is not just a hill. It is a volcano!" Tim looked at the volcano and asked, "What is a volcano, Max?"
Max said, "A volcano is a big hill with hot fire inside. When the fire comes out, it can hurt." Tim was scared, but Max said, "Do not worry. We will be safe if we stay away."
Tim and Max played a game. They took turns to number the rocks near the volcano. Tim counted one, two, three rocks. Max counted four, five, six rocks. They laughed and had fun. They were careful not to go too close to the volcano. They did not want to get hurt.

Once upon a time, there was Snowy the bunny. He was lost in the woods and felt very scared. He looked all around for his family but couldn't find them.
He hopped in a bush and thought, 'Maybe I should stay here and wait for them'.
After a while, Snowy heard another voice. It was his friend Bear. Bear said, 'Snowy! I'm here to help! Let's search together'.
Snowy was so happy that he had a friend to help him! He hopped out of the bush and they started searching. After a while, they found Snowy's family. Everyone was so happy! 
Snowy learnt a very important lesson - if you are scared and lost, it is better to search with a friend instead of staying alone.

Once upon a time, there was a large lizard named Lizzy. She lived in a big forest with many trees. Lizzy was a very friendly lizard.
One day, Lizzy met a small bird named Bobby. Bobby was sad because he lost his way home. "Don't worry," Lizzy said to Bobby, "I can help you find your home."
Lizzy had an idea. She suggested, "Let's ask the other animals in the forest to help us." They asked a squirrel, a rabbit, and a frog. All the animals wanted to help Bobby.
Together, they found Bobby's home. Bobby was so happy! "Thank you, Lizzy and friends," Bobby said. From that day on, they all became best friends and had many fun days in the forest.

One day, a boy named Tim went outside to play in the snow. He put on his coat, hat, and gloves. He was very happy because there was a lot of snow available for him to play with. Tim built a big snowman with a carrot nose and stick arms.
While Tim was playing, a big dog came running up to him. The dog knocked over the snowman by accident. Tim started to panic because his snowman was gone. He was sad and did not know what to do.
But then, the dog did something unexpected. The dog started to help Tim build a new snowman! Tim was very surprised and happy. They built the best snowman ever, even better than the first one. In the end, Tim made a new friend, and they played in the snow together all day.

One day, a little girl named Sue felt lonely. It was her birthday, but no one came to her party. Sue was sad and didn't know what to do. So, she went outside to play and skip.
While Sue was skipping, she saw a cat. The cat said, "Meow, why are you sad?" Sue told the cat, "It's my birthday, but no one came to my party. I feel lonely." The cat felt bad for Sue and wanted to help her.
The cat tried to find friends for Sue, but no one wanted to come. Sue and the cat went back home. They sat together and ate cake. Even though they had each other, Sue still felt lonely on her birthday.

One day, a popular boy named Tom had a toy boat. He liked to sail it on the water. He went to the park with his mom and his toy boat. At the park, there was a big pond. Tom and his mom went to the pond to sail the boat.
Tom put the boat on the water. It began to sail. As it sailed, it went close to a strip of land in the middle of the pond. A girl named Sue saw the boat and liked it. She said, "Hi Tom, can I play with your boat too?" Tom said, "No, it is my boat. You can't play with it."
Sue was sad, but she had an idea. She found a long stick and used it to push the boat back to Tom. Tom was happy to have his boat back. He said, "Thank you, Sue. You can play with my boat now." They played together and had fun. The unexpected thing was that Tom learned to share. The moral of the story is to share with others and make friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Maya. She was three years old and loved to play with her dad's axe. One day, she asked her dad if she could use the axe to chop some logs.
"No way," said her dad. "That axe is too big for you and it's a bit weird. You can use it when you're older."
Maya was sad, but she decided to get the axe herself. She found it in her dad's shed and decided to give it a try. She started to swing the axe, but she was too small. The axe was just too big and heavy for her. 
Suddenly, her dad walked into the shed. "Oh no!" he shouted. "What are you doing? You could have hurt yourself!"
Maya began to cry. She knew that she had done something wrong. 
"It's alright," said her dad. "It's just that axes are very dangerous. You should only use an axe when you're old enough to handle it and understand its power. It requires strength and skill so you must increase your age before you even think of using it again." 
And that's how Maya learned that she needed to be older before she could use an axe. She remembered her dad's words and was careful in the future.

Once upon a time, there was a nurse named Sue. Sue was very attractive and kind. She loved to support and help her friends.
One day, Sue met a little bird who hurt its wing. The bird said, "Help me, please." Sue wanted to support the bird, so she took it home.
At home, Sue took care of the bird. She helped the bird get better. Soon, the bird could fly again. The bird said, "Thank you, Sue!" Sue was happy to support her new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a smart cat named Tom. Tom loved to smile and play with his friends. One day, he went to the park to have fun.
At the park, Tom met a dog named Max. Max said, "Let's play with the ball." Tom smiled and said, "Yes, let's play!" They played a game called pass. Tom would throw the ball, and Max would catch it. Then Max would throw the ball, and Tom would catch it.
They played pass all day long. The sun was warm and bright, and the sky was blue. Tom and Max were very happy. They smiled and laughed as they played pass. At the end of the day, they were tired but still smiling. Tom and Max became best friends and played pass every day.

Once upon a time there was a boy who was very sorry. He had done something wrong and now he was feeling bad. He was so sorry he decided to give away a special square that he had.
The boy found a friend and said, "Would you like my square?" His friend said yes and was very happy. But then the boy said, "If you want my square, you have to do something for me."
The boy's friend didn't want to do it so he refused. He said, "No, I'm sorry but I don't want to do it."
The boy was disappointed. He said, "I understand. It's okay if you don't want to do it. You don't have to have my square. I'm sorry."
The boy's friend was really sad. He was sorry too. He wished he hadn't refused the boy's request so he could have the square. But in the end the boy kept his square and both the boy and his friend learned a valuable lesson.

Once upon a time, there was a long cat named Tom. Tom liked to sit on a shelf near a window. He loved to look outside and see the birds fly by. One day, Tom saw a big red ball near a tree. He wanted to play with the ball, but he was inside, and the ball was outside.
Tom tried to open the door, but he could not. He was too small. He looked around and saw a big dog named Max. Tom asked Max to help him open the door. Max was strong, and he could open the door. Max wanted to help Tom, but he wanted a treat first. Tom agreed, and Max opened the door.
Tom ran outside to get the ball. He was so happy that he could play with it. But then, something unexpected happened. The ball was not a ball at all. It was a big, round, red hat! Tom did not know what to do, but Max had an idea. Max put the hat on Tom's head, and they both laughed. Tom and Max had a fun day playing with the hat, and they became best friends. Tom learned that sometimes, even when you don't succeed in what you want, you can still have fun and make new friends.

Once upon a time there were two friends. They were a frog and a fish, and they lived in a pond together. One day, the frog said to the fish, "Let's do something fun!" The fish agreed and the frog got an idea. He had a big, long rod and he said, "I'm going to introduce it to the pond!"
The fish helpfully followed the frog as he placed the rod in the pond. Then they watched as the rod wiggled around. The fish was excited and he asked, "What's it doing?" The frog laughed and said, "We're fishing!"
A few minutes later, the frog pulled out the rod and it had a big, juicy fish on it! The frog was very happy and the fish was even more excited. After they ate the tasty fish, the frog and the fish began to feel tired.
So they napped in the warm sunshine until they felt refreshed. The friends hugged and said goodbye, before the frog went on his way. The two were happy and would never forget the day they had fished together with the rod.

Once upon a time, there was a big iron. The iron could move by itself. It liked to move around the house and see what was happening.
One day, the iron smelled something spicy coming from the kitchen. It decided to move closer and see what it was. The iron saw a big pot on the stove with spicy soup inside. The iron wanted to try the soup, but it knew that it couldn't eat.
So, the iron decided to move back to its spot and wait for its family to come home. When the family came home, they saw the iron by the kitchen. They laughed and said, "Silly iron, you can't eat spicy soup!" The iron knew they were right, but it was still happy to be part of the family.

Ben and Lily were playing with their toy cars in the garden. They liked to make them zoom and crash and honk. Ben had a red car with a big engine that made loud noises. Lily had a blue car with a regular engine that was quiet and smooth.
"Look at my car, Lily!" Ben said. "It can dive under the water and come out again. Watch!" He drove his car to the edge of the pond and pushed it in. The car sank and then floated up, making bubbles.
"Wow, Ben, that's cool!" Lily said. "But my car can do something else. It can fly in the air and land on the grass. Watch!" She drove her car to the top of the slide and let it go. The car flew and then bounced on the grass.
"Wow, Lily, that's cool too!" Ben said. "But can your car do this?" He drove his car to the swing and hung it on the rope. He pushed the swing and the car swung back and forth.
"No, Ben, my car can't do that," Lily said. "But can your car do this?" She drove her car to the sandbox and buried it under the sand. She dug it out and the car was dirty.
"No, Lily, my car can't do that," Ben said. "But I don't mind. I like your car and you like my car. We can share them and play together. Do you want to try my car?"
"Yes, Ben, I want to try your car," Lily said. "And you can try my car. We can have more fun that way. Let's swap!"
They swapped their cars and drove them around the garden. They made them dive and fly and swing and dig. They laughed and smiled and had a good time. They were happy with their toy cars and their friend.

Once upon a time, there was a kind ice cream man. He had a big heart and was very compassionate. He gave massages to his friends when they were tired. He loved to make people happy with his ice cream.
One sunny day, a little girl came to buy ice cream. The ice cream man gave her a scoop of her favorite flavor. But then, something unexpected happened. The ice cream started to melt very fast. The little girl was sad.
The ice cream man had an idea. He quickly gave the little girl a new scoop. This time, it did not melt. The little girl was so happy. The ice cream man had a magic touch. From that day on, his ice cream never melted too fast. Everyone loved the ice cream man even more.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a big, red rubber ball. He loved to play with it. He would bounce it, kick it, and throw it high in the sky. Tim took the ball with him everywhere he went.
One sunny day, Tim saw a yummy ice cream truck. He wanted ice cream so much! He let go of his red ball to get some money from his pocket. But when he looked back, his ball was rolling away fast. It rolled and rolled until it hit a sharp rock. The ball popped with a loud sound!
Tim was very sad, but then, something strange happened. The popped ball changed into a big, red rubber dog! The dog was friendly and wagged its tail. Tim was so happy and surprised. He named the dog Red and they became best friends. They played together every day, and Tim never missed his red ball again.

One day, a girl named Lily and her mom went to the beach. They brought a big bag with useful things like a towel, a ball, and a bucket. Lily loved to play in the sand and splash in the water.
While Lily was playing, she saw a big box near the water. She went to peek at it and saw a crab inside. "Mom, look! I found a crab!" she said. Her mom came over and looked at the box. "Oh, what a nice crab! Let's put it back in the water," her mom said.
As they put the crab back in the water, something unexpected happened. The crab turned into a beautiful mermaid! The mermaid said, "Thank you for helping me! I was stuck as a crab because of a magic spell. Now I can go back to my home in the sea." Lily and her mom were very surprised, but happy to help. They waved goodbye to the mermaid and went back to playing on the beach.

Once upon a time there was a stubborn little dog named Bob. All day, Bob chased the wheat in the fields. He barked and barked at the wheat, but he couldn't get any of it.
One day, Bob's mom was out in the field looking for him. When she found him, he was tired and crying. She comforted him and told him all he needed was a little patience.
The next day, Bob went back out to the field. He chased after the wheat and barked and barked. Finally, he got his paws on one tiny, little grain. After that, he couldn't stop chasing after wheat. His patience had paid off.
Every day, Bob's mom came out and comforted him while he chased after wheat. Eventually, Bob became four years old and was still chasing wheat. He was so stubborn that he refused to stop. Even though his mom wanted him to take a break, she still came out every day and comforted him. That's how Bob and his mom stayed together with their wheat chasing days.

Once upon a time, in a busy little town, there lived a boy named Tim. Tim liked to study all day. He had many books with pictures and words. Tim's favorite book was about a hero with a weapon. The weapon was a big stick.
One day, Tim went to the park to play. He saw a big stick on the ground. Tim picked it up and pretended to be the hero from his book. He swung the stick like a weapon and saved his friends from a dragon. The dragon was really just a big tree.
Tim and his friends played all day. They were very busy being heroes with their stick weapons. When it was time to go home, Tim put the stick back on the ground. He knew he could always come back and be a hero again.

Ben and Sam are friends. They like to play with toys. One day, they see a big box in the park. The box has a name on it. It says "Do not touch".
Ben is eager to see what is in the box. He wants to open it and touch the things inside. He says to Sam, "Let's go and look at the box. Maybe it has something fun."
Sam is not eager to see the box. He remembers what his mom told him. She said, "Do not touch things that are not yours. It is not nice and it can be dangerous." He says to Ben, "No, we should not go and look at the box. It is not ours. It has a name on it. It says 'Do not touch'. We should listen and be good."
Ben does not listen to Sam. He runs to the box and opens it. He sees a lot of wires and buttons and lights. He thinks they are toys. He touches one of the buttons. The box makes a loud noise and a big smoke. Ben is scared and hurt. He cries.
Sam runs to Ben and helps him. He calls for help. He says, "I am sorry, Ben. You should have listened to me. You should have listened to the name on the box. It said 'Do not touch'. It was not a toy. It was something bad."
Ben says, "I am sorry, Sam. You were right. I should have listened to you. I should have listened to the name on the box. It said 'Do not touch'. I was not nice and I was not careful. I learned a lesson. I will not touch things that are not mine again."
The end.

The evening was full of excitement for Maisy, who had just turned three. Her parents had hidden a big surprise for her. After a delicious birthday dinner and a few gifts, her parents asked Maisky to close her eyes and follow them.
When she opened her eyes in the living room, she couldn't believe what she saw. Sitting in the middle of the room was the most beautiful pink unicorn!
A big smile appeared on Maisky's face. "It's for me?" she asked her parents in amazement.
Her parents nodded and said: "Yes, it's all yours!"
Maisky ran to the unicorn and hugged it so tight that the animal started to chew her hair. After a few seconds of being startled, both Maisky and the unicorn started to laugh.
Maisky and the unicorn spent the entire evening together playing and having fun. For the rest of the evening, Maisky couldn't stop smiling and continued to hug her favourite pink toy.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Trina. She was three years old and loved to go to the lab every day to learn new things. But this time something was different. When Trina entered the lab it felt very quiet and sad. She saw everyone looking very miserable. She asked her teacher why everyone was so sad and her teacher showed Trina a big glass of liquid that they were studying in the lab. It looked very bubbly and strange, but Trina couldn't figure out why it made her classmates so sad.
Trina's teacher told her it was very important for them to make this glass of liquid the right way. Trina listened carefully and the teacher continued to explain that if it wasn't right by the end of the week, the lab would close and they wouldn't be able to come back.
Trina was so sad, she wanted to stay at the lab and keep learning so much. Then it came to her, she knew what she had to do. She took out her art supplies and started to paint a beautiful picture of the lab. Trina's friends were all amazed by her drawing and started to cheer up.
With the help of Trina's creative thinking, the liquid in the glass was made just right by the end of the week. The lab stayed open and everyone was so happy! Trina showed everyone that even in the most miserable of times, there is still hope.

Lily liked to play with her toys, but she did not like to wash them. She thought washing was boring and hard. She wanted to have fun all the time. So she put her dirty toys in a green bin and hid them under her bed.
One day, her mom came to her room and saw the green bin. She opened it and smelled something bad. She saw the toys were covered with dirt and germs. She was angry and sad. She said to Lily, "Why did you not wash your toys? They are dirty and sick. You need to take care of your things. Washing is good for you and your toys."
Lily felt sorry and ashamed. She did not want to make her mom angry and sad. She did not want her toys to be dirty and sick. She said to her mom, "I am sorry, mom. I did not know washing was good for me and my toys. I thought washing was boring and hard. I wanted to have fun all the time. Can you help me wash my toys?"
Her mom smiled and hugged her. She said, "I am glad you are sorry, Lily. I will help you wash your toys. Washing can be fun too. You can make bubbles and sing songs. You can see your toys become clean and happy. You can learn to be responsible and kind. Washing is good for you and your toys."
Lily and her mom washed the toys together. They made bubbles and sang songs. They saw the toys become clean and happy. Lily learned to be responsible and kind. She thanked her mom for helping her. She said, "I like washing now, mom. Washing is good for me and my toys. I will wash them every day."
The moral value of the story is: Washing is good for you and your things. You should take care of your things and be responsible and kind.

Once upon a time, there was a lazy cat named Tom. Tom liked to sleep all day and play all night. He had a lot of fun with his friends, but he also liked to solve mysteries.
One day, Tom found a big box in the yard. It was a mystery! He wanted to know what was inside. Tom asked his friends, the dog and the bird, to help him open the box. They all worked together and opened it.
Inside the box, there were many toys for them to enjoy. Tom, the dog, and the bird played with the toys all day long. They had so much fun and forgot about being lazy. The mystery box made them very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a big, fearful bear. The bear lived in a dark forest. The bear did not like other animals. The other animals were afraid of him.
One day, a man came to the forest with an axe. He wanted to cut down the trees. The bear did not like that. The bear tried to remember how to stop the man.
The bear decided to fight the man. But the man was very strong. The man used the axe and hurt the bear. The bear was very sad.
In the end, the bear lost the fight. The man cut down all the trees. The animals had no home.
The moral of the story is to be kind and not fight. It is better to talk and solve problems together.

Once upon a time, there was a tall wolf who lived in the woods. The tall wolf liked to go for long walks. One day, he met a little girl who was picking flowers.
"Hi," said the little girl. "Do you want to go play with me?"
The tall wolf was happy and said, "Yes! Let's go play."
As they played, they found a big cave. They were curious and went inside. But something unexpected happened! The tall wolf started to shrink! He became as small as a mouse.
"Oh no!" said the little girl. "What happened to you?"
"I don't know," said the small wolf. "But I'm not tall anymore."
The little girl hugged the small wolf and they went home. They played together every day and had lots of fun. And the small wolf was happy, even though he was not tall anymore.

Bob and Suzie were out taking a walk in the park. Bob was searching for something special.
Suzie noticed and said, "What are you looking for, Bob?"
Bob smiled and replied, "I'm looking for a nut!"
Suddenly, Bob found one on the ground. He was very excited and said, "Look Suzie, I found one!"
Suzie was a bit nervous but she smiled. Bob thanked the tree for the nut and said, "Thank you tree!" Suzie watched and smiled.
That night, Bob and Suzie had a special snack of the nut Bob found. Bob was very happy, and thanked Suzie for joining him on the walk.
Suzie smiled and said, "You're welcome!"

Once upon a time, there was a big square. The square was hidden behind a tall tree. A small cat lived in the tree. One day, the cat saw a new friend. The new friend was a little dog. The cat wanted to introduce the dog to the hidden square.
The cat and the dog went to the hidden square. But, they found a big, mean bird there. The bird did not want the cat and dog to play in the square. The cat and the dog were sad. They wanted to find a way to make the bird go away.
Then, something unexpected happened. The little dog found a ball. The dog threw the ball far away. The mean bird saw the ball and flew to get it. Now, the cat and the dog could play in the hidden square. They were very happy and played all day long.

One day, a good cat named Tom went for a walk. He heard a noise coming from a big bin. Tom was very curious, so he went to see what was making the noise. He looked around, but he could not see anything yet.
The next day, Tom went back to the bin. He heard the noise again. This time, he saw a little bird inside the bin. The bird was hungry and scared. Tom knew he had to help the bird. He thought of a plan to get the bird out of the bin.
Tom found a long stick and used it to help the bird. He put the stick into the bin and the bird climbed onto it. Tom pulled the stick out of the bin and the bird was free. The bird was very happy and thanked Tom for being so good and kind. From that day on, Tom and the bird became best friends.

Mama and Papa had a plan. They wanted to find a beautiful tree for their house. Mama and Papa had an axe, so they got ready to go.
They went to the forest and looked around. Mama said, "Wow, look at those trees. They are so beautiful." Papa said, "Let's find the best tree for our house." And so they started to look.
They looked at one tree and then another. They looked at the tall trees and the short trees. The tall trees were strong and the short ones were pretty. Finally, they chose a tall, strong, beautiful tree.
Mama and Papa started to chop the tree down with their axe. They chopped and chopped and the tree fell down. They were so proud of the tree they had chosen. They knew it would make a beautiful house.

One day, a busy veterinarian named Mr. Fox was helping animals. He was very good at his job. All the animals loved him because he made them feel better when they were sick.
Mr. Fox was finishing helping a dog when a little girl named Lily came in with her cat, Fluffy. "Mr. Fox, can you help my cat? She is not feeling well," said Lily. Mr. Fox smiled and said, "Of course, Lily. Let's take a look at Fluffy."
Mr. Fox checked Fluffy and gave her some medicine. Soon, Fluffy felt much better. Lily was so happy and thanked Mr. Fox. All the animals and their friends clapped and cheered for the busy veterinarian. Mr. Fox smiled and knew he had done a good job.

Once upon a time, there was a smelly dog named Spot. Spot was always playing in the dirt. One hot day, he went to the park to play.
At the park, Spot saw his friend, a cat named Kitty. Kitty did not recognize Spot because he was so smelly and dirty. Kitty asked, "Who are you?" Spot said, "I am Spot, your friend!"
Kitty told Spot he needed a bath because of the heat and smell. They went to the pond and Spot jumped in. The water felt good on the hot day. Spot came out clean and not smelly. Kitty recognized him now and they played together all day.

One day, a little girl named Lily wanted to make a surprise for her deaf grandma. She thought and thought about what to do. Then, she had an idea. She would wrap a nice gift for her grandma.
Lily found a big, soft, and pretty scarf. She knew her grandma would love it. Lily carefully put the scarf in a box and wrapped it with colorful paper. She was so excited to give the surprise to her grandma.
When Lily gave the wrapped gift to her grandma, she said, "Look, grandma! I have a surprise for you!" Her grandma smiled and felt the wrap with her hands. She opened the box and found the scarf. Her grandma was so happy and hugged Lily tightly. They both laughed and enjoyed the surprise together.

Once there was a penguin who wanted to sell something. He had a very smooth rock that he wanted to give away. He saw a little boy walking by and decided to call out to him.
"Hi, little boy!" said the penguin. "Do you want to buy my rock? It's very smooth!"
The little boy looked at the rock. He liked it very much! "How much do you want for it?" he asked.
"How about two cents?" said the penguin.
The little boy had two cents, so he gave it to the penguin. The penguin was very happy. He thanked the little boy and said goodbye. The little boy had a new rock, and the penguin was happy he could sell his rock.

Sammy wanted to do something new today. He was feeling ready and wanted to give it a try.
He asked Mommy, "What can I do?"
Mommy said, "Let's go to the port. You can complete some puzzles there - it will be fun!"
So off they went to the port. When they arrived, Sammy was so excited he shouted, "Woohoo! Let's do it!"
Mommy showed Sammy all the fun things he could do. She said, "Let's start with the puzzles. They will be easy to complete!"
Sammy couldn't wait to try. He said, "OK, I'm ready!"
He jumped right in and started working on the puzzles. Soon enough, he had completed them all.
He was very proud. He asked Mommy, "Am I done?"
Mommy smiled and said, "Yes Sammy, you did it! You completed all the puzzles!"
Sammy was so excited. He had done something new and he was so proud of himself.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was sad because he did not have any friends to play with. One night, Tim looked out his window and saw a big, bright star. He made a wish to gain a new friend.
The next day, Tim went to the park. He saw a little girl named Sue. Sue was sad too, because she did not have any friends either. Tim said, "Hi, I am Tim. Do you want to be friends?" Sue smiled and said, "Yes, I would like that!"
Tim and Sue played together all day. They had so much fun! They played on the swings, the slide, and even had a race. At the end of the day, Tim was not sad anymore. He had gained a new friend in Sue. They promised to meet at the park every day and play together. And from that day on, Tim and Sue were the best of friends, and they were never sad again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. Lucy loved to decorate her room with pretty things. She had a big box of fun stuff to use. One day, she found an old iron in the box.
Lucy thought, "I can make the iron look nice, too!" So she took some paint and made the iron colorful. She put the iron on her table to show her mom.
When her mom saw the iron, she said, "Wow, Lucy! You made the iron look so pretty!" Lucy felt happy and proud of her work. From that day on, they used the iron to decorate their home.

Once upon a time, a little dog named Max lived in a small house. One day, Max went out for a walk at noon. The sun was shining, and the birds were singing. Max was very happy.
As Max walked, he saw a big tree. He decided to start digging under the tree to find a bone. While digging, he met a little bird named Bella. Bella said, "Hi, Max! What are you doing?" Max replied, "I am trying to find a bone, Bella!"
Max dug and dug, but he couldn't find a bone. Instead, he found a hurt, little squirrel. Max and Bella helped the squirrel feel better. They all became good friends and played together every day at noon. And they all lived happily ever after.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They had a sweet treat with them. It was a big, red apple. Tim loved apples. His mom said, "Wait, Tim. We will eat the apple after we play."
They played on the swings and the slide. Tim had lots of fun. Then, Tim said, "Mom, I want the apple now." His mom put the apple on a bench and said, "Okay, Tim. Take a bite."
But when Tim went to take a bite, the apple was gone! Tim and his mom looked around. They saw a squirrel with the apple in its mouth. The squirrel ran up a tree.
Tim and his mom laughed. The squirrel had taken the apple. Tim said, "That's okay, Mom. The squirrel can have the apple. It must be a sweet treat for him too."

One day, a blue bird named Billy was flying in the sky. He saw a big house with a door open. Billy thought, "I want to see what is inside." So, he entered the house. Inside, he saw a small boy playing with a toy. The toy had a zipper on it.
"Hi, I am Billy," said the blue bird. "Can I play with you?" The small boy looked at Billy and said, "Yes, you can play with me." They played with the toy and had fun. But then, the sky got dark and it started to rain.
Billy wanted to go back home, but the rain was very heavy. The small boy said, "You can stay here with me." But Billy saw that the door was closing. He tried to fly out but the door shut. The house was not safe. The rain came in and the house got wet. The small boy and Billy could not play anymore.

One sunny day Jack and his mom were walking in the park. Jack saw some of his friends playing on the swings and asked his mom if he could join them.
"Sure," she said, "But be careful."
Jack ran to the swings and his friends greeted him with big smiles. One of his friends, Lucy, invited him to her party at the park the following day.
"Yes!" Jack said, his eyes lighting up.
Jack was so excited he ran back to his mom and told her the news. 
"That sounds like fun," she said, "But it will be a long party. Are you sure you can stay the whole time?"
Jack was determined not to miss the party. He thought and thought and decided that he could invite his mom along so she could make sure he was okay.
The next day came and Jack brought his mom to the long party. He had so much fun with his friends, but he was glad his mom was there to look after him.

Lily likes to mail letters to her grandma. She draws pictures of her toys, her dog and her family. She puts them in envelopes and sticks stamps on them. Then she walks with her mom to the big blue box and puts the letters inside. She waves bye-bye to the letters and hopes grandma will like them.
One day, Lily gets a phone call from grandma. She is very happy to hear her voice. Grandma says she loves Lily's letters and she has a surprise for her. She tells Lily to look out the window and see what is coming. Lily runs to the window and sees a big yellow truck. It stops in front of her house and a man gets out. He has a big brown box in his hands.
The man rings the doorbell and Lily's mom opens the door. She signs a paper and takes the box. She thanks the man and closes the door. She tells Lily that the box is from grandma. She helps Lily open it and they see what is inside. It is a big teddy bear with a red bow. It has a card that says "To Lily, from Grandma. I miss you and I love you. You are a good girl and a good artist. Enjoy your new friend. Love, Grandma."
Lily is so happy. She hugs the teddy bear and says thank you to grandma on the phone. She tells grandma she loves her and she will mail her more letters soon. She says bye-bye to grandma and hangs up the phone. She takes the teddy bear to her room and plays with him. She gives him a name and a bed. She tells him stories and shows him her drawings. She is very glad that grandma sent her a surprise. She thinks grandma is the best.

One day, a little girl named Mia went to the park with her mom. Mia saw a pretty ornament on a tree. It was shiny and round. Mia wanted to take it home, but it was too high. She tried to reach it but she struggled. 
Mia asked her mom, "Can you help me get the ornament?" Her mom said, "Yes, let me try." But her mom struggled too. They were both sad. 
Then, a big bird flew by and saw them. The bird said, "I can help you!" The bird took the ornament and gave it to Mia. Mia was very happy. She said, "Thank you, bird!" The bird flew away and Mia took the ornament home.

Once upon a time, there was a brave dog named Max. Max loved to run and play in the park. One day, Max saw an old man with a cane walking slowly. The old man looked sad and lonely.
Max wanted to help the old man. He ran up to him and wagged his tail. The old man looked at Max and smiled. He started to walk with Max by his side. They walked and walked, and the old man felt happy.
As they walked, Max could hear birds singing in the trees. The old man could hear it too. They both enjoyed the beautiful sounds together. The old man was thankful for his new friend, and Max felt proud to be a brave helper.

Once upon a time, there was a graceful pony named Lily. She lived in a big, green field with her friends. They loved to play and run all day in the sun. Lily was very happy.
One day, a little girl named Sue came to the field. Sue loved Lily and wanted to play with her. Sue said, "Hi, Lily! Do you want to play with me?" Lily nodded her head and they played together all day. They had so much fun.
As the sun began to set, it was time for Sue to go home. Sue said to Lily, "I have to go now, but I will come back tomorrow." Lily was sad, but she knew Sue would come back. Sue shut the gate behind her and waved goodbye to Lily. The graceful pony and her friends went to sleep, dreaming of more fun days with Sue.

Anna and Ben are twins. They like to play with their toys on the floor. One day, their mom brings home a new toy for them. It is a big red truck with four wheels and a horn.
"Wow, look at this!" Anna says. She picks up the truck and makes it go on the floor. "Beep beep!"
"Can I play too?" Ben asks. He wants to hold the truck and make it go.
"Sure, you can play too," Anna says. She gives the truck to Ben. "But be careful. It is new and we don't want to break it."
Ben takes the truck and makes it go on the floor. He likes the sound of the horn. "Beep beep!" He smiles and laughs.
Anna and Ben take turns playing with the new truck. They have fun making it go on the floor. They share the toy and say thank you to their mom. Their mom is happy to see them play nicely. She hugs them and says, "I love you, my sweet twins."

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Millie. She was three years old and wanted to explore the world. 
One day Millie went outside and wandered into a big garden. It was a special garden, with lots of exciting things! Millie looked around and saw an open door. 
She asked her mum, "What's through that open door?". Her mum replied, "Maybe there is something special on the other side". Millie was sure she wanted to go through the open door and change what was inside. 
Quickly Millie opened the door and saw a beautiful open meadow. She ran into the clearing and started twirling around. She felt so happy and excited to see the new place. 
Just then, an old man appeared. He said to Millie, "You have changed this place. You have made it so beautiful". Millie smiled and said, "Yes I have. I am so happy". 
This was Millie's first adventure and she was thrilled to have made a difference. She knew there would be many more adventures to come.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily liked to collect pretty things. One day, she saw a light in the woods. The light was so pretty, Lily wanted to collect it too.
Lily was very careful as she walked to the light. She did not want to break it. As she got closer, the light was even prettier. It was like a big, shiny star.
But when Lily touched the light, it was very hot. It burned her hand and made her cry. She ran back home to her mom. Lily learned that some pretty things are not safe to collect.

Once upon a time, there was a boy. His name was Tim. Tim liked to play near the rail. He loved to watch the big trains go by. But Tim was deaf, so he could not hear the trains.
One day, Tim went to the rail to play. He saw a big train far away. Tim was happy and wanted to see it up close. He walked closer to the rail. He could not hear the train getting louder.
The train came very fast. Tim could not hear it. He was too close to the rail. The big train went by and Tim was not safe. The train hit Tim and he was very hurt. This was a very sad day.

Once upon a time, there was a popular bird. It was very special because it could fly higher than any other bird. It loved to fly high in the sky and close to the sun.
When it was too hot, the bird flew lower and looked for something cool to do. One day, it saw a pile of coal on the ground. It flew down and rested on top of the coal.
The coal felt cool and the bird liked it very much. It stayed there for a long time, enjoying its cool little spot. When it was time to leave, the bird spread its wings and flew off into the sky again.
The popular bird continued to fly high in the sky and close to the sun. It was so happy with its new cool spot. It went back to the coal whenever it was too hot. That's why it was so special and popular!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She had a doll that was different from other dolls. This doll had only one eye. Amy loved her doll very much.
One day, Amy and her doll went to the park. There, she met a boy named Tim. Tim saw Amy's doll and said, "Your doll is different. It looks funny with one eye!" Amy felt sad and began to cry.
Amy ran home with her doll. She was very upset. Her mom tried to make her feel better, but Amy kept crying. That night, Amy's doll went missing. She looked everywhere, but she could not find it. Amy cried even more because her special doll was gone forever.

Lily and Ben like to play chess. Chess is a game with black and white pieces. Lily has the white pieces and Ben has the black pieces. They take turns to move their pieces on the board.
One day, they play chess in the living room. The living room has a fireplace. The fireplace has fire. Fire is hot and bright. Fire can burn things.
Lily moves her queen. She says, "Checkmate! I win!" Ben is sad. He does not like to lose. He is angry. He throws his king at the fire. The king is wood. Wood can burn.
The king lands in the fire. The fire makes the king brown. The king starts to burn. Lily and Ben see the smoke. They smell the smoke. They are scared. They scream, "Help! Help!"
Mom and Dad hear the scream. They run to the living room. They see the fire. They see the king. They are mad. They say, "What did you do? You could have burned the house! You could have hurt yourself!"
Lily and Ben are sorry. They say, "We are sorry. We were playing chess. Ben was angry. He threw his king at the fire. We did not mean to burn the king."
Mom and Dad put out the fire. They hug Lily and Ben. They say, "We are glad you are safe. But you have to be careful. Fire is dangerous. You cannot play with fire. You cannot throw things at the fire. You have to respect the fire."
Lily and Ben nod. They say, "We understand. We will respect the fire. We will not play with fire. We will not throw things at the fire."
Mom and Dad smile. They say, "Good. Now, let's go to the kitchen. We have cookies for you. Cookies are sweet and yummy. Cookies do not burn."

Once upon a time, in a normal little town, there lived a bunny named Bob. Bob liked to hop all day long. Yesterday, he hopped to the park to play with his friends.
At the park, Bob saw his friend, a bird named Sue. Sue was sad because she could not hop like Bob. Bob wanted to help Sue feel happy, so he had an idea.
Bob told Sue to stand on his back. Then, Bob started to hop with Sue on his back. Sue felt happy because she could hop too. They hopped and played all day long, and they were the best of friends.

Sara was curious about the party. She saw many balloons and cakes and toys in the big room. She wanted to go inside and play with them. But Mommy said no. Mommy said the party was for big people, not for little girls. Mommy said Sara had to stay in her room and be quiet.
Sara was sad and bored. She did not like her room. She did not have many toys or books or friends. She only had a teddy bear. She loved her teddy bear very much. She called him Bobo. She hugged him and talked to him. She said, "Bobo, you are my best friend. I value you more than anything. You always make me happy."
But Sara was still curious about the party. She wanted to see what was inside the big room. She wanted to have fun too. She thought, maybe Mommy will not notice if I sneak out for a little bit. Maybe I can take Bobo with me and show him the balloons and cakes and toys. Maybe I can find some nice big people who will let me join the party.
So Sara waited until Mommy was busy talking on the phone. Then she took Bobo and tiptoed out of her room. She walked down the hall and opened the door to the big room. She saw many big people laughing and dancing and eating and drinking. She saw many balloons and cakes and toys. She smiled and ran inside.
But the big people did not smile at Sara. They did not like her. They did not want her to join the party. They said, "Who are you? What are you doing here? Go away, you little brat!" They pushed her and shouted at her. They took Bobo from her and threw him on the floor. They popped the balloons and smashed the cakes and broke the toys. They made Sara cry.
Mommy heard Sara cry. She ran to the big room and saw what happened. She was angry and scared. She said, "Sara, what have you done? How could you be so naughty and rude? You have ruined the party! You have made everyone mad! You have lost your teddy bear! You have no value at all!"
Mommy grabbed Sara and dragged her back to her room. She locked the door and left her alone. She did not hug her or talk to her. She did not say she was sorry or that she loved her. She did not give her back her teddy bear. Sara was alone and sad and scared. She had no party, no fun, no friends, no Bobo. She had nothing. She wished she had never been curious.

Once upon a time, there was a big, round pumpkin. It was orange and shiny. It lived in a garden with many other pumpkins. One day, the pumpkin heard a loud noise. It was a little scared, but it wanted to find out what made the noise.
The pumpkin started to search for the loud noise. It rolled and rolled through the garden. It saw a big tree, a green bush, and a small pond. But it did not find the loud noise.
Then, the pumpkin saw a tiny bird. The bird was singing a loud song. The pumpkin was happy to find the loud noise. It was not scared anymore. The pumpkin and the bird became good friends. They played together in the garden every day.

Sara and Tom liked to bake with Mom. They helped her make cookies and cakes and pies. They mixed and poured and rolled and cut. They had fun and made a mess.
One day, Mom had to go out for a while. She told Sara and Tom to be good and not touch the oven. She said it was very hot and could hurt them. She said she would be back soon and they could eat the cookies they baked.
But Sara and Tom were playful and curious. They wanted to see the cookies in the oven. They climbed on a chair and looked through the glass. The cookies smelled good and looked yummy. They wanted to taste them.
"Let's take them out," Sara said. "Mom won't know."
"No, we can't," Tom said. "Mom said not to touch the oven. It's hot."
Sara did not listen. She reached for the switch that opened the oven. She thought it would be easy. But the switch was hard to move. She pushed and pulled and twisted. She did not see the red light that flashed on the oven.
Suddenly, there was a loud bang. The oven door flew open. Hot air and smoke came out. The cookies flew out too. They hit Sara and Tom in the face. They burned and hurt. Sara and Tom screamed and cried.
Mom heard the noise and ran back to the kitchen. She saw the oven and the cookies and the smoke. She saw Sara and Tom on the floor. They had red marks and blisters on their skin. They looked scared and sorry.
Mom was angry and sad. She turned off the oven and called the doctor. She hugged Sara and Tom and said, "Why did you do that? I told you not to touch the oven. You could have been hurt worse. You were very naughty and foolish."
Sara and Tom felt bad. They wished they had listened to Mom. They wished they had not touched the oven. They wished they had not baked cookies. They learned a hard lesson. They said, "We're sorry, Mom. We won't do it again."

Once upon a time there was a bird, who wanted to soar. So every day she went up really high in the sky and flew around. One day she saw a cool dish in the air. It was spinning around. The bird thought it looked fun. So she went closer to check it out. She flew around the dish and it lifted her higher in the sky. She felt so happy! She soared even higher so she could touch the sky. The bird was so excited she kept flying around the dish. She flew and flew until she was so tired she had to go home. But the bird would never forget the cool dish in the sky that let her soar so high.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Billy. Billy loved to sing. Every day, he would sit on a tree branch and sing his happy songs. All the animals in the forest liked to listen to Billy's songs.
One day, it was very dry outside. Billy was so thirsty, but he still wanted to sing. So, he used his strong muscles to fly to the river for a drink of water. He took a big sip of water and felt much better.
Now, Billy could sing again. He flew back to his tree and sang a beautiful song. All the animals in the forest came to listen and dance. They were so happy that Billy could sing again. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a big, amazing house. In the house lived a little boy named Tim and his mom. Tim loved to play with his toys and have fun all day.
One cold day, Tim and his mom sat near the fireplace to keep warm. As they sat, Tim's mom began to yawn. "I am so sleepy," she said. Tim looked at his mom and yawned too. "Me too, Mom," he said.
Tim's mom had an idea. "Let's take a nap," she said. So, Tim and his mom lay down on the soft rug near the fireplace. They closed their eyes and fell asleep, feeling warm and cozy. And they both had happy dreams.

Once upon a time, there was a rocket. It was very dirty. The rocket did not like to be dirty. It wanted to be clean.
One day, a little boy named Timmy saw the rocket. Timmy did not like the harsh dirt on the rocket. He wanted to help the rocket be clean. So, Timmy got a big cloth and some soap. He started to clean the rocket.
Timmy cleaned and cleaned. The rocket started to look clean and shiny. The rocket was very happy. It thanked Timmy for making it clean. Now, the rocket could fly high in the sky. Timmy and the rocket became good friends.

One day, a little boy named Tim saw a crack in his wall. He did not like the crack. It was smelly. Tim did not know what to do. He went to his mom and asked, "Mom, what can I do about the smelly crack?"
His mom said, "Let's clean it and make it go away." So they took a cloth and soap. They cleaned the crack together. The smelly smell went away.
Tim was happy. He said, "Thank you, Mom!" Now, Tim's wall was nice and clean. Tim and his mom were happy. They played in his room all day.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a little girl named Amy. Amy loved dessert. One day, Amy's mom made a big ice cream dessert for her. The dessert was very cold and sweet. Amy was so happy to eat it.
But Amy's mom told her, "Amy, you must play outside and be safe. Then, you can eat your dessert." Amy went outside to play with her friends. They played ball and ran around. They had so much fun, but Amy forgot about her dessert.
When Amy came back inside, she saw her dessert had melted. She was sad, but her mom said, "Don't worry, we can make another dessert. But remember, always listen and be safe." Amy learned that it is important to listen and be safe, even when you want to eat dessert.

One day, a big rain came. A girl named Lucy had a pretty umbrella. She went outside to play in the rain. She saw a big, sour lemon under a tree. She thought, "What will happen if I take the lemon?"
Lucy took the lemon home. She put it on the table. Then, something funny happened. The lemon started to grow! It grew bigger and bigger. Lucy was very surprised. She did not know what to do.
Then, the lemon stopped growing. Lucy had an idea. She took her umbrella and climbed on the big lemon. She opened her umbrella and jumped. The umbrella helped her fly in the sky. Lucy had fun flying with her umbrella and the big, sour lemon.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Tim went to camp. The camp was in a distant place, far from his home. Tim was very happy to play with his new friends at camp.
One day, Tim and his friends went for a walk in the woods. They saw a big rock and decided to climb it. Tim's friend, Sam, said, "Be careful, Tim! The rock is wet and you might slip." Tim listened to Sam and was very careful.
As they climbed the rock, they found a hidden door. They opened the door and saw a room full of toys! It was a secret toy room. Tim and his friends were so surprised and happy. They played with the toys all day and had the best time at camp.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Bobo. Bobo loved to sing all day long. He would sing when the sun came up and he would sing when the sun went down. One day, while Bobo was singing, he saw a big tire on the ground.
Bobo thought it would be fun to play with the tire, so he flew down and landed on it. "This is so much fun!" he said. "I can roll and sing at the same time!" Bobo started to roll the tire with his little wings, but he was a foolish bird and didn't see the big hill in front of him.
As the tire rolled down the hill, Bobo kept singing. He was having so much fun that he didn't notice the tire was going faster and faster. Suddenly, a wise old owl saw Bobo and shouted, "Bobo, stop! You're going too fast!" But Bobo didn't hear the owl because he was singing too loudly.
At the bottom of the hill, the tire hit a big rock and stopped. Bobo flew out of the tire and landed softly on the grass. He looked up at the wise old owl and said, "Thank you for trying to help me. I was foolish and didn't listen, but I will be more careful next time."
From that day on, Bobo still loved to sing, but he also made sure to look around and be careful while playing. And he never played with a tire on a hill again.

Once upon a time, there was a big table. It was hidden behind a tree. A little boy named Tim found the table while playing. Tim was very happy. He wanted to share his find with his friend, Sue.
"Look, Sue! I found a hidden table!" Tim said. Sue was excited too. They decided to play a game on the table. They put their toys on the table and played together. They had so much fun.
One day, a man came. He had a big box. The man wanted to deliver the box to the table. Tim and Sue watched him. The man opened the box. Inside, there were new toys for them to play with. They were so happy.
The man said, "I saw you two playing together and being kind. I wanted to give you a gift. Always be kind and share with others." Tim and Sue learned that being kind and sharing brings good things.
From that day on, Tim and Sue always shared their toys with others. They played at the hidden table every day. They knew that being kind and sharing made everyone happy.

Once upon a time, a small boy named Joe lived at the bottom of a mountain. One day, Joe decided to climb the mountain. He looked outside and saw the mountain was very big and looked very rough. He was a bit scared, but he knew it would be a great adventure.
