Joe put on his shoes and started to walk. Step by step, he walked up the mountain. It was hard walking, but he didn't give up. After a few hours, Joe was at the top of the mountain. Joe said to himself "Wow, I did it! I was brave and didn't give up. Anything is possible if I just try."
Joe's Mom was waiting for him at the bottom of the mountain. When Joe arrived, she said to him: "Joe, I'm so proud of you! You showed bravery by walking up the mountain. No matter how hard it may seem, never give up on your dreams!" 
Then, Joe and his Mom walked home. Joe knew that if he tried his best and didn't give up, he could do anything.

Once upon a time, in a big landscape, there was a small pond. In the pond, there was a kind and reliable frog named Fred. Fred loved to play and splash in the water all day. He had many friends who liked to play with him.
One day, a little bird named Betty flew down to the pond. She saw Fred splashing in the water and said, "Hi, Fred! Can I play with you?" Fred smiled and said, "Yes, Betty! Come and splash with me!" So, Betty jumped in the pond and they splashed and played together.
After they played, Fred and Betty sat by the pond. They looked at the pretty landscape and talked about their fun day. They knew they could always count on each other to have a good time. From that day on, Fred and Betty became best friends and always played together in the big landscape.

Anna and Ben are playing in the house. They have many toys and books. They like to make noise and mess. They do not like to be tidy.
"Anna, Ben, come here!" Mom calls from the kitchen. "It is time for lunch. You have to be tidy first. Put your toys and books away."
Anna and Ben do not want to stop playing. They do not want to be tidy. They say, "No, Mom, we are not hungry. We want to play more."
Mom is not happy. She comes to the house. She sees the noise and mess. She says, "Anna, Ben, this is not good. You have to be tidy. You have to listen to Mom. If you are not tidy, you cannot play more. You cannot have lunch. You cannot have dessert."
Anna and Ben are scared. They do not want to miss lunch and dessert. They do not want to make Mom sad. They say, "Sorry, Mom, we will be tidy. We will put our toys and books away. We will listen to Mom."
Anna and Ben start to be tidy. They pick up their toys and books. They put them in the box and on the shelf. They make the house clean and quiet. Mom smiles. She says, "Good job, Anna and Ben. You are tidy now. You can come to the kitchen. You can have lunch and dessert. You can play more later."
Anna and Ben are happy. They hug Mom. They say, "Thank you, Mom. We love you. We will be tidy next time." They go to the kitchen. They have lunch and dessert. They are good children.

Once upon a time, there was a reliable otter named Ollie. Ollie loved to chew on fish. He had many friends who liked to play with him.
One day, Ollie met a big fish. The big fish said, "Ollie, I have a secret. If you chew on this special fish, you will be very strong." Ollie thought this was a good idea. He wanted to be strong.
Ollie chewed on the special fish. But, the big fish tricked him. Instead of being strong, Ollie became very weak. His friends were sad, and they could not play with him anymore. The big fish swam away, laughing at Ollie.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a hero named Tim. Tim was very confused because he lost his red cape. He needed his cape to help people. Tim looked everywhere for his cape, but he could not find it.
One day, Tim met a girl named Sue. Sue saw that Tim was sad and asked, "Why are you sad, hero?" Tim told her about his lost cape. Sue wanted to help Tim find his cape. They looked and looked but still could not find it.
Then, they went to Tim's house. In his room, they found a red bag with a zip. Sue opened the zip and there was the red cape! Tim was so happy. He put on his cape and thanked Sue. Now, Tim could be a hero again and help people. And Sue became Tim's best friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily was adventurous and loved to learn. One day, she went to school to play with her friends.
At school, Lily's teacher said, "Let's learn and play together!" Lily and her friends were very happy. They played with blocks, drew pictures, and shared their toys. They learned about colors, shapes, and numbers. Lily was having so much fun at school.
One day, Lily saw a new girl sitting alone. The new girl looked sad. Lily thought, "I should be kind and help her." So, Lily went to the new girl and said, "Let's be friends and play together!" The new girl smiled and they played together. Lily learned that being kind and sharing with others made her feel happy and made her friends happy too.

One day, a big dog named Max went to see an opera. It was difficult for him to sit still because the music was so loud. He wanted to sing along, but he didn't know the words.
Max saw a little girl named Lily. She was sad because she lost her key. The key was to lock her toy box. Max wanted to help her find it. He asked, "Lily, where did you last see the key?"
Lily thought hard and said, "I think I left it near the big tree." Max and Lily went to the big tree and found the key. They were so happy. Lily locked her toy box and they went back to enjoy the opera.

One day, a big dog and a little cat were friends. They liked to play and have fun. The big dog was very fair and always shared his toys with the little cat. One day, the big dog said to the little cat, "Let's go bathe in the pond."
The little cat was scared. "But I don't like water," she said. The big dog smiled and said, "Don't worry, I will be with you. It will be fun!" So, they went to the pond to bathe.
As they were playing in the water, the little cat saw a fish in the pond. The fish swam up to them and said, "Hello, friends! I lost my way. Can you help me find my family?" The big dog and the little cat looked at each other and said, "Yes, we will help you."
Together, they helped the fish find his family. The fish was very happy and said, "Thank you, friends!" The big dog and the little cat learned that helping others is a good thing to do. They went home feeling happy and proud.

Lisa was feeling very worried. She was standing on her lawn, looking up at the sky. It was a beautiful day, the sun shining brightly. Suddenly, Lisa noticed something very interesting - a flying kite!
The kite was colorful, its string trailed behind it in the wind. It was a very curious sight.
"Oh! What is that?" Lisa asked.
"It's a kite," said her brother. "Let's go fly it!"
Lisa was still uncertain, but her brother was so excited, she decided to give it a try. She followed her brother to the nearby park, and soon both of them had a kite in the air.
The sun was high in the sky, and they watched the kite soar around in the wind. Lisa forgot all her worries and couldn't help but feel amazed at how beautiful it was. They had a great time playing in the park, and both went home with happy smiles on their faces.

Once upon a time, in a thick forest, there lived a small cat named Kitty. Kitty loved to play and run around the trees. One day, while playing, she got lost and couldn't find her way home.
Kitty met a big dog named Max. Max said, "I can help you find your home, but first, we must rescue my friend, Birdy. She is stuck in a cut in the tree." Kitty agreed to help Max rescue Birdy.
Together, Max and Kitty climbed the tree and found Birdy. Max said, "Hold on, Birdy! We will rescue you!" They pulled and pulled, but Birdy was stuck very tight in the cut. They tried and tried, but they couldn't rescue Birdy.
Kitty and Max were very sad. They couldn't rescue Birdy, and Kitty still couldn't find her way home. They sat under the tree, feeling very sad. The forest was dark, and they were all alone.

Once there was a little girl named Lily. She had long, dark hair and brown eyes. Lily loved to play with her toy dolls and go outside to explore. One day she felt sad. She didn't know why.
Lily's mum noticed and asked her what was wrong. Lily shook her head and stayed quiet. Her mum smiled, and said it was time for a bath. 
Lily was so excited. She ran into the bathroom and hopped into the big, thick bathtub. The water was warm and Lily felt happy. She splashed around, playing with her favourite toys.
When her bath was over, Lily was still feeling a little bit sad. But then she thought of something wonderful. She put her hands together and closed her eyes. She hoped that the feeling of happiness would stay with her forever.
Lily opened her eyes and smiled. She felt much better! From then on, every time she felt sad, she remembered to hope.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his toy whip. One day, Tim went outside to play with his whip in the sun.
While Tim was playing, a crazy bird flew down and took his whip. Tim was sad and wanted his whip back. He tried to think of a way to get it back from the crazy bird.
Tim had an idea. He went inside and put some bread on the ground. The crazy bird saw the bread and dropped the whip to eat the bread. Tim was happy to have his whip back and played with it all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Abigail. She was always very curious and eager to learn new things. She asked her mom a lot of questions every day, and her mom loved spending time answering Abigail's questions.
One day, Abigail asked, "Mommy, what's a lawyer?" Her mom replied, "A lawyer is someone who helps people solve their problems." Abigail wondered what it was like to be a lawyer and help people with problems.
Abigail wanted to become a lawyer someday. Her mom knew she was persistent, so she encouraged Abigail to keep learning and striving for her dreams.
Abigail kept learning and studying. After many years, Abigail achieved her goal of becoming a lawyer.
The moral of the story is that being persistent pays off. If you keep on trying, you will eventually achieve success.

Once upon a time, there was a big sun in the sky. It was very bright and warm. One day, a little boy named Tom went outside to play. He saw his friend, the bird, flying in the sky. Tom was very alert and saw the bird coming down to talk to him.
"Hello, Tom!" said the bird. "Do you want to play with me today?"
"Yes, please!" Tom said with a big smile. "What game will we play?"
The bird thought for a moment and said, "Let's play a game that includes finding things. We can look for pretty stones and leaves."
So, Tom and the bird played the game together. They found many pretty stones and leaves. They had so much fun under the warm sun. When they were done, they sat down and looked at all the things they found. They were very happy and couldn't wait to play together again.

Once upon a time, there was a sleepy cat named Mimi. Mimi loved to eat jelly. One day, Mimi's friend, a little bird named Kiki, came to visit.
"Hi Mimi, what are you doing?" asked Kiki. Mimi yawned and said, "I am making jelly. I am very sleepy, but I want to eat jelly."
Kiki wanted to help Mimi. "Let me add more jelly for you," said Kiki. Mimi smiled and said, "Thank you, Kiki. You are a good friend."
Together, they added more jelly to the bowl. Mimi ate the jelly and felt very happy. After eating, Mimi and Kiki played together until it was time for bed. They were both very sleepy, so they said goodnight and went to sleep.

Once upon a time, there was a town with a very strange law. In this town, everyone had to be generous. They had to share their toys and food with others. The people in the town were very happy because they all had many things to play with and eat.
One day, a little boy named Tim found a magical toy car. The car could go forward and reverse. Tim was very excited to show his friends his new toy. But he remembered the law and knew he had to share it with others.
Tim shared the car with his friends, but they did not want to give it back. They played with it all day long and did not let Tim play with it. Tim was sad and wished the law would change. Suddenly, the toy car started to reverse all by itself! It went back to Tim and stayed with him. The town's people saw this and decided to change the law. They learned that it was important to share, but also to be fair and take turns. From that day on, everyone in the town played together and shared their toys happily ever after.

Once upon a time there was a naughty pig called Red. Red loved to surf and spent most of her days playing in the sea and in the sand.
One day Red decided to try to teach her friend, Sam, how to surf. She showed Sam how to use the surfboard, but he struggled to stay on his feet.
"It's hard!" Sam said. Red just laughed and encouraged him to keep trying.
Suddenly Red noticed a shark swimming in the water. She quickly pushed Sam to safety.
"Oh no!" Red said. "We have to get out of here!"
Sam was scared but Red had a plan. She grabbed the surfboard and said, "Let me supply you, Sam. Climb on my back."
So Red carried Sam away from the shark. When they were safe, they promised to never be naughty in the sea again!

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the beach with his mom. They saw the big blue sea and the waves. Tim loved to watch the waves go up and down. He liked to jump in them and splash around.
Tim saw a funny shape in the sand. It was a crazy star shape, with lots of points. He showed it to his mom and said, "Look, Mom! I found a crazy shape!" His mom smiled and said, "That's a starfish, Tim! It's a special animal that lives in the sea."
They picked up the starfish and waved it in the air. It made Tim laugh. They put the starfish back in the sea and watched it swim away. Tim and his mom had a fun day at the beach, playing with the waves and finding crazy shapes in the sand.

Once upon a time, there was a small planet high in the sky. On this planet, lived two friends - a horse and a frog. The two friends were always together and having funny adventures!
One day, they decided to go on an exploration. They jumped, hopped and slid across the planet, until they reached a meadow full of flowers. In the middle of the meadow, there was a small hill. The two friends raced to the top of the hill and looked around.
At the top of the hill, they found a surprise- a bright yellow sunflower. Its petals were like shimmering gold and its center was a glistening yellow - it was the most beautiful flower they had ever seen! 
The two friends were so filled with joy that they pointed and laughed with delight. They thought the flower was the best thing on the planet! 
The flower made them so happy that their laughter echoed across the small planet. Even when the two friends said goodbye, the flower still filled their hearts with joy and happiness.

Once upon a time, there was a girl who loved to shine. Every morning she woke up super early and grabbed her teddy to go and shine. Her teddy was soft and smooth, and always made her feel calm like a summer's breeze on her skin.
Every time she shone, the girl felt confident and proud. She smiled, knowing she made her world a brighter place. But this morning was different; the girl could feel a new pain in her heart.
She decided to keep shining and ignore the pain. She was determined to make the most out of her morning. She shined a little brighter and then she saw something ahead in the distance.
It was a golden light, shining even brighter than she ever could. She ran towards it and as she got closer, her pain began to slowly disappear. When she reached the light, she looked up and realized it was the beautiful sun!
The sun had awoken and it's warmth began to shine down upon her. The girl smiled with joy, the answer to her pain was right in front of her the whole time. From that day on, the girl made sure she shone like the sun every morning, just like her beautiful teddy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He had a big white cat named Fluffy. They were best friends and liked to play together. One day, Tim's mom was making a cake. She needed butter for the cake, but she had run out. She asked Tim to go to the store and buy some butter.
Tim and Fluffy walked to the store. They saw some kids playing ball. They wanted to play too, but they had to get the butter first. At the store, Tim found the butter and paid for it. On the way home, they saw the kids again. One of the kids said, "Hey Tim, want to play with us?"
Tim looked at Fluffy and said, "We can play for a little bit, but then we have to go home." They played and had fun. Tim was good at striking the ball with the bat. But then, Tim remembered the butter. He said goodbye to his friends and ran home with Fluffy.
When they got home, Tim gave the butter to his mom. She was happy and thanked him. She finished making the cake and shared it with Tim and Fluffy. They all enjoyed the cake and had a great day.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to play outside. He saw a big, rough rock in his yard. Tim touched the rock and felt how rough it was. He wanted to discover what was behind the rock.
Tim pushed the rock away and found a small bottle with a wand inside. He opened the bottle and waved the wand in the air. Suddenly, many bubbles came out! Tim was very happy and shouted, "Look, bubbles!"
His friend, Lily, came running to see the bubbles. She saw the rough rock and the bottle with the wand. "Can I try?" she asked. Tim said, "Yes, you can!" Lily waved the wand and more bubbles came out. They laughed and played with the bubbles all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She was very impatient. She always wanted to play with her friends, but they were not always around. One day, Sue was all alone and didn't know what to do.
Then, Sue heard a small voice. "Hello, Sue!" said the voice. Sue looked down and saw her thumb talking to her. "Hi, Thumb!" Sue said. "I am so bored. I want to play, but my friends are not here."
Thumb said, "Sue, you can still have fun alone. You just need to be patient and use your imagination." So, Sue listened to Thumb and started to play on her own. She pretended to be a princess in a big castle, and soon she was having a great time.
Sue's friends came back later, and they all played together. Sue learned that being patient can make things better. She also learned that her thumb was a wise friend. And from that day on, Sue was never too impatient to have fun, even when she was alone.

Once upon a time, there was a shy cat named Tim. Tim liked to play with a loop. One day, Tim went to the park to play with his loop.
At the park, Tim met a big dog named Max. Max wanted to play with the loop too. Tim was scared but he wanted to make a new friend. So, Tim said "yes" and shared his loop with Max.
As they played, a bird came and took the loop away. Tim and Max were sad. But then, the bird came back with two loops! The bird wanted to play too. Tim and Max were happy to accept the new friend and play together with the loops.

Once upon a time, there was a colorful bird named Bobo. Bobo loved to fly and play with his friends. One day, Bobo's mom asked him to help her cook. She told him, "Bobo, please watch the stove and don't forget to turn it off."
Bobo said, "Okay, Mom!" He watched the stove while his mom went to the store. But soon, Bobo saw his friends playing outside. He wanted to play too, so he went out and forgot about the stove.
When Bobo's mom came back, she saw smoke coming from the stove. She quickly turned it off and opened the windows. Bobo came back inside and said, "I'm sorry, Mom. I forgot about the stove."
Bobo's mom hugged him and said, "It's okay, Bobo. We all forget sometimes. But now you know how important it is to remember." From that day on, Bobo never forgot to do what his mom asked. And as a surprise, his mom got him a colorful kite to play with outside, so he could have fun and still help her when she needed him.

Once upon a time, there was a huge tree. The tree had many leaves. One day, a big wind came. It was a hurricane. The hurricane blew very hard. The tree was scared.
The tree said to the wind, "Please stop! You are too strong!" But the hurricane did not stop. It blew harder and harder. The tree's leaves began to rot. They fell to the ground.
Then, a small bird came. The bird saw the tree and said, "Tree, do not be sad. I will help you." The bird sang a happy song. The hurricane heard the song and stopped blowing. The tree was happy again. The tree and the bird became best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who loved daisies. Every day, she would search for them in the field, filled with excitement. She knew that when she found some, she would pick them and squeeze them between her fingers until all of the petals fell off. 
One day, the little girl found a daisy that looked very cool. She couldn't wait to take it home and squeeze it. But as she went to pick it, she heard a loud voice from behind her.
"Don't squeeze that daisy!" said the voice.
The little girl turned around to see an old man. He had a big, white beard and a gentle smile.
"Why not?" she asked.
"Well," replied the old man, "it's the daisy's home. If you take it away, it won't be happy. Let it stay here and enjoy being in its own special place."
The little girl thought about what the old man said. She decided to leave the daisy in the field and watch as it swayed in the cool breeze. Instead of squeezing it, she gave the daisy a gentle hug.

Once upon a time, a long, long time ago, there was a dolphin. The dolphin lived in the big, blue sea. The dolphin had many friends like fish, crabs, and turtles. They all played and swam together every day.
One day, the dolphin went far away from his friends. He swam and swam until he found a new place. In this new place, he saw something long and shiny. It was a big, long fish! The dolphin was very surprised. He had never seen a fish like this before. He wanted to show his friends, so he swam back to them as fast as he could.
When the dolphin returned, he told his friends all about the long, shiny fish. They were all very excited to see it too. So, they all swam back to the new place with the dolphin. But when they got there, the long fish was gone! Instead, there was a big, friendly whale. The whale had been playing a trick on the dolphin! He had pretended to be a long, shiny fish. The dolphin and his friends laughed and laughed. They had a lot of fun, and they all became good friends with the whale.

Once upon a time, there was a little brown dog. He loved to run and play outside. One day, he saw a big shape in the snow. He wanted to find out what it was.
As he got closer, the shape began to move. The little brown dog was scared, but he wanted to see what it was. Then, the shape started to freeze. The little brown dog didn't know what to do.
Suddenly, the shape turned into a big, scary monster. The little brown dog ran away as fast as he could. He learned that it's not always good to be too curious. Sometimes, it's better to stay safe and not go near things we don't know.

One day, Tom and his friends wanted to go to a party. They were so excited! They put on their party hats and got ready to leave. But Tom's mom said, "You must be calm before you go." Tom and his friends tried to be calm, but it was hard. They were too excited for the party.
On their way to the party, they saw a big hill. They knew that the party was just on the other side. They all ran up the hill as fast as they could. When they got to the top, they saw the party down below. It was so close! They could hear the music and see the balloons.
Tom remembered what his mom said about being calm. He told his friends, "Let's take a deep breath and be calm before we go down the hill." They all took a deep breath, and they felt calm. They walked down the hill, and when they got to the party, they had so much fun! They were happy that they listened to Tom's mom and were calm before they got to the party.

Once there was a little girl called Alice who lived with her family in a small, but happy, house near a big hedge.
One day, Alice noticed that the hedge had become very tall and it was blocking the sun from the garden. She tried to cut the hedge, but it was too high for her and she felt helpless.
So, Alice decided to ask her father for help. She said to him, "Daddy, can you please help me change the hedge so that we still get sunlight in the garden?" Her father was so proud of Alice for wanting to do something to make the garden better.
So, her father and her worked together to shorten the hedge and make the garden brighter. After they had finished, the garden was beautiful and the sun shined brightly. Alice was so happy!
The moral of this story is that if you want to make a change in the world, even if it feels helpless at first, it is always worth asking for help. Together, we can make a big difference.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a happy dog named Spot. Spot loved to run and play outside. One day, it was very cold, and Spot began to shiver. He wanted to go inside and be warm.
Spot saw an angry cat named Tom. Tom was not nice to Spot. Tom said, "I am the spirit of this house, and you cannot come in!" Spot felt sad, but he did not want to fight with Tom.
Spot thought of a plan. He found a toy and showed it to Tom. He said, "Tom, if you let me in, we can play with this toy together." Tom liked the toy and agreed to let Spot in. They played together and became friends. And Spot did not shiver anymore.

Sara loves her pet cat, Max. Max is soft and warm and likes to play with Sara. Sara likes to hug Max and give him treats. Max is an important friend for Sara.
One day, Sara and Max are in the garden. Sara sees a big dog on the other side of the fence. The dog is barking and growling. Sara thinks the dog is scary and mean. She wants to go inside the house.
But Max is not afraid of the dog. He runs to the fence and hisses at the dog. He wants to protect Sara and his home. He thinks he is a big and brave cat.
"Max, come back!" Sara calls to Max. "The dog is bad! He can hurt you!"
Max does not listen to Sara. He thinks he can scare the dog away. He jumps on the fence and swipes his paw at the dog. The dog snaps his teeth at Max. Max loses his balance and falls off the fence.
Sara screams and runs to Max. She picks him up and hugs him. She is afraid that Max is hurt. She sees a scratch on his ear and some blood on his fur.
"Max, you are silly!" Sara says to Max. "Why did you do that? I warned you about the dog!"
Max looks at Sara with his big green eyes. He purrs and rubs his head against her cheek. He is sorry that he did not listen to Sara. He is glad that Sara is safe and loves him.
Sara takes Max inside the house. She cleans his wound and gives him some milk. She tells him that he is a good cat, but he should be careful. She tells him that he is her important pet and she does not want to lose him.
Max snuggles with Sara on the couch. He is happy and sleepy. He dreams of chasing mice and birds. He does not dream of dogs. He knows that Sara will warn him if there is danger. He knows that Sara will always be his friend.

One day, a boy named Tim wanted to gain money. He thought, "I will be careful and sell my toys." So, he put his toys in a big box and went outside.
Tim saw a girl named Sue. He said, "Do you want to buy a toy?" Sue looked at the toys and said, "Yes, I want that doll." Tim was happy and gave Sue the doll.
But then, something unexpected happened. Tim's mom came outside and said, "Tim, those toys are not yours to sell! They belong to your little sister." Tim felt bad and gave the money back to Sue. From that day on, Tim learned to be more careful with his things.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. He had a lock that he loved. One day, Tim wanted to mail a letter to his friend, Sam. It was a dry, sunny day outside. Tim put the letter in a box and walked to the mail place.
As Tim walked, he saw a big, dry tree. He decided to climb it. When he climbed up, he saw a bird's nest. In the nest, there was a shiny key! Tim thought the key might open his lock.
Tim took the key and climbed down. He ran home to try the key on his lock. He put the key in the lock and turned it. The lock opened! Inside the lock, there was a note. It said, "Surprise, Tim! I found your lock and hid the key in the tree. I hope you had fun finding it. Love, Sam."
Tim was very happy. His friend Sam had made a fun game for him. Tim decided to mail a thank you note to Sam for the surprise. And they both stayed good friends forever.

One day, a peaceful cat named Tom found a case. The case was big and blue. Tom was very happy. He wanted to show the case to his friend, Sam the dog.
Tom went to Sam's house. "Look, Sam! I found a case!" said Tom. Sam looked at the case and smiled. "Wow, Tom! That's a nice case!" said Sam.
Tom and Sam opened the case. Inside, they found many toys with numbers on them. They played with the toys and had a lot of fun. They counted the numbers and laughed together. Tom and Sam were very happy with their new case and toys.

Once upon a time, in a small house in the west, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy box full of fun things to play with. One day, Tim wanted to play with his favorite toy, a big red ball. But the ball was stuck at the bottom of the toy box.
Tim tried to reach for the ball, but he was too small. He struggled to get the ball out. Tim felt sad and asked his mom for help. "Mom, can you help me get my ball? It's stuck and I can't get it," he said.
Mom came to help Tim. She moved the other toys out of the way and got the big red ball for him. Tim was so happy, and he hugged his mom. "Thank you, Mom!" he said. Now Tim could play with his favorite toy, and they all lived happily ever after.

Tom and Sam were best friends. They liked to play with cars and balls and blocks. They shared their toys and helped each other. They were loyal friends.
One day, they found a big red car in the park. It was shiny and fast and had a loud horn. They both wanted to play with it. They ran to the car and grabbed it.
"It's mine!" Tom shouted.
"No, it's mine!" Sam shouted.
They pulled the car and pushed each other. They started to quarrel. They were not happy.
A man came to the park. He saw Tom and Sam fighting over the car. He was angry. He walked to them and said, "Hey, what are you doing? That's my car! Give it back!"
Tom and Sam were in shock. They let go of the car and looked at the man. They were scared. They did not know it was his car. They thought it was a toy.
"I'm sorry, mister," Tom said.
"Me too," Sam said.
The man took the car and left. He was still angry.
Tom and Sam looked at each other. They felt bad. They did not want to quarrel. They wanted to be friends.
"I'm sorry, Tom," Sam said.
"I'm sorry, Sam," Tom said.
They hugged and said, "We are still best friends."
They smiled and went to play with their own toys. They were loyal friends.

One day, a little girl named Mia found a big box of crayons. She was very happy. She wanted to show her friend Tom. She picked up the box and ran to his house. But on her way, she saw a nosy cat. The cat was looking at her crayons.
"Hi, cat," Mia said. "Do you want to see my crayons?" The cat nodded its head. Mia opened the box and showed the cat all the pretty colors. The cat liked the crayons too. They were having fun.
But then, something unexpected happened. Mia slipped on a rock and the crayons fell out of the box. The nosy cat quickly picked up a crayon and ran away. Mia was sad, but Tom came to help. They looked for the cat and found it under a tree.
"Give back the crayon, cat," Tom said. The cat looked at them and dropped the crayon. Mia and Tom picked up all the crayons and put them back in the box. They were happy again and went to their houses to draw with their crayons. The nosy cat watched them from the tree, wishing it could draw too.

Once upon a time, there was a fair little girl named Lily. She had a big cat named Sam. Lily and Sam were best friends. They liked to play all day.
One Wednesday, Lily and Sam went to the park. They played in the mud and got very dirty. Their hands and paws were full of mud. They laughed and had lots of fun.
When they got home, Lily's mom saw how dirty they were. She said, "You need to wash your hands and paws!" Lily and Sam went to the bathroom. They washed their hands and paws with soap and water. Now they were clean and ready to play again.

Once upon a time, there was a little mole. He was very cold, so he decided to go on an adventure. He hopped and hopped down the road, looking for something fun to do. Suddenly, he heard clapping! He looked up and saw a group of children playing in a big open field. The mole was excited and he started to clap too!
The children laughed and shouted, "Hi mole!" He was so happy and he clapped even louder. They all ran around, and the mole joined in with the fun. He hopped, skipped, and jumped with the children until it was time to go home.
The mole was sad that the fun was over and he hugged all the kids goodbye. He waved and ran back home. As he was running, he was still clapping and singing. He was so happy and couldn't wait for the next adventure!

Once upon a time, in a fair land, there was a brave boy named Tim. Tim had a big shield that he loved to play with. One day, he saw a big hill and wanted to go up. He took his shield and started to walk.
As he went up the hill, he saw a big tree. Tim thought the tree would be a good place for a surprise. He put his shield behind the tree and kept going up. He was excited to see what would happen next.
When Tim got to the top, he saw a big, mean bear. The bear wanted to get Tim. Tim was scared, but he knew he had his shield. He ran down the hill, back to the tree. He grabbed his shield and turned to face the bear. With his shield, Tim was safe from the bear. The bear saw the shield and ran away. Tim was very happy and knew that his shield would always keep him safe.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim loved to play chess. One day, Tim was worried. He had lost his chess set. Tim asked his friend, Sam, "Have you seen my chess set?"
Sam said, "No, but let's look for it." They looked in Tim's room, but it was not there. They looked in the garden, but it was not there either. They felt sad.
Then, they saw a big box in the corner of the room. They opened the box and found a new chess set inside. Tim's mom had filled the box with a new chess set as a surprise! Tim and Sam learned that sometimes, when you feel worried, good things can still happen.

Once there was a little boy who was only three years old. He wanted to take a nap, so he snuggled up in bed. But, he had a problem. He couldn't sleep. He wanted to play outside, but the door was locked. He felt so ashamed because he couldn't get outside. 
The little boy started to cry. He felt so sad that he was stuck inside. But then, he had an idea. He started to count sheep! He counted and counted until he finally fell asleep.
When he woke up, the door was unlocked! He was so excited to go outside and play, but then he remembered that he was supposed to be taking a nap. He felt ashamed again. 
The little boy decided that he would take a short nap, then go outside and play. He closed his eyes and soon he was sound asleep. 
This time when he woke up, the door was still open and he was happy. He ran outside and enjoyed the sunshine and fresh air.

Once upon a time, in a wide room, there was a little girl named Amy. Amy liked to play with her toys all day. One day, she found a small box in the room. Inside the box, there was a sharp pin. Amy did not know what it was, so she took it out to look at it.
Amy showed the sharp pin to her mom. Her mom told her, "Be careful, Amy! That pin is very sharp. It can hurt you." Amy listened to her mom and put the pin back in the box. She closed the box and put it away.
Later, Amy and her mom used the sharp pin to make a pretty dress for Amy's doll. They were very careful with the pin. They had fun making the dress together. After they finished, Amy played with her doll in the wide room, and they were both very happy.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the beach with his mom. They had a big towel to sit on. Tim saw a high hill and wanted to climb it. His mom said, "Be careful, Tim!"
As Tim climbed the high hill, he saw a crab. The crab was on his towel! Tim was scared. He did not want the crab on his towel. He called his mom, "Mom, there is a crab on our towel!"
His mom came and said, "Let's poke the crab with a stick, so it goes away." Tim and his mom poked the crab. The crab walked away from their towel. Tim and his mom were happy. They sat on the towel and had fun at the beach.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He loved to play outside with his friends. One day, they saw a big, expensive toy on a post. They all wanted the toy, but they did not know how to get it.
Tim had an idea. He said, "Let's pause and think." They all stopped and thought about how to get the toy. Tim's friend, Sam, found a long stick. They used the stick to get the toy down from the post.
When they got the toy, they all played together and had fun. They learned that it is good to pause and think before doing something. This way, they could find a good way to solve a problem. And they also learned that sharing is better than fighting over an expensive toy.

Ricky was a very clever little boy. He started to go to school every day. He took the bus to school with his friends.
One day, Ricky told his friends that he had a secret. They were all very curious, so they asked him what it was. 
Ricky smiled and said, "I like to study in the evenings. Sometimes I even stay up late to study."
"Wow! That's amazing," said one of his friends.
The other friends were also amazed. They couldn't believe how hard Ricky worked to learn things.
Ricky liked studying and he was getting better and better every day. He was so proud of himself! 
He would take the bus to school each day, but at night he would surprise everyone by studying in the most clever ways.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his red ball all day. One day, while playing, he fell down and got a small cut on his arm. "Ouch!" Tim cried, as he saw the open cut on his arm. He knew he needed to get help.
Tim ran to his mom and showed her the cut. "Mom, I have a cut and it hurts!" he said. His mom looked at the cut and said, "Don't worry, Tim. I will help you." She went to the kitchen and got some medicine to put on his cut. She carefully put the medicine on Tim's arm and gave him a big hug. "All better now," she said.
As Tim went back outside to play, he saw a tiny, green bug on his red ball. The bug had a small cut on its leg too! Tim wanted to help the bug, just like his mom helped him. He carefully put a tiny drop of medicine on the bug's cut. The bug suddenly grew bigger and bigger! Tim was surprised, but he was happy that he could help the bug. They became friends and played together all day.

Once upon a time, there was a land where everyone was always happy. They played all day and slept all night. But one day, a war started in the land. The people were scared and didn't know what to do.
One morning, a light and kind fairy woke up early. She saw the war and felt sad. She wanted to help the people and make them happy again. So, she went to the king and said, "I want to help stop the war. How can I help you?"
The king thought for a moment and said, "You are light and kind. You can help us by making everyone wake up and remember how to be happy. When they are happy, the war will stop." The fairy agreed and used her magic to help the people.
The fairy went to every person and made them wake up with a big smile. They remembered how to be happy and started to play again. Soon, the war stopped, and the land was happy and peaceful once more. The king and the people thanked the light and kind fairy for her help.

Once upon a time, there was a big tree in the middle of a park. The tree had many leaves, and it was very tall. A little girl named Emma loved to play near the tree every day. One day, she saw a squirrel on the tree and said, "Hello, squirrel! What are you doing?"
The squirrel looked at Emma and said, "I am looking for food. I wonder if there is any food available for me." Emma thought for a moment and then said, "I have some nuts in my bag. I can give them to you."
The squirrel was very happy, and it took the nuts from Emma. They both sat under the tree, and the squirrel ate the nuts. Emma felt happy that she could help her new friend. From that day on, Emma and the squirrel played together under the tree every day, and they became the best of friends.

Anna and Ben like to play in the garden. They have many toys and flowers there. They also have a number game. The game has cards with numbers and pictures. They have to match the cards and say the numbers.
One day, they are playing the number game in the garden. Anna picks a card with a number four and a picture of a cat. She says, "Four, cat". She looks for the matching card. Ben picks a card with a number six and a picture of a dog. He says, "Six, dog". He looks for the matching card.
But then, a careless bird flies over the garden. The bird sees the cards and thinks they are food. The bird swoops down and grabs a card with its beak. It is the card with the number four and the cat. The bird flies away with the card.
Anna sees the bird and shouts, "Hey, bird, give me back my card! That is my number four and my cat!" Ben sees the bird and shouts, "Bad bird, bad bird! Leave our cards alone!" They run after the bird, but the bird is too fast. The bird flies over the fence and disappears.
Anna and Ben are sad. They have lost their number four and their cat. They cannot finish the number game. They go back to the garden and look at the other cards. They see a card with a number five and a picture of a flower. They say, "Five, flower". They smile and decide to play another game. They hope the bird will not come back.

One day, a furry cat named Tom went out to play. He saw a little bird on a tree. Tom wanted to tease the bird, so he said, "Hey bird, I can jump higher than you!" The bird looked at Tom and said, "No, you can't."
Tom jumped high to show the bird he was right. But when he jumped, he hit his head on a big skull that was hiding in the tree. The skull fell down and Tom was scared. The bird laughed and said, "I told you, you can't jump higher than me!"
Tom felt sad and walked away. But then, something unexpected happened. The skull started to talk! It said, "Thank you for making me fall down. I was stuck in that tree for a long time." Tom was surprised and said, "You're welcome!" They became friends and Tom learned not to tease others.

Once upon a time, there was a big orange cat. The cat loved to play with his ball. One day, the ball went far away. The cat wanted to find it.
The cat walked and walked. He saw a daddy with his little girl. The daddy was sad. His little girl lost her toy. The cat wanted to help them. He looked and looked for the toy. He found the toy under a bush. The little girl was so happy, she hugged the cat.
The cat did not quit. He kept looking for his ball. Then, something unexpected happened. The little girl found the cat's ball. She gave it to the cat. The cat was very happy. The daddy said, "Thank you, cat." The cat learned that helping others can make you happy too.

Once upon a time, a boy named Tom went on a holiday with his family. They went to a big beach with lots of sand and water. Tom was very happy because he loved to play in the sand and swim in the water.
One day, while playing on the beach, Tom saw something that looked disgusting. It was brown and slimy, and it seemed like it was moving. He felt scared, but he wanted to know what it was, so he slowly went closer to take a better look.
When Tom got close, he saw that the disgusting thing was not a scary monster, but a little puppy who was covered in mud! The puppy was lost and needed help. Tom took the puppy to his family, and they cleaned him up. They all became friends and had the best holiday ever. And the puppy was not disgusting anymore, but very cute and happy.

Once upon a time, there was a man. The man had gray hair. He liked to run in the park. Every day, he put on his shoes and ran.
One day, while the man was running, he saw a big box. The box was gray like his hair. He stopped running and looked at the box. The man was very curious.
He opened the box and found a gray hat. The man put the hat on his head. Suddenly, he could run very fast! The man was so happy. He ran and ran, faster than ever before. And from that day on, the gray man and his gray hat were the fastest runners in the park.

Once upon a time, there was a wise old owl who lived in a big tree. The wise owl had many friends in the forest. One day, a little rabbit came to the owl with a problem. The rabbit's fur was very long and messy. The rabbit said, "Wise Owl, can you help me? My fur is too long and messy."
The wise owl thought for a moment and said, "I will provide you with a razor. You can use it to cut your fur and make it neat." The little rabbit was very happy and thanked the wise owl. The rabbit used the razor carefully and soon, its fur was short and tidy.
All the other animals in the forest saw how neat the rabbit looked and wanted to be like him. They all went to the wise owl for help. The wise owl provided razors to everyone and soon all the animals had neat fur. The forest was a happier place, and the animals learned that it is good to take care of themselves. The moral of the story is to always ask for help when you need it and to take care of yourself.

Sara loves to dance. She likes to move her body to the rhythm of the music. She spins and jumps and claps her hands. She feels happy and free.
But sometimes, Sara is naughty. She dances when she should not. She dances in the classroom, when the teacher is talking. She dances in the library, when everyone is quiet. She dances in the supermarket, when her mom is shopping.
One day, Sara's mom takes her to a special place. It is a dance studio. There are many other children who love to dance. There is a nice lady who teaches them how to dance. She shows them different moves and rhythms. She praises them when they do well. She corrects them when they make mistakes.
Sara is amazed. She learns new things. She makes new friends. She has fun. She is not naughty anymore. She dances when she should. She listens when she should. She is respectful and polite.
Sara's mom is proud of her. She sees how much Sara enjoys dancing. She sees how much Sara improves. She sees how much Sara grows. She hugs Sara and tells her she loves her. Sara hugs her back and tells her she loves her too. They are happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Emma. Emma was a fast learner. She loved to learn new things. One day, she saw a big ice-cream truck in the distant. It was far away, but she could see it. She wanted to go to the truck and get some ice-cream.
Emma asked her mom if she could go to the ice-cream truck. Her mom said yes, but only if she would learn to tie her shoes first. Emma was excited to learn, so she listened to her mom's words. She tried and tried to tie her shoes. After a few tries, she finally learned how to do it.
Emma and her mom walked to the ice-cream truck. Emma was happy that she learned to tie her shoes. She was also happy to get some ice-cream. She picked her favorite flavor, chocolate. Emma and her mom sat on a bench and enjoyed the ice-cream together. Emma was proud of what she learned that day.

Once upon a time, there was a gifted little girl named Mia. She was a very special girl and was loved by all.
Now, Mia had a hose that she adored. She would drag it around the garden and use it to water her flowers.
Mia used her hose every day and didn't have a care in the world.
But one day, Mia's hose suffered a puncture. Water came spraying out everywhere and Mia was very sad. She tried to fix the hose, but it was no use.
Mia asked her parents for help. "Can you fix my hose?" she pleaded.
Mia's parents smiled and said, "Yes, we can help."
So, they fixed the hose and Mia was so happy. She took her hose back out into the garden, spraying and watering her flowers.
Mia was relieved to have her hose back!

One day, a boy named Tim wanted to relax and watch a movie. He had a friend named Sam who was very generous. Sam had many movies at his house. Tim went to Sam's house to watch a movie together.
But when Tim got to Sam's house, Sam was not there. Tim was sad and did not know what to do. He wanted to watch a movie, but he could not find Sam. Tim sat down and thought about where Sam could be.
Then, Tim remembered that Sam liked to play at the park. Tim went to the park and found Sam. Sam was happy to see Tim. They went back to Sam's house to watch a movie and relax. They had a great time together.

Once upon a time, there was a bossy cat named Tom. Tom loved to play with his bucket. One day, he saw his friend, a little dog named Max.
Max was playing with a ball. Tom wanted Max to play with his bucket too. So, he told Max, "Remove your ball and play with my bucket!" Max didn't like how bossy Tom was, but he wanted to be a good friend.
They played with the bucket all day. They filled it with sand, water, and even leaves. At the end of the day, Max and Tom were both very happy. They learned that playing together was more fun than being bossy. And from that day on, they always shared their toys and played nicely.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Sally. She had a jacket that she loved very much. One day, she met a boy named Tim. Tim was deaf, but he was very kind and could talk with his hands.
Sally and Tim played together every day. They liked to run, jump, and laugh. When it was cold, Sally wore her jacket to keep warm. Tim liked Sally's jacket too. He thought it was pretty.
One day, Sally said to Tim, "When we grow up, I want to marry you!" Tim smiled and said with his hands, "I want to marry you too!" They were very happy. When they grew up, they got married and lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time there was a mommy and a baby. The mommy had a lotion. The baby wanted to have some too. So mommy said, "Yes, you can have some lotion."
The baby was so excited. She took the lotion and put it all over her body. She laughed and felt so happy. But then...the mommy realised there was no more lotion left.
Mommy said,"Oh no! All the lotion is gone. You made it empty. Now I don't have any lotion for myself."
The baby felt so sorry. She had not meant to use all the lotion.
But it was too late. The lotion was empty. The mommy was very sad.
And that was the bad ending. The baby was sad because she had made the lotion empty.

Once upon a time, there was a large bear. The large bear had a wife. They lived in a big cave in the woods. The bear and his wife were very happy together. They liked to play and eat honey.
One day, the large bear took a long nap. While he was napping, he had a dream. In his dream, he and his wife went on a fun adventure. They climbed trees and swam in the river. They found a big tree with lots of honey.
When the large bear woke up, he told his wife about his dream. His wife smiled and said, "Let's go on an adventure like in your dream!" So the large bear and his wife went on a fun adventure together. They climbed trees, swam in the river, and found a big tree with lots of honey. They were very happy and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a big, light house. Inside lived a little girl who loved playing with a string. Every day, she would play for hours until the sun went down and it became too dark to see.
One day, a mysterious old lady appeared. She wore a big hat with colourful feathers and sparkly shoes. The little girl was so excited and asked the old lady where she had come from. 
The old lady smiled and told her that she had come from a distant land to give her a magical gift. She handed the little girl a long, light string. She said that if she tied it to her finger, it would grant her a wish!
The little girl thought for a moment before twirling the string around her finger. She made a wish and the string started to sparkle and shine. The old lady smiled and told her that it was all true.
The little girl thanked the old lady and watched as she disappeared into the night. From then on, the little girl was always happy and her light string made all her wishes come true.

Lily and Ben are twins. They like to go to the park with Mom and Dad. The park has swings, slides, and a big pond. Lily and Ben love to feed the ducks and geese at the pond.
One day, they see a new duck at the pond. It is very big and has a long neck. It is not like the other ducks. Lily and Ben are curious. They want to get closer to the new duck.
"Hello, duck," Lily says. "What is your name?"
The duck does not answer. It looks at Lily and Ben with its small eyes. It makes a loud noise. "Honk! Honk!"
Lily and Ben are scared. They run back to Mom and Dad. The duck follows them. It flaps its wings and honks some more.
"Help! Help!" Lily and Ben cry. "The duck is chasing us!"
Mom and Dad see the duck. They laugh. They are not scared. They know what the duck is.
"That is not a duck, Lily and Ben," Mom says. "That is a goose. A goose is a different kind of bird. It is not very friendly. It likes to be alone."
"Sorry, goose," Ben says. "We did not mean to bother you. We thought you were a duck."
The goose stops chasing them. It goes back to the pond. It honks at the other ducks. The other ducks swim away.
Lily and Ben watch the goose. They feel sorry for it. It has no friends.
"Maybe the goose is lonely," Lily says. "Maybe it wants to play with us."
"Maybe," Ben says. "But we have to be careful. The goose might bite us."
They see an old man walking near the pond. He has a big hat and a long coat. He has a bag of bread in his hand. He is one of the staff who works at the park. He takes care of the animals and the plants.
The old man sees the goose. He smiles. He walks towards the goose. He throws some bread into the water. The goose swims to the bread. It eats the bread. It does not honk. It does not flap. It looks happy.
The old man talks to the goose. He says, "Hello, Gus. How are you today? You are a good goose. You are my friend."
The goose listens to the old man. It nods its head. It makes a soft noise. "Hmmm. Hmmm."
Lily and Ben are surprised. They see that the goose likes the old man. They see that the old man likes the goose. They see that the goose and the old man are friends.
"Wow," Lily says. "The goose has a name. It is Gus. And it has a friend. It is the old man."
"Yes," Ben says. "That is nice. Maybe Gus is not so lonely after all."
They wave to the old man and Gus. They say, "Bye, Gus. Bye, old man. Have a nice day."
The old man and Gus wave back. They say, "Bye, Lily. Bye, Ben. Thank you for visiting."
Lily and Ben smile. They are happy. They learned something new. They go to play on the swings and slides. They have fun at the park.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Tim went on a vacation with his mom and dad. They went to a big, noisy city. Tim was very excited to spend time with his family.
One day, they went to a big park. Tim saw many birds, dogs, and kids playing. He was happy and wanted to play too. But then, something unexpected happened. A big, colorful bird flew down and took Tim's hat!
Tim was sad and surprised. He chased the bird to get his hat back. The bird flew into a small, quiet garden. In the garden, Tim found a magic stone. The stone could make wishes come true!
Tim wished for his hat back, and the bird gave it to him. He also wished for the noisy city to become quiet and peaceful. The city became quiet, and everyone was happy. Tim and his family enjoyed the rest of their vacation in the quiet city, and they all lived happily ever after.

One day, a cat and a dog were playing in a peaceful park. They were running and jumping in the sun. They saw a big puddle and jumped in it. They got all wet!
The cat said, "We need to dry now. Let's sit in the sun." The dog agreed, and they sat down. But the sun was not drying them fast enough.
The cat had an idea. "Let's ask the wind to help us!" The dog said, "Good idea!" They called for the wind, and the wind came. The wind blew hard, and they were dry in no time.
But now, the wind was making a big mess. Leaves and dirt were flying everywhere. The park was not peaceful anymore. The cat and the dog did not like the mess.
The dog said, "Wind, please stop now. We need to put things in order again." The wind stopped blowing, and the cat and the dog worked together to clean up the mess. Soon, the park was peaceful and clean again, and they continued to play happily.

Once upon a time, there was a big, tough bear who lived in the woods. He loved to eat jam on his bread. One day, he saw a jar of jam high up in a tree. The bear wanted the jam very much.
The bear tried to climb the tree to get the jam, but the tree was too tough for him to hold on. He fell down and felt sad. Then, a small bird saw the bear and wanted to help him.
The bird flew up to the tree and held the jar of jam in its beak. It flew down and gave the jam to the bear. The bear was so happy! He thanked the bird and shared the jam with his new friend. They both enjoyed the jam together and became best friends.

One day, a lazy cat named Tom was lying under a big tree. He saw a little bird with a gift in its beak. The bird was trying to open the gift, but it was too hard for her. Tom went to the bird and said, "Can I help you open the gift?"
The bird was happy and said, "Yes, please!" Tom used his strong teeth to open the gift. Inside the gift, there was a shiny stone. The bird said, "Thank you, Tom! This is a very special stone. It will help us find food when we are hungry."
Tom and the bird became friends. They played and looked for food together. They learned to value each other's help. The bird taught Tom to fly high, and Tom taught the bird how to run fast. They were very happy and had lots of fun together.

One day, a little girl named Lily went to the sea. She saw a dolphin. The dolphin was fair and nice. Lily and the dolphin became friends.
Lily said, "Let's play!" The dolphin said, "Okay!" They played and had fun. The dolphin showed Lily how to swim fast. They laughed and splashed in the water.
Then, Lily saw something in the sand. She went to examine it. It was a big shell. When she picked it up, a little crab came out. The crab was the dolphin's friend too. Now, they all played together.

Once upon a time there was a nice parade. Everyone was very happy and had lots of fun. The parade was led by a big dolly in a fancy dress. She was in charge and was ordering everyone around.
Then something bad happened. A big, scary dragon came and crashed the parade. He started roaring and flying high in the sky. He said he wanted to take over, and everyone was scared.
The dragon ordered the people to fly away and leave the parade. Everyone was sad and scared. They flew away and the parade was never seen again. 
It was a very sad story with a bad ending.

Once upon a time, in a warm yard, a little bird named Timmy lived. Timmy loved to sing. Every day, he would sing to his friends, the sun, and the trees.
One day, while Timmy was singing, a big cat named Sam came to the yard. Sam said, "Hi Timmy, I like your song. Can I sing with you?" Timmy was scared, but he said, "Okay, let's sing together."
Timmy and Sam started to sing. Their friends came to listen. Everyone was happy and having fun. Then, something unexpected happened. Sam, the big cat, began to dance! All the animals laughed and clapped. From that day on, Timmy and Sam were best friends, and they sang and danced together in the warm yard every day.

Once upon a time, there was a messy little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play in the mud and make a big mess. One day, Tim went to a temple with his mom and dad. The temple was big and pretty. Tim wanted to play in the mud outside, but his mom and dad said, "No, we must go inside the temple."
Inside the temple, Tim saw a big, shiny ball. He wanted to touch it, but his hands were very messy. Tim's mom and dad wanted to prevent him from touching the ball, but they were too late. Tim touched the ball, and something unexpected happened.
The ball started to glow and shake. Then, the ball changed into a big, friendly dragon! The dragon said, "Thank you, Tim. Your messy hands helped me. I was stuck as a ball, but your mud made me free!" Tim's mom and dad were very surprised. They learned that sometimes, being messy can be a good thing.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had very long hair. He did not like to get a haircut. One day, his mom said, "Tim, it's time to get a haircut. Your hair is too long."
Tim felt sad. He did not want to go. His mom took him to the haircut place. The haircut man was very nice. But Tim was careless. He did not sit still. The haircut man tried to be careful, but Tim moved too much.
Then, Tim's mom said, "Tim, you need to settle down. The haircut man needs to cut your hair." Tim listened to his mom. He settled down and sat still. The haircut man cut Tim's hair. When it was done, Tim looked in the mirror. He liked his new haircut. Tim was happy, and his mom was proud of him.

Lily and Ben were twins who liked to play games. They were very competitive and always wanted to win. One day, they decided to have a race with their toy cars. They set up a track in the living room with books, pillows and boxes.
"Ready, set, go!" Lily shouted and pushed her red car. Ben pushed his blue car and tried to catch up with her. They zoomed around the track, dodging the obstacles and cheering for their cars.
"I'm going to win!" Lily said.
"No, I'm going to win!" Ben said.
They reached the finish line, which was a plate of sausages that their mom had made for lunch. They both wanted to grab a sausage, but there was only one left. They reached for it at the same time and pulled hard.
"Let go, it's mine!" Lily said.
"No, it's mine!" Ben said.
They pulled and pulled until the sausage snapped in half and flew in the air. It landed on their dad's head, who was reading a book on the couch. He looked up and saw the twins with their cars and the broken sausage.
"What are you two doing?" he asked.
"Sorry, dad!" Lily and Ben said.
They ran to hug him and apologized. They realized that they had been too competitive and that sharing was better. They decided to split the sausage and eat it together. They also shared their cars and played nicely. They learned their lesson and had fun.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a little boy named Tim. Tim had a best friend named Sam. They loved to play together every day. One day, they heard some grown-ups talking about a scary thing called war. Tim and Sam did not know what war was, but they knew it must be bad.
Tim asked his mom, "What is war?" His mom said, "War is when people fight and it can be very scary." Tim and Sam were scared, but they made a promise to each other. They said, "We will never fight like that. We will always be friends."
One day, Tim and Sam had a small fight over a toy. They remembered their promise and said sorry to each other. They knew they did not want to be like the people in the scary war. They hugged and played together again, happy that they kept their promise to always be friends.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a lot of fog. In this town, there was a hungry cat named Tom. Tom was always looking for food to eat. One day, he saw a big bird in the sky. Tom thought the bird might have food for him.
Tom decided to pray for help. He closed his eyes and said, "Please, help me get the bird's food." Suddenly, the bird came down and landed right in front of Tom. The bird looked at Tom and said, "I heard your prayer. I am here to help you."
Tom was very surprised! He did not know that birds could talk. The bird gave Tom some food and they became good friends. From that day on, Tom was never hungry again. And the town was not foggy anymore.

Tom was a shy boy who liked to play with his scooter. He had a red scooter with big wheels and a bell. He rode his scooter every day in the park with his mom. He liked to go fast and make noise with his bell.
One day, he saw a girl with a pink scooter in the park. She had long hair and a smile. She rode her scooter near Tom and said hello. Tom felt nervous and did not say anything. He looked at his mom and hoped she would not notice.
The girl did not give up. She rode closer to Tom and asked him his name. Tom whispered his name and looked at the ground. The girl said her name was Lily and she liked his scooter. She asked him if he wanted to play with her.
Tom wanted to play with Lily, but he was too shy. He did not know what to say or do. He looked at his mom again and saw that she was smiling. She nodded at him and said, "It's okay, Tom. You can play with Lily. I permit you to go with her. She seems nice."
Tom felt a little braver. He looked at Lily and nodded. He said, "Okay, let's play." Lily smiled and took his hand. They rode their scooters together in the park. They had fun and became friends. Tom was not shy anymore. He was happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little alarm. The alarm had a rough, red button. Every day, the alarm would watch the sun come up.
One day, the alarm saw a big dog. The dog was very rough when he played. The alarm watched the dog play with a ball. The dog was happy.
In the end, the alarm and the big dog became friends. They would watch the sun come up together. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time there were two friends, Alex and Toby. Alex was very clever and knew lots of things. Toby was shy but kind. 
One day, they came across a microphone and Alex wanted to play with it. Toby thought this was a fun idea. They took turns speaking into the microphone, but Toby whispered his words. Alex spoke loudly.
Suddenly, a voice came through the microphone. It was a grumpy old lady! She said Alex was being rude for speaking so loudly. Alex and Toby were scared, so they ran away quickly.
Finally, they stopped and Toby turned to Alex and said, "We should whisper our words from now on!". Alex agreed and they looked at the microphone with a smile.

One day, a girl named Lucy went to the store with her mom. They wanted to buy some food for their home. Lucy saw a big bag of oats. "Mom, can we get this?" she asked. Her mom looked at the bag and said, "We can try something new. Let's get it."
At home, Lucy and her mom wanted to make a snack. Lucy suggested, "Let's use the new oats!" They mixed the oats with some sweet stuff and put it in the oven. They waited for the snack to be done.
When the oven beeped, Lucy and her mom opened it. They saw something unexpected! The oats had turned into a big, friendly bear! The bear said, "Thank you for making me. I will help you cook and clean." Lucy and her mom were very happy to have a new friend in their home.

One day, a small bird saw a big crane. The crane had long legs and a long neck. The small bird wanted to become friends with the crane. He flew to the crane and said, "Hi, I am a bird. Do you want to be my friend?"
The crane looked at the bird and said, "Yes, I would like to be your friend. My name is Crane. What is your name?" The bird told him his name was Birdy. They started to play together. They played in the open field with the sun shining down on them. They were very happy.
One day, a strong wind came and blew Birdy into a tree. Birdy was stuck and scared. Crane used his long neck to help Birdy get free. Birdy said, "Thank you, Crane. You are a good friend." Crane smiled and said, "You are a good friend too, Birdy."
The moral of the story is that it is important to be kind and help your friends when they need you. Friends can come in all shapes and sizes, and it is good to have friends who are different from you.

Once there was a little girl called Laura. She was three years old and loved going outside to play. One day, when Laura was outside, she saw a puppy. She kneeled down to say hello and the little puppy licked her on the nose. Laura laughed, happy to have made a new furry friend.
Just then, Laura heard a voice behind her. It was a grumpy old man with a bushy moustache. 
"Hey there!" he said, "what are you doing to my pup?"
Laura was a little scared but she remembered that it was rude to talk to someone like that. 
"I'm just saying hello," she said, looking down at her toes, "I didn't mean any harm."
The old man softened, "Ah, I'm sorry, I just remember when I was young and people were mean to me. I wanted to make sure my pup was safe. I'm sorry if I was rude."
Laura looked up, smiled, and said, "That's okay. I forgive you." The old man smiled back and they both laughed together.
Laura waved goodbye to the puppy as she walked back to her house. That night she tucked herself into bed, but she was still smiling as she remembered her adventure that day.

Once upon a time, there was a dog named Spot. Spot was a light dog with big eyes and a waggy tail. Every day, Spot would go for a jog with his friend, Tom the cat.
One sunny day, Spot said to Tom, "I want to jog by the big tree today." Tom agreed, and they went on their jog together. The big tree had lots of pretty birds and fun things to sniff.
As they jogged, Spot and Tom saw a little girl. The little girl was sad. Spot asked the girl, "Why are you sad?" The girl said, "I lost my toy." Spot and Tom wanted to help, so they looked for the toy.
Spot and Tom found the toy under a bush. They gave the toy back to the little girl. She was so happy and said, "Thank you, Spot and Tom!" Spot and Tom felt good that they could help. They finished their jog and went home.

Once upon a time, there was a restless little bee named Buzz. Buzz loved to fly around and visit all the pretty flowers. One day, Buzz found a big sunflower. It was the biggest and prettiest flower he had ever seen. He was so happy to find it.
As Buzz flew closer to the sunflower, he saw a tiny bug trapped in a spider's web. The tiny bug cried, "Help me, please! I want to escape!" Buzz felt bad for the tiny bug and decided to help. He flew close to the web and tried to set the tiny bug free.
But as Buzz tried to help the tiny bug, the spider came back. The spider was angry and wanted to catch Buzz too. Buzz tried to escape, but it was too late. The spider caught Buzz and the tiny bug in the web. They couldn't get away, and the sun set on the sad little friends.

One day, a big, impressive bird was flying in the sky. A small boy named Timmy was outside to play. He looked up and saw the bird. Timmy liked to watch the bird fly. It was so fun to see.
Timmy said, "Bird, come play with me!" The bird heard Timmy and flew down to him. They played catch with a ball. Timmy threw the ball, and the bird caught it in its beak. They had a great time.
But then, the bird felt a pain in its wing. "Ouch!" said the bird, "My wing hurts." Timmy felt sad for the bird. He helped the bird find a soft place to rest. Timmy's mom came out and saw the bird. She gave the bird some food and water. The bird felt better soon. Timmy and the bird became good friends and played together every day.

Anna and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they find a big bunch of grapes on a bench. They are hungry and want to eat the grapes.
"Look, grapes!" Anna says. "Let's share them."
"OK," Ben says. "But how do we divide them?"
Anna thinks for a moment. She has an idea. "Let's march around the bench. The one who marches the most times gets the most grapes."
"Good idea," Ben says. "But who will count?"
Anna points to a dog that is sitting near the bench. The dog has a collar with a tag that says "Spot". "Spot will count. He is a dependable dog. He will not lie or cheat."
"OK," Ben says. "Let's start."
Anna and Ben start to march around the bench. They hold their arms up and stomp their feet. They sing a song: "We are marching, we are marching, we are marching for the grapes."
Spot watches them and barks every time they complete a circle. He wags his tail and looks happy.
Anna and Ben march and march. They have fun and forget about the grapes. They are too busy marching and singing.
After a while, they stop and look at Spot. He has barked 10 times. They have marched 10 times.
"Wow, we marched a lot," Anna says.
"Yes, we did," Ben says.
They look at the grapes. They are still on the bench. They are still juicy and sweet.
They look at each other. They smile.
"Let's share the grapes anyway," Anna says.
"OK," Ben says. "That's fair."
They take the grapes and sit on the bench. They give some grapes to Spot. He eats them and licks his lips.
They eat the grapes and enjoy them. They are happy and full.
They thank Spot for counting. He barks and wags his tail.
They hug each other and say: "We are friends. We are dependable friends. We are friends who march and share."

Once upon a time, in a small house by the sea, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play pretend with her toys. She would pretend to be a modern princess, with a big, pretty dress.
One day, Lily went to the beach with her mom and dad. They built a sandcastle and watched the tide come in and out. Lily liked to watch the waves and listen to the sound of the water.
While playing on the beach, Lily found a pretty shell. She pretended that it was a magic shell that could make her a real modern princess. She held it tight and made a wish. The tide came in and washed her feet, making her giggle.
Lily's mom and dad watched her play and smiled. They knew that their little girl was a modern princess, even without a magic shell. And they all lived happily ever after, playing pretend by the sea.

One day, a girl named Mia had a plan. She wanted to go for a jog in the park. She put on her shoes and went outside.
As Mia jogged, she saw a big dog. The dog was not mean, but Mia was frightened. She stopped and looked at the dog. The dog looked back at Mia.
Mia took a deep breath and walked closer to the dog. The dog wagged its tail. Mia smiled and pet the dog. Now, Mia was not frightened anymore. They both jogged together and had fun in the park.

Once upon a time, there was a dog. The dog was very hungry. The dog wanted to eat. The dog saw a big cake. The cake was on a table. The dog jumped on the table. The dog started to eat the cake.
The owner of the cake came into the room. The owner was a little girl. The little girl saw the dog eating the cake. The little girl was sad. The dog felt sorry. The dog tried to say sorry to the little girl, but the dog could not talk.
The little girl cried. The dog wanted to make the little girl happy again. But the dog could not fix the cake. The dog felt very sorry. The little girl was still sad. The dog felt bad. The dog left the house. The little girl never saw the dog again.

Mum and Dad were taking a walk when they stopped at a shop. There were lots of exciting things in the shop and Dad said to Mum, "Let's buy a bell." Mum agreed that a bell would be nice and so Dad bought it for her. 
When Mum and Dad got home, Mum hung the bell in the garden. Every time wind blew, the bell would chime and make a lovely sound. Also, it was very nosy!
Their neighbour Mister John heard the bell and said, "What is that nosy sound? I want to see!" So, he came to their garden to take a look. He was so impressed by the bell that he bought one for his garden too. 
From that day, whenever wind blew, both of their bells would sound together. They continued to enjoy the nosy sounds of the bells for a long time.

Once, there was a boy named Tim. Tim felt troubled one day because he lost his fork. He looked everywhere for it, but he could not find it. Tim was very sad.
Tim asked his friend, Sam, "Did you see my fork?" Sam said, "No, but let's look together." They looked in the house, in the yard, and under the bed. They still could not find the fork.
Then, they saw a ball. Sam kicked the ball, and it hit a tree. The fork fell from the tree! Tim was happy to find his fork. He thanked Sam for helping him. They played with the ball and had a fun day.

Once upon a time there was a boy called Jack. He had a nice jacket that he liked to wear. One day he wanted to play outside, so he put on his jacket and set off. He had lots of fun running around and playing, but he didn't realize that his jacket had got caught on a bush. As he ran away, the bush broke the jacket.
When Jack came home, he was sad to see his broken jacket. He wanted it fixed, so he asked his mom for help. She said she couldn't fix it and said Jack should try and work it out himself.
Jack was a very clever boy and he was determined to try and make his jacket better. He worked very hard, but no matter what he did, it still stayed broken. He was so disappointed.
Jack was very sad and he never wore his jacket again.

Tom and Lily were playing in the yard. They saw a big pile of leaves that dad had made with the rake. They ran to the pile and jumped in. The leaves were soft and crunchy and colorful.
"Look, I'm a leaf monster!" Tom said. He put leaves on his head and arms and growled. Lily laughed and threw more leaves at him.
"Stop, stop, you're tickling me!" Tom said. He chased Lily around the pile and caught her. He gave her a big hug. "You're my leaf sister!"
Lily hugged him back. "You're my leaf brother!"
They heard a loud bark. It was Max, their fat dog. He saw the pile of leaves and wanted to join the fun. He ran to the pile and jumped in. He wagged his tail and licked Tom and Lily's faces.
"Hi, Max!" Tom and Lily said. They hugged Max and petted him. "You're our leaf dog!"
They all played in the pile of leaves until mom called them for lunch. They ran to the house, leaving a trail of leaves behind. They were happy and hungry. They loved fall.

One day, a boy named Tim found a magnet. He played with it all day. He liked how the magnet could stick to things. Tim showed his friends, and they thought it was fun too.
"Look, my magnet sticks to this!" Tim said loudly. His friends laughed and clapped. They played with the magnet until it was time to go home.
The next day, Tim took his magnet to the park. He was playing with it when a loud dog came running up. The dog barked and jumped around. The magnet stuck to the dog's collar! Tim was scared and didn't know what to do. He tried to get the magnet back, but the dog didn't want to quit playing.
"Please give my magnet back!" Tim said. The dog just barked and ran around. Then, something unexpected happened. The dog's owner came and called the dog. The dog went to its owner, and the magnet came off the collar.
Tim was happy to have his magnet back. He learned to be more careful when playing with it. And from that day on, Tim and the dog became good friends.

Once there was a girl named Emmy who was three years old. She loved to play and explore the world around her. One day Emmy's mommy asked her if she would dare to put on her fancy dress up clothes. Emmy smiled and nodded in agreement.
Emmy had on her favorite fancy blue dress, her sparkly shoes and a big princess hat. Emmy felt so brave and fancy. She couldn't wait to go outside and show the world her beautiful dress.
When Emmy walked outside, she saw all of her playmates. They were dressed in fancy clothes just like hers. Emmy said, "Let's all play together in our fancy clothes!" Everyone agreed and they all ran around the park screaming and laughing.
Their playtime lasted for hours and when it was time to go home everyone said goodbye to each other. Emmy was so happy with her daring adventure. She had never felt so fancy!
