Max heard Lily say, "Wow, look at these stickers and cards! They are so pretty and fun!" He got curious and went to see what she had. He saw the envelope with their names on it and said, "Hey, that's for both of us! Grandma sent it to us. Can I see the stickers and cards too?"
Lily said, "No, they are mine! Go away, Max! You have your cars. I don't want to share with you. You are always mean to me." She hid the envelope under her pillow and pushed Max away.
Max felt sad and angry. He said, "You are not nice, Lily. You are selfish. You don't care about me. I miss grandma. She is always kind and fair. She would not like what you are doing." He ran to his room and cried.
Lily felt a little guilty, but she still wanted the stickers and cards. She looked at them and tried to enjoy them. But she felt lonely and bored. She missed Max. He was her twin and her best friend. She realized she was wrong. She decided to say sorry and share with him.
She took the envelope and went to Max's room. She knocked on the door and said, "Max, I'm sorry. I was selfish. I want to share the stickers and cards with you. Can we play together?"
Max opened the door and saw Lily with the envelope. He smiled and said, "I'm sorry too. I miss you, Lily. You are my twin and my best friend. Thank you for sharing with me. Can we hug?"
They hugged and said they loved each other. They opened the envelope and looked at the stickers and cards. They had fun sticking them on their books and making cards for grandma. They were happy.

John and Lisa were in the garden. John looked out in the wide open space and saw the fair Earth. He pointed his finger up to the sky and asked, "Do you see the fair Earth, Lisa?"
Lisa smiled and said, "Yes, I do see it!" She wanted to feel the Earth, so she bent down and put her hand on the grass. She felt the soft blades of grass move as the wind blew by.
John asked, "How does it feel, Lisa?" She smiled and said, "It feels nice and fair. It gives me a happy feeling." She looked at the sky and whispered, "I love the Earth."

One day, a little boy named Tim was playing outside. He saw a fast bug running on the ground. Tim wanted to catch the bug, so he tried to run as fast as the bug. But Tim was not fast enough. He felt sad.
Tim's mom saw him and asked, "Why are you sad, Tim?" Tim said, "I want to catch the fast bug, but I am not fast enough." His mom had an idea. "Let's make a trap to catch the bug," she said.
Together, they made a trap with a box and a stick. They put the trap near the bug and waited. Suddenly, the sun started to burn hot on Tim's body. He did not like it, so he ran inside to get a hat. When he came back, the box was moving! Tim and his mom looked inside and saw a big, friendly dog, not the fast bug. They all laughed and played together. The dog was a fun surprise!

One day, a big hairy dog named Max found a microscope in the park. He didn't know what it was, but he thought it looked fun. Max wanted to celebrate his new toy with his friends, so he ran to find them.
Max found his friend, a little cat named Lily. "Look at my new toy!" Max said to Lily. "Let's celebrate and play with it!" Lily looked at the microscope and said, "I don't know what it is, but it looks fun!" So, Max and Lily played with the microscope, trying to see small things up close.
But, they didn't know how to use it right. They looked at a bee, and the bee got angry. The bee stung Max and Lily, and they both cried. Their fun day was now a bad day. They learned that it's not good to play with things they don't know about. The moral of the story is to always ask for help when you find something new and don't know how to use it.

Once upon a time, there was a wealthy man named Tom. He had a big factory where he made toys. One day, he decided to visit his factory and see how the toys were made.
When he went to the factory, he saw many people working hard to make the toys. Tom was very happy. He saw a big box in the corner and thought, "I will open this box later."
After watching the workers, Tom went to the big box. He opened it and found a big, shiny toy car. The workers had made it just for him! Tom was so happy and thanked them. The visit to the factory was very special.

Ben and Sam were brothers who liked to play on the farm. They liked to run, jump, and chase the animals. But they did not like to do their chores. Their mom and dad always told them to help with the milk, the eggs, and the hay. But Ben and Sam always said no.
One day, they saw a big cow in the field. The cow had a bell around her neck. Ben and Sam thought it would be fun to take the bell and make noise with it. They ran to the cow and tried to grab the bell. But the cow did not like that. She mooed loudly and kicked with her legs. Ben and Sam got scared and ran away.
The cow followed them, still mooing. She wanted her bell back. She chased them all the way to the barn, where their mom and dad were. Their mom and dad saw the cow and the bell and knew what Ben and Sam had done. They were very angry.
"Ben and Sam, you have been very bad boys!" their mom said. "You should not take things that are not yours. You should not bother the cow. She gives us milk. You have made her angry and sad. You have to give her back her bell and say sorry."
"And you have to do your chores for a week," their dad said. "That is your punish. You have to learn to be good and helpful. Or else you will not get any milk or eggs or hay. And you will not get any cake or candy or toys. Do you understand?"
Ben and Sam nodded. They felt sorry and ashamed. They gave the cow back her bell and said sorry. The cow mooed softly and licked their faces. She forgave them. Ben and Sam learned their lesson. They did their chores and were good and helpful. They never took things that were not theirs again. And they never bothered the cow again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys all day long. One day, Lily saw a big box in her room. She was very excited to open the box and find out what was inside. Inside the box, she found a new toy, a soft and cute bear. Lily was so happy to play with her new toy.
As Lily played with her bear, she started to feel tired. Her mom told her that it was time to take a nap. But Lily didn't want to stop playing with her new friend. She wanted to keep playing with the bear, but her eyes were getting heavy. Her mom said, "Lily, you need to rest so you can have more energy to play later."
Lily listened to her mom and took a nap with her bear. When she woke up, she felt much better and was ready to play again. She had so much fun playing with her bear and her other toys. Lily learned that when she's tired, it's good to take a break and rest. This way, she can have more energy to play and have fun later. And that is the story of Lily and her new toy bear.

Tom and Lily were playing in the garden. They liked to dig in the dirt and look for bugs. They found a big worm and a shiny beetle. They put them in a jar and gave them some leaves.
"Look at our new pets!" Tom said. "They are so cool!"
Lily nodded. She liked the worm and the beetle too. But she wanted to find something more. She saw a hole under a bush. She crawled towards it.
"Maybe there is something else in there," she said. "Maybe a mouse or a frog."
Tom followed her. He was curious too. He reached the hole and peeked inside. He saw something long and scaly. It had a forked tongue and small eyes. It was a snake.
"Snake!" Tom shouted. He jumped back and ran away. He was scared of snakes. He had heard they could bite and hurt people.
Lily heard Tom and looked at the hole. She saw the snake too. But she was not scared. She liked snakes. She had seen them in books and on TV. She thought they were pretty and smart.
"Hello, snake," she said. She reached out her hand to touch it.
The snake saw Lily and hissed. It did not like people. It felt threatened and angry. It opened its mouth and showed its fangs. It was ready to strike.
Lily did not notice. She smiled and moved closer. She wanted to pet the snake.
"Stop, Lily!" Tom yelled. He came back and grabbed her arm. He pulled her away from the hole. He was brave and wanted to save his sister.
The snake missed Lily by a hair. It slithered back into the hole. It was glad to be left alone.
Lily cried. She did not understand why Tom stopped her. She wanted to play with the snake.
Tom hugged her. He tried to calm her down.
"Lily, you can't play with snakes," he said. "They are not pets. They are wild and dangerous. They can hurt you very bad. You have to be careful and stay away from them."
Lily looked at Tom. She saw he was pale and shaking. He was still scared. She felt sorry for him. She wiped her tears and nodded.
"Okay, Tom," she said. "I'm sorry. I didn't know. Thank you for saving me."
Tom smiled. He was relieved and happy. He kissed her cheek.
"You're welcome, Lily," he said. "I love you. You're my sister."
They hugged each other. They learned a lesson. They decided to stick to their worm and beetle. They were safer and friendlier. They went back to their jar and played with them.
The moral of the story is: Don't play with things that can harm you. Listen to your brother or sister. They care for you and want to protect you.

Once upon a time, there was a big, hard steel box. It was sent to a small town. The box was very heavy. The people in the town wanted to know what was inside.
They tried to open the box. They pushed it, and they pulled it. But it was too hard. They could not open it. They were sad.
One day, a little girl came to the town. She saw the hard steel box. She touched it and said, "Please open." And the box opened! Inside, there were many toys for all the children. They were so happy and played all day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Sam. He was only three years old. He wanted to decorate a boat he found at the beach. He put sparkly, shiny things all over it to make it look beautiful.
Then he got in and tried to sail away. But the tide was very strong and it swept him out to sea. Sam started to get scared, he was in a very dangerous situation.
Sam looked around and the sea seemed to get darker and darker. He was too far away from the beach and he couldn't turn the boat around. Suddenly a giant wave came and sent the boat toppling to the ground.
Sam was so scared, he shouted for help but no one could hear him. He never made it back to the beach, he was lost at sea forever. Sam's boat still drifts out there, but it's no longer decorated and full of sparkly things. The tide had taken him away forever.

One day, a dog named Spot went to the park with his owner, Sam. Spot was a very obedient dog. He always did what Sam told him to do. At the park, Sam said, "Spot, stand!" Spot stood on his back legs and wagged his tail. Sam laughed and clapped his hands.
As they played, a big wind came. It blew a red ball right to Spot. Spot looked at Sam and Sam said, "Go get it!" Spot ran fast and caught the ball with his mouth. He wagged his tail and ran back to Sam. Sam was happy and said, "Good job, Spot!"
Just then, a little girl came up to them. She said, "That's my ball!" Sam and Spot were surprised. Spot dropped the ball and the little girl picked it up. She smiled and said, "Thank you for finding my ball!" Spot wagged his tail and Sam said, "You're welcome!" They all played together in the park and had a fun day.

Once there was a lonely boy named Tim. He had no friends to play with. One day, Tim went to the park. He saw a big tree with a tie hanging from a branch. Tim thought the tie was funny and started to laugh.
A girl named Sue heard Tim laugh. She came to see what was so funny. Sue saw the tie and laughed too. Tim and Sue looked at each other and smiled. Tim said, "Do you want to play with me?" Sue said, "Yes, let's play together!"
They played all day under the big tree. When it was time to go home, Tim and Sue shouted, "Bye, funny tie!" They were not lonely anymore. Tim and Sue became best friends and went to the park to play every day.

Tom and Sue were friends who liked to swim in the lake. They wore swimsuits and goggles and jumped into the water. They saw many fish and plants under the water. They played games and had fun.
One day, they saw something shiny at the bottom of the lake. They swam closer and saw that it was a big copper coin. It was round and had a picture of a man on it. They wondered who he was and how the coin got there.
"Wow, look at this!" Tom said. "It is so pretty and heavy. I want to keep it."
"No, it is mine!" Sue said. "I saw it first. It is mine."
They both grabbed the coin and pulled hard. They did not want to share. They were angry and rude. They forgot to swim and breathe.
Suddenly, they heard a loud splash. They looked up and saw a mighty duck. It was big and brown and had a long neck and a yellow beak. It was swimming towards them. It looked angry too.
"Quack, quack, quack!" the duck said. "This is my lake. This is my coin. Go away!"
Tom and Sue were scared. They let go of the coin and swam away. They did not want to fight with the duck. They realized that they were silly and greedy. They said sorry to each other and hugged.
They learned to share and be kind. They also learned to respect the duck and his lake. They still liked to swim, but they did not touch the coin again. They were happy and safe.

Sara and Ben were playing in the park. They saw a big slide and ran to it. Sara wanted to go first, but Ben wanted to go too. They both grabbed the ladder and tried to climb up.
"Let me go first!" Sara said. "I am the queen of the slide!"
"No, I am the king!" Ben said. "You go second!"
They pulled and pulled on the ladder, but neither of them could go up. They were stuck in the middle.
A man was walking by with a dog. He saw Sara and Ben and smiled.
"Hello, kids," he said. "Do you need some help?"
"Yes, please," Sara and Ben said. "We want to go on the slide, but we can't."
The man lifted them up and put them on the top of the slide. He gave them each a candy.
"Here you go," he said. "You can share this candy and take turns on the slide. Be nice to each other, okay?"
"Thank you, mister," Sara and Ben said. They smiled and nodded.
They opened the candy and took a bite. But it was not sweet. It was sour!
"Yuck!" Sara and Ben said. They made a funny face and spit out the candy.
They looked at each other and laughed. They realized they were being silly.
"Sorry, Sara," Ben said. "You can be the queen of the slide."
"Sorry, Ben," Sara said. "You can be the king."
They hugged and slid down together. They had fun and forgot about the sour candy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue liked to play with her toy police car. It was her favorite toy because it was very attractive. The police car was red and blue and had shiny lights on top.
One day, Sue's family decided to go on a trip. Sue needed to pack her toys in a bag. She put her police car, her doll, and her teddy bear in the bag. She made sure the bag was not too heavy for her to carry.
Sue and her family went to the park for their trip. Sue played with her attractive police car all day. She had so much fun with her family. When it was time to go home, Sue packed her toys back in the bag. She was happy that she brought her favorite toy on the trip.

Once upon a time, there was a big, attractive cake. It was in the kitchen on the table. A girl named Lily wanted to eat the cake. She was very excited.
Lily's mom said, "First, you need to clean your room." So, Lily went to her room and started to clean. She put her toys away and made her bed. She wanted to eat the cake very much.
When Lily finished cleaning, she went back to the kitchen. But the cake was not there. Instead, there was a note. It said, "Surprise! The cake is for your friend's birthday party." Lily was happy to share the attractive cake with her friend, and they all had fun at the party.

One day, a little girl named Lucy went to the park with her mom. She saw a swing and thought it was amazing. Lucy asked her mom if she could go on the swing. Her mom said, "Yes, you can."
Lucy sat on the swing and her mom pushed her. Lucy went up and down, and it was so much fun. She felt like she was flying in the sky. Lucy was very happy.
After a while, Lucy requested to stop. Her mom stopped pushing the swing and Lucy got off. They went home, and Lucy told her dad about the amazing swing at the park. She couldn't wait to go back and play on the swing again.

One day, a kind squirrel named Sam was playing in the park. He found a small acorn under a big tree. Sam was very happy and wanted to show his friend, Tim the bird. He picked up the acorn and ran to find Tim.
Sam found Tim sitting on a branch. "Tim, look what I found!" he said, showing the acorn. Tim was very excited too. "Let's hide it in a secret place," Tim said. They both smiled and started looking for a good hiding spot.
They found a small hole in the ground, perfect for hiding the acorn. They put the acorn in the hole and covered it with dirt. "No one will find it here," Sam said. Little did they know, in a few months, a tiny tree would start to grow from the acorn they hid. And one day, it would become a big tree, just like the one they found the acorn under.

One day, a little fish saw a jellyfish in the sea. The fish was scared of the jellyfish, but it wanted to be friends. The fish swam up to the jellyfish and said, "Hi! Can I be your friend?"
The jellyfish looked at the fish and said, "You are too small and stupid to be my friend." The little fish felt sad and swam away.
Later, the jellyfish got stuck in a net. It could not get out. The little fish saw the jellyfish and wanted to help. The fish swam up to the net and asked, "Do you need help?" The jellyfish said, "Yes, please!"
The little fish helped the jellyfish get out of the net. The jellyfish said, "Thank you! I was wrong. You are not stupid. You are a good friend." The fish and the jellyfish became best friends. The moral of the story is to not judge others by their size or what they look like.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a lazy barber. He did not like to work hard. He liked to sit and sleep all day. But people in the town needed haircuts, so they went to the lazy barber's shop.
One day, a boy came to the lazy barber for a haircut. The barber was so lazy, he did not want to hold the boy's hair. So, he decided to tie the boy's hair with a string. But the string was too tight, and it hurt the boy's head.
The boy cried and ran away from the barber's shop. The people in the town heard the boy cry and came to see what was wrong. They saw the string on the boy's head and got angry at the lazy barber. They told the barber he must work harder and be nicer to the people in the town. The lazy barber learned his lesson and became a better barber for everyone.

Once upon a time, two friends were walking down the street. The sky was bright and blue. As they walked, they heard a noisy vehicle coming around the corner. They stopped to watch it go by.
The friends were so surprised to see a bus. It was huge and colourful, with bright lights on top. The driver honked the horn and smiled.
Suddenly, one of the friends noticed something dropped from the moving bus. He ran and picked it up. It was an apple. He showed it to his friend and they both laughed.
The two friends thanked the driver. He was so happy to see them smiling. 
"Thanks for the apple!" they shouted. The driver smiled and waved goodbye.

One day, a little girl named Lily lost her mitten. She looked all around her room but could not find it. Lily was sad because she loved her mitten very much. It was wide and cozy, perfect for her little hand.
Lily asked her mom, "Mom, have you seen my mitten?" Her mom said, "No, but let's look outside. Maybe it's there." They went outside and looked everywhere. They looked near the trees and in the grass, but they could not find the mitten. Lily started to cry.
Just then, a small bird flew down and settled on a branch near Lily. The bird had something in its beak. It was Lily's wide mitten! The bird dropped the mitten into Lily's hands. Lily was so happy and said, "Thank you, bird!" The bird chirped and flew away. Lily and her mom went back inside, and Lily never lost her mitten again.

One day, a girl named Lily went to play near the river. She saw a duck with dirty wings. "I will wash you, duck," said Lily. The duck was very happy. Lily took water from the river and washed the duck's wings. The duck said, "Thank you, Lily!"
While they were playing, they heard a loud noise. A big dog came running to the river. The duck was scared. Lily said, "Don't worry, duck. I will help you find peace." The big dog stopped and looked at them. He was not mean, he just wanted to play too.
Lily, the duck, and the big dog played together by the river. They were all happy and at peace. The big dog was not scary anymore, and they all became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a big, red truck. The truck would deliver things to people. One day, the truck was feeling selfish. It did not want to deliver things to people anymore.
The truck said to the car next to it, "I do not want to deliver things anymore, I want to keep them for myself." The car told the truck, "That is not nice. People need the things you deliver. It is your job to help them."
The next day, the truck was delivering a big box. Inside the box was a new life, a cute little puppy. The truck did not know what was in the box. As the truck was driving, the box fell out and opened. The puppy jumped out and ran away.
The truck was sad and knew it was wrong to be selfish. It went to find the puppy and bring it back to the people who were waiting. The truck learned that helping others and delivering things made it happy. From that day on, the truck was never selfish again.

Once upon a time, in a small world, there lived a careless cat named Max. Max loved to mix things up. He would mix his food, his toys, and even his friends' things. Max's friends did not like this, but Max did not care.
One day, Max found a big pot. He thought it would be fun to mix everything in the world. So, Max went around and put everything he could find into the pot. He put in trees, houses, and even his friends. Max mixed and mixed until everything was a big mess.
Max looked at his mixed-up world and started to cry. He realized that he had made a big mistake. His friends were not happy, and the world was not fun anymore. Max wished he had not been so careless. But it was too late, and the world stayed mixed up forever.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was going on a trip with his family. He had to pack his luggage with clothes and toys. Tim was very excited to go on this trip.
On the way, Tim saw a lot of trash on the street. It was disgusting. He asked his mom, "Why is there so much trash?" His mom said, "Some people do not behave well and throw trash on the streets."
Tim wanted to help. He told his mom, "I will behave well and not throw trash on the streets." His mom was very proud of him. From that day, Tim always behaved well and kept the streets clean. The moral of the story is to always behave well and take care of our surroundings.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She loved to look at books with big pictures. One day, Sue found a book with many interesting pictures of animals. She wanted to learn more about them.
Sue asked her mom to help her read the book. Her mom said, "We can learn a spell to help you read." They worked together to learn the spell. Sue tried very hard and soon, she could read the words in the book.
As Sue read the book, she learned that it is important to be kind to animals. She shared her new knowledge with her friends. They all learned to be kind to animals too. The moral of the story is that learning can help us be better people.

Once upon a time, there was a clean room. In the room, there was a book with a poem. A little girl named Lily liked to read the poem. She read it every day.
One day, a naughty cat came in the room. The cat wanted to play. It jumped on the book and disturbed the pages. Lily was sad because her poem was not clean anymore.
Lily's mom saw her sad face. She helped Lily clean the book and the poem. The cat said sorry and did not disturb the book again. Lily was happy and read her clean poem with a smile.

Once upon a time, there was a mole. The mole lived in a hole. The mole was fit and strong. He liked to dig and play all day.
One day, the mole found a big box. The box was in his hole. The mole did not know who put the box there. The mole was very surprised. He wanted to see what was inside the box.
The mole opened the box. Inside the box, he found a hat. The hat was too big for the mole. He tried to wear the hat, but it did not fit. Then, a small bug came out of the hat. The bug told the mole that the hat could make him big.
The mole put on the hat, and he became big. He was so big that he did not fit in his hole anymore. The mole was sad. He wanted to be small again. The bug said, "You can be small again. You just have to say 'please'." The mole said "please," and he became small again. The mole was happy. He could play and dig in his hole again.

Tom and Lily were playing near the river. They liked to throw stones and watch the water splash. They did not see the big sign that said "Danger! Crocodiles!"
A crocodile was hiding under the water. It saw the children and wanted to eat them. It swam closer and closer, very quietly.
"Look, Lily, a big fish!" Tom said, pointing at the water. He did not know it was a crocodile.
"That's not a fish, Tom, that's a crocodile!" Lily said, scared. She knew what a crocodile was. She had seen one in a book.
"Run, Tom, run!" Lily shouted, and she ran away from the river. But Tom was careless. He did not listen to Lily. He wanted to see the crocodile better. He walked closer to the water.
The crocodile jumped out of the water and opened its big mouth. It tried to bite Tom's leg. Tom was very scared. He screamed and tried to resist. He kicked the crocodile with his other leg.
Lily heard Tom's scream and ran back to help him. She picked up a big stick and hit the crocodile on the head. The crocodile was hurt and angry. It let go of Tom's leg and swam away.
Tom and Lily hugged each other. They were safe, but Tom's leg was bleeding. Lily helped him walk to their house. They told their mom what happened. She was very angry and worried. She took Tom to the doctor and scolded him for being careless. She told him to never play near the river again.
Tom and Lily learned their lesson. They never went near the river again. They played in the park instead, where there were no crocodiles. They were happy and careful.

Once upon a time, there was a girl called Lucy. She was very small, only three years old, and sometimes felt helpless. Lucy wanted to explore the world, so one day she decided to wander. 
She went far from home and eventually stumbled upon a weird stage. On the stage was an old man who saw Lucy and asked her if she wanted to join him. She nodded, filled with excitement about what she would see. 
The old man put on a show, but Lucy didn't understand one bit of it. She became frustrated and started to cry and told the old man that she wanted to go home. He laughed and continued the show. 
Lucy felt helpless and didn't know what to do. Suddenly, a woman walked on to the stage and said to the old man, "Let the little girl go. She's too young to understand what you are doing." 
The old man gave a funny smile and nodded. He said to Lucy, "You can go home now - remember never to wander too far again." Lucy smiled and wandered back home, feeling a little wiser.

Once upon a time, there was a pirate who lived in a far away land. He was a mean pirate and was very intelligent. He looked for ways to steal from others.
One day, he noticed two young kids playing nearby. The pirate decided to steal their toys. He waited until the kids were not looking and then he quickly grabbed the toys and ran away.
The kids were very sad. But one of them, who was very intelligent, decided to take action. He looked around for the pirate and soon spotted him far away in the distance.
The intelligent kid thought of a plan and quickly ran back to get help. He gathered his friends and they all ran after the pirate.
But the pirate knew that they were following him and he was too fast for them. In the end, the pirate was able to escape with the kids' toys and never got caught. The kids were very sad that they couldn't get back what he had stolen.

One evening, Milly was walking in the woods. She was cheerful and excited as the birds chirped and the sun shined brightly. Even though it was a peaceful evening, something didn't seem right. Every once in awhile, Milly heard a strange sound that disturbed her calm. 
Milly hurried along, determined to reach the clearing before it got dark. As she entered a clearing, the noise grew louder. Something was moving in the shadows, and Milly started to worry.
Suddenly, a friendly face appeared! A little rabbit hopped out of the shadows, making the happiest sound. Milly realized that the noise was coming from the rabbit's cute little noises! 
Milly laughed with delight as the rabbit hopped around her. They had a wonderful time playing together that evening, until the sunset made it too dark for them to stay.
Milly said goodbye, but was happy to know the rabbit would still be in the woods the next evening. Her walk home was peaceful and cheerful!

One day, a little girl named Sue was very excited. She was going on a holiday with her mom and dad. They were going to the beach. Sue had never been to the beach before, so she was happy.
On the way to the beach, Sue saw a little boy crying. She asked her mom, "Why is he sad?" Her mom said, "He lost his toy." Sue thought about it and said, "Can I give him my toy?" Her mom nodded and smiled. Sue gave her toy to the little boy. He stopped crying and said, "Thank you!"
Sue felt good helping the little boy. She learned that sharing can make others happy. She had a great holiday at the beach, and she made a new friend too.

Once upon a time, in a small town, lived a boy named Tom. He had a big, shiny diamond. He loved his diamond very much. One day, he met a girl named Sue. Sue saw the diamond and liked it too. Tom wanted to be nice, so he decided to share his diamond with Sue.
Tom said to Sue, "We can separate the diamond into two parts. You can have one part, and I can have the other part." Sue was very grateful and happy. She said, "Thank you, Tom! I love my part of the diamond."
Tom and Sue played together every day with their diamond parts. They were very happy and always said "please" and "thank you". They learned that sharing can make everyone feel grateful and happy. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a caterpillar named Flopsy. Flopsy was new to the garden and it was very exciting.
"I want to be friends with everyone," said Flopsy, "and find adventure!" 
So Flopsy hopped around the garden. As he hopped, he noticed something shiny up ahead. He hopped closer and found a brand new bucket! 
"This is for me?" asked Flopsy. 
But then he heard a voice call out from behind a big tree. It was Teddy, the garden frog. 
"That bucket is for cleaning the garden," said Teddy. 
Flopsy was excited to help. He grabbed the bucket, hopped around, and filled it with all the yucky things in the garden. When he was done, he looked around and smiled. The garden was clean! 
Flopsy was so proud of his work. He ran over to Teddy and hugged him very tight. 
"Thank you for helping me clean the garden!" said Teddy. 
Flopsy was happy to have made a friend, and the garden was very happy too! 
The End

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park. He saw a big tree with red fruit. Tim was glad. He wanted to pick the fruit from the tree. He tried to reach up, but he was too small. Tim thought about how to get the fruit.
A girl named Sue saw Tim. She asked, "What are you doing?" Tim said, "I want to pick the fruit, but I can't reach." Sue had an idea. She found a stick and gave it to Tim. Tim used the stick to pick the fruit. They were both very happy.
After picking the fruit, Tim and Sue were thirsty. They went to a small table with cups and a big jug of juice. Tim poured juice into two cups. They drank the juice together and smiled. They were glad they could pick the fruit and have juice to drink. They played in the park until the sun went down, and then they went home.

Once upon a time, there was a warm bear. The bear liked to throw things. He would throw stones, and sticks, and sometimes even acorns. But this bear had a secret. Every day he would throw something special, and he kept it a secret.
One day, the bear went out to look for something special to throw. He found a warm, fuzzy blanket. He picked it up and threw it up into the sky. It flew so high until it was out of sight. The bear was so happy to have a secret in the sky.
The bear loved his secret so much that he went out every day to find something new to throw. He would throw up butterflies, and leaves, and even a banana. Every time he saw his secret in the sky he smiled.
The bear still throws his secrets into the sky today. If you look up you may catch a glimpse of the bear's warm secrets in the sky.

One day, a cat and a dog were playing in the yard. The cat was jumping and the dog was running. They were having a lot of fun. But then, the weather became very cold. The cat and the dog started to feel miserable.
The cat said to the dog, "I am cold. Let's go inside the house." The dog agreed and they went inside. They saw a pan on the floor. The dog asked, "What is that?"
The cat replied, "That is a pan. We can use it to make something warm." They put the pan on the stove and made hot soup. As they ate the soup, they started to feel warm and happy again. They forgot about the cold weather and they did not freeze anymore. The cat and the dog were no longer miserable.

One day, a little dog named Max went for a walk. Max saw a big tree and wanted to play. He saw a squirrel on the tree. The squirrel looked down at Max and said, "Hi, do you want to play with me?"
Max was very happy and said, "Yes, I want to play with you!" The squirrel came down from the tree. They played together and had lots of fun. Max was running and the squirrel was jumping.
Suddenly, they heard a loud snap. Max and the squirrel were frightened. They did not know what made the sound. They looked around and saw a big box on the ground. Max went to the box and opened it.
Inside the box, there was a surprise. It was a big, shiny ball. Max and the squirrel were not frightened anymore. They were very happy to find the ball. They played with the ball all day and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue had a scary dream one night. In her dream, there was a big monster with a long nose and big teeth. Sue woke up and felt scared. She looked around her room and saw that everything was okay.
The next day, Sue told her mom about the scary dream. Her mom said, "It's okay to feel scared, but you should ignore the scary dream. It's not real." Sue thought about what her mom said and decided to be brave.
That night, Sue played with her toys on the carpet before bedtime. She remembered her mom's words and ignored the scary dream. Sue learned that she didn't have to be scared of things that were not real. And from that day on, Sue was brave and ignored all the scary things in her dreams.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She had a pretty crystal. The crystal was shiny and bright. Lily was grateful for her crystal. She loved it very much.
One day, Lily went to a show. There were people singing and dancing. Lily wanted to join them. She got up and danced with her crystal. Everyone saw her dance and they were happy.
When the show was over, everyone clapped their hands. They did applaud for Lily and her crystal. Lily was very happy and grateful. She went home with a big smile on her face.

One day, a girl named Lily wanted to spend time with her friend, Tom. Tom was rich and had many toys. Lily liked to play with Tom's toys, but she also liked to listen to Tom play the violin. Tom was very good at playing the violin.
"Can I come over to play and listen to you play the violin?" Lily asked Tom. Tom said, "Yes, come over and we can have fun."
When Lily went to Tom's house, they played with toys for a while. Then, Lily asked Tom to play the violin. But when Tom opened the case, the violin was gone! They both looked at each other, surprised.
"Where did the violin go?" Lily asked. Tom didn't know. They looked all around the house for the violin, but they couldn't find it.
Just when they were about to give up, they heard a sound from the garden. They went outside and saw a big bird playing the violin! The bird had taken the violin from Tom's house. The bird played the violin very well, and Lily and Tom danced to the music. They all had fun together, and the bird gave the violin back to Tom when they were done.

Once upon a time, there was a furry duck named Ducky. Ducky loved to swim in the pond every day. One day, Ducky met a new friend, a little frog named Froggy.
Ducky said, "Hi Froggy! Do you want to swim with me?" Froggy smiled and said, "Yes, I love to swim too!" So, Ducky and Froggy swam together and played in the water. They had so much fun.
After a while, Ducky looked at the big clock near the pond. "Oh no!" Ducky said, "It's late. I need to go home now." Froggy said, "Okay, bye Ducky! Let's swim again tomorrow." Ducky waved goodbye and went home, excited to swim with Froggy again the next day.

Once upon a time, there was a large dog named Buddy. Buddy liked to play with his toy and run in the park. One day, Buddy's mom made some treats for him. She put the treats on a tray and left it on the table.
Buddy saw the tray and wanted the treats. He tried to jump and get them, but he was not tall enough. He forgot that he was not allowed to jump on the table. Buddy felt sad and went to lay down in his bed.
While Buddy was laying down, a small cat named Whiskers came into the room. Whiskers saw the tray on the table and jumped up. She pushed the tray off the table, and the treats fell on the floor. Buddy was happy and ate the treats. Whiskers and Buddy became friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a tidy room. In the room, there was a flute. The flute was very special. It was on a high place. It was hanging on a hook.
One day, a boy came into the room. The boy saw the flute. He wanted to play with the flute. The boy tried to get the flute. He climbed on a chair to reach it. But the chair was not strong.
The chair broke and the boy fell down. The flute fell too. The flute broke into pieces. The boy was sad. The tidy room was not tidy anymore. The flute was gone and the boy could not play with it. The end.

Once there was a little boy named Joe. Joe was very popular with all the other kids in his school. He loved playing with all the children and making them happy.
One day, Joe noticed one of his classmates was feeling a bit lonely. He wanted to help, so he went over and gave the little girl a big hug.
The girl smiled and said, "Thank you, Joe. I feel much better now". Joe was happy he could yield some joy to his classmate. The girl went away feeling happy and content.
The other children saw what Joe did and decided to follow his example. They all began offering hugs and kind words to the classmates who were feeling lonely. The next day, when Joe came to school, he saw that everyone was smiling and enjoying their time together.
Joe was so proud of his friends. He had helped his classmates yield joy and happiness to the whole school. From that day forward, Joe was even more popular than before.

Once upon a time, there was a big whale. He swam in the sea, and it made him so tired. Whenever he needed a rest, he would take a deep breath and yawn. It was a huge yawn that went on and on!
He did this every day, until one day he noticed something magical. All around him were colorful fish. They were so bright and colorful that they made him smile.
The whale swam around the colorful fish and they twirled and danced together. With every twist and turn, the whale couldn't stop himself from yawning. He was so happy and peaceful that he even started to sing. 
The colorful fish happily surrounded the whale and sang with him. They spent all day together as they swam around in the sea. And as the sun started to set, the whale yawned one last time before swimming home.

Once upon a time, in a little town, there was a girl named Amy. Amy liked to raise her hand in class to answer questions. She was very good at following the teacher's order.
One day, Amy felt very tired. She didn't want to raise her hand at school. Her friends noticed she was not like before. They asked her, "Amy, why are you so tired?"
Amy told her friends she couldn't sleep at night. Her friends wanted to help her. They made a plan to make her feel better. They told her to go to bed early and think of happy things.
Amy tried their plan and it worked! The next day, she was not tired anymore. She raised her hand in class and followed the teacher's order. Her friends were happy that she felt better. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was an old farm. On the farm, there lived many animals. There was a big cow, a little pig, and a funny chicken. They all played together and had lots of fun.
One day, the farmer needed to order more hay for the animals to eat. The cow, the pig, and the chicken heard him talking. They wanted to help the farmer, so they came up with a plan.
The cow said, "I will go find more hay." The little pig and the funny chicken went with the cow to look for hay. They found a big pile of hay near the old barn. The three friends carried the hay back to the farmer. The farmer was very happy and thanked them. The animals smiled and went back to playing together on the old farm.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and stuff. One day, she wanted to play with her toy car. She asked her mom, "Mom, can I play with my car?" Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, Lily, I will allow you to play with your car."
Lily was so happy. She played with her car all day long. She went round and round in circles, making her car go fast. After a while, she started to feel dizzy. She stopped playing and sat down. "Oh no, I feel dizzy," Lily said to herself.
Her mom saw her and asked, "Are you okay, Lily?" Lily nodded and said, "I am okay, but I feel dizzy from playing too much." Her mom hugged her and said, "Next time, take breaks when you play, so you don't feel dizzy." Lily agreed and promised to be careful. From that day on, she always took breaks while playing, and she never felt dizzy again.

Once upon a time, there was a big ship. The ship was on the water. One day, the ship saw a box in the water. The ship was worried. The ship said, "What is in the box?"
The ship went to the box. The ship opened the box. Inside the box, there was a toy. The toy was a little boat. The little boat said, "Hello, big ship!"
The big ship was not worried anymore. The big ship and the little boat played in the water. They had fun together. They were happy. And they lived happily ever after.

Once there was a little boy named Joe. He was playing near the mill when he saw a large ball. Joe ran up to the ball and gave it a big kick.
The ball rolled away and became stuck at a wall. Joe heaved and pushed but he couldn't move it. 
Suddenly, Joe heard a loud voice. It was coming from the wall. The voice said "Why are you kicking my wall, young boy?"
Joe was scared and replied, "I'm sorry! I was just kicking the ball."
The voice said in a harsh tone, "Go away! I don't want you near my mill!"
Joe quickly ran away from the mill and never came back. He learned his lesson--no more kicking balls near the mill!

Once upon a time, there was a jolly dog named Spot. Spot had a big, white bone. He loved his bone very much. Spot liked to lean on his bone when he was tired. It made him happy.
One day, a mean cat came to Spot's house. The cat saw Spot's white bone and wanted it. The cat tried to take the bone away from Spot. Spot was sad and didn't know what to do.
Spot's friend, a kind bird, saw what was happening. The bird talked to the cat and told her that it was not nice to take things from others. The cat felt bad and gave the bone back to Spot. They all learned that sharing and being kind to others is very important.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the big store with his mom. They needed to go up to the second floor. Tim saw the elevator and asked his mom, "Mom, can we take the elevator?" His mom said, "Yes, I permit you to press the button."
Tim was so happy. He pressed the button and the elevator doors opened. They went inside and Tim pressed the number two. But the elevator did not move. Tim felt stupid. He thought he broke the elevator.
Just then, a store worker came and said, "Don't worry, the elevator is being fixed. Let's take the stairs." They all walked up the stairs together. When they reached the second floor, Tim saw a big toy car. His mom bought it for him as a surprise. Tim was very happy and forgot about the elevator.

Once upon a time there was a family of three. They were very rich, and they had a lot of things. One day, the little girl decided she wanted to have a grill. Her mum and dad smiled and told her that she could have one.
The little girl was delighted, and she ran to look for the grill. She couldn't find it at first, then finally, she spotted it in the corner. She picked it up and carried it to the garden. She then asked her mum and dad to show her how to use it.
Mum and Dad were both excited to show the little girl how to grill. They explained how to light the grill, how to make sure it was safe to cook over and also how to cook different foods. The little girl decided that it was very easy to learn and was thrilled with her new skill.
The little girl had lots of fun grilling with her mum and dad. They cooked lots of delicious food and enjoyed being able to cook together as a family. The little girl was so delighted with her new skill, and she loved being able to cook food for her family. The family were all very happy and the little girl was really glad she had decided to get a grill.

Once upon a time there was a fierce king. He ruled over the land with an iron fist, and all his subjects were very afraid of him.
One day, the king was walking in the forest, when he heard a sound coming from behind a nearby bush. He stopped and peered through the leaves.
To his surprise, the king saw a small, furry creature with a sad face. "What are you doing?" asked the king.
The creature sighed and pointed to a torn piece of cloth. "My friend ripped this cloth," it said. "I'm trying to fix it."
The king smiled and said, "That sounds like a difficult task. Let me help you."
The king carefully stitched the tear back together until the cloth was as good as new. The furry creature thanked the king and promised to always remember his kindness.
The king smiled and walked away, feeling happy that he had helped the creature. As he walked, he thought to himself, "It's important that even a fierce king can show kindness."

Once upon a time, there was a big hurricane. It was very loud and scary. All the people went to a safe place. They wanted to stay away from the hurricane. They took what was available to them, like food and toys, so they could be happy and not hungry.
The hurricane went on for a long time. The wind blew, and the rain fell. The people stayed inside and played games. They ate their food and shared with each other. They made sure everyone had something to eat and play with.
After a while, the hurricane began to end. The wind stopped blowing, and the rain stopped falling. The people came out of their safe place. They were happy that the hurricane was over. They went back to their homes and started to clean up. They helped each other and made sure everyone was okay. And they all lived happily ever after.

One day, a little girl named Lucy went to the park. The sun was shining and the sky was blue. Lucy liked to play in the park with her friends. Today, she saw a fair with lots of fun games and treats. Lucy felt happy and excited.
Lucy walked to the fair and gazed at all the fun things to see. She saw a big wheel, a funny clown, and a game with a ball. Lucy wanted to try the game with the ball. She used her hand to throw the ball at some pins. She tried her best and knocked down all the pins. Lucy won a prize - a cute, fluffy teddy bear.
Lucy was very happy with her new teddy bear. She held it in her hand and showed it to her friends. They all thought it was very nice. Lucy played with her teddy bear at the park until it was time to go home. She couldn't wait to come back to the park and play again.

Mia and Ben love to play in the forest. They like to find pine cones and make things with them. Sometimes they make animals, sometimes they make hats, sometimes they make cars.
One day, they find a big pine cone that looks like a rocket. They are very enthusiastic. They want to send it to the moon. They look for a big stick to make a launch pad. They find one near a big pine tree.
They put the pine cone rocket on the stick. They count down from ten. They shout "blast off!" and push the rocket with their hands. The rocket flies in the air. It goes very high. They clap and cheer.
They watch the rocket until it is very small. They think it reaches the moon. They are very happy. They hug each other and say "we did it!"
They run back to their house to tell their mom and dad. They want to make more pine cone rockets. They love to play in the forest.

Once there was an ordinary girl. She had an ordinary case that she liked to carry around. One day she went for an adventure in the park, and she brought her case with her.
She came to a pond and saw a strange creature. She was very curious, so she reached out to touch it. But when her hand touched the creature a loud sound came from the case! The creature was so surprised that it jumped away.
The girl opened the case, and inside was a special toy. It had lots of buttons and made loud noises, and when you touched it the noise came out! She laughed at the noise and touched it again and again. She was having so much fun.
Then the girl saw a butterfly and went over to touch it. The butterfly flew away, but the girl still had her special toy in her case. She was so happy that she kept playing with it all day.

One day, a big bear named Ben went for a walk in the woods. Ben was a calm bear who loved to give hugs. He walked and walked until he met a small bunny named Lily. Lily looked sad, so Ben asked, "Why are you sad, Lily?"
Lily said, "I am trying to weigh my carrots, but I can't lift them. They are too heavy." Ben wanted to help his new friend. So, he gave Lily a big, warm hug to make her feel better. Then, Ben helped Lily weigh her carrots.
Together, they put the carrots on a big rock to weigh them. The rock went down because the carrots were heavy. Lily was so happy that Ben helped her. She gave Ben a big hug to say thank you. They became best friends and played in the woods every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. She had a lot of toys and stuff in her room. One day, Mia was playing with her toys when she accidentally broke her favorite doll's arm. Mia was very sad because her doll was broken.
Mia's mommy saw her sad face and asked what was wrong. Mia showed her mommy the broken doll. Her mommy said, "Don't worry, Mia. I will fix your doll for you." Mia's mommy took the doll and went to find some glue to fix the broken arm.
While her mommy was fixing the doll, Mia remained in her room with her other toys. She played with her toy cars and stuffed animals, but she still missed her favorite doll. After a little while, her mommy came back with the fixed doll. Mia was very happy to see her favorite doll was not broken anymore. She hugged her mommy and thanked her for fixing her doll. From that day on, Mia learned to be more careful with her toys and stuff.

One day, a big helicopter flew in the sky. It went up, up, up. The helicopter was very big and made a loud sound. The people in the town looked up and saw it. They were very happy.
A man in the helicopter said, "Hello! We have tasty food for you!" The people were very excited. They loved tasty food. The man in the helicopter dropped the food down to the people. The people ate the food and it was so good.
But then, something strange happened. The tasty food made the people grow! They got bigger and bigger. The people were scared. They did not want to be so big. The man in the helicopter said, "Oh no! I will help you." He flew away and came back with a special drink.
The people drank the special drink and they got smaller again. They were happy and said, "Thank you, helicopter man!" The helicopter man smiled and flew away. The people in the town never forgot the day the helicopter brought them tasty food and a big surprise.

Adaya and her mom went to the backyard. It was a cheerful place with lots of sun. Adaya's mom set up a bucket and gave Adaya cloths to put inside it. Adaya smiled and she understood her mom wanted her to make the cloths dry.
Adaya took the cloths and put them inside the bucket. She was very careful to make sure the cloths were all wet from the water. Then Adaya found a strong stick and tried to stir the cloths around until they were all wet.
Mom watched Adaya doing this for a few minutes and then told her to stop. Adaya saw that the sun was out and the wind was blowing slowly. She knew now that the cloths would get dry without her help.
Adaya's mom came back after a few hours and Adaya was delighted to show her the dried cloths. Adaya and her mom smiled at each other, happy that the cloths were now dry and ready to use once more.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot loved to play outside. One day, Spot's mom told him, "Do not go near the laundry. You will get dirty." She warned him, but Spot did not listen.
Spot went outside and saw the laundry hanging on a line. He wanted to play, but he remembered what his mom said. He felt guilty, but he still played near the laundry. Then, a big wind came and blew the laundry down.
Spot knew he was in trouble. His mom came outside and saw the mess. She was not happy. Spot learned his lesson and never played near the laundry again.

Anna liked to play with her dolls in her room. She had many dolls with different dresses and hair. She made them talk and have tea parties. She was happy and peaceful.
But one day, she saw a big dust ball under her bed. She was curious and wanted to touch it. She reached under the bed and grabbed the dust ball. It was soft and fluffy. She liked it and wanted to keep it.
She put the dust ball in her doll house and gave it a name. She called it Fluffy. She pretended Fluffy was a pet for her dolls. She played with Fluffy and her dolls for a long time.
But then, her mom came to her room. She saw the dust ball in the doll house and was angry. She said, "Anna, what is this? This is not a toy. This is dust. It is dirty and makes you sneeze. You have to throw it away."
Anna was sad and scared. She said, "But mom, this is Fluffy. He is my friend. He is not dirty. He is soft and fluffy. Please let me keep him."
Her mom said, "No, Anna. You cannot keep Fluffy. He is not a friend. He is dust. You have to learn to keep your room clean. If you don't, I will punish you. I will take away your dolls for a week."
Anna cried and begged. She did not want to lose her dolls or Fluffy. She loved them. But her mom did not listen. She took Fluffy and threw him in the trash. She also took Anna's dolls and put them in a box. She said, "You can have your dolls back when you learn to clean your room. Now go to bed."
Anna went to bed, but she could not sleep. She missed Fluffy and her dolls. She was not happy or peaceful. She was sad and lonely. She wished she could have Fluffy back. She wished her mom would not punish her. She wished she could play with her dolls again.

Once upon a time, in a small house, lived a boy named Tim and his old grandpa. Tim liked to play with his toys and listen to grandpa's stories. Grandpa was very smart and knew many things. His brain was like a big supply of stories.
One day, Tim asked grandpa, "Can you tell me a story about a big tree?" Grandpa smiled and said, "Sure, Tim. I have a story just for you." He started to tell the story of a big tree that gave fruit to all the animals in the forest. The animals would say "thank you" to the tree for the yummy food.
As grandpa told the story, Tim listened with big eyes. He loved the story so much. When the story was over, Tim said, "Thank you, grandpa. Your brain has the best stories." Grandpa laughed and said, "You're welcome, Tim. I'm happy to share my stories with you."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily was a dependable girl who always helped her mom and dad. One day, Lily saw a small plant in the garden. She wanted to help the plant grow big and strong.
Lily asked her mom, "How can I help the plant grow?" Her mom said, "Give it water and sun, and it will grow." So, every day, Lily watered the plant and made sure it had enough sun. Slowly, the plant began to grow.
Lily was also learning math at school. She counted the days it took for the plant to grow. One day, Lily's dad asked her, "How many days did it take for the plant to grow?" Lily counted and said, "It took ten days!" Her mom and dad were proud of her for being dependable and learning math. Lily was happy that she could help the plant grow and learn math at the same time.

Once upon a time, there was a nosy little cat named Mimi. Mimi loved to mind her friends' business. One day, Mimi saw her friend, a mouse named Max, with a yummy muffin.
"Hi Max!" said Mimi, "Where did you get that muffin?" Max looked at Mimi and said, "I found it in the big house. Do you want to come with me and find more muffins?"
Mimi and Max went to the big house to look for more muffins. They looked high and low, but they could not find any. Suddenly, they heard a loud noise. They turned around and saw a big dog named Daisy.
Daisy looked at Mimi and Max and said, "Why are you in my house? Are you looking for muffins?" Mimi and Max were scared, but they told Daisy the truth. Daisy said, "I have lots of muffins, and I will share them with you if you promise to be my friends and play with me."
Mimi, Max, and Daisy became good friends. They played together every day and shared yummy muffins. Mimi learned that being nosy can sometimes lead to unexpected friendships.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot loved to perform tricks for his friends. One day, he wanted to learn a new trick called "turn." Spot thought if he could do the turn, he would be successful and make his friends happy.
Spot went to his friend, Cat, and said, "Cat, will you help me learn the turn?" Cat nodded and said, "Yes, Spot! Let's practice together." They practiced the turn over and over. Sometimes, Spot fell down, but Cat helped him up. They kept trying until Spot could do the turn very well.
Finally, the day came for Spot to perform his new trick for his friends. He was so excited! Spot did the turn, and it was successful! All his friends clapped and cheered. Spot was happy, and he thanked Cat for helping him learn the turn. From that day on, Spot and Cat were the best of friends, and they continued to learn new tricks together.

Once upon a time, in a peaceful village, there lived a boy named Tom. Tom liked to store his toys in a big box. One day, Tom found a long stick that looked like a spear.
Tom showed the spear to his friend, Sam. "Look, Sam! I found a spear!" Tom said. Sam was excited too. "Wow, Tom! It's so cool! Let's play with it!"
So, Tom and Sam played with the spear all day. They pretended to be warriors, protecting their village. They had lots of fun and felt very brave. At the end of the day, Tom put the spear in his toy box, ready for more adventures tomorrow.

Once upon a time, there was an old man named Tim. Tim loved to create. He enjoyed color so much that he would paint pictures of all sorts. But Tim was very patient; he never rushed his work. 
One day, Tim decided to tackle the most ambitious painting of his life. He took out all of his best colors and got to work. 
He spent hours mixing and blending the colors, carefully tracing outlines and perfecting his masterpiece. As he worked, he hummed a happy tune. 
At last, he was finished. When he stepped back and looked at his work, he smiled with pride. He had created something truly beautiful. 
Suddenly, a loud rumble shook the house. Seconds later, there was a brilliant flash of light, followed by an explosion. When the smoke cleared, Tim was gone, but his masterpiece remained, full of beautiful and vibrant colors. 
And so it was, that Tim taught us all a great lesson. With patience and a passion for creating, you can leave behind something truly beautiful.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a happy cat and a harmless dog. They were best friends. They played together, ate together, and slept together. They loved each other very much.
One day, the cat found a message in a bottle. The message said, "Please separate the red ball from the blue ball." The cat and the dog looked around and saw two balls in their toy box. They worked together to separate the red ball from the blue ball.
After they separated the balls, the cat and the dog played with them all day long. They were very happy they could read the message and do what it said. They stayed best friends forever, and they never let anything separate them again.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside with his friends. One day, Timmy and his friends were playing hide and seek. Timmy found a big bush to hide behind. It was very dark behind the bush. 
As Timmy lay behind the bush, he heard his friends call out for him. They could not find him. Timmy felt a little bit ashamed because he knew his hiding spot was too good. He wanted his friends to find him so they could keep playing together. 
Timmy decided to come out from the dark bush. He barked and wagged his tail so his friends could find him. When they found him, they all laughed and played together. Timmy was happy again, and they all had a fun day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She lived in a small house with her mom and dad. One day, Lucy saw an enormous drawer in her room. She wanted to know what was inside it.
Lucy poked the drawer and it opened. Inside, she found many colorful toys. She played with the toys all day long. Then, her mom came into the room and said, "Lucy, did you ask if you could play with these toys?" Lucy shook her head. "No, Mommy, I didn't." Her mom told her, "It's important to ask before you touch things that aren't yours."
Lucy learned that it's always good to ask for permission before touching things that don't belong to her. So, she asked her mom if she could play with the toys in the drawer. Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, you can play with them, but remember to always ask first." Lucy was happy and played with the toys in the drawer, knowing that she had done the right thing.

Once upon a time, there was a sleepy cat named Tom. Tom loved to enjoy the sun and play with his friends. One day, Tom saw a well near his home. He had never seen it before. Tom was very curious about the well.
Tom went to the well every day. He liked to look at it and play near it. Tom's friends told him to be careful, but Tom didn't listen. He was too busy having fun. The well made Tom feel happy and excited.
One day, Tom was playing near the well. He was very sleepy and not watching where he was going. Tom fell into the well. His friends tried to help him, but they couldn't. Tom was stuck in the well and could not get out.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She had a toy phone that could ring. She loved to play with her toy phone and talk to her friends. One day, Sue met a new friend named Tom. Tom had a big, ugly hat. Sue did not like the hat.
Sue said to Tom, "I don't like your ugly hat. It's not nice." Tom felt sad and did not know what to say. Sue's toy phone started to ring. She picked it up and talked to her friend. Her friend told her that it's not nice to call things ugly.
Sue thought about what her friend said. She knew she was wrong to call Tom's hat ugly. She told Tom, "I'm sorry I called your hat ugly. We can still be friends." Tom smiled and they played together. From that day on, Sue learned to be kind to others and not call things ugly.

Once upon a time, there was a small farm with a variety of animals. At the farm lived a tiny mouse, who was busy helping out the other animals. One sunny day, the mouse spotted a broken haystack at the edge of the farm and wanted to repair it. 
"Oh no!" the mouse sighed. "How am I supposed to fix it? I'm too small!"
The mouse was feeling helpless, when suddenly a friendly farmer came over.
"Can I help you?" the farmer asked.
The mouse explained the situation, and the farmer kindly offered to help repair the haystack. After lots of hard work, the haystack was fixed and the mouse was grateful.
"Thank you so much," said the mouse. "The hay is safe now."
The farmer smiled and said, "You're welcome!"

Once upon a time, in a quiet town, there lived a little girl named Sue. Sue had a pet cat named Fluffy. They loved to play together. One day, Sue's mom welcomed a new baby brother into their family. His name was Tim.
Sue and Fluffy were very excited. They wanted to play with baby Tim. But baby Tim was always sleeping. "Shh, be quiet," said Sue's mom. "Baby Tim is sleeping." Sue and Fluffy were sad. They wanted to play, but they had to be quiet.
One day, Sue found a toy that looked like a dead bug. She showed it to Fluffy. Fluffy was scared at first, but then they both laughed. They played with the toy bug and baby Tim woke up. "You can play now," said Sue's mom. Sue, Fluffy, and baby Tim played together and had lots of fun.

One day, a little bird named Timmy loved to sing. He sang all day long. Timmy had a friend named Billy. Billy was a silly automobile. They liked to play together.
One morning, Timmy saw Billy looking sad. "Why are you sad, Billy?" asked Timmy. Billy said, "I want to sing like you, but I can't. I can only make loud noises." Timmy thought for a moment and had an idea.
Timmy told Billy, "I have a plan. When I sing, you can make your loud noise. We will sing together!" So, they practiced all day. Timmy sang a song and Billy made his loud noise. At the end of the day, they were happy. They loved singing together, and everyone liked their new song.

Jimmy the puppy was very happy. He loved to run around and explore the neighborhood. But one day, the pup stopped and could not move. He tried to take a step, but his legs were too heavy.
Jimmy's family called the veterinarian. The doctor arrived and put a brown collar around his neck. Jimmy felt scared, but the doctor said everything would be alright. 
Jimmy went with the doctor to a brown building. Inside, the doctor looked at Jimmy and said, "if I don't operate soon, the pup could stop breathing. I'm so sorry." 
Jimmy's family was worried, but the doctor was confident. After a few hours of surgery, Jimmy was wheeled out with a smile on his face. He was happy to be living and breathing normally again. 
The doctor said, "It was a successful operation, but we will have to keep an eye on him. Gather any care he needs and take him back home." 
Jimmy's family was so relieved to have their pup back. He was full of energy and life, and he ran around the neighborhood with a smile. Knowing that Jimmy was ok had made everyone's day.

Once upon a time, there was a big, impressive tree. Two little squirrels lived in the tree. The squirrels were friends, but sometimes they would disagree.
One day, the squirrels found some shiny money under the tree. One squirrel said, "Let's buy nuts with the money!" The other squirrel said, "No, let's buy a toy to play with!" They did not know what to do with the money.
The squirrels asked their friend, the wise old owl, what they should do. The owl said, "Why not share the money? Buy nuts and a toy, and you can both be happy!" The squirrels agreed, and they were happy. They learned that sharing is good, even when they disagree.

Once upon a time, there was an adorable panda named Pandy. Pandy loved to play in the park. His favorite thing to do was to slide down the big, red slide.
One sunny day, Pandy met a little girl named Lily at the park. Lily saw Pandy and said, "Hi, panda! Do you want to play with me?" Pandy nodded and smiled. They played on the swings, climbed on the jungle gym, and then went to the slide.
Pandy and Lily took turns sliding down the slide. They laughed and had so much fun. After playing, they sat down on the grass to rest. "Today was a great day," said Lily. Pandy agreed, and they both knew they had made a new friend.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play with blocks and dolls. But sometimes they fight. They fight over who gets the blue block or the pink doll. They say mean words to each other. They say "I hate you" and "You are bad".
One day, they fight again. Lily wants the blue block and Ben wants the pink doll. They pull and push and yell. They make a big mess. Mom comes and sees them. She is not happy. She says "Stop fighting! Why do you hate each other? You are friends!"
Lily and Ben look at Mom. They feel sorry. They do not know why they hate each other. They do not have a good answer. They have a question. They ask Mom "What is hate? How can we stop hating?"
Mom smiles and hugs them. She says "Hate is when you do not like someone or something. You do not want to be with them or share with them. You want to hurt them or make them sad. Hate is not good. It makes you and others unhappy. You can stop hating by doing the opposite. You can like someone or something. You can want to be with them or share with them. You can help them or make them happy. Like is good. It makes you and others happy. You can start by saying sorry and giving a hug."
Lily and Ben listen to Mom. They understand. They do not want to hate. They want to like. They say sorry and give a hug. They say "I like you" and "You are good". They smile and play again. They share the blue block and the pink doll. They do not fight. They are happy. Mom is happy too. She says "Good job! You are good friends!"

One sunny day, a boy named Tim went on a march with his mom. They walked on a dry path in the park. The sky was blue and the sun was bright. It was a perfect day to be outside.
As they walked, Tim saw a little bird. The bird was thirsty. Tim said, "Mom, can we give water to the bird?" His mom smiled and said, "Yes, Tim. Let's help the bird."
They found a small cup and filled it with water. Tim put the cup near the bird. The bird drank the water and felt better. Tim and his mom continued their march, happy that they helped the bird.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a beautiful snake. This snake had many colors on its body. All the animals in the forest liked to look at the snake because it was so pretty.
One day, the beautiful snake saw a small house. The snake was curious and wanted to see what was inside. So, the snake decided to enter the house. Inside the house, there was a little mouse. The mouse was very scared of the snake.
The beautiful snake saw that the mouse was scared and decided to be nice. The snake and the mouse talked and became friends. They played together and had lots of fun. Soon, all the animals in the forest saw that the snake was kind and they all wanted to be friends with the snake too.
The moral of the story is that being kind and friendly is more important than being beautiful.

Tim liked to play in the mud. He liked to make mud pies and mud castles and mud balls. He liked to splash and jump and slide in the mud. He did not like to wear his boots. He said boots were too big and too heavy and too hot. He wanted to feel the mud on his feet.
One day, Tim went to the park with his mom. He saw a big puddle of mud. He ran to the puddle and took off his boots. He threw them on the grass and jumped into the mud. He laughed and shouted and had fun. He did not see the green frog that was hiding in the mud.
The frog did not like Tim. He did not like Tim's noise and Tim's splashing and Tim's jumping. He wanted to be alone in the mud. He decided to teach Tim a lesson. He waited for Tim to get close and then he jumped out of the mud. He landed on Tim's head and croaked loudly.
Tim was scared. He screamed and cried and ran out of the mud. He looked for his mom and his boots. He saw his mom, but he did not see his boots. He saw the green frog sitting on his boots. The frog looked at Tim and croaked again.
Tim regretted playing in the mud. He regretted taking off his boots. He regretted making the frog angry. He wished he had listened to his mom and worn his boots. He said sorry to the frog and asked for his boots back. The frog did not answer. He just croaked and smiled.

Once upon a time, there was a big mug. This mug was very special. It could guess what you wanted to drink. All the other cups in the house were envious. They wished they could do that too.
One day, a little boy named Tim came to the kitchen. He was very thirsty. The big mug saw him and guessed that Tim wanted some water. So, the mug filled itself with cold water. Tim was very happy and drank all the water.
All the other cups saw this and tried to guess what Tim wanted to drink next. But they could not do it. They were still envious of the big mug. The big mug was proud to help Tim and his family. And they all lived happily ever after.

Charlie liked to paint. One day, he was painting in his room when he saw something outside his window. It was a swan. He wanted to bring the swan inside to paint it, but when he opened the window, he saw the swan was dead.
Charlie was sad. He carefully took the swan and put it on the ground. Then he grabbed some colorful paints and a brush and began painting the swan. He painted circles, triangles and squares all over the swan.
After painting, Charlie went outside and put the swan in a pond. Everyone in the neighborhood watched as he said goodbye to his swan. 
Charlie now remembers the day he painted the dead swan with smiles. Someday, he will paint another swan.

Once upon a time, there was a big, colorful bird. The bird loved to spread its wings and fly in the sky. The bird had many friends who liked to watch it fly.
One day, the bird found a box of pastel colors. It had an idea. The bird would use the pastels to make its wings even more colorful. It asked its friends to help. They all said yes and were very excited.
The bird and its friends worked hard to color the wings with the pastels. When they were done, the wings were so beautiful and colorful. The bird spread its wings and flew high in the sky. All its friends clapped and cheered. The bird was so happy, and its colorful wings made the sky even more beautiful.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play outside in the sun. One day, he saw a big tree with lots of shade. Tim thought it would be a good place to play.
Tim walked to the tree and saw a small cat. The cat was sad because it could not find its toy. Tim wanted to help the cat, so he kneeled down and looked for the toy. Suddenly, the cat jumped up and turned into a big, happy dog!
The dog was magic and could change into any animal it wanted. Tim and the dog played together in the shade all day. They found the toy and the cat was happy. Tim felt successful because he helped his new friend. And from that day on, Tim and the magic dog had many fun adventures together.

Once upon a time there was a little girl who wanted a new cake. She needed it to feel happy and have some fun. So she asked her mom for the new cake. Mom said yes, and the little girl was very excited. 
But she could not find the cake. She looked everywhere, near and far, but she just couldn't find it. She asked her mom if she could help her find the cake. 
Her mom smiled and said, "Let's go to the store and get a new cake. That way, you'll have fresh and yummy cake to eat!" 
So the little girl and her mom went to the store, and they got a big, new cake. They took it home and the little girl was so excited that she ate it right away. The cake was delicious! 
The little girl was very happy. She had the new cake that she needed.

One day, a boy named Tim wanted to raise a heavy box. Inside the box was a film. He wanted to see the film with his friends. Tim tried to lift the box, but it was very heavy. Tim was sad and didn't know what to do.
Then, Tim saw a big dog. The dog was strong and came to help Tim. The dog helped Tim raise the heavy box. Tim was very happy. They carried the box to Tim's house to watch the film.
When they opened the box, they found not one, but two films! It was a surprise. Tim and the dog were very excited. They watched both films with their friends and had a fun day. The big dog became Tim's best friend.

Once upon a time, there was a happy little girl named Lily. Lily had a toy iron that she loved to play with all day. She would pretend to iron her doll's clothes and make them look nice and neat. One day, Lily's mom told her that if she helped with some chores, she would get a treat. Lily was excited and wanted to help.
Lily's mom asked her to help clean the house. She showed Lily how to sweep the floor and put away her toys. Lily worked hard and did a good job. Her mom was very proud of her. Lily remembered her toy iron and thought that maybe she could use it to help with the chores too. She went to her room and got her toy iron.
Lily pretended to iron her mom's clothes, just like she did with her doll's clothes. Her mom saw her and smiled. She said, "Thank you, Lily, for being such a big help today. I am so proud of you." Lily was very happy that she could help her mom. It was time for Lily to get her treat. Her mom gave her a big hug and a yummy ice cream cone. Lily knew that helping her mom was a good thing to do and she was happy to pay with her toy iron.

Sara likes to count. She counts her fingers, her toes, her toys, and her books. She counts everything she sees. She is a clever girl.
Yesterday, Sara went to the park with her mom. She saw many things to count. She counted the birds, the flowers, the swings, and the slides. She counted the dogs, the bikes, the balls, and the kites. She counted the clouds, the stars, the sun, and the moon. She counted and counted and counted.
But Sara forgot to count one thing. She forgot to count her mom. When she looked around, she could not see her mom. She felt scared and sad. She cried and cried and cried.
Then she heard a voice. It was her mom. She was looking for Sara. She heard her cry. She ran to her and hugged her. She said, "Sara, I'm sorry. I lost you. I was counting too. I was counting how much I love you. I love you more than anything you can count."
Sara smiled and hugged her mom. She said, "I love you too, mom. You are the best thing to count." They went home together, happy and safe. Sara learned to count, but she also learned to stay close to her mom. She is a clever girl.
