Once upon a time, there was a purple crab. The crab lived near the sea. It liked to bounce on the sand. One day, the crab met a little girl. The girl saw the crab and smiled.
"Hello, crab!" said the girl. "You are purple! I like to bounce too!" The crab felt happy. It bounced with the girl on the sand. They had fun together.
The sun went down, and it was time for the girl to go. "Bye, crab!" she said. "I will come back soon." The purple crab waved with its claw. It knew they would bounce again another day.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a boy named Tim. Tim loved to collect things. He had many toys, but his favorite thing to collect was wheels. Big wheels, small wheels, wheels from bikes and cars, he had them all.
One sunny day, Tim met a girl named Sue. Sue was also a collector. She collected pretty stones. Tim and Sue decided to have a fun and competitive game. They wanted to see who could collect the most things in one day.
"Let's see who can collect more!" said Tim. Sue agreed, and they started the game. They ran around the town, picking up wheels and stones. They counted their finds as they went. "I have ten wheels!" said Tim. "I have twelve stones!" said Sue.
At the end of the day, Tim and Sue were tired but happy. They had both collected many things, but they decided that it didn't matter who won the game. They had so much fun together, and now they were friends. They went home, excited to play and collect more things together.

One day, a clever cat and a fast dog had a race. They wanted to see who was the fastest. The cat said, "I will win the race!" The dog said, "No, I will win the race!"
They ran and ran. The cat was fast, but the dog was faster. The dog was close to winning the race. But then, the cat had a clever idea. The cat hid behind a big tree. The dog did not see the cat hide.
The dog searched for the cat. He looked here and there, but he could not find the cat. While the dog was searching, the cat ran to the finish line. The cat won the race! The dog was sad, but he said, "You are very clever, cat. You won the race. We can race again another day."

One day, a dog and a cat were playing near a hot stove. They both saw a big, available cake on the table. The dog said, "Let's share the cake!"
The cat agreed, and they both jumped on the table. They tried to share the cake, but it was too hot to touch. The dog said, "It's too hot! We need to wait."
But the cat didn't want to wait. She tried to take the whole cake for herself. The dog tried to stop her, but it was too late. The cat dropped the hot cake on the floor.
The cake broke into pieces, and now they couldn't share it. The dog and the cat were both sad because they lost the cake.

One day, a dog named Bow saw a cat. The cat was new in town. Bow was glad to meet the cat. He wanted to be friends.
Bow said, "Hi, I am Bow. Do you want to play?" The cat did not understand Bow's language. The cat said, "Meow?" Bow tried again, but the cat still did not understand.
They tried to play together, but it was hard. Bow was sad. The cat was sad too. In the end, they could not be friends. Bow and the cat went their own ways, feeling sad.

Lily and Ben were twins who liked to play in the forest. They saw many animals and plants there. They also saw some lumber that people left behind. Lumber was big and hard wood that people used to make things.
One day, Lily and Ben decided to make a fort with the lumber. They worked hard to stack the lumber and make a wall. They were very proud of their fort. They wanted to display it to their friends.
"Look at our fort!" Lily said to Ben. "It is the best fort ever!"
"Yes, it is!" Ben said. "Let's go and get our friends. They will love it too!"
They ran to the village to find their friends. They did not see the dark clouds in the sky. They did not hear the thunder. They did not feel the rain.
Soon, the rain became a storm. The storm was very strong and loud. It made the wind blow and the lightning flash. It made the lumber wet and slippery.
The lumber fort could not stand the storm. It fell down with a loud crash. It broke into many pieces. Some of the pieces hit Lily and Ben, who were on their way back to the forest. They were hurt and scared. They cried for help.
Their friends heard their cries. They ran to the forest to help them. They saw the broken fort and the injured twins. They called for their parents. Their parents came and took them to the doctor.
The doctor said that Lily and Ben were lucky. They only had some bruises and cuts. They would heal soon. But they had to stay in bed for a while. They could not play in the forest anymore.
Lily and Ben were sad and sorry. They learned a lesson. They learned that lumber was not a toy. They learned that they should not display their pride. They learned that they should be careful and listen to the weather. They learned that being healthy was more important than having a fort.

One day, a powerful bird named Big Blue lay on a tree. He saw a little girl named Lily. Lily was sad.
Big Blue flew down and asked, "Why are you sad, Lily?" Lily said, "I want to know about history, but the words are too big for me."
Big Blue said, "I can help you, Lily. I know a fun way to learn history." They played a game with pictures and easy words. Lily was happy and learned a lot.
From that day on, Lily and Big Blue played and learned together. They became the best of friends, and Lily now loved history.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a nervous boy who had a pair of sunglasses. He loved his sunglasses very much. Every day, he would wear them and play outside with his friends.
One sunny day, while Tim was playing, he saw a small bug on the ground. He wanted to poke it with a stick. But his friend, Sam, told him not to do it. "We should be nice to bugs," said Sam. Tim listened to his friend and did not poke the bug.
The next day, Tim lost his sunglasses. He was very sad. He looked everywhere, but he could not find them. Then, the little bug that Tim did not poke came to help. The bug had seen where the sunglasses were. The bug led Tim to his sunglasses, and Tim was very happy.
Tim learned that being kind to others, even small bugs, is important. When you are nice to others, they will be nice to you too. And that is the moral of the story.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big calendar on her wall. Lily liked to look at the calendar every day. She saw a special day coming soon. It was her birthday!
One day, Lily met a funny cat. The cat was persistent. It followed her everywhere. The cat made her laugh a lot. Lily said, "You are so funny, cat! You can come to my birthday party."
The day of the party came. Lily and the cat played and laughed. They had so much fun. All of Lily's friends came to the party too. They all laughed and played together. The cat had a gift for Lily. It was a new calendar! Now Lily could look forward to more special days.

Once there was a loyal cat. He was very faithful and loved by his family. Every day, the cat would help his family by fixing things around the house. One day his family needed a specific piece of cloth fixed. So, the cat took the cloth and used his claws to make the adjustments. Finally, the cloth was fixed and the family was overjoyed. The cat was so happy that he had been able to be of help to his family. From then on, the cat never stopped trying to fix things and remain loyal to his family.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She had a pet cat named Luna. They loved to play together. One sunny day, they went to the park to have a picnic.
Amy brought a basket filled with delicious food. There were apples, bananas, and sandwiches. Luna brought her favorite toy, a soft ball with a bell inside. They sat on a soft, green grass and shared their food.
As they ate, Amy heard a tiny whisper. She looked around and saw a small bird. The bird had a sweet voice. It sang a beautiful song for Amy and Luna. They all became friends and played together all day long.

Mama and Jane went for a walk. Jane was three and loved going outside with Mama. Mama put a leash on Jane and they started their walk. Jane saw a big dog and wanted to play.
Mama: "Jane, be careful! That is a bad dog. He doesn't look very friendly. We need to keep our distance."
Jane was too curious, though. She wanted to go closer and play. Jane began to pull her leash and moved closer to the dog.
Mama: "Jane, no! Stop! We have to stay away from the bad dog."
Jane stopped and looked scared. Mama gave Jane a hug and they started walking away. They kept an eye on the bad dog just in case. After a while, they were safely at home. Jane couldn't wait to go playing outside with Mama again soon.

Once there was a boy named Tim. He liked to go on walks with his mom. One day, they went for a walk to the store. The sun was shining and it was very light outside.
On their walk, they saw a big dog. The dog said, "Woof, woof!" Tim looked at his mom and asked, "Can we pet the dog?" His mom said, "Yes, but be gentle." Tim pet the dog and it wagged its tail.
After they pet the dog, they went to the store. Tim picked up a toy car. His mom said, "We can buy the toy car." They paid for the toy car and walked back home. Tim was happy with his new toy car and played with it all day.

One day, a little dog named Max went to the store with his mom. Max was very anxious because he knew his mom needed a pill to feel better. They walked to the store and looked for the pill.
Max's mom said, "Max, help me find the pill, please." Max looked around and saw the pill on a shelf. He barked and pointed to the pill. His mom smiled and said, "Thank you, Max!"
Then, they went to the front of the store to pay for the pill. Max's mom gave the money to the store man. They took the pill home, and Max's mom felt better. Max was happy he could help his mom.

One day, a little boy named Tim was feeling restless. He wanted to do something fun. He thought of playing with his toy cars, but he had a better idea. He wanted to plant a flower in his garden.
Tim went outside with a small pot and some soil. He filled the pot with the soil. He made a little hole in the soil with his finger. Tim put a tiny seed in the hole and covered it with more soil.
Next, Tim needed to pour water on the seed. He went inside and got a cup of water. He poured the water on the soil in the pot. Every day, Tim watered the seed and waited for it to grow. Soon, a beautiful flower grew in the pot. Tim was so happy that he had made something so pretty.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Annie. Annie was a very adventurous girl. One day she was walking through the forest and she saw a mysterious herb growing near a log. She wondered what it was, and decided to pick it. 
Annie was so tired from her long journey, so when she saw the herb she yawned. She looked around at all the trees and timidly said," What should I do with this herb?" 
Suddenly, she heard a voice say, "Why don't you eat it? It tastes delicious!" It was a wise old bird. Annie was so surprised that he could talk to her.
The bird said, "This is a magical herb and if you eat it, you will have enough energy to explore the rest of the forest." 
Annie was so excited by this prospect. She thanked the bird, ate the herb and then quickly headed off on her adventurous journey.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a boy named Tom. Tom liked to jog every day. He would jog to the park, to the store, and to his friend's house. Tom was an honest boy. He always told the truth.
One day, Tom found a big cake on the street. He thought it was a gift for him. Tom wanted to eat the cake, but he knew it was not his. He did not want to spoil the cake. So, Tom went to find the person who lost the cake.
Tom asked his friends and neighbors about the cake. But no one knew who it belonged to. Tom felt sad because he could not find the owner. He did not want to spoil the cake, so he left it on a bench in the park.
Later that day, it started to rain. The rain spoiled the cake. Tom felt bad because the cake was ruined. He wished he had found the owner in time. The honest boy learned that sometimes, even when you try your best, things can still have a bad ending.

Once upon a time, there was a purple planet. On this planet, there were many small animals. They liked to play and have fun. One day, a big animal came to the planet. The big animal was not nice. The small animals were scared.
The big animal wanted to explain something to the small animals. He told them that he wanted to take their planet. The small animals did not like this. They tried to think of a way to stop the big animal.
The small animals tried to talk to the big animal, but he did not listen. They tried to hide, but the big animal found them. In the end, the big animal took the purple planet. The small animals were very sad. They had to find a new place to live. The purple planet was not their home anymore.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a big barrel. The barrel was full of yummy apples. A harmless little mouse named Mimi lived near the barrel. Mimi loved to eat apples.
One sunny day, Mimi went to the barrel. She wanted to eat a big, juicy apple. As she was eating, she heard a whisper. "Hello," said a tiny voice. Mimi looked around and saw a friendly bug named Benny. Benny was sitting on an apple next to her.
"Hi," Mimi whispered back. "Do you like apples too?" Benny nodded his head. "Yes, I love apples!" They both smiled and enjoyed eating apples together. From that day on, Mimi and Benny became best friends. They always shared the yummy apples from the big barrel.

Once upon a time, a kind mommy and baby bunny were walking in the woods. Suddenly, the baby bunny saw something and shouted, "Mommy! What is that big machine?"
Mommy looked and explained, "That is called a tank. It is used in wars."
The baby bunny was shocked, "What is war? Is it bad?"
Mommy smiled and said, "No, it is not bad. It is when people fight but try to be kind."
The baby bunny then asked, "What do people do in wars?"
Mommy said, "Sometimes they use tanks and they kick and throw things."
The baby bunny was a little scared but asked, "Can we play war?"
Mommy smiled and said, "Yes! We can play war, but let's be extra kind." 
So Mommy and the baby bunny ran around the forest, pretending to fight a war, but with lots of hugs and kisses too. They had so much fun playing and being kind.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a little mushroom. The mushroom was very independent. It liked to do things all by itself. It grew in a small spot where it fit just right. The mushroom was happy.
One day, a small bug came to visit the mushroom. The bug said, "Hello, mushroom! Do you want to play with me?" The mushroom thought for a moment and said, "Yes, I would like to play with you, bug." They played together all day and had lots of fun.
The next day, when the mushroom woke up, it found that it had grown bigger. Now, it did not fit in its small spot anymore. The mushroom was sad. But then, the bug came back and said, "Don't worry, mushroom. We can find a new spot for you to fit." So, they looked together and found a new spot where the mushroom fit just right. The mushroom was happy again, and it learned that having friends can help when unexpected things happen.

Lily likes to follow daddy when he goes to work. She thinks he has a fun job. He makes things with his hands. He paints and cuts and glues. He calls them original art.
One day, Lily sneaks out of the house and follows daddy to his studio. She hides behind a big box and watches him work. She sees him paint a picture of a bird. It is blue and yellow and green. It is very pretty.
Lily wants to make a picture too. She finds some paper and crayons. She draws a bird. It is red and purple and orange. She thinks it is original too.
She runs to daddy and shows him her picture. She says, "Look, daddy, I made a bird too. Do you like it?"
Daddy looks at her picture and smiles. He hugs her and says, "I love it, Lily. It is very original and beautiful. Just like you. But you should not follow me to work. It is not safe. You could get hurt. You should stay at home with mommy. She worries about you."
Lily feels sorry. She says, "I'm sorry, daddy. I just wanted to see what you do. I like your art. Can I help you sometimes?"
Daddy says, "Maybe sometimes, when I have time. But you have to ask me first. And you have to listen to me and be careful. OK?"
Lily says, "OK, daddy. I will. Can I keep my picture?"
Daddy says, "Of course you can. It is your original art. And I am very proud of you."

Tom and Mia are playing in the park. They have a new toy. It is a bow and arrow. Tom wants to shoot the arrow at a tree. Mia wants to shoot the arrow at a bird.
"Let me try, let me try!" Mia says. She takes the bow and arrow from Tom. She aims at a bird on a branch. She pulls the string and lets go.
But the arrow does not fly to the bird. It flies to a man on a bench. The man is reading a book. He does not see the arrow coming. The arrow hits his book and makes a hole.
"Ouch!" the man says. He looks at his book. He sees the arrow. He is angry. He stands up and looks for the children.
Tom and Mia are scared. They run behind a slide. They cover their mouths. They hope the man does not find them.
"Who did this? Who shot this arrow?" the man shouts. He walks around the park. He looks for the bow and arrow.
Tom and Mia stay behind the slide. They are quiet. They are sorry. They do not want to play with the bow and arrow anymore. They want to go home.

Once upon a time there was a young girl who loved to ride her bike. One day, her mom wanted her to wear a pretty blouse. She was very fearful, because it was too tight.
The girl went to ride her bike. But suddenly, the blouse got caught in the wheel of the bike! No matter how hard the girl tried, she couldn't get it out.
The girl became more and more scared. She ran to get her mother. But it was too late! By the time they arrived, the blouse had been ripped apart and the girl was in tears. 
The girl had a bad day. She could never wear her blouse again.

Tommy was grumpy. He did not want to help Mommy clean the house. He wanted to play with his toys and watch TV. But Mommy said he had to do his chores or he would not get any cookies.
Mommy gave Tommy a mop and told him to clean the floor in the kitchen. Tommy took the mop and dragged it on the floor. He did not care if he did a good job or not. He just wanted to finish quickly.
But then he saw something shiny under the table. He dropped the mop and ran to the table. He knelt down and reached for the shiny thing. He thought it was a coin or a toy. He wanted to have it.
But it was not a coin or a toy. It was a mouse trap. And it snapped on his finger. Tommy screamed and cried. He let go of the trap and held his finger. It hurt a lot.
Mommy heard Tommy scream and ran to the kitchen. She saw him kneeling on the floor, holding his finger. She saw the trap and the mop. She understood what happened. She felt sorry for Tommy, but she also felt angry.
"Tommy, what did you do?" she asked. "Why did you leave the mop and touch the trap? You know you are not supposed to do that. You could have hurt yourself badly."
Tommy looked at Mommy with tears in his eyes. He was still grumpy, but he also felt sorry. He knew he did something bad. He said, "I'm sorry, Mommy. I wanted the shiny thing. I didn't know it was a trap. It looked like a toy."
Mommy sighed and hugged Tommy. She said, "It's okay, Tommy. I'm glad you are not hurt too much. But you have to be careful and listen to me. The trap is not a toy. It is for the mice. And the mop is not a toy either. It is for cleaning. Next time, please do your chores and don't touch things that are not yours."
Tommy nodded and said, "Okay, Mommy. I will do my chores and be good. Can I have a cookie now?"
Mommy smiled and said, "Yes, you can have a cookie. But only one. And after that, you have to finish mopping the floor."
Tommy agreed and took a cookie. He ate it and then picked up the mop. He mopped the floor more carefully. He was still grumpy, but he also felt a little happy. He learned a lesson and he got a cookie.

The sun was shining and the sky was bright. A young bird was flying high in the sky. He passed over a fountain, and decided to land and take a drink. As he flew down and perched on the edge of the fountain, he saw a young girl.
The bird said, "Hello! What's your name?"
The girl looked up and smiled. "I'm Penny. What's your name?"
"I'm Birdy. I'm flying around the sky. Would you like to come with me?"
Penny was excited. "Yes! Can I?"
So Birdy spread his wings and carefully scooped up Penny with his beak. Then they flew off together, high in the sky. Penny smiled as they flew through the clouds and waved to the people below.
The sun began to set, and they flew back down to the fountain. Birdy said, "Goodbye Penny. Let's fly together again soon."
Penny waved as Birdy flew away. She said, "Bye Birdy, I hope we can fly again soon!"

Once upon a time, there was a grumpy cat named Tom. Tom lived in a big yard with a swing. Tom did not like to play with the other cats. He liked to sit on the swing alone.
One sunny day, a little cat named Lily came to the yard. She saw Tom on the swing and said, "Hi, can I play with you?" Tom looked at her and said, "No, I like to be alone." Lily felt sad, but she did not give up. She tried to make Tom happy by bringing him a toy mouse.
Tom saw the toy mouse and started to play with it. He felt less grumpy. He looked at Lily and said, "Thank you. You can play with me now." They played on the swing together and had lots of fun.
The other cats in the yard saw Tom and Lily playing. They joined in, and everyone had a great time. Tom learned that sharing and being kind to others can make you feel happy. From that day on, Tom was not a grumpy cat anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a hero. The hero had a thick cape. He liked to help people. He had a best friend named Dog. Dog had big teeth and liked to bite toys.
One day, the hero saw a big tree. The tree had a cat stuck in it. The hero wanted to help the cat. He asked Dog to help him. Dog looked at the tree and wagged his tail. The hero and Dog had a plan.
The hero climbed the tree to save the cat. Dog stayed on the ground, ready to help. The hero got close to the cat, but the cat was scared. The cat hissed and jumped. It landed on Dog. Dog got scared and bit the cat. The cat ran away, hurt and sad. The hero and Dog were sad too. They didn't want to hurt the cat. They learned to be more careful next time.

John was feeling restless. He desperately wanted to go outside and explore the world around him. As he pulled his boot on, his mom saw him and said, "Here sweetie, let me help you restore your boot, so it doesn't come off." 
John was grateful for his mom's help and gave her a big hug. He then ran to the door, opened it and shouted, "Goodbye Mom, I'm going for an adventure!" 
John explored the world around him, looking for things he could see, hear and touch. As the sun started to set, he realised he had to go home. He sighed and looked back at the window to his house. Suddenly, he saw his mom standing there and waving.
John smiled and waved back. He was grateful she had helped him restore his boot so he could have his adventure. He then ran back home, ready for his next adventure.

Molly was a sleepy girl. She was always tired and let out a big yawn. She opened the file and she shook it. She could feel something inside it. Inside the file was a big surprise! A puppy! Molly was very excited and shook the file even more. The puppy was shaking too. It was tumbling around inside the file. Molly took the puppy out and hugged it tightly. Molly was so happy and full of energy now. She was not sleepy anymore! Molly and her puppy played happily together all day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He had a loyal dog named Spot. Tim, Spot, and his mother lived in a small house. They were a very happy family.
One sunny day, Tim and Spot went to the park. They saw a big stage. Many people were there to watch a show. Tim and Spot went to see the show too. They sat next to Tim's mother, who was already there.
The show started, and everyone began to applaud. Suddenly, Spot jumped on the stage! He started to dance and sing. Everyone was surprised, even Tim and his mother. They did not know that Spot could dance and sing. Tim's mother smiled and applauded for Spot. The people loved Spot's show, and they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. Lily loved to collect cool things. One day, she found a cage in her yard.
Inside the cage, there was a bird. The bird was sad. Lily wanted to help the bird. She opened the cage and the bird flew out.
The bird was so happy. It sang a cool song for Lily. Lily and the bird became best friends. They played and collected cool things together. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time there was a pretty girl. She loved playing with her toys. One day she found some clay. She was very happy! She took the clay and offered it to her friend.
Her friend said "Thank you!" Then she took the clay and made a toy snake. The girl was amazed and said "Wow!"
The girl's friend was so happy. She showed the toy to the girl and said "Look what I made!" The girl was happy too.
They played with the clay and talked all day. They had so much fun. At the end of the day, the girl offered her friend a hug. Her friend was very happy and hugged the girl back tightly. 
The girl and her friend were so happy and continued playing together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Tim. Tim had a job to do. His job was to help his friend, the farmer. The farmer was very sad. He felt miserable because his farm was very messy.
One day, Tim went to the farmer and said, "I will help you clean the farm. Can you guess how?" The farmer looked at Tim and thought for a moment. Then he said, "You can pick up the sticks and put them away."
So, Tim started to pick up the sticks. But there was a big cat named Max who lived on the farm too. Max was a mean cat. He didn't want Tim to do his job. Max tried to stop Tim by taking the sticks away.
Tim said to Max, "Please let me do my job. The farmer is sad, and I want to help him." Max thought about it and decided to let Tim do his job. Together, they cleaned the farm and made the farmer happy again.

Lily and Ben were playing with their toy trucks in the living room. They liked to load the trucks with different things and drive them around. Lily had a pink truck and Ben had a blue one.
"Look, I have a coat for my truck," Lily said, showing Ben a small coat she found in the closet. "It is soft and warm. I can put it on the back of my truck."
"That is silly," Ben said. "Coats are for people, not trucks. Trucks need strong things, like rocks and sticks. I have some rocks and sticks for my truck. They are heavy and hard. I can load them on the front of my truck."
Lily and Ben started to load their trucks with their things. Lily put the coat on the back of her truck and Ben put the rocks and sticks on the front of his truck. They were having fun.
Then, they saw a box on the table. It had a sticker that said "fragile". They did not know what that word meant, but they were curious.
"What is in the box?" Lily asked.
"I don't know," Ben said. "Let's see."
They climbed on the couch and reached for the box. They opened it and saw a beautiful vase. It was shiny and colorful. It had flowers and birds on it.
"Wow, it is pretty," Lily said.
"Can we play with it?" Ben asked.
"Maybe," Lily said. "But we have to be careful. It looks breakable."
They took the vase out of the box and put it on the couch. They admired it for a while. Then, they had an idea.
"Let's load it on our trucks," Lily said.
"Okay," Ben said.
They lifted the vase and tried to put it on their trucks. But the vase was too big and heavy for their trucks. It slipped from their hands and fell on the floor. It broke into many pieces. It made a loud noise.
"Oh no!" Lily and Ben said.
They heard their mom coming. They were scared. They hid under the coat on the back of Lily's truck. They hoped their mom would not be angry. They learned a new word: fragile.

Once upon a time, there was a green bird. The bird liked to play with a wire. The wire was long and fun to pull. The bird had many friends, but the wire was its favorite toy.
One day, the bird saw a red thing on the ground. It was hot and bright. The bird wanted to show the red thing to its friends. The bird thought, if the wire can touch the red thing, everyone can see it too.
The bird took the wire and put it near the red thing. But then, the wire started to burn. The bird was sad and scared. It flew away to find help, but it was too late. The wire was gone, and the bird's favorite toy was no more.

Once upon a time there was a young girl named Tilda. She was very happy and healthy. One day Tilda wanted to go for an adventure, so she put on her shoes and took one big step outside. She looked around and saw a beautiful bow lying on the ground. The bow was made of delicate ribbons in pink and purple.
Tilda took another step and picked up the bow. She twirled around, feeling the bow twirl around with her. Then she tied the bow around her arm and continued to step through the meadows.
She saw lots of beautiful flowers and animals on her journey and enjoyed the healthy air. Suddenly, Tilda saw a rabbit and began to run. The rabbit hopped away, leaving Tilda laughing with joy.
Tilda eventually found her way home, but she never forgot that day and the healthy air she breathed. She kept her bow around her wrist as a reminder of her special adventure.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sharon. She was only three years old. She had a very heavy heart because she wanted to go the harbor, but it was so far away.
One day, her mommy took her to the harbor. Sharon was so excited, she couldn't believe it. She had never been to the harbor before.
At the harbor, they got on a boat. The boat was very high, and Sharon was a bit scared. However, her mommy said, "It's okay Sharon, everything will be alright."
The boat rocked back and forth in the water, and Sharon said, "Mommy, I'm scared."
Her mommy replied, "Let's look around, it's beautiful here. Don't worry, I'm right here with you."
Sharon looked around and saw the seagulls soaring through the sky. She took a deep breath and felt a bit better.
After a while, the captain told them it was time to weigh anchor and head back home. Sharon was sad to go, but she had a smile on her face. She knew that one day she would go back to the beautiful harbor.

Once upon a time, in a hot and dry land, there was a little cactus. The cactus was all alone. It was sad because it wanted a friend. One day, a clear rain drop came down from the sky. The drop saw the sad cactus and wanted to help it.
The drop said, "Let's be friends!" The cactus was happy to have a new friend. They played and talked all day. But then, the sun came out. The sun was very hot and bright. The clear drop started to feel sick.
The cactus tried to help its friend, the clear drop. But the sun was too strong. The drop became smaller and smaller. The cactus felt very sad. It tried to hide the drop from the sun, but it was too late.
The clear drop was gone. The cactus was alone again. It was even more sad than before. It missed its friend, the clear drop. The cactus stayed alone in the hot and dry land, waiting for another friend to come. But no friend came, and the cactus stayed sad and alone.

One day, a little girl named Lily was playing with her crayons. She loved to draw and color with them. She had a big box of crayons with many colors. Lily was very happy and felt harmless when she played with her crayons.
Lily's friend, Tim, came to play with her. They both liked to draw and color together. Lily would pass the crayon to Tim, and they would take turns drawing. They made a big and pretty picture on the paper.
Then, something unexpected happened. A small dog ran into the room and took one of the crayons in its mouth. Lily and Tim were surprised! They thought the dog would eat the crayon. But the dog did not eat it. Instead, the dog started to draw on the paper too! Lily and Tim laughed and clapped. They had a new friend who liked to draw with them. Now, they all played together with the crayons and made even bigger and prettier pictures.

One day, a girl named Lucy had a big party. She wanted to invite all her friends. She called them on the phone and said, "Come to my party!"
When the day came, Lucy's friends came to her house. They all had luggage with them. Inside the luggage were toys and games. They were all excited to play together.
At the party, they played a game called "Flexible Animals." They pretended to be animals that could bend and stretch. They had so much fun at Lucy's party, and they all knew they would remember it forever.

Once upon a time, there were two friends called Lucy and Jack. Lucy was shy and Jack was brave. They both enjoyed playing together.
One day, Jack found a big box and he opened it. Inside there was a strange magic wand! Jack waved the wand and the toy soldiers from his room vanished! Jack was so excited.
Later, Lucy and Jack pretended to have a war. They gathered up their toy soldiers and waved the wand. All their soldiers vanished! They couldn't believe it.
Soon, it was getting late and Lucy went home. As Lucy left, the wand vanished too! Jack was so sad. He wanted to play with the wand again, but it was gone. 
The next day, Lucy came back with the magic wand. She had found it in her garden! Jack was very happy and they both played together with the wand all day. 
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim wanted to be a big hero. He saw heroes on TV and in books. They were strong and brave. Tim wanted to be just like them.
Tim had a special belt that was flexible. He could stretch it and bend it. He wore the belt every day. Tim practiced being a hero with his belt. He jumped and climbed and ran. Tim tried very hard to succeed.
One day, Tim saw a cat stuck in a tree. He knew this was his chance to be a hero. Tim used his flexible belt to climb the tree. He saved the cat and felt very happy. Tim had succeeded in being a hero, just like the ones he saw on TV and in books.

Once upon a time, there was a mouse who wanted to race. He knew of a contest far away and he set out to find it. Along the way, he heard a beautiful sound. It was the sound of a flute. The mouse wondered where it was coming from, so he followed the sound.
When he arrived he saw a big bird playing the flute. The mouse was so envious of the bird and wanted to be able to play the flute too. He decided to ask the bird to teach him.
The bird agreed. She taught the mouse how to play the flute and introduced him to the race. The race would be a competition amongst all the animals to see who could play the flute the best.
The mouse was so excited to compete and put all his practice to use. On the day of the race, all the animals gathered around and cheered for the mouse. He played his flute beautifully and won the race! Everyone was so proud of him and he was so happy.

One day, a dog named Max was out for a walk. He was very tired, but he wanted to play. Max saw a shiny diamond on the ground. He wanted to pick it up, but a big cat was there too.
The cat wanted the diamond as well. Max and the cat did not know what to do. They both wanted the shiny diamond, but they did not want to fight.
So, Max and the cat decided to play a game. They would see who could run the fastest. The winner would get the shiny diamond. Max and the cat ran as fast as they could. Max was tired, but he tried his best.
In the end, Max won the race. The cat was sad, but Max was kind. He gave the cat the shiny diamond, and they both became friends. Now, they play together every day, and they are not tired anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a nosy little dog named Spot. Spot loved to ride in the car with his family. One day, they went on a trip to the airport. Spot was very excited!
At the airport, Spot saw big planes and lots of people. He wanted to ride on a plane too, but he had to stay with his family. They watched the planes take off and land. Spot barked and wagged his tail.
After a fun day at the airport, Spot and his family went home. Spot was happy to have had a fun day with his family. He couldn't wait for their next adventure.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Amy. Amy had a flower named Poppy. Poppy was a messy flower. It had dirt all around it. Amy loved her Poppy very much.
One day, Amy saw a boy named Tim. Tim saw Poppy and said, "I like your flower. Can I touch it?" Amy said, "Yes, but be careful. I love Poppy." Tim touched the messy Poppy. The dirt got on his hands.
Tim did not like the dirt. He got mad and pulled Poppy out of the ground. Poppy was hurt. Amy was sad. She cried and said, "You hurt my Poppy!" Tim said, "I'm sorry." But it was too late. Poppy was gone.

Once upon a time there was a chubby boy named Jack. Jack loved to climb. Everyday, he would climb high up into the trees, much to the sounds of his mom's shouts of protest.
One day, Jack climbed higher than ever before and found a trade. He took it down from the tree and showed his mom.
"What is it?" Jack asked excitedly.
"It's a trade. It is called a trade," his mom said.
Jack loved his trade so much that he slept with it every night. He even took it with him when he went on his daily climbing adventures.
However, one day Jack's chubby hand slipped and the trade flew out from his hand. Jack's heart began to break.
But then, to his surprise, a friendly bird came by and flew the trade back to him. Jack was so happy that he hugged the bird and shouted out with joy! From then onwards, Jack and the bird were friends forever.

Once upon a time, in a tidy little house, there lived a boy named Tim. Tim had a big toy box in his room. One day, Tim's favorite toy, a red ball, seemed to vanish. He looked everywhere but could not find it. Tim was sad and sat down on the floor.
While sitting, Tim felt hungry. His stomach started to grumble. He went to the kitchen to find a snack. As he opened the fridge, he saw his red ball inside! Tim was surprised and wondered, "How did my ball get in here?" He took the ball out and went back to his room.
As he played with his red ball, Tim noticed that his little sister, Lily, was giggling. She was hiding behind the door. Tim realized that Lily had put the ball in the fridge as a joke. They both laughed and played together with the red ball. And from that day on, Tim always made sure to check the fridge if anything vanished.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim liked to print pictures of animals. One day, Tim wanted to go to the market with his mom. He was very excited.
At the market, Tim saw a dog. The dog was big and brown. Tim wanted to show the dog his animal pictures. But, he was ashamed because he thought the dog might not like them.
Tim's mom saw him looking sad. She told Tim not to be ashamed and to show the dog his pictures. Tim showed the dog his animal pictures, and the dog was very happy. They became good friends, and Tim was not ashamed anymore.

One day, a dog and a cat were walking in the park. They saw a big bird lying on the grass. The bird was not moving. The dog went closer and sniffed the bird.
"Is the bird dead?" the dog asked the cat.
"Yes, the bird is dead," the cat said. "It cannot fly or sing anymore."
The dog felt sad for the bird. He wanted to say goodbye to the bird. He lowered his head and bowed to the bird.
"Goodbye, bird," the dog said. "You were a beautiful and happy friend."
The cat also felt sorry for the bird. He joined the dog and bowed to the bird.
"Goodbye, bird," the cat said. "You were a brave and clever friend."
The dog and the cat stayed with the bird for a while. They remembered how the bird used to soar in the sky and chirp in the trees. They thanked the bird for sharing the park with them.
Then, the dog and the cat decided to go back to their home. They walked together, side by side. They were glad that they had each other as friends. They hoped that the bird was in a peaceful and sunny place.

Once there was a little girl with a big dream. She wanted to go on a search to find the perfect place. But she couldn't go alone, so she asked her mom and dad for help.
Her mom and dad said yes, and so the little girl and her parents packed up their car and went on a search. It was a very dry day and the girl was so excited!
They drove around all day looking for the perfect spot, and finally after some time they found it. The little girl was happy to discover it was a dry field with lots of tall grass and wildflowers.
The little girl loved it and said that this was the place she wanted to explore. So, she and her parents enjoyed the day playing in the grass, looking for bugs and discovering new things together. 
At the end of the day, the little girl was so excited to have found the perfect spot on her search. She knew she would never forget her day of enjoyment in the dry field.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was very excited because today he would prepare for a big race. The prize for the race was a big, shiny, red ball. Tim wanted to win the prize so much.
The day of the race came, and all the kids lined up to run. Tim was ready. The race started and Tim ran as fast as he could. But then, something unexpected happened. A little girl named Sue fell down and started to cry. Tim stopped running and helped Sue get up. They both finished the race together, but they did not win the prize.
Even though Tim did not win the prize, he felt grateful for helping Sue. And guess what? Sue's mom was so happy that Tim helped her daughter that she gave Tim a prize too! It was a big, shiny, blue ball. Tim and Sue became the best of friends and played with their big, shiny balls every day. They knew that being kind was the best prize of all.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a boy named Tim. Tim had a mask that was very important to him. He loved to wear it when he played with his friends. One day, Tim could not find his mask. He was very sad. He asked his mom, "Mom, have you seen my important mask?"
His mom said, "No, I have not seen it. Let's search the house together." So, Tim and his mom started to search for the mask. They looked in his room, the kitchen, and the living room, but they could not find it. Tim was very sad.
Then, Tim's little sister, Lily, came into the room. She was wearing the mask! Tim was surprised and said, "Lily, you found my mask!" Lily smiled and said, "Yes, I found it under your bed. I wanted to wear it too." Tim was happy to have his important mask back, and from that day on, he always shared it with his sister.

Once upon a time, in a lovely big zoo, there lived a zebra named Zara. Zara had many friends, but her best friend was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to visit Zara every day and watch her run and play with her zebra friends. They would laugh and have so much fun together.
One sunny day, Tim came to the zoo with a new toy. It was a toy camera that could shoot pictures. Tim wanted to take a picture of Zara to show his friends at school. Zara was so excited and started to run and jump for the camera. Tim laughed and shot many pictures of Zara having fun.
But then, something unexpected happened. When Tim shot a picture of Zara jumping high, she suddenly turned into a beautiful rainbow-colored zebra! Tim and Zara were both very surprised. They found out that the toy camera had magic powers! From that day on, Zara was the most special zebra in the lovely big zoo, and Tim and Zara had even more fun together.

One day, a little boy named Tim saw a big car with lights and a loud sound. It was an ambulance. Tim asked his mom, "What is that big car, mom?" His mom said, "That is an ambulance, Tim. It helps people who are not feeling good. It takes them to the hospital to get better."
Tim wanted to help people too. He asked his mom, "Can I help people like the ambulance does?" His mom smiled and said, "Yes, Tim. You can be good and kind to others. That is a way to help people."
The next day, Tim saw a girl who fell down and hurt her knee. He went to her and said, "Are you okay?" The girl was sad and said, "No, I hurt my knee." Tim remembered what his mom said. He helped the girl up and took her to his mom. His mom put a bandage on the girl's knee.
The girl said, "Thank you, Tim. You are a good friend." Tim felt happy that he could help. He learned that being kind and good to others is a way to help people, just like an ambulance does.

Once there was a girl named Lola who lived on a farm with all her brothers and sisters. One day, when Lola was playing outside in the barn, she found a delicate leather glove. She loved it so much she took it home with her and kept it forever.
Lola's mom warned her not to spoil the glove by playing with it too much. However, one day, while Lola was playing, she accidently tore a tiny hole in the glove. She felt so guilty and wanted to fix it, but she soon realized that she couldn't.
Lola learned a valuable lesson: even when you love something, it is still important to take good care of it. It's always better to be gentle and take care of your things, instead of spoiling them.

Once upon a time, there was a fast taxi. The taxi loved to deliver things to people. One day, a little girl named Lily needed a ride to her friend's house.
The fast taxi stopped by Lily's house. "Hi, I am the fast taxi. I can deliver you to your friend's house," said the taxi. Lily smiled and got in the taxi.
The taxi drove very fast, and soon they reached Lily's friend's house. "Thank you, fast taxi, for the quick ride!" said Lily. The taxi was happy to help, and it drove away to deliver more people to their places.

One day, a curious cat named Tom saw a bottle of medicine on the table. He wanted to know what it was, so he asked his friend, a dog named Max. "What is this, Max?" Tom said.
Max looked at the bottle and said, "That is medicine, Tom. It helps people feel better when they are sick. But we should not touch it, it is not for us."
Tom was still curious, but he listened to Max. They went outside to play instead. While they were playing, they saw a little girl who was not feeling well. Her mom came out with the same bottle of medicine and gave her some. The little girl started to feel better, and she came to play with Tom and Max.
Tom and Max were happy that they did not touch the medicine. They learned that it was important to listen to their friends and not to play with things that were not for them. And they all played happily together.

One day, a girl named Mia went for a walk. She saw a soft, green hedge. Mia liked the hedge, so she clapped her hands. She thought it was fun to clap near the hedge.
As Mia clapped, she heard a sound. It was a clap back! Mia was surprised. She clapped again and the clap came back again. Mia wondered who was clapping with her.
Mia looked behind the hedge and saw a little bird. The bird was clapping its wings! Mia laughed and clapped with the bird. They had fun clapping together. And that is how Mia made a new friend that day.

One day, a little girl named Lucy woke up very early. She was not angry, but happy because today was a special day. She was going to show her mom the folder she made at school. Inside the folder, there were pretty drawings she had made just for her mom.
Lucy went to her mom's room and said, "Mom, wake up! I have something to show you!" Her mom opened her eyes and smiled. "What is it, Lucy?" she asked. Lucy showed her mom the folder with a big smile on her face.
Her mom looked at the drawings and said, "Wow, Lucy! These are so beautiful! Thank you for making them for me." Lucy felt very happy and proud. They spent the whole day looking at the folder and talking about the drawings. It was a very special day for both of them.

Once upon a time, there was a little gray dog named Spot. Spot had a big notebook. He loved to draw in his notebook every day.
One sunny day, Spot met a new friend named Tim. Tim was a small boy with a big smile. Spot showed Tim his notebook. "Wow!" said Tim, "I like your drawings, Spot!" Spot wagged his tail and was happy.
Spot and Tim played together every day. They would run, jump, and have fun. One day, Spot found a new path in the park. He wanted to show Tim. Spot led Tim down the path, and they found a beautiful pond with ducks. They played by the pond and had the best day ever. And from that day on, Spot and Tim were best friends forever.

One day a little girl was wandering through the park. She saw a small kitten walking around. She was so excited! She quickly ran up to it and knelt down beside it. The kitten purred happily and snuggled up to her. She pet the kitten softly, glad to have a new friend.
Suddenly the kitten's face turned worried. It was looking for something, but the girl had no idea what. It started to wander off, and the little girl worried too. She didn't want her newfound friend to be lost!
The girl followed the kitten, trying to keep up with it. She soon realized the kitten was searching for its mother! She followed it to a nearby bush and there was the mother cat!
The little girl smiled and hugged the kitten, relieved. The kitten curled up in the girl's arms, nuzzling her in thanks. The little girl petted the kitten and made sure it was safe before walking home with a warm glow in her heart.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to dress up and play with her toys. She had an adventurous heart and liked to pretend she was a singer. Sue had a big, fun microphone that she loved to sing into.
One day, Sue was singing into her microphone when something unexpected happened. A little bird flew into her room through the open window! The bird was very pretty and Sue was very surprised. She stopped singing and looked at the bird.
The bird looked at Sue and then at the microphone. It hopped onto the microphone and started to sing, too! Sue and the bird sang together, and they were very happy. They became best friends and had many more adventurous days together.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim loved to play sports. His favorite sport was to throw a ball. One day, Tim went to the park to play.
At the park, Tim saw a big tree. He thought it would be fun to throw the ball up into the tree. He threw the ball, but it did not come back down. Tim was sad. He tried to jump and reach the ball, but he was too small.
Just then, a mild wind blew. The wind made the ball fall from the tree. But something unexpected happened! When the ball fell, it hit a hidden button on the ground. The button made a secret door open in the tree. Tim was very surprised. He went inside the tree and found a new fun place to play. Tim had a great day and made new friends in the secret tree.

Once upon a time, there was a bossy boy named Tim. Tim had a toy rocket that he loved to play with. He would always tell his friends what to do when they played with his rocket. 
One day, Tim was playing with his rocket outside. His friend, Sam, came to play with him. Tim told Sam that he could only watch, not touch the rocket. Sam felt sad, but he sat and watched Tim play with the rocket.
As they played, a big wind came and blew the rocket away. Tim tried to catch it, but he could not. He got very mad and decided to slap Sam's hand. Sam cried and ran away. Tim never found his rocket and lost his friend Sam too.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a useful pocket on his shirt. He loved to put things in his pocket and carry them around all day.
One day, Tim found a machine that could print pictures. He was very happy. He printed a picture of a cat and put it in his pocket. He showed the cat picture to his friends, and they all liked it.
The next day, Tim printed more pictures of animals. He put them in his pocket, too. He shared the pictures with his friends, and they had fun looking at the animals. Tim's pocket was very useful, and he loved to share his printed pictures with everyone.

One day, a boy named Tim found a shiny gold rock. He did not know what gold was, so he went to his friend, Sam, to ask. Sam did not know either, but he wanted the gold rock too. They both were ignorant about gold.
Tim and Sam asked their big sister, Sue, to explain what gold is. She said gold is very special and worth a lot. Tim and Sam wanted the gold rock even more now. They started to fight over it.
Sue tried to stop the fight, but Tim and Sam would not listen. They pulled the gold rock so hard that it broke into tiny pieces. Now, no one could have the gold rock. Tim and Sam were very sad because they lost the gold rock.

One day, a dog named Spot and a cat named Fluffy were playing in the yard. Spot liked to play with a ball, and Fluffy liked to chase birds. They were very happy friends.
"Spot, come here!" called Fluffy. Spot ran to Fluffy with the ball in his mouth. "Let's play with the ball!" Fluffy said. They played with the ball for a long time. But then, Spot did something bad. He bit Fluffy's tail!
"Ouch!" cried Fluffy. "That hurt! You need to say sorry!"
"I'm sorry, Fluffy," said Spot, feeling sad. "I didn't mean to hurt you."
Just then, their owner, a big man, came outside. He saw that Fluffy was hurt and decided to punish Spot. He told Spot to sit and stay by his heel. Spot was very sorry and didn't want to make Fluffy sad again.
But then, something unexpected happened. A butterfly landed on Fluffy's tail, and Fluffy laughed! "Look, Spot! The butterfly tickles my tail! It feels funny!" Fluffy wasn't sad anymore, and Spot was happy. The big man saw this and knew that Spot was sorry, so he let Spot go and play again. Spot and Fluffy played happily for the rest of the day.

Once upon a time, a friendly little girl named Lucy was walking through the woods. She saw an old hut, and she thought it looked interesting. She stepped closer and noticed it was clean and inviting. 
Suddenly, a small, old man emerged from behind the hut. He said to Lucy, "Hello there! I haven't seen you before! What brings you to my humble hut?"
"I was just walking through the woods and saw your hut," Lucy said, excitedly.
The old man smiled. "Well, why don't you step inside? We can have a nice chat!"
Lucy happily stepped inside the warm, neat hut. Inside, it was very clean and cosy. The old man served her some tea and honey cakes and they talked and laughed together.
After some time, Lucy said goodbye to the old man and stepped back out into the woods. She felt so lucky to have met him, and couldn't wait to come back and visit again!

Once upon a time, there was a smelly cat named Fluffy. Fluffy loved to play in the mud. One day, Fluffy found a big bowl of spaghetti. Fluffy was so happy and started to eat it. But Fluffy's fur was very dirty and the spaghetti became smelly too.
Fluffy's friend, Bunny, came to see what was happening. Bunny said, "Fluffy, you need to bathe! You are very smelly!" Fluffy looked at the spaghetti and knew Bunny was right. Fluffy didn't want to be smelly anymore.
So, Fluffy went to the pond and jumped in. The water made Fluffy clean and not smelly. Bunny helped Fluffy bathe and they both laughed. After Fluffy was clean, they went back to eat the spaghetti. Now, the spaghetti was not smelly and it tasted very good. Fluffy and Bunny were happy and they played together all day.

Tom and Lily are playing in the park. They like to slide, swing and run. They see a big box under a tree. It is brown and rough. They want to know what is inside.
"Let's open it!" Tom says. He runs to the box and pulls the lid. It is heavy and hard.
"Wait for me!" Lily says. She runs after Tom and helps him. They push and pull together. The lid opens a little bit.
They look inside. They see many toys. There are cars, dolls, balls and books. They are happy and excited.
"Wow! Look at all these toys!" Lily says. "Who left them here?"
"I don't know. Maybe someone forgot them." Tom says. "Can we play with them?"
"Yes, let's play!" Lily says. They take out some toys and start to play. They have a lot of fun.
They do not see a man watching them from behind the tree. He has a big smile on his face. He is the one who left the box. He is a kind man who likes to make children happy. He thinks it is a good time to give them a surprise. He waits for them to finish playing. Then he will come out and say hello.

Tom and Lily were on a trip with their mom and dad. They stayed in a big hotel with many rooms and a pool. One day, they wanted to go to the park near the hotel. Mom and dad said they could go, but they had to be careful and stay together.
They walked to the park and saw a big slide, a swing, and a sandbox. They ran to the slide and took turns going down. It was fun and fast. Then they went to the swing and pushed each other. They felt like they were flying. They laughed and shouted.
But then they saw a big dog. It was black and brown and had sharp teeth. It barked and growled at them. It looked dangerous. They were scared and did not know what to do. They ran to the sandbox and hid behind a pile of sand.
"Help! Help!" they cried. "There is a big dog and it is dangerous!"
Mom and dad heard them and came running. They saw the dog and shooed it away. They hugged Tom and Lily and said they were brave.
"Are you okay?" mom asked.
"Yes, we are okay," Tom said.
"Can we go back to the hotel?" Lily asked.
"Yes, let's go back to the hotel," dad said. "We can have some ice cream and watch a movie."
They walked back to the hotel, holding hands. They were happy and safe. They learned to be careful in the park. They loved their mom and dad.

Once upon a time, there was a pretty dog. The pretty dog was good at balance. It could walk on two legs, just like people. The pretty dog liked to have fun and play with its friends.
One day, the pretty dog saw a cop. The cop was nice and liked to help people. The cop saw the pretty dog and wanted to play too. They played catch with a ball in the park. The pretty dog was fast and the cop was happy.
After playing, the pretty dog and the cop were tired. They sat under a big tree and shared a yummy snack. They were very happy and became good friends. They promised to play together again soon.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to go to the beach with his mom and dad. They would play with sand and pour water into buckets. The beach was Tim's favorite place to be.
One day, the sun was very hot and the wind was very strong. Tim's mom said, "This is a terrible day for the beach." But Tim wanted to go, so they went anyway. They put on their hats and went to the beach.
At the beach, the wind blew sand into Tim's eyes and it hurt. The water was too cold to play in. Tim's mom and dad said, "Let's go home and come back another day." Tim agreed, and they went home. Tim learned that sometimes, it's okay to wait for a better day to play at the beach.

Once upon a time there was a girl named Rose. She was three years old. One morning, Rose woke up and was very excited. She asked her mom, "What are we doing today?" Her mom said, "We are going to the store to do some numbering. Do you know what that means?" Rose shook her head, no. Her mom explained, "Numbering means that we're going to count how many things we need to buy."
At the store, Rose and her mom counted how many kinds of bread they needed to buy. They started with toasts. Rose counted them out loud and said, "One, two, three, four" and so on until they had the right number. After that, they did the same with apples and oranges. But it was more difficult than counting toasts because there were so many different kinds of fruits. 
Once they finished the number, Rose and her mom went to the checkout. Rose was so excited to see the groceries in their cart that she couldn't stop counting them. "One, two, three, four" she said as she pointed to each item. Her mom smiled and said, "Good job counting, Rose!" They went home and put away their groceries. Rose knew that counting things was fun, even if it was a bit difficult sometimes.

Once upon a time, there was a sleepy frog named Bob. Bob loved to jump all day long. He jumped high and low, near and far. One day, while Bob was jumping, he found a bottle.
The bottle was big and blue. Bob was very curious about the bottle. He wanted to know what was inside. He tried to open the bottle, but it was too hard for him. So, he decided to jump on the bottle to open it.
Bob jumped and jumped on the bottle. Finally, the bottle opened! Inside the bottle, there was a soft, cozy bed. Bob was so happy to find the bed. He was very sleepy after all that jumping. So, he snuggled up in the bed and fell fast asleep.

One day, a new player came to the park. His name was Tim. He had a big, shiny, modern toy. All the kids wanted to see it.
A girl named Sue wanted to meet Tim. She went to him and said, "Hi, I am Sue. I want to introduce myself." Tim smiled and said, "Hi Sue, nice to meet you."
Sue and Tim played with the modern toy all day. They had so much fun. All the kids in the park were happy to meet the new player. And they all became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a naughty skeleton. He was always doing the wrong thing and his family and friends were getting frustrated.
One day, his mum had had had enough. She said to him sternly, "You need to reverse your behaviour. I can't have you keep being so naughty!"
The skeleton was a little bit confused. He didn't know how to reverse. So he said to his mum, "What does 'reverse' mean?"
His mum smiled and said, "It means to do the opposite. Instead of doing naughty things, you need to start doing nice things".
The skeleton thought about it and then he said, "I think I understand mum. I will try my best to be nice".
And that's what he did. He started being nice, and everyone was much happier!

Once upon a time, there was a big gray hippo. The hippo lived in a pond with his friends. They liked to play and splash in the water all day.
One day, the gray hippo went on a walk. He saw many fun things. He saw birds, trees, and flowers. But after a while, the gray hippo missed his friends.
The gray hippo decided to return to his pond. He walked and walked until he saw his friends. They were so happy to see the gray hippo. They played and splashed in the water again. The gray hippo was happy to be home with his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a gifted dog named Spot. Spot could do many tricks. Spot's friend, Ben, liked to watch him play. One day, Ben and Spot went to the park. Ben put a leash on Spot so he wouldn't run away.
At the park, Ben saw a big seat. He said, "Spot, let's sit on the big seat!" Spot jumped up on the seat and wagged his tail. Ben and Spot were having fun.
A big bird flew by and saw Spot's leash. The bird wanted the leash for her nest. The bird flew down and grabbed the leash. "Oh no!" said Ben. The bird pulled Spot up into the air. Ben tried to save Spot, but he could not. The bird took Spot away, and Ben was very sad.

One day, a little gray fish named Bob met a small shrimp named Tim. They wanted to be friends. They swam in the sea and played all day.
Bob and Tim saw a big rock. They wanted to discuss what to do next. Bob said, "Let's talk about our day. What was your favorite part?" Tim said, "I liked when we swam fast and played hide and seek."
After they talked, they saw a big gray whale. The whale was nice and wanted to play with them. So, Bob, Tim, and the whale played together. They had a fun day in the sea.

Once upon a time, there was a huge lake. It was so big that all the animals liked to play in it. They would swim and splash all day long.
One day, a little frog wanted to store his toys by the lake. He had a ball, a boat, and a duck. He put them all in a box and carried them to the lake. The frog was very happy because now he could play with his toys whenever he wanted.
The frog and his friends played at the lake every day. They would swim with the duck, throw the ball, and watch the boat float. They all had so much fun at the huge lake with the toys that the frog stored there. And they lived happily ever after.

One sunny day, a little boy named Tim went to the park. He saw a big slide and wanted to play. Tim was very excited to slide down.
As Tim climbed up, he saw a quiet girl sitting at the top of the slide. She looked sad. Tim asked her, "Why are you sad?" The girl said, "I'm scared to slide down."
Tim had an idea. He held the girl's hand and said, "We can slide down together!" They both went down the slide, laughing and smiling. The quiet girl was not scared anymore. They became good friends and played on the slide all day.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. He loved to learn new things. One day, he found a big machine in his yard. The machine was fast and shiny. Tim was very happy to see it.
Tim wanted to learn how to use the machine. He asked his mom and dad for help. But they were too busy. So, Tim decided to learn by himself. He climbed on the machine and started to play with the buttons.
The machine went very fast. Tim was scared. He didn't know how to stop it. The machine went faster and faster. Tim tried to jump off, but it was too late. The machine crashed into a tree. Tim was sad and hurt. He wished he had waited for his mom and dad to help him learn.

One day, a girl named Lily went to the subway with her mom. The subway was a big place where trains went fast. Lily liked to watch the trains go by. But the subway was also filthy. The floor was dirty, and there were papers everywhere.
Lily saw a man sitting on a bench. The man looked sad. Lily asked her mom, "Why is the man sad?" Her mom said, "I don't know, maybe he needs help." So Lily went to the man and said, "Hello, why are you sad?"
The man looked at Lily and said, "I can't find my way. I don't recognize this place." Lily thought for a moment and said, "I can help you. My mom knows the way." So Lily, her mom, and the man walked together. They found the right train and the man was happy again. Lily felt good for helping the man and making a new friend in the subway.

One day, a little monkey named Tim found a big, yellow banana. He was very happy because he loved bananas. He wanted to eat it, but his tummy was full. So, he decided to save it for later.
Tim went to play with his friend, Sam. They played with a ball and had a lot of fun. But Tim was worried that someone might disturb his banana. He told Sam, "I have a banana, and I don't want anyone to disturb it."
Sam promised to help Tim protect the banana. But then, a big bird saw the banana and wanted to eat it. The bird tried to take the banana, but Tim and Sam stopped the bird. The bird was hurt and flew away.
Tim and Sam were happy that they saved the banana. They decided to share the banana and ate it together. They learned that it was important to help each other and not let anyone disturb their things.

Once upon a time, there was a big clock in the town. It was very hard and strong. Every day, the people in the town would count the hours with the clock. They loved the clock because it helped them know when to eat, play, and sleep.
One day, a big storm came to the town. The wind blew, and the rain fell. The people were scared. They stayed in their homes and hoped the storm would go away soon. The clock was outside and the wind blew it very hard. The clock was strong, but the storm was stronger.
The next day, the storm was gone. The people came out of their homes and saw the big clock was broken. They were very sad because they could not count the hours anymore. The clock was too hard to fix, and the people did not know what to do. The town was never the same without the big clock, and the people missed it every day.

Once upon a time there was a big dragon who lived deep in the forest. His roar was so loud it could be heard all around the forest. Every time he roared, all the animals and birds would tremble with fear.
One day, the dragon was feeling lonely and sad. He wanted someone to keep him company. He opened his big ears and listened. He heard a tiny humming sound coming from far away. 
He followed the sound, and soon he discovered a small bee who was collecting pollen from the flowers. She was so happy and busy buzzing from one flower to the other. Seeing her happy and cheerful face made him smile.
The dragon and the bee quickly became friends. Every morning, the bee would bring the dragon a yummy honeycomb for breakfast. The dragon would thank the bee with a big roar. They would spend all day playing together and exploring the forest. 
The dragon and the bee were the best of friends, and they stayed together for many years. They were very happy until the day the dragon flew away to his own far away kingdom. But they still remembered each other and stayed in touch, sending letters on the wings of the birds.

Once upon a time, there was a brave fish named Fin. He lived in a big reef with his family. The reef was full of colors and other fish friends. Fin loved to play with his friends and swim around the reef.
One day, Fin saw a pretty dress stuck in the reef. He knew it belonged to a little girl who lived near the sea. Fin wanted to help and return the dress to her. He was a little scared, but he knew he had to be brave.
Fin swam very fast to the shore with the dress. The little girl saw Fin and was so happy to get her dress back. She thanked the brave fish and gave him a big hug. Fin felt proud and swam back to his family in the reef. They all cheered for their brave hero.

Once upon a time, a messy pigeon lived in a park. The pigeon liked to play in the mud. One day, the pigeon saw a boy with a big bag of food.
"Come, Pigeon! Eat with me!" the boy said. The pigeon flew to the boy and they shared the food. They laughed and played together.
After they ate, the boy said, "You are very messy, Pigeon. Let's clean you up!" The boy took the pigeon to a small pond. The pigeon washed in the water and became clean. The boy and the pigeon became good friends, and they played in the park every day.

One day, a sweet little girl named Lucy went to the refrigerator. She wanted a sweet treat. She opened the refrigerator door and saw a yummy cake inside.
Lucy tried to get the cake, but the cake was too high up. So, she got a stick and tried to strike the cake down. She hit the cake and it fell down, but it did not break.
Lucy was happy she got the cake. She shared the sweet cake with her friends. They all loved the cake and had fun eating it together.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They saw a big ambulance parked near the playground. Tim asked his mom, "What is that big car for?" His mom said, "That is an ambulance. It helps people who are hurt. It is very useful."
Tim and his mom played at the park for a while. They saw the ambulance stay there the whole time. Tim thought about how useful it was and wanted to learn more. He told his mom, "I want to be useful like the ambulance when I grow up."
Later, Tim and his mom saw a girl fall off the swing. She was crying and hurt her leg. The ambulance was there to help her. The people from the ambulance were kind and made her feel better. Tim smiled and said, "See, mom? The ambulance is so useful. I want to help people like that one day." His mom hugged him and said, "You will be very useful, Tim. I know it."

One day, a big bear and a little rabbit were in the woods. The big bear wanted to teach the little rabbit how to find food. They saw a berry bush with red and blue berries. The big bear said, "Little rabbit, I will teach you how to pick the delicate berries."
The little rabbit was happy and listened carefully. The big bear showed the little rabbit how to pick the delicate berries without hurting the bush. They picked many berries and put them in a basket.
Suddenly, a small bird came and said, "Please don't take all the berries! We need them too." The big bear and the little rabbit were surprised. They didn't know that the small bird and her family needed the berries too. They decided to share the berries with the small bird and her family. The big bear, the little rabbit, and the small bird all ate the berries together and became good friends.

Once upon a time, in a big field, there was a bald ostrich named Olly. Olly was not like other ostriches. He did not have many feathers on his head. Some of the other ostriches would laugh at him and call him names. This made Olly very sad.
One day, Olly saw a small bird who was stuck in a hole. The bird was scared and could not get out. Olly wanted to help the little bird. He bent down and used his long neck to lift the bird out of the hole. The bird was so happy and thanked Olly for his help.
Later, as the sun was setting, all the ostriches started to yawn and get ready for bed. The small bird flew over to the other ostriches and told them how Olly had saved him. The other ostriches felt bad for making fun of Olly. They all said sorry to him and became his friends. From that day on, they learned that it is not nice to make fun of others and that being kind is what makes someone truly special.

Once upon a time, there was a modest boy named Tim. He liked to play baseball with his friends. One day, Tim and his friends went to the park to play.
While playing, Tim hit the baseball very hard. It flew far away and landed in a big tree. Tim and his friends tried to get the baseball back, but it was too high.
A tall man saw them and asked, "What happened?" Tim replied, "Our baseball is stuck in the tree." The man tried to help, but he couldn't reach it either. In the end, they all went home sad because they couldn't play baseball anymore.

One day, a little girl named Lucy found a yellow ball. She loved the ball very much. She played with it all day. The ball was very pretty and it made her happy.
Lucy took the ball to the park. She saw her friend Tom there. They played catch with the yellow ball. Tom said, "I like your ball, Lucy. How much did it cost?" Lucy said, "I don't know the price. I found it!"
But then, Lucy lost the ball. She was very sad. Tom and Lucy looked for the ball everywhere. They could not find it. They went home feeling sad.
The next day, Tom went to the store. He saw a yellow ball just like Lucy's. He knew the price and bought it for her. He gave the ball to Lucy. She was so happy! They played with the yellow ball together and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a wild file. Every day it would sit in the same place and never moved. Little Mabel was curious about the wild file, so one morning she decided to go and sit beside it.
Mabel and the wild file talked and played together all morning. They had so much fun! Then came lunchtime and Mabel had to go home. She waved goodbye to the wild file, but it didn't move at all. 
The next morning, Mabel came back with her mom. They found the wild file still sitting in the same place. Mabel's mom opened the file and found lots of pictures and stories inside. Even though the wild file never moved, it told many stories with its content. 
Mabel, her mom and the wild file sat under a tree all afternoon and enjoyed the stories inside that file. The wild file was so magical, it was like a secret friend to Mabel. 
From then on, Mabel would come back everyday to sit with the wild file and see what it held inside.

Once upon a time, there was a humble farmer. He had a big red barn and many animals. One day, his dog, Spot, went away. The farmer was sad.
The farmer said, "I must search for Spot." He looked in the barn, under the big tree, and near the pond. But he could not find Spot. The sun was going down, and it was getting dark.
The farmer asked his friend, "Have you seen Spot?" His friend said, "No, I have not seen Spot." The farmer felt very sad. He went home without Spot. The end.

Once upon a time, in a calm pond, there lived a big alligator. He had many friends, and they all liked to play together. One day, the alligator and his friends decided to bake a cake. They were very excited and happy to do something new and fun.
The alligator and his friends found a recipe and started to bake the cake. They mixed flour, eggs, and sugar in a big bowl. They poured the mix into a pan and put it in the oven. They waited and waited for the cake to bake. The smell of the cake filled the air, and it made them very hungry.
Finally, the cake was ready. The alligator and his friends took the cake out of the oven. But, they were too excited and didn't wait for the cake to cool down. They all took a big bite of the hot cake, and it burned their mouths. The alligator and his friends were very sad and cried because the cake was too hot to eat. And that's how their fun day of baking ended with a bad ending.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot liked to play outside in the sun. One day, it rained and everything was wet. Spot did not like the rain, so he stayed inside his small house.
After the rain stopped, Spot went outside to play. He saw a board on the ground. The board was wet from the rain. Spot thought it would be fun to play with the board. He picked it up with his mouth and ran around the yard.
Then, Spot saw his friend, a cat named Fluffy. Fluffy was hiding under a tree because she did not like the wet ground. Spot ran over to Fluffy with the board in his mouth. Fluffy did not recognize the board at first, but when she saw Spot playing with it, she thought it was fun too. They played together with the board until the sun went down and it was time to go home.

One day, a little cat named Mimi was playing in the yard. She was running and jumping when she saw a big garage. The door was open, so Mimi went inside to explore. The garage was full of boxes and toys.
Mimi found a soft ball and started to play with it. She threw the ball up in the air and tried to catch it. Then, she heard a voice say, "Hello! Who are you?" Mimi looked around and saw a friendly dog named Max.
"I'm Mimi," said the little cat. "I found this soft ball in the garage. Do you want to play with me?" Max wagged his tail and said, "Yes, I would love to play with you!" So, Mimi and Max played with the soft ball for a long time. They had so much fun!
After playing for hours, Mimi and Max were very tired. They decided to rest in the garage. They found a cozy corner with a soft blanket and lay down together. Mimi and Max became good friends and promised to play together again soon.

Tom and Sam are brothers. They like to help Mom in the kitchen. Today, Mom is making soup for lunch. She tells Tom and Sam to watch the pot and stir the soup. She goes to the living room to talk on the phone.
Tom and Sam are bored. They want to have fun. They see a big jar of salt on the counter. Tom has an idea. He says to Sam, "Let's add salt to the soup. It will make it taste better." Sam thinks it is a good idea. He says, "OK, let's do it." They take the jar and pour a lot of salt into the pot. They stir the soup and laugh.
Mom comes back to the kitchen. She smells the soup and says, "Mmm, it smells good. Let's have lunch." She serves the soup to Tom, Sam and herself. She takes a sip and makes a terrible face. She says, "Yuck, this soup is too salty. It is terrible. What did you do?" Tom and Sam look at each other. They feel bad. They say, "We are sorry, Mom. We added salt to the soup. We wanted to have fun."
