Mom is angry. She says, "That was not fun. That was naughty. You wasted the soup and made me sad. You have to go to your room and think about what you did. No soup for you." She takes away their bowls and sends them to their room. Tom and Sam cry. They wish they did not add salt to the soup. They wish they listened to Mom. They have a bad lunch and a bad day.

One day, a furry dog named Max went to visit his friend, a cat named Luna. Max was very happy because he had a new medal. He wanted to show Luna his shiny medal. Max ran to Luna's house, wagging his tail.
When Max got to Luna's house, he said, "Luna, look at my new medal! Isn't it pretty?" Luna looked at the medal and said, "Yes, Max, it is very pretty. I wish I had a medal too." Max smiled and said, "Maybe you will get one soon."
The next day, Luna and Max went to the park. They saw a big tree with a medal stuck in its branches. Luna jumped high and got the medal down. Max said, "Wow, Luna! You got a medal now too!" Luna was very happy and they both wore their medals as they played in the park.

One day, a little boy named Tim went for a walk. He wanted to find a new path to play on. Tim saw a big, heavy rock on the ground. He tried to move it, but it was too heavy. Tim felt sad.
Tim saw a big stick and had an idea. He used the stick to stir the dirt around the heavy rock. He thought it would make the rock easier to move. But the rock was still too heavy. Tim tried to stir more dirt, but it did not help.
A big, angry dog came and saw Tim. The dog did not like that Tim was on his path. The dog barked and chased Tim away. Tim ran home, scared and sad. He did not find a new path to play on.

One day, a little dog named Spot went to the park. Spot was happy and comfortable in the warm sun. He saw a big tree and knew it would be fun to play near it.
Spot met a new friend, a cat named Fluffy. Fluffy said, "Do you know where to find a good spot to nap?" Spot thought for a moment and said, "I know a big tree that is very comfortable. Let's go there!"
They went to the big tree and found a soft, warm spot to nap. Spot and Fluffy were happy and comfortable. They knew they would be good friends and play at the park again soon.

Once upon a time, there was a little cat named Kitty. Kitty was very persistent. She always tried to find new friends.
One day, Kitty saw a small infant in a park. The infant was laughing and playing with a ball. Kitty did not recognize the infant, but she wanted to be friends with them.
Kitty went to the infant and they played with the ball together. They laughed and had lots of fun. The infant's mom saw them and smiled. Kitty and the infant became good friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a big, graceful bird. This bird had a dream. In the dream, the bird could fly high in the sky and see everything.
One day, the bird met a small bug. The bug wanted to be friends with the bird. So, the bird said, "Let's play a game. The game will include flying and finding things."
The bug was happy and said, "Yes, let's play!" They played the game together. The bird flew high and the bug flew low. They found many things and had lots of fun. The bird's dream came true and they were the best of friends.

One day, a boy named Tim wanted to decorate his porch. He wanted it to look tidy and nice. Tim asked his mom for help. "Mom, can you help me make the porch tidy?" Tim said. His mom said yes, and they both started to clean and decorate the porch.
They used a broom to sweep the porch. Tim and his mom put away all the toys and things that were on the porch. They also hung up some pretty lights. The porch looked very tidy and nice.
But then, a big wind came. It blew all the toys and things back onto the porch. The pretty lights fell down too. Tim and his mom were sad. The porch was not tidy anymore. They tried to fix it, but the wind was too strong. In the end, the porch stayed messy and they went inside the house.

Once upon a time there was a pupil in school. He loved to sit in the front row and always paid attention to the teacher. 
One day, he was feeling a bit dizzy and he wanted to sit down. But the teacher said he had to stand up and keep paying attention. 
He tried to keep standing but he was getting dizzier and dizzier. He knew he had to sit or he would fall over! 
Suddenly, the teacher had an idea. She asked the other pupils to help him and they all got up and put their hands out so he could hold onto them. He was so relieved that he could sit down! 
Everyone was happy in the end because he got to sit down and settle. Even the teacher was proud of the other pupils for helping him out.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a girl named Lily. She had a fancy red ball that she loved to play with. Every evening, she would go to the park and play with her ball.
One evening, as Lily was playing with her ball, it suddenly vanished! She looked around and saw a little boy holding her ball. "Hey, that's my ball!" she said. The little boy looked at her and said, "No, it's mine!"
Lily was sad and didn't know what to do. Just then, a big wind came and blew the ball out of the little boy's hands. The ball flew high into the sky and then, something unexpected happened. The ball changed into a beautiful bird!
The bird flew down and landed on Lily's shoulder. The little boy was amazed and said, "Wow, I didn't know your ball could do that!" Lily smiled and said, "Neither did I!" From that day on, Lily and the little boy became best friends, and they played with the bird every evening.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to play with his toy car. His toy car was different from other cars. It could change colors and go zigzag.
One day, Tim met a girl named Sue. Sue saw Tim's car and said, "Wow! Your car is so different! Can it change colors?" Tim said, "Yes, it can change colors and go zigzag too!" Sue was very happy and wanted to play with Tim's car.
Tim and Sue played with the car all day. They made the car change colors and go zigzag. They had a lot of fun. At the end of the day, they were tired but very happy. They became best friends and played with the car every day.

Once upon a time, in a big sea, there was a shark. The shark was not nice. He was a bad shark. All the fish were scared of the bad shark.
One day, the bad shark lay on the sand near the beach. He was very tired. The sun was hot, and the shark started to feel weak. The little fish saw the shark and wanted to help.
The little fish got their friends and they all worked together. They pushed the bad shark back into the water. The bad shark started to feel better. He was not bad anymore. The shark and the fish became friends and they all played together in the sea.

Once upon a time, there was a clean automobile. It was a very nice car that everyone loved. The car had a big job to do. It had to organize a race with all the other cars in the town.
The clean automobile went to all the other cars and asked them to come to the race. All the cars were happy and said yes. They all wanted to see who was the fastest car in the town.
On the day of the race, all the cars lined up. The clean automobile had done a great job organizing the race. When the race started, all the cars went very fast. In the end, a red car won the race. All the cars were happy and thanked the clean automobile for organizing the fun race.

One day, Timmy was watching his favorite show on the big TV. He loved to watch the funny animals dance and sing. But then, something terrible happened. The TV stopped working! Timmy was very sad and didn't know what to do.
Timmy's mom saw him crying and asked what was wrong. Timmy told her about the broken TV. Mom had an idea. She said, "Let's try to reverse the TV!" Timmy didn't know what that meant, but he wanted to try.
Mom took the TV remote and pushed a button. Suddenly, the TV started working again! The funny animals were back, dancing and singing. Timmy was so happy. He hugged his mom and said, "Thank you for fixing the TV!" From that day on, Timmy knew that if something terrible happened, his mom would always be there to help him.

Tom and Lily were twins who liked to play together. But sometimes they would quarrel over their toys and make a lot of noise. One day, they found a big bag in their room. It was full of colorful blocks and puzzles. They both wanted to play with the bag, but they did not want to share.
"Give me the bag!" Tom shouted. "It is mine!"
"No, it is mine!" Lily shouted back. "I saw it first!"
They pulled and tugged at the bag, but neither of them would let go. They were very impatient and angry. They did not notice that their mom was watching them from the door.
Mom was not happy with their behavior. She decided to teach them a lesson. She walked into the room and took the bag away from them.
"Stop quarreling, Tom and Lily!" she said sternly. "You are being very selfish and rude. You should learn to share and be kind to each other. If you cannot play nicely, you cannot play at all. You will not get the bag back until you say sorry and hug each other."
Tom and Lily felt ashamed and sorry. They realized that they had hurt each other's feelings and wasted their time. They looked at each other and said sorry. Then they hugged each other and smiled.
Mom was pleased with their change of heart. She gave them back the bag and praised them for being good. She told them that sharing is caring and that they should always love each other.
Tom and Lily thanked mom and promised to be more respectful and generous. They opened the bag and played happily with the blocks and puzzles. They took turns and helped each other. They had more fun than ever before. They learned that quarreling is bad and sharing is good.

Once upon a time there was a little boy named Jake. Jake was three years old and liked to explore. One day he wanted to go for a walk outside.
"Let's go!" said Jake to his mom.
"It's very hot outside," suggested his mom. "Why don't you wear a hat?" 
"Ok," said Jake. He found a lovely hat and put it on.
The hat kept him cool as the went outside. He and his mom walked around the block. They saw lots of interesting things, like squirrels and flowers.
When they got back home, Jake took off the hat.
"Thanks for suggesting the hat," said Jake with a big smile.
"You're welcome," said his mom, smiling back at him. "I'm glad you had a lovely walk.

Once upon a time, there was a wise man. Every day, he went to the market to buy vegetables so he could feed his family. One day, when he was at the market, he heard somebody saying they wanted to buy a gun. 
The wise man stopped and said, "No, you should not buy the gun. Guns will only bring bad things, like danger and fear," he said. 
The man who wanted to buy the gun was confused, so he asked the wise man why he said such a thing.
The wise man smiled and said, "Guns can only destroy. That is why wise people like me do not buy guns." 
The man was surprised and thanked the wise man for his advice. He realized the wise man was right, so he decided not to buy the gun. He went on his way, feeling better for his wise choice.
The moral of the story is that wise people choose to stay away from bad things like guns.

Once upon a time, in a big country, there lived a cat named Tom. Tom loved to eat yummy food. Every day, he would go out and look for yummy things to eat.
One day, while Tom was looking for food, he saw a big, yummy cake on a table. He thought it was for him, so he jumped up and took a bite. But, something unexpected happened! The cake was not yummy at all. In fact, it was very bad. Tom started to feel sick, and he knew he would suffer.
The next day, Tom was very sad and hungry. He didn't want to eat any more bad cake. Then, he saw a little girl with a plate of yummy cookies. He thought she would be mad if he took one, but the little girl smiled and gave him a cookie. Tom was so happy! The cookie was very yummy, and he didn't suffer anymore. From that day on, Tom and the little girl became best friends, and they always shared yummy food together.

Sara and Ben were twins who liked to go outside and play. They had a big yard with many trees and flowers. They liked to run, jump, and hide in the yard. They also liked to look at the landscape, the big picture of the land and the sky. They saw hills, clouds, birds, and houses.
One day, they decided to play a game of raise. They each had a stick and they tried to raise it higher than the other. They said, "I raise my stick higher than you!" and "No, I raise my stick higher than you!" They had fun and laughed a lot.
But then, they saw a big bee flying near them. They were scared of the bee, because it could sting them and hurt them. They dropped their sticks and ran away. The bee followed them and buzzed loudly. They screamed and cried for help.
Their mom heard them and came outside. She saw the bee and shooed it away. She hugged Sara and Ben and said, "Don't worry, the bee is gone. You are safe and brave. I'm proud of you." She gave them a kiss and a cookie.
Sara and Ben felt better and thanked their mom. They picked up their sticks and smiled at each other. They said, "Let's play raise again, but this time, let's be playful and not serious. And let's watch out for bees!" They nodded and ran to the yard. They raised their sticks and giggled. They enjoyed the landscape and the game. They were happy.

Once upon a time, there was a clever little bee named Buzz. Buzz loved to fly around the big garden and look at all the pretty flowers. One day, he saw a flower that was about to bloom. Buzz was very excited to see the new flower.
Buzz went to his friend, a small red motor car named Zoom. "Zoom, come see the flower that is about to bloom!" said Buzz. Zoom was also excited and drove to the garden with Buzz.
When they got to the garden, they saw the flower start to bloom. It was so beautiful! Buzz and Zoom were very happy they could see it together. And just then, they found out that the flower made the garden smell so nice. They knew they had found a very special flower.

Once upon a time, there was a pilot who flew a big plane in the sky. He loved to watch the clouds and birds as he flew. One day, he saw something new in the sky. It was a big, green, and disgusting monster!
The pilot was scared, but he knew he had to keep flying. He did not want the monster to catch him. So, he flew faster and faster. The monster tried to chase him, but the pilot was too fast. The monster got tired and went away.
The pilot was happy that he had escaped the disgusting monster. He continued to fly and watch the beautiful sky. He knew that he was safe now. From that day on, he always looked for monsters in the sky, but he never saw one again. And he lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a clever little girl named Lily. Lily loved to eat strawberries. One sunny day, she went to the garden to pick some strawberries. She saw a big, red strawberry and wanted to eat it.
Lily's friend, Tim, came to the garden too. He saw the big, red strawberry and said, "Lily, can I have that strawberry?" Lily looked at the strawberry and thought for a moment. Then she said, "No, Tim, I found it first. But we can look for more strawberries together."
Tim was sad, but he knew Lily was right. He insisted, "Okay, but we must find more strawberries for me too." They looked around the garden and found many more strawberries. They picked them all and filled their baskets.
Lily and Tim sat down under a tree and ate their strawberries together. They were very happy to share their sweet treats with each other. And from that day on, they always picked strawberries together and shared them with each other.

One day, a little girl named Mia found a small, interesting cube in her room. She picked it up and looked at it. The cube was shiny and had many colors. Mia did not know where it came from, but she liked it a lot.
Mia went to her friend Tom and showed him the cube. "Look what I found, Tom! Isn't it nice?" she asked. Tom nodded, "Yes, it is very nice. But what does it do?" They both did not know, but they wanted to find out.
They played with the cube and tried to see what would happen. Suddenly, the cube seemed to make a noise. Mia and Tom looked at each other, surprised. They touched the cube again, and it made another noise. This time, the noise was louder, and the cube started to grow! Mia and Tom were scared, but they could not stop looking at the big, interesting cube. They did not know what would happen next, but they knew they had found something very special.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spike. Spike loved to play and make noise. He was a very noisy dog. He would run around the house, barking and wagging his tail.
Spike had a toy that he liked a lot. It was a red ball. He would chew on the ball all day long. He would bite it, and it would make a squeaky sound. Spike loved the sound it made.
One day, Spike was playing with his ball in the yard. He was having so much fun, being noisy and chewing on his ball. Then, a big wind came and blew the ball away. Spike was sad, but he knew he would find another toy to chew on and be noisy with. And so, he went on a new adventure to find a new toy to play with.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a scooter that she loved to ride. One day, it was very icy outside, but she wanted to play with her scooter.
Lily put on her warm clothes and went outside. She tried to ride her scooter, but it was hard because of the icy ground. She was very careful and tried to display how good she was at riding her scooter, even on the ice.
After a while, Lily's mom called her inside to have a hot drink. Lily was happy that she got to play with her scooter, even on the icy day. She knew she would have more fun when the ice melted away.

Once upon a time, there was a big jungle. It was a mysterious place. Many animals lived there. One day, a little girl named Mia went into the jungle. She wanted to solve a problem. 
Mia met a talking monkey. The monkey said, "Hello, Mia! What are you doing here?" Mia replied, "I want to solve a mystery in the jungle. Can you help me?" The monkey nodded and said, "Yes, I can help you!"
Mia and the monkey walked through the jungle. They found a big box. Together, they solved the mystery of the box. Inside the box were toys for all the animals. Mia and the monkey shared the toys with everyone. They all played happily in the jungle.

Once upon a time, in a high tree, lived a little bird named Blue. Blue had a big heart and loved to sing. Every day, Blue would fly around and make friends with all the animals.
One day, Blue met a squirrel named Nutty. Nutty liked to climb trees and find nuts. Blue said, "Let's be friends!" Nutty smiled and said, "Yes, I would like that."
But Blue and Nutty did not always agree. One day, Blue wanted to fly high in the sky, but Nutty wanted to stay on the ground. Blue said, "Flying is so much fun!" Nutty disagreed and said, "I like to stay close to the ground and find nuts."
Even though they disagreed, Blue and Nutty still loved each other. They learned that it's okay to be different and have different likes. And so, Blue and Nutty stayed friends with their big hearts, always playing and having fun together.

One day, two friends, Joe and Amy, were walking through the forest. They saw something shining in the grass. Joe said to Amy, "What's that?" Amy bent down and picked it up. It was a gold piece! Amy said, "Look! I found a gold piece!" Joe showed her a big smile.
Amy and Joe began to walk again. Then they saw something else in the grass. This time it was a pretty flower. Joe said, "Ooh, it's so pretty!" Amy took the flower and showed it to Joe. They both smiled.
Then they heard a noise. It was a bee! It flew up to Amy. When the bee flew away, Joe said, "Let's show the gold piece and flower to the bee." Amy and Joe ran after the bee, but it was too fast and disappeared. Amy and Joe just laughed.

Once upon a time, there was a pretty girl named Lily. She had a nice dress with a zipper. The zipper was shiny and attractive. Lily liked to wear the dress every day.
One day, Lily met a cute cat. The cat was soft and fluffy. Lily liked to rub the cat's fur. The cat liked it too. They became good friends and played together all the time.
Lily and the cat went on a walk. They saw a big tree with many colorful leaves. The cat climbed the tree and Lily laughed. They had a fun day together. And they both lived happily ever after.

Molly and Joe were walking in the park when they saw something yellow peeking out from the ground. "What is that?" Joe said.
Molly bent down to take a closer look. It was a beautiful yellow butterfly. "Can we take it home, Joe?" Molly asked.
Joe nodded. He dug around the butterfly until he could pick it up. The butterfly was very still and quiet. 
Molly and Joe took the butterfly home and put it in a jar. They placed the jar by the window so the butterfly could feel the warmth of the sun. 
The next morning, Molly and Joe opened the jar. The butterfly fluttered and flew out of the jar! Molly and Joe jumped for joy. They had released the hot, yellow butterfly back into the wild. 
Molly and Joe watched the butterfly for a few more minutes as it flew away. 
"That was fun!" Joe said, smiling. Molly and Joe gave each other a big hug before they started walking home.

Once upon a time, there was a big, strong bear named Ben. He lived in a forest with many trees and animals. Ben was very happy, and all the animals liked him.
One day, Ben found a magic cup. He saw that when he poured water into the cup, it gave him more power. Ben loved his new cup and used it every day to become even stronger.
With his new power, Ben helped his friends in the forest. He carried heavy things for them and protected them from danger. The animals were very thankful for Ben's help. They all lived happily ever after.

One day, a boy named Tim was eager to play by the water. He saw a big yacht near the shore. Tim wanted to go on the yacht and sail away on an adventure.
As Tim walked closer to the yacht, he saw a sharp rock on the ground. He was careful not to step on it. Suddenly, the sharp rock started to move! It was not a rock, but a big turtle!
The turtle looked at Tim and said, "I can take you on an adventure too!" Tim was surprised and happy. He climbed on the turtle's back, and they swam away on a fun adventure together.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim was a rich boy with many toys. One day, he wanted to choose a new toy from his big toy box.
Tim looked and looked, and then he found a flashlight. "Wow!" he said, "I like this flashlight!" He turned it on, and it made a bright light. Tim played with the flashlight all day.
At night, Tim heard a noise outside. He took his flashlight and went to see. He saw a little dog. "Hi, dog!" said Tim. "Do you want to play with me and my flashlight?" The dog wagged its tail and played with Tim. They became best friends and played with the flashlight every day.

Once upon a time, there were two friends, Adam and Josie. They were walking through a big city and got lost. Suddenly, they stumbled upon a big, modern factory.
Adam said, "Let's peek inside!"
They slowly opened the big door and saw a busy kitchen. In there, people were cooking lots of delicious food.
Adam said, "We should cook too!" But Josie replied, "I'm scared. What happens if they get mad?"
Adam smiled and said, "Don't worry. Let's just ask and see what they say."
They went over and kindly asked if they could help. The people in the kitchen were grateful and allowed them to help.
After they finished, the people thanked them and said, "You will never get lost if you use your kindness as a guide."
Adam and Josie smiled and thanked them back. Now they knew, being kind and helpful can lead to great things.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim lived in a small house with his mom, dad, and sister. Every day, Tim would play with his toys and talk to his family. One day, his mom said, "Tim, you need to behave and not make a mess with your toys."
Tim looked at his toys and thought about what his mom said. He didn't want to make a waste of his toys, so he decided to put them away when he was done playing. Tim started to be more careful with his things.
One day, Tim went to a park with his family. The park was very distant, but Tim was excited to play there. He saw other kids playing and having fun. Tim remembered what his mom said about behaving. He played nicely with the other kids and did not make a mess. His mom was very proud of him.
At the end of the day, Tim's mom said, "I'm so happy you behaved today, Tim. You made me very proud." Tim smiled and hugged his mom. He knew that behaving was important, and he promised to always be good.
From that day on, Tim always behaved and never made a waste of his toys. He learned that being good made his mom and dad happy, and that made him happy too. And they all lived happily ever after.

One day, a cat and a dog had a quarrel. They were not happy. The cat said, "I found a plastic toy first. It is mine!" The dog said, "No, I saw it first. It is mine!"
The cat and the dog pulled the plastic toy. The toy was fragile. It broke into two pieces. The cat and the dog were sad. They did not want to play with the broken toy.
Then, a little girl came. She saw the broken toy. She said, "I can fix it!" The little girl put the toy back together. The cat and the dog were happy. They said, "Thank you!" Now, they played together and did not quarrel anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a happy boy who loved to play with his toys. One day, Tim decided to have a picnic with his toys. He wanted to have lunch outside with them.
Tim set up a soft blanket on the grass. He put his toys on the blanket and gave each one a plate. Tim's mom made a yummy lunch for them. Tim and his toys were so excited to eat together. They had sandwiches, fruits, and juice.
But then, the wind blew very hard. It was harsh and cold. Tim's toys fell over and their lunch plates flew away. Tim felt sad, but he knew what to do. He picked up his toys, held them close, and went back inside the house. Tim and his toys had lunch inside, where it was warm and cozy. They were happy and safe from the harsh wind.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy sword that he loved to play with. One day, he found a weak, old cat in his yard. The cat was very thin and hungry. Tim wanted to help the cat, so he brought it some food and gave it a gentle rub.
As Tim rubbed the cat, something unexpected happened. The weak cat began to change! Its fur became shiny and it grew bigger and stronger. Tim couldn't believe his eyes! The cat was now a big, strong lion!
The lion looked at Tim and his toy sword. It gave a friendly smile and said, "Thank you for helping me, Tim. I am a magic lion, and your kindness has set me free. As a thank you, I will make your toy sword magic too!" Tim's toy sword began to glow, and he knew that it was now a magic sword. Tim and the magic lion became best friends, and they had many fun adventures together.

One day, a boy named Tim wanted to play ball. He went to the park with his ball. He saw a big goal. He wanted to kick the ball into the goal. 
Tim said, "I will kick the ball into the goal." But when he tried, the ball did not fit. It was too big for the goal. Tim was sad. He did not know what to do.
Just then, a girl named Sue came to the park. She saw Tim and his big ball. Sue said, "I have a small ball. Let's play with my ball." They played with Sue's ball and it fit in the goal. Tim was happy. They played until the sun went down and the grass was dry.

Once upon a time, there was a modest boy named Tim. He loved to paint. One day, Tim found a big piece of film. He was very happy.
Tim wanted to paint on the film. He took his colors and started to paint. He painted a big sun, a tree, and a house. Tim was having lots of fun.
When Tim was done, he showed his mom and dad. They were very proud of him. Tim's painting was so pretty. They put it on the wall. Tim smiled big, happy that he could paint such a nice picture.

One day, a white bird named Bob saw an oyster by the sea. Bob was hungry, so he flew down to the oyster. The oyster was closed, but Bob wanted to eat it. He tried to open the oyster with his beak, but it was too hard.
As Bob tried to open the oyster, a little girl named Amy came to watch. Amy saw Bob having a hard time with the oyster. She wanted to help Bob, so she picked up a small rock. Amy used the rock to open the oyster, and Bob was happy.
Bob and Amy became friends. They played together by the sea and watched the waves. The white bird and the little girl were happy. They shared the oyster and had a fun day at the beach.

Once upon a time, there was a grumpy cat named Tom. Tom lived in a small house with a girl named Emma. Emma loved to play with Tom, but sometimes, Tom just wanted to be alone. One day, Emma wanted to make a cake. She needed to measure the flour, sugar, and milk. But she was too small to reach the high shelf where the measure cup was kept.
Emma asked Tom, "Can you help me get the measure cup?" Tom was grumpy, but he saw that Emma needed help. So, he used his strong paws to climb up the shelf and get the measure cup. Emma was so happy that she clapped her hands and said, "Thank you, Tom!"
After they made the cake together, Tom felt less grumpy. He even tried a small piece of the cake and liked it. From that day on, Tom and Emma became the best of friends. They learned that saying "thank you" and helping each other can make even the grumpiest cat happy.

One day, a little dog named Spot was feeling impatient. He wanted to play with his ball, but it was stuck under the couch. Spot tried to reach the ball, but his paws were too short. He was sad and didn't know what to do.
Then, Spot's friend, a big cat named Fluffy, came over. "What's wrong, Spot?" asked Fluffy. Spot told Fluffy about the ball under the couch. Fluffy wanted to help, so she tried to get the ball with her long paw. But the ball was too far away.
Spot and Fluffy didn't quit. They had an idea. They pushed the couch together and the ball rolled out. Spot was so happy! He said, "Thank you, Fluffy!" They played with the ball all day and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a loyal dog named Buddy. Buddy had a toy with a horn. He loved to play with his toy all day. Buddy and his toy were best friends.
One day, while Buddy was playing, he heard a loud sound. The horn on his toy did break! Buddy was very sad. He did not know what to do without his toy.
But then, something unexpected happened. The broken horn made a new sound, like a whistle. Buddy liked the new sound even more! He played with his toy all day and was happy again. The broken horn made Buddy and his toy even better friends.

Jack was a regular boy with a big imagination. He loved to go on adventures. One day he wanted to be a pirate just like his dad! His dad was the bravest pirate of all. 
He grabbed a big pillow and his dad's old pirate hat. Then he went outside and found the perfect seat - the big tree in the backyard. Jack tucked the pillow into the tree branches and planted himself into the cozy spot. 
He was ready for his voyage now! He closed his eyes and felt the cool breeze tickle his face. His little pirate heart fluttered and he imagined himself sailing the ocean blue. 
He had so much fun he forgot to come back to his regular seat at the dinner table. His parents laughed when they found him and together they all shared a delicious dinner. Jack couldn't wait to be a pirate again.

One day, a little girl named Mia was playing in her room. She found a big sheet in her toy box. Mia thought it would be fun to play with the sheet. She picked it up and began to shake it. The sheet moved up and down, making a fun sound.
Mia's mom heard the sound and came into the room. She saw Mia playing with the sheet and smiled. "What are you doing, Mia?" she asked. Mia replied, "I am making the sheet dance, Mom!" Her mom laughed and said, "That looks like fun! Can I play too?" Mia nodded her head, and her mom joined her in shaking the sheet.
As they played, the room became calm and quiet. Mia and her mom were having a great time shaking the sheet together. They made the sheet dance and sing, and they laughed and played until it was time for bed. That night, Mia went to sleep with a big smile on her face, dreaming of her fun day with her mom and the dancing sheet.

Ben and Lily love to play with their wagon. They fill it with toys and books and take turns pulling it around the yard. Sometimes they pretend it is a train or a boat or a rocket. They have so much fun with their wagon.
One day, they decide to take their wagon to the park. They put on their hats and shoes and ask their mom to help them. Mom says yes and puts some snacks and water in the wagon. She also puts a blanket and a pillow in case they get tired.
They walk to the park with their mom and their wagon. They see many things on the way. They see cars and dogs and birds and flowers. They say hello to the people they meet. They are happy and excited.
At the park, they play on the swings and the slide and the sandbox. They share their snacks and water with their mom and their wagon. They also read some books and sing some songs. They have a lot of fun at the park.
But soon they start to feel sleepy. They yawn and rub their eyes. They tell their mom they want to go home. Mom says okay and helps them get in the wagon. She covers them with the blanket and gives them the pillow. She pulls the wagon back to their house. They see the sun setting in the sky. It is bright and beautiful. They close their eyes and fall asleep in their wagon. They dream of their next adventure.

Once upon a time, there was a cool castle. In this castle, lived a king and a queen. They had a little boy named Tom.
One day, Tom went outside to play. He saw a big frog. The frog said, "Hi, Tom! Let's play together." Tom was happy and they played all day long.
While they were playing, the frog tried to slap a ball. But the frog missed the ball and hit Tom by mistake. Tom cried, "Ouch! That hurt!" The frog said, "I'm sorry, Tom. I didn't mean to hurt you." Tom forgave the frog, and they kept playing happily.

Once upon a time there was a girl named Mary who wanted to go to the ranch. She went outside and saw a big, calm horse standing in the field. 
Mary went up to him and said, "Hello Horse! Can I ride you to the ranch?". 
The horse looked at Mary and said, "Ring the bell and I will take you." 
Mary looked around and saw a big bell hanging from the tree. She walked up to the bell and gently rang it. As soon as the bell rung, the horse started walking towards the ranch. 
Mary hopped on the horse's back and they rode to the ranch. It was so calm and peaceful! When they arrived at the ranch, Mary was so happy and said goodbye to her horse.

One day, a little girl named Agnes was playing in the garden. She filled her bucket with water and then smiled as she walked towards the beach. As soon as she arrived, she noticed the bright blue water and knew she was in the right place. She grabbed her bucket, and then she saw a little pink jellyfish swimming nearby. Agnes quickly ran to it, filled her bucket with water, and then splashed it over the jellyfish. The jellyfish squealed and swam away happily. Agnes looked around, and saw that some other children were playing in the water and looking at her with envious eyes. Agnes smiled and said, "Let's splash together!" The children eagerly joined Agnes, and they all had lots of fun splashing in the water and chasing jellyfish.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim went to school every day. He liked his classroom a lot. One day, he saw a big box in the classroom. Tim wanted to examine the box. He went close to the box and looked at it.
Tim saw that the box had a lock. He wanted to open it. He tried to break the lock, but he could not. He felt embarrassed. Tim did not want his friends to see him. He wanted to open the box without help.
Tim found a big stick. He used the stick to hit the lock. The lock broke, and the box opened. But when the box opened, a lot of water came out. The water made the classroom very wet. Tim and his friends were sad. The classroom was a big mess.
The teacher came in and saw the wet classroom. She was not happy. Tim felt very bad. He knew he should have asked for help. The moral of the story is: always ask for help when you need it, and don't be embarrassed.

One day, a little girl named Sue went for a walk in the woods. She saw a big tree with a big root. Sue was glad to see the root because it was fun to play on.
As Sue played on the root, she met a boy named Tom. Tom said, "Hi, I like to play on the root too." They both played on the root together, laughing and having fun.
But then, Sue stumbled on the root and fell down. She started to cry because it hurt. Tom tried to help her, but he also stumbled and fell down. They both cried and couldn't play anymore. They wished they had been more careful on the root.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot loved to run and play all day. He liked to bark with his mouth and wag his tail. One day, Spot saw a big red ball. It was very important to him. He wanted to play with it.
Spot ran and ran to get the ball. He was so happy. But then, something unexpected happened. Spot got very tired. He needed to rest. He lay down under a tree and closed his eyes.
While Spot was resting, a little bird saw the important red ball. The bird took the ball and flew up high into the sky. When Spot woke up, he saw the ball in the sky. He barked and jumped, but he could not reach it. The little bird saw Spot and felt bad. So, the bird flew down and gave the ball back to Spot. They became good friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was not very strong. He had weak muscles. He wanted to be big and strong like his dad.
One day, Tim's dad told him a secret. "If you want to have strong muscles, you must eat good food and chew it well," he said. Tim listened to his dad and started to eat healthy food. He chewed his food very well.
As the days went by, Tim ate good food and chewed it well. He began to feel stronger. His muscles grew bigger, and he was not weak anymore. Tim was happy because he was now big and strong like his dad.

Once upon a time, there was a fat cat named Tom. Tom loved to play in the closet. He liked to match the socks. One day, he saw a big box in the closet. He did not know what was in it.
Tom wanted to find out what was in the big box. He tried to open it, but it was too heavy. He pushed and pushed, but the box would not move. Tom was sad, but he did not give up. He knew he would find a way to open the box.
The next day, Tom found a long stick. He used the stick to open the big box. Inside the box, he found lots of socks! Tom was so happy. He spent the whole day matching the socks in the closet.

Once upon a time there was a family that loved packing for trips. They packed all sorts of things, from their swimsuits to their sun hats. 
They were getting ready to pack for their next adventure when the little boy said, "Can I pack the sunset?". His mom and dad started to laugh because the sunset wasn't something you could put in a suitcase. 
The little boy kept asking, "Why can't I pack the sunset?" His mom said, "That's silly! The sunset is too big to fit in a suitcase. Maybe you can take a picture of it and put it in your suitcase." 
So the little boy took some silly pictures of the beautiful sunset and put them in his suitcase. He was so excited to take the pictures with him and show them to his friends. 
The family was all ready to go on their trip and the little boy was so excited. He had his suitcase packed and now his special sunset pictures were inside too. Now he was even more ready for his adventure!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big, round face with a big smile. Lily loved to play with her friends in the park. One day, she saw a new boy sitting alone on a bench. He looked sad and had no friends to play with.
Lily walked up to the boy and said, "Hi, I'm Lily. Do you want to play with me and my friends?" The boy looked up and smiled. His face was happy now. "Yes, I would like that," he said. Lily took his hand and they went to play with her friends. Lily invited the boy to join their game.
As they played, the boy was very loud. He laughed and shouted with joy. Lily's friends did not like how loud he was. They told Lily they did not want to play with the loud boy. But Lily said, "We should be kind and let him play with us. He is new and needs friends."
Lily's friends thought about what she said. They decided to let the loud boy play with them. Soon, they all had fun together. The loud boy was not so loud anymore. He learned to play nicely with others.
The moral of the story is to be kind and invite others to join you, even if they are different. Everyone needs friends and a chance to learn and grow.

Once upon a time, there was a big race. All the animals wanted to win. They were very competitive. The rabbit was fast, and everyone thought he would win. The turtle was slow, and no one thought he could win.
Before the race, the rabbit saw a symbol on a tree. It was a picture of a rabbit sleeping. The rabbit laughed and said, "That's silly! I won't sleep during the race." The race started, and the rabbit ran very fast. The turtle walked slow, but he did not stop.
The rabbit was far ahead. He thought, "I can lie down and rest for a bit. The turtle is so slow." So the rabbit lay down and closed his eyes. He did not see the turtle walk by.
When the rabbit woke up, he saw the turtle near the finish line. He ran as fast as he could, but it was too late. The turtle won the race! The symbol on the tree was a sign that the rabbit should not have ignored.

One day, a kind, compassionate lady named Lucy wanted to go on a trip. She needed to pack her bag. She put in clothes, food, and toys to play with on her trip.
Lucy started her trip and saw many pretty landscapes. There were big trees, green grass, and colorful flowers. She walked, skipped, and jumped as she went on her adventure.
As she traveled, Lucy met many new friends. She shared her toys and food with them. They all played and laughed together. At the end of the day, Lucy went home happy and tired. She knew she would always remember her fun trip and her new friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. She loved to play outside in her garden. One day, while playing, she found a tiny tomato plant. Mia thought it was an incredible find! She wanted to help the tomato plant grow big and strong.
Mia went to her mom and said, "Look, mom! I found a tomato plant in the garden. Can we help it grow?" Her mom smiled and said, "Of course, Mia! Let's get some water and give it some sun."
They went outside and Mia knelt down by the tomato plant. Her mom gave her a small cup of water. Mia gently poured the water on the plant. She talked to the tomato plant, saying, "Grow big and strong, little tomato!"
Every day, Mia would kneel by the tomato plant and give it water and sun. Soon, the tomato plant grew big and strong, with lots of big red tomatoes. Mia and her mom were so happy. They picked the tomatoes and made a yummy salad. Mia knew that with love and care, even a tiny tomato plant could grow into something incredible.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a kind man with a big mustache. He loved to help everyone. One day, he saw a little girl crying near a candy shop. She was sad because she dropped her ice cream on the ground.
The kind man with the big mustache went to the little girl and asked, "Why are you crying, little girl?" The girl said, "I dropped my ice cream and now it's spoiled." The man felt sorry for her and wanted to help.
The kind man bought a new ice cream for the little girl. She was very happy and stopped crying. They both enjoyed their ice creams together. The girl said, "Thank you, kind man with the big mustache!" From that day on, they became good friends and the little girl learned that sometimes things can spoil, but there are always kind people to help.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a little bunny named Ben. Ben was a frightened bunny because he was scared of the dark. One day, Ben's mom told him to go out and play with his friends. She allowed him to go, but he had to be back before it got dark.
Ben and his friends played near a big tree. They made a circle and played a fun game. They laughed and had a great time. But as they played, the sky started to get darker. Ben knew he had to go home soon.
As the sky got darker, Ben said goodbye to his friends and ran home as fast as he could. He was scared, but when he got home, his mom was waiting for him. She gave him a big hug and told him he was brave. Ben felt happy and safe, and he was no longer frightened of the dark.

Once upon a time, there was a small girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and have fun. One day, her mom gave her a pretty box with jewelry inside. Lily was so happy to see the shiny things.
Lily put on the jewelry and showed it to her friends. They all thought it was very nice. They played games and had a lot of fun. Lily liked to share her jewelry with her friends so they could all wear it together.
At the end of the day, Lily put her jewelry back in the box. She thanked her mom for the special gift. Every day, Lily and her friends played with the jewelry and had lots of fun. They were all very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She had a loyal dog named Spot. Amy and Spot did everything together. They played, ate, and slept together. Amy loved Spot very much.
One day, Amy was eating food from a dish. Spot was next to her, waiting for some food too. Suddenly, the dish started to move! Amy and Spot didn't understand what was happening. They were very surprised.
It turned out, there was a little mouse under the dish! The mouse was trying to get some food too. Amy and Spot laughed when they saw the mouse. They decided to share their food with the little mouse. From that day on, Amy, Spot, and the mouse became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a thin person who went on a walk. They walked and walked, until they came to a path. On the path, they saw a voice. It asked them, "Where are you going?" The thin person was scared. What was this voice?
They replied, "I'm going for a walk." The voice said, "This way is dangerous. You should not go this way." The thin person was determined. They said, "I will still go this way."
The voice warned them, "I cannot tell you what will happen. But you might find what you are looking for." The thin person kept walking, despite the warning.
Soon enough, the thin person found out why the voice had been so concerned. There was a deep hole in the path. If the thin person had kept walking, they would have fallen into the hole! The thin person was very glad they had heeded the warning. 
They thanked the mysterious voice and continued on their walk, this time more carefully. From then on, they always listened out for warnings.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a noisy dog named Spot. Spot liked to run and play all day long. He would bark and chase the birds in the village. All the people would laugh and clap as Spot played.
One day, Spot's mom told him to sit and be quiet. Spot tried very hard to sit still, but it was not easy for him. He wanted to run and play with his friends. But he knew he had to listen to his mom.
After a while, Spot was able to sit quietly. His mom was so proud of him. She gave him a big hug and a treat. From that day on, Spot learned that sometimes it is good to be noisy and play, but other times it is important to sit and be quiet.

Once there was a very clever bear. He was always looking for new things to do. One day he decided to visit the store to get something special for himself.
When he arrived he saw something that caught his eye. It was a lollipop, it looked so tasty! "I want that!" he thought to himself.
He asked the storekeeper, "Can I borrow the lollipop?"
The storekeeper smiled and said, "No, but I can give it to you if you promise to bring it back when you're done."
The bear was so happy that he ran home with the lollipop, eager to enjoy his treat. He had been so clever to think of asking the storekeeper if he could borrow the lollipop instead of trying to take it!

Lily liked to write in her diary every day. She had a pink diary with a lock and a key. She wrote about her friends, her toys, her dreams, and her secrets. She used a purple pen to mark her words.
One day, Lily came home from school and saw her brother Max in her room. He had her diary in his hands and a big smile on his face. He was reading her diary out loud and laughing.
"Hey, give me that!" Lily shouted. She ran to Max and tried to grab her diary. But Max was bigger and stronger. He pushed her away and kept reading.
"Listen to this, Lily has a crush on Ben from her class. She wants to kiss him and marry him. How crazy is that?" Max said. He made a kissing sound and teased Lily.
Lily felt angry and embarrassed. She hated Max. She wished he would leave her alone. She wished he would disappear. She wished he would get in trouble.
She got her wish.
As Max was reading, he did not see their mom coming up the stairs. She heard his voice and opened the door. She saw him with Lily's diary and Lily crying on the floor.
"Max, what are you doing?" she asked. She looked very mad.
Max tried to hide the diary behind his back. He lied and said, "Nothing, mom. I was just playing with Lily."
But mom did not believe him. She took the diary from him and gave it back to Lily. She hugged Lily and said, "I'm sorry, honey. Your diary is yours. No one should read it without your permission."
Then she turned to Max and said, "You are in big trouble, mister. You have to apologize to Lily and write her a letter saying you are sorry. And you are grounded for a week. No TV, no games, no friends. Go to your room now."
Max felt scared and sorry. He wished he had not read Lily's diary. He wished he had not made fun of her. He wished he had been nicer to her.
But it was too late. He had to face the consequences of his actions. He had to learn his lesson. He had to mark his calendar with a red pen. He had a bad ending.

Once there was a thin man who loved to print. Every day he would come out of his room and print a lot of things. One day he decided to print some soup. He used yellow ink to make noodles and red ink to make tomato sauce. He was so excited that he licked the spoon and it was delicious! He put the soup in a bowl and ate it up. He had printed the best soup he ever had!

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a little rabbit with very big ears. His name was Benny. Benny's ears were so big that he could hear things from very far away. One day, Benny heard a small cry for help. He knew he had to do something.
Benny hopped very fast to find who needed help. He found a tiny bird trapped in a big net. The bird looked very serious and scared. Benny wanted to save the bird, so he used his sharp teeth to bite the net.
As Benny set the bird free, the bird was very happy. The bird thanked Benny for saving him. From that day on, Benny and the bird became best friends. They played together every day and had lots of fun. Benny's big ears always helped them stay safe in the big forest.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to hang his drawings on the wall. He liked to draw cats, dogs, and trees. He was very happy when he saw his drawings on the wall.
One day, Tim's mom told him that he was going to learn something new called math. Math was important, she said. Tim was excited to learn math because he wanted to be a big kid. He knew that big kids learn important things.
Tim started to learn math with his mom. They counted apples, oranges, and toys. Tim liked math because it was fun. He knew that math was important, just like his mom said. And when Tim got better at math, he drew a big number on a paper and hung it on the wall next to his drawings.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park. He wanted to meet new friends. He saw a big toy that looked like a web. It was called a network. Tim was excited to play on it.
Tim was patient and waited for his turn. When it was his turn, he climbed up the network. At the top, he met a girl named Sue. "Hi, I'm Tim!" he said. "Hi, I'm Sue!" she said. They played together and had fun.
Then, something unexpected happened. A big, friendly dog came and climbed up the network too! Tim and Sue were surprised. They never saw a dog do that before. The dog said, "Hi, I'm Max!" Tim, Sue, and Max became good friends and played together all day.

Sara and Tom were twins who liked to play with their toys. One day, they found a new toy in their room. It was a flashlight with a red handle and a yellow button. Sara wanted to play with it, but Tom grabbed it first.
"Mine!" Tom said. "I saw it first!"
"No, mine!" Sara said. "I want to see it glow!"
They pulled and pushed, but neither of them would let go. The flashlight fell to the floor and broke. The handle came off and the button stopped working. Sara and Tom looked at the broken toy and felt sad.
"Sorry," Tom said. "I was too busy wanting it for myself."
"Me too," Sara said. "I was not nice to you."
They hugged and said they were sorry. Then they went to their mom and told her what happened. Mom was not happy, but she was glad they told the truth. She said they could share another flashlight if they promised to be careful and kind.
Sara and Tom learned that sharing is better than fighting, and that toys are more fun when they glow.

One day, a little girl named Amy was upset. She wanted to put a sticker on her bedroom ceiling, but she was too small to reach it. Her mom saw her and said, "Don't be upset, Amy. I will help you."
Amy's mom gave her a chair to stand on. She encouraged Amy, saying, "You can do it! Just be careful." Amy stood on the chair and tried to reach the ceiling. But, she still could not reach it.
Then, something unexpected happened. A little bird flew in through the window. The bird saw Amy and said, "I can help you put the sticker on the ceiling." The bird took the sticker from Amy and put it on the ceiling for her. Amy was so happy and thanked the little bird.
The moral of the story is that sometimes, when you need help, it can come from unexpected places.

One day, a boy named Tim found a basketball. It was big and round. The basketball was not soft, it was harsh. Tim liked to play with it.
Tim went to the park with the basketball. He saw a girl named Sue. Sue was staring at the basketball. She wanted to play too. Tim and Sue played together.
They threw the basketball to each other. They had lots of fun. The sun was shining, and they were happy. Tim and Sue became good friends.

John was curious about what was at the gym. He wanted to find out so he asked Mom to take him there. Mom said yes and off they went.
At the gym, John saw lots of big kids playing. He wanted to join them, but he was too small. He decided to sit in the corner and watch.
John soon noticed the kids weren't playing nicely. They were pushing each other and it made John sad. He wanted to help them stop fighting but he didn't know how.
Then John had an idea. He walked up to the kids and told them to stop. Surprisingly, they did! They even asked John to play with them. He smiled and said yes.
John and his new friends had lots of fun. John knew he did the right thing, and he was proud of himself. They all sat together and talked about their games until it was time to go home.

One day, a little girl came to her mommy and asked her, "What is a dictionary?" Her mommy smiled and said, "A dictionary is a very nice book with a lot of words. Would you like to see it?" The little girl was so excited, she nodded her head quickly.
So her mommy went and took a big, beautiful book off of the shelf. The little girl saw that it had a lot of pages, but it was filled with words she could not understand. She could not read it, but she thought it was really nice. 
The mommy carefully explained to the little girl how a dictionary was a good tool to use when you needed help discovering a certain word or understanding its meaning. The little girl enjoyed looking at all the pretty pictures in the book. 
The mommy warned her that although the dictionary was nice, it would not always have all the answers. The little girl thought that was a very strange thing, but she was happy just to have the dictionary there. 
When the little girl grew up, she didn't need the dictionary as much as when she was three, but the dictionary was still nice to have around. Now, if the little girl ever needed help understanding a word, she knew exactly where to come look for answers.

Once upon a time, there was a curious cat named Kitty. Kitty loved to explore and learn new things. One day, she heard her owner talking about a place called "university." She wanted to know what it was, so she asked her friend, Doggy.
"Doggy, what is university?" Kitty asked. Doggy thought for a moment and said, "It's a place where people go to learn and grow. They load their brains with lots of new things."
Kitty was excited to learn more. She asked her owner if she could go to university too. Her owner laughed and said, "Kitty, you are a cat. Cats don't go to university. But you can learn new things by watching and listening."
So, Kitty watched and listened to her owner every day. She saw her owner read books, talk to friends, and do many interesting things. Kitty learned a lot, even though she didn't go to university.
The moral of the story is that you don't have to go to a special place to learn. You can learn new things every day by watching and listening to the world around you.

Once upon a time, there were two friends, Jack and Jill. One day, they decided to play a somersault race. 
Jack rolled and rolled, faster and faster. But Jill was too slow. She got angry.
Jack saw her angry face and laughed. Jill's face turned red. "Don't laugh!" she shouted. 
Jack had an idea. He grabbed a plastic bottle and sprayed it at Jill.
 
Jill was shocked. "That's not nice!" she said. She ran away and shouted, "I'm never playing with you again!" 
Jack felt sorry. He chased after Jill and said, "I'm sorry. Can we still be friends?" 
Jill hesitated, but then she smiled. She said, "Okay." And they were friends again.

Once upon a time there was a wealthy clown called Toto. Everywhere he went people would smile and clap as he did funny tricks. One day, Toto had a special idea. He wanted to take some of his wealth and talk to the poor children of the village. 
So Toto put on his best clown face and set out to talk to the kids. But the children were very sad and Toto wasn't sure how to make them feel better. So he asked them, "Why do you look so sad?". 
One of the children straight away said, "My family is very poor, so there is never enough food for us all to share". Toto felt very sad for the children and discussed with them a plan. "Let us share", he said. "Everyone deserves a share of what we have".
The children smiled and thanked Toto for his generosity. This made Toto very happy and he was glad to have helped those in need.
The moral of this story is that we should think of others and share what we have with those in need. Everyone deserves a share and it is important to be kind and generous.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lilly. Lilly had a great present to give. She wanted to call someone to come over to receive the present.
So Lilly called her best friend, Ben. She shouted "Ben! Can you come over please?"
Ben heard Lilly's call and quickly ran to her doorstep.
When he arrived, Lilly was so happy and showed him the present. "Wow! This looks great! What is it?" asked Ben excitedly.
"It's a surprise! Open it and find out," said Lilly, giggling.
Ben opened the present and a big smile appeared on his face. It was a big toy car that was bright blue and shiny.
"Thank you so much, Lilly!" Ben said with joy. "This is a great present!" 
The two friends played with the car all day, having a great time.

Once upon a time, there was a gentle cat named Fluffy. Fluffy lived in a big house with a nice family. One day, Fluffy saw a little bird sitting on a seat near the window. The bird looked sad.
Fluffy went to the bird and asked, "Why are you sad, little bird?" The bird replied, "I want to go outside, but I'm scared. I've never been on the other side of the window."
Fluffy thought for a moment and said, "I'll help you, little bird. We can go outside together, and I'll stay by your side." The bird felt better, so they went outside.
They played together in the sun, and the bird learned that it was fun to explore new things. The bird thanked Fluffy for helping and staying by its side. The moral of the story is that it's always good to help others and be there for them when they're scared.

Tom and Sue are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they find a big tent in the park. It is green and yellow. They want to go inside.
"Can we go in the tent?" Tom asks Sue.
"I don't know. Maybe it is someone's home. Maybe they will be mad," Sue says.
Tom is not afraid. He is smart. He has an idea.
"Let's hop to the tent. Hop, hop, hop. Then we can peek inside. Maybe we will see something fun," Tom says.
Sue likes Tom's idea. She is smart too. She hops with Tom to the tent. Hop, hop, hop. They reach the tent. They peek inside.
They see a lot of toys. There are cars, dolls, books, and balls. They also see a man and a woman. They are smiling. They are not mad.
"Hello, kids. Do you want to play with us?" the man says.
"Yes, please. We like toys. We like tents. We like you," Tom and Sue say.
The man and the woman are happy. They are the owners of the tent. They are camping in the park. They invite Tom and Sue to join them. They play together. They have fun. They are friends.

Tom and his mom went to the city for a fun day. The city was busy with many cars, people, and noises. Tom liked to see the big buildings, the parks, and the shops. He held his mom's hand and followed her.
But then, Tom saw a big red balloon in a store window. He loved balloons and wanted to have one. He let go of his mom's hand and ran to the store. He did not look where he was going. He did not hear his mom calling him.
Tom reached the store and grabbed the balloon. He was happy for a moment. But then, he looked around and could not see his mom. He felt scared and alone. He did not know where he was. He started to cry and panic.
"Mommy, mommy, where are you?" he shouted.
A kind lady saw Tom and heard his cries. She came to him and asked him what was wrong. Tom told her he lost his mom. The lady said she would help him find her. She took his hand and looked for his mom.
Soon, they saw his mom looking for him. She was worried and sad. She saw Tom and the lady and ran to them. She hugged Tom and thanked the lady. She was happy to see him again.
"Tom, I'm so glad you're safe. But why did you run away from me?" she asked.
Tom said he was sorry. He said he wanted the balloon. He said he was scared and panicked.
"Tom, you should never run away from me in the city. The city is busy and dangerous. You could get lost or hurt. You should always stay with me and listen to me. Do you understand?" she said.
Tom nodded and said he understood. He said he would never do it again. He gave the balloon back to the lady and said thank you. He held his mom's hand and followed her.
Tom learned a lesson that day. He learned to be careful and obedient in the city. He learned that his mom loved him and wanted him to be safe. He learned that balloons are not worth losing his mom.

One day, Alice and her family went on a trip to the icy country. They wanted to explore the snowy landscape and have lots of fun. 
Alice was very excited. She couldn't wait to get there. When they arrived, Alice said, "Let's go and play in the snow". 
Everyone agreed and so they all went outside to enjoy the cold weather. 
Suddenly, a man ran past them and somebody shouted, "He's trying to steal our country's golden treasure!" 
Alice looked around and noticed that the man was carrying a sack. 
Alice quickly ran after him and shouted, "Stop! That's not yours to take!" 
The man stopped, dropped the sack and ran away. Everyone was relieved and looked inside the sack. There was the country's icy golden treasure! 
Alice and her family returned the treasure to the country's officials. They were very thankful and rewarded Alice with a medal. 
Alice was proud that she had helped save the country's precious icy treasure.

Once upon a time, there was a dark night. The sky had many stars, and the moon was big and bright. In a small house, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy horn that he loved to play with every day.
One day, Tim wanted to fill his horn with something fun. He looked around and saw a big bowl of colorful balls. Tim filled his horn with the balls and went outside to play. He blew the horn, and the balls flew everywhere. Tim laughed and had a great time.
As the dark night went on, Tim played with his horn and the colorful balls. He filled the horn again and again, making the balls fly high into the sky. The balls looked like little stars, and Tim felt so happy. When it was time for bed, Tim took his horn and went inside. He knew he would have many more fun days with his horn.

Once upon a time, there was a big lion who had a fancy freezer. The lion loved to roar and play with his friends in the jungle. The freezer was very special to him because it kept his food cold and fresh.
One day, a sneaky monkey saw the fancy freezer and wanted it for himself. The monkey made a plan to take it when the lion was not looking. The lion was busy playing with his friends and did not see the monkey take his fancy freezer away.
When the lion came back, he saw that his fancy freezer was gone. He was very sad and began to roar loudly. His friends heard him and came to help. They all looked for the fancy freezer and found the sneaky monkey trying to hide it. The lion and his friends took the fancy freezer back, and the monkey said sorry. From that day on, the lion shared his fancy freezer with all his friends, and they all lived happily together in the jungle.

Lily and Mom were at the store. Mom wanted to buy coffee. Lily liked coffee, but she could not drink it. It was too hot and bitter for her.
"Can I have some juice, Mom?" Lily asked.
"Sure, honey. Let's find some juice for you," Mom said.
They walked to the juice aisle. There were many kinds of juice. Lily saw one that was red and shiny. It looked like candy.
"Mom, can I have this one?" Lily pointed to the red juice.
Mom looked at the label. It said "cranberry juice". She knew it was very sour and not sweet.
"No, Lily. You won't like this one. It will make your face change. It will make you pucker and frown," Mom said.
Lily did not understand. She wanted to try the red juice. She thought it would be yummy.
"Please, Mom. Just a little bit," Lily begged.
Mom sighed. She wanted to make Lily happy. She took the red juice and a small cup. She poured a little bit of juice for Lily.
"Here you go. But be careful. It's very sour," Mom warned.
Lily took the cup and drank the juice. She felt a sharp taste in her mouth. It was not yummy at all. It was loud and ouchy. She spit out the juice and made a face.
"Yuck! I don't like it! It's bad!" Lily cried.
Mom smiled and hugged Lily. She gave her a napkin to wipe her mouth.
"I told you, honey. It will make your face change. Do you want some water?" Mom asked.
Lily nodded. She drank some water and felt better. She did not want the red juice anymore.
"Can I have some apple juice, Mom?" Lily asked.
"Of course, honey. Apple juice is sweet and good. Let's get some apple juice for you," Mom said.
They put back the red juice and took the apple juice. Mom paid for the coffee and the juice. They left the store and went to the car.
Lily was happy. She had her apple juice and Mom had her coffee. They both liked their drinks. They did not want to change them.

Once upon a time there was a smart bunny. The bunny loved to spring around and play tag with other animals. One day, the bunny found an old shape on the ground. It was a funny shape and the bunny didn't know what it was. The bunny picked it up and started to spring away with it.
Suddenly, the shape started to sparkle and the bunny knew it must be special. The bunny put it in its pocket and kept running. But then the shape made a loud noise and the bunny got shocked! Quickly, the bunny threw the shape away, but it was too late. The shape had burned the bunny's pocket.
The bunny was so sad. It knew the shape must have been special, but now it was gone. The bunny had been so smart to pick it up, but not smart enough to leave it alone. The bunny never found the shape again and never knew what it had been.

Once upon a time, there was a little red car. The car was very loyal. It always helped its friends.
One day, a big blue truck was stuck in the mud. The little red car wanted to help. It went to the truck and tried to push. But the truck was too big, and the car was too small.
Then, a big green tractor appeared. The tractor was strong. It helped the little red car push the big blue truck out of the mud. The truck was happy, and the car was happy too. The little red car, the big blue truck, and the big green tractor became best friends. They always helped each other, and they were very loyal friends.

Once upon a time, in a big zoo, there was a zebra named Ziggy. Ziggy was excited to see his friend, the lion named Leo. They loved to play ball together.
One day, Ziggy and Leo were playing ball near the fence. Ziggy kicked the ball very hard and it went out of the zoo. They were both sad because they could not get the ball back.
A little boy named Tim saw the ball outside the fence. He picked it up and said, "Is this your ball?" Ziggy and Leo nodded their heads. Tim threw the ball back over the fence. Ziggy and Leo were very happy.
Ziggy said, "Thank you for returning our ball!" Tim smiled and said, "You're welcome! Have fun playing!" Ziggy and Leo were excited to play with their ball again.
From that day on, Ziggy and Leo made sure to play more carefully, so they would not lose their ball again. And every time they saw Tim, they would give him a big happy smile.

Once upon a time, there was a big, dependable dog named Bob. Bob had a small, pink ball that he loved to play with. Every day, Bob would play with his pink ball in the yard. It would remind him of the fun times he had with his friends.
One sunny day, while Bob was playing with his pink ball, it bounced far away into the woods. Bob was scared, but he knew he had to find his ball. So, he went into the woods to look for it. He searched and searched until he found the pink ball near a big tree.
Just as Bob was about to pick up his pink ball, a big bird came down from the tree and took the ball in its beak. Bob barked and tried to get the ball back, but the bird flew away with it. Bob was very sad and went back home without his pink ball. He missed his ball and the fun times he had with it, but he could not get it back.

Once upon a time there was a lazy dog. He hardly ever wanted to do anything, and always just wanted to sleep.
One day he decided to go for a walk. He walked and walked and then saw something strange. It was a tornado! He had never seen one before, so he was curious and he wanted to climb it.
He barked and said, "Hey Tornado, can I climb you?" 
But the tornado didn't answer. Curiously, the lazy dog stepped closer to have a better look. Suddenly the tornado started to spin faster and get bigger. 
The poor dog started to get scared, as he knew he was too close for comfort. He tried to run away, but it was too late. The tornado carried him up really high and he never came back down again.

One day, a little dog named Max went for a walk. He saw a big smelly trash can. Max was curious, so he went closer to look at it. He saw a bandage inside. Max thought it was strange and just gave a little shrug.
Max kept walking and found a park. He saw kids playing and laughing. Max wanted to play too, so he ran to the kids. They were playing with a ball. Max jumped and caught the ball. The kids clapped and laughed. Max was very happy.
After playing, Max went home. He told his mom about the smelly trash can and the bandage he found. His mom said, "Good job, Max." Max felt proud of his day and went to sleep with a big smile on his face.

Once upon a time, there was a big structure in a cold land. It was very cold, so cold that everything would freeze. In this structure, there lived a small bear and a big bear. They were very good friends.
One day, the small bear went outside to play. He saw a helpless bird who could not fly. The bird was very cold and could not move. The small bear wanted to help the bird, so he went to the big bear for help.
The big bear knew what to do. He said, "We must warm the bird so it can fly again." They took the bird inside the structure and made it warm. Soon, the bird was not cold or helpless anymore. The bird could fly and was very happy. The small bear and the big bear were happy too because they helped their new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a loud engine. It was a big, strong engine that could spring fast. It lived in a small town with many other engines. The loud engine had a best friend named Tim. Tim was a little boy who loved to play with the engine.
One day, Tim said to the engine, "Let's go fast! Let's spring away!" The engine liked the idea, so they went to the long road. The loud engine started to spring fast with Tim. They were having a lot of fun. Tim felt happy and the engine felt strong.
But, they did not see the big rock in the road. The loud engine hit the rock and broke. Tim was sad and cried. The engine could not spring anymore. It was the end of their fun days together.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the store with his mom. They wanted to buy a new melon for a snack. Tim saw a big, round melon and said, "Mom, let's get this one!"
His mom looked at the melon and said, "Yes, this melon looks good. Let's take it home." They bought the melon and went back to their house.
At home, Tim's mom cut the melon into small pieces. Tim and his mom ate the melon together. It was sweet and yummy. They were both happy to have the new melon.

Milly loved to take walks. When she went for her walks, she always saw something new and unique. One day, Milly spotted a tall, white wall. She stood still in front of it for a moment, and then Milly started to walk around it. 
Milly asked her mother, "What is this wall?" Her mother replied, "This wall is part of a maze." Milly asked, "What's a maze?" Her mother smiled and said, "It's like a game where you have to find the right path. I think it looks like fun." 
Milly was excited to try out the maze. She entered it but quickly found herself lost and confused. She wish she had asked her mother more questions about the maze before she started playing, but it was too late. No matter how much she tried, Milly couldn't find her way out of the maze and she eventually gave up. Milly found herself feeling very sad and scared. 
The unique maze had brought Milly unhappiness and confusion, instead of the fun and excitement she had been expecting.

Once upon a time, there was a clever cat named Kitty. Kitty loved to play with yarn. One day, she found a big ball of yarn in the corner of her room. She was very happy and started to play with it.
As Kitty played with the yarn, she began to sing a fun song. She sang, "Yarn, yarn, oh so fun! I love to play and run!" Kitty's friend, a little bird named Birdie, heard her singing. Birdie came to the window and asked, "Kitty, what are you singing about?"
Kitty replied, "I am singing about my yarn! I love to play with it. Do you want to play with me?" Birdie said, "Yes, I would love to play with you!" So Kitty and Birdie played with the yarn and sang the fun song together. They had a great time and became the best of friends.

Anna likes to read books. She has many books in her room. She puts them on her bookcase. Her bookcase is black and tall.
One day, Anna wants to get a new book. She goes to the bookshop with her mom. She sees a big book with many pictures. She likes it very much. She asks her mom to buy it for her.
Mom says, "OK, but we have to measure it first. Maybe it is too big for your bookcase." Mom takes a tape and measures the book. It is 40 centimeters long and 30 centimeters wide. Mom says, "This book is very big. It will not fit on your bookcase. You have to choose a smaller book."
Anna is sad. She really wants the big book. She thinks for a while. Then she has an idea. She says, "Mom, can we buy a new bookcase? A bigger one? Then I can put the big book on it. And I can have more space for my other books too."
Mom smiles. She says, "That is a good idea, Anna. But we have to measure the space in your room first. Maybe there is no room for a bigger bookcase. Let's go home and see." Mom and Anna take the big book and the tape and go home. They measure the space in Anna's room. They find a place where a bigger bookcase can fit. Mom says, "You are lucky, Anna. There is enough space for a bigger bookcase. We can go to the furniture shop and buy one. But you have to help me carry it and assemble it."
Anna is happy. She says, "Thank you, Mom. I will help you. And I will read the big book to you when we finish." Mom and Anna hug and go to the furniture shop. They buy a new bookcase. It is white and wide. They carry it and assemble it in Anna's room. They put the big book and the other books on it. It looks very nice. Anna and Mom sit on the bed and read the big book together. They have a lot of fun.

Once upon a time, a helpful girl named Lucy lived in a small house. She loved to help her mom and dad with chores. One day, her mom and dad said they were going on a vacation. Lucy was very happy.
On the vacation, they went to a big beach. Lucy saw a little boy crying. She asked, "Why are you sad?" The boy said, "I lost my toy in the sand." Lucy wanted to help him find it.
Lucy started to dig in the sand. She believed she could find the toy. After a while, she found the toy and gave it to the boy. The boy smiled and said, "Thank you, Lucy!" They played together and had fun on their vacation.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a girl named Amy. Amy liked to write on her velvet book. She wrote about her day and her friends. Amy was very brave.
One day, Amy saw a big dog near her house. The dog looked sad and lost. Amy wanted to help the dog. She thought she was brave enough to go near the dog. She did not tell her mom or dad.
Amy went close to the dog. The dog was scared and bit Amy's hand. Amy cried and ran back home. Her mom and dad took her to the doctor. The doctor said Amy would be okay, but she should not go near dogs she did not know.
The moral of the story is to always tell your mom and dad what you are doing. Being brave is good, but being safe is more important.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she went to the doctor with her mom. Lily was scared, but her mom said it was safe. They were going to take an x-ray of her arm. Lily did not know what an x-ray was, but she was brave.
