The doctor took Lily to a big room. There was a big machine there. The doctor said, "This is the x-ray machine. It will help us see your bones." Lily thought it was like magic. She started to wonder how it worked. 
The x-ray was quick and easy. Lily saw a picture of her bones on a screen. She was happy and not scared anymore. She knew that going to the doctor was safe. Lily and her mom went home, and she told her friends about the x-ray and how she wondered about the big machine.

Tommy likes to rise early and go to the park with his dad. They play catch, slide, and swing. Tommy feels happy and warm in the sun. He likes to hear the birds sing and the dogs bark.
One day, it is cool and cloudy. Tommy and his dad stay at home. They read books, draw pictures, and bake cookies. Tommy feels cozy and safe in the house. He likes to smell the cookies and hear his dad laugh.
Tommy remembers another cool day, when his mom was still with them. They went to the park and had a picnic. They ate sandwiches, fruit, and cake. They hugged and kissed. Tommy feels sad and misses his mom.
He tells his dad about his memory. His dad hugs him and says he misses her too. He says they will always love her and keep her in their hearts. He says they can still have fun and be happy together. He says they can go to the park again when it is sunny.
Tommy feels better and smiles. He loves his dad and knows his dad loves him. He says they are a good team. He says he is ready to eat some cookies. They go to the kitchen and enjoy their treat.

Lily did not like haircuts. They made her sit still and feel cold. She liked her long hair. It was soft and shiny. She did not want to cut it.
But Mommy said she had to. Mommy said her hair was too long and messy. Mommy said it was time for a haircut. Mommy took her to the salon. Lily saw the scissors and the comb. She felt scared.
"No haircut! No haircut!" Lily cried. She kicked and screamed. She tried to run away. But Mommy held her hand. Mommy said it would be quick and easy. Mommy said she would look pretty.
The lady with the scissors smiled. She said hello to Lily. She said she would be gentle. She said she had a surprise for Lily. She put a cape around Lily's neck. She picked up the scissors.
Lily did not like surprises. She did not like the cape. She did not like the scissors. She closed her eyes. She opened her mouth. She roared like a lion.
"ROAR! ROAR! ROAR!" Lily roared. She hoped the lady would go away. She hoped Mommy would change her mind. She hoped the haircut would stop.
But the lady did not go away. She did not mind the roar. She laughed and said, "What a brave lion you are! Do you want to see your surprise?"
She turned Lily around. She showed her a mirror. Lily opened her eyes. She saw her face. She saw her hair. It was short and curly. It had a ribbon on it. It looked like a lion's mane.
Lily stopped roaring. She looked at the mirror. She looked at the lady. She looked at Mommy. She felt confused. She felt curious. She felt different.
"Do you like your haircut?" the lady asked. "Do you like your surprise?"
Lily touched her hair. She felt the ribbon. She felt the curls. She smiled. She nodded. She liked her haircut. She liked her surprise.
She said, "Thank you, lady. Thank you, Mommy. I like my haircut. I am a lion. Roar!"
The lady and Mommy clapped. They said, "You're welcome, Lily. You're a beautiful lion. Roar!"
Lily roared again. She was happy. She was proud. She was a lion.

Once upon a time, there was a pretty lake. Many animals lived near the lake. One day, a little frog saw something in the water. He wanted to store it in his home.
The frog jumped into the lake to get it. But it was not a toy. It was a big fish! The big fish said, "Hello, little frog. Do you want to play with me?"
The little frog was scared at first. But then he said, "Yes, let's play!" They played all day in the pretty lake. The little frog and the big fish became best friends. They stored many fun memories in their hearts.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He lived in a small house near a big land. Tim loved to play outside with his friends. They liked to run, jump, and laugh all day long. Tim thought the land was amazing because it was so big and fun to play on.
One day, Tim's friend, Sara, came to play. Sara did not have a ball. Tim wanted to help Sara, so he decided to lend her his ball. Sara was very happy and said, "Thank you, Tim!" They played with the ball on the amazing land all day long.
As the sun began to set, Tim and Sara were tired but happy. They had a great day playing on the amazing land with the ball Tim lent to Sara. They said goodbye and went home. Tim knew that lending his ball to Sara made their day even more fun.

One day, a boy named Tim had a light vest. He loved his vest very much. It was his favorite thing to wear. Tim would wear his vest all the time, even when it was hot outside.
One day, Tim and his friends went to play at the park. They played on the swings, the slide, and the see-saw. Tim was having so much fun with his friends. But then, Tim's vest got stuck on the slide. It started to part.
Tim was sad because his vest was broken. He didn't want to play anymore. His mom saw him and came to help. She took the vest and said, "Don't worry, Tim. I can fix it."
Tim's mom fixed his light vest. She made it good as new. Tim was very happy. He put on his vest and went back to play with his friends. They had a great day at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a big red door. The door had a lock. A little girl named Amy wanted to unlock the door. She had a key, but she felt guilty. She knew she should not open the door.
Behind the door, Amy saw a cobweb. It was big and old. She was scared, but she wanted to see what was behind the door. So, she took a deep breath and unlocked the door. She pushed it open.
Amy thought she would find something scary. But, surprise! Behind the door, there was a room full of toys! Amy was so happy. She played with the toys all day long. The guilty feeling went away. The cobweb was just a twist in her fun story.

Tom and Lily are friends. They like to play in the park. They like to swing on the swings. They swing high and low. They feel happy.
One day, they see a big tree in the park. The tree has many fruits. The fruits are purple and wrinkly. Tom and Lily are curious. They want to try the fruits.
They ask a lady who is sitting on a bench. The lady is nice. She tells them the fruits are prunes. She says prunes are good for you. She gives them each a prune.
Tom and Lily say thank you. They bite the prunes. They make a face. The prunes are sour and dry. They do not like the prunes. They spit them out.
They run back to the swings. They swing again. They forget about the prunes. They think swinging is more important. They laugh and have fun.

Once upon a time, in a small, quiet town, there lived a girl named Mia. Mia was a happy girl, but she thought her town was very dull. She wanted to make it more fun for everyone.
One day, Mia had an idea. She would send letters to all her friends, asking them to come and play. Mia wrote the letters, put them in envelopes, and sent them to her friends.
Soon, Mia's friends came to the quiet town. They played games, sang songs, and had a lot of fun. The town was not dull anymore. Everyone was happy, and Mia was glad that she sent the letters.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big box of files. Every day, she would wake up and look at her files. Lily thought they were incredible.
One day, Lily woke up and her files were gone! She looked everywhere but could not find them. Her mom came in and said, "What is wrong, Lily?" Lily said, "My incredible files are gone!"
Then, Lily's little brother, Tim, came in with a big smile. He said, "I have a surprise for you, Lily!" He showed her a big, beautiful picture made from her files. Lily was so happy! The picture was more incredible than her files. They all laughed and played together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Claire. Claire was so pretty, with her long blonde hair and her bright blue eyes. She was always smiling, and she loved to give hugs.
One day, Claire was out playing in the park. She was having so much fun playing with the other children that she forgot that it was almost time to go home. 
Claire's mom came to the park to pick her up. She looked around, but couldn't find Claire. Finally, she saw her swinging on the swing set and gave her a big hug. 
Claire was so happy to see her mom, and she hugged her back. She was so glad that her mom didn't forget her. 
Claire was so excited that she gave her mom one last hug before she went home. They smiled at each other, and Claire's mom said, "I could never forget my pretty little girl!"

One day, a big orange cat named Tom lay on the grass. He saw a little bird with a hurt leg. The bird could not fly. Tom wanted to help the bird, but he did not know how.
"Little bird, can I help you?" Tom asked. The little bird said, "Yes, please. My leg hurts, and I can't fly home." Tom thought about how he could help the bird. He had an idea!
Tom told the bird to hop on his back. The bird hopped on, and Tom walked very carefully. They went to the bird's home in a big tree. The bird thanked Tom for his help. They became good friends, and Tom learned how good it felt to help others.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a big part. Many people came to have fun. They talked, laughed, and ate yummy food. There was a little boy named Tim who wanted to play with the toys, but they were not available.
Tim looked around and saw an ashtray. He did not know what it was, but it looked fun. He picked it up and started to play with it. But then, his mommy saw him and said, "No, Tim! That is not a toy. It is dirty and not good for you."
Tim felt sad and wanted a toy to play with. He asked his mommy, "Can I have a toy, please?" His mommy thought and had an idea. She took Tim to the store, and he picked out a new toy. Tim was happy and played with his new toy all day long. The part went on, and everyone had a good time.

Once upon a time, there was a compassionate girl named Lily. She loved to read books and play with her toys. One day, her mom and dad told her they were going on a holiday. Lily was very happy and excited.
On the holiday, Lily brought her favorite book to read. She sat under a big tree and started to read. The sun was shining, and the birds were singing. Lily felt very happy and enjoyed her book.
But then, a big wind came and blew her book away. Lily tried to catch it, but it flew too far. She was very sad and cried. Her holiday was not fun anymore, and she missed her favorite book.

Once upon a time, there was a smart dog named Spot. Spot loved to go for a walk every day. He would wag his tail and bark when he was happy.
One day, Spot heard his friend, a little bird, mention a big park. Spot liked big parks. He thought it would be fun to go for a walk there. So, Spot and the bird went to the big park together.
At the big park, Spot and the bird had a great time. They played with a ball, ran around, and laughed. After their walk, they were both very tired. They went home and took a long nap, dreaming of the fun they had at the big park.

Lily liked to display her drawings on the wall. She used tape and glue and stickers to make them stick. She was proud of her art and wanted everyone to see it.
One day, her parent came home from work and saw the wall. She was angry and said, "Lily, what have you done? You have ruined the wall with your careless mess. You have to take them off right now and say sorry."
Lily felt sad and scared. She did not think her drawings were a mess. She thought they were beautiful and fun. She said, "But parent, I like my drawings. They make me happy. Why are you mad at me?"
Her parent sighed and said, "Lily, I know you like your drawings, but you can't put them on the wall like that. It is not good for the wall and it is hard to clean. You can display your drawings on the fridge or in your room, but not on the wall. Do you understand?"
Lily nodded and said, "I understand, parent. I'm sorry for being careless. I will take them off and put them somewhere else. Can you help me?"
Her parent smiled and said, "Of course, Lily. I will help you. And I'm sorry for being mad at you. I love you and your drawings, but we have to be careful with the wall. OK?"
Lily hugged her parent and said, "OK, parent. I love you too. Thank you for helping me."

One day, a little girl named Mia went to the park with her mom. Mia saw a pond with many fish. "Look, Mom! Fish!" she said. Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, Mia, there are lots of fish here."
Mia wanted to catch a fish, but her mom told her, "We don't have a net available, dear." Mia was sad. But then, a nice boy named Tim came over. He had a net. "Do you want to catch fish with me?" he asked. Mia was happy and said, "Yes, please!"
Mia and Tim tried to catch fish together. At first, they didn't catch any. But they didn't give up. They believed they could do it. Soon, they caught a big fish! They were so proud. Mia's mom said, "Good job, both of you! You learned that if you believe in yourself and work together, you can do anything."

Once upon a time, there was a mom and her daughter. They lived in a small house near the woods. The mom was very good at her job. She was successful because she worked hard. The daughter wanted to be just like her mom when she grew up.
One sunny day, the mom and her daughter went for a walk. They went into the woods to gather sticks and leaves. The daughter liked to help her mom. They found many sticks and leaves on the ground. They picked them up and put them in a big bag.
When they were done, they went back to their house. The mom and daughter were happy with all the sticks and leaves they had gathered. They used them to make a beautiful picture on the wall. The daughter knew that she could be successful like her mom if she worked hard and helped others.

Tim and Mia were very excited. They were going to fly in an aeroplane for the first time. They packed their bags and hugged their toys. They said goodbye to their dog and their cat.
They drove to the big place where the aeroplanes were. They saw many aeroplanes in the sky. They heard the loud noise they made. They showed their tickets to the nice lady. She gave them stickers and told them to follow the signs.
They walked to the gate where their aeroplane was waiting. They saw a big blue aeroplane with a red tail. It had a number on it. It was their aeroplane. They boarded the aeroplane and found their seats. They buckled their belts and listened to the man who told them what to do.
The aeroplane started to move. It went faster and faster. It lifted off the ground. Tim and Mia looked out the window. They saw the clouds and the sun. They saw the houses and the cars get smaller and smaller. They felt the aeroplane go up and down.
"Look, Mia, a rainbow!" Tim said. He pointed to the colourful arc in the sky.
"Wow, Tim, it's so pretty!" Mia said. She smiled and clapped her hands.
The man on the speaker said they were flying over a rare place. It was a place where the rainbows were always there. He said they were lucky to see it. He said they should remain in their seats and enjoy the view.
Tim and Mia remained in their seats. They enjoyed the view. They were happy. They were flying in an aeroplane.

Once upon a time, there was a prince. He was very popular, and lots of people liked him. He was kind, and everyone wanted to be his friend.
One day, there was a big party. The prince was invited and excited to go. Many people were there and it was very fun.
At the party, the prince met lots of new friends. They did all sorts of fun activities. These included fishing in the lake and running around in the garden. The prince really enjoyed the party and had lots of fun.
At the end, the prince said goodbye to his new friends and thanked them for coming. Everyone waved goodbye and the prince went home. Everyone talked about how much fun it was and how popular the prince was.

One day, Maria was playing in her garden and she saw a wild nut. She wanted to win it so she grabbed it. When Maria's brother saw the wild nut, he said, "That nut is mine. Give it back!"
Maria smiled and said, "No, let's have a race. If I win, I get to keep the nut!"
Her brother agreed and they began to run around the garden. Maria ran so fast that she won the race!
Her brother was a very good loser and he said, "You won! You can keep the nut."
Maria smiled, thanked her brother and ate the wild nut. It tasted so delicious!

Once upon a time, there was a lonely toy car. The car had a battery inside to make it go. But it had no friends to play with. The car felt very sad.
One day, a little boy found the car. The boy called out, "Car, do you want to play with me?" The car was so happy. It used its battery to go fast and play with the boy.
The car was not lonely anymore. It had a friend who called it every day to play. The car and the boy had lots of fun together. And they lived happily ever after.

One day, a little girl named Mia went to visit her aunt. Her aunt lived in a big house with a pretty garden. Mia liked to play in the garden with her toys.
Mia saw an unknown cat in the garden. The cat was very quiet and sneaky. Mia watched the cat as it walked around the garden. Then, the cat did something bad. It tried to steal Mia's toy!
Mia ran to her aunt and told her about the cat. Her aunt smiled and said, "That cat is not unknown, Mia. It is our new pet! I got it for you as a surprise!" Mia was so happy and played with the cat all day. The cat did not try to steal any more toys, and they became best friends.

Joe and his parents went to the park. Joe saw a camera and asked his parents if he could have it. His parents refused because Joe was too young. Joe was upset but he tried to be independent. He went to the park by himself to see the camera again. Joe asked the park keeper if he could have the camera, but the park keeper refused too. Joe was angry and sad but he tried to be brave. He thanked the park keeper and walked away. He knew he could not have the camera, but Joe was very proud of being independent.

Once upon a time, in a big green field, there was a tiny seed. This seed wanted to grow into a big, strong vine. One day, a kind girl named Lucy found the seed. She said, "I will help you grow, little seed."
Lucy took the seed home and planted it in her garden. She gave it water and lots of sun. Soon, the seed started to grow. It grew into a small vine. The vine was so happy! "Thank you, Lucy!" the vine said. "Now I can spread and become big and strong."
The sky was clear and the sun was shining. The vine grew and grew. It spread all over the garden. One day, the vine saw a big tree. It wanted to reach the top. The vine knew that if it could touch the sky, it would be the biggest and strongest vine ever.
The vine worked very hard to climb the tree. It spread up and up. Finally, the vine reached the top of the tree. It was so happy! "I did it!" the vine said. "I am the biggest and strongest vine!"
Lucy was so proud of her vine. She knew that with love and care, even the tiniest seed could become something amazing.

One day, a little boy named Tim was feeling adventurous. He wanted to find the biggest cookie in the world. He put on his hat and went outside to look for it. He walked and walked until he saw his friend, Sally.
Tim asked Sally, "Do you know where the biggest cookie is?" Sally said, "No, but let's look for it together!" They both started to look for the cookie. They looked behind trees and under rocks, but they could not find it.
Then, they saw a big box. They opened the box and found a big cookie inside! They were so happy! But suddenly, the cookie started to talk! It said, "Please don't eat me! I am a magic cookie and I can make your wishes come true!" Tim and Sally were surprised, but they decided to keep the cookie as a friend instead of eating it. They all played together and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little duck named Ducky. Ducky was very intelligent. He loved to play in the rain. One day, the rain came down and Ducky was very excited.
Ducky went outside to play in the rain. He saw a little worm on the ground. The worm was scared of the rain. Ducky wanted to help the worm. So, he picked up the worm and put it in a safe place.
Then, something unexpected happened. The worm said "thank you" to Ducky. Ducky was surprised. He learned that even the smallest animals can be kind and talk. The moral of the story is to be kind to everyone, no matter how small they are.

Once upon a time there were two best friends, Sammy and Zack. They were very curious and always wanted to improve. 
One day, Sammy and Zack wanted to play a game and decided to play navy. They used their imagination and built an original navy with rocks, stones, and tree branches. After setting up their navy, Sammy and Zack took turns throwing a ball in their navy.
While playing, Sammy said to Zack "Let's try to improve our navy game!". Zack agreed and they both decided to make their navy game more fun.
To improve their navy game, Sammy and Zack took it to the park. There, with the help of their parents and some other kids, they built an even bigger and better navy by using colourful stones and shells.
When their new and improved navy was ready Zack said to Sammy: "We really improved the navy game!" Sammy smiled and replied:"Yes we did! We used our imagination and worked together to make it better".
The moral of this story is that when two or more people work together they can make something better. So don't forget to use your imagination and work as a team if you want to make something great!

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a mom, a dad, and a little girl named Amy. Amy loved dessert, especially cake. One day, her mom made a big cake for a party. The cake had many colors and looked very yummy.
Amy wanted some cake, but her mom said, "No, not yet. We must separate the cake into pieces for the party." So, Amy waited and watched as her mom cut the cake into small pieces. She wanted to help, but her mom said it was not safe for her to use the big knife.
When the party started, all of Amy's friends came over. They played games, sang songs, and had lots of fun. Finally, it was time for dessert. Amy felt happy and safe as she ate her piece of cake. It was the best cake she had ever tasted.

Once upon a time, there was a helpful girl named Emma. She loved to paint. One sunny day, Emma wanted to paint a big picture. She went outside to find a good place to paint.
Emma saw a stand near her house. She put her paper and paint on the stand. She started to paint a pretty flower. The sun was shining and the birds were singing.
A little boy named Max walked by. He saw Emma painting. Max said, "Hi, can I paint too?" Emma smiled and said, "Yes, you can!" Max was happy. They painted together and made a beautiful picture. They had a fun day painting and playing together.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to play outside. He saw a brilliant red ball near the drain. He wanted to play with it. Tim tried to get the ball, but it was too far. He needed help.
Tim saw his friend Jane and asked, "Can I borrow your long stick?" Jane said, "Yes, you can." Tim took the stick and tried to get the ball out of the drain.
With the stick, Tim reached the ball and pulled it out. He was happy! Tim and Jane played with the ball all day. They had lots of fun and laughed a lot. The brilliant red ball made their day great.

Once upon a time there was a kitty named Sam. Sam was a brave kitty but today he felt a bit nervous. He wanted to watch his favorite cartoon but he felt scared. He was too worried about his friend in the cartoon getting hurt!
So Sam took a deep breath. He called his friend and asked for help. His friend promised to come over so Sam felt a bit better.
When his friend arrived, they both sat on the sofa to watch the cartoon. They laughed and sang along together. Sam forgot to be scared and enjoyed the show. It was so much fun!
When it was over, Sam thanked his friend for coming over. He was so glad his friend helped him be brave. He felt a lot better and couldn't wait for cartoon time again.

Lily and Ben were playing in the backyard. They liked to pretend they were explorers, looking for treasure and adventure. They had a big cardboard box that they used as their boat. They put some pillows and blankets inside to make it cozy.
One day, they heard a strange noise coming from the roof of their house. It sounded like a scratch, scratch, scratch. They looked up and saw a shadow moving behind the chimney. What could it be? They wondered.
"Maybe it's a dragon!" Ben said. He liked dragons. He had a toy dragon that he always carried with him.
"Or maybe it's a ghost!" Lily said. She liked ghosts. She had a book of ghost stories that she liked to read at night.
They decided to investigate. They got out of their box and tiptoed to the house. They found a ladder leaning against the wall. They climbed up the ladder, very carefully. They reached the roof and looked around.
There, on the other side of the chimney, they saw a big, fluffy, gray cat. It was the cat that lived next door. It had climbed up the roof to find a sunny spot to nap. It opened its eyes and saw Lily and Ben. It meowed at them.
"Hello, cat!" Lily said. She liked cats. She had a cat sticker on her shirt.
"Can we pet you?" Ben said. He liked cats too. He had a cat hat that he wore sometimes.
The cat nodded and stretched. It walked over to Lily and Ben and rubbed its head against their hands. They petted the cat and smiled. They had found a new friend.
They decided to name the cat Roofy, because they had met it on the roof. They brought it some milk and cookies from the kitchen. They played with it until it was time to go inside. They said goodbye to Roofy and promised to visit it again.
They went back to their box and told their toys about their adventure. They agreed that it was the best day ever. They had solved the mystery of the roof.

One day, a little dog named Max found an envelope. Max liked to chew things, so he started to chew the envelope. Max's friend, a big cat named Luna, saw Max and came over to see what he was doing.
Luna told Max, "Don't chew the envelope! There might be something inside." Max was a bit tired, but he stopped chewing. Luna helped Max open the envelope. They found a note and a small toy inside.
The note said, "Dear Max and Luna, you are good friends. Here is a toy for you to share." Max and Luna were so happy. They played with the toy all day. They were glad they did not chew the envelope, and they learned that sometimes it's better to open things and see what's inside.

Once there was a little girl named Milly. Milly loved to play with water. One day, Milly noticed a faucet in the kitchen. She wanted to have some fun. So Milly turned the faucet slowly and started playing with the water.
Milly's mom saw what was happening and said, "Milly, stop playing with the faucet! You can get hurt!" 
But Milly didn't listen. She kept playing. So her mom got louder. She said, "Milly, stop! Now!" 
Milly was startled and stopped. Then she slowly stepped away from the faucet. 
Milly's mom said, "You need to be careful around the faucet. It's not a toy. If you want to play with water, I'll help you find a safe way to do that. Okay?" 
Milly nodded. She knew she had to be careful around the faucet.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Sara went to the theater with her mom. The theater was a big room where people watched interesting shows. Sara was very excited to see the show.
Before the show started, Sara's mom said, "Sara, let's relax in our seats and wait for the show to start." They sat down in their big, soft chairs and waited for the show to begin.
The show was about a funny cat and a silly dog who became best friends. They played and laughed together. Sara and her mom laughed too. After the show, Sara said, "Mom, that was so much fun! I want to come back to the theater again!" Her mom smiled and said, "We will, Sara. We will."

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a little girl named Lily and her aunt. Lily liked to play with her toys all day. Her aunt was fine and kind. She loved to take care of Lily.
One sunny day, Lily and her aunt went to the park. They saw a big tree. Lily pointed at the tree and said, "Look, aunt! A big tree!" Her aunt smiled and said, "Yes, it's a very big tree indeed."
They played near the tree for a long time. They had lots of fun. Lily's aunt was happy to see Lily laugh and play. When the sun went down, they went back to their small house. They had a fine day at the park.

One day, Tim found a big book. It was a dictionary. The cover was torn and some pages were missing. Tim wanted to repair the dictionary so he could read it.
Tim asked his mom for help. She got tape and glue. They fixed the cover and put the pages back in. The dictionary looked good as new.
After they repaired the dictionary, Tim and his mom made cookies. The cookies were delicious. They ate them while reading the dictionary together. They had a fun day.

Once upon a time, there was a hen. The hen had an egg. The egg was deep in the nest. The hen was happy.
One day, a boy came. The boy asked, "Can I see the egg?" The hen said, "I permit you to see, but be careful." The boy looked at the egg. The boy was happy too.
The egg grew big. One day, it cracked. A baby chick came out. The hen, the boy, and the baby chick were all very happy. They played together and had fun.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. Tim saw a big rock and tried to jump on it. But he did not see a small stick in front of the rock. Tim stumbled on the stick and fell down. His mom came to help him up. Tim was sad because he got a little hurt.
"Let's go watch a movie at home to make you feel better," said Tim's mom. Tim liked that idea, so they went home to watch a movie. They chose a fun movie about animals who could talk. Tim's mom made popcorn for them to eat while they watched.
In the movie, there was a deaf dog named Spot. Spot could not hear, but he could still play and have fun with his friends. The other animals helped Spot by using their paws to show what they were saying. Tim liked the movie and felt happy again. He learned that even if someone is different, they can still be a good friend.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Tim had a toy. The toy was a fake snake. Tim liked to play with the snake and scare his friends. One day, Tim played a trick on his sister, Ann. He put the fake snake in her bed. Ann saw the snake and was very scared. Tim laughed and laughed.
Tim's mom saw what happened. She was not happy. She told Tim to remove the snake from Ann's bed. Tim did not listen. He thought it was funny. Later, Tim felt a pain in his foot. He stepped on a sharp rock. He cried and cried.
Tim's mom came to help. She saw the pain in his foot. She told him, "This is what happens when you don't listen." Tim's mom removed the rock from his foot. But the pain was still there. Tim's foot hurt for many days. He could not play with his friends. He was very sad.

One sunny day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They walked and played. Tim gazed at the big trees and the pretty flowers. He was very happy. After playing, Tim's mom said they could get some ice-cream.
Tim was excited! He loved sweet ice-cream. They went to the ice-cream shop and Tim picked his favorite, chocolate. He could not wait to eat it. But then, something unexpected happened.
A little dog came running by and took Tim's ice-cream! Tim was sad, but then the dog did a funny dance. Tim laughed and felt better. His mom got him a new ice-cream and they all enjoyed the sunny day at the park.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. Tim saw a big, red ball. He wanted to catch the ball. So, he ran and ran, and at last, he caught the ball. Tim was very happy.
Then, Tim saw an unusual bug. The bug was green and had a long, thin body. Tim wanted to show the bug to his mom. So, he picked up a pin from the ground and gently poked the bug. The bug moved very slowly.
Tim called his mom to see the unusual bug. His mom looked at the bug and said, "Wow, that is a very special bug!" Tim felt proud that he found the unusual bug. After that, they played with the red ball and had a fun day at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a big ocean. It was a brilliant blue color. Many fish lived in the ocean. One day, a little fish named Fin wanted to gather some sea shells.
Fin asked his friend, Star, "Do you want to help me gather sea shells?" Star said, "Yes! Let's go!" So, Fin and Star swam around the ocean, looking for pretty sea shells.
As they swam, they saw many other ocean friends. They saw a big whale, a funny crab, and a fast dolphin. They all said hello to Fin and Star. At last, Fin and Star found many sea shells. They were very happy and had a great day in the brilliant ocean.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved fruit. She ate fruit every day. Her favorite fruit was apples. One day, she went to get an apple, but there were no more apples in the house. Lily was upset.
Lily decided to go to the store with her mom to buy more apples. On the way, they saw a big tree with fruit on it. They went to the tree and saw it was not apples, but bananas. Lily had never tried bananas before. She was so excited to try something new.
Lily took a banana from the tree and ate it. She loved it so much that she quit eating apples. Now, Lily's favorite fruit was bananas. She was happy that something unexpected happened, because it helped her find her new favorite fruit.

One day, a big dog and a small cat went to a hotel. They were very tired from playing all day. They wanted to sleep in the hotel. But there was only one room left. The dog and the cat began to quarrel.
The dog said, "I am big, so I need the room more." The cat said, "No, I am small and need to sleep too." They could not agree on who should get the room. They were not being polite to each other.
Just then, a nice mouse came by. The mouse said, "Why don't you both share the room? You can both sleep and be happy." The dog and the cat were surprised. They never thought of sharing the room. They said sorry to each other and decided to share the room. They all became good friends and slept well in the hotel.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a belt in his room. The belt was not fun. It was boring. Tim wanted to make the belt more fun. He had an idea.
Tim went to his mom and said, "Mom, can I put a ring on my belt?" His mom smiled and said, "Yes, Tim. Let's do it together." They put a big, shiny ring on the belt. Tim was very happy.
Now, when Tim walked, the ring on his belt made a fun sound. It went "ring, ring, ring." He showed his friends his new belt with the ring. They all liked it too. Tim's boring belt was now fun and he loved it.

One day, a dog named Spot was very upset. His toy was lost, and he could not find it anywhere. Spot looked under the bed, behind the chair, and in the closet. He was sad and did not know what to do.
Spot's owner, Mom, had a big bottle of wine on the table. She put a pretty cover on it to keep it safe. She went to the store and told Spot to stay and not touch the wine.
While Mom was gone, Spot saw his toy under the table. It was near the wine with the cover. Spot was so happy, he wagged his tail and jumped. His tail hit the wine, and it fell on the floor. The cover kept the wine safe, and it did not break.
When Mom came back, she saw what happened. She was happy that the cover saved the wine. Spot was happy too, because he found his toy. From that day on, Spot was more careful around the table, and Mom always used the cover to keep the wine safe.

Once upon a time, there was a lively little dog named Spot. Spot loved to play with his ball in the park. One day, Spot saw a big piece of steel near his ball. He wanted to play, but the steel was in the way.
Spot tried to move the steel, but it was too heavy. He did not want to quit. So, he asked his friend, a big strong horse named Max, to help him. Max came and pushed the steel with all his might.
Together, Spot and Max moved the steel out of the way. Now, Spot could play with his ball again. He was so happy that he didn't quit. Spot and Max played in the park all day, and they were the best of friends.

Lily and Tom are friends. They like to play with dolls and cars. One day, Lily has a new doll. It is pink and shiny. It can talk and sing. Lily loves her new doll.
Tom sees Lily's new doll. He wants to play with it too. He is jealous of Lily. He says, "Can I use your doll, Lily? It looks fun."
Lily says, "No, Tom. This is my doll. You have your own toys. Go away."
Tom is angry. He thinks of a plan. He waits until Lily is not looking. He grabs her doll and runs away. He hides behind a tree. He thinks he is smart.
But Lily sees Tom. She knows he took her doll. She is sad and mad. She runs after Tom. She says, "Tom, give me back my doll. That is not nice. That is my secret doll. My grandma gave it to me. She said it is special."
Tom hears Lily. He feels sorry. He knows he did a bad thing. He comes out from behind the tree. He says, "I'm sorry, Lily. I was jealous of your doll. It is very pretty. But I should not have taken it. Here, you can have it back."
Lily takes her doll. She hugs it. She says, "Thank you, Tom. I forgive you. You can play with my doll sometimes. But you have to ask me first. And you have to be gentle."
Tom nods. He says, "OK, Lily. I will ask you first. And I will be gentle. Can we still be friends?"
Lily smiles. She says, "Yes, Tom. We can still be friends. Do you want to play with me and my doll?"
Tom says, "Yes, Lily. I do. Let's play together."
Lily and Tom play with the doll and the cars. They are happy. They are friends.

One day, a big and strong tree named Tim was standing tall in the forest. Tim had many zigzag branches that reached out to the sky. Tim loved to support small birds by letting them sit on his branches. 
One sunny day, a little bird named Bob came to sit on Tim's branch. Bob was rude and said, "This branch is not good enough for me! I want a better one!" Tim was sad but he still wanted to help Bob. So, he gently lowered another branch for the little bird.
Bob hopped onto the new branch and said, "Thank you, Tim!" Tim felt happy that he could support Bob, even though he was rude at first. They became friends and many more birds came to sit on Tim's branches. The forest was full of happy songs and laughter.

Jack was playing in the park one day when he felt something strange. The ground shook and Jack fell over. He looked around and saw that the trees were shaking, too. He saw a light in the sky that was a dull gray.
An older boy called out to Jack. "That was an earthquake," he said. "Oh no," thought Jack, his eyes as big as saucers. He was scared.
Just then, his mom came running over to him. She picked him up and hugged him tight. "It's okay, Jack," she said. "Everything is going to be alright."
Jack looked up at his mom with his big blue eyes. He knew that he was safe now that he had met his mom.

Once upon a time, there was a big lab. In the lab, there were many small animals. One day, a little mouse named Tim found a small box. Tim thought, "This box is very cheap, but I like it."
Tim wanted to see if he could fit in the box. He tried to go in, but his tail was too long. Tim asked his friend, Cat, "Can you help me fit in the box?" Cat said, "Yes, let's try."
Cat pushed Tim into the box gently. Now, Tim fit in the box. He was very happy. Tim and Cat played with the cheap box all day long in the big lab. They had so much fun together.

Once upon a time there was a little girl who was very anxious. She had never worn a dress before and she was very scared. She was about to go to a special event and she needed to wear a dress for it. Her parents had bought her a nice dress but she was worried. 
Her mother came up to her and said, "sweetie, a dress is part of history. Lots of people have worn dresses before, and you can too!" The little girl felt a bit less anxious. Slowly she put on the dress with the help of her mother. 
At first, it felt kind of strange. But the more she wore it, the more she liked it! She looked in the mirror and smiled. The dress was so beautiful and it made her feel strong. She was no longer anxious and she felt ready for the special event. The little girl had made history by wearing a dress and it felt great!

Once upon a time, there was a graceful cat named Lucy. Lucy had a big head and she loved to dance. One day, Lucy met a little bird named Timmy. Timmy also liked to dance.
"Let's dance together!" said Lucy. Timmy agreed and they started to dance. They danced and danced, and they were very happy.
As they danced, a group of animals came to watch. The animals saw how well Lucy and Timmy danced together. They all started to applaud, clapping their hands and paws.
Lucy and Timmy smiled and bowed. They were so happy that their friends liked their dance. From that day on, they danced together every day, and all the animals would come to watch and applaud.

Once upon a time, there was a great zoo. Many animals lived in the zoo. There was a big lion, a tall giraffe, and a funny monkey. The zookeeper, named Tom, took care of all the animals. He loved them very much.
One day, the monkey asked the lion, "Why does Tom keep us here?" The lion said, "He keeps us here to be safe and happy. He wants people to learn about us and love us too."
The animals learned to be kind to each other and to Tom. They knew Tom was keeping them safe. The people who came to the zoo saw the happy animals and learned to be kind to all animals too. The moral of the story is that when we are kind to others, they will be kind to us.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Gabrielle. She loved playing in the park with her friends. One day, Gabrielle came to the park to play and she was very thirsty. She saw a small stand with a man behind it.
Gabrielle asked the man, "Can I please have something to drink?"
The man smiled and said, "I can give you something to drink, but you must be very quiet."
Gabrielle nodded her head yes and the man gave her a drink. She thanked the man and went back to playing.
After a while, Gabrielle noticed that the man was being very serious. She asked him, "Why are you being so serious?"
The man smiled and said, "Sometimes it is important to be quiet. When you are quiet, you can think carefully about the decisions you make and that can help you make the right choices."
Gabrielle nodded her head and said, "Thank you for the drink and the lesson!"
The moral of the story is that it is important to be quiet and think carefully before you do something so that you can make the right choices.

One day, a group of animal friends went to play outside. The sun was hot, so they put on their hats. They saw a big hill and wanted to race down it.
The animals started to run down the hill. They went very fast. The rabbit went "zoom" and was in the lead. The other animals tried to catch up, but the rabbit was too fast for them.
At the bottom of the hill, the animals were tired and hot. They found a shady tree and sat down to rest. They laughed and talked about their fun race. The rabbit was happy to win, but they all had fun going "zoom" down the hill together.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Bow. Bow was a restless dog who loved to run and play all day. He lived in a small house with his best friend, a boy named Tim.
One day, Bow and Tim went to a big party. There were lots of people and other dogs to play with. Bow was very happy. At the party, there was a big cake with a small flame on top. Tim told Bow that the flame was special, and they needed to be careful around it.
Bow wanted to be a good dog, so he did not go near the flame. But, he still had fun playing with the other dogs and running around. At the end of the party, Tim and Bow went home, tired but happy. Bow knew he had been a good dog and stayed away from the flame, and that made Tim proud.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to wander around his house, looking for fun things to do. One sunny day, he saw a tall shelf in the living room. Tim was very alert and curious about what was on the shelf.
Tim wanted to see what was on the shelf, but he knew he was too small to reach it. He thought of asking his mom for help, but she was busy in the kitchen. So, Tim decided to climb the shelf all by himself. As he climbed, he felt excited but also a little scared.
Suddenly, the shelf started to shake and Tim fell down. Luckily, he was not hurt. His mom heard the noise and came to see what happened. She hugged Tim and told him that it was dangerous to climb the shelf alone. Tim learned that it was better to ask for help when he needed it. The moral of the story is to always ask for help when you need it, instead of trying to do something dangerous on your own.

Tim and Jen like to go to the park with Mom. They see many things in the park. They see trees, flowers, birds, and dogs. They also see a vendor. A vendor is a person who sells things. The vendor has a cart with many balloons. The balloons are red, blue, yellow, and green. They are big and round and shiny.
"Mom, can we have a balloon?" Tim asks.
"Me too, me too!" Jen says.
"OK, let's go to the vendor and ask," Mom says.
They walk to the vendor and say hello. The vendor smiles and says, "Hello, little ones. Do you like my balloons?"
"Yes, we do!" Tim and Jen say.
"Which one do you want?" the vendor asks.
Tim points to a blue balloon. Jen points to a yellow balloon.
"Here you go," the vendor says. He gives them the balloons and ties them to their wrists. "That will be two dollars, please."
Mom gives the vendor two dollars and says, "Thank you very much."
"You're welcome. Have a nice day," the vendor says.
Tim and Jen are very happy with their balloons. They say thank you and goodbye to the vendor. They run and play in the park with their balloons. They see a gray cloud in the sky. The cloud looks like a big elephant.
"Look, Mom, a gray elephant!" Tim says.
"Wow, it does look like an elephant," Mom says.
"Can we make a part of the elephant?" Jen asks.
"What do you mean?" Mom asks.
"Can we make a trunk, or an ear, or a tail?" Jen says.
Mom laughs and says, "Sure, why not? Let's use our imagination."
They look at the cloud and pretend to make different parts of the elephant. They have fun and laugh. They love the park and the vendor and the balloons and the gray elephant.

Once upon a time, there was a charming little girl named Lily. She had a big box of buttons. She loved to play with them. One day, she found a big red button in the box. It was very pretty.
Lily showed the button to her friend, Tom. Tom said, "Wow, that's a nice button! What can it do?" Lily did not know. So, they decided to solve the mystery of the big red button.
They pushed the button, and something fun happened. A big, colorful ball came out of the box. They played with the ball all day long. They laughed and had a great time. In the end, they solved the mystery of the big red button.

Once upon a time, there were two friends: a rabbit and a fox. They were playing in the grassy field, enjoying the beauty of the day. 
The fox found a spade and ran to the rabbit holding it in front of him. "What is this?" he asked the rabbit. 
The rabbit looked very smart. She said: "This is a spade. It is a tool which you can dig with it in the ground." 
The fox was very curious. He immediately started to dig, but soon the spade broke.
The rabbit smiled and said: "Did you learn something? Always be careful when you use tools. They are not toys!" 
The fox was very sad, so the rabbit hugged him and said: "Don't worry, it's okay. You can be happy and still be smart." 
The friends had learned a lesson: be careful and be smart!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play in his room with his toys. One day, he saw a big cupboard in the corner of his room. He had never seen it before. Tim thought it looked harmless and fun to play with.
Tim went to his mom and asked if he could play with the cupboard. His mom was busy, so she just nodded her head. Tim was very happy and ran back to his room. He opened the cupboard and found many old and dusty things inside. He started to take them out and play with them.
As Tim played with the things from the cupboard, he started to feel sick. He didn't know that the dust on the old things was making him sick. Tim's mom found him lying on the floor, not feeling well. She was very sad and worried. Tim had to go to the doctor, and he was not allowed to play with the cupboard anymore.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a fair. A little boy named Tim went to the fair with his mom and dad. They had a lot of fun. They saw a big wheel and lots of games. Tim wanted to win a toy.
They saw a game with steps. Tim had to step on the right ones to win. His mom and dad said, "Remember, step on the blue ones." Tim tried to keep the memory in his head. He stepped on the blue steps and won a big teddy bear.
The sun went down and it was time to go home. Tim was happy with his teddy bear. He hugged it tight and said, "I will always remember the fair and the steps." His mom and dad smiled. They knew Tim would keep that memory forever.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Lucy wanted to help her mom prepare pasta for dinner. She put on her apron and stood on a chair to reach the big pot on the stove. Her mom smiled and said, "Be careful, Lucy. The pot is very hot."
Lucy watched as her mom poured the pasta into the pot. The water bubbled and steamed. When the pasta was ready, Lucy helped her mom put it on plates. Then, her mom poured some sauce on top. Lucy looked at the sauce and said, "Mom, the sauce looks sour."
Her mom laughed and said, "Don't worry, Lucy. The sauce is not sour. It is sweet and yummy. Just taste it." Lucy took a bite of the pasta and smiled. The sauce was not sour at all. It was the best pasta she had ever eaten.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a big, red bicycle in his yard. He wanted to ride it, but he was scared. He never rode a bicycle before. Tim asked his friend, Sue, to help him. Sue said, "Don't worry, Tim! Riding a bicycle is fun and easy!"
As they started to ride the bicycle, they heard a loud roar. Tim and Sue were very scared. They thought it was a big, scary animal. They hid behind a tree and peeked out to see what made the noise.
To their surprise, they saw a small, harmless kitten. The kitten was just playing with a toy that made a roar sound. Tim and Sue laughed and went back to riding the bicycle. They learned that sometimes, things that seem scary can be harmless and fun.

One day, a little girl named Lucy went to the town with her mom. They walked and looked at all the fun things. Lucy saw a big toy store and wanted to go in.
Inside the toy store, Lucy started to examine all the toys. She saw dolls, cars, and a big spinning top. Lucy wanted to play with the spinning top, so her mom said, "Okay." Lucy spun the top very fast, and it went around and around.
Lucy watched the spinning top and started to feel dizzy. She sat down and her mom gave her some water. After a while, Lucy felt better. They left the toy store and went back home. Lucy had a fun day in the town with her mom.

Once upon a time, in a quiet little town, there was a small rabbit named Remy. Remy had big ears that he loved to use for listening. One day, Remy heard a tiny sound coming from a tree. He wanted to find out what it was.
Remy tried to use his ears to listen more. Then, he saw a little bird up in the tree. The bird was sad because it could not fly. Remy wanted to help the bird, so he had an idea. He tried to think of a way to help the bird fly.
Remy found a soft leaf and put it under the bird's wing. He tried to help the bird fly by lifting the leaf up and down. The bird started to fly a little. They tried again and again, and soon the bird was flying high in the sky. The bird was happy, and Remy was happy too. They became good friends and played together every day.

One day, a big bus was on its way to town. The bus was old and needed to be restore. The bus driver was an impatient man. He wanted to get to town fast. On the way, he saw a little boy standing by the road.
"Hey, little boy," the bus driver said. "Do you want to ride my bus?"
"Yes, please," said the little boy. He was very happy to get on the bus. He wanted to see the town.
The bus driver drove very fast. He did not want to wait. Suddenly, the bus hit a big rock. The old bus broke down. The little boy was sad. The bus driver was sad too. They could not go to town. The bus driver should have been more patient and fix the bus before driving it.

Once upon a time, there was a big, modern house. In the house, there was a little girl named Amy. Amy loved to play with her toys and have fun all day.
One night, Amy had a dream. In her dream, she saw a beautiful garden with pretty flowers and butterflies. Amy was so happy in her dream.
The next day, Amy wanted to make her dream come true. She went outside and started to kneel down. She dug the dirt with her little hands and planted seeds. Every day, she watered the seeds and watched them grow.
Soon, the seeds turned into lovely flowers, just like in her dream. Amy was very happy to see her dream garden come to life. She played there every day and took care of her flowers, making her house even more beautiful.

Liz was very busy making dinner. She had to remember to make rice and vegetables. But while she was cooking, Liz forgot all about her yoga class. She had been so busy lately, she hadn't had time to go to class. 
When Liz was almost done cooking, she heard a knock at the door. To her surprise, it was her yoga instructor! Her instructor had come to remind Liz about the yoga class. She had been so busy, she had forgotten all about it.
Liz apologized, but her instructor said it was no problem. He said she should wear something comfortable, but also let her know that all her yoga poses should be held really tight. Liz thanked her instructor and quickly changed her clothes to get ready for yoga. 
At the yoga class, Liz was surprised she was able to hold all the poses so tightly. She tried her best and she was having so much fun. When it was time for the final pose, Liz held it tight and it made her feel so relaxed. 
She was so happy she had remembered her yoga class. If she had forgotten it for the second time, she would have definitely regretted it!

Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived an elderly lady. She was very kind and everyone loved her. She had a big heart and always shared her toys and food with others.
One day, a stranger came to the town. He was lost and needed help. The elderly lady saw him and wanted to help. She took his hand and showed him the way. The stranger was very happy and thanked her.
From that day on, the stranger and the elderly lady became good friends. They played together and shared their toys and food. Everyone in the town loved them, and they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. Lucy liked to draw and color. One day, she saw a pretty butterfly. The butterfly was very attractive. Lucy wanted to draw it.
She took a piece of paper and a pencil. She started to draw the butterfly. She drew a circle for the head and big shapes for the wings. But she wanted to improve her drawing. So, she looked at the butterfly and tried to draw it better.
Lucy showed her drawing to her mom. Her mom was happy and wrote a note. The note said, "Good job, Lucy!" Lucy felt proud of her drawing. She put the note on the fridge. Now, everyone could see her pretty butterfly drawing.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Jack. Jack was spoiled by his mother. Each time he wanted something, his mom would always say yes.
One day, Jack's mom said to him "Jack, I suggest you take an exam." 
Jack was confused and said, "What is an exam?". 
His mom replied, "An exam is a test. It will help you learn new things!"
Jack thought about it for a moment and then said, "No, I don't want to take an exam. I'm spoiled and taking exams is too hard". 
His mom thought for a minute and then said, "Okay, you don't need to take an exam now if you don't want to. But, I still suggest that you take an exam one day."
Jack smiled and said, "Okay". 
And with that, Jack and his mom kept on living happily ever after.

Jim was a very nervous 3 year old. He was about to receive a new style of shoes for the first time. He was so excited, he could hardly contain himself!
When his mom presented him with the new shoes, Jim gasped in delight. He loved the way they looked! He couldn't wait to show them off to his friends.
Jim was struck with a moment of unexpected nerves. "Mommy, what if the other children don't like my new shoes?" he asked.
His mother smiled reassuringly. "Don't worry, Jim. They'll love them just as much as I do," she said.
Jim received the new shoes with a newfound confidence. He couldn't wait to wear them to the playground the next day!

Once, there was a smooth stone. It was big and shiny. The smooth stone liked to lie in the sun. It felt warm and happy there. One day, a small boy found a pot. The pot was empty and sad.
The boy had an idea. He went to the smooth stone and asked, "Stone, can you help the pot?" The smooth stone said, "Yes, I can help!" So, the boy put the smooth stone in the pot. The pot was not sad anymore because it had a friend.
One day, the pot and the stone saw a cat stuck in a tree. They wanted to help the cat. The boy put the pot under the tree. The smooth stone told the cat, "Jump! The pot will catch you!" The cat jumped and landed in the pot. The cat was safe, and the pot and the stone felt good for helping. The moral of the story is that even small things can help others in big ways.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a scary wolf. The scary wolf had big teeth and a loud voice. He liked to scare all the little animals in the forest. The little animals were very scared of the scary wolf.
One day, a little rabbit was hopping in the forest. The scary wolf saw the little rabbit and wanted to scare him. The little rabbit saw the scary wolf and said, "Please, Mr. Wolf, do not scare me. I am just a little rabbit."
The scary wolf thought about it and said, "Okay, little rabbit. I will not scare you today. Please be my friend." The little rabbit and the scary wolf became friends and played together in the forest. All the other little animals saw this and were not scared of the scary wolf anymore. They all became friends and lived happily in the forest.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a bean. The bean was green and big. Tim thought it was a magic bean. He wanted to show the bean to his friend, Sue. So, he put the bean in his pocket and went to find Sue.
When Tim found Sue, he showed her the bean. Sue made a face. She thought the bean was disgusting. She did not want to touch it. Tim was sad. He thought the bean was special. Sue and Tim started to fight about the bean.
Then, Tim's mom came. She told them to stop fighting. She said, "It's just a bean. It's not worth fighting over." Sue and Tim listened to Tim's mom. They said sorry to each other. They learned that friends should not fight over small things.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a girl named Lily. Lily liked to jog every day. She was very organized and always put her shoes and socks in the right place.
One sunny day, Lily went for a jog in the park. The park was full of pretty flowers and big trees. She saw a cute dog playing with a ball. Lily smiled and waved to the dog.
As Lily jogged, she did not see a big rock on the path. She tripped and started to fall. But, a nice boy named Tim saw her and caught her just in time. Lily said, "Thank you, Tim!" They became good friends and jogged together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a bike with pedals. He loved to ride it up and down the street. Tim was a dependable friend, always ready to help others.
One day, Tim met a girl named Sue. Sue was sad and worried. Tim asked, "Why are you worried, Sue?" Sue said, "I lost my toy in the park and I don't know how to find it."
Tim wanted to help Sue. He said, "Don't worry, Sue. I can help you find your toy. Let's ride my bike to the park and look for it." Sue felt better now that she had a dependable friend to help her.
They pedaled to the park and searched for the toy. After some time, they found it under a tree. Sue was very happy and said, "Thank you, Tim! You are a good friend." Tim was happy too. They pedaled back home together, knowing that they could always depend on each other.

Once upon a time there was a patient pig who lived on a farm. Every day he stayed in his pen and waited for something special to happen. One day he heard a noise coming from outside and he was excited to see what was coming.
He saw a little girl walking across the fields with a basket full of sour apples! His eyes lit up and he started jumping around, squealing with delight. 
The little girl noticed the pig and smiled. "Do you want to stay for a snack, little piggy?"
The pig nodded eagerly and stayed put as the girl shared her sour apples with him. He munched happily and enjoyed every bite. 
As he ate, the girl told him that she had many more surprises in store for him and his friends if he was a good and patient pig. 
The pig was so excited that he could barely contain himself. He knew something wonderful was in store and he patiently waited for the day it would come.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a girl named Sally. She loved to play dress-up and wear fun costumes. One day, she put on a beautiful costume that made her feel like a princess.
Sally had a friend named Tom. Tom liked to play pretend too. They decided to play a game where they would marry each other. They dressed up in their best costumes and said, "I do." All their friends clapped and laughed.
But then, Sally accidentally stepped on Tom's foot. She felt very sorry. She said, "I'm sorry, Tom." Tom smiled and said, "It's okay, Sally. We're still friends." They hugged and continued to play together, having lots of fun in their costumes.

Once upon a time, there was a baby. The baby lived with his mom and dad. They were a happy family. One day, the baby saw an unknown toy in his room. He did not know what it was.
The baby asked his mom, "What is this?" His mom smiled and said, "This is a new toy for you to play with. It will help you understand new things." The baby was happy and wanted to play with the unknown toy.
As the baby played with the toy, he started to understand how it worked. He learned to press buttons and turn knobs. The baby was very happy. His mom and dad were happy too because their baby was learning new things. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a curious little girl named Lily. Lily loved to explore and play with her toys. One day, she saw her baby brother's crib was broken. "Oh no!" she said, "I must repair the crib!"
Lily went to her dad and asked, "Dad, can you help me repair the crib?" Her dad smiled and said, "Of course, Lily! Let's fix it together." They worked together to fix the crib. Lily was very happy and proud of herself.
Just as they finished repairing the crib, they heard a strange noise. To their surprise, they found a little bird outside their window. The bird had a broken wing. Lily looked at her dad and said, "Let's help the bird, too!" They carefully took the bird inside and helped it get better. The bird became their new friend, and they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, in a lively forest, there lived a giant. The giant was big and strong. He liked to play with his friends, the animals. One day, a little bird came to the giant. The bird was sad because her nest had fallen from a tree.
The giant wanted to help the little bird. He picked up the nest and put it back in the tree. The little bird was happy again. She said, "Thank you, giant! You are very kind."
The next day, the giant saw a small boy. The boy was lost and scared. He said, "Giant, please help me find my way home." The giant did not demand anything. He just wanted to help. He picked up the boy and took him back to his family.
The family was so happy to see the boy. They thanked the giant for his help. The giant smiled and went back to the forest. The animals and the giant played together.
The moral of the story is to be kind and help others when they need it.

One day, Tim and his mom went to visit his grandpa. Tim loved to play with his grandpa. They had so much fun together. Grandpa had a big rope in his yard. Tim liked to swing on the rope.
"Grandpa, can we play with the rope?" Tim asked. "Yes, of course!" Grandpa said with a big smile. They went outside and Tim held the rope. Grandpa pushed Tim, and he swung back and forth. Tim laughed and laughed.
Then, a bird flew by and landed on the rope. The bird looked at Tim and said, "You are stupid!" Tim felt sad, but Grandpa hugged him. "Don't worry, Tim. That bird doesn't know you. You are smart and kind." Tim smiled and knew that Grandpa was right. They played with the rope all day, and Tim forgot about the silly bird.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim had a scooter. His scooter was different from the other scooters. It was very big and very red.
One day, Tim went to the park with his scooter. He saw a girl named Sue. Sue was sad because she could not find her toy. Tim wanted to help. He said, "I will mind your toy if I find it."
Tim looked around the park with his scooter. He found Sue's toy under a tree. He gave it to Sue. Sue was very happy. She said, "Thank you, Tim. Your scooter is different, but it is very nice."
From that day on, Tim and Sue were good friends. They played together in the park every day. Tim always minded Sue's toys, and they had a lot of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia loved to play outside. She would run, jump, and laugh. She was always excited to find new things. One day, Mia saw a big box in her yard. She felt wonder about what could be inside.
Mia opened the box and found a big, red ball. She was very happy and started to play with it. As she played, the ball started to grow bigger and bigger. Mia was amazed and thought it was magic. She loved the big, red ball even more now.
But then, the ball stopped growing. Mia was sad and didn't know why it stopped. She looked around and saw her dad. He was holding a pump. Mia realized her dad had made the big, red ball grow. It was not magic after all, but she still loved playing with it.

Once upon a time, there was a brown dog named Buddy. Buddy loved to play with his ball. One day, Buddy saw a big print on the ground. It was a cat print! Buddy was excited and wanted to find the cat.
Buddy followed the print and found a brown cat named Whiskers. Buddy wanted to play with Whiskers, but Whiskers did not want to play. Whiskers began to tease Buddy by running away and hiding. Buddy felt sad because he just wanted to be friends.
Buddy did not give up. He tried to show Whiskers his ball and how fun it was to play. After some time, Whiskers saw how much fun Buddy was having and decided to give it a try. They played together and had lots of fun. In the end, Buddy and Whiskers became best friends and they never teased each other again.

Once upon a time, there was a sad dog named Max. Max was sad because he lost his band. The band was his favorite toy. He looked for the band all day but could not find it.
One day, Max saw a cat with his band. The cat was happy and played with the band. Max wanted his band back, but he did not know how to ask the cat. He felt very sad.
Max decided to change and be brave. He went to the cat and asked, "Can I have my band back, please?" The cat said, "Yes, we can share the band!" Max was happy, and the cat was happy too. They played together and became good friends.
The moral of the story is to be brave and ask for what you want. Sharing can make everyone happy.

Once upon a time, there was a powerful princess. She had lots of magical powers, and she was always so kind. One day, the princess felt lonely, so she asked her friends to come and play. But they were all too busy.
So, the princess went on an adventure. On her way, she came across a big garden. There were apples, pears and celery! She was so amazed at the sight of plants.
The princess asked the gardener if she could pick some of the celery and take it with her. The gardener said yes, and the princess was so happy to have something special to take.
The princess took the celery home and she enjoyed it. Eating this celery made the princess feel very powerful, and she was so glad she'd asked for it.
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little bug. The bug liked to crawl on the ground. One day, the bug saw a big shadow. The shadow was very big and the bug was very small. The bug wanted to find out where the shadow came from.
The bug crawled and crawled to find the shadow. The bug met a frog on the way. The frog had a sour face. The bug asked the frog, "Why is your face so sour?" The frog said, "I ate a sour bug. It made my face sour." The bug said, "Oh no! I hope you feel better soon."
The bug kept crawling to find the shadow. The bug saw the shadow came from a big tree. The bug was happy to find the shadow. The bug crawled back home and told all its friends about the big shadow and the sour frog. The bug's friends were happy to hear the story, and they all played under the big tree together.

Sara and Ben are playing with sand in the park. They have a bucket, a shovel and some cups. They make a big hill of sand and put a circle on top. The circle is a lid from a jar. They pretend it is a castle.
"Look at our castle!" Sara says. "It is so big and pretty!"
"Yes, it is!" Ben says. "Let's make more circles for the windows and doors!"
They use the cups to make more circles in the sand. They are having fun.
But then, a big boy comes. He is older and taller than Sara and Ben. He has a water bottle in his hand. He sees the castle and smiles. He is not nice.
"Hey, what are you doing?" he says. "This is my sand!"
"No, it is not!" Sara says. "We made this castle! Go away!"
The big boy does not listen. He opens his water bottle and pours water on the castle. The water makes the sand wet and soft. The castle falls down. The circles are gone.
"Ha ha ha!" the big boy laughs. "Your castle is ruined!"
Sara and Ben are sad and angry. They cry and shout.
"Stop it! Stop it!" they say. "You are mean! You are bad!"
But the big boy does not care. He runs away with his water bottle. He leaves Sara and Ben alone with their broken castle. They have no more fun. They have a bad day.

One day, a boy named Tim and his dog, Spot, were at home. They wanted to watch their favorite show on the TV. Tim's mom was in the kitchen making food. She told Tim to order Spot to sit before they could watch TV. 
Tim said, "Spot, sit!" But Spot did not sit. Instead, he ran fast around the room. Tim tried again, "Spot, sit!" But Spot still did not sit. Tim was sad and did not know what to do.
Then, something unexpected happened. Spot stopped running and sat down by the TV. Tim was so happy! He said, "Good boy, Spot!" They both watched their favorite show together, and Tim's mom brought them a snack to enjoy.

Once upon a time, in a dry land, there was a little fish named Fin. Fin was very sad because he had lost his way home. He knew he needed water for his life, but he could not find any.
One day, while Fin was looking for water, he met a big bird named Sky. Sky saw that Fin was lost and wanted to help him. Sky told Fin that he knew where to find water, and he could take him there. Fin was very happy and thanked Sky.
Sky carried Fin in his beak and flew high up in the sky. After a while, they found a big pond with lots of water. Sky gently put Fin in the water, and Fin was so happy to be back in the water. He could now live his life without any worry. Fin and Sky became best friends, and they played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a tailor who was very special. He had a rare needle that no one else had. Every day he would wear a special hat and coat and go to the market to sell his special clothes.
One day, a little girl passed by his stall and said to him: "Mister, why do you wear such a strange hat?". The tailor smiled and said, "It's to hold my very special needle that I use to make my clothes".
The little girl was very curious and said, "Can I see your special needle?" The tailor smiled again and took out the needle from his pocket. The little girl was amazed when she saw the needle, it was so rare.
The tailor said, "This needle is a very special one, it's very rare and it helps me make the best clothes. You should always take care of your things because they are precious". The little girl was very thankful and smiled. "Thank you Mister! I will always take care my things now". The tailor was very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a cheerful little boat. The boat was made of steel. It loved to sail on the big blue sea.
One sunny day, the cheerful steel boat went out to sail. It sailed far away from its home. The boat was very happy, and it made friends with the fish and the birds.
But then, the sky turned dark and stormy. The cheerful steel boat was scared. It tried to sail back home, but the waves were too big. The boat got lost in the storm and could not find its way back. The fish and the birds could not help the boat.
In the end, the cheerful steel boat was all alone in the big stormy sea. It was very sad and scared. The boat wished it had never sailed so far away from home.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mimi. She loved to paint and made lots of wonderful and colourful pictures. One day, her brother wanted to tease her, so he grabbed her paintbrush and her pot of paint and started to make a big, messy paint mess. Mimi shouted at him to stop, but he just laughed and kept going, making an even bigger mess.
Finally, Mimi had enough and ran away with her paintbrush and paint pot. She told her mommy what had happened and her mommy shouted at her brother for being such a tease. He apologised and had to help clean the mess up.
Mimi was happy because she had her paintbrush and paints back and she could create her pictures. She was very careful with her paints from then on and was never teased ever again!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He loved to watch the stars at night. Every night, he would sit by his window and look up at the sky. Tim saw many stars, but there was one star he liked the most. This star was very big and bright.
One day, Tim went outside to play. He found a very dirty rock. It was all covered in mud. Tim decided to take the rock home and clean it. He washed the rock with water and soap. As he cleaned the rock, he saw that it was not a rock at all. It was a shiny star!
Tim was so happy. He had his very own star. He put the star in his room and watched it every night. The star would light up his room and make him feel safe. And every night, when he looked out the window, the big bright star in the sky would wink at him. Tim knew that it was happy that he had found a friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird in a birdcage. The birdcage was in a big, scary house. The bird felt sad and alone in the scary house.
One day, the bird found a small seed in the birdcage. The bird planted the seed and it started to grow. The bird was happy to see the plant grow bigger and bigger every day.
But one day, something unexpected happened. The plant grew so big that it broke the birdcage! The bird was free and not scared anymore. The bird flew away from the scary house and found a new, happy home. And the bird and the plant lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a colorful top. It loved to spin all day. It would spin fast and slow, round and round. The top was very happy when it spun.
One day, the top met a pointy stick. The stick said, "I can help you spin better!" The top was excited. The pointy stick helped the top spin faster and longer. They became good friends.
Together, the colorful top and the pointy stick played and spun all day. They had lots of fun. The top was happy to have a friend who could help it spin so well. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a boy named Tim. Tim loved to count. He counted everything he saw. One day, on a sunny Sunday, Tim went for a walk with his mom and dad.
While they walked, Tim saw some rare, pretty stones by the road. He decided to count them. There were five stones! Tim showed them to his mom and dad, and they smiled. They were proud of him for counting so well.
As they walked back home, Tim counted more things. He counted ten birds, seven flowers, and three big trees. Tim was happy, and his mom and dad were happy too. They had a fun Sunday together, and Tim couldn't wait to count more things next time.

Once upon a time, there was a polite dog named Sam. He loved to follow his friend, a little bird named Tina. They played together every day. Tina liked to eat prunes, and Sam liked them too.
One day, Tina found a big prune tree. She said, "Sam, let's eat prunes!" Sam was happy and wagged his tail. They ate many prunes from the tree. But they did not know that these prunes were not good to eat.
After eating the prunes, Sam and Tina felt sick. They could not play anymore. They lay under the tree and wished they had not eaten the bad prunes.

One day, a boy named Tom had a sack. It was a normal sack. Tom liked to play with the sack. He would put toys in it and carry it around. He liked to do this every day.
One day, Tom saw his friend, Sue. Sue had a sack, too. But Sue's sack was bigger than Tom's sack. Tom was sad. He wanted a big sack like Sue's. Tom said to Sue, "Why do you have a bigger sack than me?"
Sue said, "I don't know. But we can still play together!" Tom and Sue played with their sacks. They put toys in them and carried them around. They had fun. In the end, Tom was happy. He learned that it was okay to have a normal sack.

Tom and Mia are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big pile of junk near the pond. They want to see what is in the junk.
"Look, a bike!" Tom says. He pulls out a bike with no wheels. "Can I ride it?"
"No, it is broken," Mia says. She finds a hat with a feather. "This is interesting. I can be a pirate!"
They put on the hat and the bike and pretend to be pirates. They make noises like "Arrr" and "Yo-ho-ho". They have fun.
Then they see a duck in the pond. The duck is swimming and splashing. Tom and Mia want to splash too.
"Let's go to the pond!" Tom says. He runs to the water.
"Wait for me!" Mia says. She follows him.
They get close to the pond and splash the water with their hands. The water is cold and wet. They laugh and scream. The duck is not happy. It quacks and flies away.
Tom and Mia are sorry. They did not want to scare the duck. They say "Bye, duck" and wave. They go back to the junk and play some more. They are happy.

Once upon a time, there was a yellow duck called Daisy. Daisy was exploring the world and one day, she decided to go underground. As she went deeper and deeper she noticed that the walls were yellow and she started to feel scared.
