Suddenly, she saw a rabbit coming towards her. He showed her the way and she was no longer scared. The rabbit brought Daisy deep underground and showed her a secret place. Suddenly, Daisy spotted something yellow and it was shining brightly. 
Daisy said, "What's that?" The rabbit replied, "It's a treasure, it's a special treat, just for you!" Daisy was so happy that the rabbit showed her the special treat and thanked him for the wonderful surprise!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She loved to design pretty pictures in her journal. The journal was very fragile, so she was always careful with it.
One day, Lucy's little brother, Timmy, wanted to play with her journal. Lucy did not want Timmy to touch it because it was fragile. She knew that Timmy was not always careful with things. This made Timmy very sad and upset.
Lucy thought about it and decided to help Timmy design his own journal. They found paper and crayons, and Lucy showed Timmy how to make pretty pictures. They had fun together, and both of their journals stayed safe and not broken.

Once upon a time, there was a clever boy named Tim. Tim loved to go on trips with his family. One day, they were going to a big park. Tim had to pack his bag with things he needed.
When they got to the park, they saw a little mosquito. The mosquito was not nice. It wanted to bite Tim and his family. Tim did not want the mosquito to win.
Tim had an idea. He took out a big fan from his bag. He used the fan to blow the mosquito away. The mosquito could not bite them now. Tim and his family were safe and happy. They had fun at the park all day.

Once upon a time, there was a kind little girl named Lila. She liked to go explore in the fog that filled her backyard. One day, Lila met a strange creature in the fog. She was a bit worried, but decided to ask it what she wanted.
"Where are you going?" asked Lila. 
"Oh, I'm just looking for a special item I've lost," replied the creature in a friendly voice.
"What kind of item?" asked Lila.
"It's a special button that can reverse the fog," said the creature. "It's very powerful and I need to find it quickly."
Lila was excited about this and said she would help. With Lila's help, the creature soon found the button. When the button was pressed, the fog reversed and the creature disappeared! 
Lila was sad to see her new friend go, but thanked them for the kind adventure. She vowed to never forget this magical experience.

One day, a brilliant dog named Max went to a lab. In the lab, there were many big boxes. Max liked to look at the boxes. He was a very smart dog.
Max heard a small voice say, "Help me, please!" It was a little cat stuck in a box. The box was shut very tight. Max wanted to help the cat.
Max used his strong teeth to open the box. The little cat jumped out and said, "Thank you, Max!" They became good friends and played together all day. They were very happy in the lab.

John was a little boy with a lot of energy. He always wanted to explore, to run and to climb. One day, his mommy took him for a walk in the park. Everything was so charming! There were tall trees, colorful flowers and friendly birds.
John's eyes lightened up and he wanted to run, but mommy said, "You must surrender your legs, John. You can't run. Walk, instead."
John smiled and followed her. He noticed a bathroom and asked, "Mommy, can I go in there?"
Mommy said,"No, sweetheart, it's not a place for children. We'll go back home soon and you can go to the bathroom at home."
John sighed and said, "Okay, I surrender!" Then he held mommy's hand and they walked around the park, enjoying the beautiful views.

Once upon a time, in a big tree, there was a rare bird. This bird could shine like the sun. Every day, the bird would fly and play with its friends.
One day, while the bird was shining and playing, a little girl saw it. She said, "Wow! Look at that bird shine! It is so pretty!" The bird heard her and flew down to meet her.
"Hello," said the bird. "I am a rare bird that can shine. Do you want to play with me?" The little girl smiled and said, "Yes, let's play together!" And so, they played and laughed all day long. The rare bird and the little girl became the best of friends, and they lived happily ever after.

One day, Ben and Lily went to the park with their mom. They liked to play on the swings and the slide. They also liked to look at the birds and the flowers.
But when they got to the park, they saw something strange. There was a lot of smoke in the air. It was gray and smelly. It came from a large fire. The fire was near the trees and the grass.
"Mom, what is that?" Ben asked, pointing at the smoke.
"That is a fire, Ben. It is very hot and dangerous. We have to stay away from it," mom said.
"Why is there a fire, mom?" Lily asked.
"Sometimes, fires happen by accident. Maybe someone left a match or a cigarette on the ground. Or maybe there was a lightning strike. We don't know for sure. But the firemen are here to put out the fire. They have big hoses and trucks. They are very brave and helpful," mom said.
Ben and Lily saw the firemen. They wore helmets and coats. They sprayed water on the fire. They made loud noises. They worked hard to stop the fire.
"Can we say thank you to the firemen, mom?" Ben asked.
"Of course, Ben. That is very nice of you. Let's wait until they are done, and then we can say thank you," mom said.
Ben and Lily nodded. They were glad that the firemen were there. They hoped that the fire would go out soon. They hoped that the park would be safe and beautiful again.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a little bird named Tim. Tim had a small nest made of soft twigs. The nest was on a big tree. Tim loved his nest very much.
One day, Tim met a squirrel named Sam. Sam was eating a spicy nut. "Yum, this nut is very spicy!" said Sam. Tim asked, "Can I try the spicy nut?" Sam shared the nut with Tim, but Tim didn't like it. "It's too spicy for me!" said Tim.
Tim invited Sam to see his nest. Sam loved the soft twigs. They played and talked until it was late. Then, Tim said, "It's time to sleep, Sam." Sam agreed and they both slept in the nest made of soft twigs. They were happy and became best friends.

One day, Little Jack wanted to celebrate. He ran around grabbing everything he could find. He found a big vase with bright colours. He smiled as he grabbed it and started to dance around the house. He quickly put the vase back on the table.
Little Jack ran to find his daddy. He was bald and Little Jack liked to give him lots of hugs. His daddy said, "Let's go outside and celebrate!" They went to the park and Little Jack laughed with glee. His daddy chased him around the park and they laughed and celebrated.
When they finished celebrating, they went to the house. Little Jack put the bright vase back on the table and ran off to get ready for bed. He gave his daddy a big hug and said, "Goodnight daddy." Little Jack was very happy to have celebrated such a wonderful day with his daddy.

Samantha was so excited. She was about to celebrate her birthday with her family. She put on her party dress and opened her presents. Her grandmother gave her a prize. It was an easy puzzle game that Samantha could easily do.
The family all sat around the table and sang "Happy Birthday" to Samantha. She smiled and blew out the candles on her cake. Everyone clapped and cheered for her. 
Samantha said with a big smile, "Thank you everyone for celebrating my birthday with me. I'm so excited to start playing my new puzzle game".
Grandma smiled and said, "You're welcome, Samantha. I'm very proud of you. I know you'll do well and have fun playing the game". 
The family all cheered and said, "Congrats, Samantha! You will get the prize for sure!" 
Samantha was so happy that her family was celebrating her birthday. She couldn't wait to start playing the game and winning the prize.

Lily likes to paint. She has many colors and brushes. She paints on paper, on walls, and on her face. She likes to make shapes and animals and flowers. She is happy when she paints.
One day, Lily goes to yoga with her mom. Yoga is when you move your body in different ways. You can stretch, bend, twist, and balance. Lily thinks yoga is fun. She tries to copy what her mom does. She makes a bridge, a tree, and a star.
Lily sees a tall lady in yoga. The lady is very tall. She can touch the ceiling with her hand. Lily wants to be tall too. She asks the lady, "How do you get so tall?" The lady smiles and says, "I eat a lot of vegetables and drink a lot of water. And I do yoga every day."
Lily thinks for a moment. She likes vegetables and water. She likes yoga too. She says, "I want to do that too. Maybe I can be tall like you." The lady says, "Maybe you can. But you are already beautiful and smart and kind. And that is more important than being tall."
Lily hugs the lady and says, "Thank you. You are very nice. Can I paint with you?" The lady says, "Sure. I like to paint too. Let's go and find some colors and brushes." Lily and the lady go to paint together. They paint on paper, on walls, and on their faces. They make shapes and animals and flowers. They are happy when they paint.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the beach with his family. He saw a big octopus in the water. The octopus was moving its arms in crazy ways. Tim thought it was funny and wanted to play with it.
Tim asked his mom, "Can I play with the octopus, please?" His mom said, "No, Tim. It's not safe to play with animals in the water. You must resist the idea." Tim was sad, but he knew his mom was right.
Later, Tim saw a group of kids playing with a beach ball. He joined them and had lots of fun. At the end of the day, Tim learned that it's important to resist things that can be dangerous, and that there are always other fun things to do.

Sara and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. But today, Sara is sad. She misses her mom. Her mom went to work and said she will come back soon.
"Ben, do you miss your mom?" Sara asks.
"No, I don't miss my mom. She is at home. She makes me lunch and reads me stories. She is nice," Ben says.
"I wish my mom was at home too. She is nice too. She hugs me and sings me songs. She is not here," Sara says.
Sara and Ben sit on the bench. They see a big door. The door is dirty. It has paint and mud on it. They wonder what is behind the door.
"Maybe there is a secret place behind the door. Maybe there are toys and candy and animals. Do you want to see?" Ben says.
"Yes, I want to see. Maybe my mom is there. Maybe she is waiting for me. Let's go," Sara says.
Sara and Ben run to the door. They try to open it. But the door is locked. They push and pull. But the door does not move.
"Ben, the door is stuck. We can't see what is behind it. I want to see. I want to see my mom," Sara says.
"Don't worry, Sara. Maybe we can find another way. Maybe we can climb over the door. Maybe we can dig under the door. Maybe we can break the door," Ben says.
Sara and Ben look for another way. They see a ladder. They see a shovel. They see a hammer. They try to use them. But they are too small. They can't reach the ladder. They can't lift the shovel. They can't swing the hammer.
"Ben, we can't find another way. We can't see what is behind the door. I don't want to play anymore. I want to go home. I want to see my mom," Sara says.
"OK, Sara. Let's go home. Maybe your mom is back. Maybe she is looking for you. Maybe she has a surprise for you. Let's go," Ben says.
Sara and Ben leave the door. They walk to Sara's house. They see Sara's mom. She is smiling. She is holding a cake. She has a surprise for Sara.
"Sara, I'm back. I missed you so much. I made you a cake. It is your favorite. It has chocolate and cherries. Happy birthday, Sara," Sara's mom says.
Sara runs to her mom. She hugs her mom. She kisses her mom. She is happy. She does not miss her mom anymore. She does not care about the door anymore. She has her mom and her cake.
"Mom, I missed you too. I love you so much. Thank you for the cake. It is beautiful. Can I share it with Ben? He is my friend. He helped me look for you," Sara says.
"Of course, you can share it with Ben. He is a good friend. He can come in and have some cake. Come on, let's go inside. It is time to celebrate," Sara's mom says.
Sara and Ben go inside. They have some cake. They have some juice. They have some fun. They are happy. They are friends. They are family.

Lily and Ben were playing with paper and scissors. They wanted to make shapes and animals. Lily cut a circle and said, "Look, this is the sun. It is bright and warm." Ben cut a triangle and said, "This is a hat. It is funny and cool."
They cut more paper and made more things. They had fun and laughed. But Ben was clumsy. He did not hold the scissors well. He cut his finger by mistake. He cried and said, "Ow, ow, ow! It hurts!"
Lily saw the blood and felt sorry. She said, "Don't cry, Ben. I will help you." She ran to get a band-aid and a hug. She put the band-aid on Ben's finger and gave him a hug. She said, "There, there. It will be okay. You are brave and strong."
Ben stopped crying and smiled. He said, "Thank you, Lily. You are kind and sweet." He gave her a hug back. He said, "Let's play something else. No more scissors."
Lily agreed. She said, "Yes, let's play something else. How about blocks?" They put away the paper and scissors and got the blocks. They built a tower and a bridge. They had fun and laughed again. They forgot about the cut. They had a good day.

Once upon a time there was a brave girl who loved to ride her bike. Every day she would go out and ride, enjoying the fresh air and the adventure it brought. 
One day while she was out, she saw a bowl of yogurt on the side of the road. It looked so delicious and impressive so she decided to take it home.
When she got home, her mom was really angry with her. She said, "You can't take things that do not belong to you! Now put it back where you found it."
The brave girl was sad, but she knew she had made a mistake. She rode her bike back to the street and put the yogurt back where she had found it. Everyone was sad that day and no one could enjoy the ride anymore.

Once upon a time, in a big tree, there was a squirrel named Squeaky. Squeaky had a huge nut that he found in the park. He was very happy and wanted to share it with his friends. So, he decided to invite them to a party.
Squeaky's friends came to the party. They saw the huge nut and were very excited. They all wanted to eat the nut, but first, they played games and danced. They were having a lot of fun.
Then, something unexpected happened. A little bird named Chirpy flew in and took the huge nut away. Squeaky and his friends were sad. But Chirpy came back and said, "I'm sorry, I didn't know it was your nut. Let's all share it together." So, they all ate the nut and had a great time.

Once upon a time, there was a big bear named Ben. Ben was very hungry, so he went to a small food place. He saw a menu on the wall. The menu had many good foods to eat.
Ben wanted to pick the best food, so he poked the menu with his big paw. But something unexpected happened! The menu fell down and turned into a big, yummy cake. Ben was very surprised.
Ben thought the cake was the best food on the menu, so he ate it all up. The twist was that the cake made him very full, but it also made him very small. Ben was not a big bear anymore, but he was still very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a big dog named Spot. Spot loved to go on walks with his best friend, a little girl named Lucy. Every day, Lucy would tell Spot, "Let's go for a walk!" And off they would go, walking and playing together.
One sunny day, Lucy and Spot went for a walk in the park. Spot was very patient as Lucy stopped to look at the pretty flowers and to pick up cool rocks. Spot would sit and wait for Lucy, wagging his tail happily.
As they walked, they saw a little boy who was sad. Lucy asked the boy, "Why are you sad?" The boy said, "I lost my toy." Lucy and Spot decided to help him find his toy. They looked and looked, and finally, Spot found the toy under a big tree. The boy was so happy, and he said, "Thank you, Lucy and Spot!" From that day on, they all became good friends and went on many more walks together.

One day, a gentle cat named Mimi and a dog named Max were playing in the park. They liked to roll on the soft grass and chase each other. They were good friends and always had fun together.
Mimi said, "Max, let's play a game. We will take turns telling each other what to do. We will call it 'order'." Max thought it was a good idea. Mimi went first and told Max to roll over three times. Max did it and laughed. Then it was Max's turn. He told Mimi to jump up and down. Mimi did it and they both laughed.
As they were playing, a big wind came and blew a hat right onto Mimi's head. Mimi and Max were surprised! They didn't know where the hat came from. They decided to try and find the owner of the hat. They asked their friends in the park if it was their hat, but no one knew whose hat it was. So, Mimi and Max decided to keep the hat and take turns wearing it while they played their "order" game. They had a fun day and loved their new hat.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She loved to celebrate her birthday with her family. Lucy was very enthusiastic about her birthday this year. She wanted to help her mom bake a cake in the stove.
Lucy's mom said, "Lucy, come help me with the cake. We will put it in the stove together." Lucy was so happy. She ran to the kitchen and helped her mom put the cake in the stove.
When the cake was ready, they took it out of the stove. Lucy's family sang "Happy Birthday" to her. They all enjoyed the cake and had a great time celebrating Lucy's birthday.

Once upon a time, in a big nation, there were two friends, Tom and Tim. They liked to play and run together. One day, they found a big, red ball. Tom said, "Let's play with the ball!" Tim said, "No, that's a stupid idea. We should take it home." But Tom did not listen.
Tom and Tim played with the ball all day. They laughed and had a lot of fun. They did not know that the ball was very special. It was a magic ball that could make wishes come true. They did not know that they could ask the ball for anything they wanted.
The next day, Tom and Tim were very tired. They went to take a nap under a big tree. When they woke up, the ball was gone. They were very sad. They looked for the ball everywhere, but they could not find it. They knew then that they should have listened to Tim and taken the ball home. But they learned a good lesson: always listen to your friends, even if their ideas seem stupid at first.

There was a little girl named Lucy. She was 3 years old and very curious. One day, Lucy saw something she had never seen before. It was big, blue, and unknown to her. She began to stare at it. 
Lucy touched the object and noticed it was soft and smooth. She rubbed the object and found it was very soothing. She felt happy and calm. 
But then, all of sudden, the unknown object began to move! Lucy became scared and stepped away from it. She stared as it moved and made strange noises. 
Suddenly, Lucy remembered her pet dog at home. It was also unknown to Lucy, but it felt familiar. Lucy smiled and ran home to play with her pet.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy who loved to unpack her toys. One sunny day, she saw a big structure in the park. It was warm outside, so she went to play with her friends.
While they were playing, they found a secret door in the structure. They opened the door, and they saw a room full of toys! They were so happy and started to unpack the toys.
But then, something unexpected happened. The toys came to life and became their new friends! Amy and her friends were surprised but had the best day playing with their new toy friends in the warm sun.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. One day she went to the park with her mom. 
She ran over to the swings and hopped right on. She was so excited! She started to move back and forth, back and forth. 
Suddenly, she heard a weird sound. She stopped and looked around. A big bird had landed on the swing next to her. The bird disturbed Amy! 
But then the bird flew away, and Amy was happy again. She hopped back on her swing and smiled as she went back and forth, back and forth.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to space. He saw a big planet. The planet was round and had many colors. Tim wanted to put his toy car on the planet.
When Tim landed on the planet, he met a rude alien. The alien said, "You cannot put your toy car on my planet!" Tim was sad and asked, "Why not?"
The alien thought for a moment and said, "Okay, you can put your toy car on my planet, but you must be nice to me and my friends." Tim agreed, and they played together with the toy car. The rude alien became a nice friend, and they all had fun on the big, colorful planet.

One day, a brave dog named Max went to play in the park. He found a big steel box in the ground. Max wanted to bury the box. He dug a big hole with his paws and put the box in it.
A little boy named Tim saw Max and said, "What are you doing, Max?" Max barked, "I found a box and I am burying it." Tim wanted to help Max, so they both dug and covered the box with dirt.
Suddenly, the box started to shake and make loud noises. Max and Tim were scared, but they were brave too. They dug up the box again, and when they opened it, they found a baby robot inside. The robot was friendly and wanted to play with Max and Tim. They all played together and had a lot of fun.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to play in the park. He saw a big red ball with the number zero on it. Tim thought the ball was amazing. He wanted to play with it, but the ball was stuck in a tree.
Tim tried to pull the ball out of the tree. He pulled and pulled, but the ball did not move. Then, a friendly squirrel came and helped Tim. Together, they pulled the ball out of the tree. Tim was very happy and said thank you to the squirrel.
Just as Tim started to play with the ball, it began to rain. Tim was sad because he could not play outside anymore. But then, the squirrel had an idea. They went to Tim's house and played with the ball inside. The squirrel and Tim had an amazing time playing with the big red zero ball.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to build things with her toy blocks. One day, it was very cold outside, so Lily decided to stay inside and build a big tower with her blocks.
As Lily was building her tower, she heard a knock on the door. She opened the door and saw a dry leaf on the ground. The wind blew the leaf inside the house. Lily thought it was strange, but she decided to keep the leaf and use it to make her tower even better.
Lily put the dry leaf on top of her tower. Suddenly, the leaf started to move! It was not a leaf at all, but a tiny bug! The bug had been very cold, and now it was warm inside Lily's house. The bug thanked Lily for helping him get warm, and they became friends. From that day on, Lily and the bug built many more towers together, and they had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little mouse who loved cheese. He lived in a small hole in a big house. The mouse knew where to find the best cheese in the house. It was in the kitchen, on a high shelf. He would climb up and take a small piece of cheese to eat every day.
One day, the mouse saw a big, dangerous cat in the house. The cat wanted to catch the mouse, but the mouse was very fast. The mouse knew he had to be careful so the cat wouldn't catch him. He thought about how to get the cheese without the cat seeing him.
The mouse had a smart idea. He waited until the cat was sleeping, then he quickly ran to the kitchen. He climbed up to the high shelf and took a piece of cheese. The mouse was so happy! He knew that he could still enjoy his cheese, even with the dangerous cat in the house.

Once upon a time, there was a boy who had a great pistol. He played with the pistol every day, pretending to go on adventures.
One day, the boy's father saw him playing with the pistol and took it away, telling him that it was too dangerous. The boy was very sad, but accepted his father's decision.
The next day, the boy went to his father and asked to have his pistol back. His father said, "The pistol has started to rot. You can't play with it anymore."
The boy was so disappointed, but he understood what had happened. Instead of playing with the pistol, he started making paper airplanes and had lots of great adventures with them instead.

Once there was a family who lived in the woods. They had a son who was three years old. His name was Penny. Penny loved to play in the woods and to pick wildflowers. One day, Penny saw a sign that said "Pick wildflowers in moderation".
Penny was so excited to follow the sign's advice. He wanted to help keep the woods healthy. So every day, Penny only picked one flower. He would then put a penny behind the sign as a thank you. 
Soon, some of the other children in the woods started to follow the same rule. They all put pennies behind the sign whenever they picked flowers. That way the woods stayed healthy.
The sign was there for many years. Whenever Penny saw it, he smiled. He was proud of how the whole forest got healthier and healthier because of the sign.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim had a toy case with many toys inside. He loved his toys very much. Every day, he would play with them and have lots of fun.
One day, Tim was playing with his toys when he heard a loud "break". He looked at his toy case and saw that it was not fine. The case was broken, and his toys were all over the floor. Tim felt very sad.
Tim's mom saw the broken case and said, "Don't worry, Tim. We can fix the case, and everything will be fine again." Tim and his mom worked together to fix the broken case. After they were done, Tim put his toys back inside. He was happy and knew that his toys were safe in their case again.

Once upon a time, there was a fox. The fox was independent. He liked to do things by himself. He lived in a big forest with his friends.
One day, the fox was walking in the forest. He saw his friend, the rabbit. The rabbit was sad. The fox wanted to make the rabbit happy. So, the fox told a joke. The joke was very funny.
The rabbit laughed and laughed. He was not sad anymore. The fox was happy too. They played together all day. The independent fox learned that it was fun to make his friends happy. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a big white dog. The dog liked to run and play. One day, he saw a shiny jewel on the ground. It was very pretty, and the dog wanted to show it to his friends.
The white dog picked up the jewel in his mouth and started to run. He ran to his friend, the cat. The cat looked at the jewel and said, "Wow! That is so pretty!" The dog was very happy.
But then, the dog saw a big red ball. He wanted to play with the ball, but he had the jewel in his mouth. The dog knew he had to stop and put the jewel down. He put the jewel down, and then he played with the ball. The dog and the cat played with the ball all day, and they were very happy.

Once, there was a unique boat. This boat was navy blue. It could allow people to go on it. Many kids loved to play on the boat.
One day, a little boy named Tim went to play on the boat. He saw a big red button on the boat. Tim was curious, so he pushed the button. Suddenly, the boat started to move!
All the kids were surprised. They did not know the boat could move. The boat took them to a fun island. They played there all day. At the end of the day, the boat took them back home. Now, they knew the boat was more than just a place to play.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to draw in his notebook. One day, he went to the park to play with his friends. He brought his notebook with him to show his friends his drawings. Tim was very happy.
At the park, Tim met a new friend named Max. Max didn't know how to draw, but he wanted to learn. Tim was kind and decided to lend Max his notebook. Max was very happy and said thank you. Tim felt good about helping his friend.
While Max was drawing in the notebook, a big wind came and blew the notebook away. Max was sad and didn't know what to do. Tim saw what happened and ran to find the notebook. He found it under a tree. Max was very happy to see the notebook again. They both learned that it's important to hold on tight to things you care about.

One day, a curious little boy named Tim went for a walk. He saw a big police car on the street. The police car had bright lights and made a loud noise. Tim wanted to see what was happening.
Tim walked up to the police officer and asked, "What are you doing?" The police officer smiled and said, "I am helping people stay safe. Do you want to help too?" Tim nodded his head and said, "Yes, I want to help!"
So, the police officer let Tim sit in the police car. Tim felt happy and proud to help the police. He waved to his friends as they drove by. At the end of the day, Tim went home and told his mom all about his big adventure.

One day, Mommy and Tom went to the store. Tom liked the big, bossy truck outside. He wanted to go and drive it, but Mommy said no. 
Inside the store, Tom saw a fashion show. He watched the people walk around in their fancy clothes. Tom wanted to join the fashion show, so Mommy said yes. He got dressed up in a suit and tie.
When it was time for the fashion show to finish, Tom waved to the crowd. He was so excited. Everyone clapped and cheered for Tom's amazing style. 
After the show, Tom asked Mommy if he could go drive the big, bossy truck outside. She said yes! Tom had a great time driving the truck and was very proud of himself.

Once there was a clever girl named Sarah. She had beautiful, blonde hair. Every day, she would display her hair in a variety of ways. 
One day, Sarah decided to display her hair in two ponytails. She loved the way it looked! Everyone she saw said how beautiful the two ponytails were.
Another day, she decided to display her hair in a single braid. Everyone thought the braid was lovely.
But Sarah had a lot of hair, so one day she decided to display it in three pigtails. She felt so happy with how she looked. 
Everyone Sarah showed off her hair, they said how clever she was for having so many different ways to show off her beautiful hair.

Once upon a time, there was a big airport. Many planes would come and go every day. One day, a little boy named Tim went to the airport with his mom. Tim was very excited to see the planes.
At the airport, Tim saw a man with a big bunch of balloons. The man said, "Hello, little boy! Do you want a balloon?" Tim said, "Yes, please!" The man gave Tim a fine, big, red balloon. Tim was very happy.
Tim and his mom walked around the airport, looking at the planes. But Tim let go of his balloon by mistake. The balloon went up, up, up into the sky. Tim was sad. His mom said, "It's okay, Tim. The balloon is free now. It will have fun in the sky." Tim felt better and they went home after a fun day at the airport.

Once upon a time, there was a king. The king was very ugly. He had a big nose and a small mouth. The people in the land did not mind. They liked the king because he was kind.
One day, the king went for a walk. He saw a big red ball. The king kicked the ball. The ball went high in the sky. The king was happy. He liked to play with the ball.
The ugly king played with the ball all day. The people in the land saw the king play. They were happy too. They liked their king. They did not mind that he was ugly. They knew he was a good king.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy. He was fat and liked to stare at the sky. One day, the sky started to get very dark and the wind started to blow. Suddenly, there was a huge storm. 
The little boy was scared, so he hid under the bed. He peered out from underneath the bed and saw his mommy. 
"Mommy, what's that?" He asked as he pointed towards the storm.
"That's a storm, honey," she said.
The little boy continued to stare at the storm with his big, fat eyes. His mommy hugged him tightly, and he slowly stopped being so scared. 
They watched the storm together until it finally passed. The little boy was so relieved when the sky was blue and sunny again. 
The End.

One day, a boy named Tim and his dog, Spot, went to the beach. They saw a lot of sand and water. Tim said, "I want to use the sand to make a big sand house!" So, Tim and Spot started to build the sand house together. They used their hands and paws to put the sand in place.
As they were building, a girl named Sue came over. She looked at the sand house and said, "That's a bad sand house!" Tim and Spot felt sad. They didn't know what to do. They wanted to have a good sand house, not a bad one.
Then, something unexpected happened. A big wave came and washed away the bad sand house. Tim, Spot, and Sue were all wet! They laughed and said, "Let's build a new sand house together!" So, they all helped each other and made a big, good sand house. They played in the sand house all day and became good friends.

One day, a cat named Sam found a smooth sheet. He liked to play with it. He would act like a king with the sheet as his cape. Sam's friend, a dog named Max, saw him and wanted to play too.
Max said, "Can I play with the sheet too, Sam?" But Sam didn't want to share. They both wanted the sheet and started to fight. They pulled and tugged on the sheet. It looked like it would rip soon.
Just then, Sam's mom came in and saw the fight. She took the sheet away and said, "You must learn to share." Sam and Max felt bad. They said sorry to each other and promised to share. Sam's mom gave the sheet back, and they played together all day, taking turns with the sheet.

One day, a little squirrel was playing near a big oak tree. The squirrel liked to play with his friends, but today he was all alone. He was running around the tree and jumping from branch to branch. The squirrel was having a lot of fun.
While playing, the squirrel found a tight hole in the oak tree. He thought it would be fun to squeeze into the hole, but he got stuck! The squirrel felt embarrass because he could not get out. He started to cry and wished his friends were there to help him.
Just then, a big bird flew by and saw the squirrel stuck in the hole. The bird thought the squirrel was playing a game and laughed. But the squirrel cried even more, so the bird understood he needed help. The bird pulled the squirrel out of the hole, and they became friends. The squirrel was happy and not embarrass anymore. From that day on, they played together near the big oak tree, and the squirrel never went into tight holes again.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a boy named Tim. Tim had a big, red ball. He loved to play with his ball every day. One day, the ball went up, up, up and did not come down. Tim was sad.
Tim's mommy gave him gum to make him feel better. The gum was sweet and sticky. Tim liked the gum a lot. He forgot about his ball for a little while. But then, he saw the ball up in the tree.
Tim felt angry. He wanted his ball back. He thought and thought. Then, he had an idea. He took the gum out of his mouth and threw it at the ball. The gum stuck to the ball. Tim pulled and pulled, and the ball began to rise. It came out of the tree!
Tim was so happy to have his ball back. He thanked his mommy for the gum. From that day on, Tim and his ball were always together. They played and had fun every day. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play outside in the dirt. He would dig and make mud pies. His hands would become dirty, but he did not care. He was having so much fun.
One sunny day, Tim found a big, red apple on the ground. He was very hungry, so he picked it up. He forgot that his hands were dirty from playing. The apple got dirty too. But Tim did not see the dirt on the apple.
Tim took a big bite of the apple. The dirt went into his mouth. "Yuck!" he said, spitting out the dirty apple. Tim's mouth felt dirty too. He ran to his mom and asked for help. She gave him a glass of water to wash out his mouth. Tim felt better after that.
From that day on, Tim remembered to wash his hands before eating. He did not want his mouth to become dirty again. And they all lived happily ever after.

Lucy was outside playing when she saw something very special - a big purple ball! She wanted to play with it, so she hurried over. As she began to roll the ball, she met a new friend, Daisy, who was also playing nearby. 
"Hi, my name is Daisy. What's your name?" Daisy asked her. 
"I'm Lucy. Can I play with you too?" Lucy replied. 
"Yes, of course!" said Daisy. 
So they both started to play together, rolling the ball back and forth in different styles. Lucy tried to spin it like a top, and Daisy tried to throw it up into the sky. 
When the ball was tired of running around, they both sat down in the grass to rest. 
"That was so fun!" said Lucy. 
"It sure was!" said Daisy. "Let's do it again in a different style tomorrow!"
Lucy was very excited. She was glad that she had hurried over to the purple ball, because she had made a new friend.

One day, Joe was playing in his bedroom. His room was a busy place. He had lots of toys and would sometimes kick them around. Joe kicked his toys in the air and he was having lots of fun. He thought nothing could ruin his day.
Suddenly, he heard a loud noise and felt a sharp pain on his foot. He looked down and saw a hole in the wall from where he had kicked his toys. 'Oh no", thought Joe. He had made a big mess.
Joe knew he would be in trouble for what he had done. He was afraid that his mom would be mad at him. He waited for her to finish her chores and when she arrived, she was very angry. She said Joe had to clean the whole room and he was very sad.
Joe worked hard to clean up the mess, but no matter what he did, he realized that he couldn't undo the harm he had caused. The day had gone very wrong and Joe learned a valuable lesson- kicking toys around can lead to bad endings.

One day, a cat and a dog went on a tour. They wanted to see all the big trees and pretty flowers. They were very good friends and liked to play together.
On their tour, they saw a big tree that was part open. The cat said, "Let's go inside and see what's in there!" The dog wagged his tail and agreed. They knew they would find something fun inside the tree.
When they went inside the tree, they found a big box. The cat and dog were very excited. They remembered seeing the box and knew it was something special. They opened the box and found lots of toys to play with. They had a good time playing with the toys and knew their tour was a big success.

Once upon a time there was a happy little girl. She was wearing a navy shirt and navy shorts. Her name was Joy, and she was three years old.
Joy wanted to climb the big tree in her backyard. She stepped back and took a deep breath. She leaned forward and started to climb up the tree.
When she was about halfway up, she started to feel really hungry. She stopped climbing and looked down. Her mom was looking up at her and said, "Are you hungry, Joy?"
Joy nodded her head and said, "Yes, I am really hungry!" Her mom smiled and said, "Wait for me, I'll be right there with some lunch for you!"
Joy leaned against the tree, waiting for her mom. Soon her mom came up with a big lunch. Joy ate lunch, feeling very happy and content. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tom. Tom had a toy car. The car was modern and shiny. Tom loved to play with his car all day long.
One day, Tom's car got stuck under the big chair. Tom tried to get it out, but he had to struggle. He pushed and pulled, but the car would not come out. Tom felt sad, and he did not know what to do.
Then, Tom's big sister came into the room. She saw Tom was sad and asked, "What is wrong?" Tom told her about the car under the chair. His sister helped him lift the chair. With one big push, they moved the chair to the left. The car came out, and Tom was happy again. They played with the car together and had lots of fun.

One day, a little boy named Tim felt miserable. He didn't want to play with his toys or go to the park. His mom saw him sad and asked, "Why are you sad, Tim?"
Tim said, "I don't know, Mom. I just feel sad." His mom thought for a moment and had an idea. She went to the kitchen and came back with a big lollipop. "Here, Tim," she said, "this might make you feel better."
Tim took the lollipop and smiled. It was so big that it was hard for him to hold it up. He tried to weigh it with his hands, but it was too heavy. Tim's mom helped him hold the lollipop and he started to lick it. The sweet taste made Tim feel happy again.
"Thank you, Mom!" Tim said as he enjoyed his lollipop. His mom smiled and said, "You're welcome, Tim. I'm glad you're happy again."
From that day on, whenever Tim felt miserable, he would remember the big lollipop and how it made him feel happy. And sometimes, his mom would give him another lollipop to help him feel better.

Once upon a time in a magical forest, there was a little girl. Her name was Sarah and she was three years old. One day, Sarah was playing in the forest when she noticed something sparkly on the ground. When she looked closely, she saw it was a comb! She reached out and grabbed it, expecting it to stay in her hand, but when she looked down, the comb had vanished!
Sarah was so confused and sad. She began to cry and asked the forest, "Where did my comb go?"
Just then, a small fairy appeared and said, "I can help you find your comb." Sarah wiped away her tears and nodded, eager to find her comb.
The fairy waved her wand and said, "You have a lesson to learn, so the comb has vanished. Don't use items that don't belong to you. It's harmless, but it's still not nice." Sarah listened attentively and understood. 
Suddenly, the comb reappeared! Sarah was so happy and thanked the fairy as she hugged the comb tightly.
The fairy smiled at Sarah and said, "Remember, it's never a good idea to take something without asking, even when it looks harmless." Sarah vowed to never take something that didn't belong to her and thanked the fairy before skipping away, comb in hand.

Once upon a time there was an enormous whistler. He liked to whistle a lot. Every morning he'd wake up and the first thing he'd do was give a big, loud whistle.
One day, a little boy heard the whistling. His name was Michael. He liked the whistling and decided he wanted to whistle like the enormous whistler. He practised and practised but he could not whistle as loud or as good as him.
Michael kept whistling until one day it made the enormous whistler very mad. He got so angry that he chased Michael away. Michael was very scared and ran away with tears in his eyes.
From then on, the enormous whistler never whistled again. He missed the whistling but he was too scared to whistle in case Michael returned. And from then on, the enormous whistler was very sad. The end.

Tom and Lily were having lunch with Mom and Dad. They liked to eat cheese and bread and grapes. Mom gave them each a blue napkin to wipe their mouths. Tom and Lily liked the blue napkins. They were soft and pretty.
"Can I have more cheese, please?" Tom asked Mom.
"Of course, here you go," Mom said and gave him a slice of cheese.
"Thank you, Mom," Tom said and smiled.
Lily wanted more cheese too, but she did not ask. She reached for Tom's cheese when he was not looking. She pulled it hard and tore his blue napkin.
"Hey, that's my cheese!" Tom shouted and saw his napkin. "And you tore my napkin!"
He was very angry and sad. He liked his napkin.
"I'm sorry, Tom," Lily said. "I did not mean to tear your napkin."
She felt bad and gave him back his cheese.
Mom and Dad saw what happened. They were not happy.
"Lily, that was not nice. You should not take Tom's cheese or tear his napkin. You should ask politely and share," Mom said.
"And Tom, you should not shout at Lily. You should tell her how you feel and forgive her," Dad said.
Tom and Lily nodded. They knew Mom and Dad were right.
They hugged each other and said sorry.
"Can we have a new napkin, please?" they asked together.
Mom and Dad smiled and gave them each a new blue napkin.
They finished their lunch and wiped their mouths.
They were happy again.

Once upon a time, there was a hero. The hero was very strong and kind. The hero had a big sack. He carried the sack to help people.
One day, the hero saw a scary thing. The scary thing was big and loud. It made people sad and scared. The hero wanted to help them.
The hero took his sack and went to the scary thing. He used the sack to catch the scary thing. Then, the hero took the scary thing far away. The people were happy and safe. The hero was very proud.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tom. Tom wanted to be successful. He had a big dream. He wanted to count from one to ten in front of everyone. He practiced every day.
One day, there was a big show at school. Tom was very excited. He went on stage to count. He started, "One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine..." But then he forgot the next number! He said, "Zero!" instead of ten.
Everyone was quiet. No one did applaud. Tom felt sad. He did not count right, and he was not successful. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little rabbit. The rabbit lived in a comfortable home in the forest. The rabbit had many friends, but sometimes he felt lonely.
One day, the rabbit saw a bird in a tree. The bird stared at the rabbit. The rabbit stared back at the bird. Then, the rabbit said, "Hello, bird! Do you want to play with me?" The bird said, "Yes! I would love to play with you, rabbit."
The rabbit and the bird played all day. They became very good friends. Other animals in the forest saw them playing together and wanted to join. Soon, the rabbit was not lonely anymore. The rabbit learned that being kind and asking others to play can make new friends.
The moral of the story is: Being friendly and kind helps you make new friends.

Once upon a time, in a big park, there was a happy bunny. The bunny loved to play near the bush. One day, while the bunny was playing, something unexpected happened.
The bunny saw a big ball coming towards him. He jumped high to catch the ball. But when he landed, the bush was gone! The bunny was sad because the bush had vanished.
The bunny looked around and saw a big tree. Behind the tree, there was the bush! It had not vanished, but just moved. The bunny was so happy to find his bush again. He played near the bush and the big tree every day, and they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a big shark. The shark liked to swim in the sea. One day, the shark saw a small fish. The shark wanted the fish to be his friend. So, the shark swam up to the fish and said, "Be my friend!"
The small fish was scared. He did not want to be the shark's friend. He thought the shark was guilty. The fish thought the shark would eat him. The fish said, "No, I will not be your friend!" The shark was sad. He did not want to eat the fish. He just wanted a friend.
The shark did not give up. He demanded, "Please, be my friend!" The small fish saw that the shark was not guilty. He saw that the shark was nice. So, the fish said, "Okay, I will be your friend!" The shark and the fish became best friends. They swam in the sea together and played all day. And they lived happily ever after.

One day, a little boy named Tim went for a walk with his mom. They gazed at the pretty trees and flowers in the park. Tim saw a wallet on the ground. He picked it up and showed it to his mom.
His mom said, "Oh no! Someone lost their wallet. This is terrible. We must find the person who owns it." Tim and his mom looked around the park to find the person who lost the wallet.
They saw a sad man sitting on a bench. Tim's mom asked if the wallet was his. The man was so happy to get his wallet back. He thanked Tim and his mom for being so kind. The moral of the story is to always help others when they are in need.

Jimmy and Mommy played a game. They each had a magnet and took turns moving it around the room. Mommy taught Jimmy how to use his magnet. "Let's pick up the blocks," she said. 
Jimmy moved his magnet around the room. He was surprised when he saw the blocks move and stick to it. Mommy was proud of him. "You did it Jimmy! Magnets can be so helpful!" she said.
Jimmy kept playing, picking up anything he found with his magnet. He moved his magnet over Mommy's box of toys and all of the toys started to move and stick too. "Wow!" said Jimmy.
Mommy was happy too. She said, "Magnets are so helpful. Let's keep playing."
So, Jimmy and Mommy kept playing the game. Jimmy was having so much fun using the magnets to pick things up. He was so proud of himself. He was even more proud of Mommy for being so helpful.

One day, a little girl named Sue wanted to make a cake. She went to the kitchen and saw her mom. Sue asked, "Can I make a cake, Mom?" Her mom said, "Yes, let's make a cake together."
Sue and her mom started to mix the cake mix in a big bowl. It was fun to mix and it made a noisy sound. Sue laughed and said, "I like the noisy sound when we mix!" They mixed and mixed until the cake mix was smooth.
Next, they put the cake mix in the oven to bake. Sue and her mom waited for the cake to be done. When the cake was ready, they took it out of the oven. Sue was excited to taste the cake. She took a bite and said, "This cake has the best taste ever!" Sue and her mom were happy they made the cake together.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a little boy named Tim and his mom. Tim loved to eat popcorn. One day, Tim saw a big bowl of popcorn on the table. He was so happy and excited. He wanted to eat all the popcorn.
But, his mom said, "Tim, you can only have a little bit. You need to save some for later." Tim was sad, but he took a small handful of popcorn. When his mom wasn't looking, Tim took more popcorn. He ate and ate until the bowl was empty.
Later, his mom came back and saw the empty bowl. She was upset and said, "Tim, you didn't listen to me." Tim felt bad and said, "I'm sorry, mom. I didn't mean to eat it all." His mom looked at him and said, "I forgive you, Tim. Next time, let's share the popcorn and make it fit for both of us." And they hugged each other. From that day on, Tim always shared his popcorn with his mom.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to eat apples. One day, while walking in the park, he saw an ugly apple on the ground. It was brown and had spots on it. Tim thought it might still be good to eat.
Tim picked up the ugly apple and showed it to his mom. "Mom, can I eat this apple?" he asked. His mom looked at the apple and said, "No, Tim. That apple is not good to eat. It is ugly and old. We can get a fresh apple at home."
Tim felt sad but listened to his mom. Later, he saw a squirrel eating the ugly apple. The squirrel didn't seem to like it and ran away. Tim thought, "I'm glad I didn't eat that ugly apple. I would regret it if I did." So, Tim and his mom went home, and he ate a fresh, tasty apple instead. And they both lived happily ever after.

"Come on!" Mum said as they walked along the path. The sun was shining, and the little girl was excited to explore the world around her.
The girl followed her mother's lead and skipped along. Everywhere she looked, she saw something new and interesting. She saw trees with long branches, and pretty flowers stretching up towards the sky.
"Look, there's a stream!" the girl shouted. She ran over to the stream and watched the water ripple and flow. "It's so pretty!" she said.
Mum smiled. "It sure is." She scooped up some of the water in her hands and the girl followed suit. "Let's keep walking," Mum said.
The girl followed her mother as they walked along the path. She was excited to see what other wonders the world held. The path seemed to go on for a long time. But eventually, they reached the end. 
"Wow," said the girl, "we made it!"
Mum smiled. "We sure did," she said. "Isn't this world amazing?" 
The girl nodded. "It sure is!" She smiled and hugged her mother, feeling grateful to be able to explore this amazing world.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim was wearing a thick vest. He liked to play outside with his friends. One day, they played a game called "shoot".
In the game, they would throw a ball and try to hit a tree. They took turns and laughed a lot. Tim was very good at the game. He could shoot the ball very far.
After playing, Tim and his friends went home. They were happy and tired. They had lots of fun playing "shoot" with the thick vest. And they all lived happily ever after.

One day, a boy named Tim went on a tour with his mom and dad. They went to a big farm with many animals. Tim was very happy to see all the animals. He saw cows, pigs, and chickens. The farm was smelly, but Tim did not care. He loved the farm.
Tim saw a big pig in the mud. He wanted to touch it. His mom said, "Be careful, Tim." Tim went close to the pig and gave it a soft slap on its back. The pig made a loud noise, and Tim laughed.
After the tour, Tim and his family went home. Tim told all his friends about the smelly farm and the pig he slapped. Everyone wanted to go on a tour too. Tim could not wait to go back to the farm again.

Once upon a time, there was a big bull named Ben. Ben lived on a farm with his friends. He was very useful because he helped carry heavy things for the farmer.
One day, Ben saw a magic hat near the barn. He put the magic hat on his head and said, "I wish to vanish!" Suddenly, he disappeared! Ben was so happy that he could not be seen.
Ben's friend, a little bird named Tim, was looking for him. Tim asked the other animals, "Have you seen Ben?" They all said, "No, we have not seen him." Tim was sad, but he did not give up. He found the magic hat and said, "Please bring Ben back!" Ben appeared again, and everyone was happy. Ben learned that being seen was more useful than being invisible.

Once upon a time, there lived a little girl named Kara. She was only three years old. One day, she decided to go for a walk. As she strolled along, she heard a loud sound. It was coming from an old house.
Kara was curious, so she decided to peek into the house. Inside, she saw a crazy old woman. The woman was shouting at a little bird. The bird was trying to teach the woman how to fly. But the lady just kept yelling. The bird was starting to suffer.
Kara didn't like what she saw. She stepped into the house and said, "Why do you make that poor bird suffer?"
The woman was taken aback. She looked at Kara and said, "That bird is trying to teach me something. But I don't have to listen to it."
Kara replied, "It's not nice to make others suffer. You should be kind to all living things."
The woman smiled and said, "You're right. I won't let the bird suffer anymore."
Kara was happy to have helped. She smiled and said goodbye to the woman. As she left the old house, Kara realised that being kind to others is the best way to show love and care.

Once upon a time, there was a big, serious bear. He lived in a green forest. One day, he went for a walk.
As he walked, he met a small, happy rabbit. The rabbit said, "Hello, bear!" The bear said, "Hello, rabbit!" They became friends.
The big, serious bear gave the small, happy rabbit a big hug. They played all day. They were very happy. The end.

One day, a sweet little girl named Amy went to school. She had a new eraser in her bag. It was pink and smelled like candy. Amy was very happy to show her friends her new eraser.
During break time, Amy showed her eraser to her friend, Ben. "Look, Ben! I have a new eraser. It is sweet and pink," she said. Ben liked the eraser too. He asked, "Can I use it for a little bit?" Amy said, "Yes, but please return it when you are done." Ben promised to give it back.
Later, Amy could not find her eraser. She asked Ben, "Did you return my eraser?" Ben said, "I forgot, I am sorry." They both looked for the eraser everywhere. Finally, they found it under a big tree. Amy was happy to have her sweet eraser back. She knew that Ben would return it, just like he promised.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a wise old elephant. He had a big trunk and many friends. One day, a little bird came to the wise elephant. The bird was sad because its wing was hurt. The bird could not fly.
The wise elephant said, "Don't worry, little bird. I will help you heal your wing." The elephant used his big trunk to put a soft leaf on the bird's wing. The leaf helped the bird feel better.
But a naughty monkey saw the elephant helping the bird. The monkey wanted to play a trick on them. He took the leaf away from the bird's wing. The bird was sad again.
The wise elephant saw what the monkey did. He said, "Monkey, that is not nice. You should help your friends, not hurt them." The monkey felt sorry for what he did. He gave the leaf back to the bird.
The bird's wing healed, and it could fly again. The monkey learned to be a good friend. They all lived happily in the big forest.

The spoiled girl smiled as her mother handed her a shiny new pen.
"Please only use it when you do your homework!" her mother said. The girl nodded and set the pen on her desk.
The next day, the girl ran to her desk. She picked up the pen and wrote on the wall. She smiled as she saw the mark on the wall. 
The next morning, her mother came into her room and saw the mark. She closed her eyes for a moment. When she opened them, her eyes were full of anger.
"Did you use my pen to write on the wall?" she asked. The girl nodded and looked away.
"That was not the right way to use my pen," her mother said. "We use the things we are given for good things, not for something that makes a mess!"
The spoiled girl learned her lesson. From then on, she used her pen only for good things like homework and drawing pictures. She knew that please meant to use it properly.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot loved to play with his friends in the park. One day, he found a useful lotion in a small bottle. He didn't know what it was for, but he thought it might be fun to play with.
Spot showed the lotion to his friends. They all tried to guess what it could do. A small bird named Chirpy said, "Maybe it will help us fly higher!" They all wanted to see if Chirpy was right. Spot put some lotion on Chirpy's wings. Chirpy tried to fly, and he did succeed! He flew higher than ever before. All the other animals wanted to try the lotion too.
The animals learned that the lotion could help them do things they couldn't do before. They all became very good at what they did. But one day, the lotion was gone. The animals were sad and worried they would not be good anymore. But they soon realized that they could still do those things without the lotion. They just needed to believe in themselves. The moral of the story is that we can succeed if we believe in ourselves, even without a magic lotion.

Once upon a time, in a quiet little town, there lived a boy named Tim. Tim liked to pretend he was a big news reporter. He would tell his friends about the things happening in their town.
One day, Tim heard some news about a lost dog. He wanted to help find the dog, so he told his friends. They all went to look for the lost dog. They looked in the park, and they looked by the river, but they could not find the dog.
Then, Tim had an idea. He pretended to be a dog and started barking. The lost dog heard him and came running. Tim and his friends were so happy they found the lost dog. They took the dog back to its home, and everyone in the town was proud of Tim and his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to travel and explore new places. One day, he found a path near his house. He decided to see where it went. 
As Tim walked down the path, he met a big, silly dog. The dog said, "Woof! Don't go that way! It's a stupid path!" Tim looked at the dog and thought about what he said. He decided to keep going down the path.
Soon, Tim found a beautiful park with lots of flowers and a playground. He played there all day and made new friends. When it was time to go home, he thanked the dog for trying to help, but he was happy he didn't listen to the dog's advice.
The moral of the story is: Sometimes, you have to trust yourself and not always listen to others.

Once upon a time, there was a little pupil named Tim. Tim was very fearful of the dark. Every night, he would hope that the sun would not go down. He did not like going to bed because it was too dark and scary.
One day, his friend, Sally, told him about a magic night light. This night light would make the dark not so scary. Tim wanted to find this special light. He hoped it would help him not be fearful anymore.
Tim and Sally went to the store and found the magic night light. That night, Tim used the light and was not afraid of the dark. He was so happy! From then on, Tim and Sally were never fearful at night. They hoped that other kids would find magic night lights too.

Once upon a time, there were two friends - a ladybug and a caterpillar. They were the best of friends, but the ladybug always wished she could fly like a bird or a bee. One day, the caterpillar asked her why she'd never even tried. So, the ladybug flapped her wings and off she went into the sky. 
The caterpillar watched and felt jealous, but it was also very happy for her. She flew high and saw wonderful things. Meanwhile, a mosquito flew by and the ladybug began to shiver. But she kept flying and soon came back down to the ground.
The ladybug had seen the moon and stars and she was so proud. The caterpillar had to admit, he was a little jealous that she got to experience all of that. The excited friends hugged, and then laughed and laughed until it was late at night. Then, feeling happy and content, they said goodnight and went to bed.

One day, a little girl named Sue found a tray in her room. She felt happy because she could use it to carry her toys. She put her teddy bear, ball, and blocks on the tray. Sue walked around her room, holding the tray with her toys.
Sue's mom came into the room and saw the tray. "What a fine tray you have, Sue!" her mom said. Sue smiled and said, "Thank you, Mom! I like my tray." Sue's mom felt proud of her little girl.
Later, Sue's friend, Tim, came over to play. They used the tray to share their toys. They had lots of fun playing together. At the end of the day, Sue and Tim felt tired but happy. They put the toys back on the tray and said goodbye. Sue knew she would have more fun days with her tray and her friend.

Lily was eager to paint. She had a big paper, a brush and many colors. She wanted to make a picture of her family and her dog.
She held the brush and dipped it in red. She made a circle for her mom's face. Then she dipped the brush in brown and made her mom's hair. She smiled and said, "Mom, look! I am painting you!"
Mom looked and said, "That's very nice, Lily. I like your red and brown. What else are you going to paint?"
Lily said, "I am going to paint you a dress and a necklace. And then I am going to paint dad and me and Spot."
She held the brush and dipped it in blue. She made a dress for her mom. Then she dipped the brush in yellow and made a necklace. She said, "Mom, you are so pretty!"
Mom said, "Thank you, Lily. You are very sweet. And you are a good painter. I can't wait to see the rest of your picture."
Lily held the brush and dipped it in green. She made a circle for her dad's face. Then she dipped the brush in black and made his hair and glasses. She said, "Dad, look! I am painting you!"
Dad looked and said, "That's very nice, Lily. I like your green and black. You are very creative. Who else are you going to paint?"
Lily said, "I am going to paint me and Spot. We are going to be happy and play."
She held the brush and dipped it in pink. She made a circle for her face. Then she dipped the brush in orange and made her hair and a bow. She said, "This is me. I am cute!"
Dad said, "You are very cute, Lily. And you are a smart girl. How are you going to paint Spot?"
Lily said, "I am going to paint Spot with white and gray. He is a good dog. He likes to run and bark."
She held the brush and dipped it in white. She made a big oval for Spot's body. Then she dipped the brush in gray and made his ears, tail and spots. She said, "This is Spot. He is my friend!"
Mom and Dad said, "We love your picture, Lily. You did a great job. You are a wonderful artist!"
Lily said, "Thank you, Mom and Dad. I love you. And I love painting!"

Once upon a time there was a girl named Sierra. She was happy and helpful. Sierra had a waist as round as the moon. 
Every day, Sierra went outside and played. She called to the birds in the sky and ran around in the grass. One day, Sierra found a bug on the ground. It had four legs and waved its antennae to say hello. 
Sierra wanted to help the bug, so she put it carefully onto a flower. It seemed happy there! She watched it jump around until night time. 
Sierra smiled. She loved being helpful! She waved goodbye to the bug, feeling proud of her waist, and skipped back home. 
The end.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. Tim loved to play on the slide. He would climb up the stairs and slide down again and again. He was having so much fun.
As Tim was sliding, he saw a dark cloud in the sky. It started to rain. Tim and his mom ran under a big tree. They did not want to get wet. They waited for the rain to stop, but it did not.
Tim's mom had an idea. She called a taxi to take them home. When the taxi came, Tim and his mom got in. But this was not a normal taxi. As they started to drive, the taxi began to slide on the wet road like Tim on the slide. Tim and his mom laughed and laughed. The ride home was so much fun, even in the rain.

Once upon a time, there was an attractive bird. This bird had a shiny diamond. The bird loved the diamond very much. It made her feel special. She would show it to all her friends in the forest.
One day, the bird lost her diamond. She was very sad. She looked everywhere for it, but she could not find it. Her friends saw her crying and wanted to help her feel better.
So, her friends got together and found a pretty stone. They gave the stone to the bird to replace the diamond. The bird was happy again. She thanked her friends and knew that the pretty stone was just as special as the diamond.

Once upon a time, there was a big red car. It could drive very fast. One day, the big red car met a small blue car. The big red car was jealous of the small blue car. The small blue car could rub its wheels on the ground and make fun sounds.
The big red car said, "I want to be like you, small blue car. How do you make those fun sounds?" The small blue car smiled and said, "I will show you how to do it. Just watch me." The small blue car rubbed its wheels on the ground again and made the fun sounds. The big red car watched and learned.
The next day, the big red car tried to rub its wheels on the ground, just like the small blue car. At first, it was hard. But soon, the big red car could make the fun sounds too. The big red car was so happy. The small blue car was happy too. They became best friends and drove together, making fun sounds all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot was a very dirty dog. He liked to play in the mud all day. One day, Spot's mom said, "Spot, you need to wash yourself. You are very dirty."
Spot did not like to wash. He was ashamed of being a dirty dog, but he did not want to go to the water. So, Spot ran away from home. He ran and ran until he found a big building. It was a hospital.
In the hospital, Spot saw many people who were sick. The doctors and nurses told Spot, "You can't be dirty in the hospital. You have to wash to be clean." Spot felt very ashamed. He went back home and let his mom help him wash. From that day on, Spot was always a clean dog.

One day, a little worm was in the dirt. The worm was small and wiggly. The sun was up, and the sky was clear. The worm wanted to find a friend to hug.
The worm saw a big bird in the sky. The bird came down and said, "Hello, little worm. Do you want to be my friend?" The worm was happy and said, "Yes, I want to be your friend! Can I hug you?" The bird said, "Yes, you can hug me."
But when the worm tried to hug the bird, something unexpected happened. The worm was too small and could not hug the big bird. The bird had an idea. "Wait here, little worm," said the bird. The bird flew away and came back with a long piece of grass. The bird tied one end of the grass to the worm and the other end to itself. Now, the worm and the bird could hug each other by hugging the grass. They were both happy and became best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little tiger named Tim. Tim lived in a big jungle with many trees and flowers. One day, Tim saw a pretty flower that was about to bloom.
Tim was very curious about the flower. He asked his friend, the serious elephant, "What is this flower?" The elephant said, "This flower is very special. When it blooms, it will make the jungle even more beautiful."
Tim waited and watched the flower. After a little while, the flower started to bloom. It became big and colorful. Tim was so happy to see it. He said, "Wow, the flower is blooming! It makes our jungle so pretty."
The serious elephant smiled at Tim and said, "Yes, it does. And it reminds us that even small things can make a big difference in our world."
From that day on, Tim and the serious elephant took care of the blooming flowers and made their jungle a more beautiful place for everyone.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Amy. Amy had a pretty garden. She loved to care for her garden every day. It was easy for her to make the flowers grow big and strong. In the garden, there were red flowers, blue flowers, and yellow flowers.
One day, a boy named Tom came to visit Amy. He saw her garden and said, "Wow, your garden is so pretty! Can I help you care for it?" Amy thought for a moment and then said, "Yes, you can help me. But it's not easy. You have to be very careful."
Tom started to help Amy in the garden. But he didn't listen to Amy. He thought it was easy. He pulled the flowers too hard and they broke. The garden was not pretty anymore.
Amy was very sad. She said to Tom, "You didn't listen to me. Now my garden is not pretty." Tom felt bad, but it was too late. The garden was not pretty anymore, and Amy was sad.

Once there was a small girl who was feeling very lonely. She was sitting in her house all by herself. She looked out the window, but she couldn't see anyone. 
Just then, her finger started to move. It started pointing to the door. The little girl said to herself, 'I wonder what my finger is trying to tell me?' 
So she got up and walked to the door. When she opened it, she smiled. There was her best friend from down the street! They said hello and hugged each other. 
The little girl was so happy to have a friend. She knew she wouldn't feel lonely anymore. With her friend by her side, she felt like she had all the company she could ask for.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a boy named Tom. Tom had a light blue ball that he loved to play with. He would bounce it, throw it, and roll it all day long.
One day, while Tom was playing with his ball outside, a girl named Sue came over. Sue had a leather toy horse that she liked to play with. Sue saw Tom playing with his light blue ball and thought it looked like fun. So, Sue went up to Tom and offered to share her leather toy horse if Tom would share his light blue ball.
Tom thought Sue's leather toy horse was very cool, so he agreed to share his ball. They played together all day, taking turns with the light blue ball and the leather toy horse. They had so much fun that they became best friends. From that day on, Tom and Sue always shared their toys and played together. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She had a big book that she loved to read. One day, she lost her book and felt very sad.
Amy looked all over her room for the book. She found an empty box and thought maybe her book was inside. But when she opened the box, she realized it was not there. She kept looking and looking.
Finally, Amy found her book under her bed. She was so happy! She learned that if she kept her room clean and put her things away, she would not lose them. This is the end of the story, and the lesson is to always keep your things in their place.

One day, a cute little dog named Spot found a big maze. Spot wanted to play in the maze. He ran and jumped into the maze. Inside the maze, Spot met a tiny mouse named Mimi. Mimi was lost and scared.
Spot said, "Hi, Mimi! I will help you." Mimi was happy. They walked in the maze together. But then, they saw a big cat. The cat wanted to catch Mimi. Mimi was very scared.
Spot said, "Stop, cat! Do not catch Mimi!" The cat stopped. Spot and Mimi ran away fast. They found the way out of the maze. Mimi said, "Thank you, Spot!" They were safe and happy.

One day, a dog and a cat were playing outside. The dog was very patient and waited for the cat to finish playing with a ball. The cat said, "Let's go for a walk!" The dog thought it was a good idea and they went for a walk together.
While they were walking, they saw a big car. The cat said, "I want to drive the car!" The dog was not sure if that was a good idea. The dog said, "Do you have a license to drive?" The cat did not know what a license was, so the dog explained that they needed one to drive.
The cat was sad, but the dog had an idea. The dog suggested, "Let's find a toy car to play with instead!" The cat liked the idea and they went to look for a toy car. They found one and had lots of fun playing with it. And they didn't need a license to play with the toy car!

Once upon a time, there was a wise clown. The clown had a big red nose and funny clothes. He made people laugh and smile. The wise clown was very good at his job.
One day, the wise clown had to deliver a big box. Inside the box were toys and balloons for a birthday party. The wise clown put the big box on his little bike and rode to the party.
When the wise clown got to the party, he opened the big box. Out came the toys and balloons. The kids at the party were so happy. They played with the toys and laughed at the wise clown's funny tricks. The wise clown made everyone's day better.

One day, a mommy and her little girl set out on a journey. They traveled over hills and through valleys and stopped to admire the beautiful countryside. The air was peaceful and the sky was blue.
As they kept walking, the little girl noticed a tiny cobweb in a bush. She asked her mommy, "What is that?"
Her mommy smiled and said, "That's a cobweb, sweetheart. It's spun by a spider to catch food."
The little girl smiled and said, "That's so cool!" She loved exploring nature and looking for things like cobwebs.
After a few more minutes, they arrived at a beautiful lake. The little girl was mesmerized by the peacefulness of the lake. The mommy watched as the little girl ran around and collected special stones and flowers around the lake.
The little girl had a great time exploring and playing in the peaceful lake. The mommy and little girl finally ended their journey and went back home. What a wonderful day of travel!

Once upon a time there was a little bunny named Fluffy. Fluffy was very sleepy. One day, Fluffy's mommy called to him from the kitchen. She told him that it was time for breakfast, and it was Fluffy's favorite food - toast with jam. 
Fluffy hopped quickly to the kitchen, his ears flopping as he went! When he got there, he saw a big plate full of toast with delicious-looking jam spread on it. Fluffy's tummy rumbled, he was so hungry!
Fluffy gobbled up his toast and jam quickly, and soon he felt much better. He was no longer so sleepy - he was wide awake! Fluffy's mommy smiled and gave him a hug, and then it was time to go outside and play. 
Fluffy was so happy, he hopped around the garden. He could hear his mother calling him back for dinner, and he smiled as he ran back to the house.

One day, a little girl named Amy was playing outside. She saw her mom doing laundry. She wanted to help her mom. So, she went to her mom and said, "Mom, can I try to help you with the laundry?"
Her mom smiled and said, "Of course, Amy! You can help me hang these blue clothes on the line." Amy was so happy to help her mom. She picked up a blue shirt and tried to hang it on the line. But as she was doing it, a big wind came and blew the shirt away.
Amy and her mom looked at each other and laughed. They didn't expect that to happen! They ran after the blue shirt together. They had so much fun chasing the shirt and trying to catch it. In the end, they caught the shirt and finished hanging the laundry. They had a great day, and Amy learned that helping her mom could be a lot of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a lonely pumpkin. The pumpkin lived in a big garden. The pumpkin was sad because it had no friends.
One day, a little girl named Lily came to the garden. She saw the lonely pumpkin and wanted to help. Lily decided to make the pumpkin happy by finding it a friend.
Lily looked around the garden and saw a tiny bird. The bird was stuck in a bush. Lily helped the bird get out of the bush. The bird was very happy and flew to the pumpkin. The bird and the pumpkin became best friends. The lonely pumpkin was lonely no more. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a kind and compassionate girl named Lily. She loved to hold her big book of history and read it every day. The book was full of stories about brave people and animals from long ago.
One sunny day, Lily went to the park with her history book. She sat under a big tree and started to read. As she read, a little bird flew down and sat next to her. The bird looked at the book and said, "Can you tell me a story from your book?"
Lily smiled and said, "Of course!" She opened the book and told the bird a story about a brave dog who saved a family from a big storm. The bird listened carefully and loved the story. When Lily finished, the bird said, "Thank you for sharing your story with me!"
From that day on, Lily and the bird became best friends. They spent every day at the park, reading the history book together and sharing stories with each other. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a fat factory. It was big and shiny and made lots of things. Every day a little girl named Lucy would come to the factory and watch it work. She loved to see the bright lights and the loud noise!
One day, the factory stopped working. Nothing was coming out of it anymore. Lucy was so sad! She went up to the factory door and knocked on it. "Hello? Is anyone there?" she called out.
But no one answered. Lucy started to miss the factory. She missed the sounds and the lights. She missed how it used to make things. She was so sad.
Then, a voice called out. "Don't worry, Lucy!" it said. "I'm still here!" It was the factory! It said it was taking a break and asked if Lucy wanted to join it. Lucy smiled and said yes.
The factory and Lucy had fun together. They ran around and laughed and even made up new things that the factory could do. Lucy didn't miss the factory anymore.
