One day, a girl named Lucy went to a big market with her mom. She saw a vendor who was selling books. The vendor was a nice man, but he looked nervous.
Lucy wanted to help the vendor. She picked up a book and started to read it out loud. The words were easy for her to say. As she read, more people came to listen.
The vendor was happy and not nervous anymore. Many people bought books from him. Lucy felt good for helping the vendor. She went home with a new book to read.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She had a big, heavy guitar. Sue wanted to play the guitar, but it was too heavy for her. She asked her mom to help her. Her mom said, "Let's wait until you are bigger."
One day, Sue met a small, nice mouse. The mouse said, "I can help you with your guitar." Sue was happy. The mouse told her, "Let's go find a stick." They found a long stick, and the mouse tied the stick to the guitar.
The next day, Sue tried to play her heavy guitar again. With the stick, it was not too heavy. Sue was very happy. She played her guitar and sang a song. The nice mouse danced to the song. Sue and the mouse had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a toy cat that she loved very much. The cat was white and Lily thought it was very pretty. They played together every day and had lots of fun.
One day, Lily met a boy named Tom. Tom saw the white cat and said, "Wow, your cat is so pretty! Can I play with it too?" Lily smiled and said, "Yes, we can all play together!" So, Lily, Tom, and the white cat played and laughed all day long.
From that day, Lily and Tom became best friends. They always played with the pretty white cat and shared many happy moments. Their love for the cat brought them closer and they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a cool berry tree in the woods. Two friends, Tommy and Bella, were walking along the path. Tommy saw the tree and said to Bella, "Let's see if we can find some berries!"
Bella smiled and said, "Let's go!"
The two friends hurried to the berry tree. When they reached the berry tree, Bella found some yummy red berries and said, "Look! I found some cool berries here!"
But Tommy said, "I want to tease you. Let's see who can find the biggest berry!"
The two friends began to pick the biggest berry they could find. After a few minutes, Bella looked at her berry and said, "I won!"
Tommy laughed and said, "You sure did! That was a cool berry!"
Bella smiled and said, "Let's eat these berries and then go home."
Tommy and Bella enjoyed their delicious berries, and happily walked home together.

One day, a little boy named Tim was very eager to go outside and play. He put on his shoes and opened the door. But, as he stepped outside, he felt rain on his head. "Oh no!" he said, "I can't play outside now."
Tim's mom came to him and said, "Why don't you play inside? You can still have fun!" Tim thought for a moment and then smiled. He decided to play with his toy cars. He loved the motion of the cars as they zoomed across the floor.
As the rain fell outside, Tim played with his cars. He made them go fast and slow, and he even made them talk to each other. One car said, "I love the rain!" The other car replied, "Me too! It makes everything clean and fresh." Tim laughed and kept playing until the rain stopped, and he had a great day inside.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a fair. At the fair, people played games and ate good food. There was a kind lady who loved to knit. She had a lot of yarn in many colors.
One day, the kind lady met a little girl at the fair. The little girl was sad. She said, "I lost my hat and I am cold." The kind lady wanted to help the little girl. She said, "I will make you a new hat with my yarn."
The kind lady sent the little girl to play at the fair while she knitted a new hat. She used her soft, warm yarn to make a pretty hat. The little girl came back and saw the hat. She was very happy.
"Thank you for my new hat!" the little girl said. She put on the hat and felt warm. The kind lady smiled and said, "You're welcome! I am glad I could help you." The little girl and the kind lady became good friends and played together at the fair.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to play in the park. He saw a little girl named Amy playing with a ball. Tim wanted to play too, so he asked Amy, "Can I play with you?" Amy said, "Yes, let's play together!"
While they were playing, Tim threw the ball very hard. The ball hit Amy's arm and it hurt a lot. Amy started to cry. Tim felt bad and said, "I'm sorry, I didn't want to hurt you." Amy said, "My arm suffers now."
Then, something unexpected happened. A little dog came running to them. The dog had a special bag around its neck. The dog opened the bag and took out a magic band-aid. The dog put the band-aid on Amy's arm. Suddenly, Amy's arm felt better and she stopped crying.
Tim and Amy were very surprised and happy. They thanked the little dog and continued to play together. From that day on, they became best friends and always played gently with each other.

Once upon a time, there was a gray cat named Tom. Tom liked to walk around the town. One day, while walking, he saw a hammer on the ground.
"Hi hammer," said Tom, "Do you want to walk with me?" The hammer replied, "Yes, Tom. I would like that."
So Tom and the hammer walked and played together. They had so much fun. Tom was happy to have a new friend. And they lived happily ever after.

Once there was a little girl named Sarah. She was three years old and loved to explore. Everywhere she went, she brought a big smile and happy thoughts.
One day, Sarah went to the park with her family. There was a pond there, with lots of animals swimming around. Sarah noticed a bright yellow duck in the water and she wanted to get close to it.
"Be careful, Sarah," said her mom. "The water might hurt you."
But Sarah didn't listen, she walked closer and closer to the water. When she reached it, she felt something strange and a sudden pain in her foot.
"Looks like you stepped on a rock and hurt your foot," said her dad. 
Sarah started to cry but then realized something. The duck she had been looking at had changed colors. It was no longer a bright yellow but it was now a bright orange. 
"Look, Mommy and Daddy!" Sarah said. "The duck changed colors!" 
Sarah understood that she had taken a risk to get close to the duck, but it was worth it because she was able to see the beautiful colors of the duck. From that day forward, Sarah was always careful when she explored.

Lila and Ben were twins who liked to play in the garden. They had a big tree with purple fruits that they called prunes. They liked to pick the prunes and eat them, but they had to be careful not to eat too many or they would get a tummy ache.
One day, they saw a big basket of prunes on the table. Lila wanted to eat them all, but Ben said they should share with their mom and dad. Lila did not listen. She grabbed the basket and ran to her room. She locked the door and ate the prunes as fast as she could.
Ben knocked on the door and said, "Lila, please open the door. You should not eat all the prunes. They are not good for you. You should yield some to me and our parents."
But Lila did not answer. She felt her tummy getting tight and sore. She wished she had listened to Ben. She started to cry.
Mom and dad heard the crying and came to the door. They asked, "Lila, what is wrong? Why did you lock the door?"
Lila said, "I'm sorry, mom and dad. I ate all the prunes and now my tummy hurts. I was greedy and did not share with Ben. I did not yield any prunes to him or you."
Mom and dad hugged Lila and said, "It's okay, Lila. We forgive you. But you have to learn to share and be generous. Prunes are good, but too many can make you sick. Next time, yield some to others and you will feel better."
Lila nodded and said, "I'm sorry, Ben. I should have shared with you. Will you forgive me?"
Ben smiled and said, "Of course, Lila. You are my twin and I love you. But next time, please yield some prunes to me. They are my favorite too."
Lila and Ben hugged and said, "We love you, mom and dad. Thank you for the prunes. We will share them next time."
Mom and dad smiled and said, "We love you too, Lila and Ben. You are our sweet prunes. Now, let's go to the garden and see if the tree has more prunes for us."
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a lively girl named Lucy. She was playing in the park when she saw an old key lying on the ground. She decided to join the key with her.
When Lucy got home, she showed her key to her mommy. Her mommy said, "Oh, that is a very special key! You must take good care of it, okay?" Lucy said, "Okay".
But the next day, Lucy decided to take the key back to the park. A big bad guy was there. He said to Lucy, "How about you give me the key? I promise I won't hurt you." Lucy knew she had to be brave and she said, "No! That key belongs to me!"
The bad guy got very angry and he took the key away from Lucy. Lucy started to cry. Then the bad guy ran away with the key.
The bad guy never came back. Lucy was very sad that she had lost her key and she never saw it again.

Once upon a time, there was a small boy. He was 3 years old. The boy wanted to find a pillow. He looked around everywhere, but he couldn't find one. Nothing seemed available. He tried the shop, but there were no pillows. He asked his mom, but she said there were no pillows in the house. The boy was feeling sad.
Suddenly, a bright idea came to him. He smiled and ran outside. He went to the park and looked around. Sure enough, there was a pillow there! It seemed that it had been left behind and was available for him to take.
The boy was so excited. He picked up the pillow and hugged it tight. Now he had his own pillow and could take a nap whenever he wanted. He thanked the pillow and went happily home.
The boy knew he would never forget his special pillow. It seemed like the perfect fit for him.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, a little rabbit named Max had a big horn. Max loved his horn so much. He was always very careful with it.
One day, Max met a big bear named Ben. Ben saw Max's horn and said, "Wow, Max! That horn is so big! Can you write with it?" Max thought about it and said, "I don't know, but I can try!"
Max tried to write with his horn on the ground, but he was not careful enough. He pushed too hard, and his horn broke into two pieces. Max was very sad and cried. Ben felt bad and said, "I'm sorry, Max. I didn't mean for your horn to break."
Max learned that he should be more careful with his things. But now, his big horn was gone, and he couldn't fix it. Max and Ben went back to their homes in the forest, both feeling sad about the broken horn.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a wallet on the ground. He was very excite. He ran to his mom and said, "Look, Mom! I found a wallet!"
His mom said, "That's great, Tim! But we need to find the owner. They must be sad." Tim was a persistent boy, so he agreed to help his mom find the owner of the wallet.
They asked their friends and neighbors if they lost a wallet. Nobody knew who it belonged to. Then, they saw a sad man sitting on a bench. Tim walked up to the man and asked, "Did you lose a wallet?" The man smiled and said, "Yes, I did! Thank you for finding it!" Tim felt happy that he helped the man and learned the importance of helping others.

Once upon a time, there was a shy little girl named Lily. She lived in a small house with her mom and dad. Every day, Lily would go to the park and sit under a big cherry tree. She loved to watch the sun rise in the sky.
One day, while Lily was sitting under the cherry tree, she saw a tiny bird. The bird was sad and couldn't fly. Lily said, "Hi bird! Why are you sad?" The bird replied, "I'm too shy to fly. I'm scared of the sky."
Lily wanted to help the bird. She thought of a plan. She picked some cherries from the tree and put them on the ground. The bird hopped closer to the cherries. Then, Lily put cherries on the tree's branches, higher and higher. The bird followed the cherries, hopping from branch to branch. Soon, the bird was at the top of the tree.
The bird looked at the sky and said, "I'm not scared anymore!" Then, the bird started to fly. Lily clapped her hands and laughed. She was happy that the bird could fly. The bird was not shy anymore, all thanks to Lily and the cherry tree.

One day, a boy named Tim was playing in his room. He saw a big couch in the middle of the room. It was a normal couch, with soft cushions and a nice color. Tim liked to sit on the couch and play with his toys.
While playing with his toys, Tim saw a picture on the wall. It was hanging near the couch. Tim thought it would be fun to try and hang like the picture. So, he climbed up onto the couch and tried to hang from the wall. But, he could not reach the picture.
Just then, something unexpected happened. The couch started to move! It was not a normal couch after all. The couch had wheels and it began to roll around the room. Tim was surprised and laughed as the couch took him on a fun ride. After a while, the couch stopped moving and went back to being a normal couch. Tim had a great time and knew that his couch was special.

Ben and Mia are playing with their toy cars on the floor. Ben has a big red car and Mia has a small blue car. They make vroom-vroom noises and pretend to drive around the room.
But then Ben wants to go where Mia is going. He tries to push her car out of the way with his car. Mia says, "No, Ben, this is my road. You have to yield. That means you have to let me go first."
Ben does not like to yield. He says, "No, Mia, this is my road. You have to yield. I am bigger and faster than you." He pushes harder with his car.
Mia gets angry and sad. She says, "Ben, you are not being nice. You are hurting my car and my feelings. You have to share and take turns. That is what friends do."
Ben feels sorry. He sees that Mia's car has a scratch and a dent. He says, "I am sorry, Mia. I was being mean. I did not mean to hurt your car and your feelings. Can we still be friends?"
Mia nods. She says, "Yes, Ben, we can still be friends. But you have to be more careful and gentle with my car. It is not as strong as yours."
Ben agrees. He says, "OK, Mia, I will be more careful and gentle. And I will yield sometimes. Can I do something to make your car feel better?"
Mia thinks. She says, "Well, maybe you can give it a massage. That means you rub it softly with your hands. That can make it feel good and fix the scratch and the dent."
Ben likes that idea. He says, "OK, Mia, I will give your car a massage. And you can give my car a massage too. Maybe we can use some of this thick cream. It smells nice and it can make the cars shiny."
Mia likes that idea too. She says, "OK, Ben, let's do that. Then we can play some more with our cars. And we can have fun and be nice to each other."
They smile and hug. They get some thick cream and start to massage their cars. They make vroom-vroom noises and pretend to drive around the room. They are happy and they are friends.

Once upon a time, there was a big onion. The onion had a friend named Tim. Tim was a careless boy. One day, Tim and the onion went to the park to play.
At the park, they saw a dog. The dog was hungry. The dog said, "I want to eat you, onion." The onion was scared. Tim told the onion, "Don't worry, I will help you."
Tim and the onion hurry away from the dog. They run and run until they are safe. Tim says, "We are safe now, onion." The onion is happy and thanks Tim for helping.
From that day on, Tim and the onion were best friends. They played together every day and had lots of fun. And Tim learned to be more careful, so the onion would always be safe.

There was a cop in the neighborhood who wanted to help everyone. One day, he was walking around when he heard a noise coming from an alley. He went to investigate. He saw a child crying, so he asked what was wrong. 
The child said that he was scared of a rat that he saw in the alley. It made him feel really disgusting.
The cop said, "Don't worry, I'm here to help. I'll take care of it." He took out his big stick and chased the rat away. 
The little kid was so relieved. He said thank you to the cop and then went on his way. The cop smiled and went back to his patrol.

Tom and Sue are friends. They like to play together. Today they want to play dress-up. They go to Sue's room and look for clothes.
"Look, Tom, I have a pink dress. Do you want to try it?" Sue asks.
Tom nods. He likes pink. He takes the dress and puts it on. But the dress is too small for him. It is tight on his arms and legs. He feels uncomfortable.
"Sue, this dress is tight. I can't move. Can I have another one?" Tom says.
Sue looks at Tom. She sees that the dress is tight. She feels sorry for him.
"I'm sorry, Tom. That dress is for me. It is not for you. You can have this shirt and pants. They are blue. Do you like blue?" Sue says.
Tom smiles. He likes blue. He takes off the dress and puts on the shirt and pants. They fit him well. He feels happy.
"Thank you, Sue. I like this shirt and pants. They are not tight. They are good for me. You look pretty in your dress. Can we play now?" Tom says.
Sue nods. She likes Tom. She is happy that he likes his clothes. She takes a hat and a scarf and puts them on.
"Yes, Tom. We can play now. Let's pretend we are going to a party. We can discuss what we will do there. Come on, let's go!" Sue says.
Tom and Sue hold hands and go to the living room. They play dress-up and discuss their party. They have fun. They are good friends.

Once upon a time, in a peaceful park, there lived a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his football. One sunny day, he went to the park with his mom to play.
While playing, Tim saw a big tree. He wanted to lift his football high in the sky and throw it. So, Tim lifted his football, but it got stuck in the tree. He was sad and didn't know what to do.
Just then, a friendly squirrel came by and said, "Don't worry, I'll help you!" The squirrel climbed the tree and pushed the football out. Tim was very happy and said, "Thank you, squirrel!" They became good friends and played together in the peaceful park every day.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Sue had a pretty scarf. She loved her scarf very much. Sue wore her scarf every day, even when it was hot outside. One day, she went to the park with her mom and dad. The sky was clear and the sun was shining.
At the park, Sue played on the swings and the slide. She was very happy. But then, she started to struggle with her scarf. It was too hot to wear it. Sue took off her scarf and put it on the bench. She went back to play, but soon she forgot about her scarf.
Later, a small dog came to the park. The dog saw Sue's scarf on the bench. It picked up the scarf in its mouth and ran away. When Sue noticed her scarf was gone, she was sad. But then, she saw the dog wearing her scarf like a cape, running around the park. Sue laughed and clapped her hands. The dog was now a superhero! Sue and the dog played together, and from that day on, they were best friends.

Once upon a time, in an ancient forest, there was a big tree with a little hole. In the hole, a small bird with a broken wing lived. The bird could not fly, but it was happy to remain in the hole.
One day, a kind squirrel saw the bird with the broken wing. The squirrel wanted to help, so it brought nuts and berries for the bird to eat. The bird was very happy and said "thank you" to the squirrel.
Days went by, and the bird's wing started to heal. Soon, the bird could fly again. The bird and the squirrel became good friends. They played together and had fun in the ancient forest. And they remained friends forever.

Once upon a time, there was a big wardrobe in a room. The wardrobe had many pretty clothes inside. One day, a little girl named Lucy went to the room to pick a dress to wear. She saw a beautiful dress with flowers on it. Lucy wanted to wear the dress, but it belonged to her big sister, Lily.
Lucy wore the dress and went to show her friends. When her friends saw the dress, they said, "Wow, Lucy! That dress is so pretty!" Lucy felt very happy, but she also felt a little ashamed. She knew she should not have taken Lily's dress without asking.
When Lucy came home, Lily saw the dress and said, "Lucy, that's my dress! You should not take things without asking." Lucy felt very bad and said, "I'm sorry, Lily. I will ask next time." Lily pointed at the wardrobe and said, "Let's put the dress back and find one that is just for you."
They put the dress back in the wardrobe and found a nice dress for Lucy. Lucy learned that it is important to ask before taking things that do not belong to her.

Once there was a boy and a girl. They were best friends and loved to play together. One day, the boy invited the girl to come to his house. The girl was very excited, but a bit embarrassed. She didn't know if he really wanted her to come.
When the girl arrived, the boy took her to his bedroom. He had drawn a big line on the floor. He told her that they were going to play 'jumping the line'. The girl was so happy.
The two of them jumped and laughed and had lots of fun. The girl was no longer embarrassed. She saw that the boy had just wanted her to come so that they could have fun together.

Once upon a time, there was a restless boy named Tim. Tim liked to run and play all day. He had a big part in making his friends laugh.
One day, Tim and his friends were playing near a big tree. They saw a small bird with a hurt wing. The bird could not fly. Tim wanted to help the bird, so he and his friends took it to a kind doctor.
The doctor looked at the bird and said, "This bird has a hurt lung, too. But I can fix it." The doctor helped the bird and it got better. Then, something unexpected happened. The bird started to talk! The bird said, "Thank you, Tim and friends, for helping me." The bird was a magic bird! From that day on, the bird and Tim were best friends.

Once there was a girl called Lily. Lily was three years old. She had a very special room with a warm yellow curtain. Whenever she wanted to be alone, she would go and sit behind the curtain. She would close her eyes and think about all the things she wanted to do when she was bigger.
Lily liked playing in her room. She would take out all of her blocks and dolls and lay them on the floor. She imagined she was building a castle and sailing away in a boat. 
One day, Lily was feeling very warm. The sun was shining, so she opened her curtain and let the sunshine in. She lay down on the floor and looked at the way the sun lit up the room. She closed her eyes and thought about the games she could play in the sunshine.
Lily was so happy to see the sunny days and it filled her heart with warmth. Every day she spent in her room behind the warm curtain was a day of adventure. She closed her eyes and thought of all the places she wanted to explore.

Anna and Ben were having lunch with their mom. They had soup and bread and cheese. Mom gave them each a fork to eat the cheese. Anna liked cheese a lot. She used her fork to cut a big piece and put it in her mouth. She smiled and said, "Yummy!"
Ben did not like cheese. He looked at his fork and then at his cheese. He did not want to eat it. He pushed his plate away and said, "No cheese!" Mom frowned and said, "Ben, you have to eat your cheese. It is good for you. Be a good boy and use your fork."
Ben shook his head and said, "No cheese! No fork!" He threw his fork on the floor. Mom was angry and said, "Ben, that is not nice. Pick up your fork and eat your cheese. Or you will have no dessert." Ben did not care. He crossed his arms and said, "No cheese! No fork! No dessert!"
Anna stared at Ben. She could not believe he was so naughty. She liked dessert. She wanted to have cake and ice cream. She was obedient and ate her cheese with her fork. She said to Ben, "Ben, you are silly. Cheese is good. Fork is good. Dessert is good. Eat your cheese and be happy."
Ben stared at Anna. He did not understand why she liked cheese. He thought cheese was yucky. He did not want to eat it. He did not want to use his fork. He did not want to be happy. He said to Anna, "Anna, you are silly. Cheese is bad. Fork is bad. Dessert is bad. I don't want to eat anything."
Mom sighed and said, "Ben, you are making me sad. You have to eat something. How about some bread? Do you want some bread?" Ben looked at the bread. He liked bread. He nodded and said, "Yes, bread. Bread is good." Mom smiled and said, "OK, Ben. Here is some bread. But you have to use your fork. Can you do that?" Ben looked at his fork. He did not like his fork. But he wanted some bread. He picked up his fork and said, "OK, fork. Fork is OK." He used his fork to eat some bread. Mom and Anna were happy. They ate their lunch and then had some dessert. Ben liked cake and ice cream. He said, "Yummy!"

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. Tim saw a big red ball. He wanted to play with it. Tim said, "Mom, can I kick the ball?" His mom said, "Yes, but be careful."
Tim ran to the ball and kicked it very hard. The ball flew high into the sky. Suddenly, a big bird caught the ball in its beak. Tim was scared. He did not know what to do. His heart was beating fast.
The big bird flew down and dropped the ball in front of Tim. Tim was not scared anymore. He said, "Thank you, bird!" The bird chirped and flew away. Tim played with the ball and had lots of fun.

Lily and Ben wanted to go to the zoo. They liked to see the animals and hear their sounds. But they needed a ticket to enter the zoo. They asked their mom if she could provide them with a ticket.
"Mom, can we go to the zoo today?" Lily asked.
"Please, mom, we want to see the lions and the monkeys and the penguins!" Ben added.
Mom smiled and said, "Sure, we can go to the zoo. But first, we have to do some chores. Lily, you have to tidy up your room. Ben, you have to help me with the dishes. Then, I will provide you with a ticket for the zoo."
Lily and Ben agreed and did their chores. They worked hard and fast. They wanted to go to the zoo as soon as possible. When they finished, they ran to their mom and said, "Mom, we are done! Can we have our ticket now?"
Mom nodded and gave them each a ticket. She said, "Good job, kids. You are very helpful and responsible. Now, let's go to the zoo and have some fun!"
Lily and Ben were very happy. They thanked their mom and hugged her. They put on their hats and sunscreen. They got in the car and drove to the zoo. They saw many animals and learned many things. They had a cool day at the zoo. They loved their mom and their ticket.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to play outside. He saw a big net near the trees. He wanted to use the net to catch a ball. Tim's friend, Sue, came over to play too. Sue had a new, big ball. Tim felt jealous because he wanted a big ball too.
Tim and Sue played catch with Sue's big ball. They threw the ball and tried to catch it with the net. They laughed and had fun. Then, Tim said, "I want to throw the ball very high!" So, he threw the ball as high as he could.
But, something unexpected happened. The ball went too high and got stuck in a tree! Tim and Sue looked up and did not know what to do. They tried to use the net to get the ball down, but the net was not long enough. Tim felt sad and said, "I'm sorry, Sue. I didn't mean to get your ball stuck."
Just then, a big wind came and made the tree shake. The ball fell down from the tree and landed right in the net! Tim and Sue were so happy. They laughed and played catch again. Tim was not jealous anymore, because they could both have fun with Sue's big ball.

Once upon a time, there was an attractive pilot. He loved to fly planes high in the sky. One day, he saw a little bird who looked sad.
The pilot asked the bird, "Why are you sad, little bird?" The bird said, "I lost my family. I don't know where they are." The pilot wanted to help the bird find its family.
So, the pilot and the bird flew up in the sky, looking for the bird's family. They looked left and right, up and down. Finally, they found the bird's family in a big tree.
The bird was very happy and said, "Thank you, pilot, for helping me find my family." The pilot smiled and said, "You're welcome, little bird. We should always help each other."
The moral of the story is: Be kind and help others when they need it.

Once upon a time, there was a brave boy named Peter. He was very special and unique. In his town they had a bow. Peter wanted to try out the bow, but nobody ever dared him. He asked all his friends, but nobody wanted to do it.
One day, Peter got a daring idea. 'I can do it!' he thought. He stayed up late that night, making sure he was ready for the challenge. 
Peter was very brave, so he went up to the bow and grabbed it. Everybody watched in surprise. He was determined to be the first person to use the bow.
He pulled back the bow and with a twang, he fired an arrow. The arrow flew through the air. Peter had successfully become the first person to use the bow! Everyone was very impressed and clapped for Peter.
From that day on, Peter was known for his brave and unique behavior.

Once upon a time there was a boy named Tim. He was three years old. He was playing outside when he saw a cut on the sidewalk. He wanted to look at it, but his mom told him to ignore it.
So, Tim ignored the cut, and he kept playing. After a bit, he decided to get messy. He got some mud and made a big squishy pile. When he was done, it was very messy.
His mom came out and saw the messy pile. She was not happy. She told him to clean it up, but Tim decided to ignore her. He just sat there in the mud and smiled.
His mom knew that he was ignoring her, so she made him clean it up. After he finished, he promised not to ignore his mom again and to always listen to her.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia loved the sea. One sunny day, she went to the beach with her mom and dad. They were very happy.
Mia was very careful near the sea. She liked to watch the fish swim and the waves splash. Her mom said, "Welcome to the sea, Mia! Let's have fun today!" Mia smiled and clapped her hands.
Mia and her mom built a big sandcastle near the sea. They put shells on it to make it pretty. Her dad found a crab and showed it to Mia. She laughed and said, "Hello, crab!" They all had a great day at the beach.

Once upon a time, there was a jolly dog named Spot. Spot liked to play with his ball and run in the park. He had a big smile on his face every day.
One day, Spot met a little girl named Sue. Sue was sad because she lost her toy. Spot wanted to help Sue find her toy. He said, "Let's look for your toy together!" Sue smiled and said, "Thank you, Spot!"
They looked and looked until they found the toy under a tree. Sue was so happy! She said, "You are the best, Spot!" They played together all day long. Spot was jolly and Sue had a big smile on her face. They became best friends forever.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who was very impatient. She loved butterflies, so she asked her Mom if they could buy a butterfly.
Her Mom said yes, so they drove to the store. The little girl was so excited she couldn't sit still in the car!
Finally, they arrived at the store and the little girl looked around. She saw so many butterflies! She couldn't choose just one, so she asked her mom to help her.
Finally, they bought a beautiful butterfly with colorful wings. The little girl was very happy, and they took the butterfly home.
The little girl decided to put it in a special jar so it could fly around. She smiled and said, "Look Mom, my butterfly!"

One day, a strong man named Tom went to the subway. He wanted to ride the train to see his friend. As he waited, he met a little girl named Sue. Sue was lost and wanted to find her mom.
"Hi, I'm Tom. What happened?" he asked. Sue said, "I lost my mom. Can you help me?" Tom wanted to help Sue, so they looked for her mom together.
As they looked, something unexpected happened. A big dog ran into the subway! The dog barked and wagged its tail. It was Sue's dog, Max! Max led them to Sue's mom. Sue was so happy to find her mom and thanked Tom for his help.

One day, a girl named Lily got an invitation. The invitation was for a fun show. Lily was very happy. She wanted to watch the show with her friends.
Lily and her friends went to the show together. They saw a big, organized room. There were many people there. They all sat down and got ready to watch.
The show started and everyone watched. They saw funny clowns and pretty dancers. Everyone laughed and clapped. Lily and her friends had a great time at the show.

Once there was a small girl who loved to watch cartoons. She loved them so much that one day she decided to twist the cartoon characters into shapes she liked. She got so carried away that she didn't realize how hot it was getting in her room. When she looked down, she saw that the cartoon characters she had twisted were starting to melt.
The little girl was so sad and felt terrible for what she had done. She knew that she should have done the right thing and stopped when she felt the heat getting stronger.
The little girl learned an important lesson that day. She should never do something too hot for her to handle because it might result in something bad happening.

One day, a big colorful cow was eating hay in a field. The cow liked the hay a lot. The sun was shining and the cow was happy.
A small bird came to the cow and said, "Can I have some hay too?" The cow said, "Yes, you can have some hay." The bird took some hay and said, "Thank you, cow."
Then, something unexpected happened. The hay turned into yummy candy! The cow and the bird were very surprised. They ate the candy and became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a big cat named Tom. Tom had a ball that he loved to play with. One day, Tom saw a small hole in the wall. He thought his ball would fit in the hole. So, he pushed the ball into the hole. But the ball got stuck! Tom was sad and didn't know what to do.
Tom's friend, Sam the dog, came to help. Sam had a long stick. He said, "I will use the stick to get the ball out." Sam tried to push the ball out, but it didn't work. Then, Sam had an idea. He said, "Let's go to the other side of the wall and see if there is a way to get the ball out."
Tom and Sam went to the other side of the wall. There, they found a secret pass! They walked through the pass and saw a big room full of balls, even bigger than Tom's ball! Tom was so happy and surprised. He and Sam played with the big balls and had lots of fun. Tom felt proud that he found the secret pass and the big room. From that day on, Tom and Sam played together in the big room, and they were the best of friends.

Lily and Tom were playing in the garden. They liked to pretend they were animals. Lily had a mask that looked like a cat. Tom had a mask that looked like a dog.
"Meow, meow, I am a cat," Lily said. She put on her mask and jumped on the grass.
"Woof, woof, I am a dog," Tom said. He put on his mask and ran after Lily.
They had fun chasing each other and making noises. They were happy.
But then, Lily saw a bee. She was scared of bees. She ran away from the bee and tripped over a rock. She fell down and hurt her knee. She cried.
Tom heard Lily cry. He stopped playing and ran to her. He saw her knee was bleeding. He took off his mask and said, "Don't cry, Lily. I will help you."
He took a leaf and wrapped it around her knee. He said, "This will make it better. You are brave, Lily."
Lily stopped crying. She smiled and said, "Thank you, Tom. You are kind, Tom."
She took off her mask and hugged him. They were friends.

Once upon a time, a little ant named Andy loved to dance. He would dance on a stage made of leaves. All his friends would come to watch him dance. One day, Andy was getting ready to finish his big dance show. He was very excited.
As Andy danced on the stage, a big wind blew. It made the leaves fly away. "Oh no!" Andy cried. "My stage is gone!" All his friends were sad too. They did not know what to do. Andy felt dead inside.
Just then, a friendly spider named Sally came by. She saw the sad friends and asked, "Why are you sad?" Andy told her about the stage. Sally had an idea. She used her web to make a new stage for Andy. "Thank you, Sally!" Andy said. He danced on the new stage and all his friends clapped. The show was a big hit and everyone was happy.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Tom loved to ride his red bike. He would ride it all around his yard, up and down the street, and sometimes at the park. One day, Tom saw a big hanger in his yard. He wondered what it could be for. 
Tom asked his mom, "Mom, what is this hanger for?" His mom smiled and said, "It's for hanging clothes, Tom. But you can play with it if you want." Tom was so happy to play with the hanger. He thought it would be fun to ride his bike while holding the hanger.
Tom rode his bike very slow, holding the hanger with one hand. He pretended the hanger was a kite, flying high in the sky. Tom's friend, Lily, saw him and asked, "What are you doing, Tom?" Tom said, "I'm riding my bike with my kite!" Lily laughed and said, "That's not a kite, it's a hanger!" They both laughed and played together, riding their bikes and having fun with the hanger.

One day, a lovely girl named Lily went to the store with her mom. They needed to buy some things for their home. Lily was very excited to go shopping with her mom.
At the store, Lily saw a pretty hanger. She asked her mom, "Mom, can we buy this hanger, please?" Her mom looked at the hanger and said, "Yes, Lily, we can buy the hanger. It is very lovely."
They bought the lovely hanger and went back home. Lily was so happy to hang her favorite dress on the new hanger. She showed her dad the hanger and said, "Look, Dad! We bought a lovely hanger!" Her dad smiled and said, "That's a very pretty hanger, Lily."

Once upon a time, there was a big dog named Spot. Spot lived in a small house with his best friend, a little girl named Lily. They loved to play in the yard together. One day, they saw a distant hill and decided to go on an adventure.
As they walked, Spot started to feel an itch on his back. He tried to scratch it, but it was too hard to reach. Lily saw Spot's itch and wanted to help. She remembered that she had a special brush at home that could help Spot.
Lily and Spot went back home to get the brush. Lily used the brush to scratch Spot's itch, and he felt much better. After that, they went back to their adventure and had a great time playing on the distant hill. They always remembered their fun day and the itch that brought them back home.

One day, a little boy named Tim was eager to find a hidden chamber in his house. He knew it was somewhere, but he did not know where. Tim wanted to succeed in finding it.
Tim looked in every room. He looked under his bed, behind the door, and even in the closet. Then, he found a small door in the wall. Tim opened the door and saw the chamber. He was so happy to succeed in finding it.
Inside the chamber, Tim found toys and games. He played with them all day. He was glad he had found the hidden chamber. Tim knew that when you try hard, you can succeed in anything.

One day, a little boy named Tim was playing with his toy car. It was a very expensive car that his mom and dad got for him. He loved his car so much and played with it every day.
While he was playing, Tim suddenly heard a loud noise. It sounded like an emergency! He looked around and saw a big truck coming down the street. The truck was going very fast and made a loud sound. Tim was scared and didn't know what to do.
But then, the big truck stopped right in front of Tim's house. The truck driver came out and gave Tim a big box. Inside the box was a brand new toy car! The loud noise was not an emergency at all. It was just the truck bringing Tim a new toy. Tim was so happy and couldn't wait to play with both of his cars.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim liked to play with his toy cars. One day, Tim saw his dad working on a car. His dad was very messy. There was oil and dirt everywhere. Tim wanted to help his dad. He asked, "Can I help, Dad?"
His dad said, "Sure, Tim. Just be careful. This is an operation." Tim leaned on the car, trying to see what his dad was doing. But he leaned too much and fell into the messy oil. Tim got oil all over his clothes and face.
Tim's dad was not happy. He said, "Tim, you made a big mess. Now we have to clean you up and the car too." Tim felt sad that he made his dad upset. The day did not end well for Tim, and he learned to be more careful when trying to help.

Lily and Ben were twins who liked to play together. One day, they found a big box in the garage. They wanted to make a fort with the box, but it was too heavy for them to move.
"Let's ask Dad to help us," Lily said.
"OK," Ben agreed.
They ran to the kitchen, where Dad was making lunch. They asked him to support them with the box. Dad smiled and said he would help them after they ate.
Lily and Ben were restless. They could not wait to play with the box. They ate their lunch very fast and ran back to the garage. They saw that Dad had moved the box to the backyard. He had also cut a door and a window in the box.
"Wow, thank you, Dad!" Lily and Ben said.
"You're welcome, kids. Have fun with your fort," Dad said.
Lily and Ben climbed into the box. They pretended it was a castle, a spaceship, and a cave. They had a lot of fun with their fort. They gave each other a look of happiness. They were glad that Dad had supported them with the box.

Once upon a time, there was a blue bird named Bob. Bob loved to eat oats. One day, while flying, he saw a big oat field. Bob was very happy.
In the field, Bob met a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to play with his toy that could shoot. Tim said, "Hi, bird! My toy can shoot. Do you want to play with me?"
Bob nodded his head and played with Tim. They had fun shooting the toy at the oats in the field. They laughed and played all day.
At the end of the day, Bob and Tim were tired. They sat down and shared some oats. They became good friends and promised to play together again. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, in a far away land, there was a small, unknown flower. It was alone and unloved, until one day, a magical visit happened. The flower started to bloom and it was so happy! Everywhere it looked, it could see other flowers, bees, butterflies and wonderful creatures.
The little flower was overjoyed and wanted to make new friends. It wished every day for a visit from someone new and special. So, one day, the flower got its wish! A beautiful little girl and her family came to visit. She was curious about the little flower and asked her mom why it was all alone.
The family laughed and explained that the flower was waiting for them to come and see it. The girl was so happy and the flower felt like blooming even more. She was no longer alone and unknown. She was part of the family and was loved. The little flower was so happy and it knew it had found its forever home. 
The moral of the story is that if you are patient, something wonderful will always come your way. No matter how alone and unknown you feel, never give up on finding your place. Believe that something special is on its way and it will bloom in the end!

One day, a little duck went to the lake. The sky was gloomy and the duck felt sad. The duck wanted to play, but no friends were there.
The little duck saw a big fish in the lake. The fish yawned and said, "I am tired and bored. Will you play with me?" The duck was happy to have a friend to play with.
They played in the lake all day. The sky was not gloomy anymore, and the sun came out. The little duck and the big fish were not sad anymore. They were friends and had lots of fun.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to a shop with his mom. He saw a big sack full of toys. Tim asked his mom, "Can I have one toy, please?" His mom smiled and said, "Yes, you can pick one toy."
Tim looked at the sack and saw a fragile toy bird. He liked it a lot. But his mom said, "Be careful, Tim. The bird is fragile, and it might break." Tim held the bird gently and said, "I will be careful, Mom."
As they left the shop, Tim's mom told him that if he takes good care of the fragile bird, his toy collection will increase. Tim was happy and promised to be careful with his new toy.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a helmet in his room. The helmet was big and scary. He did not know where it came from. Tim wanted to wear the helmet, but he was scared.
Tim's mom saw him with the helmet and said, "Tim, you need to behave and not be scared of the helmet. It is just a toy. You can wear it and play with it."
Tim put on the helmet and felt brave. He went outside to play with his friends. But when his friends saw the scary helmet, they were scared too. They did not want to play with Tim.
Tim felt sad and took off the helmet. He told his friends, "This helmet is just a toy. We can all play together and have fun." His friends listened and they all played happily together with the scary helmet.

One day, a little boy named Tim went for a walk in the park. He loved to walk and see all the pretty flowers and trees. As he walked, he saw a big tree with a hole in it. Tim thought it would be fun to create something with the tree.
Tim found some sour lemons under the tree. He picked them up and said, "I will create a lemonade stand with these sour lemons!" So, he ran home to get some water and sugar.
Tim mixed the sour lemons, water, and sugar in a big bowl. Then, he made a sign that said, "Lemonade!" He put the lemonade and the sign on a table under the tree. Soon, a little girl came by and said, "I want some lemonade, please!" Tim smiled and gave her a cup. They both enjoyed the lemonade and had a great day in the park.

Sam likes to play guitar. He has a small guitar that is blue and yellow. He likes to sing songs with his guitar. He knows how to play some notes and chords.
One day, Sam wants to play guitar with his friend Lily. Lily has a big guitar that is red and black. She likes to play rock songs with her guitar. She knows how to play many notes and chords.
Sam and Lily decide to play guitar together. They try to find a song that they both know. Sam suggests a song that is slow and easy. Lily suggests a song that is fast and hard. They cannot agree on a song.
Sam and Lily try to play different songs at the same time. They make a lot of noise. They do not sound good. They add more and more notes and chords. They make more and more noise. They do not listen to each other.
Sam and Lily feel uncomfortable. They do not have fun. They do not like playing guitar together. They stop playing guitar. They put their guitars away. They say sorry to each other. They decide to play something else. They play with blocks. They have fun. They like playing with blocks together. They are friends again.

One day, a little girl named Sue went to the park with her mom. Sue saw her friend Tim playing with a ball. Sue wanted to play too, but she was shy. She felt frustrated because she did not know how to ask Tim to play with her.
Sue's mom saw her sad face and gave her some popcorn. Sue loved popcorn, and it made her feel better. She thought of a plan to share her popcorn with Tim. Sue walked over to Tim and gave him some popcorn. Tim was happy and clapped his hands.
Tim and Sue ate the popcorn together and played with the ball. They laughed and clapped as they had fun. Sue learned that sharing can make friends and help when you are shy.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max was an independent dog who liked to play outside. One day, Max saw a big red ball in the yard. He wanted to play with it.
As Max played with the ball, he saw a fire in a tree. Max knew he needed to help. He started to rush towards the tree, barking loudly. Max's barks were so loud that all the other animals came to see what was happening.
When the animals saw the fire, they all worked together to put it out. The big elephant used its nose to spray water on the fire. The strong bear shook the tree to make the fire go away. The fast rabbit ran to get more help. In the end, the fire was gone, and all the animals were safe. Max learned that even an independent dog can work with friends to solve big problems.

Once upon a time, there was a kind girl named Lily. Lily was a compassionate girl who loved to help others. She had a special wish in her heart. Lily wanted to bring joy and happiness to everyone she met.
One sunny day, Lily met a sad boy named Tim. Tim was sitting under a big tree, crying. Lily asked, "Why are you sad, Tim?" Tim said, "I lost my toy car, and now I have nothing to play with." Lily felt bad for Tim and wanted to help him.
Lily thought about her wish and knew she could make Tim happy. She said, "Let's find your toy car together, Tim!" They looked everywhere, and finally found the toy car behind a bush. Tim was so happy, and he hugged Lily. He said, "Thank you, Lily! I value your help and kindness." From that day on, Lily and Tim were the best of friends, and they always helped others together.

Once upon a time, there was a little blue bird. The bird lived in a big tree. One day, the bird saw a gift on the ground. The bird flew down to look at the gift. The bird was very happy.
The bird tried to open the gift, but it was hard. The bird sighed. A big cat came and wanted the gift, too. The bird and the cat did not want to share. They both wanted the gift for themselves.
Then, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and blew the gift away. The bird and the cat were sad. They looked at each other and sighed. They realized that if they had shared, they could have enjoyed the gift together. From that day on, the bird and the cat became friends and learned to share.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim went on a journey with his mom and dad. They wanted to supply food to their friends who lived far away.
On their journey, they saw many fun things. They saw big trees, pretty flowers, and cute animals. Tim was very happy to see all these things.
When they got to their friends' house, they shared a delicious meal together. They had yummy fruits, tasty bread, and sweet juice. Everyone was happy and full. After their meal, Tim and his family went back home, and they all had a great day.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a sleepy bear named Ben. Ben loved to take long naps during the day. When Ben was awake, he liked to play with his friends, a bunny and a squirrel.
One day, Ben and his friends wanted to play a game of hide and seek. Ben was very good at this game because he was big and could hide behind the tall trees. The bunny and the squirrel were also good at hiding because they were small and could escape into little holes.
But during the game, Ben and his friends got separated. They looked and looked, but could not find each other. They were very sad and wanted to be together again.
As the sun started to set, Ben felt very sleepy. He decided to take a nap under a big tree. While he was sleeping, the bunny and the squirrel found him. They were so happy to be together again.
From that day on, Ben and his friends promised to never separate again. They played together every day and had lots of fun in the big forest. And when Ben felt sleepy, they all took naps together under the big tree.

Once upon a time, there was a nosy cat named Tom. Tom liked to look at everything. One day, Tom went to a big building called a museum. The museum had many pretty things to see. Tom wanted to make pretty things too. So, he decided to design his own pretty things.
Tom met a nice lady in the museum. The lady said, "Hello, Tom! What are you doing here?" Tom said, "I want to design pretty things like the ones in the museum." The lady smiled and said, "That's a great idea! Let's design something together."
Tom and the lady started to design a big, pretty thing. They used many colors and shapes. But then, something unexpected happened. The pretty thing they designed came to life! It started to dance and sing. Tom and the lady were very surprised. They laughed and clapped their hands. From that day on, Tom and the lady became good friends and designed many more pretty things together.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named John. John was a happy little boy who loved to play outside. Every day, he would walk to the river with his fishing rod and enjoy the sun. Today he was especially excited because he was going to fish with his father.
John and his father arrived at the river. His father showed him how to make the perfect little row for his bait. Then, he showed John how to cast his line and calmly wait for a bite. John was so excited that he couldn't wait to catch something. 
But a few moments later, John noticed something strange. He noticed a fake fish floating in the water. He was so mad that someone had tricked him into thinking there were real fish in the river. 
John's father saw the fake fish too and knew they were in trouble. He explained to John that someone had brought the fake fish to make it look like the river was full of fish. He told John that it is important to always tell the truth.
John understood what his father said and promised never to bring a fake fish to the river. From that day on, he never lied about things he saw in the river and was careful to tell the truth about what he saw. John and his dad continued to enjoy many more days of fishing, and John was always sure to tell the truth.

Once upon a time, there was a fearful dog named Sam. He was always scared of everything. One day, he went for a walk in the park with his friend, a little girl named Lucy.
As they walked, they saw a shiny thing on the ground. Lucy picked it up and saw that it was a diamond! Sam and Lucy were very happy. They decided to learn more about diamonds and how to find them.
They asked a big bird in the park about diamonds. The bird said, "I know where to find more!" But, when they followed the bird, he took them to a pile of rocks, not diamonds! The bird laughed and flew away. Sam and Lucy learned that not everyone can be trusted, but they still had fun on their adventure.

Once upon a time, there was a calm girl named Lily. She had a pretty jewel that she loved very much. One day, she wanted to send the jewel to her friend, Tim.
Lily put the jewel in a box and went to the post office. She gave the box to the man there. The man said he would send it to Tim. Lily felt happy and went back home.
But, the man was not nice. He did not send the jewel to Tim. Instead, he took the jewel for himself. Tim never got the pretty jewel and Lily was very sad. The man was not a good person and the story had a bad ending.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy that he liked a lot. It was a magnet. He played with it all the time.
One day, Tim went to the park with his mom. He took his magnet with him. At the park, he met a girl named Sue. Sue saw Tim's magnet and asked, "What's that?"
Tim said, "It's a magnet! It can stick to some things." Sue did not know about magnets, so she was ignorant. Tim showed her how the magnet worked. They had a lot of fun together.
Before they left the park, Tim's mom mentioned, "It's time to go home, Tim." Tim and Sue said goodbye. Tim was happy he made a new friend and taught her about magnets.

One day, a big tank was driving down the road. The tank felt very embarrassed because it was so big and loud. It saw a small car and said, "Hello, little car! I am a big tank. I am sorry for being so loud."
The small car looked at the tank and said, "That's okay, big tank! You are just doing your job. I am not scared of you." The tank felt a little better after talking to the small car.
Then, the tank saw a little girl with a flat bike tire. The tank wanted to help, so it offered to give her a ride. The little girl was happy and said, "Thank you, big tank! You are very kind." The tank and the little girl became good friends, and the tank was no longer embarrassed.

Sam likes to play with his drum. He has a big drum and a small drum. He hits them with his sticks and makes loud sounds. He likes to make his own rhythm. He listens to the sounds and tries to make them match.
One day, Sam's mom brings home a new toy. It is a guitar. She says it is for Sam. She shows him how to hold it and strum it. She says he can make music with it too. She plays a song and sings along. Sam likes the song. He nods his head and taps his foot.
Sam wants to try the guitar. He puts it on his lap and strums it. He makes different sounds. Some are high and some are low. Some are fast and some are slow. He tries to make a rhythm like his mom. He sings a little too. He is happy.
Sam's mom smiles and claps. She says he is doing great. She says they can play music together. She picks up her guitar and plays another song. She asks Sam to join her. Sam nods and strums his guitar. They play and sing together. They have fun.
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a toy cat named Whiskers that she took everywhere with her. One day, Lily and Whiskers went to the park to play.
Lily was very careful when she played with Whiskers. She always made sure he was safe. But today, Whiskers disappeared! Lily looked around the park with her big eyes, but she could not find him.
Then, Lily saw a boy named Tim. She asked, "Have you seen my toy cat?" Tim said, "Yes, I saw him by the tree!" Lily went to the tree and found Whiskers. She was so happy and said, "Thank you, Tim!" From that day on, Lily was even more careful with Whiskers, and they lived happily ever after.

One day, a boy named Tim found a big, rich eraser. It was so big that it could finish erasing all the things in the world. Tim felt very happy and showed it to his friends. They all wanted to play with the rich eraser too.
Then, something unexpected happened. When Tim tried to erase a small line, the eraser made it even bigger! Tim and his friends were surprised. They thought the rich eraser could finish erasing things, but it was making them bigger instead.
Tim and his friends decided to use the eraser in a new way. They drew a tiny cake and used the eraser on it. The cake became big! They all laughed and enjoyed a big party with the big cake. The rich eraser made them happy in a different way than they thought.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a flag that he loved very much. It was red and blue, and he would wave it all day long.
One day, Tim saw a man with a tasty apple. The man said, "If you help me improve my garden, I will give you this tasty apple." Tim wanted the tasty apple, so he said, "Yes, I will help you."
Tim and the man worked hard in the garden. They dug and planted, and soon the garden looked better. The man gave Tim the tasty apple, and Tim was very happy. He went home, ate the apple, and waved his flag.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a thick tree. The tree was very tall and strong. It had many green leaves. One day, a little star fell from the sky and landed on the tree. The star was sad because it could not shine anymore.
A little bird saw the star and wanted to help. The bird told the star, "If you let me touch you, I can help you shine again." The star was scared at first, but it trusted the bird. So, the bird touched the star gently with its beak.
As soon as the bird touched the star, it started to shine again. The star was very happy and thanked the bird. The bird was happy too because it helped the star. They became good friends and the star shone brightly every night. The moral of the story is that when we help others, we can make their lives bright and happy.

One day, a little boy named Tim had a birthday. He was very happy. Tim wanted to play with his friends. His mom made a big, rough cake. It was a fun day.
Tim's friend Sam came to the party. Sam said, "I have a big gift for you!" Tim was very excited. But when he opened the gift, it seemed empty. Tim was sad.
Then, Sam said, "Wait! Look closer!" Tim looked inside the gift box again. He saw a tiny, cute puppy. Tim was so happy! The birthday became even more fun. They all played with the puppy and ate the rough cake.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Amy. Amy liked to go to the gym with her mom. The gym had many fun things to do like jump, run, and play.
One day, Amy saw something unusual at the gym. It was a big, colorful ball. She had never seen a ball like this before. Amy started to worry. She didn't know what to do with the big ball.
Amy's mom saw her worry and came to help. She showed Amy how to play with the big, unusual ball. They had lots of fun together. Amy was not worried anymore. She was happy to play at the gym with her mom and the big ball.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park. He saw a wide slide and wanted to play on it. But there was a big dog sitting at the bottom of the slide. Tim was scared of the big dog.
Tim asked his mom, "Can you help me make the dog go away?" His mom said, "Let's try to talk to the dog and see what happens." They walked closer to the dog and said, "Please move, dog. We want to play on the slide."
The dog looked at them and barked. But then, it moved away from the slide. Tim was happy and said, "Thank you, dog!" As a result, Tim could play on the slide all day. The big dog watched and wagged its tail. Tim learned that sometimes, all you need to do is ask.

Once upon a time, in a big sea, there was a rare fish. This fish was very nice. The fish had many friends. One day, the fish saw a shark. The shark was big and scary.
The rare fish wanted to help its friends. It swam fast to warn them about the shark. The fish said, "Watch out! There is a big shark coming!" All the fish friends listened to the rare fish.
The fish friends swam away from the shark. They hid in a safe place. The shark could not find them. The rare fish and its friends were happy. They thanked the rare fish for the warning.

Once upon a time, there was a big bear. The bear lived in a distant forest. He was very heavy. He wanted to find out how much he weighed.
One day, the bear found a big scale. He got on the scale to weigh himself. The scale broke because the bear was too heavy. The bear was sad. 
The bear walked away from the broken scale. He was still sad. He saw a big cliff. He wanted to go there to think. The bear walked to the edge of the cliff. The ground was weak. It could not hold the bear's weight. The bear fell down the cliff. The bear was hurt and could not get up.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tom. Tom loved sport. He played a popular sport with his friends. They all liked to kick a ball. They played every day.
One day, Tom could not find his ball. He looked everywhere. He asked his friends to help. They looked and looked, but they could not find it. Tom was sad because he did not want to lose his ball.
Then, a big bird came. The bird had Tom's ball in its beak. Tom and his friends were happy. But the bird did not give the ball back. The bird flew away with the ball. Tom and his friends were sad. They could not play their popular sport anymore.

Once upon a time, in a dark room, there was a big box. The box could move and talk. It had a friend, a small cat. The cat liked to rub on the box.
One day, the box and the cat went outside to play. They played in the sun and the grass. The cat would move fast and rub on the box. The box would laugh and move too.
As the sun went down, it got dark. The box and the cat went back to their dark room. They were happy and tired. They said good night and went to sleep.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy yet. He loved his yet very much. Every day, he would pull his yet around the house. It was so much fun.
One day, Tim saw a big, scary bug. He was so scared. But he had an idea. He would use his yet to help him. Tim pulled his yet near the bug. The bug jumped on the yet and started to play.
Tim was surprised. The scary bug was not scary at all. It was just a friendly bug who wanted to play. Now, Tim and the bug were friends. They played together every day, and Tim was not scared anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a big festival in a small town. Everyone was happy and excited. They all wanted to have fun at the festival. One little boy, named Tim, was very anxious. He wanted to go to the festival too, but he was scared of the big rides.
One day, Tim's mom took him to the festival. They saw many fun things like games, food, and rides. Tim's mom wanted him to try a small ride first. She told him, "Tim, if you seat on this ride, you will see it's not so scary." Tim was still anxious, but he wanted to be brave.
Tim sat on the small ride and held his mom's hand. As the ride started, Tim's face lit up with joy. He was not scared anymore. After the ride, Tim was so happy that he wanted to try all the other rides. The festival became a fun day for Tim and his mom. Tim learned that sometimes, you just need to be brave to have fun.

One day, a little girl named Amy went to the park with her mom. Amy wore her favorite orange scarf. She loved her scarf because it was soft and warm. At the park, Amy saw a big swing. She wanted to play on it.
Amy's mom helped her get on the swing. Amy held the swing tight with her hands. Her mom pushed her gently. Amy felt happy as she swung back and forth. Her orange scarf flew in the wind. It looked like a long, orange tail.
After playing on the swing, Amy and her mom sat down to rest. They watched the birds and the trees. Amy's orange scarf kept her warm. She was glad she wore it to the park. It was a fun day for Amy and her mom.

Once upon a time, there was a dolphin who was very very fast. Every day, he would speed through the ocean and make big splashes. He was so fast, he was like a little race car! He was the fastest thing in the sea.
One day, the dolphin and his friends were swimming really really fast. They were racing, and the dolphin was sure he was going to win. But, then something very strange happened. Suddenly the dolphin's speed slowed down until it was the same as his friends. Everyone was going the same speed. It was so strange.
The dolphin was worried at first, but then he realized that this was normal. Now he could swim along with his friends, and have just as much fun. So, every day, they have lots and lots of fun, all swimming at the same normal speed.

Once upon a time, there was a cool little girl named Lucy. She loved to dress up in fun clothes every day. Lucy had a special book called a diary, where she drew pictures of her outfits.
One day, Lucy put on a pretty dress with flowers on it. She felt so happy in her dress. She drew a picture of her dress in her diary. Lucy showed her diary to her mom and dad, and they smiled.
The next day, Lucy wore a cool hat with her dress. She drew a picture of her hat in her diary too. She showed her friends at school, and they thought it was cool. Lucy felt happy that she could share her diary with everyone.

One day, a girl named Sue found a flute. She was very happy. She wanted to play it and make pretty sounds. Sue ran to her friend, Tom, to show him her new flute.
"Look, Tom!" said Sue. "I found a flute. Let's start to play." Tom looked at the flute and said, "Wait, I think this flute is fake." Sue was sad. She wanted to play a real flute, not a fake one.
But then, something funny happened. When Sue played the fake flute, it made a sound like a duck! Sue and Tom started to laugh. They played the fake flute all day, making funny sounds and having fun.

Lily and Ben love to play with their puppy, Spot. Spot is a cheerful puppy who likes to run and jump and lick their faces. One day, Lily and Ben take Spot to the park. They see a big slide, a swing, and a sandbox.
"Let's go on the slide!" Lily says.
"OK!" Ben says.
They run to the slide with Spot. Lily goes first. She sits on the slide and slides down. Whee! She laughs. Ben goes next. He slides down too. Whee! He laughs. Spot runs after them and barks. He wants to slide too.
"Can Spot go on the slide?" Lily asks.
"I don't know," Ben says. "Maybe he is too small."
They look at Spot. He is wagging his tail and jumping up and down. He looks happy.
"Let's try!" Lily says.
They help Spot climb up the slide. He is a little scared, but he trusts Lily and Ben. They hold him and slide down together. Whee! They all laugh. Spot licks their faces. He likes the slide.
They play on the swing and the sandbox too. They have a lot of fun. Spot is a cheerful puppy who loves to play with Lily and Ben. They are his best friends.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a clumsy dog named Spot. Spot would always knock things over with his big tail. He loved to play with his ball and run around the yard.
One day, Spot felt his stomach growl. He was very hungry. He went to his friend, a little girl named Lily. Spot said, "Lily, can I request a snack? My stomach is hungry." Lily smiled and nodded. She went to the kitchen and got a big, juicy bone for Spot.
Spot wagged his tail and said, "Thank you, Lily!" He took the bone and went to the yard to eat it. Even though Spot was clumsy, he was a happy dog with a full stomach. And Lily was always there to help him when he needed it. They were the best of friends.

One day, a big piano was in a room. The piano was old and dead. It could not make music. It was sad.
In the room, there were also little toys. They wanted to help the piano. They had a plan. They said, "Let's unite and fix the piano!" All the toys agreed.
Together, the toys worked hard. They fixed the piano. The piano was happy. It played music again. The toys danced and played. They were all happy.

Once upon a time, there was a rich man who had a big house. He had a pet dog named Chew. Chew loved to chew on things. One day, Chew found a pen with ink inside.
Chew thought, "This pen looks fun to chew!" So, he started to chew on the pen. The ink inside the pen squirted out all over the floor. Chew's mouth was full of ink too! He made a big mess.
The rich man came into the room and saw the mess. He said, "Oh no, Chew! You made a big mess with the ink!" Chew felt sad and said, "I'm sorry." The rich man smiled and said, "It's okay. We can clean it up together." So, they cleaned up the ink and Chew learned not to chew on pens.

Once upon a time, there was a red bird. The red bird loved to fly and sing. One day, the red bird found a shiny jewel on the ground. The jewel was so pretty that the red bird wanted to keep it.
The red bird took the jewel to his friend, the cat. The cat said, "Wow, that is a nice jewel! Can I have it?" The red bird said, "No, it is mine. I found it first." The cat was not happy. The red bird flew away with the jewel.
Later, the sky turned dark and cold. The red bird started to shiver. The cat saw the red bird shivering and said, "If you give me the jewel, I will help you get warm." The red bird did not want to give up the jewel, so he said no. The cat left, and the red bird was still cold and shivering. In the end, the red bird was too cold and could not fly anymore. He lost the jewel, and he was very sad.

One day, a little girl named Lucy and her dog, Max, went for a walk. They went down the path to the small creek near their house. Lucy liked to play by the water and throw sticks for Max to fetch. Max loved to play in the water and swim.
As they were playing, Lucy saw a frog and said, "Max, look at the frog! Let's catch it!" Max got very excited and started to run after the frog. But the frog jumped into the water, and Max got scared. He felt anxious and began to panic.
Lucy saw Max panic and said, "Don't worry, Max! It's just a frog. It won't hurt you." Max calmed down and wagged his tail. They continued to play by the creek, laughing and having fun.

Once upon a time, there was a big blue whale. The blue whale lived in the deep sea. The blue whale was very kind and had many friends.
One day, a little fish came to the blue whale. The little fish said, "Please, Mr. Whale, can you help me? My friends are stuck in a net." The blue whale wanted to help, so they went to find the net. When they found the net, the blue whale used its big tail to touch the net. With one big touch, the net broke, and the little fish's friends were free.
The little fish and their friends were very happy. They thanked the blue whale for helping them. The blue whale felt good for helping his friends. The moral of the story is that it's always good to help others, even if they are smaller than you. And sometimes, a little touch can make a big difference.

Once upon a time there was a little boy called Chico. He wanted very much to learn to sing.
One day he went to his teacher, who taught him the basics of singing. Chico was a keen pupil and practiced singing everyday.
He became very good, but still not quite as good as the other children at his school. When they all sang together, Chico's voice was the quietest and he wasn't as in tune.
The other children made fun of Chico and called him a poor singer. This made him very unhappy.
One day, Chico decided to practice even harder. He sang for an entire afternoon. When the next singing lesson came around, Chico's teacher was amazed to hear he had improved so much.
Chico's voice was beautiful as he sang with all the other children. His singing was so good that the teacher praised him and all the other pupils clapped and cheered.
From then on, Chico was known as the best singer in the school and he no longer felt poor when he sang.

Lucy loved fairies. She had many fairy books, fairy toys and fairy dresses. She wished she could see a real fairy one day. She asked her mom and dad to take her to the fairy forest, where the fairies lived. But they said no. They said it was too far, too cold and too dangerous. Lucy was sad and angry. She refused to eat, to play and to sleep.
One night, Lucy saw a bright light outside her window. She got up and looked. It was a fairy! A tiny fairy with wings and a wand. The fairy smiled and waved at Lucy. Lucy was so happy. She opened the window and whispered, "Hello, fairy. Can I come with you?"
The fairy nodded and said, "Yes, Lucy. I can take you to the fairy forest. It is a wonderful place. You will love it. But you have to be quick. We have to fly before the sun comes up."
Lucy did not think twice. She grabbed her fairy dress and climbed out of the window. She held the fairy's hand and flew into the night. She did not say goodbye to her mom and dad. She did not know that they would miss her and worry about her.
The fairy forest was not what Lucy expected. It was dark, cold and scary. There were no flowers, no animals, no other fairies. Only thorns, spiders and bats. Lucy felt afraid and cold. She wanted to go back home. She asked the fairy, "Where are we? Where are the other fairies? I don't like it here. Please take me back."
The fairy laughed and said, "This is the fairy forest, Lucy. This is where I live. And you are my guest. You can't go back. You are mine now. You see, I am not a good fairy. I am a bad fairy. I tricked you. I need a human child to make me strong. You are weak and small. I will use your magic and your life to make me powerful. You will never see your mom and dad again."
Lucy screamed and cried. She tried to run away, but the fairy was faster and stronger. She caught Lucy and held her tight. She pointed her wand at Lucy and said, "Goodbye, Lucy. Thank you for your gift."
The fairy forest was silent, except for the fairy's evil laugh. Lucy was gone. The fairy was happy. She had what she wanted. She flew away, leaving behind Lucy's fairy dress and a broken wand.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a good dog named Spot. Spot loved to play with his toy ball. One day, Spot could not find his ball. He looked everywhere, but it was gone.
Spot's friend, a little bird, saw him looking sad. The bird wanted to help Spot feel better. The bird said, "Why not play with a piece of stick?" Spot thought that was a good idea. So, they went to the park to look for a stick.
At the park, Spot found a nice piece of stick. He and the bird played with it all day. They had so much fun! Spot was very happy. From that day on, Spot and his friend the bird played together with the stick every day.

One day, a little boy named Tim went for a walk with his mom. They saw a big gray cat sitting under a tree. Tim looked at the cat and said, "Hello, cat! Why are you sitting in the dark?"
The cat looked at Tim and said, "I am hiding from the rain. I don't like getting wet."
Tim realized that the sky was getting dark too. He said to his mom, "Mom, I think it's going to rain. We should go home."
His mom looked at the sky and said, "You're right, Tim. Let's go home before it starts to rain." So, they said goodbye to the cat and walked home.

One day, a little boy named Tim and his big brother, Sam, went out to play. They loved to play in the mud and get dirty. They made mud pies, mud castles, and even had a mud fight. They were having so much fun that they didn't realize how dirty they were.
Their mom saw them and said, "You boys are so dirty! Let's clean you up and display your artwork." So, Tim and Sam washed their hands and faces. They were still a little dirty, but they were excited to show their mom what they made.
Mom helped them put their mud pies and mud castles on a table outside. She said, "Wow, you boys did a great job! I'm so proud of you." Tim and Sam smiled and gave each other a big high five. They were happy to display their muddy creations and have fun with their brother.

Once upon a time, there were two players living in the same village. One of the players was very compassionate and always helped people in need. The other player was very selfish and only cared about himself.
One day, the compassionate player saw a small kitten stuck up in a tree and in trouble. He called out to the other player to help him get the little kitten down. But, the selfish player just shrugged and said no.
The compassionate player sighed and fetched a ladder. He dug around the tree and built a staircase so the little cat could get down. When the little cat was safe, the compassionate player smiled. But the selfish player had disappeared.
The moral of the story is that although being selfish might look like the easier option, it can make you disappear. Being compassionate and kind, however, never disappears.

Once upon a time, a pretty girl named Lily loved to travel. She went to many places with her mom and dad. Lily always took her flashlight with her.
One sunny day, Lily and her family went to a big park. They played, laughed, and had fun. When it got dark, Lily took out her flashlight and turned it on. The light was very bright.
As they walked, Lily saw something shining in the bushes. She went closer and found a pretty, shiny stone. But when she touched the stone, something unexpected happened. The flashlight turned into a magic wand! It could make things change colors and shapes. Lily was so happy and surprised. She had a magic wand to play with now, and it made her travels even more fun.

Once upon a time, there was a clever fox. He lived in the woods. The clever fox was very good at finding food.
One day, the clever fox saw a sign. The sign said, "Yummy food this way!" The clever fox followed the sign. He walked and walked until he met a little bird.
