The little bird said, "Hello, clever fox! Did you see the sign too? Let's find the yummy food together!" The clever fox and the little bird walked together. They found a big tree with lots of yummy food.
The clever fox and the little bird ate the yummy food. They were very happy. From that day on, they were best friends. And they always looked for signs to find more yummy food.

One day, a busy bee named Bob was flying around the garden. He saw a big, red flower and thought it would be fun to get nectar from it. As he flew closer, he saw a tiny ant named Ann, who was also trying to get to the flower.
"Hi Ann," said Bob. "Do you want to have fun and get nectar together?"
"Yes, Bob," replied Ann. "But I need to prepare. I am very small and it is hard for me to reach the flower."
Bob thought for a moment and said, "I can help you, Ann. I will carry you up to the flower so we can both have fun getting nectar."
Ann was happy and climbed onto Bob's back. Together, they flew up to the big, red flower and had lots of fun getting nectar. They shared their nectar with their friends and everyone was happy.
The moral of the story is that when we help each other and work together, we can have more fun and achieve our goals.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tom. Today, Tom had a big race at school. He was very excited. But before the race, Tom saw a big, disgusting bug. He was scared of the bug, but his mom told him to be brave.
Tom wanted to win the race, so he thought about the bug to make him hurry. He ran very fast and passed all his friends. He was so fast that he won the race! Everyone cheered for Tom.
After the race, Tom saw the disgusting bug again. But this time, Tom was not scared. He learned that being brave can help you do great things. The moral of the story is to face your fears and they can help you grow.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Will. Will loved to build things. He would build tall towers with his blocks. One day, he wanted to build the biggest tower ever.
Will asked his friend, Tom, to help him. "Tom, can you help me build a big tower?" Will said. Tom was excited, "Yes, Will! Let's build it together!" So, Will and Tom started to build the tower with their blocks.
As they built the tower, they found a sour lemon. It was so sour that it made their faces scrunch up. They laughed and kept building. Finally, their big tower was done. They were very happy and proud of their work.

Once upon a time, there was a big castle. In the castle, there lived a princess. The princess was sad because the castle was dull. The walls were not bright and pretty. The princess wanted a friend to make the castle fun.
One day, a frog came to the castle. The frog said, "I can help you make the castle fun." The princess asked, "How can you help me?" The frog said, "Just give me a kiss, and I will show you."
The princess kissed the frog. Suddenly, the frog turned into a prince. The prince and the princess painted the castle walls with bright colors. They laughed and played all day. The castle was not dull anymore. The princess was happy because she had a new friend, and they lived happily ever after.

One day, a girl named Lily went to play outside. It was very cold, so her mom said, "Lily, bring your mittens!" Lily put on her mittens and went out to have fun in the snow.
While playing, Lily saw her friend, Tom. Tom looked unhappy and uncomfortable. Lily asked, "Tom, why are you sad?" Tom said, "My hands are very cold. I lost my mittens." Lily wanted to help Tom feel better.
Lily had an idea. She took off one of her mittens and gave it to Tom. Now, they both had one warm hand. They played together in the snow and had lots of fun. And from that day, Lily and Tom became best friends.

Once there was a prince who liked to shoot arrows. He had a big bow and many arrows that he kept in a bag. He was very good at shooting and could hit any target he wanted. He was happy and proud of his skill.
But there was another prince who was envious of him. He did not like to shoot arrows, but he wanted to have the big bow and the bag of arrows. He was angry and mean and always tried to make the other prince feel bad. He said things like, "You are not a real prince, you are just a shooter. You have no friends, no fun, no crown. You are boring and silly."
One day, the envious prince had a plan. He waited until the shooter prince was out in the woods, practicing his shooting. He followed him quietly and hid behind a tree. He saw the shooter prince take out an arrow from his bag and put it on his bow. He aimed at a bird on a branch. He was about to shoot when the envious prince jumped out and shouted, "Boo!"
The shooter prince was startled and missed his shot. The arrow flew past the bird and hit a bee hive. The bees came out and buzzed angrily. They saw the shooter prince and the envious prince and thought they were enemies. They stung them all over their faces and arms and legs. The princes screamed and ran away, but the bees followed them.
They ran back to the castle, but the guards did not recognize them. They saw two boys covered in red bumps and swollen eyes and thought they were thieves or spies. They grabbed them and locked them in a dark dungeon. They said, "You will stay here until the king comes and decides what to do with you. You are in big trouble."
The shooter prince and the envious prince were very sad and sorry. They wished they had been nicer to each other and not played with arrows and bees. They learned that shooting can be dangerous and envy can be foolish. But it was too late. They had no bow, no arrows, no friends, no fun, no crown. They were boring and silly. And they were stuck in the dungeon. The end.

One day, a little girl named Sue went for a walk. She saw a small cat by a drain. The cat was sad and bitter because it was lost. Sue wanted to help the cat. She thought, "I will call my friend Tom to help me."
Sue called Tom and said, "I found a cat by the drain. Can you help me?" Tom came to help Sue and the cat. They looked at the cat and saw a tag on its neck. The tag had a phone number.
Sue and Tom called the phone number. A nice lady answered the phone. She said, "Oh, I lost my cat! Thank you for finding her!" Sue and Tom were happy to help the lady. They thought the cat was lost, but it was the lady's cat all along! The cat was not bitter anymore, and they all became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little panda named Pandy. Pandy had a big dream. Pandy wanted to become a dancer. Pandy practiced dancing every day in the forest.
One day, Pandy felt ready to dance in front of his friends. He invited all his friends to watch him dance. Pandy was very excited but also a little embarrassed. Pandy started to dance, but something unexpected happened.
While Pandy was dancing, a big wind came and blew Pandy up into the sky. Pandy was scared but kept dancing. All of Pandy's friends looked up and saw Pandy dancing in the sky. They all clapped and cheered. Pandy was no longer embarrassed, but happy. Pandy became the best sky dancer in the forest.

One day, a little boy named Tim was helping his mom in the kitchen. Tim was an obedient boy, and he always did what his mom asked. His mom said, "Tim, please hang the big spoon on the hook." Tim reached up high and hung the spoon.
Just then, Tim's cat, Fluffy, jumped on the table. Fluffy saw a shiny knife and tried to play with it. Tim saw Fluffy and said, "No, Fluffy! That's not a toy!" Tim's mom heard him and quickly took the knife away. She put it in a safe place where Fluffy could not reach.
Tim's mom was so proud of him for being careful and brave. She said, "Thank you, Tim, for keeping Fluffy safe. Let's make cookies together as a treat." Tim and his mom made yummy cookies and shared them with Fluffy. They all had a fun and happy day in the kitchen.

Once upon a time, there was a tall bunny named Bobo. Bobo loved to jump all day long. He would jump in the grass, jump over rocks, and jump with his friends. One day, Bobo heard that his friend, Lulu the bird, was having a birthday.
Bobo was very excited. He wanted to give Lulu a special birthday gift. He thought and thought, and then he knew what to do. Bobo would jump high into the sky and pick a star for Lulu.
On the day of Lulu's birthday, Bobo jumped as high as he could. He jumped and jumped until he got the most beautiful star he could find. He brought it back down to Lulu.
"Happy birthday, Lulu!" said Bobo, as he gave her the star. "I jumped very high to get this for you!"
"Thank you, Bobo!" said Lulu, with a big smile. "You are the best friend ever!" They played and jumped together all day long, and Lulu's birthday was the happiest day ever.

Once upon a time, a big cat and a small dog were best friends. They loved to play and eat together. One day, they found an interesting piece of cake in the kitchen. It was a big, yummy cake with lots of colors. They wanted to eat it, but they did not want to share.
The cat had an idea. "Let's mix the cake and make two pieces," said the cat. So, they mixed the cake and made two pieces. They were very happy and started to eat their pieces of cake.
But, as they ate, something unexpected happened. The cake pieces began to grow bigger and bigger! The cat and the dog were very surprised. They did not know what to do. Then, they decided to share the big pieces of cake with all their friends. In the end, they learned that sharing is more fun than keeping things just for themselves.

Once upon a time, there was a big bear named Bob. Bob loved to hug his friends. One day, Bob went to eat a meal with his friends. They all sat down and ate tasty food. They were very happy.
While they were eating, a little bird flew by. The little bird looked very alert. It flew around and around. Bob and his friends looked at the bird. They wondered what it was doing.
Then, the little bird did something unexpected. It dropped a big, shiny rock in front of Bob. Bob looked at the rock and smiled. He gave the little bird a big hug. The bird had given them a gift. From that day on, the little bird became friends with Bob and his friends. They all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a compassionate cat named Daisy. She loved to help her friends. One day, Daisy saw her friend, Benny the mouse, looking sad.
"Hi Benny," said Daisy. "Why are you sad?"
Benny replied, "I ate too much cheese and now my stomach hurts."
Daisy wanted to help Benny feel better. She dared to think of a way to help him. She thought of a plan. "Let's go for a walk, Benny. It might help your stomach feel better."
So, Daisy and Benny went for a walk. They saw flowers, birds, and butterflies. Benny's stomach started to feel better. They both smiled and continued to walk, happy to be friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a sister named Rose. They liked to play together in the sun. They were very happy.
One day, Lily and Rose were playing in the park. They saw a little cat. The cat was sad. Lily and Rose wanted to help the cat. They gave the cat some food. The cat ate the food and started to become big. The girls were very surprised.
The big cat said, "Thank you for the food." Lily and Rose were scared, but the cat was fine. The cat told them it was a magic cat. The cat said, "I will give you one wish." Lily and Rose wished to be best friends forever. The cat made their wish come true. Now, Lily and Rose were not just sisters, but also best friends. They played happily ever after.

Once there was a mom and a dad who wanted to go to the garage. They seemed very excited, so the little three year old wanted to go too. So the family all jumped in the car and drove off.
When they arrived at the garage, it seemed huge! The little ones eyes were wide with wonder. There were so many things to look at, racks with tools, shelves of spare parts and even cars.
They began to look around and the dad said they were looking for something special. He seemed to know exactly what he was looking for. After a while, he found it! It was a shiny red bike. It was available so the dad bought it straight away.
The family went home with the new bike and all the little one could think of was how they would all go riding together. The garage seemed like a magical place and the little one knew they would go back again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a red spade. He loved to play with it in the sand. One sunny day, Tim went to the park to play.
The park was very busy. Lots of kids were there. Tim played with his spade and made a big sand castle. He was so happy.
But then, Tim lost his spade. He looked for it everywhere. He felt sad. A nice girl found Tim's spade and gave it back to him. Tim said, "Thank you!" Now, Tim and the girl played together, and they had lots of fun.

Lily was a curious girl who liked to explore new things. One day, she found a pack of gum in her mom's purse. She wondered what it was and how it tasted. She opened the pack and took out a piece of gum. She put it in her mouth and started to chew.
The gum was sweet and soft. Lily liked it a lot. She chewed and chewed and blew a big bubble. She was proud of her bubble and smiled. But then, the bubble popped and stuck to her face. She tried to pull it off, but it was very sticky. The more she pulled, the more the gum increased and covered her nose and eyes.
Lily was scared and cried. She could not see or breathe well. She ran to her mom and asked for help. Her mom saw her and was shocked. She quickly got a wet cloth and wiped the gum off Lily's face. She hugged Lily and told her to never chew gum again. She explained that gum was not for eating, but for playing. She said that gum could be dangerous and make her sick.
Lily was sorry and learned her lesson. She said she would not chew gum again. She asked her mom to forgive her and give her a kiss. Her mom forgave her and kissed her. She told her she loved her and that she was a curious girl who liked to explore new things. But she also told her to be careful and ask before trying something new. Lily agreed and nodded. She hugged her mom and said she loved her too.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Bobo. Bobo loved to spring around all day long. He would jump from his warm home and play with his friends in the big green grass.
One day, Bobo and his friends were playing a game. They would spring high into the air and try to touch the sky. Bobo jumped so high that he could see his home from up above.
As the sun began to set, Bobo and his friends said goodbye. Bobo hopped back to his warm home, tired from a fun day of playing. He snuggled into his cozy bed and fell asleep, dreaming of more days full of springing and laughter.

Once upon a time, there was a friendly girl named Lucy. She loved to ride her beautiful bicycle around the park with her mommy. 
One day, Lucy and her mommy went to the park. After they found a spot to sit, Lucy said, "Mommy, can I draw a pretty picture?" 
"Yes, let's get some paper and something to write with," said her mommy. 
So, Lucy got out her crayons and markers. She drew a picture of her favorite bicycle and wrote her name alongside it. 
When Lucy showed her mommy, she said, "That's so beautiful, Lucy! I'm so proud of you." 
Lucy smiled, happy that she had been able to write her name and draw her favorite bicycle in such a beautiful way.

Once upon a time, there was a compassionate lady who loved to work in her garden. She grew pretty flowers of all colors. She liked to put the flowers in a vase and give them to her friends.
One sunny day, the lady was working in her garden. She found a big, beautiful flower. She knew it would look nice in her vase. She picked the flower and went inside her house.
She put the flower in the vase and gave it to her friend who was feeling sad. Her friend saw the pretty flower and smiled. The compassionate lady was happy that her flower made her friend feel better. They both had a fun day together.

Once upon a time, there was a adorable pig. He lived in a meadow and loved to search for tasty food. 
One day it started to rain. The pig was scared and decided to hide in a big hole. He stayed in the hole for hours. 
Suddenly the pig heard some yelping sounds. It was an even more adorable pig, who had also run away from the rain. The two of them snuggled in the hole. 
But then the pig's stomach started growling. He thought it would be okay if he went out and looked for food. But as soon as he stepped out, the rain came down even harder. He was stuck outside in the rain. 
The pig got very scared, and he yelped for help. His friend had no choice but to leave the hole and try to save him. Unfortunately the rain became too strong, and the pig's friend couldn't save him. 
The pig never made it back home. He was gone forever, and his friend was very sad.

Lily and Ben are twins. They like to play in the bath. They have many toys in the bath. They have a duck, a boat, a fish and a frog. They make the toys swim and splash.
One day, Mom gives them a new shampoo. It is in a pink bottle. It smells like flowers. Mom says it is good for their hair. She says they can use it by themselves.
Lily and Ben are happy. They want to try the new shampoo. They take the bottle and open it. They pour some shampoo on their hands. They rub it on their hair. They make bubbles.
"Look, Ben, I have a lot of bubbles!" Lily says.
"Me too, Lily, I have more bubbles!" Ben says.
They laugh and have fun. They blow the bubbles. They pop the bubbles. They make more bubbles.
But they do not see that the bottle is fragile. It is not strong. It can break. They squeeze the bottle too hard. The bottle cracks. The shampoo spills out. It makes a mess.
"Oh no, Lily, the bottle is broken!" Ben says.
"Oh no, Ben, the shampoo is gone!" Lily says.
They are sad. They do not have any more shampoo. They do not know what to do.
Mom hears them. She comes to the bath. She sees the broken bottle and the spilled shampoo. She is not happy. She is mad.
"Lily and Ben, what did you do?" Mom says.
"We are sorry, Mom, we wanted to use the new shampoo, but the bottle is fragile, it broke, we did not mean to, we are sorry!" Lily and Ben say.
Mom sighs. She is not mad anymore. She is calm. She loves Lily and Ben. She knows they are little. They make mistakes. They learn.
"It's okay, Lily and Ben, I forgive you, but you have to be careful with the shampoo, it is not a toy, it is for washing your hair, you have to use it gently, not squeeze it hard, do you understand?" Mom says.
"Yes, Mom, we understand, we are sorry, we will be careful next time, we love you, Mom!" Lily and Ben say.
Mom hugs them. She rinses their hair. She dries them with a towel. She gives them a kiss. She says they are good kids. She says they smell like flowers.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Sam. Sam loved to go for a walk every day. One day, while Sam was walking, he saw a small, rough-looking dog. The dog looked sad and lost.
Sam wanted to save the dog, so he took the dog home with him. He gave the dog food and water. The dog was very happy. Sam's mom and dad said Sam could keep the dog. They named the dog Max.
Now, Sam and Max go for a walk together every day. They play and have lots of fun. Sam saved Max, and now they are best friends.

Once there was a duck who wanted to go on an adventure. The duck was very excited. He spread his wings and took off. 
He flew above the trees and over the river. The duck loved the feeling of the wind blowing in his feathers. 
The duck saw some good friends along the way. First, he saw a rabbit hopping. Then he saw a squirrel running. Finally, he saw a bird singing in the sky. 
The duck kept flying until it was time to go back home. He flew into his pond and said goodbye to his friends. 
The duck had a good adventure and was very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little black cat. The cat lived in a big tree. The tree had many pears. The cat loved to eat the pears.
One day, the cat was tired. It wanted to rest. The cat found a soft spot under the tree. The cat lay down on the soft spot and closed its eyes.
While the cat rested, a pear fell from the tree. The pear rolled to the cat. The cat woke up and saw the pear. The cat was very happy. It ate the pear and went back to rest.

Once upon a time, there was an elderly dog named Max. Max liked to relax under a big tree in his yard. One day, Max saw a shiny nail on the ground near the tree. He did not know what it was, but he thought it was pretty.
The next day, Max's friend, a little bird named Chirpy, came to visit. Chirpy saw the shiny nail too. Chirpy told Max, "Be careful with that nail. It can help you one day, but you must be careful."
Max did not understand, but he listened to his friend. He kept the shiny nail safe in his dog house. Time went by, and Max forgot about the nail.
One sunny day, Max was playing with his ball. The ball got stuck in the tree. Max tried to get it, but he could not reach. Then, he remembered the shiny nail. Max used the nail to get the ball out of the tree. He was so happy!
Max thanked Chirpy for the advice. From that day on, Max and Chirpy played together under the big tree. And Max always kept the shiny nail close, just in case he needed it again.

Once upon a time, there was a unique little bug named Benny. Benny loved to crawl all around the big garden. One day, Benny found a beautiful castle made of sticks and leaves.
Benny wanted to live in the castle, but it belonged to a wise old ant named Andy. Benny asked, "Can I please live in your castle, Andy?" Andy thought for a moment and said, "You can live here, but you must help me find food every day."
Benny agreed, and they both worked together to find food. They became good friends and shared the castle. Benny learned that when you help others and share, you can have a happy life. And that was the moral of the story.

One day, a little frog was hopping through the pond. He wanted to find a big button. He searched and searched until he saw something shiny in the water. It was a broken button!
The little frog looked up to the sky and said, "I must be brave and swim to the bottom. I know I'll get it!" He jumped in the pond and he started swimming around to find the button. With each dive he got closer and closer to the shiny broken button. The frog was so excited! He reached the bottom and grabbed the button.
As he started to swim to the surface, he noticed that something was wrong. He was stuck in the pond! The button had been caught on some weeds. He tried and tried but he could not get free. He cried and cried until he heard a voice.
"I'll help you, little frog!" It was a friendly snail. He said, "Just grab on to my back, and we'll get out of here!" The frog did as the snail said, and soon they were out of the pond.
The frog smiled, and thanked the snail for helping him. He held the broken button tightly in his hand, proud of his brave and successful adventure.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a dirty room. The room had a lot of furniture in it. There was a big chair, a small chair, and a table. The room needed to be cleaned.
One day, a little cat came into the room. The cat saw the dirty furniture and wanted to help. The cat started to clean the big chair. It took a long time, but the cat did not give up.
After the big chair was clean, the cat saw a soft rug. The cat was very tired, so it decided to lie down on the rug. The cat was happy it helped clean the furniture. The room looked much better, and the cat fell asleep on the clean rug.

Once upon a time, there was a bald man named Tom. Tom had a flashlight that he loved. He took it everywhere he went. One day, Tom went for a walk in the woods.
As he walked, he saw a little girl. The girl was lost and scared. Tom asked, "Do you know where your home is?" The little girl shook her head no. Tom wanted to help her find her way back.
Tom took out his flashlight and turned it on. They walked through the woods, looking for the girl's home. The light from the flashlight helped them see in the dark. Finally, they found the girl's house. She was so happy and said, "Thank you, Tom!" And they both went inside to tell her family how Tom helped her with his flashlight.

Sara and Ben were playing in the garden. They had a spray bottle and a bucket of water. They liked to spray each other and the flowers.
"Spray, spray, spray!" Sara said, as she squirted Ben with water.
"Hey, stop that!" Ben said, as he dodged the spray. "You are wetting my shirt!"
He grabbed the spray bottle from Sara and sprayed her back. They laughed and ran around the garden.
But then they saw something mysterious. There was a big brown pot on the porch. It had steam coming out of it. And it smelled funny.
"What is that?" Sara asked, pointing at the pot.
"I don't know," Ben said, curiously. "Let's go and see."
They walked towards the porch, holding the spray bottle. They saw a sign on the pot. It said "coffee".
"Coffee?" Sara repeated. "What is coffee?"
"I think it's a drink for grown-ups," Ben said. "They like it hot and bitter."
They looked at the pot. It was bubbling and hissing.
"Maybe we can spray it," Sara suggested. "Maybe it will make a funny sound."
"Okay," Ben agreed. "But be careful. It might be hot."
They aimed the spray bottle at the pot and pressed the trigger. But nothing happened. The bottle was empty.
"Oh no," Sara said. "We used all the water."
They looked around for more water. They saw a hose on the wall. They ran to the hose and turned it on. Water came out of the hose.
"Yay!" Sara said. "Now we can spray the coffee!"
They dragged the hose to the porch and sprayed the coffee pot. The water hit the hot coffee and made a loud sizzling noise. The coffee splashed and spilled everywhere.
"Wow!" Ben said. "That was cool!"
But then they heard a voice behind them. It was Mom.
"What are you doing?" Mom asked, angrily. "You ruined my coffee!"
Sara and Ben dropped the hose and looked at Mom. They saw her face was red and her eyes were wide.
They knew they were in trouble. They said nothing. They wished they had not sprayed the coffee.

Once upon a time, there was a lonely aeroplane named Andy. Andy was sad because he had no friends to play with. He flew high in the sky all by himself, watching the birds and clouds go by.
One day, Andy saw a big kite flying in the sky. The kite was blue and yellow and looked fun to play with. Andy flew closer to the kite and said, "Hi, I'm Andy the aeroplane. Do you want to be my friend?"
The kite smiled and said, "Yes, I'd love to be your friend, Andy! My name is Kelsey the kite. We can play together in the sky."
Andy and Kelsey played together all day, flying high and low, and cutting through the air. They laughed and had so much fun. From that day on, Andy the aeroplane was never lonely again because he had found a great friend in Kelsey the kite.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Beaky. Beaky lived near a big cliff. Every day, Beaky would fly and pass the cliff to find food.
One day, Beaky met a new friend, Squirrelly. Squirrelly wanted to pass the cliff too, but he was scared. Beaky said, "Don't worry, I will help you. We must be careful."
Together, Beaky and Squirrelly passed the cliff. They were very careful. Beaky said, "See, we did it!" Squirrelly was happy and thanked Beaky.
From that day on, Beaky and Squirrelly always passed the cliff together. They were careful and became the best of friends. They played and laughed every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little seed named Sam. Sam wanted to grow big and strong, but he was scared. He lived in a safe garden with many other seeds and plants.
One day, Sam met an old wise tree named Mr. Oak. "How did you grow so big and strong, Mr. Oak?" asked Sam. "Well, little Sam," said Mr. Oak, "I had a special page that told me how to grow. I followed the words on the page, and I grew big and strong."
Sam wanted to find that special page. He looked all around the garden until he found it. The page said, "To grow big and strong, you must drink water, get sun, and be brave." Sam did what the page said. He drank water, got sun, and was brave.
Soon, Sam started to grow. He grew into a beautiful, strong plant. All his friends in the garden were happy for him. Sam learned that if you listen and follow good advice, you can grow big and strong too. And that was the moral of the story.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was troubled because he found a nail on the floor. He did not know what to do with it. He looked around and saw his friend, the cat.
The cat saw Tim and came to help. The cat urged Tim to give the nail to his mom. "Give it to mom," the cat said. Tim thought it was a good idea. He took the nail and went to find his mom.
Tim found his mom in the kitchen. He gave her the nail and told her what the cat said. His mom was happy and thanked him. Tim felt better and went back to play with the cat. They played all day and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a flexible snake named Sam. Sam lived in a big forest with many paths. One day, Sam wanted to find a new friend.
Sam spread out along a path and met a little bird. The bird said, "Hi, I am Birdie. What is your name?" Sam said, "I am Sam. Do you want to be friends?" Birdie said, "Yes, let's be friends!"
Sam and Birdie played on the path every day. They were very happy. Sam was glad he found a new friend. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there lived a 3 year old boy. One day, he was in his bedroom looking into a big box full of things. In the box were lots of bright colours and things he could play with. 
As he was looking through the box, he picked up a book. He opened it and found it was filled with blank pages. He was wondering how he could make it more interesting. 
Just then, his mum came in and asked, "What are you up to?" 
The little boy showed her the book and asked, "What can I do with this book?" 
His mum smiled and said, "I know! Let's mix together some paints and use them to paint the pages. Then it could be useful!" 
The little boy was so excited, he couldn't wait to start. 
So, the mum and the little boy mixed the paints together, and then he painted the pages of the book. He made lots of beautiful colours, and soon enough, the book was full of wonderful pictures. 
The little boy was so proud of his work, and he knew he could use the book whenever he wanted. He was very proud and happy with his useful book!

Once upon a time, there was a little monkey. This monkey was incredible. He could do many fun things. He loved to play all day.
One day, the monkey had to pack. He was going on a trip. He packed his bag with toys and food. But his friend, a big dog, wanted to play. The dog did not want the monkey to go away.
The monkey and the dog had a fight. They were very sad. The monkey still had to go. He said goodbye to his friend. The dog was alone and felt bad. The end.

Frankie and her mom were in the kitchen, unpackng all their groceries when Frankie saw something interesting. 
"Mom, what is this?" asked Frankie.
"Oh, that is a missile," answered her mom.
Frankie was excited. "What does it do?" 
"Well, it can shoot out all kinds of treats, like spicy peppermints!" 
Frankie was so excited that she ran to the living room and started to unpack all the spicy peppermints. She put them in a bowl and started snacking on them right away. 
Frankie liked the spicy peppermints and asked her mom, "Mom can we get more missiles? Please?" 
"Sure, honey," laughed her mom, "Maybe next time we go shopping."

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He lived in a peaceful house with his mom, dad, and his dog, Spot. They all loved to play outside in their big yard, where the sun was always shining.
One day, Tim's mom made a big cake for the family. It looked so good that Tim wanted to eat the whole thing by himself. But, his mom said, "Tim, if you eat all that cake, it won't fit in your stomach, and you'll feel sick!" So, Tim shared the cake with his family and Spot, and they all enjoyed it together.
After they ate the cake, Tim and Spot went outside to play in the peaceful yard. They ran and played until the sun went down. Tim was happy that he listened to his mom because his stomach felt just right. At the end of the day, Tim, Spot, and his family all went inside to rest, feeling full and happy.

Once upon a time, in a far away land, there was a helpful boy named Tim. Tim had a big dream. He wanted to grab a comet from the sky.
One day, Tim met a wise old man. The old man said, "I know how to grab a comet, but you must be very brave." Tim was excited and said, "I am brave! Please tell me how." The old man smiled and replied, "Wait for the night when the sky is full of stars. Then, you will see the comet."
That night, Tim looked up at the sky. He saw many stars and then, he saw the comet! It was big and bright. Tim closed his eyes and made a wish. He wished to be helpful to all his friends.
When Tim opened his eyes, he found that he could grab the comet! He pulled it down from the sky, and it made him very happy. From that day on, Tim was even more helpful to his friends, and they all loved him very much. And every time he saw a comet in the sky, he remembered the wise old man and his magical wish.

Once upon a time, there was a kind nurse. She liked to help people feel better. She was very compassionate. She had a big heart and always took care of everyone.
One day, the nurse decided to wander. She walked and walked in the big park. She saw many pretty flowers and green trees. She liked to be outside.
While she was wandering, she saw a little bird. The bird was hurt. The compassionate nurse took care of the bird. She helped the bird feel better. The bird was happy, and the nurse was happy too. They became good friends.

One day, a shy cat named Tim went for a walk. He saw a big waste bin and thought he could find some food. Tim jumped in, but he got stuck. He felt embarrass, but no one was around to help him.
A dog named Max saw Tim and wanted to play. Max didn't know Tim was shy and embarrass. Max ran to the waste bin and barked. The waste bin fell over, and Tim came out. Tim was scared and ran away.
Max felt sad and went to find Tim. When he found him, Tim was hiding. Max said, "I'm sorry, I didn't mean to scare you." Tim came out and said, "It's okay, I was just shy." They became friends and played together. The twist was that Tim found a friend in the end.

Once upon a time, there was a dependable dog named Spot. Spot loved to dig. One day, he found a big pit in the ground. He thought it would be fun to play in the pit.
Spot's friend, a little bird named Chirpy, said, "Don't go in the pit, Spot! It might not be safe!" But Spot did not listen. He wanted to play in the pit. So, he jumped in and started to dig.
After a while, Spot tried to get out of the pit. But he could not. He was stuck! Chirpy saw Spot and said, "I told you not to go in the pit, Spot! Now you need help." Chirpy flew away and came back with more friends. They all worked together to help Spot get out of the pit.
Finally, Spot was free! He was so happy to be out of the pit. He thanked Chirpy and his friends for helping him. From that day on, Spot refused to play in pits. He learned to listen to his dependable friend, Chirpy. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to create things with his toys. One day, he went to the park with his mom. The park was big and had many fun things to do. Tim was very happy.
At the park, Tim saw a stranger. The stranger was a little girl. She was all alone and looked sad. Tim wanted to help her. He went to the girl and said, "Hi, I am Tim. Do you want to play with me?"
The little girl smiled and said, "Yes, I am Lucy. I was sad because I have no friends." Tim and Lucy played together in the park. They created a big castle with sand. The castle was not empty; it was full of love and friendship.
From that day on, Tim and Lucy were best friends. They always played together and created many fun things. The park was never empty again, and the stranger was now a friend. Tim and Lucy were very happy, and they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time there was a brave girl. She loved to play in the sunshine outside. One day, when she was playing, it began to rain and she had to go inside. Suddenly, the little girl sneezed! She had a tickle in her nose.
When the girl opened her eyes, she saw a bracelet was there! It was a pretty bracelet and it was fairy fierce. She put it on her wrist and kept it safe.
The little girl loved wearing the bracelet. Everywhere she went, she showed it to everyone. The bracelet became her best friend. 
Now the little girl always wears her fierce bracelet - and she doesn't even think of sneezing anymore!

Jimmy and Mommy were walking in the park one day. Jimmy pointed out a really big tree and asked Mommy to help him get to the top. Mommy said, "Oh Jimmy, I don't know if I can do that. It looks too high."
Jimmy frowned and said, "Mommy, don't quit. I know we can do it!" Mommy smiled and decided to try. She stepped up onto the first branch, then the second branch. The third branch was tight and hard to get onto.
Mommy said, "Oh Jimmy, this branch is too tight. I don't think I can do it." Jimmy shook his head and said, "Mommy, don't quit. Come on, just take one more step." 
So Mommy took one more step, then two more, then three more and eventually she made it to the top. They both laughed and screamed with joy. They could see the whole park from the top of the tree. 
They stayed up there for a while and enjoyed the view. They knew that no matter what, they could always do something together. When it was time to go, they carefully stepped down, one branch at a time. As they reached the ground, they hugged each other and smiled. They had done it - they had climbed to the top together!

Sara and Tom were playing hide and seek in the park. Sara was the seeker and Tom was the hider. Tom ran behind a big tree and waited for Sara to find him. He was very quiet and still.
Sara looked around the park, but she could not see Tom. She called his name, but he did not answer. She started to feel scared. Where was Tom? Did he vanish? She ran to the big tree and looked behind it. There was no Tom. She saw a hole in the ground. She looked inside the hole. There was Tom. He was lying on the floor. He was not moving. He was not breathing.
Sara screamed. She ran to get help. She saw a man and a woman. They were Tom's parents. They were looking for Tom. Sara told them what happened. They followed her to the hole. They saw Tom. They cried. They called an ambulance. But it was too late. Tom was gone.
The result was very sad. Sara and Tom's parents were very sad. They missed Tom. They wished he did not hide in the hole. They wished he did not vanish. They wished he was still alive. They thought it was a crazy thing to do. They never played hide and seek again.

Sam and Mia were friends. They liked to play in the park. One day, they saw a big bench near the pond. The bench was high and long. Sam had a plan.
"Let's climb on the bench and jump into the pond!" he said to Mia. "It will be fun!"
Mia was not sure. She looked at the pond. The water was deep and dark. She looked at the bench. The bench was old and shaky. She felt scared.
"Sam, I don't want to jump into the pond," she said. "It is too high and too cold. And what if there are fish or frogs or snakes in the water?"
Sam laughed. He thought Mia was silly. He did not listen to her. He ran to the bench and climbed on it. He waved to Mia.
"Come on, Mia, don't be a baby!" he shouted. "It is easy and fun! Watch me!"
He jumped from the bench into the pond. He made a big splash. He smiled. He felt brave and happy.
But then, something went wrong. Sam felt something bite his leg. He screamed. He saw a big fish with sharp teeth. The fish was angry and hungry. It pulled Sam under the water. Sam tried to swim and kick, but he was too slow. The fish was too strong.
Mia saw what happened. She was shocked and scared. She ran to the bench and looked for Sam. She did not see him. She only saw bubbles and blood. She cried. She wished she could help Sam. She wished Sam had listened to her. She wished they had never climbed on the bench.

Once upon a time, there was a brilliant king. The king lived in a big castle. The king was very kind and everyone loved him.
One day, a little bird came to the king. The bird said, "King, please listen to me. My family is lost. Can you help me find them?" The king listened to the little bird and said, "Of course, my friend. I will help you."
The king and the little bird went on a long walk. They looked everywhere for the bird's family. Finally, they found the bird's family in a small tree. The little bird was very happy. The king and the little bird became best friends. They all lived happily ever after.

Once there was a three year old named Connor. He loved music so he asked his mommy to take him to visit a piano shop. When they arrived, Connor was so happy. He saw a big piano and asked his mom to sit down and try it. 
His mom said: "Sure, let's give it a test". So Connor sat down on the bench and touched the keys. Little notes started playing, and Connor was fascinated with the sound. 
He ran to his mom, who was standing at the side of the piano, and asked: "Mommy, can I test the piano too?". She said: "Yes, you can, Connor". 
Connor was embarrassed at first, but he plucked up his courage and sat down on the bench. He touched the keys and made some music, and everyone was so proud of him. 
He was so proud of himself too. He had tested the piano and made some beautiful music.

Once upon a time, there was a brave little boy named Tim. Tim lived near a big mountain. One day, he decided to climb the mountain.
As Tim started to climb, he met a kind bird. The bird said, "Hi, Tim! Do you want help?" Tim smiled and said, "Yes, let's work together!" So, Tim and the bird climbed up the mountain.
They climbed and climbed, and finally they reached the top. Tim and the bird were very happy. They had worked together and had a fun day. From that day on, Tim and the bird were the best of friends.

The sun was setting and the sky was turning a gray color. Little Anna ran out to the porch to watch the sunset. She looked up and watched as the oranges, pinks, and blues slowly faded away. All of a sudden, Anna saw something in the sky. It was a big white cloud that looked like a giant teddy bear! 
Anna reached out her arms and said, "Come here teddy bear. I want to give you a squeeze!" She felt so excited that she could almost reach out and touch it.
 
Suddenly, the cloud started moving away. Anna's Dad came out to the porch and said, "I think the wind was too strong, Anna. The cloud floated away too quickly."
Anna frowned and looked up at her Dad. "It's ok," she said as she squeezed her Dad's hand. "Maybe I'll see the teddy bear cloud tomorrow."

Lily likes to go to the park with her mom. She likes to see the trees, the flowers, the birds and the bugs. She thinks nature is beautiful. She likes to play on the swings, the slide and the sandbox. She likes to make friends with other kids.
One day, Lily sees a shiny thing on the ground. She picks it up and looks at it. It is a ring. It has a red stone that sparkles in the sun. Lily thinks it is pretty. She puts it on her finger and shows it to her mom.
"Look, mom, I found a ring!" Lily says.
"Wow, that is a nice ring, Lily. Where did you find it?" mom asks.
"I found it in the grass, over there." Lily points.
Mom looks at the ring and smiles. She says, "Lily, you are very lucky. This ring is special. It is a magic ring. Do you know what it can do?"
Lily shakes her head. She does not know.
Mom says, "This ring can make a wish come true. If you hold it and say what you want, it will ring and grant your wish. But you can only use it once, so be careful what you wish for."
Lily thinks for a moment. She wonders what she wants. She has many things she likes, but she also has some things she does not like. She does not like when it rains, when she is sick, when she has to go to bed early, or when she has no one to play with.
She holds the ring and says, "I wish I could always be happy and have fun."
The ring rings. It makes a soft and sweet sound. Lily feels a warm and fuzzy feeling in her heart. She smiles and hugs her mom.
"Thank you, ring. Thank you, mom. I love you." Lily says.
"I love you too, Lily. You are my happy and fun girl." mom says.
They go back to playing in the park, enjoying the beautiful nature and the magic ring.

Tom and Lily were friends who liked to play games. One day, they saw a big poster that said: "Come to the fair and win a prize!" They asked their mums if they could go, and they said yes.
At the fair, there were many fun things to do. Tom and Lily tried the ring toss, the duck pond, and the balloon pop. They had tickets that they could use to play. Every time they won a game, they gained a sticker. The more stickers they had, the bigger the prize they could get.
Tom and Lily wanted to get the biggest prize of all: a jolly teddy bear. They needed ten stickers to get it. They played hard and had fun, but they only had nine stickers. They had one ticket left. They saw a game that looked easy: a bean bag toss. They had to throw a bean bag into a hole.
Tom and Lily decided to share the ticket and the bean bag. They agreed that whoever threw the bean bag into the hole would get the last sticker. They took turns to try. Tom threw first, but he missed. Lily threw next, but she missed too. They were sad. They thought they would not get the jolly teddy bear.
Then, a nice man who worked at the fair saw them. He smiled and said: "You two are very good at playing games. You have worked hard and had fun. You deserve a prize. Here, take this sticker. You have gained ten stickers. You can get the jolly teddy bear now."
Tom and Lily were very happy. They thanked the nice man and ran to the prize booth. They exchanged their stickers for the jolly teddy bear. They hugged it and each other. They decided to share the teddy bear and be best friends forever. They had a great day at the fair.

Tom likes to jog every morning. He puts on his shoes, his pants and his shirt. He says bye to his mom and his dad. He goes outside and runs fast.
But today, Tom sees a big puddle on the road. He thinks it is fun to jump in it. Splash! Splash! Splash! He gets wet and filthy. His shoes, his pants and his shirt are all dirty. He laughs and jumps some more.
Then, he hears his mom calling him. She is angry. She says, "Tom, what did you do? You are filthy! You need to dress in clean clothes. Come inside right now!"
Tom stops jumping. He feels sorry. He runs back to his mom. He says, "I'm sorry, mom. I was having fun. I didn't mean to get filthy. Can I dress in clean clothes and jog again?"
His mom sighs. She says, "Yes, you can. But first, you need to take a bath. And next time, stay away from the puddle. OK?"
Tom nods. He says, "OK, mom. I love you." He gives her a hug. He goes to take a bath. He hopes he can jog again soon.

One day, Jack decided to go to the park to try out the swings. He felt excited. He could feel the gentle breeze blowing as he approached the swings. He couldn't believe his eyes. It was a big, thick swing hanging from the tree. It looks so inviting, Jack thought.
"Can I have a try?", Jack asked his mum.
"Yes, of course you can!", she replied.
Jack hopped onto the swing, grabbed hold of the chains and started to move back and forth. He felt so happy as he flew across the park. He felt the wind in his face and enjoyed the feeling of swinging in the air.
But suddenly, he stopped swinging. The swing was too heavy for him. He couldn't push it any higher. Jack was disappointed. He wished he could swing higher.
"Don't worry Jack, I will help you!", his mum said as she walked over and pushed the swing. 
Jack screamed with joy as he flew higher and higher. The feeling was indescribable. He felt free and joy. Flying up and down, Jack could feel bliss like never before. He had fun all day.

Once upon a time, there was a little yellow mouse. The mouse lived in a small house with his friend, a big cat. They were very good friends and liked to play all day.
One day, the cat said to the mouse, "Mouse, there is a big box in our house. It is in the way. Can you help me remove it?" The mouse said, "Yes, I will help you, cat." They worked together to remove the big box.
As they moved the box, they found a hidden toy under it. The cat and the mouse were very happy and played with the toy. They learned that when they work together, they can do anything. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a normal boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his toy volcano. He would pretend that it would make loud noises and shake the ground.
One day, Tim wanted to make his volcano even more fun. He had an idea to mix some things together to make it look like his volcano was really working. He found some red paint, a little water, and a spoon.
Tim mixed the red paint and water together with the spoon. It looked like lava coming out of his volcano! He was very happy and played with his volcano all day long.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was an unusual law. The law said that everyone must wipe their feet before going inside. One day, a little boy named Tim forgot to wipe his feet.
As he walked inside, something unexpected happened. His shoes started to talk! Tim was scared and surprised. The shoes told him that because he didn't follow the law, they would take him on a magical adventure.
The shoes took Tim to a world full of talking animals, where he made many new friends. But then, the plot twist came. The animals told Tim that they were the ones who made the unusual law. They wanted to teach people to be clean and careful. Tim learned his lesson and promised to follow the law from now on. The animals sent him back home, and he never forgot to wipe his feet ever again.

Once upon a time, there was a gloomy town. The people were sad because a big monster came to destroy their homes. They did not know what to do. They needed help.
One day, a pretty angel came to the town. The people were happy to see the angel. They thought the angel would help them. The angel said, "I will stop the monster and make the town happy again."
The people cheered and waited for the angel to save them. But, the angel had a secret. The angel was friends with the monster. The angel and the monster made a plan to destroy the town together. The people were sad, and the town stayed gloomy.

Once there was an old man who loved to swim. He had a special lamp that was always with him when he went to the beach. The old man would always talk to the lamp when he got ready to swim in the sea.
One day, the old man was swimming and the lamp floated away from him. The old man chased the lamp and shouted, "Come back! I need you by my side!" The lamp heard him and swam back toward the old man.
The old man was so happy and said to the lamp, "Thank you for coming back! I was so afraid I had lost you. I need you with me when I go swimming in the ocean."
The old man and the lamp were now best friends and they went to the beach everyday to swim together.

Once upon a time, there was a man who loved to dress up. He had many clothes in his big box. He liked to be useful too. One day, he heard that a party was going to happen in the town. The man wanted to help and be a part of the party.
The man thought of a plan. He would dress up as a clown and make the kids at the party laugh. He took out his red nose, big shoes, and funny hat from the box. He was so excited to be useful at the party. The man practiced his funny dance and tricks.
The day of the party came. The man dressed up as a clown and went to the party. All the kids laughed and clapped when they saw him. They loved his funny dance and tricks. The man was very happy to be useful and make the kids smile. The party was a big hit, and everyone had a great time.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He liked to play outside with his friends. One day, he saw an interesting pole in his yard. The pole was tall and shiny, and he wanted to climb it.
Tim called his friend, Sue. He said, "Sue, come see this interesting pole! Let's climb it together!" Sue came running and saw the pole. She thought it was very interesting too. They decided to polish the pole to make it even shinier.
As they polished the pole, they laughed and talked. Sue said, "I've never seen a pole like this before!" Tim agreed, "Me neither! Let's keep polishing it!" They worked together, making the interesting pole even more shiny and fun.
Finally, the pole was so shiny that it sparkled in the sun. Tim and Sue were very happy with their work. They climbed the interesting pole and played on it all day long. The end.

Once upon a time, in a big park, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia had a pretty pink bike with pedals. She loved to ride it every day.
One sunny day, Mia went to the park with her bike. She pedaled fast and felt the wind on her face. Mia saw her friend Tom on the playground. She wanted to join him, so she turned her bike towards the swings.
Mia and Tom played on the swings and had lots of fun. Then, they took turns riding Mia's pink bike. They pedaled and turned around the park all day long. They were very happy and tired when it was time to go home.

Mia liked to ride her bike. She had a pink bike with a basket and a bell. She was very independent. She did not need help to pedal or steer. She could go fast and slow, and turn left and right.
One day, she went to the park with her mom. There were many other kids there. Some of them had bikes too. Mia saw a boy with a blue bike. He had a helmet and a sticker that said "Zoom". He looked at Mia and said, "Your bike is too small and too slow. You can't keep up with me. I'm the best rider in the park."
Mia felt angry and sad. She did not like to be teased. She said, "No, you're not. My bike is fine. I can ride as fast as you. Let's race and see who wins."
The boy laughed and said, "OK, let's race. But you'll lose. I'll start from here and you start from there. The first one to reach the big tree is the winner."
Mia agreed. She went to her starting point and waited for the boy to say "Go". She was ready to pedal hard and show him that she was a good rider.
But the boy was not fair. He did not say "Go". He just started to pedal and zoomed away. He shouted, "Bye-bye, slowpoke. I'm the winner. You're the loser."
Mia was shocked and angry. She did not like to be cheated. She decided to chase him and catch him. She pedaled harder and harder. She did not give up. She was very independent.
She saw the boy ahead of her. He was getting closer and closer. He did not see her. He was too busy looking at the big tree and smiling.
Mia reached him and passed him. She rang her bell and said, "Ha-ha, I'm the winner. You're the loser. You cheated and you still lost. You're not the best rider in the park. You're the worst."
The boy was shocked and sad. He did not like to be beaten. He stopped his bike and cried. He wished he had not teased Mia. He wished he had been fair and nice.
Mia felt sorry for him. She turned her bike and went back to him. She said, "Don't cry. It's OK. You have a nice bike. You can ride well. But you should not tease or cheat. You should be kind and honest. Then we can be friends and have fun."
The boy nodded and said, "I'm sorry. You're right. I was mean and silly. Can we be friends?"
Mia smiled and said, "Yes, we can. Come on, let's ride together. There's a lot to see and do in the park."
They rode their bikes side by side. They saw the big tree, the pond, the swings, and the slide. They had fun and laughed. They were independent, but they were also friendly. They learned a lesson and made a friend.

One day, a girl named Lily and her reliable dog, Max, went for a walk. They passed by a big cardboard box. Lily looked at Max and said, "I wonder what's inside?"
Lily and Max went closer to the cardboard box. They heard a small sound coming from inside. Lily said, "Hello? Is someone in there?" A tiny voice answered, "Yes, I am here. Can you help me?"
Lily and Max opened the box and found a little bird inside. The bird said, "Thank you for helping me. I was lost and scared." Lily and Max were happy to help the bird. They all became good friends and had fun playing together. In the end, the little bird found its way back home, and they all lived happily ever after.

Once there was a little girl named Molly who was three years old. She had a pet rabbit called Bunny, who was very hairy and green.
One day, Molly took Bunny out for a walk in the garden. When the sun went down, it was time to go inside. But Bunny didn't want to go! He kept running away in the garden and hopping around. 
Molly thought hard about how she could convince Bunny to go inside. She decided to offer him a treat. She ran inside and came out with a bowl of carrots.
Molly put the carrots right near the entrance to her house. But Bunny tried to ignore the carrots and kept hopping away. Molly thought again, and she came up with an idea.
Molly picked up Bunny and said, "Come inside, Bunny! Then you can have the carrots!" 
Bunny thought about it, and decided that it was a good deal. So, he hopped inside the house with Molly and they enjoyed their carrots together.

Once upon a time, there were two kids, Sean and Claire, who loved to play together. Every day, after their lessons were done, they always went to the park.
They would collect shiny rocks, explore the playground and often play tag. They had so much fun!
One day, Sean announced to Claire that he had a special surprise. He took her to a garage and introduced her to the mechanic.
The mechanic asked them to collect some tools and they happily agreed. Sean explained that they were very independent and could do a lot of things by themselves. 
The mechanic smiled and said, "You know, if you could fix my car, I'd be very impressed. It looks like it needs some work."
Claire and Sean smiled and said in unison, "We'd love to try!"
The mechanic showed them how to use each tool and how to fix the car. The next day, Sean and Claire proudly drove the car away. 
Ever since then, Sean and Claire have enjoyed collecting tools, fixing things and being independent to everyone's amazement.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Nia. She was 3 years old, and she loved to explore. One day, she decided to check out a mysterious building.
Once inside, Nia was confused. She couldn't find an exit. She kept searching, but none of the doors seemed to lead outside. Frustrated, Nia cried out, "How can I solve this problem?!"
Just then, a kind old man appeared. He said, "If you truly want to find the exit, you must complete a challenge." He handed Nia a box full of puzzles.
Nia was scared, but she was ready. She wanted so badly to complete the challenge. After a lot of hard work, Nia finally solved the puzzles. Sure enough, the box opened and revealed the exit! Nia hurried outside, feeling happy and relieved. 
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a sunflower named Sunny. Sunny was a very fancy sunflower. She lived in a big garden with her friends. They all liked to play in the sun.
One day, the sky was dark. Sunny and her friends did not have the sun. They were sad. They need the sun to grow big and strong. So, they asked the wind for help. The wind blew and blew, but the sun did not come.
Then, something unexpected happened. A little boy came to the garden. He had a big, bright light. The light was like the sun. Sunny and her friends were happy again. They did not need the real sun. The little boy and his light helped them grow big and strong.

One day, a big strong cat went for a walk. The cat saw a small dog. They meet and said hello. They wanted to play together. The strong cat and the small dog were happy.
The cat and the dog found a big ball. They played with the ball. They ran and jumped. They had lots of fun. The strong cat gave the ball a big rub. The ball started to change.
The ball became a big bird! The cat and the dog were very surprised. The big bird said thank you for the rub. The big bird, the strong cat, and the small dog all played together. They were all very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a naughty dog named Max. Max liked to collect things. He would take things from his family and hide them in his space under the bed.
One day, Max saw a big, red ball in the yard. He wanted to add it to his collection. Max took the ball and hid it in his space under the bed. But the ball was very big and it did not fit well.
Max's family looked for the big, red ball everywhere. They could not find it. Then, they saw Max come out from under the bed. They knew Max liked to collect things. They looked under the bed and found the big, red ball. They also found all the other things Max had taken. Max learned not to take things that did not belong to him.

Once upon a time, a cat named Bow lived in a small house. Bow was a serious cat who loved fashion. He liked to wear hats, scarves, and even shoes.
One day, Bow met a dog named Spot. Spot saw Bow's clothes and said, "Bow, you look funny! Why do you wear those things?" Bow replied, "I like fashion. It makes me feel special."
Bow and Spot became friends. They played together every day. Bow taught Spot about fashion, and Spot taught Bow how to have fun. They were very happy together.

One day, a boy named Tim found a long rope in his toy box. He wanted to play with it. Tim had a fun idea. He would mix the rope with his fake toys to make a game.
Tim took his rope and tied it around his toy bear, toy car, and toy ball. He pulled the rope and all the toys moved with it. Tim laughed and clapped his hands. He was happy.
Tim's friend, Sue, came to play with him. She saw the rope and the fake toys. Sue and Tim played with the rope and toys all day. They had lots of fun mixing the rope with their toys.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim liked to play with his friends. They played games like tag, hide and seek, and catch. Tim was a happy boy, but sometimes he would act rough when he played.
One day, Tim and his friends were playing tag. Tim ran fast and caught his friend Sam. When Tim tagged Sam, he pushed Sam too hard. Sam fell down and got hurt. Sam was sad, and Tim felt bad for acting rough.
Tim said sorry to Sam and helped him stand up. Tim promised to be more careful and not act rough when they played. Sam forgave Tim and they continued to play together. From that day on, Tim played nicely with all his friends, and they all had lots of fun.

Lily and Ben love to play with their colorful toys. They have cars, dolls, blocks, and books. They like to make noise and laugh a lot. But when it is time to go to bed, they do not want to stop playing.
"Mom, can we play a little more?" Lily asks.
"No, sweetie, it is late. You need to sleep and rest. Come on, let's go to your room," Mom says.
Lily and Ben follow Mom to their room. They see their beds with soft blankets and pillows. They also see their night light, which makes a soft glow. Mom helps them get ready for bed. She gives them each a hug and a kiss.
"Good night, my loves. Sleep tight and have sweet dreams," Mom says.
"Good night, Mom. We love you," Lily and Ben say.
Mom turns off the light and leaves the room. Lily and Ben feel cozy and warm in their beds. They look at their night light and smile. They are not afraid of the dark, because they have each other. They close their eyes and fall asleep.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there was a gray cat named Fluffy. Fluffy loved to play with her friends. One day, while she was playing, she saw a big box. Fluffy was very curious and wanted to see what was inside.
Fluffy asked her friend, Doggy, "What do you think is in the box?" Doggy said, "I don't know, let's open it and find out!" So, they opened the box together. Inside the box, they found a toy weapon. It was a small, soft sword.
Fluffy and Doggy were very happy to receive the toy weapon. They played with it all day long. They took turns pretending to be knights and having fun. In the end, Fluffy and Doggy learned that sharing and playing together made their days even more special.

One day, a tutor went for a jog in the park. The tutor liked to jog because it made her feel good. The park was big and had many trees and flowers. The flowers were delicate and pretty.
As the tutor jogged, she saw a little cat. The cat was lost and looked very sad. The tutor wanted to help the cat find its way home. She picked up the cat and looked for its house.
Then, something unexpected happened. The cat started to talk! The cat said, "Thank you for helping me, tutor." The tutor was very surprised but happy to help the talking cat. They found the cat's home and became good friends.

Once upon a time, a cheerful boy named Tom found a card on the floor. The card had a picture of a cat on it. Tom liked the card a lot. He showed it to his friend, Tim. Tim liked the card too.
Tom and Tim started to quarrel about the card. Tom said, "I found the card, so it is mine!" Tim said, "But I like the card too, I want it!" They both wanted the card very much.
Then, a wise old owl saw them quarrel. The owl said, "Stop fighting! I have an idea." The owl gave them another card with a picture of a dog on it. Now, Tom had the cat card and Tim had the dog card. They were both happy and played together with their cards.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She had many yummy treats she wanted to make with her mom. One day, her mom told her she could make a special treat just for herself. Lucy got to work and grabbed some yummy ingredients from the fridge. She then put them all together in a bowl, and started to mix them up.
But Lucy was a bit bossy and didn't give her mom time to help. She said she was big enough to do it all by herself. Then she put her bowl on the stove and started to mix the ingredients up.
When it was all done, Lucy turned the stove off and opened the oven door. Every one gasped when they looked inside- the treat was burnt and crunchy!
Her mom smiled and said, 'That's what happens when you don't listen to Mommy, Lucy. Being bossy is not always the best way. When you do something special, it's OK to ask for a bit of help.' 
From that day on, Lucy never tried to do things all by herself. She waited to get help, and always made sure to share the fun with her mom too. In the end, Lucy learned that it's not always best to be bossy- it can lead to big mess-ups!

Once upon a time there lived a little girl called Sarah. She was three years old and very curious. One day she saw some stairs and started to climb them. When she reached the top she saw a white door. She opened it and found a bathroom. She had never seen a bathroom before and began to explore it. She pushed a button on the wall and suddenly, the room started to spin. Sarah quickly became dizzy and started to feel funny. 
"Mommy!", she called out.
Just then her mom appeared. "What are you doing in here Sarah?", she asked.
Sarah replied, "I pushed the button and the room started spinning and I felt dizzy." 
Her mom smiled and said, "Oh, that's the flush for the toilet." She explained that Sarah had found the bathroom and showed her how to use it. 
Sarah was so happy she had learned something new. She smiled at her mom and thanked her for teaching her how to use the bathroom. 
They both laughed and hugged, and then they started back down the stairs. They had a lot of fun together that day!

One hot summer, Susie decided to play outside. As she went out, she noticed a thief spreading across the yard. Susie knew she had to do something. She didn't know what the thief was, but she knew it was up to her to stop it!
Susie thought and thought, coming up with a plan. She took all the buckets and tubs from her garage and filled them with hot water. Then, she set them in a line across the yard.
When the thief arrived, it was surprised. It immediately stopped spreading and tried to escape. But Susie had it all figured out - each time the thief tried to sneak away, it had to pass through a bucket of hot water.
In the end, the thief had no choice but to surrender. It got burned and Susie laughed in satisfaction. She had figured out how to deal with the sneaky thief!

Ben loves his purple toy train. He plays with it every day. He makes it go fast on the tracks and makes engine noises. He pretends he is the driver and talks to the passengers.
One day, his sister Lily wants to play with the train too. She grabs it from Ben and runs away. Ben is angry and chases her. He shouts, "Give it back! It's mine!"
Lily does not listen. She tries to make the train go faster, but she pushes it too hard. The train falls off the tracks and breaks. The engine comes off and the wheels are bent. Lily is scared and cries.
Ben sees the broken train and feels sad. He loves his train and does not want it to be hurt. He says to Lily, "Why did you do that? You broke my train!"
Lily says, "I'm sorry, Ben. I just wanted to play. I didn't mean to break it."
Ben is still angry, but he sees that Lily is sorry. He remembers that mom always says to be kind and forgive. He says, "It's okay, Lily. I forgive you. But you have to help me fix it."
Lily nods and wipes her tears. They go to mom and ask for some glue and tape. They work together to put the engine back and straighten the wheels. They make the train look like new again.
Ben smiles and hugs Lily. He says, "Thank you, Lily. You helped me heal my train. Do you want to play with it with me?"
Lily smiles and hugs Ben. She says, "Yes, Ben. Thank you for sharing your train with me. You are a good brother."
They take the train to the tracks and play happily. They make engine noises and talk to the passengers. They are friends again.

One day, a little boy named Tim went for a walk. It was a nice Wednesday. He saw a big tree and wanted to climb it. As he started to climb, he heard a voice. "Hi, I am Stretch, the unknown cat!" said the voice.
Tim looked up and saw a cat in the tree. "Can you help me climb?" asked Tim. "Yes, just stretch your legs and arms like me," said Stretch. Tim did as he was told and climbed higher and higher.
As they climbed, the tree began to shake. Suddenly, the tree changed into a big ice cream! Tim and Stretch were so surprised. They laughed and ate the ice cream together. They became best friends and had a fun day.

One day, a friendly cat went to play outside. She saw a big jug. The friendly cat wanted to see what was inside the jug. She tried to look in, but the jug was very tall. The friendly cat started to struggle to see inside.
A little mouse saw the friendly cat struggle. The mouse wanted to help the cat. The mouse had an idea! The mouse told the friendly cat to push the jug over. The friendly cat pushed and pushed, and the jug fell over.
But, surprise! There was a big dog hiding inside the jug. The friendly cat and the little mouse were scared at first. But the big dog was nice too! All three of them became good friends and played together all day.

Once upon a time, in a big green forest, there lived a little bunny named Bobo. Bobo was a good bunny who loved to play with his friends. One sunny day, Bobo was playing with his friend, a small bird named Titi.
While they were playing, Bobo accidentally stepped on Titi's wing. "Ouch!" cried Titi. "I am in pain!" Bobo felt very bad and said, "I am so sorry, Titi. I did not mean to hurt you. Can you forgive me?"
Titi looked at her friend and said, "Yes, Bobo, I forgive you. I know you are a good bunny and did not want to hurt me." They hugged and continued to play happily in the big green forest.
After a while, Titi's pain went away, and they played until the sun went down. Bobo and Titi learned that saying sorry and forgiving each other is important in friendship. From that day on, they became even better friends and always took care of each other. And they lived happily ever after in the big green forest.

Once upon a time, there was a pale dog named Tim. Tim loved to play ball. One day, Tim saw a big goal in the park. He wanted to play with the ball and score a goal.
Tim ran to the goal with his ball. He paused and looked around for friends to play with. He saw a little girl named Sue. Sue was happy to play with Tim.
Together, Tim and Sue played near the goal. They took turns kicking the ball. Tim scored a goal and Sue clapped. They played until the sun went down. Tim and Sue had a fun day at the park.

Lily liked to play with her mom's comb. It was shiny and had many teeth. She liked to comb her hair and pretend she was a princess. One day, she saw a candle on the table. It had a bright flame that looked pretty. Lily wanted to see if the comb could make the flame bigger.
She took the comb and held it over the candle. She saw the flame jump and dance on the comb. She thought it was fun. But then, the comb started to burn. It made a bad smell and smoke. Lily felt hot and scared. She dropped the comb and ran to her mom.
Mom saw the burning comb and the candle. She quickly put out the fire with a cup of water. She was angry and worried. She asked Lily what she was doing. Lily said she was sorry. She did not know the comb would burn. She wanted to play with the flame.
Mom hugged Lily and said she was glad she was not hurt. She said the comb was empty now. It had no teeth and no shine. She said the flame was dangerous and not a toy. She said Lily should never play with fire or candles. She said she loved her and wanted her to be safe.
Lily felt sad and sorry. She said she loved her mom and would not play with fire again. She said she would find a new comb for her mom. She said she would be a good princess. Mom smiled and kissed her. She said she was proud of her and gave her a new comb. Lily thanked her and combed her hair. She was happy and safe.

Once upon a time, there was a big red car. The car had four big tires. One day, the car met a little blue bike.
The little blue bike said, "I am very tired. Can you help me go up the hill?" The big red car promised to help the little blue bike. They went up the hill together.
At the top of the hill, the little blue bike said, "Thank you, big red car!" The big red car was happy to help. They became good friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a big fish named Bob. Bob was very generous. He loved to share his food with all his fish friends. One day, Bob found a new friend. His new friend was a tiny fish named Tim. Tim was very shy and had a small lip.
Bob said to Tim, "Hi, I am Bob. I like to share. Do you want to eat with me?" Tim was happy and said, "Yes, thank you, Bob!" So, they swam together to find some food. They found a big pile of food for all the fish to eat.
As they were eating, Tim's lip got stuck in a small hole. Tim was scared and said, "Help, Bob! My lip is stuck!" Bob knew what to do. He told Tim, "Don't worry, I will help you." Bob used his strong tail to release Tim's lip from the hole. Tim was free and happy again. They continued to eat and share with all their friends. And from that day on, Bob and Tim were best friends forever.

Once upon a time, in a pretty place, there lived a nice cat named Sam. Sam had a toy that he loved a lot. It was a toy with the number zero on it. Sam played with it every day.
One day, Sam went to the park with his toy. He saw a bird with a sharp beak. The bird looked very attractive. Sam wanted to be friends with the bird, so he walked up to it and said, "Hi, I am Sam. Do you want to play with me and my toy?"
The bird looked at Sam and said, "Yes, I would love to play with you and your toy. My name is Lizzy." They played together all day, and they became good friends. Sam learned that even if someone looks different or has a sharp beak, they can still be a nice friend. And Lizzy learned that playing with new friends is fun.

Once upon a time, there was a big hippo who lived by a river. The hippo was very compassionate and loved to help his friends. One day, a little bird came to the hippo and said, "My friend is stuck in a tree. Can you help me?"
The hippo nodded and went with the bird to the tree. The hippo tried to speed up to reach the tree quickly. He knew that the bird's friend needed help fast. As they got closer, the hippo saw the bird's friend, a little squirrel, high up in the tree.
The big hippo stood on his back legs and reached up with his mouth. He gently grabbed the squirrel and brought him down to the ground. The little bird and squirrel said, "Thank you, hippo, for helping us!" The compassionate hippo smiled and went back to the river, happy to have helped his friends.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a wild lion. The lion was very big and strong. He loved to fight with other animals. One day, he saw a small cat. The cat was very pretty and nice.
The wild lion wanted to fight with the cat. The cat did not want to fight. The cat said, "Please, do not fight me. I am too small." But the lion did not listen. He was very wild and did not care.
The cat ran away very fast. The lion chased the cat. They ran and ran until they both fell into a deep hole. The cat and the lion could not get out. The lion was sad and regret that he wanted to fight the cat. They stayed in the hole, and it was a bad ending.

Once upon a time, there was a small, wild planet. On this planet, there were many animals. They were all friends. One day, they decided to have a big party.
A little bird said, "Let's fill the sky with pretty colors!" So, all the birds flew up and made the sky look like a rainbow. All the animals were happy and danced together.
But then, something unexpected happened. A big, friendly giant came to the party. He was so big that he filled the whole sky! The animals were scared at first, but the giant said, "Don't be scared, I just want to dance too!" So, they all danced together and had the best party ever.

Once upon a time, there were two sisters. One of them liked to number things very fast. The other sister was not as good at numbering. 
One day, the sister who liked to number fast said to the other sister, 'Let's go number things together!'
The other sister agreed, and they set off. They counted and numbered a lot of things in the park.
But then, the fast-numbering sister got bored and said, 'You are too slow, let's play something else!'
The slow-numbering sister was sad and replied, 'But I am trying my best!'
The fast-numbering sister didn't listen and kept going, running faster and faster. 
Eventually, the fast-numbering sister went too fast. She ran into the road and was hit by a car! The bad ending made everyone sad.

Tom and Lily were playing in the kitchen. They liked to pretend they were chefs and make yummy food. They used pots and pans and spoons and bowls. They did not touch the stove or the oven, because they knew they were hot and could burn them.
One day, they saw a big cake in the fridge. It looked so good, with pink frosting and sprinkles. They wanted to taste it, but they knew it was for Mom's birthday. They decided to just look at it and smell it.
They opened the fridge door and reached for the cake. But they did not see the candle on top of the cake. It was lit and had a small flame. The flame touched Lily's hand and she screamed. "Ow, ow, ow! It burns, it burns!"
