Just then, the thin branch broke! The cat fell down and landed on a soft pile of leaves. The bird flew away and said, "Thank you, thin branch!" The cat was surprised and laughed. From that day on, the cat and the bird became friends and played together under the shining sun.

Lily and Tom were playing in the garden. They liked to look at the flowers and the bugs. They saw a big red calendar on the wall of the house. It had many numbers and pictures on it.
"What is that?" Lily asked Tom.
"That is a calendar," Tom said. "It tells us what day it is and what season it is. See, this picture is spring. Spring is when the flowers grow and the birds sing."
Lily nodded. She liked spring. She saw a butterfly flying near a rose. She ran to catch it. Tom followed her.
They reached the rose bush and saw something on the ground. It was a bird. It was not moving or singing. It had blood on its feathers.
"What is that?" Lily asked Tom.
"That is a bird," Tom said. "But it is not a happy bird. It is a dead bird. Dead means it is not alive anymore. Something hurt it and it stopped breathing."
Lily felt sad. She liked birds. She wondered why the bird was dead.
"Can we help it?" Lily asked Tom.
"No, we can't," Tom said. "When something is dead, it can't come back to life. We can only say goodbye and bury it."
Lily and Tom dug a hole in the ground. They put the bird in the hole and covered it with dirt. They found some stones and made a cross. They said a prayer for the bird.
"Goodbye, bird," Lily said. "We are sorry you are dead. We hope you are happy in heaven."
"Goodbye, bird," Tom said. "We will remember you. You were a beautiful bird."
They hugged each other and went back to play. They saw the butterfly again. It was flying near the calendar. It landed on the picture of spring.
"Look, Tom," Lily said. "The butterfly is saying hello to the bird. It is telling it that spring is here and that life goes on."
Tom smiled. He agreed with Lily. He felt a little better.
"Yes, Lily," Tom said. "Spring is here and life goes on. And we are here to enjoy it."

Once there was a little girl called Mary. Mary was 3 years old and she was a very kind person. One day Mary was walking in the park when she heard a bell. It was a very loud bell! Mary was curious, so she went to investigate.
When Mary got closer to the bell, she saw that it was a big crab who was ringing it. Mary said "Hello crab, why are you ringing the bell?". The crab replied in a rude voice "Because I want everyone to know what a good job I can do with my bell. Can you show me too?".
Mary was very surprised. She thought it was very rude for the crab to ask her to show him how to ring the bell. So she smiled and said "No, I don't think it's a good idea. It's better to be kind, not rude, and then more people will help you".
The crab was surprised by Mary's answer. He thought and then he said "Yes, you are right. I'm sorry for being so rude. From now on, I will try to be a kind crab".
The moral of this story is that we should always try to be kind to others. We will get more help that way!

Once upon a time, there was a big dog named Max. Max had a brilliant red ball. He loved to play with his ball in the park. One day, Max saw his ball on the other side of the road. There was a lot of traffic with many cars going fast. Max wanted his ball but he knew he had to mind the traffic.
Max's friend, a little girl named Lucy, saw Max looking at the ball across the road. She knew that Max needed help. Lucy walked up to Max and said, "Max, we must mind the traffic. I will help you get your ball." Max wagged his tail and knew that Lucy would help him.
Lucy held Max's leash and they waited for the cars to stop. When there was no traffic, Lucy said, "Now, Max!" They both crossed the road safely and got the brilliant red ball. Max was very happy and licked Lucy's face. They went back to the park and played with the ball all day.

Once upon a time, there was a clumsy dog named Spot. Spot loved to play in the water. One sunny day, Spot went to the pond to soak in the water and have fun.
While Spot was playing, he saw a big stick in the water. He thought it was a missile, but it was just a big stick. Spot wanted to catch the stick, so he jumped into the water and swam as fast as he could.
Spot caught the stick and brought it back to the shore. He was so happy and proud of himself. Spot played with the stick all day long, and he was not clumsy anymore. He had so much fun, and he couldn't wait to come back to the pond again.

Once upon a time, there was a big gate. A boy named Tom and a girl named Lily liked to play near the gate. They were very competitive. They liked to dare each other to do things.
One day, Tom dared Lily to touch the gate. Lily said, "I dare you to touch it first!" So Tom touched the gate. Nothing happened. Then, Lily touched the gate too. Suddenly, the gate opened!
Behind the gate, they found a big, colorful playground. They had never seen it before. Tom and Lily played there all day. They were so happy that they forgot about their dare game. From that day on, they were best friends and had lots of fun together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia was a tough girl who loved to play outside. One day, she fell down and hurt her knee. Mia was sad because it hurt a lot.
Mia's mommy saw her crying and came to help. She put a band-aid on Mia's knee to help it heal. Mia felt better with the band-aid and her mommy gave her a big hug.
To make Mia feel even better, her mommy let her watch her favorite movie. Mia was very happy and soon, her knee was all healed. Mia learned that even tough girls need help sometimes.

Once upon a time there was a family who decided to travel across the country in their car. The car had four tires that allowed them to travel far and wide. But as they were travelling, one by one, the tires started to become tired and worn down.
The family kept driving until they one of the tires suddenly popped! They had no choice but to stop and get the tire fixed. When the mechanic showed them the tire, they couldn't believe it! It was so worn down that it was barely having any effect on the car. 
The family was very sad at first, but soon all felt better. They realised that sometimes it is good to take a break and get your tires changed. It is amazing how a small break can give you the energy to keep travelling.
The moral of the story is, even though it may feel like stopping and taking a break will make your journey longer, it can actually save time and energy. Taking breaks can be amazing for your journey!

Once upon a time, there was a little cube. The cube was fine and loved to blink. It blinked all day and all night. One day, the cube met a big ball. The ball was rolling around and saw the cube blinking.
"Hi! Why do you blink so much?" asked the ball. The cube smiled and said, "I blink because it makes me happy. Do you want to blink with me?" The ball thought for a moment and said, "Okay, let's blink together!"
So, the cube and the ball blinked and blinked. They had so much fun. But then, a big wind came. The wind was so strong that it blew the cube and the ball far away from each other. The cube tried to blink, but it was too sad. The cube and the ball never saw each other again.

John was a very curious three year old. One day, he looked through a microscope and he saw something special. He saw a tiny perfect flower and he smiled. Later that day, he went to bed and he yawned. 
The next morning, John woke up early and he ran outside. He ran to the garden and he looked for the perfect flower he saw through the microscope. He searched for a long time but he couldn't find it. 
Suddenly, John heard a very small voice. "John," it said, "look over here!" John turned around and he saw the perfect flower he had seen through the microscope. He was so excited he started to jump up and down! 
John realized that sometimes the things he saw through the microscope could be real. He smiled, and he yawned - this time because he was so happy!

Once upon a time, in a small village, there was a boy named Tom. Tom had a big shield. He loved to play with it all day. One day, Tom felt very tired.
Tom's friend, Sam, came to play. Sam saw Tom and his shield. "Let's play with your shield!" Sam said. Tom looked at Sam and said, "I am tired. Can we play later?" Sam wanted to play now, but he saw that Tom was tired.
Sam had an idea. "I will help you!" Sam said. He urged Tom to sit and rest. Sam picked up the shield and played with it near Tom. Tom smiled and watched. They had fun, even though Tom was tired.

Mummy, Daddy, and Jess all went to the park one day. Jess was so excited and started running around. He saw all the interesting animals, the lush green trees and the beautiful flowers.
Suddenly, Jess saw a big man sitting on the park bench. He had a messy mustache and big arms that stretched high in the sky. Jess watched him curiously.
Mummy and Daddy asked Jess, "What are you doing?" Jess replied, "I'm stretching like the man." 
Mummy and Daddy said, "That is not polite. We do not stretch in public like that man. We should always be polite and use our manners." 
Jess said, "Yes, Mummy. I will be polite and use my manners." 
Mummy and Daddy smiled. They were proud of the lesson Jess had learned. From then on, Jess always stretched at home, but never in public.

Mama was going to do something special. She filled the trunk of the car with big things. Lee watched as she loaded the armchair, which was tall and bright green. Lee was excited.
Mama said, "Come on, let's go!"
Lee asked, "Where are we going Mama?"
Mama said, "You'll see!"
So they drove and drove until they finally came to a park. Mama said, "We are here to surprise your Papa!" The opened the trunk and Mama and Lee carried the tall armchair over to where Papa was sitting.
When Papa saw the armchair he was very happy. He said, "This armchair is just right for reading my stories!" He put it right next to his chair and sat down. It was so comfortable that he fell asleep right away! Lee smiled with big eyes.
Mama said, "See, Lee, I knew that this armchair will fill Papa's heart with joy!" Lee nodded and said, "I'm glad it filled Papa's heart with joy, Mama."

Once upon a time, there was a big thing. It loved to provide for people. Every day it provided fair things for everyone. The people were happy and the thing was happy too. But then one day, something happened. The thing stopped providing fair things. The people were sad and asked the thing why it was not providing things like it used to. The thing couldn't give an answer. The people tried very hard to help the thing, but it was no use. In the end, all the people had to find other ways to get their fair things. The thing never provided again, and everyone was very sad.

Anna and Ben were best friends. They liked to play in the park every day. They had a lot of fun on the swings, the slide and the seesaw. But their favorite thing was to ride their bikes.
One day, they decided to ride their bikes to the other side of the park, where they had never been before. They wanted to see what was there. Maybe they would find a mystery.
They rode their bikes along the path, past the trees and the flowers. They saw some birds and some squirrels. They said hello to them. They kept riding until they reached a big gate. The gate was closed and had a sign on it. The sign had some words on it, but Anna and Ben could not read them.
"What do you think it says?" Anna asked Ben.
"I don't know," Ben said. "Maybe it says 'Do not enter' or 'Danger' or 'Keep out'."
"Maybe it says 'Welcome' or 'Fun' or 'Adventure'," Anna said.
They looked at each other. They were curious, but they were also worried. They did not know what was behind the gate. Maybe it was something good, or maybe it was something bad.
"Should we open the gate and see?" Anna asked Ben.
"I don't know," Ben said. "Maybe we should go back and ask our moms."
"Maybe we should be brave and find out," Anna said.
They looked at the gate again. They wondered what to do. They wanted to ride their bikes and solve the mystery, but they also wanted to be safe and smart.
What do you think they did?

Anna was a daughter who loved to swim. She liked to go to the pool with her mom and dad. They had a regular day every week when they went to the pool.
One day, Anna saw some big kids dive into the water. They jumped from a high board and made a big splash. Anna wanted to try it too. She asked her mom, "Can I dive, mom?"
Her mom said, "No, Anna, you are too small to dive. You need to learn how to swim better first. Diving is not safe for you."
Anna was sad. She wanted to have fun like the big kids. She said, "But mom, I can swim. I can swim fast and far. Please let me dive, mom."
Her mom said, "No, Anna, I'm sorry. You can swim in the shallow end with me and dad. Maybe when you are older, you can dive. But not today."
Anna was not happy. She pouted and crossed her arms. She did not want to swim in the shallow end. She wanted to dive. She thought her mom was not fair.
She waited until her mom and dad were not looking. Then she ran to the high board. She climbed up the ladder. She stood on the edge. She looked down at the water. It was very deep and blue. She felt scared. But she also felt brave. She said to herself, "I can do it. I can dive."
She closed her eyes and jumped. She felt the air and then the water. She went down, down, down. She opened her eyes and saw bubbles. She tried to swim up, but she could not. She felt water in her nose and mouth. She felt pain in her ears. She felt cold and alone. She wanted her mom and dad. She cried, "Help, help!"
Her mom and dad heard her cry. They saw her dive. They were very scared. They swam to her as fast as they could. They grabbed her and pulled her up. They hugged her and kissed her. They said, "Anna, Anna, are you okay? Why did you dive? You could have drowned. You scared us so much. Don't ever do that again."
Anna coughed and gasped. She felt sorry and ashamed. She said, "I'm sorry, mom and dad. I wanted to dive. I wanted to be like the big kids. I didn't listen to you. I was wrong. Please forgive me."
Her mom and dad said, "We forgive you, Anna. We love you, Anna. But you have to listen to us. We know what is best for you. We want you to be safe and happy. Diving is not for you. Not yet. Maybe when you are older, you can learn how to dive. But for now, you have to swim with us. Okay?"
Anna nodded. She said, "Okay, mom and dad. I will swim with you. I will not dive again. I love you, mom and dad."
They smiled and said, "We love you too, Anna. Come on, let's swim together. And have fun. But not too much fun."

One day, Jack wanted to go outside and play. He looked around his garden and noticed a big hedge by the fence. He wanted to see what was on the other side, so he decided to climb the hedge.
Jack started to climb, but it was tricky because the hedge was tall and he was only three. He kept slipping back down, but he wouldn't give up! After what seemed like forever, he finally made it to the top. 
A clear meadow and a lovely stream greeted him at the top! Jack was so excited he shouted out loud, "I made it!".
Just then, a voice came from the other side of the hedge. It was Mrs. Jones, the kind neighbour who lived next door. She said, "Well done Jack, you've done a great job! Would you like me to help you down?".
Jack replied, "Okay!" and with Mrs. Jones's help, he was soon safely on the ground. From then on, Jack explored the meadow every day. He made sure to always keep an eye on the hedge and cover himself so he could make it back home.

Once upon a time, there was a loyal dog named Spot. Spot loved his home and his family. Every day, he would play with his family in the big yard.
One day, Spot heard a loud noise. It was a band playing music. They were walking down the street. Spot wanted to see the band, so he followed them. The band played and people clapped. Spot liked the sound of the applaud.
Spot was having fun, but he missed his home and family. He wanted to go back, but he was lost. Just then, a little girl named Amy saw Spot. She knew he was lost and wanted to help him. Amy took Spot's paw and they walked together. 
As they walked, Spot heard the sound of his family clapping. They were watching the band too! Spot and Amy found them and everyone was happy. Spot was back home with his family, and he had made a new friend in Amy. From that day on, Spot knew he would always find his way back home.

One day, a little mouse saw a big piece of cheese. The cheese was in a trap. The mouse was worried. He did not want to get caught in the trap.
A big cat saw the mouse. The cat said, "I will help you get the cheese." The mouse was scared of the cat. He said, "Why do you want to help me?" The cat replied, "I want to be your friend."
The cat helped the mouse get the cheese out of the trap. The mouse was very happy. The cat and the mouse became good friends. They shared the cheese and played together every day.

Once there was a little girl called Millie. She was very excited. She was going to visit her best friend's house for a special tea party. But first Millie had to prepare. She wanted to give her friend something special. 
So she went to her room, opened the drawer and took out a paper and pen. Millie had a great idea; she was going to write a poem for her friend.
Millie focussed really hard on finding the words that fit together just right, but the words weren't coming out in the way she wanted them to. Millie tried for hours but she just couldn't seem to get it right. The poem felt dull and boring and she was losing her patience.
Millie started to get frustrated and she was about to give up when a little voice said, "Hey Millie, why don't you say it out loud as if you were talking to your friend?" Millie thought to herself, "That's a good idea!" 
So, Millie took a deep breath, closed her eyes and this is what she said; "You are my best friend, you understand me like no other, I am so lucky to have you in my life. I love you!" 
When Millie opened her eyes, she realised that she had written the perfect poem for her best friend. Millie smiled to herself, she was really proud of her work.

One day, a light seal named Sam went to the beach. Sam liked to play in the water and make new friends. He saw a little girl with a book. The girl was trying to read, but she did not know how.
Sam wanted to help the girl. He swam to her and took the book in his flipper. The girl laughed and watched Sam. Sam read the book to her with his funny seal voice. The girl clapped her hands and smiled.
Now, Sam and the girl were friends. They read and played together at the beach every day. The girl learned to read, and Sam was happy to help. They had lots of fun in the sun with their new book.

Once upon a time, in a distant land, there lived a kind and gentle king. The king loved peace and wanted everyone in his land to be happy. He would walk around and talk to the people, asking if they needed help with anything.
One day, the king saw a little girl who seemed very sad. He went to her and asked, "Why are you so sad, little one?" The girl looked up at the king and said, "My kitty is lost, and I can't find her anywhere."
The king wanted to help the girl find her kitty. He called his friends, and they all looked for the kitty together. They looked in the trees, behind the bushes, and under the rocks. Finally, they found the kitty hiding in a small cave.
The girl was so happy to see her kitty again. She thanked the king and his friends for their help. From that day on, the king, the girl, and her kitty became good friends. They played together and had lots of fun, and the land was filled with peace and happiness.

Once upon a time, there was a new flower. It wanted to bloom. It was a very small flower. The flower lived in a big garden with many other flowers. They all wanted to see the new flower bloom too.
One day, a little girl came to the garden. She had a video box. The video box could take pictures and show them to people. The little girl wanted to take a picture of the new flower when it bloomed.
The little girl came to the garden every day. She watched the new flower very closely. She waited and waited for it to bloom. The other flowers in the garden were also excited. They knew the new flower would bloom soon.
Finally, the day came when the new flower bloomed. It was so pretty! The little girl took a picture with her video box. She showed the picture to everyone. They all loved the new flower. The new flower was very happy that it bloomed and made everyone smile.

Once upon a time, there was a clever little dog named Max. Max lived in a small house with his family. Max loved to play on the big, soft rug in the living room.
One day, Max was playing with his favorite toy on the rug. His mom came into the room and said, "Max, it's time to wash the rug. It's very dirty." Max didn't want to stop playing, but he knew he had to help his mom.
Max picked up his toy and moved it to the side. Then, he helped his mom take the rug outside. They washed the rug together with soap and water. When they were done, the rug was clean and bright again. Max's mom said, "Thank you, Max! You are such a clever and helpful dog!" Max wagged his tail happily and went back to playing on the clean rug.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was very creative. He liked to draw and paint all day. One day, Tim was making a big mess in the kitchen. He was trying to make dinner for his mom and dad. 
Tim put all kinds of food on the table. There was bread, cheese, and fruit. But he also added some funny things like toys and leaves. When mom and dad saw the dinner, they laughed. 
Mom and dad knew that Tim was just being creative. They did not get mad at him for the mess. They forgave him and helped him clean up. They all had a fun dinner together.

Once upon a time, there was a gifted princess. She could find lost things very well. She lived in a big castle with her mom and dad. They were the king and queen.
One day, the princess wanted to find a new friend. She went outside and saw a little cat. The cat was lost and sad. The princess was happy to find her.
The princess took the cat home. She gave the cat food and a soft bed. They played all day. The cat was very happy. The gifted princess and the cat were best friends forever.

One day, a little girl named Lily went to play outside. She was very careful as she played. She liked to clap her hands and listen to the sound it made. Lily saw a big cloud in the sky. She thought it was going to rain.
Lily saw her friend, Tim, and said, "Tim, do you see the big cloud? We should go inside." Tim looked at the cloud and said, "Yes, let's go inside and play." They both went inside and started to play with their toys.
As they played, they heard a loud noise. It was thunder! They looked outside and saw the rain falling. Lily and Tim were happy that they were inside. They continued to play and clap their hands, making their own fun sounds while the thunder roared outside.

Once upon a time there was a lovely fair foot. It glowed brightly and made the whole room fill with light. 
One day, the foot said to its owner, "I'm so tired, I don't want to move anymore". Its owner replied, "Don't worry, I know something that will help you".
The owner picked up the foot and placed it into a magical sock. "I'll keep you safe here," he said. As the foot was put away it slowly started to glow brighter and brighter.
The following day, the owner took the foot out of the magical sock. Everyone was amazed as the foot was now glowing even more than before. Its glow was so powerful, it could light up a whole room! 
The foot had been given a magical power and was forever glowing. Everyone loved the fair foot for its wonderful gift and it was the star of the show.

Once, there was a little boy named Tim. He had a lucky penny. Tim liked to solve problems with his lucky penny. He felt happy when he had his lucky penny with him.
One day, Tim went to the park. He saw a big tree with a cat stuck in it. Tim wanted to help the cat. He thought his lucky penny could solve the problem. He tried to use the penny to get the cat down, but it did not work.
Tim was sad. He did not know what to do. He tried again with his lucky penny, but the cat was still stuck. Then, the wind blew and Tim's lucky penny fell into a hole. Tim was very sad now. He lost his lucky penny and could not help the cat. The cat stayed in the tree and Tim went home.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She liked to play with cardboard. One day, she found a big cardboard box. She wanted to make it into a house. So, she started to fold the cardboard to make it look like a house.
The sun was hot that day. Lucy was getting hot too, but she kept folding the cardboard. When she finished, she was very happy. Her house looked great. She went inside to cool down and play.
But then, something unexpected happened. The hot sun made the cardboard house very hot too. It became so hot, that it started to bend and fall down. Lucy tried to hold it up, but it was too late. The cardboard house fell down and broke. Lucy was sad, but she learned that a hot day was not the best time to play with cardboard.

One day, a little boy named Tim was playing in his room. He saw a tiny light under his bed. Tim was frightened. He called his mom and said, "Mom, there is a light under my bed."
Mom came into the room and looked under the bed. She found a toy with a button that made it light up. She said, "Tim, this is just a toy. It won't hurt you." Tim felt better.
Later that day, Tim showed the toy to his friends. They all played with the toy and made it light up. They were so happy and they all began to applaud. Then, the toy started to talk! It said, "Thank you for finding me, Tim. I am a magic toy!" Everyone was surprised and they all laughed together.

One day, a little boy named Tim went for a walk with his mom. They went to a big park with lots of trees and flowers. In the park, Tim saw something wild. It was a small bug with many colors. Tim was very excited and wanted to look at it. He asked his mom if he could examine the wild bug.
Tim's mom said yes, so he went closer to the bug. He looked at it very carefully. The bug had small legs and wings. Tim was happy to examine the wild bug. He wanted to touch it, but his mom told him to be careful.
While Tim was looking at the bug, a little girl named Lily came to the park. She was very impatient because she wanted to play with Tim. Tim said goodbye to the wild bug and went to play with Lily. They played and laughed together in the park until it was time to go home.

Once upon a time there was a little girl who loved to act. Every day she would pretend to be lots of different things. One day, the little girl decided to act like a strawberry. She put on a red dress and imagined she was a strawberry in the middle of the cold winter. As she hopped around, the little girl felt silly but so happy. When someone asked her what she was doing, she replied, "I'm a big, red, cold strawberry!" Everyone laughed and enjoyed watching the little girl act like a strawberry. Soon it was our of sight, but the little girl would never forget how silly and happy she felt when she acted like a strawberry. 
The end!

One day, a little girl named Amy was playing with her toys. She liked to be creative and make up stories. Today, she was pretending her toys were in a big universe, far, far away.
As Amy played, she realized that her toy rocket was missing. She looked everywhere but could not find it. She was sad and did not know what to do. Then, she heard a strange noise coming from her toy box.
Amy opened the toy box and found her toy rocket inside! But something unexpected happened. The toy rocket grew bigger and bigger until it was as big as Amy! She was very surprised and happy. Now, she could play with her toys in the big universe and have even more fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little angel named Amy. She loved to play hide and seek with her friends. Amy was very good at hiding, but sometimes she was a bit noisy.
One day, Amy and her friends were playing hide and seek in the clouds. Amy found a big, fluffy cloud to hide behind. As she hid, she heard her friend Tom call out, "Ready or not, here I come!"
Amy tried to stay quiet, but she accidentally made a loud noise. Tom heard the noise and said, "I think I found you, Amy!" He looked behind the cloud and saw the little angel trying to hide.
Amy giggled and said, "You found me, Tom! I'll try to be less noisy next time." They both laughed and continued to play hide and seek all day long, having lots of fun together.

Once there was a little boy. He was three years old, and his name was Sam. Sam was a very polite boy. He never disobeyed his parents and listened to everything they said. One day, Sam went to the park with his parents.
When they arrived at the park, Sam saw a beautiful fountain with water spraying up into the sky. He wanted to play in it, but his parents told him he had to be polite. Sam was a good boy, so he said "yes" and sat on the bench.
Suddenly, Sam started to feel very sad. He didn't understand why, but he started to cry. His parents ran over to him and held him close. They kept saying how polite he had been, and that made Sam feel better.
Soon, Sam stopped crying and was happy again. He was glad that his parents appreciated his politeness. Then, Sam asked if he could play in the fountain. His parents said "yes" and off he went. He ran over to the fountain and laughed with joy. Sam had a great time playing in the fountain, and his parents were happy to see him so content.

One day, a boy named Tim saw a weak bird. The bird could not fly. Tim wanted to help the bird. He had an idea. He would make a sail to help the bird fly.
Tim made a sail from a big leaf. He put the sail on the bird. The bird tried to fly, but it could not. Tim was sad. He did not know what to do.
Then, a girl named Sue came. She looked at the bird and said, "I know this bird! It is my pet. It cannot fly because it has a hurt wing." Sue took the bird home to help it. Tim was happy the bird had a friend to help it.

Anna and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a man with a big cart. He has many toys on the cart. He says, "Come and see! I have cheap toys for you! Only one coin for each toy!"
Anna and Ben run to the cart. They see dolls, cars, balls, and books. They want to buy some toys. But they have no coins. They look at each other. They have an idea.
They say to the man, "We have no coins. But we can give you something else. We can give you a promise. A promise is when you say you will do something and you do it. We promise to come back tomorrow with coins. Can we take some toys today?"
The man thinks for a while. He says, "A promise is a good thing. But you have to keep it. If you break it, I will be sad and angry. Do you understand?" Anna and Ben nod. They say, "We understand. We will keep our promise. We will come back tomorrow with coins."
The man smiles. He says, "OK. You can take some toys today. But only one toy for each of you. And don't forget your promise." Anna and Ben are happy. They choose their toys. Anna picks a doll. Ben picks a car. They say thank you to the man. They wave to him. They run to the park. They play with their toys. They have fun. They say to each other, "We will keep our promise. We will come back tomorrow with coins."

Once upon a time there was a man named Bob. Bob was a very happy man because he was going to marry a special lady. On the day of the wedding Bob felt very dizzy. He had so many butterflies in his tummy that his head was spinning around and around. Bob said, "I'm getting married today - woo!" 
The special lady was waiting for him at the church. She was wearing a beautiful white dress and looked very happy. Bob walked down the aisle and gave her a big hug. Everyone cheered as they said their special wedding vows. 
When the wedding was over, Bob and the special lady drove off in a big car. They both had big smiles on their faces. Bob and the special lady were married - they were now a family. 
Bob and the special lady were so happy that they screamed with joy. They were thrilled that they were married and that they would spend the rest of their lives together. Now they are living happily ever after.

Molly was very sad. She had wanted to go to the park but could not. She stayed at home with her mom and dad. She wished she could go out and play, but she had to stay in instead.
Molly heard her mom and dad talking. They said they regretted not being able to take her to the park. Molly felt better when she heard that. She was still sad, but she understood why she had to stay home.
The next weekend, they went to the park together. Molly was so happy! She ran around and played tag with her dad. They stayed there until the sun went down.
Molly and her parents never regretted not going to the park again. Every weekend they made sure to spend time together there. Molly smiled the whole time, happy that she could go and play.

Once upon a time, there was a shy little dog named Spot. Spot loved to run and play with his friends. One day, Spot's owner, Sam, decided to take him to a big dog race. Spot was very excited but also a little scared.
At the race, Spot saw many other dogs. Some were big, some were small, and some were very fast. Sam said to Spot, "You can do it, buddy! Just run as fast as you can." Spot nodded and got ready to race.
The race began, and Spot ran as fast as he could. He passed many dogs and finally crossed the finish line. Spot had won the race! Sam was so proud and gave Spot a big hug. They went home with a shiny medal, and Spot was not so shy anymore.

Anna and Ben are playing in the park. They see a big tree with many nuts on it. They want to pick some nuts and eat them.
"Let's go to the tree and get some nuts," Anna says.
"OK," Ben says.
They run to the tree and look for nuts. But they do not see any nuts on the ground. They only see nuts on the branches.
"How can we get the nuts?" Ben asks.
Anna thinks for a moment. She sees a squirrel on the tree. The squirrel is holding a nut in its mouth. It looks at Anna and Ben.
"Maybe we can ask the squirrel to share some nuts with us," Anna suggests.
"Good idea," Ben says.
They go closer to the squirrel and say hello. The squirrel is friendly. It nods its head and drops a nut for Anna and Ben.
"Thank you, squirrel," Anna and Ben say.
They pick up the nut and break it open. It is sweet and crunchy. They enjoy eating it.
The squirrel sees that Anna and Ben are happy. It smiles and runs to get more nuts. It drops more nuts for Anna and Ben. There are many nuts available on the tree.
Anna and Ben are very grateful. They share the nuts with the squirrel. They have a fun and tasty snack in the park.

Lily liked to organize her toys. She had a box for her dolls, a shelf for her books, and a basket for her blocks. She liked to make everything neat and tidy.
One day, she invited her friends to play with her toys. She said, "Let's have a meeting and decide what to play." Her friends nodded and sat on the floor.
Lily said, "I want to play with my dolls. They are very pretty and have nice dresses." But Anna said, "I don't like dolls. I want to play with your blocks. They are fun and colorful." And Ben said, "I don't like blocks. I want to play with your books. They have stories and pictures."
Lily felt sad and angry. She said, "No, you can't play with my toys. They are mine and I organized them. You have to play with what I want." She grabbed her toys and put them back in their places.
Her friends felt hurt and confused. They said, "But Lily, we are your friends. We came to play with you and share your toys. Why are you so mean and bossy?" They got up and left.
Lily was alone with her toys. She felt lonely and sorry. She realized that she was not gentle and kind to her friends. She wished she could play with them again.
She ran after them and said, "Wait, please. I'm sorry I was mean and bossy. I want to play with you and share my toys. Can we have another meeting and choose what to play together?"
Her friends smiled and hugged her. They said, "Of course, Lily. We forgive you and we love you. Let's play together and have fun."
Lily learned that organizing her toys was good, but sharing them with her friends was better. She learned that being gentle and kind was more important than being neat and tidy. She learned that playing with her friends was the best thing ever.

Tony was very excited - today he was going to organize a picnic with all of his friends! He went to the kitchen to get a knife and started to cut up some apples and other fruits. 
Suddenly, Tony heard his mother's voice. He had forgotten that he was supposed to be tidying his bedroom. Tony quickly ran to his room and started to organize his toys.
When his Mom came in to check, she gasped. Tony had left his toy knife next to his bed - it was very dangerous to leave it there. She was very stern with Tony and told him that next time he would be in big trouble. 
Tony felt very guilty. He had been very careless and now he was scared of what would happen. He finished tidying his room and learned an important lesson - to never leave anything sharp lying around.

Lily and Tom were playing in the park. They saw a big tree with a thick rope hanging from a branch. They wanted to swing on the rope and have fun.
"Can I go first?" Lily asked Tom.
"OK, but be careful," Tom said. He helped Lily hold the rope and gave her a push.
Lily felt the wind in her hair as she swung back and forth. She laughed and shouted, "This is fun!"
Tom waited for his turn. He watched Lily swing higher and higher. He saw the sun rise in the sky and make the leaves glow.
"Wow, you are so high!" Tom said. "Can I try now?"
Lily nodded and slowed down. She let go of the rope and landed on the grass. She smiled and said, "That was great! Your turn now!"
Tom grabbed the rope and swung on it. He felt the thrill of rising and falling. He laughed and shouted, "This is fun!"
Lily and Tom took turns swinging on the rope. They had a lot of fun in the park. They did not want to leave, but they heard their mom call them.
"Time to go, kids!" Mom said. "We have to go home and have lunch."
Lily and Tom ran to their mom. They hugged her and said, "Thank you for taking us to the park, Mom. We had fun on the rope!"
Mom smiled and said, "You're welcome, kids. I'm glad you had fun. Now let's go home and eat. You must be hungry after all that swinging!"

One day, a little girl named Sue went to the store with her mom. They bought a magazine with pictures of animals. Sue liked the animals and wanted to show her friends.
Sue took the magazine to school. She showed her friends the pictures. Her friends were envious. They wished they had a magazine too. Sue felt happy and proud.
But then, Sue dropped the magazine in a puddle. The pages got wet and dirty. Sue felt embarrassed. Her friends helped her clean it. They were still envious, but now they all laughed together.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. Lily had a book called a diary. She wrote in her diary every day. One day, Lily felt confused. She did not know what to write in her diary.
Lily went for a walk to think. She saw a boy named Tom. Tom was nice and funny. Lily and Tom played together. They had lots of fun. Lily was not confused anymore.
Lily and Tom grew up. They liked each other a lot. One day, Tom asked Lily to marry him. Lily said yes. They had a big party with cake and balloons. Lily wrote about the happy day in her diary.

Once upon a time, in a sunny garden, there was a butterfly. The butterfly was very hungry. It flew from flower to flower, looking for food.
One day, the butterfly met a little girl named Mia. Mia saw the butterfly and said, "Hello, butterfly! You are so pretty! Why do you fly from flower to flower?" The butterfly replied, "I am hungry, Mia. I need to find food to eat."
Mia wanted to help the hungry butterfly. She took it to a flower with yummy nectar. The butterfly drank the nectar and was not hungry anymore. The sun began to shine brightly, and the butterfly's wings sparkled in the light.
"Thank you, Mia," said the butterfly. "Now I am not hungry, and I can shine and fly happily!" Mia smiled and said, "You're welcome, butterfly! Have fun flying in the sun!"
And so, the butterfly and Mia became good friends. They played in the garden every day, and the butterfly always had enough to eat. The sun continued to shine, and the butterfly's wings always sparkled, making the garden a happy place for all.

One day, a boy named Tim and his dog, Spot, went to the park. They saw a big tree. Tim said, "Spot, let's play near the tree!" Spot wagged his tail and they ran to the tree. The tree had many heavy branches with green leaves.
Tim had a ball and he threw it for Spot. Spot ran fast to get the ball. But the ball went under the tree. Spot looked at the tree and barked. Tim said, "Don't worry, Spot. I will get the ball for you."
Tim went under the tree to get the ball. He saw a little bird on a branch. The bird said, "Hi, Tim! Can I play too?" Tim was surprised. He did not know birds could talk! He said, "Yes, you can play with us!" So, Tim, Spot, and their new bird friend played together all day.

Anna and Ben are playing in the garden. They like to dig and make mud pies. They are very happy and dirty.
"Look at my mud pie!" Anna says. "It has a worm and a leaf on it."
"Mine is bigger!" Ben says. "It has a stone and a stick on it."
They discuss their mud pies. They think they are the best mud pies in the world.
But then they hear a loud voice. It is Mom. She is angry.
"Anna! Ben! What are you doing? You are filthy! Come inside right now and have a bath!"
Anna and Ben look at each other. They do not want to have a bath. They like being dirty.
"Can we play a little more, Mom?" Anna asks.
"No, you can't!" Mom says. "You have made a mess of the garden and yourselves. And look at the wall! You have splashed mud all over it. It is filthy!"
Anna and Ben see the wall. It is brown and wet. They did not notice it before.
"Sorry, Mom," they say.
They follow Mom inside. They have a bath and wash the mud off. They put on clean clothes and say sorry to the wall.
They still like mud pies, but they decide to play with them away from the wall next time.

Once upon a time, there was a creative boy named Tim. Tim loved to play outside and make things with his hands. One day, he decided to make a river in his backyard.
Tim dug and dug until he had a long path for the river. He filled it with water from the hose. As the water flowed, a little frog jumped into the river. Tim was so happy to see the frog. But then, the frog looked sad. It couldn't swim up the river because the water was too fast.
Tim wanted to help the frog. He thought hard and came up with a plan. He put big rocks in the river to slow down the water. The frog tried again and this time, it could swim up the river. The frog was happy and so was Tim. But then, something unexpected happened. The rocks Tim put in the river made a big splash, and the water went all over Tim!
Tim laughed and didn't mind getting wet. He was happy that he could help the frog and make a river in his backyard. The frog and Tim became good friends, and they played by the river every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Bob. Bob loved to hop all day long. One day, he saw a big chair in the woods. It was a serious chair, not like the ones he had seen before.
Bob hopped to the chair and said, "Hello, chair! Can I hop on you?" The chair did not talk back, but Bob thought it was okay to hop on it anyway. So, he hopped onto the serious chair and started to play.
But then, a big wind came and blew the chair away. Bob fell off the chair and got hurt. He cried and hopped back home. His mom hugged him and said, "Next time, be careful when you hop on things you don't know." Bob learned his lesson but still felt sad about the bad ending to his day.

Once upon a time, there was a bird named Bob. Bob liked to fly high in the sky. He felt happy and free when he flew. One day, he saw a comb on the ground. It was easy to see because it was very big.
Bob wanted to show the comb to his friend, Sue. So, he picked it up with his beak and flew to Sue's nest. Sue was a bird too. Bob said, "Look, Sue! I found a big comb!" Sue looked at the comb and said, "Wow, that's big! Let's play with it!"
Bob and Sue played with the comb all day. They took turns flying and carrying the comb. They had lots of fun. But then, the comb got stuck in a tree. Bob and Sue tried to get it out, but it was not easy. They pushed and pulled, but the comb would not move.
Bob and Sue were very sad. They could not play with the comb anymore. They had to say goodbye to the comb and fly away. The comb stayed stuck in the tree, and Bob and Sue never saw it again.

Once, there was a little girl who loved to ride her bicycle. Every day when she went outside, she would hop on her bike and ride it around her neighborhood.
One day, when the little girl was riding her bicycle down the street, she saw a man trembling. She thought he must have been scared or lost, so she stopped and asked if he needed help.
 
The man said he was all alone and didn't know where to go, so the little girl said, "C'mon, hop on my bicycle and I'll take you home."
The man was so surprised by her compassion that he started to cry. He said, "I'm so thankful for you!"
So the little girl hopped off her bicycle and helped the man onto it. And the two of them rode off, together.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a big cliff. Near the cliff, there was a little house. In the house, there was a girl named Sally. Sally loved to print pictures with her printer. She printed many pictures of the cliff and her friends.
One day, Sally felt sad. Her printer was not working. She wanted to print a picture of the cliff for her friend, Tim. Tim was feeling sad too. He missed playing near the cliff with Sally.
Sally had an idea. She took Tim to the cliff. They played and laughed together. They found pretty rocks and drew pictures of the cliff on them. Sally and Tim were not sad anymore. They were happy and had fun playing near the cliff.

Once upon a time, there was a big, thick tree in the forest. Many animals lived in the tree. One day, a small fish came to the tree. He was sad because he lost his shiny scale.
The animals wanted to help the fish find his scale. They looked everywhere in the forest. They looked under leaves and behind rocks. But they could not find the scale. They were very tired.
Then, something unexpected happened. The thick tree started to shake. The animals were scared. But, guess what? The shiny scale fell from the tree! It did not disappear after all. The fish was so happy and thanked his new friends. They all played together and became best friends forever.

One day, a fish named Bob was swimming near the reef. He saw a very big shark coming towards him. Bob felt uncomfortable and scared. He quickly swam to warn his friends about the shark.
Bob found his friend, Sue the starfish, and told her about the shark. Sue felt scared too. They swam together to warn their other friends. They told Tom the turtle, and he was scared as well.
As they swam back to the reef, they saw the shark again. But this time, the shark was crying. The shark was not mean; he was just lost and needed help. Bob and his friends helped the shark find his way home. They all became friends and swam together by the reef.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a big flood. The water went up and up. People were scared. They needed help.
A kind man named Tom wanted to help. He knew it was important. But his car was broken. He was delayed. Tom said, "Oh no! I must fix my car fast."
Tom fixed his car and drove to the town. He saw a little girl named Sue. Sue was crying. Tom asked, "What's wrong, Sue?" Sue said, "I lost my toy in the flood."
Tom knew it was important to Sue. He looked and looked. Finally, he found the toy. Sue was so happy. She said, "Thank you, Tom!" The town was safe, and Tom felt good for helping.

Once upon a time, there was a big red ball that loved to bounce. It would bounce all day and all night. One day, the ball met a small stitch. The stitch was wild and jumped around a lot.
The ball and the stitch became good friends. They played together every day. They would bounce and jump, having lots of fun. But one day, the stitch had an idea. It wanted to see how high they could bounce together.
The ball and the stitch started to bounce higher and higher. They went so high that they could see the whole world below them. They were very happy. But then, something unexpected happened. The wild stitch got caught on a big bird flying by.
The bird took the stitch far, far away. The big red ball was very sad. It tried to bounce high enough to find the stitch, but it could not. The ball and the stitch never saw each other again. And the big red ball never bounced as high or as happy as it did with the wild stitch.

Once there were two animals, a dog and a cat. The dog wanted to buy a present for the cat, so he went out to search. He searched high and low, but he couldn't find anything nice. Eventually he saw a friendly frog, so he decided to buy the frog as a present. The cat was happy and welcomed the frog into their family.
The moral of the story is that being friendly and welcoming to others is important. Even if something or someone is different, be kind and embrace the difference.

Once upon a time, there was a girl called Sara. She had a huge pen that she loved. Every day, she went for a walk with it.
One day, she was walking with her pen and she saw a huge rabbit. She was so excited and ran towards it. Before she could get close, the rabbit hopped away.
Sara chased the rabbit, with her pen in her hand. Eventually she got too close and the rabbit got scared. The rabbit became very angry and ran at Sara.
The rabbit was too fast and knocked the pen out of Sara's hand. The pen rolled away and stopped at a cliff. Sara tried to get her pen back, but she was too slow. The pen fell over the edge and vanished.
Sara was so sad. She had lost her huge pen forever.

Once upon a time, in a big, green forest, there lived a white bunny named Fluffy. Fluffy loved to hop and play with his friends. One day, Fluffy saw a shiny reward high up in a tree. It was a big, red ball. Fluffy wanted the ball so much!
Fluffy asked his friend, Birdie, "Can you help me get the ball?" Birdie said, "Yes, I can help you!" Birdie flew up to the tree and tried to release the ball from the branches. But the ball was stuck tight.
Fluffy and Birdie asked their friend, Elephant, for help. Elephant said, "I will try to help you!" Elephant used his long trunk to shake the tree. The ball was released and fell down to the ground. Fluffy was so happy to have the big, red ball as his reward. All the friends played with the ball and had a fun day.

One day, a cat named Tim went to play outside. He saw a big, smelly bag near the tree. Tim was curious and wanted to see what was inside. He used his paws to stretch the bag open.
When Tim opened the bag, a loud sound came out. It was gas! The gas made a funny noise and Tim jumped back in surprise. He did not know that gas could be so loud.
Tim was scared, but then he saw his friend, the dog named Rex, laughing. Rex told Tim that he put the gas in the bag as a fun joke. Tim started to laugh too. They both had a fun day playing with the smelly gas bag.

Once upon a time, there was an elderly giant. The giant lived in a big forest. He was very old and tired. One day, he met a little girl. The little girl was lost in the forest.
"Hello, Mr. Giant," said the little girl. "Can you help me find my way home?"
The giant yawned. He was very sleepy. "Okay, little girl. I will help you," he said.
They walked and walked. But the giant was so tired, he could not find the way. The little girl and the giant were still lost in the forest. The giant tried to help, but he was too old and sleepy. The little girl cried, and the giant felt sad. They could not find their way home.

Once upon a time, there was a mommy, a daddy, and a little girl. The little girl was very proud.
One day, there was a big rain, and it made the mommy and daddy sad. The little girl was still proud.
The mommy said to the little girl, "Let's go outside and wave at the rain until it stops." The little girl smiled and they went outside.
The little girl was waving at the rain and the mommy and daddy were proud of her. The rain slowly stopped and the sky was bright again. The mommy and daddy hugged the little girl and said, "Good job!" 
The little girl smiled and was proud.

One day, a big, sleepy dog named Max went for a walk. He saw a cheap map on the ground. Max picked it up with his mouth. He wanted to find a fun place to play. Max yawned because he was still sleepy.
Max walked and walked, but he could not find the fun place. He met a little cat named Lucy. Lucy was sad because she lost her map. Max showed her the cheap map. Lucy was happy! They decided to look for the fun place together.
Max and Lucy had a hard time finding the fun place. They were tired and hungry. They saw a big tree and decided to rest. Max yawned again. They shared some food under the tree. After they ate, they found the fun place! Max and Lucy played all day and became best friends.

Sara and Ben liked to play with the big book of words. They liked to look at the pictures and say the words out loud. Sometimes they tried to make new words by putting letters together.
One day, they found a word that they did not know. It was long and had many letters. They tried to say it, but it sounded strange and scary.
"What is this word?" Sara asked.
"I don't know," Ben said. "Maybe it is a bad word. Maybe it can hurt us."
They were frightened of the word. They wanted to remove it from the book. They tried to pull it out, but it was stuck. They tried to rip it, but it was strong. They tried to cover it, but it was still there.
"Help!" Sara and Ben cried. "We want to remove this word!"
Mama heard them and came to see what was wrong. She saw the big book of words and the word that scared them.
"Don't worry, my loves," Mama said. "This word is not bad or scary. It is just a word that means something very nice. It means a big hug and a kiss."
She showed them how to say the word. It was "snuggle". She snuggled them and kissed them and said the word again.
"Snuggle," Sara and Ben repeated. They smiled and felt happy. They were not frightened of the word anymore. They liked the word. They liked to snuggle with Mama and the big book of words.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Tom found a razor. He did not know what it was. He showed it to his mom. His mom told him it was not a toy and took it away. Tom was sad.
Tom went to his room and started to imagine. He imagined he had a toy razor. He played with it all day. He was very happy.
At dinner time, Tom told his mom about his toy razor. His mom was grateful that Tom was safe and happy. She gave him a big hug. They had a great time together.

Once upon a time, a boy named Tim went to the pool with his mom. Tim loved to play in the water. The pool was big and blue. He wanted to swim all day.
Tim saw a spicy pepper floating in the pool. He asked his mom, "Can I eat the spicy pepper?" His mom said, "No, Tim. It's not good to eat things from the pool." But Tim didn't care. He wanted to eat the spicy pepper.
When his mom wasn't looking, Tim took the spicy pepper and ate it. His mouth got very hot. He cried and cried. His mom tried to help him, but it was too late. Tim learned that he should listen to his mom and not eat things from the pool.

Tim and Mia liked to play in the garden. They saw many flowers and bugs. One day, they found a caterpillar on a leaf. It was green and fuzzy.
"Look, a caterpillar!" Tim said. "Can we keep it?"
Mia nodded. "Yes, let's put it in a jar. It will be our pet."
They ran to the house and got a jar. They put the caterpillar in the jar with some leaves and a stick. They made holes in the lid so it could breathe.
They were very happy with their pet. They named it Coco. They watched it eat and crawl. They took turns holding the jar.
But one day, they saw something different. Coco was not moving. It was wrapped in a white thing. It looked like a ball.
"What happened to Coco?" Mia asked. "Is it sick?"
Tim shook the jar. "Wake up, Coco! Play with us!"
But Coco did not wake up. It did not play. It stayed in the white thing.
Tim and Mia were sad. They thought Coco was gone. They did not want to play with the jar anymore. They left it on the table.
The next day, their mom called them. "Tim, Mia, come here! I have a surprise for you!"
They ran to the table. They saw the jar. But Coco was not in the jar. There was a hole in the white thing. And on the lid, there was a beautiful butterfly. It had wings with many colors.
"Coco!" Tim and Mia shouted. "You are a butterfly!"
Their mom smiled. "Yes, Coco is a butterfly. Caterpillars change into butterflies. It is called metamorphosis. Coco was not sick. Coco was finishing its change."
Tim and Mia were amazed. They wanted to touch the butterfly. But their mom stopped them.
"Be careful. Butterflies are very delicate. And some of them are dangerous. They can sting or bite. We have to let Coco go. Coco belongs to the garden, not to the jar."
Tim and Mia understood. They loved Coco, but they wanted Coco to be free and happy. They opened the lid and let Coco fly away. They waved goodbye to Coco.
They learned a lesson. They learned that some things change and some things stay the same. They learned that some things are for keeping and some things are for letting go. They learned that caterpillars are not pets, but butterflies are friends.

Once upon a time, there was a team of three friends: a cat, a dog, and a bird. They liked to play together and help each other. They were very dependable friends. They knew that they could count on each other to have fun and be safe.
One day, they went to the park to play. The cat knew how to climb trees very well. The dog knew how to dig holes and find things in the ground. The bird knew how to fly high and look for things from the sky.
While playing, the cat got stuck in a tree. The dog and the bird wanted to help their friend. The dog tried to climb the tree, but he couldn't. The bird flew up and told the cat, "Don't worry, we will help you!" The dog had an idea. He dug a big hole under the tree. The cat jumped down and landed softly in the hole. They all laughed and were happy that they were such dependable friends. They knew that they could always count on their team to help each other.

Once upon a time, in a small garden, there was a cool rabbit named Bob. Bob loved to eat carrots. He would hop around the garden all day looking for carrots to munch on.
One day, Bob saw a big, orange carrot in the middle of the garden. He wanted to eat it, but it belonged to his friend, Tim the turtle. Bob decided to ask Tim if he could borrow the carrot for a little while.
Tim said yes, so Bob took the carrot and ate it. He was very happy and thankful to his friend. After that, Bob and Tim played together in the garden all day. They had so much fun, and they shared more carrots with each other.

Once upon a time, there was a little cat and a little dog. They lived in a small house. In the house, there was a stove. The cat and the dog liked to sit near the stove to keep warm.
One day, the cat and the dog had a quarrel. The cat wanted to sit close to the stove, but the dog wanted to sit there too. They both felt frightened because they didn't want to lose their warm spot.
In the end, the cat and the dog decided to share the warm spot by the stove. They sat together, side by side, and felt happy. They learned that sharing is better than fighting. From that day on, they never had a quarrel again.

Once upon a time, there was a modern town. In the town, there was a big store. The store had many things. One day, a girl went to the store to fill her bag. She wanted to buy a toy. She saw a toy razor. The toy razor was very pretty. She wanted to play with it.
The girl took the toy razor home. She played with it all day. She showed it to her friends. They all liked it too. But then, something happened. The toy razor broke. The girl was very sad. Her friends were sad too. They did not know what to do.
The girl went back to the store. She told the store man about the broken toy razor. The store man was very nice. He gave the girl a new toy razor. This toy razor was even better. It had lights and made fun sounds. The girl was very happy. She went home and played with her new toy razor. Her friends liked it too. They all played together and had lots of fun.

Tim and Sue like to play with their toy cars. They have many cars of different colors and sizes. They like to make them go fast and race each other. But one day, Tim's car stops moving. He tries to push it, but it does not work.
"Tim, what is wrong with your car?" Sue asks.
"I don't know. Maybe it needs a new battery," Tim says.
"A battery? What is that?" Sue says.
"A battery is a thing that makes the car go. It has power inside. Look, here is the battery," Tim says, and shows Sue a small black box under the car.
"Oh, I see. Where do you get a new battery?" Sue says.
"Mommy buys them at the store. But she says they are very cheap. They don't last long. She says we should not play with the cars too much, or we will waste the batteries," Tim says.
"That is not fair. We like to play with the cars. They are fun. Why does Mommy not buy better batteries?" Sue says.
"I don't know. Maybe they are too expensive. Maybe she does not have enough money. Maybe she does not want to let us have too much fun," Tim says.
"Maybe we can ask Daddy. Maybe he will buy us better batteries. Maybe he will let us play with the cars more," Sue says.
"Maybe. But Daddy is not home now. He is at work. He will come back later. What can we do now?" Tim says.
"I have an idea. Let's play with something else. Let's play with the blocks. We can build a big tower. We don't need batteries for that," Sue says.
"OK. That sounds good. Let's play with the blocks. Maybe later we can play with the cars again," Tim says.
And so, Tim and Sue put away their toy cars and take out their blocks. They start to build a big tower. They have fun with the blocks. They forget about the batteries. They are happy.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a little girl named Mia. She loved to play outside, but the weather was not nice. It was too hot and dry. The trees and flowers were sad because they needed water to grow.
One day, Mia's mom told her about a magic word called "restore." Mia was excited and wanted to help the trees and flowers. She went outside and said, "Restore!" Suddenly, the weather changed. Clouds came, and it started to rain. The rain made the trees and flowers very happy.
Mia felt proud that she could help the trees and flowers. She learned that helping others made her feel good inside. From that day on, Mia always tried to help others and be kind. And everyone in the town lived happily ever after. The moral of the story is to always help others and be kind.

Once upon a time, there was a little faucet. The faucet lived in a small house with a big family. The faucet loved to give water to everyone. But one day, the family went away. The faucet was sad and missed the family.
In the house next door, there was a big faucet. The big faucet gave water to a big family too. The little faucet looked at the big faucet and felt envious. The little faucet wanted to be big and strong like the big faucet.
One day, the family came back to the little faucet's house. The little faucet was so happy! The family used the little faucet again, and it gave water to everyone. The little faucet didn't feel envious anymore. It knew that it was loved and important, just like the big faucet next door.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim liked to run fast. He would run with his dog, Max, every day. They had a lot of fun together.
One day, Tim and Max found a big hill. Tim wanted to run down the hill. Max did not want to go. Max insisted that they should not go down the hill. But Tim did not listen. He wanted to go fast down the hill.
Tim started to run down the hill. He was going very fast. Suddenly, he tripped and fell. His head hit the ground. Tim was sad and hurt. Max came to help him. Tim learned to listen to Max when he insists on something. They went home and played together safely.

Sara liked to play with her orange ball in the park. She would throw it high in the air and catch it with her hands. She would roll it on the grass and kick it with her feet. She would bounce it on the ground and hit it with her head. She had a lot of fun with her orange ball.
One day, a stranger came to the park. He was a big boy with a blue shirt and a red hat. He saw Sara's orange ball and wanted it for himself. He walked up to Sara and said, "Give me your ball. It is mine now."
Sara was scared and angry. She said, "No, it is not yours. It is mine. I got it from my mom for my birthday. Go away and leave me alone."
The stranger did not listen. He grabbed Sara's orange ball and ran away. He laughed and said, "Too bad for you. I have your ball and you have nothing."
Sara cried and chased after him. She wanted her orange ball back. She shouted, "Stop! Give me back my ball. You are mean and rude."
The stranger was faster than Sara. He ran to the other side of the park and threw Sara's orange ball over the fence. He said, "There. You will never see your ball again. Ha ha ha."
Sara was very sad and angry. She could not reach her orange ball. She felt like she had lost her best friend. She sat on the ground and sobbed.
A nice lady saw Sara and felt sorry for her. She had a yellow ball in her hand. She walked up to Sara and said, "Hello, little girl. Why are you crying?"
Sara looked up and told her what happened. She said, "A bad boy took my orange ball and threw it over the fence. I can't get it back. I love my orange ball. It was my favorite toy."
The nice lady said, "That was very mean of him. He should not have done that. I have a yellow ball here. Do you want to play with it? Maybe it can make you feel better."
Sara wiped her tears and smiled. She said, "Thank you, nice lady. You are very kind. Can I play with your yellow ball?"
The nice lady said, "Of course you can. Here, take it. It is yours now. I want to replace your orange ball with my yellow ball. I hope you like it."
Sara hugged the nice lady and said, "Thank you, thank you, thank you. You are the best. I like your yellow ball. It is very pretty and soft. Can I be your friend?"
The nice lady said, "Yes, you can. I would love to be your friend. What is your name?"
Sara said, "My name is Sara. What is yours?"
The nice lady said, "My name is Lisa. Nice to meet you, Sara. Do you want to play with me?"
Sara said, "Yes, I do. Let's play with the yellow ball. It will be fun."
Sara and Lisa played with the yellow ball in the park. They threw it, rolled it, kicked it, bounced it, and hit it. They had a lot of fun with the yellow ball. Sara forgot about her orange ball and the bad boy. She was happy and grateful. She had a new friend and a new toy. She learned that sometimes bad things can lead to good things. She learned that kindness can replace sadness. She learned that yellow can be as good as orange.

Once upon a time, there was a restless little boy named Tim. He loved to run and play all day long. One day, Tim saw a big mess in his room. He knew he had to clean it up. He thought, "I will clean my room and then I can play some more."
Tim started to clean his room. He put his toys away and made his bed. As he was cleaning, he found a big toy judge under his bed. He remembered that his mom told him that the judge can help him decide what is right and wrong. Tim thought, "The judge can help me decide if my room is clean enough."
Tim put the judge on his desk and asked, "Is my room clean enough now?" The toy judge looked around the room and said, "Yes, Tim, your room is clean. You did a great job!" Tim felt happy that he cleaned his room and the judge was proud of him.
Now that Tim's room was clean, he could play with his toys again. He knew that he must keep his room clean from now on. And whenever he needed help, he knew that the toy judge would always be there to guide him.

Once upon a time, there was a big mountain. On top of the mountain, there was a sweet, little house. In the house lived a kind, old lady named Sue.
One day, Sue met a small, cold bird outside her house. The bird said, "Brrr! I am cold!" Sue wanted to help the bird. She had a warm, soft blanket in her house.
Sue took the blanket and wrapped it around the bird. The bird felt warm and happy. "Thank you, Sue!" said the bird with a big smile. They became good friends and lived happily on the sweet mountain.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a humble house. This house had a red roof. Inside the house lived a kind man named Tom and his funny dog, Spot.
One sunny day, Tom and Spot were playing outside. They saw a big hose. Tom thought it would be fun to spray water on the roof. So, Tom turned on the hose and started to spray water up high.
As Tom sprayed the water, something unexpected happened. The red roof began to change color! It turned blue, green, and then purple. Tom and Spot were very surprised. They never knew their roof could change colors like that. From that day on, Tom and Spot had the most colorful house in their small town. They loved to show their friends and everyone was always amazed.

Tom and Jen are twins. They like to play outside in the snow. They have red boots and blue coats. They make a snowman and a snow fort.
"Look at our snowman!" Tom says. "He has a hat and a carrot nose. He is happy."
"Yes, he is!" Jen says. "And our snow fort is strong. We can hide in it and throw snowballs."
They have fun in the snow. But then they hear a loud bark. It is Rex, the big dog from next door. Rex likes to chase Tom and Jen. He runs to their snowman and bites his hat. He pulls the hat off and shakes it.
"Hey, stop that!" Tom yells. "That is our snowman's hat. Give it back!"
Rex does not listen. He runs to their snow fort and jumps on it. He breaks the wall and knocks down the roof. He finds their boots and coats. He grabs Jen's boot and runs away.
"Hey, that is my boot!" Jen cries. "That is not your toy. Come back!"
Tom and Jen are angry and sad. They chase Rex, but he is too fast. He goes to his house and hides under the porch. He chews on Jen's boot.
"Rex, you are a bad dog!" Tom says. "You ruined our snowman and our snow fort. And you took Jen's boot. How can we go home now?"
Jen is cold and wet. She has only one boot. She shivers and sniffles.
"I want my boot back!" she says. "It is a new boot. Mom got it for me at the store. It is a modern boot. It has a zipper and a fur lining. It is warm and cozy. I love my boot."
Tom hugs Jen. He feels sorry for her. He thinks of a plan.
"Maybe we can get your boot back," he says. "But we need to be smart and brave. We need to trick Rex."
He whispers his plan to Jen. She nods and smiles. They go to the porch and pretend to play with their other boot and coat.
"Look at this boot!" Tom says loudly. "It is so nice and shiny. It is a modern boot. It has a zipper and a fur lining. It is warm and cozy. I love this boot."
Rex hears Tom. He is curious. He peeks out from under the porch. He sees the boot. He wants the boot. He forgets about Jen's boot. He drops it and crawls out. He runs to Tom and tries to grab his boot.
But Tom is ready. He throws his boot to Jen. Jen catches it and runs to the snowman. She puts the boot on the snowman's head. She says:
"Look, Rex! This is our snowman's new hat. It is a modern hat. It has a zipper and a fur lining. It is warm and cozy. He loves his hat."
Rex is confused. He looks at the snowman. He sees the boot. He thinks it is a hat. He barks and jumps. He tries to get the hat.
But Jen is clever. She throws a snowball at Rex. It hits him on the nose. He yelps and runs away. He is scared and ashamed.
Tom and Jen laugh. They are happy and proud. They have their boots and coats back. They hug their snowman. They say:
"Sorry, Rex. You can't have our boots or our snowman's hat. They are ours. They are modern. They are warm and cozy. We love them."

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He was a tough boy who liked to play outside. One day, he saw a beautiful sight. It was a big, bright rainbow in the sky. Tim was so happy to see it.
Tim wanted to show the rainbow to his best friend, Sam. They ran as fast as they could to find the end of the rainbow. But when they got there, the rainbow was gone. Tim was very sad and started to cry.
Sam hugged Tim and said, "Don't cry. We can look for another rainbow together another day." Tim smiled and they went back home. They knew they would find a new rainbow to share someday.

Once upon a time, there was a little cat named Sleepy. Sleepy was very sleepy all the time. He liked to take naps under the warm sun. One day, it was very cold and Sleepy could not find the sun. He felt a shiver and did not want to be outside.
Sleepy looked for a place to hide from the cold. He saw a big wall and thought it would be a good place to rest. Sleepy walked to the wall and found a small hole. He went inside and found a warm, cozy spot.
Inside the wall, Sleepy met a little mouse named Tiny. Tiny was also cold and sleepy. They became friends and snuggled together to stay warm. Sleepy and Tiny were not cold anymore. They were happy and warm in their new home by the wall.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved blueberries. One day, he found a big blueberry bush in his yard. He was very happy!
Tim wanted to share the blueberries with his friend, Sam. But when Sam came over, he saw something strange. "Tim, look!" said Sam. "Some of these blueberries are fake!" Tim looked closer and saw that Sam was right. There were some fake blueberries mixed in with the real ones.
Tim and Sam decided to destroy the fake blueberries. They picked them off the bush and threw them away. Then, they picked the real blueberries and ate them together. They were very yummy! Tim and Sam were happy they could enjoy the real blueberries and not the fake ones.

One day, Simon was walking in the woods and saw a hive. He was excited, but he knew it could be dangerous. He saw a group of bees flying around it and he got a little scared. 
Then he heard some giggling behind him. He turned to see three big kids teasing him. They said they would take all his sweets if he touched the hive. Simon was scared and tried to run away, but they blocked his way. 
Suddenly, some bees flew away from the hive and started chasing the bigger kids. They quickly ran away, leaving Simon all alone. He was relieved that the kids were gone, but he still didn't want to touch the hive. 
So he slowly walked away, making sure to stay far away from the dangerous hive. Simon was happy to be safe and made a promise never to go near that hive again!

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They saw a big, funny tree with many colors. Tim wanted to touch it, so he asked his mom, "Can I touch the tree, please?" His mom said, "Yes, you can touch it, but be careful."
Tim touched the tree and felt the texture. It was very bumpy and soft, like a pillow. He liked how it felt and started to laugh. "Mom, this tree feels so funny!" he said. His mom touched it too and agreed, "Yes, it does feel funny!"
Just then, the tree began to shake and wiggle. Tim and his mom stepped back, surprised. The funny tree opened its eyes and said, "Hello! I am a magical tree. Thank you for making me laugh. I will grant you one wish." Tim and his mom looked at each other, amazed by the unexpected twist. They wished for more fun days at the park together, and the magical tree made it come true.

One day, a little boy named Todd ventured out to sea on a boat. The day was sunny and bright, and the water was calm. Todd looked out into the distant horizon and was filled with curiosity. 
He asked the captain, "What will we find?" The captain said, "Perhaps something mysterious".
Soon, the boat came across a huge anchor in the water. Todd was fascinated and asked, "What is that?" 
The captain replied, "That is an anchor - it can help us struggle against strong currents". Todd was surprised and asked, "Can we try it?"
The captain thought for a moment, then said, "Yes, but it will be quite a struggle to get it on the boat". Todd got to work and, with the captain's help, they managed to lift the anchor onto the boat. 
Suddenly, dark clouds appeared in the sky and a storm came. Todd looked out to the horizon with hope. They struggled against the powerful currents and the anchor was their savior - it kept them safe during the storm. 
Finally, the storm passed and they made it back to shore safely. Todd thanked the anchor for its help and waved goodbye as they sailed away.
The mysterious anchor had saved them from the storm. Todd vowed to never forget the power of the mysterious anchor.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily liked to travel with her mommy and daddy. They would go to many fun places together. Lily was a very flexible girl. She could bend and twist her body like a pretzel!
One day, Lily went to a class with her mommy. The class was for kids who liked to bend and be flexible too. Lily was very happy to be there. She made new friends who liked to bend just like her. They played games and learned new ways to be flexible.
In the class, Lily and her friends traveled to a pretend world. They were flexible superheroes saving the day! They used their bendy powers to help people and animals. Lily loved the class and her new friends. She couldn't wait to travel and be a flexible superhero again.

One day, a little boy named John was playing with his basketball. He shyly threw the basketball up, watching it bounce off the ground. He was excited to play, but a little scared at the same time.
John's mom watched him from the window, with a warm smile on her face. She saw John was growing up so quickly. Just then, John's dad walked in the room and called out his name, "John!". 
John spun around, surprised and scared. His dad was holding a sharp knife. John's dad said, "I'm just going to cut some apples for you. Would you like some apples?" 
John's fear turned to joy and he nodded his head. His dad held out the apple slices for him and John happily grabbed them. As he munched on the apples, he threw the basketball around, sharpening his skills for the next day.

Once there was a girl. She wanted to have a fun time so she went to the store. She asked the storekeeper if he would allow her to have a fake time. He said yes, so she bought a fake time and went home.
When the girl got home, she was very excited. She wanted to have lots of fun with her fake time. But very soon she realized that her fake time didn't work. She learnt that fake time could not be used and was not real.
The girl got very sad and angry. She didn't know what to do. She soon realized that she had wasted her money on fake time and it wasn't allowed. She was very disappointed and had a very bad time.
