Once there was a young girl called Sam. She was only 3 years old and very curious. Sam had never seen a waist before and wanted to try it. She went outside in the hot summer day. The sun was shining brightly and it was very hot outside.
Seeing a waist, Sam decided to try it. She moved her arms and legs up and down. She tried to swing round and round and it felt a bit strange. She kept trying till she felt dizzy.
Sam had so much fun trying the waist, she kept going and going. Eventually she was too hot and tired and had to go inside. But Sam had lots of fun trying the waist.

The little girl named Jane was playing in the park when she saw a red ball. She ran up to the ball and said, "I want to squeeze it!" She grabbed the ball and started squeezing it. As she was squeezing it, she started feeling dizzy and suddenly saw the ball turning into a big red ball. She was surprised and scared at the same time.
She held the ball tightly and said, "What happened?" The ball replied, "I can make you fly!" Jane was amazed and asked, "How?" The ball said, "Just squeeze me faster and you will fly!" Jane was so excited and started squeezing the ball faster and faster.
Suddenly, she felt like she was flying up in the air. She was surprised and started laughing. She said, "This is so much fun!" She was having a great time experiencing different levels of speed. Soon, she realized she was getting dizzy, so she slowed down and landed back safely on the ground. She said, "That was so much fun!"

One day, a little bug named Tim wanted to crawl to the top of a big hill. Tim was a very alert bug, always looking around and listening. He started to crawl up the hill, moving his tiny legs as fast as he could.
As Tim crawled, he saw a big pile of leaves. He thought it would be fun to play in the leaves, so he crawled over to them. Inside the pile, he found a file. The file was shiny and new. Tim picked it up and said, "Wow! What a pretty thing!"
Just then, a friendly bird named Sue flew down next to Tim. She saw the file and said, "Hi Tim! That's a nice file you found. Can I play with it too?" Tim smiled and said, "Yes, Sue! Let's play together!"
So Tim and Sue played with the file, taking turns to slide it through the leaves. They had lots of fun and became best friends. After their playtime, they crawled and flew back to their homes, excited to play again another day.

Once there was a girl named Lucy. She was three years old. 
One day, Lucy's mom gave her a mirror. It was very special! Lucy was very excited and looked at herself in the mirror. But then she saw that the mirror was broken! 
Lucy was sad. She didn't know how to fix it. But then her dad came up with an idea. He took the broken pieces and glued them back together. 
Once the pieces were fixed, Lucy looked in the mirror again. She was so proud of her mirror! She smiled and hugged her dad for helping her fix it. 
From that day on, Lucy would always look in the mirror and she was always proud of it. Not because it was beautiful, but because she had fixed it herself.

Once upon a time, there was a little worm named Wiggly. Wiggly was an unusual worm because he loved to work. He would help his worm friends dig holes in the ground. One day, Wiggly met a new friend, a tiny bug named Buggy.
"Hi, I'm Wiggly! I like to work. Do you want to work with me?" Wiggly asked Buggy.
"Yes, I want to work too!" Buggy replied. They became good friends and worked together every day.
One day, they found a big, shiny rock while digging a hole. All the other worms and bugs came to see it. They all worked together to make the rock into a beautiful home. Wiggly and Buggy were so happy to have so many friends who liked to work too. They all lived happily ever after in their shiny rock home.

Once upon a time, there was a nice dog named Max. Max loved to play with his ball. One day, Max saw a big red ball in the park. He was very happy and wanted to play with it.
Max tried to attach a string to the big red ball, but he heard a loud noise! The big red ball popped! Max was sad, but he saw something inside the ball. It was a small blue ball with a note.
The note said, "Surprise! This blue ball is for you, Max!" Max was so happy to have a new ball to play with. He played with the blue ball all day and had lots of fun. The end.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a thoughtful girl named Lily. She loved to help her friends and family. One day, Lily found a small pill on the table. She did not know what it was, but she thought it could help her sick friend, Ben.
Lily went to Ben's house and gave him the pill. She told him that it might make him feel better. Ben took the pill, and something unexpected happened. Instead of feeling better, Ben turned into a big, green frog!
Lily was very scared, but she knew she had to help her friend. She thought hard and remembered a special word her grandma taught her. She said the word "restore" and touched Ben's head. Suddenly, Ben turned back into a boy!
Ben and Lily were very happy that everything was back to normal. They learned that they should always be careful with things they do not know. And from that day on, they were even more thoughtful and careful friends.

Jim was walking through the woods. Suddenly, he heard a loud noise and he felt something rough under his feet. He looked down and gasped in surprise. It was a trap! He had stepped on a trap door which had locked him in.
Jim looked around and saw a key on the ground. He reached down and tried to pick it up, but it was too far away. He shouted for help, but no one answered.
Just then, a voice came out from behind a tree. It said, "I can help you. I have a stick that we can use to push the key towards you."
Jim thanked the mysterious person and pulled the key towards him. He then unlocked the trap door and freed himself.
Jim thanked the person again and asked who they were. The person just laughed and said, "You'll never know!" Then they ran away before Jim had a chance to say anything else.
The experience was a bit rough, but Jim was so glad to be free! He thanked his lucky stars and continued on his way through the woods.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a big, mighty armchair. It was so big that it could fit two people at once. A little boy named Tim and his sister, Lily, loved to sit on the armchair together.
One day, they both wanted to sit on the armchair at the same time, but there was only room for one of them. Tim said, "I want to sit!" Lily said, "No, I want to sit!" They both tried to sit down, but they couldn't fit.
Tim had an idea. He said, "Let's raise our hands and take turns. Whoever raises their hand first gets to sit first." Lily agreed. Tim raised his hand quickly and sat on the armchair first. After some time, Lily raised her hand and it was her turn.
From that day on, Tim and Lily took turns sitting on the mighty armchair by raising their hands. They never fought over the armchair again and they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a big pastel. It had many colors. A boy named Tim and a girl named Sue both wanted to play with it. They were competitive and wanted to see who could fold it better.
Tim and Sue took turns folding the pastel. They made a lot of shapes. They made a dog, a cat, and a boat. They had fun, but they still wanted to know who was the best.
At the end of the day, Tim and Sue showed their shapes to their mom. She said they both did a great job. Tim and Sue realized that it was more fun to play together than to be competitive. They became best friends and played with the pastel every day.

Lily liked to swim in the pool with her mom and dad. She wore a pink swimsuit and a yellow hat. She could splash and kick and float, but she was scared to go to the deep end. The deep end was where the water was very high and you could not touch the bottom.
One day, a stranger came to the pool. He was a big man with a red beard and a blue shirt. He smiled at Lily and said, "Hello, little girl. Do you want to learn how to swim in the deep end?"
Lily shook her head and hid behind her mom. She did not like strangers. She did not want to swim in the deep end.
The stranger said, "Don't be afraid. I am a swim teacher. I can help you. Swimming in the deep end is fun and easy. You just need to wear these." He showed Lily a pair of orange floaties that you put on your arms.
Lily looked at the floaties. They were bright and soft. She liked orange. She wondered if they would make her float in the deep end.
Her mom said, "Lily, why don't you try them? The swim teacher is very nice. He will encourage you and hold your hand. You can do it. You are a brave girl."
Lily thought about it. She wanted to be brave. She wanted to have fun. She nodded and said, "Okay, I will try."
The swim teacher helped Lily put on the floaties. He said, "Good job, Lily. You are ready to go. Follow me to the deep end. I will be with you all the time."
Lily took a deep breath and followed the swim teacher. She felt the water get higher and higher. She felt the floaties keep her up. She felt the swim teacher hold her hand. She heard him say, "You are doing great, Lily. You are swimming in the deep end. You are amazing."
Lily smiled and said, "I am swimming in the deep end. I am amazing."
She looked around and saw her mom and dad cheering for her. She felt proud and happy. She liked swimming in the deep end. She liked the swim teacher. She said, "Thank you, stranger. You are very nice. You helped me swim in the deep end."
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a big crane. The crane had a rough neck. He lived by a pond with many animals.
One day, the crane met a little frog. The frog said, "Hi, crane! I like your rough neck. Can you speak like me?" The crane tried to speak like the frog, but he could not. He felt sad.
The next day, the crane saw a duck. The duck said, "Hi, crane! I like your rough neck too. Can you speak like me?" The crane tried again to speak like the duck, but he still could not. He felt even more sad.
The crane went to the pond and saw his reflection. He thought, "I may not speak like the frog or the duck, but I am still a special crane with a rough neck." The other animals liked the crane just the way he was. And they all lived happily together by the pond.

Once upon a time, there was a heavy rock named Rocky. He lived in a big field, where the wind blew all day. Rocky liked to watch the trees stretch their branches when the wind blew.
One day, the wind blew very hard. It blew so hard that Rocky started to roll. He rolled and rolled until he hit a tree. The tree was not happy. It said, "Rocky, you hurt me! Why did you do that?"
Rocky felt bad. He wanted to say sorry, but he did not know how. He thought and thought. Then, he had an idea. He asked the wind to help him. The wind blew and helped Rocky roll back to his spot in the field. The tree saw this and smiled. Rocky was happy that he could say sorry and make the tree feel better.

One day, a little sad puppy was lost in the big park. He did not know how to find his way home. The puppy was very hungry and scared. The puppy sat under a tree and began to cry.
A little girl named Lily heard the puppy's cries. She went to the tree and saw the sad puppy. Lily wanted to help the puppy find his way home. She held the puppy in her arms and said, "Don't worry, puppy. I will help you."
Lily and the puppy walked around the park, looking for the puppy's home. They could not find it. Lily felt sad too. She held the puppy close and began to pray. "Please help us find the puppy's home," she said.
Suddenly, a kind man heard Lily's prayer. He knew the puppy and where he lived. The man took Lily and the puppy to the puppy's home. The puppy was so happy to be home again. He licked Lily's face to say thank you. Lily smiled and knew that her prayer was answered.

Once upon a time, there was a gifted frog. This frog could glow in the dark. He lived near a pool. He liked to play in the water. The other frogs liked to watch him glow.
Every night, the gifted frog would jump in the pool. His glow would light up the water. The other frogs would clap and cheer. They were very happy.
One day, a big bird saw the glowing frog. The bird thought the frog would be a tasty treat. The bird swooped down and grabbed the frog. The other frogs were sad. The gifted frog was gone, and the pool was dark again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She had a pretty comb that she used every day. One day, Sue went to play outside, but it was very cold. She put on her warm hat, but she forgot her comb at home.
Sue played in the cold for a long time. She built a big snowman with a big smile. But then, her hair became messy. She needed her comb. Sue thought she would not succeed in finding her comb in the cold.
But then, something unexpected happened. The snowman started to talk! He said, "I have your comb, Sue!" Sue was so surprised. The snowman gave Sue her comb. She combed her hair and it looked nice again. Sue and the snowman became good friends. They played in the cold every day, and Sue always remembered her comb.

Sara liked to dance. She danced in her room, in the garden, and in the park. She danced with her dolls, her dog, and her friends. She danced when she was happy, when she was sad, and when she was bored.
One day, Sara saw a woman dancing on the street. The woman wore a red dress and a big hat. She danced with a smile and a song. Sara wanted to dance with her. She ran to the woman and said, "Hello, can I dance with you?"
The woman was frightened. She did not know Sara. She did not like strangers. She thought Sara was a bad girl. She screamed and ran away. She dropped her hat and her purse.
Sara was sad. She did not want to scare the woman. She wanted to be friends. She picked up the hat and the purse. She ran after the woman and said, "Sorry, sorry, I just wanted to dance. Here is your hat and your purse."
The woman stopped and looked at Sara. She saw that Sara was a good girl. She saw that Sara was sorry. She felt bad for screaming and running away. She smiled and said, "Thank you, thank you, you are very kind. I'm sorry for being scared. Do you still want to dance?"
Sara nodded and smiled. The woman put on her hat and held her purse. She took Sara's hand and said, "Let's dance, let's dance, you are my new friend." They danced on the street. They danced with a smile and a song. They danced and they were happy.

Once upon a time, there was a big box. Inside the box there was something special. It was a pillow! The pillow was smooth and fluffy.
The little girl loved the pillow so much. She wanted to keep the pillow safe and sound, so she decided to store it in her bedroom. 
Every morning when she woke up, the girl always gave the pillow a big hug. One day, she even decided to take the pillow with her wherever she went!
On a hot day, the girl brought her pillow to the beach. She laid it on the sand and it felt so smooth. The girl spent the day playing games and swimming in the sea, but she never forgot to give her pillow a big hug whenever she passed by.
In the end, the girl took her pillow back home and stored it in her bedroom, safe and sound.

Once upon a time, there was a thin cat named Tom. Tom was hungry and wanted to find some food. He saw a jar on the kitchen table. Tom thought there might be food inside the jar.
Tom jumped on the table and tried to open the jar. But it was too hard for him. He asked his friend, a little mouse named Jerry, for help. "Jerry, can you help me open this jar?" Tom said. Jerry nodded and tried to help Tom. They pushed and pulled, but the jar would not open.
Finally, Tom and Jerry gave up. They had to surrender because they could not open the jar. They were both still hungry and sad. The jar stayed on the table, and Tom and Jerry went to bed with empty tummies. The end.

Tom and Lily were hungry. They wanted to eat some soup. Mom gave them each a bowl of soup. The soup was hot and yummy.
"Can I have more soup, please?" Tom asked Mom.
"Sure, you can have more soup. But be careful, it is still hot." Mom said. She used a big spoon to increase the soup in Tom's bowl.
"Thank you, Mom!" Tom said. He blew on his soup to cool it down. He ate his soup with a small spoon.
Lily watched Tom. She wanted more soup too. She liked soup. She opened her mouth and said, "More soup, please!"
Mom smiled. She used the big spoon to increase the soup in Lily's bowl.
"Thank you, Mom!" Lily said. She blew on her soup to cool it down. She ate her soup with a small spoon.
Tom and Lily ate all their soup. They were happy and full. They gave Mom a hug and a kiss.
"Good job, Tom and Lily! You ate all your soup. Now you can have some fruit for dessert." Mom said.
Tom and Lily were excited. They loved fruit. They ran to the table and picked their favorite fruit. They ate their fruit with their fingers. They made funny faces and laughed. Mom laughed too. She was proud of Tom and Lily. They were good children.

Ben and Lily were very excited. Today was the day of the big firework show. They had never seen fireworks before. They wanted to find the best spot to watch them.
They ran to the park with their mom and dad. They saw many people with blankets and baskets. They heard loud music and smelled popcorn. They looked for a place to sit.
"Look, there is a hill over there!" Ben said. "We can see better from there!"
"Good idea, Ben!" Lily said. "Let's go!"
They climbed the hill with their mom and dad. They found a nice spot under a tree. They spread their blanket and waited for the show to start.
Soon, the sky became dark. The music stopped. Everyone was quiet. Then, the first firework went up. It was red and sparkly. It made a loud boom. Ben and Lily clapped and cheered.
More fireworks followed. They were blue, green, yellow, purple, and pink. They made different shapes and sounds. They were incredible. Ben and Lily were amazed. They oohed and aahed.
"Wow, this is so beautiful!" Lily said.
"I love fireworks!" Ben said.
They hugged their mom and dad. They watched the fireworks until the end. They were very happy. They had found the best spot to watch the incredible fireworks.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to play outside. He saw his friend, the ant, working very hard. The ant was trying to move a big piece of dust, but it was difficult.
Tim asked, "Can I help you move the dust?" The ant said, "Yes, please! It is very difficult for me." Tim trusted the ant, so he helped him move the dust.
Together, they moved the dust to the ant's home. The ant was very happy and said, "Thank you, Tim!" They both smiled and played together for the rest of the day.

Once upon a time two friends were sitting by the river. They were both excited because they had found a raft. The raft was long, it looked like they could go far if they used it.
The friends hopped onto the raft and started to paddle. As they paddled further, the water became calmer and the sun got brighter. 
Suddenly, a strong wind started to blow and the raft shook. The friends heard something whispering and the raft started to move faster. They gasped. 
The raft moved and moved until it was too far away for them to paddle back. They were lost and confused. They had gone too far, too fast and were stuck in the middle of the river.
The friends cried and whispered for help, but no one could hear them. Unfortunately, their adventure had come to a bad end.

Once upon a time, there was a young boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his toy cars and trucks. One day, Tim saw a big sign near his house. The sign had a picture of a big truck on it. Tim was very excited and wanted to see the truck.
Tim's mom said that the truck was at an operation where they fix cars and trucks. Tim asked his mom if they could go see the operation. His mom said yes, and they went to see the big truck.
When they got there, Tim saw the big truck up close. He was very happy. But then, the big truck started to move and it hit a small car. The small car was broken and Tim was sad. The big truck had to go away, and Tim did not get to play with it. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a wish. He wanted to own a big, red ball. One day, he saw the ball in a shop. He asked his mom, "Can I have that ball, please?"
His mom said, "Yes, but you must promise to eat healthy food and be a good boy." Tim promised to eat healthy food and be a good boy. So, his mom bought him the big, red ball.
Tim played with the ball every day. He also ate healthy food like fruits and vegetables. He became very strong and happy. His friends saw him and wanted to be like him too. They started eating healthy food and playing together. In the end, everyone was happy and healthy.
The moral of the story is: Eating healthy food and being a good person can make your wishes come true.

Once upon a time, there was a nurse named Brian who had the most perfect folding skills. Every time he was asked to fold something, he was able to do it so perfectly.
One day, a 3-year old boy named David came to the hospital and Brian was assigned to take care of him. David noticed Brian's folding skills and was so amazed. "Can you teach me how to fold too?" asked David.
Brian laughed and said, "Sure, I can teach you! But first, I want you to practice counting to 3. When you can count to 3 perfectly, we will start folding."
David practiced counting and finally mastered counting to 3 perfectly. With excitement, he ran back to Brian's office and said, "I did it! I can count to 3 perfectly! Please, can you teach me folding now?"
Brian smiled and said, "Sure! Now that you have perfect counting skills, I'm sure you will have perfect folding skills too!"
And from then on, David and Brian practiced folding together. David learned so quickly and before long, he was as perfect a folder as Brian!

One day, a fireman named Sam went to the park. He saw a little boy named Timmy. Timmy was sad because he could not find a seat on the swing. Sam wanted to help Timmy.
Sam said, "Timmy, let's find a seat for you." They looked around and saw a big tree. Sam felt guilty because he could not find a seat for Timmy. But then, Sam had an idea.
Sam said, "I will help you, Timmy." The fireman picked up Timmy and put him on a big branch. Timmy was happy. He said, "Thank you, Sam!" They played together all day and became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. Lucy liked to play outside in her yard. One day, it was very dull outside, but Lucy still wanted to play.
Lucy went to the ground and saw a little bug. She watched the bug as it crawled on the ground. Lucy wanted the bug to remain with her, so she put it in a small box.
Later, the sun came out and it was not dull anymore. Lucy opened the box and let the bug go. The bug crawled away, and Lucy was happy to see it go back to its home.

Sara was a little girl who liked to climb trees. She wanted to find a lime, a green fruit that was sour and juicy. She saw a big tree with many limes in the park. She ran to the tree and started to climb.
But the tree was very high and the branches were very thin. Sara was not careful and she slipped. She fell down and hurt her leg. She cried and cried, but no one heard her. She was lonely and scared.
A dog came to the park and saw Sara. He was hungry and he smelled the limes. He wanted to eat them. He barked and jumped at the tree. He shook the tree and made the limes fall. He ate some of the limes and left the rest.
Sara saw the dog and the limes. She was angry and sad. She wanted a lime, but now they were all gone. She had no fruit and no friend. She wished she had listened to her mom, who told her not to climb trees alone.
The moral of the story is: be careful when you climb trees, and don't go to the park without your mom.

One day, Jack and his Mommy were walking in the park. Jack saw a big cone that he liked and he asked Mommy if he could have it. Mommy told him "No, Jack. We are not supposed to take things that don't belong to us. It's not right." Jack started to cry and was very sad.
Mommy said, "Jack, it's okay. I can forgive you if you promise not to do it again." Jack stopped crying and said, "Yes, Mommy. I promise, I won't do it again."
Jack was being a very persistent little boy and he asked Mommy again if he could have the cone. Again, Mommy said no. She told Jack, "It's not ours, and we cannot have it." But, Jack asked every day for a week and eventually, Mommy said "Yes".
Jack was so pleased and went running to the cone. He picked it up and showed it to Mommy with a big smile on his face. Mommy smiled too, knowing that she had been able to forgive and teach her son a valuable lesson.

One day, a small red square was walking in the park. The square was not very smart, and sometimes did stupid things. But the square had many friends who liked to play with him.
While playing, something happened. The square got stuck in a hole. He tried to get out but couldn't. His friends saw him and wanted to help. They all tried to pull the square out of the hole.
Finally, with the help of his friends, the square got out of the hole. He was very happy and thanked his friends. They all played together again and had lots of fun. The square learned that even if he does something stupid, his friends will always be there to help him.

Once upon a time, there was a daddy who had to deliver a special tooth. He was carrying it carefully and walking very alert.
He soon came to a house which was standing very tall. He tapped on the door, and a little girl came to see who was there. She had a big smile and lots of beautiful shiny teeth. 
"I'm here to deliver this tooth!" said the daddy. He showed the little girl the special tooth that he had. It was a sparkly golden tooth, and everyone in the house was excited to see it. 
The daddy carefully fitted the tooth onto the little girl's mouth. Then he kissed her on the forehead and sent a big smile to everyone in the house. 
The little girl was so happy with her new tooth. She thanked the daddy for delivering it and everybody cheered. The tooth made the little girl's smile even bigger!

One day, a little boy named Tim found a small, harmless bug. The bug was blue, like the sky. Tim liked the bug and wanted to show his friend, Sam. 
Tim put the bug in a box and went to Sam's house. When he got there, he said, "Sam, look at my new blue bug! It is so harmless and nice." Sam looked at the box and said, "Wow, Tim! I want to see it too."
But when Tim opened the box, the bug was gone! They were both sad. Then, they heard a noise. It was the bug! It was hiding behind a big, shut door. Tim and Sam laughed and played with the harmless blue bug all day long.

Once upon a time, in a big hot desert, there was an incredible oasis. In this oasis, there were many animals who liked to play and have fun. One day, a strong big bird and a small fast rabbit were playing with a ball.
The bird wanted to hold the ball all the time, but the rabbit wanted to hold it too. They started to get mad at each other. The bird said, "I am big, I can hold the ball better!" The rabbit said, "I am fast, I can hold the ball and run!"
A wise old turtle saw the bird and the rabbit fighting. He said, "You both can hold the ball and play together. You can take turns holding the ball. That way, everyone can have fun!" The bird and the rabbit listened to the wise old turtle.
They started to take turns holding the ball, and they played together happily. The incredible oasis was peaceful and full of joy once again. The bird, the rabbit, and all the other animals learned that sharing and taking turns can make everyone happy.

Once upon a time, in a busy little town, there lived a girl named Sue. She liked to play outside every day. One day, while playing, she saw something shiny on the ground. It was a diamond! Sue was very happy and excited.
She showed the diamond to her mom and dad. They were happy too. They told her that something special would happen because she found the diamond. Sue wondered what would happen, but she was happy to wait and see.
The next day, Sue went to the park with the diamond. She played with her friends and showed them the diamond. They all thought it was beautiful. Then, something amazing happened. A big rainbow appeared in the sky, and everyone was happy. Sue knew that the diamond had made the rainbow happen. From that day on, Sue always kept the diamond with her, and her life was filled with happiness and magic.

Once upon a time, a slow turtle named Tim went to the doctor. The doctor took an x-ray of Tim's shell because he had a little pain. The x-ray showed a small key inside the shell. Tim was very surprised.
Tim's mom told him that the key would remind him of a secret. Tim was excited to find out the secret. He went on a walk with his mom to look for a door that the key could open.
When they found a little door, Tim put the key in and turned it. The door opened and they saw a big room full of toys! The toys were all Tim's, but he forgot about them. The key helped Tim remember his toys and he played with them all day.

Once upon a time, in a big jungle, there lived a big lion. The lion liked to roar very loud. All the animals in the jungle were scared of the lion's roar.
One day, a small bird had an idea. The bird thought, "Maybe if I sing a pretty song, the lion will not roar so much." So, the bird sang a song for the lion. The lion liked the song and did not roar as much.
The bird felt happy because her idea worked. The lion also felt happy because he had a new friend. Now, the jungle was not so scary, and all the animals lived together with the lion, who did not roar so much anymore. The bird's idea was not cheap, but it made everyone in the jungle feel safe and happy.

Once upon a time there was a lucky duck named Dilly. Dilly wanted to go for a swim in the pond he saw near the river, but he was too little to get there on his own. Suddenly, he saw a barrel floating in the water. Dilly was so excited! He paddled his way towards the barrel and climbed inside.
Dilly was so happy, he started quacking loudly. But he also heard a strange noise from inside the barrel. Dilly stopped quacking and asked, "Who's that?"
He heard a voice reply, "It's me, I'm Sharp the fish."
Dilly was so surprised! He asked, "What are you doing in this barrel?"
Sharp the Fish said, "I was swimming along when I spotted this barrel and decided to take a rest. But now I'm stuck and I can't get out."
Dilly smiled. He said, "Don't worry, I'm a lucky duck and I will help you get out of the barrel."
And with that, Dilly waddled over to the barrel, pushed it back out into the water, and Sharp the Fish swam out with a big splash. 
Dilly and Sharp said their goodbyes and Dilly swam away to find his pond. He was very lucky that day, and so was Sharp the Fish.

Once upon a time, there was a red bird named Bob. Bob loved to eat vegetables. One day, he saw a big, red vegetable in a garden. He wanted it very much. But the garden belonged to a big dog named Max.
Bob asked Max, "Can you allow me to take the red vegetable, please?" Max said, "No, you cannot. It is my vegetable." Bob was sad, but he really wanted that vegetable.
Bob tried to take the vegetable when Max was not looking. But Max saw him and got very mad. Max chased Bob away and did not let him have the red vegetable. Bob flew away, sad and hungry.

One day, a powerful dog named Max went to a restaurant with his family. Max was very happy because he loved to eat. He saw a big red ball outside the restaurant and wanted to play with it. Max's mom said, "Not now, Max. We will eat first, then you can play with the ball." Max was excited to play later.
While they were eating, Max heard a loud noise outside. He looked out the window and saw the big red ball rolling away. Max knew something would happen if the ball kept rolling. He asked his mom if he could go stop the ball. His mom said, "Yes, Max. Go save the ball!"
Max ran outside and used his powerful legs to catch the big red ball. He stopped the ball just before it hit a little girl. The girl was very happy that Max saved her. Max's family was proud of him for being so brave. Max knew that he could eat and play with the big red ball now.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his blocks. He would make a big stack with them. One day, Tim wanted to complete the most interesting stack ever.
Tim asked his friend, Sam, to help him. They worked together to build the stack higher and higher. "Wow, this is fun!" said Sam. "Yes, it is!" Tim agreed. They both smiled as they played.
But then, a big wind came. It blew and blew, and knocked the stack down. Tim and Sam were sad. The interesting stack was gone. The end.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park. He saw a big orange plane. The plane could not fly. It just stood there. Tim was sad because he wanted to see the plane fly.
Then, a man came to fix the plane. He worked and worked. Tim watched the man. Suddenly, the orange plane started to move. It was flying! Tim was very happy.
But wait! The plane was not flying. It was a big orange bird! The bird flew away with a loud "tweet-tweet." Tim laughed and clapped. The park was full of surprises.

Once upon a time, there was a blue belt. The belt was very sad because it was old and broken. It wanted to be new and pretty again.
One day, a kind girl named Sue found the blue belt. Sue had an idea! She would replace the old belt with a new one. The blue belt was very happy.
But then, something unexpected happened. Sue found out that the old blue belt had magic powers! The belt could talk and help her with her problems. Sue decided to keep the old blue belt and they became best friends. The blue belt was happy again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a small house with her mom and dad. Lily loved to look at the moon at night. She thought it was big and bright.
One night, Lily looked at the moon and it seemed very boring. It was not as big and bright as before. She told her mom and dad about the boring moon. They said, "Maybe the moon is sad and needs a friend."
Lily wanted to help the moon. She decided to accept the moon as her friend. She talked to the moon every night, telling it stories and jokes. Soon, the moon became big and bright again. It was happy to have Lily as a friend. And they lived happily ever after.

Jimmy and his mom were having a wonderful day. They went to the park and Jimmy enjoyed playing on the slide and swings. His mom was so proud of him for playing so nicely. 
Jimmy then noticed a bird and ran after it. His mom called out for him to stop, but he kept running. She was worried for his safety, so she ran after him. 
Jimmy reached the bird before his mom could catch him. His mom told him not to touch the bird as it could be dangerous. But Jimmy was so excited, he didn't listen and grabbed the bird. 
The bird then flew away with Jimmy following it. His mom shouted at him to stop, but he didn't listen. His mom realised that she couldn't allow him to follow the bird and ran after him. 
But it was too late. Jimmy had run too far away and his mom could not catch up to him. No matter how hard she looked, she couldn't find him. 
 Jimmy's mom was so worried and felt so sad. She knew she couldn't be proud anymore and her will had been broken.

One day, a little girl named Sue went for a walk. She saw a big drain on the side of the road. Sue was curious and wanted to look inside. She was a bit ignorant and didn't know that drains could be dirty and smelly.
As Sue got closer to the drain, she saw a small frog. The frog said, "Hi, I'm Fred the frog. What's your name?" Sue replied, "I'm Sue. Nice to meet you, Fred!" Fred asked, "What are you doing near this drain, Sue?" Sue said, "I wanted to see what's inside."
Fred told Sue, "Drains can be yucky. Let's skip away from here and play in the park instead." Sue agreed, and they both skipped to the park. They had a fun day playing together, and Sue learned to stay away from dirty drains.

Once upon a time, there was a fast dog named Max. Max loved to run and play. Max had a job. He would serve people at the grocery store. Max's friend, Sam, worked at the grocery store too. Sam was a nice boy. Max and Sam liked to help people.
One day, Max saw a big box at the back of the grocery store. Max knew the box was important. Max told Sam about the big box. Sam said, "We will need that box later, Max. It is a surprise for the people."
The next day, many people came to the grocery store. Max and Sam were very busy. They served the people and helped them find what they needed. Then, Max remembered the big box. Max and Sam opened the box. Inside were balloons and treats for the people. The people were happy and thanked Max and Sam. Max and Sam knew they did a good job.

Tom and Sue like to play in the garden. They see many ants on the ground. The ants are busy and strong. They carry food and make a home.
Tom says, "I want to play with the ants. They are fun and flexible. They can bend and twist and go under things."
Sue says, "No, Tom. The ants are not toys. They are living things. They need to work and be safe. If you touch them, they might bite you or run away."
Tom and Sue have an idea. They decide to have a race with the ants. They find a big leaf and put it on the ground. They draw a line with a stick. They say, "This is the start. This is the end. The first ant to cross the end wins."
They look for two ants that are close to the leaf. They say, "You are the red ant. You are the black ant. Ready, set, go!"
The ants do not know what Tom and Sue are doing. They do not care about the race. They just want to find food and go back to their home. The red ant sees a crumb on the leaf. It goes to the leaf and picks up the crumb. The black ant sees a seed on the ground. It goes to the seed and picks up the seed.
Tom and Sue watch the ants. They cheer and shout. They say, "Go, red ant! Go, black ant! You can do it! You are fast and flexible!"
The red ant carries the crumb to the end of the leaf. It crosses the line that Tom and Sue drew. Tom and Sue say, "The red ant wins! The red ant wins! Hooray for the red ant!"
The black ant carries the seed to its home. It does not cross the line that Tom and Sue drew. Tom and Sue say, "The black ant loses. The black ant loses. Boo for the black ant!"
The ants do not hear what Tom and Sue say. They do not care who wins or loses. They are happy with their food and their home. They are busy and strong. They are flexible and fun.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. He saw a tasty lollipop in the store near the park. His mom bought it for him. Tim was so happy. He held the lollipop and smiled.
In the park, Tim met a girl named Lily. She saw the lollipop in Tim's hand and said, "Wow, that looks tasty! Can I have a taste?" Tim said, "Yes, you can have a taste." Lily tasted the lollipop and said, "Yum! Thank you, Tim!"
They played together all day, holding the lollipop and sharing it with each other. Tim and Lily became good friends. They went home happy and full from the tasty lollipop.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to play outside. He liked to discover new things. While playing, he found a knife on the ground. Tim knew it was not a toy, so he felt sorry and a little scared.
He ran to his mom and showed her the knife. His mom was worried and asked him where he found it. Tim took her to the spot. They saw a big cake there, too. They were both surprised.
Tim's mom understood it was for a birthday party in the park. She took the knife and the cake to the party. Tim felt happy he could help. The birthday kid was thankful, and they all had a fun time at the party.

One day, a big orange cat named Max went to teach his friends how to draw a line. Max had a lot of friends: a dog, a bird, and a fish. They all sat down and Max started to show them how to draw a line with a stick.
"Look," Max said, "you just take the stick and make a line on the ground like this!" Max drew a straight line on the ground. The dog tried to draw a line, but it was not straight. The bird tried to draw a line, but it was very short. The fish could not try because it was in the water.
Suddenly, a little girl named Lily came to play with Max and his friends. She saw the lines on the ground and said, "Wow, who drew these lines?" Max told her that he was teaching his friends how to draw a line. Lily had an idea. She took out a big orange crayon and said, "Let's all draw a line together!"
Max, the dog, the bird, and Lily held the crayon together and made a big, straight line on the ground. The fish jumped out of the water and splashed a line on the ground too! They all laughed and clapped. From that day on, they always drew lines together and had a lot of fun.

Once upon a time there was a small black box. Inside the box were many special things.
One day two friends, Jack and Jill, were playing together. Jack wanted to open the box and examine the things inside, but Jill said that they should leave it alone.
Jack was curious and he wanted to take a peek at what was inside, so he opened the box.
But when he opened it, he saw nothing, only a few old pieces of paper.
Jack and Jill were so sad that they had been tempted to open the box. They had learned an important lesson - not to open things that don't belong to them. You never know what will happen when you open something that isn't yours.

Once upon a time, there was a girl and a boy. They loved each other very much. One day, the boy told the girl, "I want to marry you." The girl was very happy. She said yes. They planned a brilliant marriage.
On the day of the marriage, the sun was bright and the sky was blue. All their friends and family came. They all wore pretty clothes. The girl and the boy were very happy. They danced and ate yummy food.
After the marriage, the girl and the boy lived in a big house. They were very happy together. They told each other stories every night. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot was a warm and fuzzy dog. He lived in a small house with his friend, Tom. Tom and Spot liked to play outside in the sun. One day, it was very hot outside. Spot did not want to play in the sun. He wanted to find a cool place to rest.
Spot had an idea. He thought, "Maybe I can find a cool spot under the big tree." So, Spot went to the big tree and lay down in the shade. It was a little cooler under the tree, but not cool enough. Spot thought again, "Where else can I go to stay cool?"
Then, Spot saw a pond. He thought, "I can go into the water to cool off." So, Spot ran to the pond and jumped in. The water was cool and nice. Spot was very happy. He played in the water all day long. When Tom saw Spot in the pond, he joined him too. They both had a great day staying cool in the pond. And from that day on, whenever it was hot outside, Spot and Tom knew where to go to stay cool and have fun together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue was very enthusiastic. She loved to play and have fun. One day, Sue went to the park with her friend, Tim.
At the park, Sue and Tim saw a big box. They did not know what was inside the box. Tim said, "Let's open the box and see!" Sue was a little scared, but she wanted to see the surprise inside.
Sue and Tim opened the box together. Inside the box, they found a big, colorful ball. They were so happy! They played with the ball all day and had lots of fun. Sue was not scared anymore, and they both loved the surprise.

One day, a little deer went to the woods to play. The deer saw a big rock and wanted to move it. He pushed and pushed, but the rock did not move. The deer felt sad and sat down.
A kind bird saw the deer and asked, "Why are you sad, little deer?" The deer said, "I want to move the big rock, but I can't. It's too heavy." The kind bird thought for a moment and said, "I have a good idea. Let's ask our friends to help us move the rock."
The deer and the bird asked their friends, the rabbit, the squirrel, and the frog, to help them move the rock. They all pushed together, and the rock moved! The deer was very happy and said, "Thank you, friends! We did it because we worked together."
The friends played in the woods all day, and the deer learned that with good friends, anything is possible. They all had a fun day and went home feeling happy and tired.

One day, a playful dog named Max went for a walk with his friend, a little girl named Lily. They walked to the big city and saw a subway. Max and Lily had never seen a subway before. They looked at each other and said, "Let's go in!"
Inside the subway, they saw many people and other dogs. Max and Lily were very happy. They played with the other dogs and talked to the people. Then, they heard a loud noise. "What's that?" asked Max. "I don't know," said Lily, feeling scared.
Suddenly, a big train came out of a tunnel. Max and Lily were surprised! They didn't know that trains lived in the subway. The train stopped, and the doors opened. Max and Lily went inside and saw more people and dogs. They all had a fun ride on the train and made many new friends.

Once there was a little girl called Anna. She was 3 years old and loved to mix things at home. 
One day, Anna's mum said to her, "Anna, come with me to school - we are going to an exam today!" Anna was excited and followed her mum.
At school, they went to a big room with lots of other children. Anna's mum said, "Anna, I will have to do the exam first, so you sit here and play nicely." Anna wanted to do the exam too, so she waited patiently.
After a while her mum had finished the exam and it was Anna's turn - but the questions were too hard for her. So instead, Anna and the other children decided to mix some paint, create funny cards and tell stories instead. Everyone had lots of fun and Anna couldn't believe how fast the time went by! 
When it was time to go home, they said goodbye and Anna was already looking forward to the next time they went to school together.

One day, a famous dog named Max went to the park. Max liked to push a big red ball with his nose. He would push the ball fast and far. Max's friend, a small cat named Lily, liked to watch him play.
"Max, you are so good at pushing the ball!" said Lily. Max was happy and pushed the ball even harder. Suddenly, a spark came out of the ball. Max and Lily were very surprised.
The spark turned into a magic fairy. The fairy said, "Thank you for finding my magic ball! As a thank you, I will give you one wish each." Max and Lily thought hard. Max wished for a big bone, and Lily wished for a soft bed. The fairy waved her wand, and their wishes came true. Max and Lily thanked the fairy and played with their new gifts in the park.

One day, a nice cat named Tom went for a walk. Tom saw a big tree and wanted to climb it. He jumped on the tree and went up, up, up. While he was up there, he saw a bird. The bird said "Hi" to Tom.
Tom felt a sneeze coming. He tried to stop it, but he could not. "Achoo!" Tom sneezed so loud. The bird got scared and flew away. Tom felt sad. He did not want the bird to go away.
Tom went down the tree and saw a wreck. It was a broken toy car. He took the toy car and went home. He showed it to his mom. Mom said, "We can fix it." Tom felt happy. He played with his new toy car all day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She loved to play with her toys and eat yummy food. One day, her mommy made a spicy potato for lunch. Amy was so excited to try it.
Amy sat at the table and tried to use her fork to eat the spicy potato. It was very hard to do. So, she decided to use her hands. She pushed the potato with her fingers and it broke into small pieces. Now, it was easier to eat.
Amy ate the spicy potato and it was so yummy. She smiled and said "Thank you, mommy!" Her mommy was happy that Amy liked the spicy potato. They both had a great lunch together.

Once upon a time, there was a big, smelly monster. The monster liked to teach little kids about space. One day, a little girl named Lucy came to the monster's house.
"Hello, Mr. Monster! Can you teach me about space?" Lucy asked. The monster smiled and said, "Yes, I can teach you about space. Space is big and full of stars."
As they were learning, a small, green alien came out of nowhere. The alien said, "I am from space! I can teach you more." Lucy, the monster, and the alien all became friends. They learned and played together, and they all had a lot of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a smart dog named Max. Max loved to play and find things. One day, Max found a treasure box in the park. It was big and shiny. He was very happy.
Max wanted to put the treasure in a safe place. He thought and thought. Then, Max had an idea. He would dig a hole and put the treasure in it. So, Max dug a big hole under a tree.
Max put the treasure in the hole and covered it with dirt. He was proud of his work. Max knew that the treasure was safe now. He wagged his tail and went back home. Max was a smart and happy dog.

Once upon a time, there was a big horse named Tom. Tom was a deaf horse, so he could not hear anything. He lived on a farm with many other animals.
One day, Tom's best friend, a little girl named Sue, came to the farm. Sue loved Tom very much and always brought him something to eat. Today, she brought him a big bag of apples. Tom was very happy to see Sue and the apples.
Sue gave Tom the apples, but she gave him too many. Tom ate all the apples and his tummy hurt. Sue had spoiled Tom with too many apples. From that day on, Sue learned not to spoil Tom, and they were still the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little monkey named Momo. Momo was very popular in the jungle. All the animals loved to play with him. Momo's favorite thing to eat was a yellow banana. He loved bananas so much that he would eat them all day long.
One day, Momo saw a big, cold lake. He wanted to swim in the lake, but he was scared. Momo thought, "I am going to shiver if I go in the cold water. But if I eat a banana first, maybe I will be brave enough to swim." So Momo took a banana from a tree and ate it.
After eating the banana, Momo felt strong and brave. He jumped into the lake and started to swim. At first, Momo shivered in the cold water, but soon he got used to it. All the animals watched Momo swim and clapped for him. Momo was so happy he had eaten the banana. It helped him be brave and swim in the cold lake. And from that day on, Momo became even more popular in the jungle.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a rough switch on the wall. He did not know what it did. He wanted to touch it but his mom said no. Tim was sad. He wanted to make his mom smile.
The next day, Tim saw his mom was cold. He thought about the switch. He thought maybe the switch could help. He wanted to try, but he remembered his mom said no. Tim was sad again.
On the third day, Tim's mom was still cold. Tim thought hard. He went to his mom and said, "Please let me try the switch." His mom thought about it and said yes. Tim pushed the rough switch and the room got warm. His mom smiled big. Tim was happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little dove. It was a regular dove, with soft gray feathers. It lived in a big tree with its family. The dove liked to fly high in the sky and play with its friends.
One day, the dove saw a big, colorful bird in the sky. The dove wanted to become friends with the big bird. The dove flew up to the big bird and said, "Hi! I am a regular dove. Do you want to be my friend?"
The big bird smiled and said, "Hello, little dove! I am a parrot. I would love to be your friend!" They played together in the sky, and the dove was very happy.
From that day on, the dove and the parrot were best friends. They played together every day, and the dove learned many new things from the parrot. The little dove was happy it had become friends with the big, colorful bird. And they lived happily ever after.

Penny had a cool pet reindeer. She cared for it and loved playing with it. Every day they ran around the field and played tag. They would also go to the park, and the reindeer ate lots of delicious plants. 
One day, Penny took her reindeer to visit Santa. He was so surprised to see it and offered them a ride on his sleigh. Penny and the reindeer smiled and flew around the sky on Christmas Eve. They saw all the stars, the snow and the Christmas trees. 
At the end of the night, Penny cuddled her reindeer and hugged it tightly. She thanked it for being cool and caring for their special times together. She said goodbye and went home with a smile on her face.

Once upon a time, there was a little cactus. It lived in a big desert. The cactus was very enthusiastic. It loved to dance and sing when the wind blew.
One day, the cactus felt sad. It needed a friend to play with. The cactus looked around and saw a bird. The bird was colorful and pretty. The cactus said, "Hi, bird! Do you want to be my friend?"
The bird was happy to be friends with the cactus. They played together every day. The cactus and bird were the best of friends. They danced and sang with joy. The cactus was not sad anymore.

One day, a little girl named Lucy found a tiny fairy in her garden. The fairy had an impressive, shiny dress. Lucy wanted to be friends with the fairy. She put the fairy on her hand and they played together.
But then, Lucy's cat saw the fairy. The cat wanted to catch the fairy. Lucy knew the cat might hurt her new friend. So, she put the fairy in a safe place, high up on a shelf. The cat tried to jump, but it could not reach the fairy.
Lucy told the cat to stop and go away. The cat listened and walked away. The fairy was safe now. Lucy put the fairy back in the garden. They played together every day and became the best of friends.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a girl named Lily. She loved to write and draw with her pastel colors. One day, she went to the park to play and brought her pastel colors with her.
At the park, Lily saw a boy named Tim. Tim was sad and sorry because he lost his toy. Lily wanted to help him feel better. She took out her pastel colors and started to write and draw a beautiful picture.
Lily showed the picture to Tim. It was a bright and happy picture with a sun, flowers, and a big smile. Tim looked at it and started to smile too. He said, "Thank you, Lily. I am not sorry anymore." They became good friends and played together in the park every day.

Once upon a time, there was a calm cat named Tom. Tom liked to play with a string. He would pull it, bite it, and run with it. Tom was very happy with his string.
One day, Tom found a big box. The box had a button on it. Tom was curious and pressed the button. The box started to make a noise. Then, the box began to print something. Tom was very surprised.
Out of the box came many strings, all different colors. Tom was so excited. He played with the new strings all day. But then, the strings started to move on their own! They were not strings, they were little snakes! Tom was scared at first, but the snakes were nice. They all played together and became friends.

It was a sunny morning and Tom decided to take a stroll. As he walked, the wind blew against his face, making him shiver. The cold air bit against his skin, so he decided to pick up his pace.
Suddenly, he heard a noise coming from the old trees. He looked up and there was a small bird, fluttering around each branch. Tom was surprised by the bird's lively colours and he watched in awe.
He wanted to get a closer look at the bird so he slowly and quietly approached. As he crept closer, the bird seemed to notice him and flew away.
Tom sighed and looked around. There was a page of paper on the ground that he hadn't noticed before. He stepped towards the paper and saw it was a map. His eyes lit up and he smiled; he knew he had made the right decision to come here.
Tom pocketed the map and continued walking. He shivered as the wind started to pick up again, but he was glad that he had at least seen a lively bird in the woods.

Lily and Max are twins. They like to visit their grandma every week. Grandma lives in a big house with a garden. She has many flowers and plants.
One day, Lily and Max go to the garden with grandma. They see a big pumpkin. Grandma says, "This is a pumpkin. It is orange and round. You can make soup or pie with it."
Lily and Max touch the pumpkin. They feel its texture. Lily says, "The pumpkin is smooth and hard. It is tough to cut." Max says, "The pumpkin is heavy and cold. It is fun to roll."
Grandma smiles and says, "Do you want to help me make pumpkin pie? We can use the pumpkin and some sugar and eggs and flour."
Lily and Max nod and say, "Yes, please! We love pumpkin pie!" They follow grandma to the kitchen. They wash their hands and put on aprons. They help grandma cut the pumpkin and mix the ingredients. They pour the filling into a crust and bake it in the oven.
Soon, the pumpkin pie is ready. It smells good and looks yummy. Lily and Max are happy. They thank grandma and say, "You are the best, grandma! We love to visit you and your garden!" Grandma hugs them and says, "I love you, too, my sweeties! You are my sunshine!" They eat the pumpkin pie together and enjoy their visit.

One day, a little girl named Sue got a bright red balloon. She loved her balloon very much. She took it everywhere she went. She even gave it a kiss before bedtime.
One sunny day, Sue went to the park with her balloon. She played with it and showed it to her friends. They all liked the bright red balloon too. They all gave it a little kiss. Suddenly, a big wind came and took the balloon up, up, up into the sky.
Sue was very sad. She thought she lost her balloon forever. But then, something unexpected happened. A friendly bird saw the bright red balloon in the sky. The bird grabbed the balloon and brought it back down to Sue. She was so happy! She kissed the bird and her balloon. And from that day on, Sue, the balloon, and the bird were the best of friends.

Once upon a time, in a big blue sea, there was a restless pirate named Tom. Tom had a big ship and a funny parrot. Tom and his parrot liked to find treasure. They would sail from island to island, looking for shiny gold and pretty jewels.
One sunny day, Tom found a treasure chest on a small island. He was very excited! But when he opened the chest, there was no shiny gold or pretty jewels. Inside the chest, there was a little kitten. The kitten was sad and scared. Tom's parrot said, "We should help the kitten. It needs love and care."
Tom took the kitten back to his ship. He gave the kitten food and a soft bed. The kitten felt better and started to play. Tom felt happy when he saw the kitten play. He gave the kitten a big kiss on the head. The kitten purred and snuggled with Tom.
From that day on, Tom, his parrot, and the kitten sailed the big blue sea together. They still looked for treasure, but they also helped other animals they found along the way. Tom learned that being kind and helping others is the most valuable treasure of all.

Once upon a time, there was a graceful cat named Lily. Lily loved to dance and play with her friends. One day, Lily wanted to watch a movie with her friends. She did not have a movie, so she decided to borrow one from her friend, Tom the dog.
Lily went to Tom's house and asked, "Can I borrow a movie to watch with my friends?" Tom was happy to help and said, "Yes, you can borrow my movie, but please bring it back when you are done." Lily promised to return the movie after watching it.
Lily and her friends watched the movie and had a lot of fun. After the movie, Lily remembered her promise to Tom. She took the movie back to Tom's house and said, "Thank you for letting me borrow your movie. We had a great time!" Tom was happy that Lily kept her promise. From that day on, Lily and Tom became the best of friends.
The moral of the story is to always keep your promises and return things you borrow from others. This will help you make good friends and be a kind person.

One day, a boy named Tim found a big knot in his long hair. He tried to untie it, but it was too hard. He felt sad and ashamed. He did not want his friends to see the knot. So, he went to his mom and said, "Mom, can you help me with this knot? I am sad."
His mom tried to untie the knot, but it was very hard. She said, "Tim, I cannot untie it. We must cut your hair." Tim did not want to cut his hair, but he said yes. He was scared and began to weep.
As his mom started to cut his hair, a little bird flew in through the window. The bird saw the knot and said, "Wait! I can help you!" The bird used its beak to untie the knot. Tim was so happy! He thanked the bird, and his mom did not have to cut his hair. They all became good friends.

Lily and Ben were playing in the park. They liked to go on the swings, the slide and the seesaw. But their favorite thing was the merry-go-round. It was a big circle with colorful animals to sit on. Lily liked the horse and Ben liked the lion.
They ran to the merry-go-round and climbed on their animals. Ben said, "Let's go fast!" He pushed the handle and made the merry-go-round spin. Lily said, "Wee! This is fun!" She held on to the horse and felt the wind in her hair.
But then, Ben pushed the handle too hard. The merry-go-round went faster and faster. Lily said, "Stop! Stop! This is too fast!" She was scared. She felt dizzy and sick. Ben said, "I can't stop! It's stuck!" He tried to pull the handle, but it wouldn't move. The merry-go-round was out of control. It was dangerous.
Lily and Ben screamed for help. They saw their mom and dad running to them. They also saw a man in a uniform. He was the park keeper. He had a big key. He ran to the merry-go-round and put the key in a hole. He turned the key and made the merry-go-round stop. Lily and Ben felt the animals slow down. They were relieved.
The park keeper helped them get off the merry-go-round. He said, "I'm sorry, kids. The handle was broken. It was a twist. I fixed it now. Are you okay?" Lily and Ben nodded. They were a little shaky, but they were okay. Their mom and dad hugged them and said, "We're so glad you're safe. That was a scary surprise." Lily and Ben said, "We love you, mom and dad. Can we go home now?" They didn't want to play on the merry-go-round anymore. They wanted to go home and have some cookies and milk.

Lily and Sam went to the beach with Mom and Dad. They liked to play in the sand and splash in the water. They saw many things at the beach: shells, crabs, birds, and boats.
One day, they saw something big and gray in the water. It had a long nose and big teeth. It was a shark! Lily and Sam were very scared. They ran to Mom and Dad and told them what they saw.
Mom and Dad looked at the water and saw the shark too. They said, "Don't worry, Lily and Sam. The shark is far away and it can't come to the shore. We are safe here. The shark is not here to scare us. It is just looking for food in the sea."
Lily and Sam felt better. They hugged Mom and Dad and said, "Thank you for keeping us safe. We love you." Mom and Dad said, "We love you too. You are very brave. Let's have some fun at the beach." They gave Lily and Sam some snacks and toys and went back to the sand. They had a happy day at the beach.

One day, a busy ant named Tim was walking in the park. He was looking for food to supply to his family. Tim saw a big apple on the ground. He was very happy and thought it would be a great reward for his family.
Tim tried to push the apple, but it was too big. A bee named Ben saw Tim and asked, "What are you doing, Tim?" Tim said, "I want to take this apple to my family, but it's too big for me." Ben wanted to help, so they both tried to push the apple together. 
They were still too small to move the apple. Then, a strong beetle named Bob came by. Ben asked, "Can you help us, Bob?" Bob agreed to help and they all pushed the apple together. They were able to move the apple back to Tim's home. Tim's family was so happy and they shared the apple with Ben and Bob. They all enjoyed the tasty reward.

One day, a little girl named Lucy went to the beach with her mom and dad. They all played in the sand and the water. Lucy loved to build sand castles and look for shells. While she was playing, she saw a big octopus in the water. Lucy was very excited and wanted to show her mom and dad.
"Mom, Dad, look! I found an octopus!" Lucy yelled. Her mom and dad came over to see. When they looked at the octopus, they saw that it was fake. They started to laugh.
"Oh, Lucy, that's a fake octopus! Someone must have left it here on the beach," her dad said. Lucy felt a little sad that it was not a real octopus. But then, something unexpected happened. The fake octopus started to move!
"Wow! It's a toy octopus!" Lucy's mom said. The toy octopus started to dance and play in the sand. Lucy, her mom, and her dad all laughed and played with the toy octopus. They had a lot of fun at the beach that day with their new friend.

One sunny day, a little bunny named Bob was hopping in the woods. He loved to hop and play with his friends. Today, he was playing with his best friend, a bird named Sue. They were having so much fun in the ordinary woods they always played in.
"Let's hop to the big tree!" said Sue. "Okay!" said Bob, and they hopped and flew together. When they got to the tree, they saw a shiny knob on it. They had never seen a knob on a tree before. "What's that?" asked Bob.
Sue flew close to the knob and said, "Let's turn it!" When they turned the knob, the tree opened like a door. Inside, they found a room full of toys and treats! They played and ate until they were tired. Then, they closed the tree door and went home.
Bob and Sue learned that even in ordinary places, you can find something special if you look for it. They also learned that sharing and playing together is more fun than playing alone.

Lily and Tom were twins. They liked to play with their toys in the garden. One day, they saw a big van on the street. It was red and shiny. They wanted to see what was inside.
"Let's go, Tom!" Lily said. She ran to the van.
"Wait, Lily!" Tom said. He followed her. He had a ball in his hand.
They reached the van. The door was open. They peeked inside. There were many boxes and bags. They looked fun.
"Wow, look at this!" Lily said. She grabbed a box. It had a picture of a doll on it. She opened the box. She saw a pretty doll with a pink dress. She smiled.
"Can I have it?" she asked.
"No, Lily, that's not ours!" Tom said. He was scared. He saw a man coming to the van. He had a cap and a shirt with a name on it. He looked angry.
"Hey, you kids, get away from my van!" the man shouted. He ran to the van.
Lily and Tom were scared. They dropped the box and the ball. They ran away from the van. They went back to the garden.
"Sorry, mister!" they said.
The man picked up the box and the ball. He put them back in the van. He closed the door. He drove away.
Lily and Tom were sad. They wanted the doll and the ball. They sat on the grass.
"Maybe we can ask mom to buy them for us," Lily said.
"Maybe," Tom said. "But we should not touch things that are not ours. That's bad."
Lily nodded. She hugged Tom.
"You're right, Tom. We should be good. And we should not be lazy. We have many toys in the garden. Let's play with them."
Tom smiled. He hugged Lily.
"OK, Lily. Let's play. And let's have fun."
They got up. They played with their toys. They forgot about the van. They were happy.

One day, a little girl named Lily went for a walk. She saw a big, pink mill. She could not believe her eyes. She went closer to look at the mill. She imagined what it would be like to go inside.
Lily met a boy named Tom. Tom said, "I want to go inside the mill too, but I am scared." Lily said, "Don't be scared. We can go together!" Tom agreed and they both went inside the pink mill.
Inside the mill, they found a big cat. The cat was not happy to see them. It said, "This is my mill! You can't be here!" Lily and Tom were scared, but they did not want to leave. They said, "We just want to look. We won't touch anything." The cat thought for a moment, and then it said, "Okay, but be careful." Lily and Tom looked around the mill and had a great time. They thanked the cat and went home, happy to have a new friend.

One day, a little boy named Tim was playing outside. He saw a big wind come, and it made a tornado. Tim was scared, but he did not know what it was. He was ignorant about the tornado.
Tim ran to his mom and asked her a question. "Mom, what is that big wind?" His mom looked outside and saw the tornado. She said, "Tim, that is a tornado. It can be very bad, so we need to go inside and be safe."
They went inside their house and closed the door. Tim and his mom sat together and talked about the tornado. Tim learned that it was important to know about things like tornadoes. He was happy that he asked his mom the question.

Once upon a time, there was a wealthy man. He had a big house and many toys. He liked to tell stories to children. One day, he met a little boy. The little boy was sad.
The wealthy man asked, "Why are you sad?" The little boy sighed and said, "I don't have any toys to play with." The man felt bad for the little boy.
The wealthy man told the little boy a story to make him happy. The story was about a big, fun toy land. The little boy liked the story. The man gave the boy some toys. They played together and became good friends. The little boy was happy, and they lived happily ever after.

Tim was a humble boy who liked to help his mom. He did not have many toys or clothes, but he was happy with what he had. He loved his mom very much and wanted to make her smile.
One day, he saw a sweater in a store window. It was red and soft and had a big heart on it. Tim thought his mom would look very pretty in it. He wished he could buy it for her, but he knew he had no money. He felt sad and walked away.
The next day, he saw a sign on the door of the store. It said they needed someone to provide help with cleaning and sorting. Tim ran inside and asked the lady if he could work for her. The lady smiled and said yes. She said she would pay him with a sweater of his choice. Tim was very happy and thanked her.
He worked hard for many days, sweeping the floor, dusting the shelves, and folding the clothes. He always looked at the red sweater with the big heart and hoped it would not be sold. He wanted to surprise his mom with it on her birthday.
Finally, the day came when he had done enough work to earn the sweater. The lady gave it to him and said he had done a great job. She also gave him a hug and a card. Tim was very grateful and ran home with the sweater and the card.
He hid the sweater under his bed and waited for his mom to come home. When she did, he gave her a big hug and said he had a present for her. He showed her the sweater and the card. The card said: "To the best mom in the world, from your humble son Tim. I love you very much."
His mom was very surprised and touched. She put on the sweater and said it was the most beautiful thing she had ever seen. She hugged Tim and said he was the most wonderful son she had ever had. She said she loved him very much too.
They both smiled and cried and hugged some more. They felt very happy and warm in their hearts. Tim was glad he had worked hard to provide his mom with a special gift. He knew she deserved it. He also knew he had the best mom in the world.

Once upon a time, a little cat named Kitty loved to travel. One day, Kitty went on a big trip to see a huge landscape. She was very excited.
On her trip, Kitty met a big dog named Doggy. Doggy wanted to play, but Kitty was scared. Doggy was so huge! Kitty didn't know what to do. Then, something unexpected happened. Doggy showed Kitty a pretty flower. Kitty was happy and not scared anymore. They played together and became friends.
The moral of the story is: don't be scared of someone just because they are different or big. They might be nice and want to be your friend.

Once upon a time, in a friendly little town, there lived a boy named Tim. Tim loved to jump and play. One day, while playing, Tim fell down and hurt his knee. He felt sad and began to cry.
A kind dog named Spot saw Tim and walked over to him. Spot asked, "Why are you crying, Tim?" Tim said, "I hurt my knee when I fell down. It hurts a lot." Spot wanted to help Tim feel better, so he stayed with him.
Tim tried to stand up, but he struggled. Spot put his head under Tim's hand to help him up. With Spot's help, Tim stood up and felt a little better. They both smiled and played together, being the best of friends.

Once upon a time, in a big garden, there was a naughty bee named Buzz. Buzz liked to play tricks on his friends. One day, he saw a little house with a door. Buzz had an idea to play a trick on his friend, Ant.
Buzz told Ant to go inside the little house. When Ant went in, Buzz used a stick to lock the door. Ant was scared and wanted to get out. Buzz laughed and flew away, leaving Ant inside the locked house.
A kind bird saw what happened and wanted to help Ant. The bird found the key to the house and unlocked the door. Ant was free and thanked the bird. Buzz saw this and felt bad for being naughty. He said sorry to Ant and promised to be a good friend from now on. The moral of the story is to always be kind and help your friends, not play tricks on them.

Once upon a time, there was a thoughtful girl named Lily. She loved to help her mom and dad in the house. One day, her mom asked her to prepare food for a picnic. Lily was very happy and said, "Yes, Mom! I will help."
Lily and her mom made sandwiches, cut fruits, and packed juice. They put everything in a big basket. Lily's dad said, "We need to bring matches to light the fire for the barbecue." Lily found a box of matches and put it in the basket too.
At the park, Lily and her family had a great time. They ate the yummy food, played games, and laughed a lot. When it was time to light the fire, Lily's dad said, "Lily, you were so thoughtful to remember the matches!" Lily smiled and said, "I love helping, and I love our family picnics!"

Once upon a time, there was a sailor. He liked to walk by the sea every day. The sailor had a small, fragile boat that he loved very much.
One day, the sailor went for a walk and saw a big fish in the water. He wanted to catch the fish, so he got into his fragile boat and sailed away. The fish was fast, but the sailor was faster.
At last, the sailor caught the fish and went back to the shore. He was very happy. The sailor walked home with his big fish, and everyone in the town cheered for him. The sailor and his fragile boat became famous, and they all lived happily ever after.

One day, a nosy cat saw a big object in the yard. The object was round and bouncy. The cat went to the object and said, "What are you?"
The object said, "I am a ball. I like to bounce and play. Do you want to play with me?"
The cat said, "No, I want to nap. I am very tired." So the cat went to nap under a tree.
The ball was sad and wanted to play. It saw a dog and asked, "Do you want to play with me?" The dog said, "Yes, I love to play!" They played and played.
The cat woke up and saw the dog and ball playing. The cat was sad because it wanted to play too. But the dog and ball did not want to play with the cat anymore. The cat learned that it should have played with the ball when it had the chance.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Mia. She had a big box of stamps. Mia loved to prepare fun pictures with her stamps. She was always patient when making her art.
One day, Mia's friend, Max, came over to play. "Can I try your stamps?" Max asked. Mia said, "Yes, but be patient. It takes time to make a good picture." Max agreed and they started to play with the stamps.
As they were playing, a stamp jumped out of the box! Mia and Max were surprised. The stamp talked! It said, "I am a magic stamp! I can make your pictures come to life!" Mia and Max were happy and they used the magic stamp to make their art come alive. They had the best day ever.

Once upon a time, in a big green forest, there lived a healthy bird named Bobby. Bobby loved to fly high and play with his friends. One sunny day, Bobby saw a big cobweb on a tree. He was very curious about it.
Bobby went to his friend, Sally the squirrel, and said, "Sally, I found a big cobweb on a tree. Do you want to play with it?" Sally said, "Yes, Bobby! Let's go see the cobweb and have fun!"
Bobby and Sally went to the tree with the cobweb. They decided to play a game. The game was to balance on a small branch near the cobweb. Bobby went first. He was very good at balancing. Then it was Sally's turn. She was a little scared, but she tried her best and balanced too.
They laughed and played near the cobweb all day long. When the sun started to set, Bobby and Sally said goodbye to the cobweb and went back to their homes. They had a great day and couldn't wait to play together again.

Once upon a time, there was a little train. It had a long track to go on. The train loved to go fast on the track. One day, the track was broken. The train could not go on the track anymore.
The train was sad. It wanted to go on the track again. The train had a friend, a big truck. The truck was incredible at fixing things. The truck wanted to help the train.
The truck worked hard to restore the track. It fixed the broken parts. The train was happy again. Now, the train could go fast on the track. The train and the truck were the best of friends. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little monkey named Momo. Momo was very restless. He always jumped and played in the trees. One day, Momo saw a big, yellow banana on the ground. He stared at it for a long time.
Momo's friend, Lulu the bird, saw him staring at the banana. Lulu asked, "Momo, why are you staring at the banana?" Momo said, "I want to eat it, but I don't know if I should take it. It's not mine." Lulu said, "You're right, Momo. We should find who it belongs to."
Momo and Lulu went to ask their friends in the forest. Finally, they found the owner of the banana. It was Toto the turtle. Toto was very happy to get his banana back. He said, "Thank you, Momo and Lulu, for being so kind and honest." Momo and Lulu felt good for doing the right thing. The moral of the story is to always be honest and kind to others.

Once upon a time, there was a little owl who loved staying up late every night. The little owl thought it was fun to play constantly, but never took the time to slow down. One day, the little owl's mom became concerned and said, "It is important to have an organized life. If you don't take a nap every day, you'll be too tired to play!"
The little owl thought this was unfair and didn't want to take any naps. But, eventually, he realized that his mom was right. He started taking organized breaks for a nap, and he found that he had more energy for playtime afterwards.
The moral of the story is that it's important to follow rules and listen to your parents. Even if it doesn't seem fun, it is important to permit yourself some time to rest and relax. You'll have more energy if you do!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He had a toy car that he loved to play with. But one day, the car became broken. Tim was very sad.
Tim went to his mom and said, "Mom, my car is broken. Can we fix it?" His mom looked at the car and said, "I think we can use some glue to fix it. Let's go to the store and find some glue."
