Tim's mom called out, "Tim, come back home! The fire is too close!" But Tim and the monkey did not hear her. They were still laughing and playing.
The fire got too close to Tim and the monkey. Tim's mom was very sad. She should have told Tim not to go near the fire.

Once upon a time, there was a gray cat named Fluffy. Fluffy liked to play outside in the sun. One day, Fluffy was very thirsty and needed a drink.
Fluffy saw a big structure made of blocks. The structure had a bowl of water inside. Fluffy was happy to find a drink. Fluffy went inside the structure to drink the water.
After Fluffy had a drink, the gray cat felt much better. Fluffy played around the structure and made new friends. They all played together and had fun. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a wise old owl who lived in the deep dark woods. The owl lived near a lake and often flew around searching for food. One day, the owl saw a small box floating on the lake. He bravely flew down and picked up the box. Inside the box, the owl found a handful of salt. 
The owl was sure he could use the salt, so he tucked it away in a safe spot. Over the next few days, the wise owl flew around the lake and watched what happened. He soon noticed the lake began to yield sweet and fresh water. 
The owl was so pleased that he'd found the salt! He started to use it in his food and found it made it much tastier. From that day on, he was always thankful for the salt and enjoyed the fresh and sweet water from the lake.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a purple envelope on the ground. He picked it up and looked at it. It was very pretty. Tim wanted to find who it belonged to.
He ran to his mom and showed her the envelope. "Mom, look what I found! Whose is it?" Tim asked. His mom looked at the purple envelope and said, "I don't know, Tim. Let's go and ask our neighbors."
So, Tim and his mom went outside and ran to their neighbor's house. They knocked on the door. Their neighbor, Mrs. Brown, opened the door. Tim showed her the purple envelope and asked, "Is this yours, Mrs. Brown?"
Mrs. Brown smiled and said, "Yes, Tim! Thank you for finding it." She took the purple envelope and gave Tim a big hug. Tim felt happy that he could help Mrs. Brown. He ran back home with his mom, feeling proud of what he had done.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. Before they left, Tim's mom said, "We must be careful today!" Tim nodded and got into the car. His mom helped him with his buckle to prevent him from falling out of his seat.
At the park, Tim saw a big slide. He wanted to go down it, but he remembered his mom's words. He asked his mom, "Can I go down the slide?"
His mom smiled and said, "Yes, but be careful and hold on tight!" Tim climbed up and slid down, holding on tight. He was so happy and proud of himself for being careful.
After playing on the slide, Tim and his mom went back to the car. Tim's mom helped him with his buckle again. They went home, and Tim told his dad all about his fun day at the park and how he was careful, just like his mom told him to be.

Lily loved to play with her toy elephant. She named him Elly and gave him a pink hat. She took him everywhere, even to bed. One day, she wanted to show Elly to her friend Sam, who lived next door. She put Elly in her backpack and ran to Sam's house.
But when she got there, she saw that Sam had a new toy car. It was shiny and red and made loud noises. Lily wanted to try it, so she asked Sam if she could. Sam said yes, but only if he could play with Elly. Lily agreed and gave him her backpack.
She got on the car and pressed the button. It started to speed along the sidewalk. Lily felt the wind in her hair and laughed. She liked the car a lot. She forgot about Elly and Sam. She drove the car around the block, then around again.
But when she came back to Sam's house, she saw that Sam was crying. He was holding Elly in his arms. His hat was torn and his trunk was bent. Lily felt guilty. She got off the car and ran to Sam. She asked him what happened.
Sam said that a big dog came and grabbed Elly from his backpack. He tried to get him back, but the dog was too strong. He bit Elly and ran away. Sam chased him, but he was too fast. He found Elly on the grass, but he was hurt.
Lily hugged Sam and said she was sorry. She said she should have stayed with him and Elly. She said she was selfish and careless. She said she would fix Elly and buy him a new hat. She said she loved him and he was her best friend.
Sam hugged Lily back and said he forgave her. He said he was glad she came back. He said he liked her and she was his best friend. He said he would share his car with her and they could play together.
They took Elly inside and cleaned him up. They put a bandage on his trunk and a sticker on his hat. They said he was brave and strong. They said they would take good care of him. They said he was their favorite toy.

Once upon a time, there was a pretty girl named Lily. She lived in a small house with her mom and dad. Lily loved to play outside and look at the pretty flowers in her garden.
One day, Lily saw a sign that said, "Dare to win a prize!" The sign was in front of a big tent. Lily asked her mom, "Can I go and try to win the prize?" Her mom said, "Yes, but be careful."
Lily went inside the tent and saw many kids playing games. She tried a game where she had to dare to put her hand in a box without looking. Lily was scared, but she dared to do it. When she put her hand in the box, she felt something soft and fluffy.
Lily pulled out a pretty stuffed bunny. Everyone clapped for her. She had won the prize! Lily was so happy and ran to show her mom. Her mom hugged her and said, "I knew you could do it!"
From that day on, Lily always dared to try new things. She learned that being brave could lead to pretty prizes and lots of fun. And Lily and her pretty bunny lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a small, delicate bird named Bella. Bella lived in a tree near a big cooler. The cooler was full of tasty food. Every day, Bella would fly down and eat some food from the cooler.
One day, Bella met a big bird named Bob. Bob wanted to eat the food from the cooler too. Bella said, "Bob, can you fit in the tree? The tree is small and you are big." Bob tried to fit in the tree, but he was too big.
Bella felt sad for Bob. She wanted to help him. So, Bella and Bob worked together to make a new home near the cooler. They used sticks and leaves to build a big nest. Now, Bella and Bob could both eat from the cooler and live happily together.

Sara liked to play with her sock. It was a cheap sock, with holes and stains, but she did not care. She liked to roll it into a ball and throw it around the room. She pretended it was a bird, or a ball, or a star.
One day, she was playing with her sock in the living room, when her mom came in. Her mom looked angry. She said, "Sara, stop throwing that dirty sock around! It is making a mess. And it smells bad. You need to put it in the trash."
Sara did not want to put her sock in the trash. She loved her sock. She said, "No, mom, please. It is my sock. It is my friend. I want to keep it."
Her mom did not listen. She grabbed the sock from Sara's hand and threw it in the trash. She said, "Sara, you need to learn to let go of things that are old and broken. You have many other toys to play with. Now, go to your room and clean up."
Sara felt sad and angry. She ran to her room and cried. She did not want to play with her other toys. She wanted her sock back. She waited until her mom was busy in the kitchen. Then, she sneaked out of her room and went to the trash. She looked for her sock, but she could not find it. She saw a big truck outside. It was the trash truck. It was taking away the trash. And her sock.
Sara ran outside and shouted, "Stop! Stop! That is my sock! Give it back to me!" But the truck did not stop. It drove away, with her sock inside. Sara watched it go, and felt a big hole in her heart. She had lost her sock forever. She wished she had never rolled it around the room. She wished she had hugged it and kept it safe. She learned a hard lesson that day. She learned that some things are not cheap, even if they look like it. They are priceless.

One day, a cat and a dog were playing near a big tree. They saw a club under the tree. The dog picked up the club and started to swing it around. The cat watched and laughed. They were having fun.
The sun was hot, and they both felt very warm. They saw a water hose near the tree. The cat had an idea. The cat turned on the water and started to spray the dog. The dog liked it because it was wet and cool. The dog took a turn and sprayed the cat too. They were both happy and wet.
But then, the dog swung the club while spraying the cat. The club hit the water hose, and the hose broke. The water stopped. The cat and the dog were sad because they could not play with the water anymore. The tree was sad too because it needed water to grow. The moral of the story is to be careful when playing, or you might break something important.

Once upon a time, there was a jolly dog named Max. Max loved to play and have fun. One day, Max went to the mall with his mom. Max was so happy to be at the mall. He felt very welcome there.
While they were at the mall, Max saw a big, mean cat. The cat did not like Max. Max and the cat started to fight. They both wanted the same big toy. Max's mom tried to stop the fight, but it was too late.
In the end, the big, mean cat won the fight. Max was sad and hurt. He did not get the toy he wanted. Max and his mom left the mall with heavy hearts. The once jolly day turned into a bad day.

Once there was a busy bee named Billy. He loved to fly around and make honey. One day, Billy found a shiny ornament hanging on a tree. He was very curious about it.
Billy went to his friend, the wise owl, and asked a question. "What is this shiny thing I found?" Owl looked at the ornament and said, "It is a special thing that humans put on trees. They call it an ornament."
Billy wanted to show the other bees the ornament. But when he took it to the hive, something unexpected happened. The ornament started to shake and make a funny noise. All the bees were scared.
Suddenly, a tiny fairy came out of the ornament. She said, "Thank you for finding my home! I was lost and now I am found." The bees were not scared anymore. They became friends with the fairy and they all lived happily together.

Once upon a time, there was a gentle rabbit named Bob. He loved to visit his friends in the spring. The sun was warm, and the flowers were pretty.
One day, while Bob was on his way to visit his friend, he saw a big, mean dog. The dog wanted to chase Bob. Bob was scared, but he knew that he had to be brave.
Bob thought fast and ran into a bush. The dog could not find him there. The dog got tired and went away. Bob was happy and continued to visit his friend. They played all day, and Bob learned that being brave is important.

One day, a little girl named Lily saw a flower bloom. She was very happy. She put on her red shoe and went to show her friend, Tom.
"Look, Tom!" said Lily. "The flower is big and pretty."
Tom looked at the flower and felt jealous. He wanted a flower too. He went to find a flower, but he could not find one. He was sad.
Then, something unexpected happened. Lily's red shoe started to bloom too! It had pretty flowers on it. Tom was surprised and happy. Now, they both had flowers to share and enjoy.

Once upon a time, in a big park, there was a swing. The swing was very fair and pretty. Kids loved to play on it every day.
One day, a little ball came to the park. The ball liked to bounce all the time. The ball saw the fair swing and wanted to play too. The ball asked the swing, "Can I play with you?" The swing said, "Yes, let's play together!"
So, the ball started to bounce, and the swing started to move. They played together all day long. The kids in the park had so much fun with the bouncing ball and the fair swing. They all became good friends and played together every day.

One day, a big red truck was driving down the road. The truck was very amazing. It had big wheels and went very fast. The truck was carrying tasty ice cream to the park.
At the park, there were many kids playing. They saw the truck and got very excited. One little boy, named Tim, said to his friend, "I hope the ice cream tastes good!" His friend, named Sue, replied, "I'm sure it will be amazing!"
The truck finally stopped, and the ice cream man opened the window. The kids lined up, and Tim was first. He got a big ice cream cone with three scoops. When he took a bite, his eyes grew wide. The ice cream was amazing and tasted so good. Tim shared his ice cream with Sue, and they both agreed it was the best ice cream they ever had. The big red truck had brought them a very special treat.

Once upon a time, a little shrimp lived in the sea. The shrimp had a furry friend, a small fish. They loved to play together every day. They were very happy.
One day, a big fish came to their home. The big fish wanted to eat the shrimp and the furry fish. The shrimp and the furry fish were scared. They did not recognize the big fish. They swam away as fast as they could.
But the big fish was faster. The shrimp and the furry fish could not escape. The big fish ate them both. It was a sad day in the sea. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. She loved to balance on one foot. One sunny day, Mia went to the park to play. The park was in the west, near her home.
At the park, Mia met a new friend, a boy named Max. Max was playing in a deep puddle of water. Mia said, "Hi! I can balance on one foot. Can you do it too?" Max smiled and said, "I can try!"
Max tried to balance on one foot, but he fell into the deep puddle. Mia laughed and helped him up. They played together all day, balancing on one foot and splashing in the puddle. They were very happy and became best friends.

One day, Jackie and Sam went fishing. Sam took Jackie to the pond on their family farm. The water was still and shimmering as Jackie looked out over it.
"Are you ready to dive in?" Sam asked. 
Jackie felt a little anxious, but she said "yes" and then she jumped in. 
They swam and played until a mosquito buzzed by. Jackie and Sam both ducked under the water to get away! When the mosquito was gone, they came back up and laughed. 
"That was fun! Let's do it again!" Jackie said.
Sam smiled and said, "Let's go!" And they both dove back in.

Once upon a time, in a small park, there was a big pink pool. Kids liked to play and splash in the water. One day, a girl named Lily and a boy named Tom went to the park to play.
Lily had a toy water gun. It was her favorite toy. She filled it with water from the pink pool. Tom and Lily ran around and laughed as they played with the water gun. They took turns splashing each other and having fun.
But then, Lily saw a big bee near the pink pool. She got scared and tried to splash it away with her water gun. The bee got angry and stung Lily. She cried and her arm hurt a lot. Tom and Lily went home sad, and they did not play with the water gun at the park again.

Once upon a time there was a boy named Timmy. He wanted something very special. One day, he went to the store and saw an enormous birdcage. He wanted the birdcage very much. He saved up his money and bought it.
When he got home, he put the birdcage in his room. He was so happy to have it. Every day, he looked at it. He loved it very much.
One day, a little bird flew into his room and landed on the birdcage. Timmy was so surprised and excited. The little bird flew around the birdcage and even flew around Timmy's head. The bird looked so happy in the enormous birdcage. Timmy was thrilled and knew this was just what he wanted.

Once upon a time, there was a tiny mouse. The mouse was very persistent. He wanted to escape from his hole, but it was very difficult. He kept trying, but could not get out.
One day, the mouse heard a voice from outside. "Can someone help me?" The mouse was surprised and poked his head out of his hole. He saw a cat outside!
The mouse said, "No! Stay away!" The cat smiled and said, "I just want to help. I won't hurt you." The mouse was scared and was about to run away. The cat said, "Don't worry, I promise I won't hurt you. I just want to help you escape. Can you trust me?"
The mouse was scared and confused. He felt like he didn't have a choice and eventually he surrendered. The cat carefully picked up the mouse and guided him out of his hole. The mouse was so happy to have escaped! He thanked the cat and said goodbye. 
The mouse was persistent and never gave up. Because he was brave and surrendered to the cat, he was able to escape from his hole.

Once upon a time, there was a very generous man. This man was always looking for ways to help those around him. 
One day, the generous man was climbing a mountain and he saw an old man who was struggling to breathe. The old man was in need of oxygen. So the generous man took out his oxygen tank and put it on the old man.
The generous man said, "Don't worry, I'll take care of you. Now you can breathe better."
The old man thanked the generous man, but he said that he still felt like he was suffering.
The generous man thought for a moment, and then he said, "Sometimes when we are in need, it is not only oxygen that we need. We also need someone to show us love and kindness. That is why it is important to always be kind and generous to those around us."
The old man thanked the generous man again and said, "You are right. Kindness and generosity make us all happy."
And that is why it is important to always be generous and kind, so that nobody has to suffer.

Once there was a little girl who was very curious. She wanted to explore her house, so she stopped at the kitchen. She saw a room with things she did not understand, and she had a lot of questions.
One thing in the room was very big, with shiny panels on it. She knew it was a faucet, because her mom pointed to it many times. It was so tall, so she had to stand on her tippie toes to see it!
The little girl wanted the faucet to do something special. So, she put her hands up to it, and asked for it to make something good. Suddenly, a stream of water started shooting out of the faucet!
The little girl clapped with joy. Now she knew that the faucet was really good, and just what she wanted!

One day, a little boy named Tim went outside to play in the snow. He was very happy because he loved to play in the snow. He saw a little girl named Sue sitting on a seat, looking upset. Tim walked up to her and asked, "Why are you upset?"
Sue said, "I want to play in the snow too, but I can't find my snow boots." Tim thought for a moment and said, "I have an idea! We can share my boots. We can take turns playing in the snow." Sue smiled and said, "That's a great idea!"
So, Tim and Sue took turns wearing the boots and playing in the snow. They made a big snowman and had a fun snowball fight. After playing, they sat on the seat together, tired but happy. They were not upset anymore because they had a great time playing in the snow together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She had a book called a journal. Lucy loved to draw in her journal every day.
One day, Lucy saw a big tree. She wanted to draw the tree in her journal. But the wind blew her journal far away. Lucy was sad. She wanted her journal back.
Lucy was brave. She started to look for her journal. She had to struggle to find it. She looked under rocks and climbed over logs. Finally, Lucy found her journal near a bush. She was very happy. She drew the big tree in her journal and showed it to her mom.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim and a girl named Sue. They were best friends and played by the sea every day. One day, they saw an enormous wave coming to the shore. They were so excited and ran to tell everyone.
Tim and Sue found a fish who could talk. The fish said, "I want to marry the wave, but I need your help." Tim and Sue were surprised but wanted to help their new friend. They asked, "What can we do to help you?"
The fish told them to find a special ring in the sand. Tim and Sue looked and looked, and finally, they found the ring. They gave it to the fish, and the fish swam to the enormous wave. But something unexpected happened. The wave turned into a beautiful fish!
The two fish were so happy and grateful to Tim and Sue. They swam away together, and Tim and Sue knew they had helped their friends find true love. From that day on, Tim and Sue continued to play by the sea, always looking for more magical adventures.

Tom and Lily are twins. They like to play games. One day, they play a game with a ball. They throw the ball to each other and catch it.
"Tom, throw the ball to me!" Lily says.
"OK, Lily, catch!" Tom says. He throws the ball to Lily.
Lily catches the ball and smiles. She throws the ball back to Tom.
"Good catch, Lily! Repeat!" Tom says. He catches the ball and throws it again.
They repeat the game many times. They have fun.
Mom watches them from the window. She is happy. She thinks, "Tom and Lily are healthy. They play well together. They share the ball. They are good twins."
She goes to the kitchen. She makes a snack for them. She puts some fruit and cheese on a plate. She takes the plate and a pass to the park.
"Tom, Lily, come here!" Mom says.
Tom and Lily stop the game. They run to Mom.
"What is it, Mom?" Tom asks.
"I have a snack for you. And a pass to the park. Do you want to go?" Mom says.
"Yes, Mom, yes!" Tom and Lily say. They are excited.
They eat the snack. They thank Mom. They take the pass and the ball. They go to the park with Mom. They play more games. They are happy.

Jack had a special jacket that he loved. It was blue and it was very clear. Every morning Jack would put it on and pretend to be an explorer. One day, he thought it would be cool to wear it on a real adventure. So he asked his mom:
"Mom, can I wear my jacket outside, please?"
Jack's mom smiled.
"Yes, you can," she said. 
So Jack grabbed his jacket and his backpack and set off on his adventure. He looked up at the clear blue sky and felt like anything was possible. He pretended to be an explorer, discovering new places and meeting new people. 
When it was time to go home, Jack was very sad. But he knew he would get to wear his clear blue jacket again soon.

One day, a big orange cat named Sam went for a walk. Sam liked to walk and see new things. He saw a big tire on the side of the road. Sam thought it would be fun to play with the tire.
Sam went closer to the tire and started to stir it with his paw. The tire began to roll down the road. Sam chased the tire, laughing and having fun. The tire rolled faster and faster.
Another cat, named Lily, saw Sam and the tire. She ran to join the fun. Lily asked Sam, "Can I play too?" Sam said, "Yes, let's play together!" They both stirred the tire and watched it roll down the road. Sam and Lily had a great day playing with the big tire.

Once upon a time, there was a thin cat named Tom. Tom liked to play with his eraser. He would push it with his paw and chase it around the house.
One day, Tom found a big bowl in the kitchen. It was full of sweet, yummy cake mix. Tom wanted to help, so he started to stir the mix with his eraser.
As Tom stirred, he saw the mix get thicker and thicker. He was so happy to help make the cake. When the cake was done, Tom shared it with his friends. They all loved the cake and thanked Tom for helping.

Once upon a time, a long train went on a trip. The train used steam to go fast. The train was very happy to take people to new places.
One day, the train saw a big rock on the tracks. It wanted to prevent a crash. The train blew its horn very loud. The people heard the sound and came to help.
The people worked together to move the big rock. The train said thank you and went on its way. The people waved goodbye. The long train kept going, using its steam to help people go places.

Once upon a time, there was a bunny called Bill. Bill was chubby and he liked eating lots of food.
One day, he saw an orange on the ground. He was so excited! He hopped over to the orange and he was about to take a bite, when a crack filled the sky.
He was so scared that he ran away, hiding behind a big tree. When he looked up, he saw a man in the sky. The man was holding a long, flash stick in his hand. 
"What are you doing?" Bill asked the man.
The man smiled. "I'm striking," he said. He took the stick and struck it into the ground. A loud crack filled the sky again and Bill's tummy rumbled. 
The man smiled. He opened up his bag and gave Bill a few apples and a carrot. Bill was so happy that he hugged the man and hopped away, towards the sunset.

One day, a little girl named Mia went to the store with her mom. They needed to buy food for dinner. Mia's mom let her choose one thing from the wide store. Mia was very happy.
Mia walked up and down the store. She saw a freezer with cold treats inside. "Mom, can I choose something from the freezer?" Mia asked. "Yes, you may," her mom said with a smile.
Mia opened the freezer and saw her favorite ice cream. But, as she reached for it, a small cat jumped out of the freezer! Mia and her mom were very surprised. The cat had been hiding in the freezer to stay cool. They took the cat home, and Mia got to choose her ice cream too. Now, Mia had a new friend and a sweet treat.

Once upon a time there were two brothers, Tony and Sam. Tony was very envious of Sam, so he decided to hide from him. Tony felt clever and thought he was the best.
One day Tony went to the circus and saw a clown. The clown was very funny and full of energy. Tony thought the clown was so cool and wanted to be like him. So Tony hid behind the clown and followed him around.
Still feeling envious, Tony continued to hide behind the clown whenever Sam was around. But soon, people noticed Tony and started to make fun of him. Tony realized that he should not have been envious and hiding.
From then on, Tony was no longer envious and stopped hiding. He realized that he should be the best at being himself and not comparing himself to other people. He learned that being envious and hiding will only make him look silly.

Once upon a time there was a big tree. At the top of the tree was a really yummy apple. Every day a bear would climb up to get the apple. One day a squirrel was watching the bear. 
The squirrel said, "Hey, why don't I get the apple too?" 
The bear said, "It'll take you a long time to climb up here. I'm bigger and faster than you."
 
The squirrel said, "I'll find a way."
The bear laughed and said, "Whatever."
The very next day the bear went up the tree but there was no apple. He looked all around and then he saw the squirrel. The squirrel had climbed up the tree with the help of a long thin tip. 
The bear was so surprised that he said, "That was a clever idea! I wish I had thought of it." 
The squirrel smiled and said, "It is always better to be kind and use your brain instead of using ugly words." 
The bear learnt a valuable lesson that day. He thanked the squirrel for the tip and went on his way.

Once upon a time, there was a bird named Mimi. Mimi loved to sing. Every morning, Mimi would open her eyes and start singing.
One morning, Mimi opened her eyes and saw mist in the sky. She frowned and knew something wasn't right. When she sang, her voice sounded different. The mist was not only blocking her view, but it was also affecting her song.
Mimi decided to do something. She needed help to make her song smooth again. She looked around and saw a frog. She asked the frog to help her. The frog agreed and said she needed to turn around and open her eyes.
Mimi did as the frog said, and when she opened her eyes the mist was gone. Not only was her view clear, but her voice was smooth again! Mimi was so thankful to the frog. She thanked him and started singing a smooth, happy song.

Once upon a time, there was a pretty bicycle. It was very attractive and all the kids wanted to ride it. One day, a little boy named Tim saw the bicycle near the park. He loved to swing and play in the park, but today he wanted to ride the bicycle.
Tim got on the bicycle and started to ride it. He went very fast, and he did not look where he was going. He was so happy to ride the attractive bicycle that he forgot to be careful. Suddenly, he hit a big rock and fell off the bicycle.
Tim was sad and hurt. The bicycle was broken too. He learned that he should have been more careful and not ride the bicycle so fast. The moral of the story is to always be careful and not let pretty things make you forget to be safe.

Once upon a time, there was a child named Tim. Tim liked to play with his toy truck. The truck could deliver things. One day, Tim decided to deliver something very special.
Tim found a fragile egg in his yard. He wanted to deliver the egg to his friend, Sue. He put the egg in his truck and started to drive. Tim was very careful because the egg was fragile.
But then, something unexpected happened. The egg started to crack! Tim stopped his truck and watched. The egg was not just an egg. It was a baby bird! The bird said "hello" to Tim. Tim was happy to have a new friend. He knew that Sue would love the baby bird too. So, Tim and the bird went to Sue's house to play.

One day, a curious little boy named Tim went out to play. He saw a big tree and wanted to find something fun. He looked around and found a cap on the ground. Tim picked up the cap and put it on his head.
Tim went to his friend, Sam, and said, "Look! I found a cap!" Sam looked at the cap and said, "Oh no! That is not a good cap. It is dirty and old. You should not wear it." But Tim did not listen. He liked his new cap and wanted to keep it.
Later, Tim started to feel sick. His head hurt and he felt very hot. His mom took him to the doctor. The doctor said, "You are sick because of the dirty cap. You should have listened to your friend Sam." Tim was sad and learned that he should listen to his friends.

Once upon a time there were two friends, a rabbit and a mouse. They always liked to play together, and they could never stop counting the numbers.
One day the rabbit found a match. She was so excited and said: "Look, Mouse! I found a match! Isn't it useful?"
Mouse thought it was a great idea and said: "Let's play with it!" So, the two friends played together, numering the match up and down until it broke!
Then the rabbit started crying and said: "What are we going to do now?"
Mouse thought and said "We could get another match, but it won't be as useful as this one".
They both went away and the match was never replaced. This was a bad ending for the two friends.

Once upon a time, in a big zoo, there were many animals. The zoo had a regular staff who took care of the animals. They fed them, cleaned their homes, and played with them.
One day, a new animal came to the zoo. It was a big lion! The lion was very loud and scared some of the staff. They did not want to go near the lion. So, they quit their jobs at the zoo.
The zoo needed new staff to help with the lion. They found a brave man named Tom. Tom was not scared of the lion. He took care of the lion and became friends with it. The lion was not loud anymore, and everyone was happy at the zoo.

One day, a small boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. Tim saw a shiny rock on the ground. He picked it up and said, "Mom, look! I found a pretty mineral!" His mom smiled and said, "Wow, that's a nice find, Tim!"
As they walked, Tim saw a confused dog. The dog was running in circles, not knowing where to go. Tim called out, "Doggy, come here!" The dog ran to Tim, wagging its tail.
Tim's mom looked at her watch and said, "Oh no, we need to hurry home for lunch!" Tim, his mom, and the dog all hurried back to their house. They ate lunch together and the dog became their new friend. From that day on, Tim, his mom, and the dog went to the park every day to look for more pretty minerals.

Once upon a time, there was a big cloud in the sky. The cloud was very fine and white. It floated high above a small town where many people lived.
One day, the cloud met a little girl named Lily. Lily looked up at the cloud and said, "Hello, fine cloud! Can you please permit me to play with you?" The cloud smiled and said, "Yes, Lily! I will permit you to play with me."
Lily and the cloud played all day. They laughed and had so much fun. The cloud even let Lily sit on it for a little while. When the sun began to set, Lily said goodbye to the cloud and went home. The cloud stayed in the sky, happy to have made a new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a smelly glove that he loved to play with. One day, Tim's mom told him, "Tim, you need to clean your smelly glove, or it will remain smelly forever."
Tim did not listen to his mom. He just played and played with his smelly glove. One day, while playing in the park, he met a new friend named Sue. Sue asked, "What's that smell?" Tim said, "It's my glove. My mom told me to clean it, but I didn't."
Sue did not want to play with Tim because of the smelly glove. Tim was sad and went home. He finally decided to clean his glove. The next day, Tim went to the park with his clean glove. Sue saw him and said, "Your glove smells nice now! Let's play together."
From that day on, Tim and Sue played together every day. Tim learned that it is important to listen to his mom and keep his things clean.

Once upon a time, there was a big orange cat. The cat liked to play with his friends in the sun. They played with a ball and ran around in the grass.
One day, the orange cat heard the word "war". He did not know what it meant. He started to wonder about it. He asked his friends, but they did not know either.
The orange cat and his friends decided to ask the wise old owl. The owl told them that "war" was when people or animals fought. The orange cat and his friends did not like the sound of that. They promised to always play nice and be kind to each other. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a tough dog named Max. Max liked to play with his friends in the park. One day, he saw a toy gun on the ground. He picked it up with his mouth and ran to show his friends.
Max went to his best friend, a cat named Tom. "Look, Tom! I found a toy gun!" said Max. Tom looked at the toy gun and said, "Wow, that's fun! Let's play with it." So, Max and Tom played with the toy gun all day long.
That night, Max and Tom were very tired. They lay down on the grass and looked at the stars. Max said, "Tom, let's pray for more fun days like this one." Tom agreed, and they both prayed together. The next day, they woke up and had another fun day playing in the park.

Jack and Mandy went to the store. They wanted to buy some candy. They looked around the store and realized it was very organized.
They both got really excited when they saw the elevator. They each pushed the button to get inside.
The elevator went up and it stopped on the top floor. Jack and Mandy saw the candy. They got really happy.
Jack and Mandy filled their bags with candy and took them to the register. Jack and Mandy realized they could have all the candy they wanted. They smiled and they were glad they went to the store.

Henry was always quite intelligent. He had a laser that he loved to play with. Every day he would shoot it around the room and pretend he was some kind of superhero. One day he asked his mom, "Mommy, I need more laser power!".
His mom smiled and said, "Henry, you've already got a lot of power from your laser. You don't need any more." 
Henry was hurt and confused. He said, "But the other superheroes have more power than me."
His mom gave him a big hug and said, "You don't need to be powerful like the other superheroes. You don't need fancy lasers. You already have everything you need - your intelligence!" 
Henry smiled and said, "You're right mommy. I have everything I need." 
Then, he hugged her back and went off to play with his laser again. He was happy to realize that he already had everything he needed.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tom. He loved to play outside. One day, he saw a snake in the grass. Tom was not scared of the snake. He wanted to kick it away.
Before Tom could kick the snake, he saw the snake was sad. The snake was hungry and wanted to eat something yummy. Tom had an idea. He went to get some yummy fruit for the snake.
Tom gave the yummy fruit to the snake. The snake was happy and ate the fruit. Tom and the snake became friends. They played together every day. Tom learned that being kind is better than being mean.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sally. Sally was only three years old and very sad. She had dropped her favorite phone with all the pictures of her family. They were all gone!
Sally was very scared and started to cry. Her mom came running over to try and comfort her. "It's OK, sweetheart," said her mom, in a soothing voice. "We'll get a new phone and put all the pictures back on it. Don't worry."
Sally stopped crying and was a bit comforted. But then her mom had an idea and grabbed the family laptop. She was so thoughtful! She quickly uploaded all the pictures onto the laptop.
The next day, Sally was so excited to get the new phone and she quickly put all the pictures back on it. But when she turned on the phone, they were all gone. All her pictures were gone forever!
Sally started to cry again, and this time all her mom's comforting words couldn't help. Sally had lost her pictures forever.

Once upon a time, there was a little rabbit named Tim. Tim had a big brother named Sam. Sam was very bossy. He always told Tim what to do. One day, they went to play in the park.
Tim and Sam loved to hop around the park. They hopped up and down, and all around. Then, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and blew Sam's hat off his head.
Tim saw the hat flying away. He wanted to help his brother. So, he hopped faster than ever before. He hopped and hopped until he caught the hat. Sam was so happy.
Now, Sam was not so bossy anymore. He saw that his little brother Tim was very brave and fast. They hopped together and played happily in the park. And they became the best of friends.

One day, a light bug named Bob lived in a big tree. The tree had many arms. Bob liked to play on the tree arms. He had many friends who lived in the tree too.
One day, Bob saw his friend, a bird named Tim. Tim looked sad. Bob asked, "Why are you sad, Tim?" Tim said, "My home is rot. I can't live in it now." Bob wanted to help his friend.
Bob and Tim went to find a new home for Tim. They looked at many tree arms. At last, they found a nice, strong arm for Tim. Tim was happy. Bob and Tim played and laughed together in their big tree.

Once upon a time, there was a baby who lived in a small house. In the house, there was a crib. The baby loved to sleep in the crib. The crib was there to protect the baby. The baby did not know this, but one day, something big would happen.
One day, the baby's mom put the baby in the crib for a nap. She told the baby, "I will always protect you." The baby did not understand, but the baby felt safe. The baby was ignorant of the big thing that would happen soon.
Later that day, a big storm came. The wind blew and the rain fell. The baby was scared, but the crib was strong. The crib protected the baby from the storm. The baby's mom came and hugged the baby. The baby was safe and happy because of the crib and the mom. The big thing had happened, and the baby was protected.

Lily and Ben were playing in the garden. They saw a thin stick on the ground. Lily picked it up and said, "Look, Ben, I have a wand!"
Ben said, "No, you don't. It's just a stick. You can't do magic with it."
Lily said, "Yes, I can. Watch this!" She waved the stick in the air and said, "Glow, glow, glow!"
Nothing happened. Ben laughed and said, "See? I told you. It's not a wand. It's a stick."
Lily felt sad. She wanted to do magic. She said, "Maybe it needs a flame to glow. Let's go to the fire pit and try."
Ben said, "OK, but be careful. Fire is hot and can hurt you."
They ran to the fire pit, where their dad was making a fire. He saw them and said, "Hey, kids, what are you doing with that stick?"
Lily said, "Dad, can I put it in the fire? I want to make it glow."
Dad said, "No, Lily, that's not a good idea. The stick will burn and turn into ash. It won't glow. It will be gone."
Lily said, "But I want to do magic with it. I want to make it a wand."
Dad said, "Lily, you don't need a wand to do magic. You have magic in your heart and in your imagination. You can make anything glow with your words and your smile."
Lily smiled and hugged her dad. She said, "Thank you, dad. You are right. I have magic in me."
Ben said, "Me too, dad. Me too."
Dad said, "Yes, you do, Ben. You both do. And you know what? You make me glow with your love."

Once upon a time, there was a brilliant cat named Tom. Tom loved to eat tuna. One day, Tom wanted to create a big tuna cake for his friends.
But there was a problem. Tom did not know how to create a tuna cake. He felt sad. He asked his friend, Birdy, for help. Birdy did not know how to create a tuna cake either. They both felt sad.
Tom and Birdy went to their wise friend, Owl. Owl knew how to create a tuna cake! Owl helped Tom and Birdy make the big tuna cake. They were all very happy. In the end, Tom, Birdy, and Owl shared the brilliant tuna cake with all their friends.

Once upon a time, there was a black train. The train had a big job. It had to take coal to the town. The train was very proud of its job. Every day, the train would go to the coal place, fill up, and then go to the town.
One day, the train was going to the town with the coal. But something unexpected happened. The train saw a big tree on the track. The train could not go. The train was very sad. It could not do its job.
Then, a big strong wind came. The wind blew the tree away. The train was so happy! Now, the train could go to the town. The train was allowed to do its job again. The town got the coal, and everyone was happy. The train was a hero!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue had a big, red bow that she loved very much. She wore it every day in her hair.
One sunny day, Sue went to play at the park. It was very dry, and the grass crunched under her feet. She played on the swings, the slide, and the seesaw. Sue was having so much fun that she did not notice her bow had fallen out of her hair.
Sue's friend, Tom, saw the bow on the ground. He picked it up and yelled, "Sue, your bow! Your bow fell out!" Sue ran to Tom and thanked him with a big hug. She put her bow back in her hair and they played together until it was time to go home.

Lily and Ben are twins. They like to play with toys and books. One day, their mom says, "We are going to the opera today. It is a big show with music and singing. You will like it."
Lily and Ben are excited. They put on their nice clothes and shoes. They go in the car with their mom and dad. They drive to a big building with many lights. They see many people in the building. Some people wear fancy dresses and suits. Some people wear poor clothes and look sad.
Lily and Ben follow their mom and dad to their seats. They sit in a big room with a stage. They see a curtain on the stage. They hear a bell ring. The curtain opens. The show begins.
Lily and Ben watch the show. They see many people on the stage. They wear colorful costumes and wigs. They sing and act. They tell a story with their voices and movements. Some parts of the story are happy. Some parts are sad. Some parts are funny. Some parts are scary.
Lily and Ben listen to the music. They hear a piano, a violin, a flute, and a drum. They hear high voices and low voices. They hear loud sounds and soft sounds. They like the music. It makes them feel different things.
Lily and Ben talk to each other. They ask questions and share their thoughts. They say things like:
"Look, that lady is crying. Why is she crying?"
"Maybe she is sad. Maybe she lost something."
"Look, that man is angry. Why is he angry?"
"Maybe he is mad. Maybe someone did something bad to him."
"Look, that girl is happy. Why is she happy?"
"Maybe she is glad. Maybe she found something good."
"Look, that boy is poor. Why is he poor?"
"Maybe he has no money. Maybe he has no home."
"Look, that lady is rich. Why is she rich?"
"Maybe she has a lot of money. Maybe she has a big home."
Lily and Ben enjoy the show. They clap their hands and smile. They say, "We like the opera. It is a big show with music and singing. We want to see it again." Their mom and dad hug them and say, "We are happy you like the opera. It is a special treat for us. We love you."

Ben loves his guitar. He plays it every day. He sings songs with his guitar. His guitar makes him happy.
One day, Ben's big brother Tom comes to his room. Tom is angry. He had a bad day at school. He sees Ben's guitar on the bed. He grabs it and says, "This is mine now. You are too little to play guitar. Go away!"
Ben is sad and scared. He says, "No, Tom, please! That is my guitar. Give it back to me. It is my favorite thing. Don't take it away!"
Tom does not listen. He runs away with the guitar. He goes to the backyard. He throws the guitar on the ground. He stomps on it. He breaks it into pieces. He laughs and says, "Ha ha, look at your guitar now. It is trash. You can't play it anymore. You are a baby. Go cry to Mommy!"
Ben hears the noise. He runs to the backyard. He sees his guitar. It is broken. It is ruined. He can't fix it. He can't restore it. He cries and cries. He says, "Tom, why did you do that? You are mean. You are a bully. You hurt my guitar. You hurt me. I hate you!"
Tom does not care. He walks away. He leaves Ben alone. He leaves the guitar on the ground. He does not say sorry. He does not feel bad.
Ben is very sad. He has no guitar. He has no songs. He has no joy. He wishes he had a mighty friend. A friend who would help him. A friend who would protect him. A friend who would love him. But he has no friend. He has only his broken guitar. And his broken heart.

One day, a little dog named Max was in a big store with his friend, a small cat named Lily. They were looking for a toy to play with. Max and Lily were very excited to find a toy they would love. But after a while, they became confused. They did not know how to find the exit.
Max asked Lily, "Can you tell me where the exit is?" Lily looked around and saw a big sign that said "Exit." She pointed at the sign and said, "Look, Max! The exit is over there!"
Max and Lily walked towards the exit. On their way, they found a ball and a toy mouse. They were so happy! They left the store and went to the park to play with their new toys. They played all day and had a lot of fun. And they were never confused in the store again.

Once upon a time, there was a dragon named Joe. Every year, Joe's family would celebrate his birthday. On his birthday, Joe and his family would go on an adventure in the woods. They were all very excited!
One day, when Joe and his family arrived at the woods, they heard loud noises. Suddenly, they saw a terrible dragon coming their way! Joe was very scared.
Joe's dad stepped forward and shouted to the dragon: "What do you want?" The dragon replied: "I want to celebrate too! I want to join your birthday party!".
Joe and his family were scared, but eventually decided that it would be nice to include the dragon in the celebration. So they all celebrated Joe's birthday together.
 
The day was filled with laughter, hugs and much fun. Even though the dragon was a little bit scary at first, they all had a wonderful time celebrating Joe's birthday.

Once upon a time, there was a woman. She had a black cat. The cat was very nice. The woman and the cat were best friends. They played all day.
One day, the woman got a big red balloon. She wanted to play with the cat and the balloon. The woman held the balloon tight. She did not want to let it go.
But then, the cat jumped up. It touched the balloon with its paw. The woman let go of the balloon by mistake. The balloon went up, up, up. The woman and the cat watched the balloon fly away. They laughed and clapped. The woman and the cat went inside to find another game to play. And they lived happily ever after.

Lily loves to watch the birds in the garden. She likes to see their colors and hear their songs. One day, she sees a beautiful bird with blue and yellow feathers. She wants to be friends with the bird, so she runs to get some bread.
"Hello, bird!" she says, holding out a piece of bread. "Do you want to play with me?"
The bird is hungry and curious. It hops closer to Lily and pecks at the bread. Lily smiles and gently strokes the bird's head. The bird likes Lily and chirps happily.
Lily decides to take the bird inside her house. She thinks the bird will be warm and cozy there. She wraps the bird in a soft towel and carries it to her room. She puts the bird on her bed and shows it her toys.
"Look, bird, this is my teddy bear. He is very soft and cuddly. And this is my doll. She has a pretty dress and a hat. Do you like them?"
The bird looks around and feels scared. It does not like the toys or the bed. It misses the garden and the sky. It flaps its wings and tries to escape. It knocks over the doll and the teddy bear.
Lily is sad and confused. She does not understand why the bird does not want to stay with her. She thinks the bird is angry and does not like her.
"Please, bird, don't go! I love you! You are my friend!" she cries, holding the towel.
The bird feels sorry for Lily. It does not want to hurt her feelings. But it also wants to be free. It gently pecks Lily's cheek and sings a soft song. It tells Lily that it is grateful for the bread and the stroke, but it belongs to the garden and the sky. It asks Lily to let it go.
Lily listens to the bird and understands. She loves the bird, but she also wants it to be happy. She unwraps the towel and opens the window. She watches the bird fly away and wave its tail. She waves back and smiles.
"Goodbye, bird! Thank you for playing with me! You are very beautiful! Come back soon!" she says.
The bird nods and flies to the garden. It joins its friends and tells them about Lily. It says that Lily is very kind and sweet. It says that it will visit her again.
Lily goes to the garden and looks for the bird. She sees it among the flowers and trees. She feels happy and proud. She has a new friend. A beautiful bird.

Jill awoke one morning with a mild feeling. She stepped outside and into the sunshine. In the corner of the garden she noticed something glistening in the sun. She kneeled down to take a closer look and was surprised to see a shell. She picked it up and ran inside to show her mom.
"Mom! Mom!" Jill yelled in excitement, "I found this in the garden!"
Her mom smiled and said, "That's a beautiful shell. Where did you find it?"
Jill replied, "I knelt down in the corner and I saw it in the sun."
Her mom was so proud of her for finding such a beautiful shell. She thanked Jill for the lovely surprise and gave her a big hug.
Jill was very happy and from that day forward she kneeled down in the garden to look for more shells. She never quite found another one like the first one, but the feeling of finding it was always mild and special.

Lily was sad. She did not want to go to bed. She wanted to play with her toys. But Mom said it was time to sleep.
"No, no, no!" Lily cried. She threw her teddy bear on the floor. She kicked her blanket. She did not listen to Mom.
Mom was not happy. She picked up the teddy bear and the blanket. She hung them on a hanger in the closet. She said, "Lily, you are being very naughty. You have to sleep now. No more toys for you."
Lily felt worse. She sobbed and sobbed. She missed her teddy bear. She was cold without her blanket. She was sorry for being naughty. She wanted Mom to comfort her.
She called out, "Mom, Mom, please come back. I'm sorry. I love you. I want my teddy bear and my blanket. Please, Mom."
Mom heard Lily. She came back to the room. She saw Lily's sad face. She felt sorry for Lily. She said, "Lily, I love you too. I know you are tired and cranky. But you have to sleep. It is good for you. It is fair. All the children sleep at night."
She took the teddy bear and the blanket from the hanger. She gave them to Lily. She hugged Lily and kissed her. She said, "Here, Lily. You can have your teddy bear and your blanket. But you have to promise me to sleep now. OK?"
Lily nodded. She smiled. She said, "OK, Mom. I promise. Thank you, Mom. You are the best."
She cuddled with her teddy bear and her blanket. She felt warm and cozy. She closed her eyes. She fell asleep. Mom smiled. She turned off the light. She said, "Good night, Lily. Sweet dreams."

Once upon a time, in a big, big house, there lived a little girl named Emma. Emma loved to play with her toys, and her favorite toy was a soft, cuddly teddy bear named Teddy. Teddy had a small hole in his leg, and he needed a stitch to fix it. Emma's mom, who was very good at fixing things, said she would help.
Emma's mom took a needle and some thread and began to supply the stitch for Teddy's leg. Emma watched as her mom carefully fixed Teddy's leg. "There you go, all better now!" said Emma's mom, as she finished the last stitch. Emma hugged Teddy and said, "Thank you, Mommy! Teddy feels much better now!"
Later that day, Emma and Teddy sat down for lunch. Mom made a yummy, spicy soup for Emma to eat. "Careful, it's a little spicy!" said Mom. Emma tried the soup and smiled. "I like spicy food, Mommy!" she said. Teddy sat next to Emma as she ate her soup, happy to be all fixed up and ready to play again.

Once upon a time, there was a big jar. The jar was full of sweet treats. A little boy saw the jar and wanted to eat the treats. He tried to open the jar, but it was too tight. He called his friend, a small cat, to help him open it.
The cat tried to open the jar too, but it was not fit to do it. The little boy and the cat were sad. They wanted the sweet treats so much. They called their big friend, a strong dog, to help them open the jar.
The strong dog came and opened the jar for them. The little boy, the cat, and the dog were very happy. They started to eat the sweet treats. But, they ate too much and felt sick. The little boy, the cat, and the dog learned that eating too many sweet treats was not good. They were sad and their tummies hurt.

Once upon a time, in a land far away, there was a mighty king. He ruled over a big kingdom. The king loved to learn about history. He would read books and ask people to tell him stories about the past.
One day, the king went for a walk in the forest. He met a little girl. The little girl was picking flowers. The king said, "Hello! I am the mighty king. I like to learn about history. Can you tell me a story?"
The little girl thought for a moment. Then she said, "Once there was a big tree. The tree was strong and tall. But one day, a storm came. The wind blew hard. The tree did not yield. It stayed strong. The storm went away, and the tree was still there. The end."
The king smiled. He was happy to hear the story. He thanked the little girl and went back to his castle. He thought about the tree that did not yield. The king knew that he could be strong like the tree, even when things were hard.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue liked to study. She would sit at her small table with her books and learn new words. One day, while she was studying, she found a rag on the floor. It was not a fancy rag, but it was soft and pretty.
Sue picked up the rag and said, "Hello, rag! Do you want to study with me?" The rag did not talk, but Sue pretended it said yes. She put the rag on her lap and opened her book. They studied together, and Sue felt happy.
After they finished studying, Sue took the rag to her mommy. "Mommy, look at my new friend! We studied together!" Sue's mommy smiled and said, "That's great, Sue! You can keep the rag as a special friend, but remember to wash it sometimes." Sue hugged the rag and promised to take good care of it.

One day, a little boy named Tim and his dog, Max, went to the park. They saw a stand with many toys. Tim wanted a toy, but he was too small to reach it. Max tried to help, but he could not manage to get it either. They both felt upset.
Then, a big girl named Sue saw them and said, "Do you need help?" Tim nodded and said, "Yes, please. We want a toy from the stand, but we can't reach it." Sue smiled and helped them get the toy.
Just when they thought they had the toy, it jumped out of Sue's hand! The toy was a magic toy! It could talk and said, "Thank you for helping me! I was stuck on the stand and wanted to play too!" Tim, Max, and Sue were surprised but happy. They all played together and had a fun day at the park.

One day, a gentle bunny named Bob went out to play. He wanted to see how big the Earth was, so he thought he would measure it. He took a long string and began to walk.
As he walked, he met a big bear named Ben. Ben saw the string and asked, "What are you doing, Bob?" Bob said, "I want to measure the Earth, so I know how big it is!" Ben laughed and said, "You can't do that, it's too big for a little bunny like you!"
Bob was sad, but he didn't give up. He kept walking with his string. Suddenly, he found a magic stone. The stone could talk! It said, "I can help you measure the Earth, but you have to promise to be my friend." Bob agreed, and the stone turned into a magic ruler.
Together, they measured the Earth in just a few steps! Bob was happy, and he had a new friend. The big bear Ben was amazed and said, "I'm sorry for laughing at you, Bob. You did it!" From that day on, they all played together and had lots of fun.

Once there was a three year old boy. He was bouncing up and down. He was so happy, he started to clap. He was having so much fun.
He asked his mom for a cup. She handed him a bright pink cup. He was so happy, he clapped even louder. He was so strong, he could clap his hands really easily.
The cup was perfect for him. He filled it with water and carried it around everywhere. He was so proud of himself and clapped even harder still.
The little boy was so happy with his cup. He loved it so much, he never wanted to put it down. He walked around the house clapping and drinking from the cup all day.
It was so easy to carry his cup and clap his hands, the little boy was having the best day ever.

Sara and Ben are twins. They like to play with their toys and eat yummy snacks. But they do not like to share. One day, their mom gives them a big silver box. She says it is a gift from their grandma, who lives far away. She says grandma loves them and sends them nice things.
Sara and Ben are happy. They want to see what is inside the box. They open it and find many things. There are books, puzzles, stickers, and candy. Sara and Ben smile. They want to play with everything. But they do not want to share.
Sara grabs the books and the stickers. She says they are hers. Ben grabs the puzzles and the candy. He says they are his. They run to their rooms and close the doors. They do not talk to each other. They do not say thank you to mom or grandma.
Mom is sad. She does not like to see her twins fight. She thinks of a way to make them happy again. She knocks on their doors and asks them to come out. She says she has a surprise for them. She says grandma also sent them a letter. She says they can read it together.
Sara and Ben are curious. They want to see the letter. They come out of their rooms and sit with mom on the couch. Mom shows them the letter. It has a picture of grandma and a big heart. It says:
Dear Sara and Ben,
I miss you very much. I hope you like the things I sent you. They are for you to have fun and learn. But they are also for you to share. Sharing is caring. When you share, you make others happy. And you make yourself happy too. I love you both. Please write back to me soon.
Love, Grandma.
Sara and Ben feel sorry. They realize they were selfish and rude. They hug mom and say they are sorry. They say they love grandma and thank her for the gift. They say they will share and play nicely. They say they will write back to grandma and tell her how they are.
Mom is happy. She hugs Sara and Ben and says she is proud of them. She says they are good twins. She says she loves them very much. She says they can have some candy as a treat. But only if they share.
Sara and Ben smile. They agree to share. They take some candy and give some to mom. They say the candy is yummy. They say sharing is yummy too. They eat the candy and read the books and do the puzzles and play with the stickers. They have fun and learn. They are happy.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a cat named Tom. Tom loved to eat butter. Every day, he would carefully sneak into the kitchen and eat the butter when no one was looking. One day, as Tom was eating the butter, he heard a yawn.
Tom looked around and saw a tiny mouse named Jerry. Jerry was very tired but also wanted some butter. Tom was not happy to share his butter, but he decided to be nice and let Jerry have some. They both ate the butter and became friends.
One day, Tom and Jerry found a big jar of butter. They were so happy! But then, they saw a little kid crying. The kid was hungry and had no food. Tom and Jerry looked at each other and decided to give the butter to the kid. The kid was so happy and thanked them. Tom and Jerry learned that sharing is good and being kind to others makes everyone happy.

Once upon a time, there was a quiet little dog named Spot. Spot loved to play all day. One day, Spot saw a big ball in the bathroom. He wanted to play with it, but his mom said no.
Spot tried to ignore his mom. He went into the bathroom to get the ball. But the ball was too big for Spot to carry. He tried and tried, but he could not get the ball out.
Then, Spot's mom came into the bathroom. She saw Spot trying to get the ball. She helped him carry the ball outside. They played with the ball all day and had lots of fun. Spot learned to listen to his mom and not ignore her.

Once upon a time, there was a heavy sack. The owner of the sack was a nice man. The sack was full of toys. The man wanted to give the toys to kids who had no toys. He carried the heavy sack on his back.
One day, the man met a little girl. The girl asked, "What is in the sack?" The man said, "Toys for kids who have no toys." The girl was sad because she had no toys. The man knew he would help her soon.
The next day, the man came back with his heavy sack. He opened the sack and gave the girl a toy. The girl was so happy. She said, "Thank you!" The man smiled and went on to help more kids with his heavy sack of toys.

Once upon a time, there was a pink van that could fly. One day, a little boy celebrated his third birthday and received the pink van as a present. As he opened the box, he was amazed by what he saw!
"Mommy, look at the van! It can fly!" he said excitedly.
His mother was so proud of him and smiled. "Yes, it's amazing! You can even say it's magical."
The little boy was beaming. He couldn't wait to show everyone his special car. He ran outside and started flying in the sky. He had so much fun watching the birds, who were also flying around.
When the sun went down, he flew his pink van back home. The little boy was both tired and happy from his special day.
The next day, he flew his pink van again, enjoying the adventure and joy it brought him.

Once upon a time, in a modest little hole in the ground, there lived a rabbit. This rabbit had a small family and they all loved each other very much. The rabbit liked to go out and play with his friends in the sunny fields.
One day, while the rabbit was playing with his friends, he saw a big shadow. The rabbit started to tremble, as he had never seen such a big shadow before. All the other animals started to run away, but the rabbit was too scared to move.
Suddenly, the big shadow turned into a huge, friendly dog. The dog said, "Don't be scared, little rabbit. I just want to play with you and your friends." The rabbit was very surprised, but he was happy that the big shadow was not something scary. So, the rabbit and the dog became friends and played together every day.

One sunny day, Tim and Sue went to the park. They were excited to play on the slide. They ran to the slide and took turns going down. They laughed and had lots of fun.
Then, Tim saw a sharp rock near the slide. He was scared that someone might get hurt. He told Sue about the rock. Sue had an idea to fix the problem.
Sue found a big leaf and put it on the sharp rock. Then, they kept playing on the slide. They were happy and safe. The leaf on the rock was their secret helper.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tom who loved shapes. He had a box full of shapes that were different colors. Tom liked to play with his shapes and make big towers with them. He also liked to be the best at making towers and would always try to make his tower taller than anyone else's.
One day, Tom was playing with his shapes when his friend, Sam, came over. They started to build towers together. "My tower is taller than yours!" said Tom, feeling very happy. Sam didn't like that and wanted to make his tower taller too. They were both trying to be the best at building towers.
As they were building, Tom had an idea. He thought that if he put his shapes near the stove, they would get bigger and his tower would be the tallest. But when Tom put his shapes near the stove, something bad happened. The shapes started to burn! Tom and Sam were very scared and didn't know what to do.
Tom's mom saw the smoke and came running into the kitchen. She quickly turned off the stove and took the shapes away from the heat. The shapes were all burned and melted. Tom and Sam were very sad because they couldn't play with the shapes anymore.
From that day on, Tom learned that being the best isn't always the most important thing. He also learned to be more careful when playing with his toys.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She loved to think about cake all day. Amy's mom knew this, so she decided to make a special cake for her.
Amy's mom made a cake that was very flexible. It could bend and twist, but it was still yummy to eat. Amy was so happy to see the cake. She thought it was magic and could not wait to show her friends.
Amy took the flexible cake to her friends. They all played with the cake and ate it too. It was a fun day for everyone. They all laughed and thought about how much they loved the magic cake.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia was very glad because she was going to see an opera with her mom and dad. She put on her pretty dress and her shiny shoes.
At the opera, there were many people. They all sat down and listened to the music. Mia liked the music and the singers. She clapped her hands and smiled.
After the opera, Mia saw a big red door. She wanted to see what was behind it. Mia used her little hands to pull the door open. Behind the door, she found a room full of beautiful costumes and wigs. Mia was so happy and danced around the room.

Once, there was a family who had a great number of luxuries. They were always very happy and had lots of fun! 
One day, the family went out for a picnic together. With them, they carried a basket of sour fruits. The father opened up the basket and carefully counted out everyone's share. 
They all ate their fruits and giggled as they found out that the fruits were sour. Mama even made a funny face while she ate her sour fruits! 
The family laughed and talked until all the fruits were eaten. Everyone agreed that it was a perfect day! Even the sour fruits couldn't ruin their fun!

One day, a boy and a girl were playing. They wanted to trade toys. The boy had a car and the girl had a doll. They were patient and waited for their turn to play with the toys.
The boy said, "I want to trade my car for your doll." The girl said, "Okay, let's trade!" But when they tried to trade, a big wind came and shut the door. They could not trade their toys.
They were sad and did not know what to do. Then, a little bird came and said, "I can help you trade your toys." The bird took the car and the doll and flew over the door. The bird gave the car to the girl and the doll to the boy. They were happy and thanked the bird. The boy and the girl played with their new toys and had a fun day.

One day, a little girl named Lily went to the beach with her mom and dad. They played in the sand and swam in the sea. The sun was warm and light, and the water was cool and fun. Lily liked to listen to the waves and feel the tide come in and out.
As they played, Lily saw a big shell. She picked it up and held it to her ear. She heard a tiny whisper from the shell. It sounded like a little voice saying, "Help me!" Lily was surprised and looked inside the shell.
Inside the shell, she found a tiny crab. The crab was stuck and needed help to get out. Lily gently shook the shell, and the crab fell out onto the sand. The crab was so happy to be free. It danced around and then went back into the sea. Lily felt good that she had helped the little crab. She didn't know that shells could talk, but now she had a secret friend from the sea.

Once upon a time, there was a big, ugly wolf. He lived in the dark woods. He loved to display his big, sharp teeth to scare the little animals.
One day, the ugly wolf saw a small, cute bunny. He wanted to scare the bunny, too. The bunny saw the ugly wolf's shadow and knew he was coming. The bunny thought of a plan.
The bunny ran to a big hole in the ground. The ugly wolf followed the bunny. When the wolf got close, the bunny jumped into the hole. The ugly wolf tried to follow, but he was too big for the hole. The bunny was safe, and the ugly wolf couldn't scare him. The little animals all laughed at the big, ugly wolf.

Tom and Lily were playing near the harbor. They liked to watch the big boats and the small fish. They saw a bright red boat with a big flag. They wanted to go on the boat.
"Can we go on the boat, please?" Tom asked his mom.
"No, you can't. The boat is not for us. It is for the people who work on the water. They have to do their job," his mom said.
"But we want to see the boat. It is so pretty and shiny. Please, mom, please," Lily asked.
"No, I said no. You have to listen to me. The boat is not safe for you. You could fall in the water or get hurt by the tools. Come on, let's go to the park instead. There is a nice slide and a swing there," his mom said.
Tom and Lily were not happy. They did not want to go to the park. They wanted to go on the boat. They did not listen to their mom. They ran away from her and towards the boat. They climbed on the boat and looked around. They saw a lot of ropes and boxes and nets. They thought it was fun.
"Look, Tom, look. There is a big wheel here. I think it is for steering the boat. Let me try it," Lily said.
She grabbed the wheel and turned it. The boat started to move. It left the harbor and went into the open water. Tom and Lily were scared. They did not know how to stop the boat. They did not know where they were going. They started to cry.
"Help, help. Mom, mom. Where are you? We are sorry. We want to go back. Help, help," they shouted.
Their mom heard them. She was very worried. She ran to the harbor and saw the boat. She waved her arms and called for help. She saw a man on another boat. He was the captain of the red boat. He saw what happened. He was very angry. He followed the boat and caught up with it. He jumped on the boat and stopped it. He took Tom and Lily and brought them back to the harbor. He gave them to their mom.
"You are very naughty children. You should not go on the boat without permission. You could have caused a lot of trouble. You are lucky I saw you. You should say sorry to me and to your mom," he said.
Tom and Lily were very sorry. They said sorry to the captain and to their mom. They hugged their mom and promised to never do it again. Their mom was very relieved. She was also very mad. She took them home and gave them a time out. She told them to think about what they did and why it was wrong. She hoped they learned their lesson.

Once upon a time, in an ordinary little house, there lived a boy named Tim. Tim liked to play with his toys, but he also liked to drop his junk all over the floor. His room was always messy, and his mom would tell him to clean up every day.
One sunny day, Tim was playing with his toy truck when he saw a big box in the corner of his room. He didn't know where it came from, but he was curious to find out what was inside. Tim opened the box, and to his surprise, he found a magic wand!
Tim decided to use the magic wand to clean up his room. He pointed the wand at his junk and said, "Clean up, clean up!" Suddenly, all the junk he had dropped on the floor started to fly up in the air and put itself away. Tim was so happy that his room was clean, and he promised to keep it that way.
From that day on, Tim never dropped his junk on the floor again. He learned that keeping his room clean made his mom happy, and it made it easier for him to find his toys when he wanted to play. And even though the magic wand was just an ordinary stick, Tim always believed that it had helped him become a better, cleaner boy.

One day, a boy named Tim and a girl named Sue were playing outside. They saw a big jar of candy on the ground. They were very happy and wanted to eat the candy.
Tim said, "Let's discuss how to share the candy." Sue nodded and said, "Yes, we need a useful way to share it." They talked and decided to take turns picking one candy each until the jar was empty.
As they were sharing the candy, a big wind came and blew the jar away. The candy spilled all over the ground. Tim and Sue were sad because they couldn't eat the candy now.
A bird flew down and picked up a candy. The bird said, "Thank you for the candy!" Tim and Sue were surprised that the bird could talk. The bird flew away with the candy, and Tim and Sue were left with no candy at all.

Once upon a time, there was a witch. The witch was not mean, but people were frightened of her. She lived in a small house in the woods.
One day, the witch had a party. She invited all her animal friends. The animals were not frightened of the witch. They knew she was nice. They all came to the party and had fun.
At the party, the witch and her friends played games and ate yummy food. The animals were happy and not frightened anymore. They all became good friends and had many more parties together.

Tom and Mia are friends. They like to play with toys and draw pictures. One day, they find a big roll of tape in the closet. It is bright and shiny.
"Wow, look at this tape!" Tom says. "It is so pretty. We can use it to make things."
"Yes, let's make something with the tape," Mia agrees. "What do you want to make?"
Tom thinks for a moment. He has an idea. "I know! Let's make a heart with the tape. A heart means love."
Mia likes the idea. She smiles. "Yes, let's make a heart. I love you, Tom. You are my friend."
They take the tape and stick it on a piece of paper. They make a big heart with the tape. It is bright and shiny. They are happy.
They show their heart to their mom. She is proud of them. She hugs them and says, "I love you, Tom and Mia. You are very creative and kind. You made a beautiful heart with the tape."
Tom and Mia are happy. They love their mom. They love their heart. They love their tape. They love each other. They are friends.

One day, a big dog named Sam was very tired. He went to a big tree to rest. He saw a little cat named Tim. Tim was sad because he had to leave his home.
Sam said, "Why do you have to leave?" Tim said, "A mean judge told me to go away." Sam wanted to help Tim, so they went to talk to the judge.
The judge was a big bird named Mr. Beak. Sam and Tim asked him, "Why did you tell Tim to leave?" Mr. Beak said, "I don't like cats. They take my food." Sam and Tim tried to tell him that not all cats are bad, but Mr. Beak didn't listen. He told them to go away.
Tim had to leave his home and find a new one. Sam felt sad for his new friend. The moral of the story is to not judge someone without knowing them well.

Mia was excited for lunchtime. She ran to the kitchen and shouted out loud, "Mommy, is lunch ready?". Her mom replied, "Yes it is, but we're going to delay eating it a bit". Mia had been playing with her toys and was curious why the lunch was delayed. She asked her mom, "Why do we need to delay our lunch?". Her mom explained, "There's lots of noisy construction work outside and I'd like the noise to die down a bit before we eat". Mia thought for a moment and then said, "Oh, okay". As she waited, Mia told her mom stories about her toys and sang her favorite songs. Finally, when the noise had died down, they headed towards the kitchen and sat down at the table and had a very yummy lunch.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. Amy had a pair of scissors that she loved very much. She used them to cut paper and make pretty shapes. One day, Amy saw a yummy cake on the table. She wanted to eat it.
Amy asked her mom, "Mom, can I have some yummy cake?" Her mom said, "Yes, but you must accept that you can't play with your scissors while you eat. Scissors can be dangerous."
Amy put her scissors away and sat down to eat the yummy cake. But then, something unexpected happened! A little mouse came out from behind the fridge and took a big bite of the cake. Amy was so surprised! She said, "Oh no, the mouse ate my cake!"
Her mom came into the room and saw the mouse. She said, "Don't worry, Amy. We can make another yummy cake together." Amy smiled and accepted that even though the mouse ate her cake, she could still have fun making a new one with her mom. And from that day on, Amy always made sure to keep her scissors away from her food.

Sara loves strawberries. She likes to pick them from the garden with her mom. She likes to eat them with cream and sugar. She likes to make them into jam and cake. But she does not like to bathe with them.
One day, Sara found a big basket of strawberries in the kitchen. She was very happy. She wanted to eat them all. But mom said, "No, Sara, you have to share. And you have to bathe first. You are very dirty from playing outside."
Sara did not want to share. And she did not want to bathe. She was very naughty. She took the basket and ran to her room. She locked the door. She ate some strawberries. They were very sweet and juicy. She ate some more. She ate and ate until the basket was empty. She was very full and happy.
But then she looked at herself. She was very messy. She had strawberry juice all over her face, her hands, her clothes, and her bed. She had strawberry seeds in her hair and on her teeth. She smelled like strawberries. She felt sticky and icky. She was not happy anymore.
She heard mom knocking on the door. She said, "Sara, open the door. It's time to bathe. I have a surprise for you." Sara felt sorry. She knew she was wrong. She opened the door. Mom was very patient. She did not scold Sara. She said, "Sara, you made a big mess. But I love you. Come on, let's bathe. I have something for you."
Sara followed mom to the bathroom. Mom filled the tub with warm water and bubbles. She helped Sara wash her face, her hands, her clothes, and her bed. She combed her hair and brushed her teeth.
