She made Sara clean and fresh. Sara felt better. She said, "Thank you, mom. I'm sorry I was naughty. I won't do it again."
Mom smiled and hugged Sara. She said, "You're welcome, Sara. I'm glad you're sorry. I have a surprise for you. Look!" She showed Sara a big bowl of strawberries with cream and sugar. She said, "These are for you. You can eat them after you bathe. But you have to share with me. OK?"
Sara was very happy. She said, "OK, mom. I love you. And I love strawberries. But not in the bath." She laughed. Mom laughed. They ate the strawberries together. They were very sweet and juicy. And they were very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little child. She liked to play outside in the sunshine. On this special day, she decided to go for a walk. As she walked, she could feel the gentle breeze. It made her feel so peaceful.
When she came to the park, she saw a beautiful lake. She stopped and watched the ducks swimming on the water. Suddenly, she heard a whistle! Someone was calling to her. She looked around and saw a bird sitting in a tree. The bird was singing a song and whistling a tune. The little child smiled and started to laugh.
The little child sat down and rested by the lake. She was so peaceful and happy. Suddenly, the bird flew down from the tree and perched on the child's shoulder. The bird sang and whistled for the child. The little girl was so happy! She laughed and grinned as the bird flew away.
The little girl went home feeling very peaceful. She had made a very special friend that day. And the bird's song and whistle stayed with her, in her heart.

Once upon a time there lived an old man called Jack who owned a beautiful forest. Jack loved walking through the trees and the animals who called the forest their home. 
One day Jack took his dog, Sam, to the forest. They were walking through the trees when they heard a loud noise. It sounded like somebody was calling out. "Help me, help me!" 
Jack and Sam ran towards the noise and to their surprise, they found a little 3 year old girl, alone in the forest. She was scared and asked, "Where is my mommy?" 
Jack reassured her, "Don't worry, little one. This is my forest, you're safe now."
He picked the girl up and with the help of Sam, took her home safely. Jack looked after her for the rest of the day. 
The next morning, the girl's parents came and thanked Jack for taking care of their daughter. Jack explained, "This is my forest, I own it and I had to make sure everybody was safe. You can trust me with your little girl whenever she wants to visit." 
The parents thanked Jack and the little girl hugged him before they all left. Jack was proud that he owned a forest and he was also glad to know that he could help others when needed.

Sam had a chubby bear called Gary. He loved Gary very much. One day, he wanted to share Gary with his friends. He asked his mum for help, and she gave him a big pin. Sam carefully stuck the pin through Gary's ear. When he was done, he proudly showed his friends. They all put on a pin just like Gary! Now, everyone can share his chubby bear. They were all very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a helpful ball named Bounce. Bounce loved to play with kids in the park. One sunny day, Bounce saw a little girl named Lily. Lily was sad because she had no friends to play with. Bounce wanted to make her happy.
Bounce rolled over to Lily and said, "Hi, I am Bounce! Do you want to play with me?" Lily smiled and said, "Yes, I would love to play with you!" So, they took turns bouncing and rolling around the park. Bounce would bounce high in the air, and then it was Lily's turn to bounce him.
As they played, other kids saw how much fun they were having. They came over and asked, "Can we play too?" Bounce and Lily said, "Yes, come join us!" Soon, all the kids were taking turns bouncing Bounce and having a great time.
Bounce was so happy to be helpful and make new friends. And Lily was happy too, because she now had many friends to play with. They all played together until the sun went down, and they promised to come back to the park to play again soon.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sara. She was very happy because she was going to receive a new toy. She told her mom, "I can't wait to see my new toy!"
Her mom smiled and said, "Soon, Sara. You will love it." Sara knew her mom was right. She was always right about these things. She felt excited and couldn't stop thinking about her new toy.
The next day, Sara got her new toy. It was a new board with lots of colors and shapes. Sara said, "Wow, this is the best toy ever! Thank you, Mom!" Sara played with her new board all day and had so much fun. She knew her mom was right all along.

Once upon a time, there was a charming little boy named Tim. Tim was very strong for his age. He had big muscles that he liked to show off to his friends. They all thought he was the strongest boy in the whole world.
One sunny day, Tim and his friends went to the park to play. They saw a big tree with a lot of leaves. Tim thought it would be fun to strike the tree with his hand. He wanted to show his friends how strong his muscles were.
Tim took a deep breath and struck the tree with all his might. The leaves on the tree shook and fell to the ground. His friends clapped and cheered for him. They all agreed that Tim was the strongest and most charming boy they knew. And from that day on, they played together happily in the park.

Once upon a time there was a boy named Jack. He wanted to go on an adventure. He looked around and found a beautiful landscape. It was a rough place, with big hills and deep valleys. He started exploring the area, but it was hard to stay in one place. He rolled down the big hills and liked the feeling of the wind in his hair. He kept going and going, until he came across a wide open field. He stayed there for a while and explored the area. He ran around and played games in the rough grass. Jack felt free and happy in this beautiful landscape. After a while, Jack realised it was time to go home. He said goodbye to the landscape and went back home, but he knew he would be back to explore it again soon.

Once upon a time, there was a poor little dog named Spot. Spot had no home, so he walked around the town. One day, he saw a big house with a nice yard. Spot thought, "Maybe they will welcome me and let me stay."
In the yard, Spot found a small, shiny pin. He picked it up with his mouth and carried it to the door. He knocked on the door, hoping someone would come out and be happy to see him. The door opened and a kind lady saw Spot with the pin.
"Thank you for bringing me this pin, Spot!" she said with a smile. The kind lady welcomed Spot into her home and gave him food and a warm bed. From that day on, Spot was no longer a poor little dog. He had a loving home and was very happy.

One day, a grumpy bear named Ben went to a picnic. He took some honey, fruits, and cookies with him. He was very excited to eat and play in the park.
While Ben was eating, a little girl named Lily came to play with him. She wanted to share her toys with Ben, but he was too grumpy to play. He just wanted to eat his honey and be alone.
Lily tried to make Ben laugh, but he did not want to. Then, she spilled some juice on Ben by accident. Ben felt embarrass and grumpy. But Lily said sorry and helped him clean up. Ben saw that Lily was nice and started to feel happy. They played together and had a fun picnic.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to a fair with his mom. There were many fun things to see and do. Tim saw a big display with lots of pretty balloons. He was very excited and wanted to get one.
"Mom, can I have a balloon?" Tim asked. His mom said yes, and they went to the display. Tim picked a big red balloon. He was very happy.
But then, a loud noise came from the sky. Tim was scared. He let go of his balloon by mistake. The balloon flew up, up, up into the sky. Tim cried and cried, but the balloon was gone forever.

Once upon a time, there was a sweet girl named Sue. She was very happy and she loved to sleep. She would sleep in her cozy bed on the soft side, with lots of blankets to make it warm.
One morning, Sue got out of bed feeling very happy. She looked out her window at the sun in the sky and it made her smile. She decided to go outside and play. She ran and laughed and tried to catch butterflies.
When the sun went down, Sue was tired. She was so happy that she had spent the day playing. She went back inside and snuggled into her bed. She fell asleep and had the sweetest dreams.
In the morning, Sue woke up feeling well-rested with a big smile. She was happy to start the day. She went outside again and spent the morning playing and exploring. 
At the end of the day, Sue was extra tired. She went back to her bed and quickly fell asleep on her cozy bedside. As she slept, she had happy dreams and felt nice and warm. And everyone lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He loved to play at the park. One day, he saw an unusual slide. It was very big and had a funny shape. Tim wanted to try the slide, but his mom said it might not be safe.
Tim did not listen to his mom. He climbed up the slide and slid down very fast. He felt scared, but he did not stop. When he reached the bottom, he fell off the slide and got hurt. His mom ran to help him.
The moral of the story is to listen to your parents when they say something is not safe. They know better and want to keep you from getting hurt. Tim learned his lesson and always listened to his mom after that day.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there was an adorable little dog named Max. Max loved to play with his friends, the children in the village. One day, Max found a shiny card on the ground. It was a license! Max did not know what it was, but he thought it was pretty.
Max showed the license to his friend, a wise old cat named Whiskers. Whiskers said, "I recommend you give this license back to its owner. They might need it." Max agreed and went on a journey to find the owner of the license.
As Max walked through the village, he asked everyone he met, "Is this your license?" Finally, Max met a kind lady who said, "Yes, that is my license! Thank you, Max!" Max was happy he could help and the lady gave Max a big hug. From that day on, Max and the kind lady became the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little rubber duck. Its name was Ducky. Ducky lived in a big tub with a lot of water. Ducky loved to play with the little boy who lived in the house. They would splash and laugh all day long.
One day, a new toy came to the tub. It was a big, angry shark. The shark scared Ducky and the little boy. They didn't want to play in the tub anymore. Ducky was sad and wanted to help the little boy.
Ducky had an idea. He went to the angry shark and asked, "Why are you angry?" The shark said, "I have no friends. I am all alone." Ducky felt sad for the shark. He said, "I will be your friend, and so will the little boy." The shark was happy. They all played together in the tub, and no one was angry anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a map. He wanted to find a big red ball. The map showed him where to go. Tim was very excited.
Tim began to step, step, step. He stepped over rocks and around trees. He saw a poor, sad cat. The cat was hungry. Tim said, "Don't worry, cat. I will help you find food." The cat meowed and followed Tim.
As they walked, Tim and the cat found the big red ball. They also found food for the poor cat. Tim and the cat played with the ball and ate together. They were very happy. From that day on, Tim and the cat were best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a smart cat named Tom. Tom lived in a small house with a big garden. He loved to play in the garden all day long.
One day, while Tom was playing in the garden, he saw a bird up in a tree. Tom wanted to be friends with the bird, so he called out, "Hello, bird! Let's play!" The bird looked down at Tom and said, "Okay, let's play together!"
Tom and the bird played in the garden every day. They had so much fun together, and they became the best of friends. And that is how the smart cat and the bird became friends in the big garden.

One day, a dog named Spot went for a walk. Spot was a very brave dog and he would always dare to do new things. Today, he saw a big hill and dared to climb it. Spot was excited to see what was on the other side of the hill.
As Spot climbed the hill, he started to feel frustrated. The hill was very steep and it was hard for him to climb. But Spot did not give up. He kept going until he reached the top. When he got to the top, he saw a big surprise.
Instead of finding more hills or a big field, Spot found a big party just for him! All his friends were there, and they had food, toys, and games. They all cheered for Spot because he dared to climb the hill. Spot was so happy and had the best day ever.

One day, a little girl named Lily wanted to wear her favorite dress. It was a pretty dress with lots of colors. Lily loved to spin and zoom around in it. But today, she could not find the dress. She looked in her room, under her bed, and in her closet, but the dress was not there. Lily felt sad.
Lily asked her mom for help. Her mom said, "Maybe your dress is in the laundry." They went to the laundry room and found the dress. It was wet and dirty. Lily's mom said, "We need to wash the dress first." Lily did not like to wait, but she knew her mom was right.
While they waited for the dress to dry, Lily's mom made a yummy snack. They had apples and peanut butter. Lily loved the snack and forgot about her dress for a little while. When the dress was dry, Lily put it on and started to zoom around the house. She was happy again, and her mom was happy to see her smile.

Once upon a time, there was a dolphin who was very persistent. She loved to drive around the ocean, going on different adventures!
She would drive around for hours, playing with her friends and exploring all the different places on the bottom of the ocean. Everyone would have lots of fun and then take a rest before heading off again.
One day, she was driving her friends around when she noticed something very special. She saw a mermaid and waved to her! The mermaid said hello and everyone was so excited.
The dolphin was very persistent and asked the mermaid to come with them on their journey. The mermaid said yes and soon enough, they were all having a great time swimming and playing together.
They swam and played until it was time to go home. The dolphin thanked the mermaid and waved goodbye as they parted ways. 
The dolphin was very proud of herself and the fun times she had shared with her friends on their adventures. She knew that being persistent was the best way to make new friends!

Once upon a time, there was a pretty girl named Lily. She lived in a small house with her cat, Max. Lily liked to play in her garden with Max. One day, she found a shiny sword in the garden. She picked it up and showed it to Max.
"Look, Max! I found a sword," said Lily. Max looked at the sword and thought it was attractive. Lily and Max decided to remain in the garden and play with the sword. They pretended to be knights and fought imaginary dragons.
As they played, a little boy named Tom saw them. He asked, "Can I play with you?" Lily said, "Yes, you can be a knight too!" So, Lily, Max, and Tom played together all day. They had lots of fun with the sword and became great friends.

Tom and Mia were playing in the garden. They liked to dig in the dirt and look for bugs. They had a big chest where they kept their toys and tools. Sometimes they pretended the chest was a treasure box or a spaceship.
One day, they heard a loud noise. They looked up and saw a big truck arrive. The truck had a picture of a dog on it. The driver got out and opened the back of the truck. He took out a big cage with a small dog inside.
"Hello, kids," the driver said. "I have a delivery for you. This is your new friend, Spot. He is a very calm and friendly dog. Do you want to meet him?"
Tom and Mia nodded. They ran to the cage and looked at the dog. He had brown fur and black spots. He wagged his tail and licked their hands. They liked him right away.
"Can we play with him?" Tom asked.
"Sure, but first you have to open the chest," the driver said. "There is a surprise for you inside."
Tom and Mia ran to the chest and opened it. They found a leash, a collar, a bowl, and some toys for Spot. They were very happy.
"Thank you, thank you!" they said to the driver.
"You're welcome," the driver said. "Have fun with Spot. He is a very good dog. He will make you happy."
Tom and Mia put the collar and the leash on Spot. They filled the bowl with water and gave him a toy. They played with him in the garden. They hugged him and kissed him. They loved him very much. Spot was their new best friend.

Once upon a time, there was a big, hungry cat named Tom. Tom lived in a small house with his best friend, a little, happy girl named Sue. Sue loved Tom very much and they always played together.
One Wednesday, Sue and Tom went to the park to play. They saw many kids and animals there. They all wanted to play, but they didn't know how to play together. Sue had an idea. She said, "Let's unite and play a big game of hide and seek!" All the kids and animals agreed and started to play.
As they played together, they all became friends. The big, hungry cat shared his food with the other animals, and they all shared their toys with each other. At the end of the day, everyone was happy and had a lot of fun. The moral of the story is that when we unite and work together, we can all be happy and have fun.

Once upon a time, there was a unique little mouse named Mimi. Mimi loved to run and play with her friends in the big green park. One sunny day, Mimi and her friends were having lots of fun running around and playing games.
As they were playing, Mimi met a new friend named Tommy. Tommy was a big, fluffy cat. Mimi said, "Hi, I am Mimi. Do you want to play with us?" Tommy smiled and said, "Yes, I would love to play with you!"
Mimi, Tommy, and their friends played all day long. They ran, jumped, and laughed together. The unique little mouse and her new friend had the best day ever. And from that day on, Mimi and Tommy were always together, running and playing in the big green park.

One day, a cat and a dog were playing. They were best friends. They liked to discuss what they did every day. Today, they were talking about going to the park.
At the park, they saw a big tree. They wanted to climb it. The cat went up first. The dog tried to go up too, but he was too big. The cat was at the top of the tree and saw a bird. The cat wanted to catch the bird.
The cat jumped at the bird, but the bird flew away. The cat was in shock and fell from the tree. The dog saw this and was very sorry. The cat was hurt and could not play anymore. The dog was sad because his friend was hurt and they could not play together again.

Once upon a time, there was a naughty dog named Spot. Spot liked to play and run all day. One day, Spot saw a sign near his home. The sign said, "Please do not play on the grass." But Spot did not value the sign and played on the grass anyway.
A little girl named Sue saw Spot playing on the grass. She said, "Spot, you should not play there. The sign says no playing on the grass." But Spot did not listen and kept playing.
Suddenly, the grass turned into a big hole, and Spot fell in. Sue was sad and said, "I told you to not play on the grass." Spot was stuck in the hole, and no one could help him out. Spot learned the hard way to value signs and listen to his friends.

Once upon a time, in a peaceful house, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue had a pretty bedroom with a big bed and lots of toys. She loved to play in her bedroom all day.
One day, Sue and her friend Tom were playing in her bedroom. They were having so much fun! But then, they had a fight over a toy. Tom said, "This is my toy!" Sue said, "No, it's mine!" They were very mad at each other.
Sue's mom came into the bedroom and saw them fighting. She said, "You both need to forgive each other and be friends again." Sue and Tom looked at each other and said, "I forgive you." They hugged and started to play together again. They were happy and the peaceful bedroom was full of laughter once more.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Tim wanted to go camping. He had a small tent and was ready to sleep in it. He asked his mom if he could put the tent in the yard. His mom said yes, and Tim was so happy.
Tim set up the tent all by himself. He put his favorite toys and a soft blanket inside. When it was time for bed, he went into the tent and fell asleep. But during the night, it started to rain. The tent was not good in the rain, and water came inside.
Tim woke up and saw the water in his tent. He was sad and cold. He suffered because his toys and blanket were wet too. Tim ran back into the house and told his mom. She hugged him and said they would try again another day. But for now, Tim had to sleep in his wet tent, and he was not happy.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a restless little boy named Tom. Tom loved to play with his toys all day long. But one day, he found a video in a box under his bed. Tom didn't know where the video came from or who it belonged to. He was very curious.
Tom went to his mom and asked, "Mom, who does this video belong to?" His mom looked at the video and smiled. "This video belongs to your dad," she said. "It is a funny video of him when he was a little boy, just like you."
Tom's eyes grew wide with excitement. "Can we watch the video, please?" he asked. His mom nodded and they put the video in the player. As they watched, Tom and his mom laughed and laughed at the funny things Tom's dad did in the video. Tom felt happy to see his dad as a little boy.
After they finished watching the video, Tom's mom said, "Now you know where your restless energy comes from. Just like your dad, you love to play and have fun." Tom hugged his mom and went back to playing with his toys, feeling proud that he was just like his dad. And from that day on, Tom knew that the video belonged to his family and held special memories.

One day, a little girl named Sue went for a walk. She saw a big temple. She wanted to go in and look around. So, she walked to the temple door and went inside.
Inside the temple, Sue found a big, sour fruit. She picked it up and tried to stretch it. When she stretched the fruit, something unexpected happened. It turned into a cute, little dog! The dog wagged its tail and licked Sue's face.
Sue and the dog became best friends. They played all day in the temple. At the end of the day, they went back to Sue's house. They had lots of fun together and lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, in a beautiful forest, there lived a little bunny named Binky. Binky loved to run and play with his friends. One sunny day, Binky and his friends were playing hide and seek.
Binky's friend, Squirrel, said, "Let's hide by the big tree near the shelter!" Binky and Squirrel ran to the big tree and hid behind it. They could see the shelter from where they were hiding. The shelter was a safe place for all the animals in the forest.
As they were hiding, Binky saw dark clouds coming. "Oh no! Rain is coming! We need to go to the shelter," Binky said to Squirrel. They ran as fast as they could to the shelter. All their friends were already there, safe and dry.
Binky and Squirrel were happy they knew where the shelter was. They stayed there until the rain stopped. Then, they went back to playing with their friends in the beautiful forest.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a happy boy who loved to play outside. One day, Tim went outside to play with his friends at noon. The sun was very bright, and it was a little harsh on Tim's skin.
As Tim played, he saw a small cat. The cat looked sad and had a frown on its face. Tim wanted to help the cat feel better. He thought that maybe the cat was thirsty, so he ran inside his house and got a bowl of water for the cat.
Tim put the bowl of water down for the cat, and the cat drank it all up. The cat's frown turned into a big, happy smile. Tim felt happy too, because he had helped the cat. They played together in the sun until it was time to go inside. And from that day on, Tim and the cat became the best of friends.

The lady was furry. She had a big coat made of soft fur. One day she was walking in the park. Suddenly, a big tree started to shake. She was scared and started to move away. Then she saw a black and white animal coming out of the tree. It was a bear! The lady was so surprised that she started to shake too. The bear saw her and ran away. The lady laughed and felt much better. She knew that the big, furry animal was going to keep her safe.

Once upon a time, there was a tall flower who wanted to bake a cake. She was so excited to find some ingredients and start baking.
The flower went looking for the things she needed. Finally, she found some eggs, flour, and butter. She carefully measured out the ingredients and started to mix them together.
While the flower was mixing, she heard a voice. It was a little girl who said, "Can I help you bake your cake?"
The flower said, "Yes, you can help me." So the little girl started to mix the ingredients too.
But soon, something went terribly wrong. The flower realised that the little girl had added too much flour. The cake was ruined.
The flower was so disappointed. She shouted at the little girl, making her cry. The flower had to start all over again, and she never got help from the little girl again.
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little fish named Fin. Fin lived in the sea. The sea was big and blue. Fin had many friends in the sea. They liked to swim and play together.
One day, Fin felt weak. He could not swim fast like his friends. Fin's friends did not want to delay their playtime. They swam away and left Fin behind. Fin was sad.
Fin's mom saw that he was weak and sad. She gave him some food to eat. Fin ate the food and felt better. He swam fast to catch up with his friends. They were happy to see him and played together again.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim had a generous mom who made him a big lunch every day. Tim loved his lunch and was very happy.
One day, Tim's mom cut up some fruit for his lunch. She put the fruit in a box. Tim took the box to school. When it was time to eat, Tim opened his box and saw something unexpected. All the fruit was gone, and there were cookies instead!
Tim was surprised but happy. He ate the cookies and shared them with his friends. Later, Tim found out that his mom had put the fruit in his sister's lunch by mistake. But Tim didn't mind because he loved the cookies and had a fun lunch with his friends.

One day, a cheerful whale named Wally lived in the big sea. Wally loved to play with his fish friends. They would swim and jump in the water all day long.
One day, Wally met a little girl named Sally. Sally was on a boat with her mom and dad. She saw Wally and said, "Hi, big whale! Do you want to play with me?" Wally jumped out of the water and splashed Sally. She laughed and clapped her hands.
Sally told Wally, "I believe you can jump very high!" Wally was happy and wanted to show Sally how high he could jump. So, he swam fast and jumped high in the air. Sally and her mom and dad were so amazed. They all clapped and cheered for Wally. From that day on, Wally and Sally were the best of friends.

One day, a little girl named Mia went to a festival with her mom and dad. There were many fun things to do at the festival. There were games, food, and rides. Mia was very excited to play and have fun. But her mom told her, "Stay close to us, Mia, so you don't get lost."
Mia saw a big ride that went round and round. It looked fun, but it also made her feel dizzy just by looking at it. She wanted to go on the ride, but she was a little scared. Her dad said, "If you feel dizzy, we will stop the ride and get off."
They went on the ride together. At first, Mia had fun. But soon, she started to feel dizzy. She remembered what her dad said, so she told him she wanted to get off. They stopped the ride and got off. Mia was happy that she tried the ride, but she was also happy to be off it.
After the ride, Mia stayed close to her mom and dad, just like they told her. They played games and ate yummy food. Mia had a great time at the festival with her family. She knew that staying close to her mom and dad made the day even better.

Once upon a time, there was a chubby cat named Tom. Tom liked to play with his ball and run in the garden. One day, Tom found a mystery box in the garden. He wanted to know what was inside the box.
Tom tried to open the box, but it was very hard. He asked his friend, a big dog named Max, to help him. Max and Tom worked together to open the mystery box. They wanted to save whatever was inside.
When they opened the box, they found a big cake. Tom and Max were very happy. They ate the cake very fast. But, the cake was not good. It made them feel sick. In the end, Tom and Max learned they should not eat things they find in mystery boxes.

Once upon a time, there was a small boy named Kid. He was only three years old and he loved candy. One day Kid was walking in the park when he saw an old man waving his hand. Kid thought that was funny so he waved back.
The old man then asked Kid, "Would you like some candy?" He held out a big bag of candy towards Kid.
"Yes please!" Kid said. He reached in and grabbed a piece of candy and smiled. He was so happy!
The old man then said, "Be careful Kid, it's very weak!"
Kid nodded and thanked the old man. He felt so lucky to have such a friendly old man share his candy with him. Together, they both waved goodbye and Kid went home with his candy.

Once upon a time, there was a brave little dog named Max. Max had a big paw that he liked to use to help his friends. One day, Max and his friends went to play in the park.
While they were playing, Max's friend, a small cat named Lily, got very tired. She needed to lie down and rest. Max saw her and wanted to help. He used his big paw to make a soft bed of leaves for Lily to lie on.
Lily was very happy and thanked Max for being so brave and kind. Max felt proud of his big paw and was glad he could help his friend. From that day on, Max and Lily became best friends and always played together in the park.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mandy. Mandy was three years old and very proud of herself. She liked to show her parents what she had learned.
One day she proudly told her mom that she had learned to count up to ten. Her mom smiled and said "That's great Mandy! Can you show me?"
Mandy began to count one, two, three and so on. After she had finished counting to ten, her mom looked up at the ceiling and said "That was wonderful Mandy! You should be very proud of yourself."
Mandy was happy and she beamed with pride. Her mom had taught her a very important lesson: no matter how small, it is important to be proud of all your achievements. Mandy would never forget this lesson, no matter how old she got.

Once upon a time, there was a powerful bird named Bob. He loved to balance on one foot. One day, he saw a big tree and wanted to balance on its branch. So, he flew to the tree and landed on the branch.
As Bob balanced on the branch, he felt a rub on his back. "Who is it?" he asked. A little bug named Tim said, "Hi, I am Tim. I saw you balance and wanted to try too." Bob and Tim became friends and balanced together on the branch.
One day, while they were balancing, a strong wind came. Bob and Tim held on tight, but the wind was too strong. The wind blew them to a new place they had never seen before. It was a beautiful land with many new friends to meet. They both said, "Wow, this is fun!" And they lived happily ever after, making new friends and balancing together.

Sara loved flowers. She liked to smell them, touch them, and look at their colors. She had a book with pictures of many flowers. She kept the book on her shelf in her room.
One day, her mom took her to a big store. There were many things in the store. Some were toys, some were clothes, some were books. Sara saw a corner with many flowers. They were in pots and vases. They were very pretty.
"Mom, can we buy a flower?" Sara asked.
"Sure, honey. You can choose one flower. But not a very expensive one. Some flowers are very expensive. They cost a lot of money," her mom said.
Sara looked at the flowers. She saw a big red flower. It had many petals. It looked like a star. She liked it very much.
"Mom, I want this one. It is so beautiful. It looks like a star," Sara said.
Her mom looked at the price tag. It said $20. That was a lot of money for a flower.
"Oh, Sara. That flower is very expensive. It is too much for us. Can you choose another one? Maybe a smaller one, or a different color?" her mom said.
Sara felt sad. She really wanted the star flower. She did not like the other flowers. They were not as pretty.
"But mom, I love this flower. It is the best flower. Please, please, can we buy it?" Sara begged.
Her mom sighed. She wanted to make Sara happy. But she also had to be careful with money. She had an idea.
"How about this, Sara. We can buy a seed. A seed is a small thing that can grow into a flower. We can plant it in a pot at home. And we can water it and take care of it. And one day, it will bloom. It will become a flower. Maybe even a star flower. What do you think?" her mom said.
Sara thought about it. She liked the idea of growing a flower. She liked the idea of watching it bloom. She liked the idea of having a star flower.
"OK, mom. Let's buy a seed. And let's plant it in a pot. And let's water it and take care of it. And let's wait for it to bloom. And let's hope it is a star flower," Sara said.
Her mom smiled. She hugged Sara. She bought a seed for $1. They went home. They planted the seed in a pot. They put the pot on the shelf in Sara's room. They watered it and took care of it. And they waited for it to bloom. And they hoped it was a star flower.

Once upon a time, in a small house, lived a girl named Lily. She loved to pack her bag and go to the park for exercise. One sunny day, she put on her comfortable shoes and went outside.
In the park, Lily met her friend Tim. Tim was sitting on the grass. "Hi, Lily!" said Tim. "What are you doing?" Lily smiled and said, "I am here to exercise. I packed my bag with a ball and a jump rope. Do you want to play with me?" Tim nodded and said, "Yes, I want to play too!"
Lily and Tim played with the ball and jumped rope. They laughed and had fun. After a while, they were tired but happy. They sat down on the comfortable grass, and Lily shared her water with Tim. They talked and enjoyed the sun. It was a great day at the park.

One day, Susie was looking for something to do. She decided to play in the garden. She ran happily around, picking up colorful flowers. She held a pink one tightly in her hand. 
Suddenly, she slipped on some wet soil. She landed with a loud thump! Her pink flower flew out of her hand, up into the air. When it touched the ground, it was covered in mud. 
Susie was sad until her mommy came outside and hugged her. She told Susie that it was okay and gave her a new, clean pink flower while she wiped the mud off the old one.
Susie felt much better. Together, they went into the house and found other fun things to do.
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a soft bunny named Bella. Bella lived in a small hole near a big tree. She had many friends in the forest. She liked to play and run with them.
One hot day, Bella and her friend, a squirrel named Sam, decided to race to the top of the hill. They started running fast. But, the heat was too much for Bella. She felt very tired. So, Bella said to Sam, "I quit! The heat is too much for me." Sam stopped running too. He agreed with Bella.
They both went under the big tree to rest. Bella and Sam sat on the soft grass and talked. They had a fun time, even though they did not finish the race. They learned that it was okay to quit when it was too hot or too hard. They played together every day, and they were happy.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a boy named Tim. Tim was an independent boy who liked to do things on his own. One day, his mom gave him a plate of food with broccoli on it. Tim didn't like broccoli, but he wanted to be a big boy and eat it all.
Tim tried to eat the broccoli, but it was hard for him. He wanted to cry, but he remembered that big boys don't cry. So, he tried to comfort himself by thinking about his toys and games. He took a deep breath and tried again to eat the broccoli.
But as Tim tried to eat the broccoli, he started to feel very bad. He didn't want to eat it anymore, but he didn't tell his mom. Instead, he kept eating it, even though it made him feel sick. In the end, Tim got very sick because he didn't tell his mom how he felt. The moral of the story is that it's important to tell someone when something is wrong, even if you want to be independent.

One day, a little girl named Lucy went for a walk with her mom. They saw a big tree with rough texture. Lucy touched the tree and said, "Mom, the tree feels bumpy."
Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, Lucy, you understand the tree is not smooth." They kept walking and saw a dog. The dog was spinning around and around.
Lucy laughed and said, "Mom, the dog looks dizzy!" Her mom said, "Yes, the dog is playing and having fun. But if we spin too much, we can also feel dizzy."
They walked more and saw a pretty flower. Lucy touched it and said, "Mom, this flower feels soft." Her mom said, "Good job, Lucy! You understand the different textures of things around you."
Lucy was happy that she could understand and learn new things with her mom.

One day, a little boy named Tim saw a big aeroplane in the sky. He did not recognize it. He was worried. He ran to his mom and said, "Mom, what is that?"
His mom looked up and smiled. "That is an aeroplane, Tim. It takes people far away to visit new places."
Tim was not worried anymore. He wanted to go on the aeroplane too. He asked his mom, "Can we go on the aeroplane one day?"
His mom hugged him and said, "Yes, Tim. One day we will go on the aeroplane together and see new places."
Tim was very happy. He waved at the aeroplane and said, "Bye-bye, aeroplane! See you soon!"

Once upon a time, there was a small town. In the town, there was a big tree. The tree had many leaves. Some of the leaves were green, and some were red.
One day, a deaf dog named Spot came to the town. Spot could not hear, but he liked to play. He saw the big tree and wanted to play near it. Spot was running and jumping under the tree.
As Spot played, the wind blew. The leaves started to fall from the tree. Spot saw the leaves falling and tried to catch them. He had so much fun. All the kids in the town came to play with Spot and the falling leaves. They all laughed and played together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia loved animals very much. One day, her mom took her to the zoo. Mia was so happy!
At the zoo, Mia saw many animals. She saw big lions, tall giraffes, and funny monkeys. Mia's favorite animal was the little elephant. She looked at the elephant and said, "Hello, little elephant! I like you!" The little elephant looked at Mia and smiled.
When it was time to go home, Mia was sad. She did not want to leave her new friend. But her mom said, "Don't worry, Mia. We can come back to the zoo another day." Mia smiled and said, "Okay, Mommy. I will remember the little elephant and all the animals." And Mia never forgot her fun day at the zoo.

One day, a little boy named Tom found a twig in the park. He wanted to bury it in the sand. He asked his friend, Sam, "Can you help me bury this twig?"
Sam said, "Yes, I can help you." They looked for a spot to bury the twig. They found a place where no other twigs were available. They dug a little hole with their hands and put the twig inside. Then, they covered it with sand.
Later, Tom and Sam came back to see the twig. They dug it up and saw that it was still there. They were happy that they had buried the twig together. They took the twig and went to play with their friends.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a friendly fountain. The fountain was very pretty. All the kids loved to play near the fountain. They would splash and laugh all day.
One day, a little boy named Tim was playing with his ball near the fountain. He threw the ball high up in the air. But the ball split in two! Tim was sad, and he did not know what to do.
Just then, something unexpected happened. The friendly fountain started to talk! It said, "Don't be sad, Tim. I can help you." The fountain splashed water on the broken ball, and it became whole again. Tim was so happy, and he played with the ball and the fountain all day long.

One day, a gentle cat named Tom found a brush. He liked to brush his soft fur. He brushed and brushed all day. Tom was very happy with his new brush.
One day, Tom saw a big car. It went "zoom!" Tom thought it was fun. He wanted to go "zoom" too. So, Tom jumped on the car. The car went "zoom" and Tom's brush fell off. Tom was sad.
But then, something unexpected happened. The car stopped and a little girl came out. She saw Tom's brush and gave it back to him. Tom was so happy! He went back home and brushed his fur again. From that day on, Tom and the little girl were best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a team of animals who lived in a light, happy forest. They were best friends and played together every day. Their team had a big elephant, a tiny mouse, a fast rabbit, and a slow turtle. They loved to race each other and have fun.
One sunny day, the team decided to split into two groups for a race. The elephant and the mouse were in one group, while the rabbit and the turtle were in the other group. They all stood at the starting line, ready to race. The rabbit said, "Ready, set, go!" And they all started running.
The elephant and the mouse ran as fast as they could, but the rabbit and the turtle were faster. The rabbit and the turtle crossed the finish line first, and they all cheered. The team came back together and said, "We had so much fun! Let's race again tomorrow!" And they all agreed, excited for the next day's race.

Once upon a time, there was an intelligent girl named Amy. She had a big mixer. Amy loved to make cake with the mixer. She smiled every time she made a cake. She was very happy.
One day, Amy made a cake for her friends. She used her mixer to make the cake. But, she forgot to put sugar in the cake. She was sad. Her friends did not like the cake. They did not smile.
Amy thought about what to do. She had an idea. She put sugar on the cake. Her friends tried the cake again. They smiled! They loved the cake now. Amy felt happy. She learned that it is good to fix mistakes.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a lucky flag. He loved his flag very much. Every day, he would take it outside to watch and play.
One day, Tim went to the park with his flag. He was playing and having fun. He put his flag down for a bit to play with his ball. Tim did not see a big dog come to the park. The big dog saw Tim's lucky flag and took it in his mouth.
Tim saw the big dog with his flag and was sad. But then, something fun happened. The big dog wanted to play with Tim and his flag. Tim played with the big dog and they became friends. Tim was happy because he got his flag back and made a new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a nosy little fish named Fin. He loved to swim around and see what his friends were doing. One day, while swimming, he saw a big shark named Spike. Fin was not scared, but he knew he had to be careful.
Fin saw that the shark was sad, so he swam closer to talk to him. "Why are you sad, Spike?" asked Fin. Spike said, "I am sad because I have no friends. Everyone is scared of me." Fin felt bad for Spike and decided to help him.
Fin talked to his friends and told them that Spike was not a bad shark. He just wanted to be friends with everyone. Slowly, the number of Spike's friends began to increase. Spike was happy and thanked Fin for helping him. From that day on, Fin and Spike became best friends and swam together in the big blue sea.

Once upon a time, there was a little brown dog named Buddy. Buddy loved to play at the park. Every day, he would run and jump with his friends. They had so much fun together.
One day, while Buddy was at the park, he saw a big cabinet. It was a very big cabinet. Buddy was curious and wanted to see what was inside. He opened the cabinet door with his nose.
Inside the cabinet, Buddy found a big pile of toys! There were balls, ropes, and even a bone. It was a special cabinet just for dogs to play with at the park. Buddy and his friends played with the toys all day long. They were so happy to find the cabinet at the park.

One day, a boy named Tim found a microscope in a box. He did not know what it was. He showed it to his mom. "Mom, what is this?" he asked.
His mom said, "This is a microscope, Tim. It helps you see very small things." Tim wanted to try it. But the microscope was very dirty. So, Tim took a cloth and started to wipe it. He wiped it until it was clean.
Tim looked through the microscope and saw a tiny bug. The bug was not moving. Tim asked his mom again, "Mom, why is the bug not moving?" His mom said, "The bug is dead, Tim. That means it is not alive anymore."
Tim felt sad for the bug. He wanted to see more things with the microscope. So, he went outside and looked at many small things. He saw tiny rocks, small leaves, and even little ants. Tim loved his new microscope.

One day, a little boy named Tim wandered far from his house. He walked and walked until he found a big tree. Under the tree, he saw something. It was an old wallet. The wallet looked very ancient.
Tim picked up the wallet and opened it. Inside, he found a map. The map showed a way to a hidden place. Tim was excited and said, "I will find this place!"
Tim followed the map and walked and walked. The sun was hot, but he kept going. Finally, he found a big rock. Behind the rock, there was a secret door. Tim opened the door and went inside.
In the secret place, Tim found a box. He opened the box and saw many fun toys! He played and played, and then he said, "I will take these toys home and share them with my friends!"
Tim took the toys home and shared them with his friends. They all played and had fun together. The ancient wallet with the map had led Tim to a great treasure.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to play with her toy jewelry. She had a necklace, a bracelet, and a ring. One day, her mom told her, "Lily, if you are obedient and do your chores, I will pay you with a new toy."
Lily was excited and did all her chores. She cleaned her room, put away her toys, and helped her mom in the garden. After she finished, her mom said, "Good job, Lily! You were very obedient. Now, let's go to the store and pay for your new toy."
At the store, Lily saw a beautiful jewelry box. She wanted it so much! But then, she saw a little boy crying. The boy said, "I lost my toy and I don't have money to pay for a new one." Lily felt sad for the boy. She thought for a moment and then said, "Here, take my money. You can pay for a new toy."
The boy was so happy and thanked Lily. Then, something unexpected happened. The store owner saw what Lily did and said, "That was very kind, Lily. I have a gift for you." He gave Lily the jewelry box she wanted. Lily was so happy and learned that being kind and sharing can bring happiness to everyone.

One day, a little boy named Tim went for a walk in the woods. He saw a big mushroom on the ground. Tim was very careless and stepped on it. The mushroom broke into many pieces. Tim felt sad.
A tiny bug came out from behind a tree. The bug said, "Oh no! You broke my mushroom house!" Tim was surprised that the bug could talk. He wanted to help the bug fix his house.
Tim said, "I'm sorry, I didn't see your house. I will help you fix it." The bug thought for a moment and said, "If we can find a way to reverse what you did, my house will be okay again."
They looked around and found a magic stick. Tim waved the stick over the broken mushroom. The mushroom pieces came together and the house was fixed. The bug was very happy.
From that day on, Tim was more careful when he walked in the woods. He and the bug became good friends and had many fun adventures together.

Once upon a time, there was a little puppy named Spot. Spot loved to play outside in the sun. One day, Spot saw a big pile of leaves. He ran and jumped into the leaves. The leaves scatter all around him. Spot thought it was very fun.
Spot's mommy called out, "Spot, come here, please!" Spot ran back to his mommy. She said, "You need to stay close to me, so you are safe." Spot nodded and promised to stay close to her.
Later, Spot and his mommy went for a walk. They saw a butterfly and chased it together. Spot stayed close to his mommy, just like he promised. They played and laughed until it was time to go home. Spot was happy because he had fun and stayed safe with his mommy.

Once upon a time, there was a big building in the middle of the town. It was a happy building where many people lived. But one day, the building felt sad. It didn't know why it was sad, but it just felt that way.
In the town, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to play outside in the spring. She saw the sad building and wanted to help. She thought, "What can I do to make the building happy again?"
Lily had an idea. She picked pretty flowers and put them all around the building. The building started to feel happy again. The people inside the building saw the flowers and smiled. They all came outside and played with Lily in the spring sun. And from that day on, the building was never sad again.

Once upon a time, there was a brave knight who was very tired. He had been riding all day, so he decided to take a break and rest. 
He galloped his horse over to a spot under a big tree. As he looked around he could see a beautiful sword glinting in the sunshine. Excitedly, the knight jumped off his horse, grabbed the sword and narrowed his eyes.
"What did I find?" he asked himself. 
He looked closer and he saw that there was a special liquid pouring from the sword. It was golden and sparkled in the sunlight. The knight had never seen anything like it. 
He leaned downstream and said, "I think I need to pour this onto something special."
So, he ran back to his horse, put the sword in a special place and with a twinkle in his eye said to himself, "Now I know what I have to do". He was ready for his next adventure!

Once upon a time, there was a grumpy old frog named Fred. Fred lived in a cold pond with many fish friends. One day, a little girl named Amy came to the pond.
Fred blinked his big eyes and said, "Hi, Amy. Why are you here?" Amy looked at Fred and said, "I am sad, Fred. I want to play, but I have no friends."
Fred felt bad for Amy. He thought for a moment and then said, "I have an idea. Let's have a big pond party! All the fish can play with you." Amy smiled and said, "That sounds fun!"
So, Fred and Amy invited all the fish to the party. They played games, and everyone had a great time. Even the grumpy old frog Fred was happy. And from that day on, Amy was never sad again.

One day, a chubby cat named Tom went for a walk. He saw a big tree and thought it would be fun to climb. As he climbed the tree, he saw a little bird sitting on a branch. Tom said, "Hi, bird! I am Tom. Do you want to play with me?"
The little bird, named Sue, said, "Yes, I want to play, Tom. But look, it is starting to rain. We should go under the tree to stay dry." So, Tom and Sue went under the tree and waited for the rain to stop.
While they were waiting, they heard a noise. It was a big dog named Max! Max was wet from the rain and wanted to play too. Tom and Sue were scared at first, but then they saw that Max was not mean. They all played together under the tree, and became best friends.

Anna and Ben are playing doctor and patient in the garden. Anna has a toy stethoscope and Ben has a bandage on his arm.
"Hello, patient Ben. I am doctor Anna. How are you feeling today?" Anna asks.
"I am feeling ouchy. I fell down from the slide and hurt my arm. It is red and sore," Ben says.
"Oh, no. That is not good. You are very clumsy, patient Ben. You need to be careful when you play. Let me check your arm with my stethoscope," Anna says.
She puts the stethoscope on Ben's arm and listens. She makes a serious face.
"Hmm, I hear something. It sounds like a beep beep beep. Do you know what that is, patient Ben?" Anna asks.
Ben shakes his head. He does not know what a beep beep beep is.
"That is your heart, patient Ben. It is beating very fast. You are scared of the doctor, aren't you?" Anna says.
Ben nods. He is scared of the doctor. He does not like needles and medicine.
"Don't worry, patient Ben. I am a nice doctor. I will not hurt you. I will just give you a sticker and a hug. And you will feel better soon," Anna says.
She peels off a sticker from a sheet and puts it on Ben's bandage. It is a sticker of a dinosaur. Ben likes dinosaurs. He smiles.
"Thank you, doctor Anna. You are a good doctor. I like your sticker. It is cool," Ben says.
"You are welcome, patient Ben. You are a brave patient. I like your smile. It is cute," Anna says.
They hug each other. They are happy.
"Can I mention something, doctor Anna?" Ben asks.
"Sure, patient Ben. What do you want to mention?" Anna asks.
"Can we play something else now? I don't want to be a patient anymore. I want to be a pirate. Arrr!" Ben says.
Anna laughs. She likes pirates too.
"Okay, patient Ben. Let's play pirates. But be careful. Don't fall down again. Or you will need another sticker and a hug," Anna says.
They run to the sandbox and pretend to sail a ship. They have fun. They are friends.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a pencil on the floor. He picked it up and felt anxious. He did not know what to do with the pencil. He thought about it and decided to ask his friend, Sally.
"Hey Sally, I found this pencil. What do I do with it?" Tim asked. Sally smiled and said, "You can draw with it, Tim!" Tim got excited and started to draw a picture of a cat.
As Tim was drawing, something unexpected happened. The pencil began to reverse his drawing! The cat he drew started to disappear. Tim was confused and called Sally to show her.
Sally looked at the paper and said, "Wow, that's a magic pencil, Tim! It can reverse your drawing." They both laughed and decided to have fun with the magic pencil all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved dessert more than anything. His favorite dessert was ice cream. One day, Tim saw a big ice cream shop. He was so happy.
In the shop, there were many kinds of ice cream. But Tim's mom said, "You can't have ice cream today. You need to eat healthy food first." Tim was sad and let out a big sigh. He did not want to eat healthy food. He just wanted ice cream.
Tim was very mad. He did not listen to his mom. He took the ice cream and ran away. But he slipped and fell. His ice cream fell on the ground too. Tim cried and his mom was not happy. Tim learned that he should listen to his mom and eat healthy food before having dessert.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Zoe. Zoe was anxious because she forgot where her key was. 
Suddenly, Zoe saw her friend Claire, who was very excited. 
Zoe asked Claire what was going on and Claire said, "I have a key to unlock a secret box and I'm going to celebrate when I open it." 
Zoe was so excited and said, "Can I join you to celebrate when you open the box?" 
Claire said, "Yes, of course. Let's celebrate when I open the box." 
So the two friends celebrated with a big hug when Claire opened the box and found a surprise inside. It was the best celebration ever!

Once upon a time, there was a little ball that loved to bounce. One day, the ball went to a camp with its friends. The camp was full of fun things to do, like playing games and singing songs.
At the camp, the ball met a spicy pepper. The spicy pepper liked to bounce too. They became good friends and played together all day. They bounced high and low, and even raced each other to see who could bounce the fastest.
As the sun set, the ball and the spicy pepper said goodbye to their new friends at the camp. They promised to come back and play again soon. The ball and the spicy pepper went home, happy and tired from their fun day at camp.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim lived near a big river. He liked to play near the river with his friends.
One day, Tim and his friends wanted to make a raft. They needed to gather wood. They found wood near the river. They put the wood together to make the raft.
Tim and his friends put the raft in the water. They got on the raft and it went fast. They had fun on the fast raft. They played on the raft all day.

Once upon a time, there lived a little girl named Millie. She was three years old, and she loved to play outside with her friends. One day, it started raining very hard at Millie's house and the rain just kept coming. Millie began to get anxious. 
The rain didn't stop, and soon a flood was forming in Millie's backyard. Millie's family decided to close the windows and turn of the electricity for the night. Millie was scared and began to cry. 
Millie knew that her family could not protect her if the flood kept rising. She wanted to find a way to fix it, but she didn't know what to do. After a while, Millie's parents saw that Millie was getting anxious, so they decided to take her to the neighbor's house so she could be safe. 
At the neighbor's house, Millie could hear the floodwaters outside and she was terrified. Millie and her family waited and hoped that the water would stop. Finally the rain slowed, and the flood receded. Millie and her family were safe.
Millie had learned a valuable lesson that day. She was now more aware of the dangers of floods and had decided to be prepared for the next storm.

Once upon a time, there was a big boat. The boat had a lazy captain. The captain's job was to deliver things from one place to another. One day, the captain went to deliver a big, heavy anchor.
The boat sailed across the water. The sun was shining, and the captain felt very sleepy. He took a nap and the boat kept going. Suddenly, the boat hit something in the water. The captain woke up and saw a big island.
The captain looked at the island and saw a lot of people. They were happy to see the boat. They needed the anchor to help their boats stay in one place. The captain thought he was just delivering the anchor to another place, but he found a new home for it instead. The people thanked the captain, and he learned not to be so lazy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a weak boy, and he had a hard time doing things that other kids could do. One day, Tim went to play near a well in his village. The well was very deep, and the water inside was cold and wet.
Tim's mom told him not to play near the well because it was dangerous. But Tim did not listen to his mom. He kept playing near the well, and one day, he fell in. The water was so cold, and Tim was very scared.
Tim's mom found out what happened and came to save him. She pulled him out of the well with a big rope. She was very worried about Tim, but she knew she had to punish him for not listening. So, Tim had to stay inside his house for a whole day without playing. Tim learned his lesson and never played near the well again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was eager to know about monsters. He asked his mom, "Do monsters live under my bed?" His mom said, "No, silly, monsters are not real."
One sunny day, Tim went to the park to play. He saw something big and furry hiding behind a tree. Tim thought, "Is this a monster?" He slowly walked closer to the tree. The big furry thing jumped out and said, "Boo!"
Tim was scared, but then he saw it was just a big, friendly dog. The dog's owner came over and said, "Don't be scared, his name is Monster." Tim laughed and said, "I know a monster now, but he is a nice monster!" They all played together at the park, and Tim was happy to have a new friend named Monster.

Once upon a time, there was a little squirrel named Sam. Sam was a brilliant squirrel who loved to play with acorns. He lived in a big tree with his mom, dad, and baby sister. Sam loved to climb trees and find acorns to eat and share with his family.
One day, Sam found a big acorn in the forest. He did not know where it came from, but he was very happy. Sam wanted to show the big acorn to his mom and dad. So, he picked it up and ran back to his tree as fast as he could.
When Sam got to the tree, he showed the big acorn to his family. But the big acorn was not a real acorn. It was a bad acorn that made Sam and his family very sick. They all felt very sad and could not play or find more acorns to eat. The brilliant squirrel Sam did not know that the big acorn was bad, and now his family was not happy.

Lily and Tom were playing with blocks in the living room. They liked to build towers and houses and cars with the blocks. But they did not like to share the blocks. Sometimes they fought over the blocks and made each other angry.
One day, Lily saw a big red block that she wanted. She reached for it, but Tom grabbed it first. He said, "This is my block. You can't have it. Go find another block."
Lily was angry. She wanted the red block. She said, "No, it's not your block. It's our block. We have to share. Give it to me."
Tom was angry too. He did not want to share. He said, "No, it's mine. Go away. You are a meanie."
Lily tried to take the block from Tom. She pulled and pulled, but Tom held on tight. They both pulled so hard that the block broke in half. They both fell to the floor, holding a piece of the block.
Lily and Tom started to cry. They both hurt their thumbs when the block broke. They both felt sad and angry. They did not want to play with each other anymore.
Mom heard the noise and came to the living room. She saw the broken block and the crying children. She was angry too. She said, "What did you do? Why did you break the block? Why did you fight? You are both naughty. You have to go to your rooms and think about what you did. No more blocks for you today."
Lily and Tom felt more sad and angry. They did not say sorry to each other. They did not touch each other. They went to their rooms and stayed there. They did not have any fun. They had a bad day.

Once upon a time, there was a big fish. The fish was important because it was the biggest fish in the sea. It liked to swim and play with its friends all day.
One day, the big fish saw a hook. It thought the hook was a toy, so it played with the hook. But then, something unexpected happened. The big fish got caught on the hook!
The big fish was very tired and needed to rest. It thought about what to do. Then, it had an idea. The big fish called all its friends to help. They all pulled and pulled, and the big fish was free! The big fish learned that not all hooks are toys, and it was happy to be safe with its friends again.

Once there was a chubby alligator named Pat. Pat loved to explore, but it was hard for him to make up his mind about what to explore. Pat was very indecisive!
One day, Pat decided to explore the swamp. He was excited! He hopped through the tall grass, taking in the fresh smells.
Suddenly, Pat heard a growl. He saw a big, red alligator in the water. It had sharp teeth and was very scary. Pat didn't know what to do, so he just froze in place. 
The big alligator then spoke. "Why are you so scared, little one?" it asked.
Pat slowly replied, "I was just deciding where to explore next." The big alligator chuckled and said, "Well, why don't you explore the swamp with me? I could use a brave friend like you."
Pat was so excited! He decided that exploring the swamp together with the big alligator would be a grand adventure. From then on, Pat and the big alligator were best friends!

One day, a girl named Amy was in her house. She saw a colorful bird outside her window. The bird was red, blue, and yellow. Amy wanted to show the bird her pretty fireplace. She thought the bird would like it.
Amy said to the bird, "Come see my fireplace, it is very nice!" The bird flew into the house and went to the fireplace. The bird saw that the fireplace was dirty. The bird told Amy, "I can help you polish it!"
Amy and the bird worked together to polish the fireplace. They made it very clean and shiny. Then, something unexpected happened. The bird started to change color! The bird was now gold and sparkly, just like the fireplace.
Amy was very surprised. She asked the bird, "Why did you change color?" The bird said, "I am a magic bird. When I help someone, I change color to match what I helped with. Thank you for letting me help you, Amy."
From that day on, Amy and the magic bird were best friends. They played and had fun every day. And Amy's fireplace stayed clean and shiny, thanks to her new friend.

Junior was so excited, he could barely contain himself. Today was the day he would finally get to unpack his surprise.
"What's inside, Mummy?" Junior asked.
Mummy smiled. "It's a secret, sweetheart. You'll have to unpack it to find out!"
Junior raced to grab the nearest chair and climbed up to reach the top shelf. He fumbled with the box and carefully opened it.
Inside was a teddy bear. Junior smiled brightly and hugged it tightly. "It's so sweet, Mummy!" Junior said as he hugged the bear.
Mummy smiled. "See, secrets can be special, too! I'm glad you like it." She hugged Junior tightly.
Junior hugged back with enthusiasm. He was so glad that he could finally unpack his surprise.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a big drawer in his room. He loved to spend time playing with his toys from the drawer. One day, Tim's brother, Sam, took a toy from the drawer without asking. Tim was upset.
Tim said, "Sam, give me back my toy. It is not nice to take without asking." Sam felt bad and said, "I'm sorry, Tim. I will ask next time."
Tim and Sam learned that it is important to ask before taking something. They played with their toys together and had a lot of fun. They promised to always ask each other before using each other's things. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little bug. The bug loved to crawl all day long. It would crawl on the grass, on the leaves, and sometimes on a big rock. The bug was always happy when it was crawling.
One day, the bug found a new tool. The tool was shiny and small. The bug was very excited. It took the tool and started to crawl with it. The bug wanted to show the new tool to all its friends.
The bug crawled to its friend, the butterfly. The butterfly liked the new tool too. They played with the tool together, laughing and crawling all around the garden. And from that day on, the bug and the butterfly had even more fun with the new tool as they crawled and played in the sun.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to school. In his class, there was a big blackboard. Tim liked to slide his hand on the blackboard. It made a funny sound. But his teacher said, "Tim, don't do that. It's not nice." Tim felt a bit stupid.
The next day, Tim saw his friend, Sam, slide his hand on the blackboard too. The teacher was not in the room. Tim thought, "Sam will feel stupid too when the teacher comes back." Tim did not want Sam to feel bad. So, he told Sam to stop.
Just then, the teacher came back. She saw that Sam had stopped sliding his hand on the blackboard. She was happy. She said, "Good job, Tim and Sam. You are both being nice." Tim and Sam felt good. They learned that it is better to be nice and listen to the teacher. And they never slid their hands on the blackboard again.

One day, a curious little girl named Lucy wanted to decorate her room. She asked her daddy for help. "Daddy, can we make my room pretty?" she said. Daddy smiled and said, "Of course, Lucy! Let's do it together."
They went to the store and bought some colorful paint, stickers, and pretty things to put on the walls. Lucy was very excited! When they got home, Daddy and Lucy started to decorate her room. They painted the walls with fun colors and put stickers everywhere.
When they were done, Lucy's room looked beautiful! She was so happy and thanked her Daddy. "Thank you, Daddy, for helping me make my room pretty!" she said. Daddy hugged her and said, "You're welcome, Lucy. I love spending time with you." And they both smiled, happy with the pretty room they made together.

In a small house, there lived a girl named Lily. She was very tidy. Every day, she would clean her room and make her bed. One day, Lily found a big bag in her room. She did not know where it came from.
Lily asked her mom, "Mom, do you know where this bag came from?" Her mom said, "No, I don't know. Maybe you can raise it up and see what's inside." Lily raised the bag to look inside. She saw many toys and books. She was very happy.
But then, something unexpected happened. The toys and books started to jump out of the bag! They were alive! The toys and books helped Lily clean her room even better. They all became good friends and lived happily in the tidy room.

Tom and Lily were playing in the park with their dog Spot. They liked to run, jump and slide on the grass and the swings. Spot liked to chase the birds and the squirrels.
One day, a big truck arrived at the park. It had a loud horn and a lot of boxes. Tom and Lily were curious. They wanted to see what was inside the boxes. Spot wanted to see too. He barked and wagged his tail.
The truck driver opened one of the boxes. He took out a big stuffed lion. He smiled and winked at Tom and Lily. He said, "This is for the zoo. They have a new lion cub. Do you want to see him?"
Tom and Lily nodded. They loved animals. They followed the truck driver to the zoo. Spot followed too. He was excited.
At the zoo, they saw the lion cub. He was small and fluffy. He had yellow eyes and a pink nose. He was playing with his mom and dad. They roared and licked him. Tom and Lily thought he was cute. They wanted to pet him.
The truck driver said, "You can't pet him. He is wild. He might bite you. But you can watch him from behind the fence. He is very brave. He will grow up to be a big and strong lion."
Tom and Lily watched the lion cub. They smiled and waved at him. Spot watched too. He barked and wagged his tail. He liked the lion cub. He thought he was brave too. He winked at him. The lion cub winked back. They became friends.

One day, a smart ant named Tim found a big pencil. Tim wanted to show his friends the pencil. He picked it up and started to march back to his ant hill.
As Tim marched, other ants saw the pencil. They wanted to help Tim. So, they all marched together, carrying the big pencil. They were a strong team.
When they got to the ant hill, all the ants were happy. They had a big party to celebrate the big pencil. They danced and played all day. Tim was proud of his friends and the pencil.

One day, a girl named Lily went to a store with her mom. In the store, she saw a pretty box with shiny things inside. Her mom told her that it was called jewelry. Lily wanted to have one, but her mom said they were too expensive.
Lily was sad, so she went to the park to play. There, she met a nice lady. The lady asked, "Why are you sad?" Lily told her about the pretty jewelry in the store. The lady smiled and said, "I can help you!" She gave Lily a pretty stone and said, "Put this under your pillow tonight."
Lily did what the lady said. The next morning, she found a shiny necklace under her pillow! She ran to her mom and showed her. Her mom was surprised and asked, "Where did you get this?" Lily told her about the lady in the park. Her mom nodded and said, "Wow, that was unexpected! You are very lucky, Lily."

Once upon a time, there was a big rhinoceros named Ronny. Ronny was a fearful rhinoceros. He was scared of many things like loud noises, fast cars, and even small bugs. Ronny had a good friend, Benny the bird. Benny was not scared of anything.
One day, Benny said to Ronny, "I recommend we go on a fun adventure!" Ronny was scared, but he wanted to be brave like Benny. So, Ronny agreed to go with Benny on the adventure. They walked and walked until they found a big, dark cave.
Ronny was very scared of the cave. But then, something unexpected happened. A tiny, friendly mouse came out of the cave. The mouse said, "Hi, I'm Molly! Don't be scared, I will show you the way." Ronny was not scared anymore. With Molly's help, Ronny, Benny, and Molly had a great adventure in the cave. And from that day, Ronny was not so fearful anymore.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his dad. They saw a grill near the trees. Tim's dad said, "Let's make some spicy food!" Tim was excited.
Tim's dad put some spicy food on the grill. The food smelled good. Tim said, "Dad, I want to eat!" His dad said, "Wait, it's not ready yet."
When the spicy food was ready, Tim and his dad ate it. Tim liked the spicy food a lot. He asked his dad, "Can we do this again?" His dad smiled and said, "Yes, we can repeat this fun day!"

One day, a boy named Tom found a passport on the floor. It was dirty and disgusting. Tom made a yucky face. He wanted to find the owner of the passport and make them smile.
Tom showed the passport to his mom. "Mom, look what I found," he said. Mom looked at the passport and said, "We should find who this belongs to."
They went to the park where Tom found the passport. They saw a man who looked sad. Tom asked, "Is this your passport?" The man looked at the passport and his face changed. He started to smile. "Yes, it is mine! Thank you, Tom!"
Tom and his mom were happy that they could help the man. They all smiled and laughed. The man said, "You are very kind, Tom. Thank you for finding my passport." Tom felt good that he could make the man smile.

One day, a fat cat went for a walk. The cat saw a big cone. The cat wanted to get the cone. The cat tried to get the cone, but it was too big. The cat tried and tried, but it could not get the cone.
The cat saw a little dog. The dog wanted to help the cat get the cone. The cat and the dog tried to get the cone together. They pushed and pulled, but the cone was still too big.
The cat and the dog were very tired. They could not get the cone. They were sad. The fat cat and the little dog went home without the cone. They did not get the cone and they did not have fun.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a curious little girl named Lily. She liked to touch everything with her tiny fingers. She wanted to know what things were and how they worked. Lily's mom always told her to be careful and behave.
One day, Lily saw a big, red button on the wall. She wanted to touch it with her finger. She thought, "Should I behave or should I push the button?" Lily was very curious about what would happen if she pushed the button.
Lily decided to be a good girl and behave. She did not touch the big, red button with her finger. Instead, she went to her mom and asked what the button did. Her mom was happy that Lily behaved and told her that the button was for a loud alarm. Lily was glad she did not push the button and make a loud noise. She learned that it was good to behave and ask before touching things she did not know.

Lily was a very intelligent girl. She liked to learn new things and ask questions. She also liked to admire her big sister, Anna, who was good at many things. Anna could draw, sing, dance, and read big books.
One day, Lily wanted to surprise Anna with a gift. She went to her room and opened her drawer. She found some paper, crayons, and stickers. She decided to make a card for Anna. She drew a picture of them holding hands and wrote "I love you, Anna" with her best letters. She also put some stickers of flowers and stars on the card.
She was very proud of her card and wanted to show it to Anna. She ran to the living room, where Anna was reading a book on the couch. She said, "Anna, Anna, look what I made for you!"
Anna smiled and put down her book. She took the card from Lily and looked at it. She said, "Wow, Lily, this is beautiful! You are so creative and kind. Thank you for this lovely gift. I love you, too."
She hugged Lily and kissed her cheek. Lily felt very happy and admired. She said, "You're welcome, Anna. You are the best sister ever."

Ben liked to deliver things. He had a big red bike with a basket. He put his toys, books and snacks in the basket and rode around the yard. He pretended he was a mailman or a pizza guy or a doctor. He liked to make people happy with his deliveries.
One day, he saw a spider in the grass. It was black and hairy and had eight legs. Ben was not afraid of spiders. He thought they were cool and smart. He wanted to deliver the spider to his mom. He thought she would like it too. He picked up the spider gently and put it in his basket.
He rode his bike to the porch, where his mom was reading a book. He smiled and said, "Mom, I have a delivery for you. It is a surprise. Close your eyes and hold out your hands." His mom did what he said. She trusted Ben. He took the spider out of his basket and put it in her hands.
But his mom did not like the surprise. She screamed and dropped the spider. She jumped up and shook her hands. She looked scared and angry. She said, "Ben, what did you do? Why did you give me a spider? That is not a nice thing to do. That is a mean thing to do. You scared me and hurt the spider. I am very upset with you."
Ben felt ashamed. He did not mean to scare his mom or hurt the spider. He thought she would like it. He thought he was being nice. He said, "I'm sorry, Mom. I did not know you did not like spiders. I like spiders. I thought they were cool and smart. I wanted to share them with you. I wanted to make you happy. I did not want to make you upset. Please don't be mad at me."
His mom saw that he was sorry. She saw that he did not understand. She calmed down and hugged him. She said, "It's okay, Ben. I know you did not mean to be mean. But you have to learn that not everyone likes the same things. Some people are afraid of spiders. Some people are allergic to spiders. Some people think spiders are gross. You have to ask before you give someone a spider. You have to respect their feelings. Do you understand?"
Ben nodded. He said, "I understand, Mom. I will ask next time. I will respect their feelings. I love you, Mom." He kissed her cheek. He said, "Can I keep the spider? I will take good care of it. I will give it a name and a home and some food. Please, Mom?"
His mom smiled. She said, "Okay, Ben. You can keep the spider. But you have to keep it outside. And you have to be careful with it. And you have to give it a nice name. What will you call it?"
Ben thought for a moment. He said, "I will call it...Delivery."

One day, a little girl named Amy was playing in her room. She was very organized and liked to keep her toys in the right place. Amy had a toy mug that she loved very much. She would pretend to drink tea from the mug and have tea parties with her dolls.
