One day, Amy's friend, Tim, came over to play. They were having a tea party with the dolls, and Tim picked up Amy's special mug. "Look at this nice mug!" he said. Amy got worried because she didn't want her mug to get lost or broken.
Suddenly, Amy's little brother, Ben, came running into the room. He was so fast that he bumped into Tim, and the mug fell on the floor. Amy started to cry because she thought her mug was broken.
But then, something unexpected happened. The mug didn't break! It was made of strong stuff, so it was okay. Tim picked up the mug and gave it back to Amy. "I'm sorry," he said. "I didn't mean to drop it."
Amy stopped crying and smiled. She was happy that her mug was safe. From that day on, she always made sure to keep her special mug in a safe place when her friends came over to play.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to play with his toys in his room. One day, he saw a big closet in his room. He opened the closet and found many toys inside.
Tim played with the toys and got very dizzy. He fell down and started to cry. His mom heard him and came to his room. She saw Tim on the floor and asked what happened. Tim told her about the dizzy feeling and the toys in the closet.
His mom hugged him and said, "I forgive you for playing with the toys without asking." She helped Tim stand up and they put the toys back in the closet. Tim learned to ask before playing with new things. From that day on, he never felt dizzy again.

Once upon a time, there was a cat named Tom. Tom was a lazy cat. He loved to sleep all day. But one day, his mom said, "Tom, you need to help me organize the yarn."
Tom did not like to work, but he loved his mom. So, he got up and went to the room with the yarn. There was a lot of yarn! There was red yarn, blue yarn, and green yarn. Tom started to organize the yarn by color.
As Tom was organizing the yarn, he saw a little mouse. The mouse was playing with the yarn too! Tom and the mouse became friends. They had fun organizing the yarn together. In the end, Tom was not lazy anymore. He liked to help his mom and play with his new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Tim. Tim had a terrible habit; he would always forget things. One day, Tim was playing with his best friend, a squirrel named Sam. They were having so much fun running and jumping in the park.
"Tim," said Sam, "I have to go home now. Can you please remember to bring my toy car when you come to my house later?" Tim nodded his big bunny ear and said, "I will not forget, Sam!"
But when Tim went home, he started playing with his own toys and forgot all about Sam's toy car. Later, he hopped over to Sam's house, excited to play some more. When he got there, Sam asked, "Did you bring my toy car, Tim?"
Tim's ears drooped down as he realized he forgot the toy car. "I'm so sorry, Sam. I forgot," he said with a sad face. Sam was a little upset, but he knew that Tim didn't do it on purpose. "It's okay, Tim. We can still play together."
From that day on, Tim tried very hard not to forget things. He would even write little notes and stick them on his ear to help him remember. And whenever he would start to forget, Sam would gently remind him, making sure their friendship stayed strong and happy.

Once upon a time, there was a cute bug named Buzzy. Buzzy loved to play with his friends in the big field. One sunny day, Buzzy saw a new bug playing all alone. Buzzy wanted to make a new friend.
Buzzy went to the new bug and said, "Hi! I am Buzzy. Do you want to join me and my friends to play?" The new bug smiled and said, "Yes, I would love to! My name is Dotty."
Buzzy and Dotty joined their friends in the field. They played fun games like tag and hide-and-seek. All the bugs had a great time. Buzzy was happy that he asked Dotty to join them. Now, they were all friends.

Once upon a time, there was a grape. It was so big that it grew all by itself in the backyard of a big house.
One day, a little girl named Lucy saw the grape and was very excited. She asked her mum, "Can I eat the grape?" Her mum said, "Yes, but first let's pick it."
So they went to the big house and picked the grape. But once they touched it, they noticed it was very flexible.
Lucy thought, "This grape feels funny. I don't want to eat it." But her mum said, "Don't worry, Lucy, it's perfectly safe."
Lucy got scared and began to weep. She said, "I don't want to eat it, Mum."
Her mum said, "Don't worry, sweetie. The grape is actually a special one, and it will make you feel much better."
Lucy stopped weeping and ate the grape. To her surprise, it was sweet and crunchy. She felt relieved and said to her mum, "Thank you, Mum. Now I feel much better."
Lucy's mum smiled. She had known all along that the grape was special and it was just what Lucy needed!

Once upon a time, there was a cheerful boy named Tim. He loved to play with his red truck. Tim would push and pull the truck all around his yard. He had a lot of fun every day.
One sunny day, Tim saw a little girl crying near the park. She had lost her toy. Tim wanted to help her. He grabbed his red truck and walked to the girl. "Here, play with my truck," he said. The little girl stopped crying and started to play with the truck. They both smiled and played together.
The next day, the little girl came back with a blue truck. She said, "Thank you for sharing your truck with me. Now we can both play with our trucks!" Tim was very happy. They became best friends and played with their trucks every day. The moral of the story is that sharing can bring happiness and new friends.

Once upon a time, there was a pirate. The pirate had a big ship. He liked to find new things. One day, the pirate found a difficult map. The map showed him where to find a big treasure.
The pirate and his friends talked about the map. They wanted to find the treasure. They sailed on the sea for many days. They saw a big island. They thought the treasure was there.
But, when they got to the island, they found a big surprise. There was no treasure! Instead, there was a big party for the pirate and his friends. They had so much fun. The pirate learned that friends are the best treasure.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a toy dog that she loved very much. One day, Lily and her toy dog went for a walk in the park. They saw a big tree and decided to rest under it.
While they were resting, Lily saw an ugly bug on the ground. She said to her toy dog, "Look at that ugly bug! Let's take a photo with it." So, Lily and her toy dog took a photo with the ugly bug.
After taking the photo, Lily and her toy dog went back home. They showed the photo to Lily's mom. Lily's mom smiled and said, "What a fun day you had with your toy dog and the ugly bug!" Lily and her toy dog were very happy. They put the photo on the fridge and went to bed.

Once upon a time there was a new jellyfish. He liked the nice hot water and air but he didn't like the new sun. The sun was too bright and made him feel too hot. He tried to move and find some shade, but it was too late. The sun had melted the new jellyfish and he was all gone.

Sara and Ben are twins. They love to play together. They have many toys, but their favorite is a big box of eggs. The eggs are different colors and shapes. Some are round, some are oval, some are big, some are small. Sara and Ben like to sort the eggs by color and shape. They also like to pretend the eggs are animals or people.
One day, Sara and Ben find a new egg in the box. It is very different from the other eggs. It is not a color, it is shiny and silver. It is not round or oval, it is pointy and bumpy. Sara and Ben are curious about the new egg. They pick it up and look at it.
"Wow, this egg is different!" Sara says.
"Maybe it is a special egg," Ben says.
"Maybe it has something inside," Sara says.
They shake the egg gently. They hear a soft sound, like a beep. They are surprised and excited.
"Did you hear that?" Ben says.
"Yes, I did! What is it?" Sara says.
They shake the egg again. The sound gets louder and faster. Beep, beep, beep. The egg starts to move in their hands. It cracks open. Sara and Ben gasp. Out of the egg comes a small robot. It has two eyes, a mouth, and two arms. It looks at Sara and Ben and smiles.
"Hello, I am Robo. I am your new friend. I love you," the robot says.
Sara and Ben are amazed and happy. They hug the robot and each other.
"We love you too, Robo. You are our new friend. You are different, but you are wonderful," they say.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot loved to play with his toy cone. One day, Spot took his cone to the park to play.
At the park, Spot met a big dog named Max. Max wanted to play with Spot's cone too. They ran and jumped and had lots of fun with the cone. The sky above them was clear and blue, and the sun was shining.
After playing, Spot and Max were tired. They found a nice, soft spot under a big tree to settle down. They shared the cone and took turns chewing on it. They became best friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a cute little dog named Daisy. Daisy had a pretty pink collar that she wore every day. She loved her collar very much because it made her feel special.
One day, Daisy went for a walk with her owner, a little girl named Lily. They walked and played in the park. While they were playing, Daisy's pink collar fell off. She didn't notice it was gone until they were about to leave the park.
Daisy and Lily looked everywhere for the pink collar. They asked their friends if they had seen it, but no one had. They were very sad. Just as they were about to leave the park, they saw a squirrel holding the pink collar in its mouth. The squirrel gave the collar back to Daisy, and she was so happy. Daisy and Lily thanked the squirrel and went home, never forgetting the adventure they had that day.

Once upon a time, there was a small, confused bug. The bug did not know how to go home. The bug was on a big, green vine. The vine was in a big, green tree.
One day, the bug saw a big, strong bird. The bird said, "I dare you to jump off the vine!" The bug was scared, but it wanted to find its home. The bug thought, "Maybe if I jump, I will find my home."
The bug jumped off the vine. It fell and fell. Then, the big, strong bird caught the bug. The bird took the bug to its home. The bug was happy to be home. The bug thanked the bird for helping it. And they became good friends.

One day, a little girl named Lily wanted to cook. She asked her mom, "Can I cook today?" Her mom said, "Yes, but be organized."
Lily went to the kitchen. She looked east and saw her friend, Tim, outside. Tim came in and said, "I want to cook too!" Lily said, "Okay, but we must be organized."
They started to cook. But Tim was not organized. He made a big mess. Lily was sad. She said, "Tim, we must be organized to cook!"
Tim said, "I am sorry, Lily. I will be organized now." They cleaned up the mess and cooked together. They were happy and had fun cooking.

Tom and Mia were twins who liked to play together. One day, they found a big bottle of medicine in their mom's room. It was red and shiny and had a mysterious label.
"Let's try some," Tom said. He opened the bottle and smelled it. It smelled sweet and sour.
"No, Tom, don't!" Mia said. She remembered that mom had told them not to touch her medicine. It was only for her when she was sick.
But Tom did not listen. He poured some medicine into a cup and drank it. He made a funny face and said, "Blech! This is yucky!"
Mia was scared. She did not know what the medicine would do to Tom. She ran to the door and shouted, "Mom! Mom! Tom drank your medicine!"
Mom heard Mia and came running. She saw Tom holding the bottle and the cup. She was angry and worried. She took the bottle and the cup from Tom and looked at the label. She whispered something to herself that Mia and Tom did not understand.
"Tom, what have you done?" Mom said. "This medicine is very strong. It can make you sleepy or sick. You have to go to the hospital right now."
Tom felt sorry and scared. He did not mean to drink the medicine. He just wanted to try something new. He started to cry and said, "I'm sorry, Mom. I'm sorry, Mia. I won't do it again."
Mom hugged Tom and Mia and said, "It's okay, sweeties. I love you both. But we have to go to the hospital to make sure Tom is okay. Come on, let's go."
Mom took Tom and Mia to the car and drove to the hospital. She called Dad on the way and told him what happened. Dad said he would meet them there.
At the hospital, the doctor checked Tom and gave him some water and some candy. He said Tom was lucky that he did not drink too much medicine. He said Tom would be fine, but he had to rest and drink lots of water.
Tom felt better and said thank you to the doctor. He also said sorry to Mom and Dad and Mia. They all hugged him and said they were glad he was okay.
Tom learned his lesson. He never touched Mom's medicine again. He also learned to listen to Mia, who was smarter than him. Mia learned to be brave and to help Tom when he was in trouble. They both learned to be careful and curious, but not too curious.

Once upon a time, there was a little duck named Ducky. Ducky lived in a dry pond. The pond was very dry because it had not rained for a whole year. Ducky was sad because he wanted to swim and play with his friends.
One day, Ducky saw a group of ducks flying in the sky. They were going to a big pond with lots of water. Ducky wanted to go with them, so he decided to follow them. He flapped his wings and flew high in the sky. It was hard for him, but he did not give up.
Finally, Ducky reached the big pond. All the ducks were happy to see him. They played and swam together. Ducky was so happy that he never wanted to leave. The moral of the story is to never give up and always follow your dreams, even when things are dry and hard.

Once, in a big classroom, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to play with his toy car. He was very proud of his car because it was red and shiny. Tim would show his car to all his friends in the classroom.
One day, Tim was playing with his car when it hit a wall. The car broke into two pieces. Tim was very sad. He did not know what to do. His friends saw him and came over to help.
Tim's friends helped him put his car back together. They used glue to fix the broken parts. Soon, the car was like new again. Tim was very happy and proud of his friends. They all played together with the fixed car in the classroom.

Once there was a little girl named Jennie who was three years old. She had a great stuffed bunny which she loved to play with.
One day Jennie was playing with her bunny and looking through her cupboard. She opened the cupboard door and out came a wild fluffy cat. Jennie was so surprised that she was embarrassed and jumped back in surprise. 
"Meow!" said the cat, "Don't be embarrassed Jennie, I'm just curious to meet you."
Jennie laughed at the cat and asked, "What's your name?" 
The cat replied, "My name is Socks. I've been sleeping in your cupboard for a while." 
Jennie was so excited to have a wild new friend. From then on, they played together every day and Jennie was never embarrassed again.

Once upon a time, in a big green forest, there was a little fox named Foxy. Foxy had a long tail that he liked to wag. He was very intelligent and had many friends. One day, Foxy met a new friend, a big bear named Benny.
Benny said, "Hello, Foxy! I like your long tail. Can you teach me how to bow like you do?" Foxy nodded and said, "Sure, Benny! I will show you how to bow. It is easy and fun!" Foxy knew that teaching Benny to bow would come in handy later.
Foxy taught Benny how to bow with his big body. Benny practiced and practiced until he got it right. They laughed and played all day. Then, they heard a loud noise. A big tree was falling!
Foxy said, "Benny, use your bow to save us!" Benny remembered what Foxy taught him. He bowed down low, and Foxy jumped onto his back. Together, they moved out of the way of the falling tree. Foxy and Benny were safe, all thanks to the bow they learned. From that day on, they were the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to laugh and play with her friends. One sunny day, Sue and her friends wanted to have a pie party. They all went to the store to buy a yummy pie.
When they got back, they saw a big spoiled pie on the table. Sue's little brother, Tim, had found the pie and made a mess. Sue was sad and said, "Tim, you spoiled our pie!" Tim looked at her and said, "I'm sorry, Sue."
Sue and her friends decided to make a new pie. They all worked together and made the best pie ever. They laughed and had so much fun at their pie party. In the end, Sue and her friends learned that even when things go wrong, they can still have fun together.

Once upon a time, there was a fair youth named Tom. Tom loved to play with his ball. One day, while playing, he met a new friend named Sam.
"Hi," said Tom. "Do you want to play with me?"
"Yes," said Sam. "I like to play too!"
Tom and Sam played with the ball. They threw it high and low. But then, Tom dropped the ball. It rolled far away. Tom and Sam ran after it.
They found the ball near a big tree. They were happy to play again. Tom and Sam became good friends and played every day.

One day, a little boy named Tim had an idea. He wanted to buy a big, expensive toy. He mentioned it to his mom. His mom said, "We will see."
Tim was very excited. He thought about the toy all day. He told his friends at school about his idea. They all wanted the expensive toy too.
But when Tim got home, his mom said, "Sorry, we cannot buy the expensive toy. We do not have enough money." Tim was very sad. He cried and went to his room. His idea did not come true, and he did not get the toy.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his toys. One day, he saw a pretty, green herb in his mom's garden. He wanted to play with it because it was so pretty. 
Tim decided to pick the herb, but it was too hard. He pulled and pulled, and finally, the herb broke. Tim felt sad because he knew his mom would be mad. The herb was very special and expensive. 
When his mom saw the broken herb, she was not mad. She told Tim that it was okay, and they could grow a new herb. Tim learned that it was better to ask before touching things that were not his. The moral of the story is to always ask permission before touching something that belongs to someone else.

Once upon a time, there was a pigeon. The pigeon flew over to a little boy and asked, "Can you help me? I'm very hungry!" The boy replied, "Yes, I can help you!" He gave the pigeon some bread. The pigeon ate it and said, "Thank you very much!" But the bread was very bitter. The pigeon frowned and said, "Why does the bread taste so bitter?" The boy replied, "I don't know - I just found it on the ground!" The pigeon seemed to understand and replied, "Ok, thank you again for the food." The pigeon flew away, happy to have a full stomach, while the boy waved goodbye. The moral of the story: when someone asks for your help, be kind and give it!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved her bookshelf. She had many books on it. She liked to read the books every day. One day, Lily was upset. She could not find her favorite book.
Lily looked all around her room. She looked under her bed. She looked in her toy box. But she could not find her book. Lily was very sad. She thought her book was gone forever.
Then, something unexpected happened. Lily's cat, named Whiskers, walked into her room. Whiskers had Lily's book in his mouth! Whiskers had been hiding the book under the sofa. Lily was so happy. She hugged Whiskers and thanked him. Now, Lily and Whiskers read the book together every day.

One day, a little boy named Tim went for a walk in nature. He saw many amazing things. He saw big trees with green leaves, pretty flowers, and little bugs. Tim was very happy to be outside.
As Tim walked, he heard a bird whistle. The bird was on a branch up high. Tim tried to whistle too, but he could not. He tried and tried, but no sound came out. Tim felt sad.
Then, a kind old man saw Tim. He taught him how to whistle. Tim tried again, and this time, he made a sound! The bird whistled back. Tim was so amazed and happy. He thanked the old man, and they both walked in nature, whistling with the birds.

One day, a little dog named Max went for a walk. He saw a big tree with tasty red apples. Max wanted to eat an apple, but they were too high for him to reach. He tried to jump, but he could not get one.
A tall boy named Tim saw Max. Tim asked, "Do you want an apple, Max?" Max barked and wagged his tail. Tim reached up and with a snap, he picked an apple from the tree. The sound made Max very happy.
Tim gave the tasty apple to Max. Max took a big bite and wagged his tail. "Thank you, Tim!" Max barked. They both smiled and played together under the big tree. Max and Tim were happy and full of tasty apples.

Once upon a time there were two friends, Tom and Jack. They wanted to join a fun game but needed something special to play with. Tom had an idea, he went to his box and looked inside. He found something he had never seen before, a jar of jam.
Tom said to Jack, "Let's join the game with this jam!" They opened the jar and tried to join the game. But the jar of jam was too long for them to join the game.
Jack said sadly, "It looks like we can't join the game."
Tom replied, "Maybe with a little teamwork and effort, we can join the game."
Tom and Jack worked together to cut the jar of jam into smaller pieces. Once they had done this, they joined the game with the smaller pieces of jam.
They had so much fun playing and learned a valuable lesson, that it is never too hard to join something with a little effort.

One day, a boy named Tim saw a symbol on a big tree. The symbol looked like a smiley face. Tim was scared, but he wanted to know more.
Tim's friend, Sam, urged him to go near the tree. As they got closer, the smiley face started to move. Tim and Sam were very scared, but they did not run away.
Suddenly, a little bird came out of the tree. The bird had been making the smiley face with its beak! Tim and Sam were not scared anymore. They laughed and played with the bird. The unexpected twist was that the bird was the one making the symbol on the tree.

Once upon a time, there was a nice dog named Max. Max had a brilliant idea. He wanted to teach other dogs how to dance. Max liked to dance with his cane. He would jump and spin with it.
One day, Max went to the park to teach the other dogs. He showed them how to dance with the cane. The dogs tried to dance, but they were not very good. They could not jump and spin like Max. Max was sad, but he did not give up.
Then, something unexpected happened. A little bird came and took Max's cane. The bird flew up high in the sky. Max and the other dogs looked at the bird. The bird started to dance with the cane. All the dogs laughed and clapped. They learned that they could dance in their own way, even without the cane. Max was happy, and they all danced together in the park.

Once upon a time, there was a reindeer named Remy. Remy was not very fast. He wanted to gain speed to race with his friends. He asked his mom, "How can I be fast like my friends?"
Remy's mom said, "Eat your food and sleep well. Soon, you will be fast like them." Remy did what his mom said. He ate all his food and slept well every day. He felt something good would happen soon.
One day, Remy went to race with his friends. He ran as fast as he could. To his surprise, he was faster than all his friends. Remy was so happy. He knew that eating his food and sleeping well helped him gain speed. Now, Remy was the fastest reindeer in the forest.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Sue. Sue had a pretty blouse. She loved her blouse very much. She wore it all the time. Sue was grateful for her blouse. It made her feel happy.
One day, Sue went to play outside. She saw a big tree. Sue wanted to climb the tree. When she climbed, something unexpected happened. Her blouse got stuck on a branch. Sue was sad. She didn't want her blouse to be torn.
Just then, a friendly bird came and saw Sue. The bird wanted to help. The bird flew to the branch and carefully set the blouse free. Sue was so grateful to the bird. She didn't think a bird could help her. Now, Sue and the bird are best friends. They play together every day.

One day, a small bird was in a big tree. The bird saw a fit squirrel playing with a twig. The squirrel was very happy and did not see the bird. The bird wanted to play with the squirrel and the twig.
The bird flew down and took the twig from the squirrel. The squirrel was sad and started to panic. The bird did not want the squirrel to be sad. The squirrel ran after the bird to get the twig back.
The bird saw that the squirrel was sad and gave the twig back. They both played with the twig together. They were both happy and had a lot of fun. The squirrel did not panic anymore and they became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a lonely house. The house was sad because it had no friends. One day, a little girl named Lily came to the house. She saw the house was sad and wanted to help. Lily had an idea. She would decorate the house to make it happy.
Lily found some paint and started to decorate the house. She painted big numbers on the walls. The house began to smile. It was not lonely anymore. Lily was happy to see the house smile. She knew she had done a good job.
But then, something unexpected happened. The numbers on the walls came to life! They jumped off the walls and started to play with Lily and the house. They were all happy and had a lot of fun. The house was not lonely anymore, and it had many new friends.

The sun was bright in the sky. A little boy and his mom were walking up the stairs together. Suddenly, they heard a loud noise coming from the top of the stairs.
The little boy was curious, so he peered around the corner. There was a group of children, speaking to each other. They all looked very competitive.
The little boy wanted to speak to them and join in the fun. He shouted out, "Hello!" but the children all laughed and ran away. The little boy was embarrassed.
He started to cry. His mom hugged him with a sad face. She said, "The stairs are no place for a little boy like you."
The little boy nodded and they walked back down the stairs. The little boy remembered not to be too competitive on the stairs. He knew bad things could happen.

One day, a big cricket was hopping around the garden. It stopped and looked around. Suddenly, it heard a noise coming from inside the house.
The cricket hopped to the window and peeked through. Inside, a little girl was in the kitchen and stirring something in a big bowl.
The little girl looked up and saw the cricket. "Hello!" she said cheerfully.
The cricket was so surprised that it hopped away. The little girl laughed and called out, "Come back!"
The cricket hesitated, then slowly hopped back to the window. It watched as the girl continued to stir the bowl.
The girl smiled at the cricket and said, "Let's play!" She put down the bowl and opened the window.
The cricket flew inside, and the girl clapped her hands with delight. The two began to play together. The girl laughed as the cricket hopped around her feet. 
The whole day the cricket and little girl spent together. Eventually, the cricket had to leave, but it looked back and smiled. The little girl waved and said goodbye. As the cricket flew away, it whispered to itself, "Big cricket stirs with little girl."

One day, a duck went for a walk. He saw a big, heavy rock. The duck thought it was fun to play with the rock. So, he pushed the rock with all his might. 
As he pushed, a little bug came up to him and said, "Why are you in such a rush to move this heavy rock, Mr. Duck?" The duck replied, "I want to play with it!" The bug laughed and said, "That's not a rock, it's a big egg!"
The duck was surprised. He had never seen such a big egg before. He decided to take care of the egg and waited for it to hatch. After some days, the egg started to crack. The duck was very excited to see what was inside.

One day, a person was very busy. They had many things to do. They needed to get food, clean the house, and play with their dog. The person said, "I am so busy today!"
While the person was cleaning, they heard a knock on the door. They opened the door and saw a big box. The person said, "I did not get this box. What is inside?" They opened the box and saw a big cake.
The person was very happy. They did not know who sent the cake. They shared the cake with their friends. The person said, "Today was a busy day, but I got a nice surprise!"

Once upon a time, there was a gifted bee named Bob. Bob could make the best honey in the hive. All the other bees loved Bob's honey.
One day, the queen bee asked Bob to make honey for a big party. All the bees were very excited. Bob worked hard to make the sweetest honey ever.
At the party, the queen bee tasted Bob's honey. She loved it so much that she asked Bob to bow in front of everyone. All the bees clapped and cheered. Bob was very happy and proud.

Once there was a big pan. This pan was very uncomfortable. It lived in a small kitchen with other pans. One day, a little boy named Tim came to the kitchen. He saw the big, uncomfortable pan and wanted to play with it.
Tim picked up the pan and said, "Hello, Mr. Pan! Why are you so uncomfortable?" The pan replied, "I don't like to fight with the other pans. They always push me around." Tim felt sad for the pan and wanted to help it.
So Tim talked to the other pans and told them not to fight. They listened to Tim and stopped fighting with the uncomfortable pan. The big pan became very happy and comfortable. Tim and the pan became good friends, and they all lived happily in the kitchen.

Once upon a time, there was a big horse named Bob. Bob lived in a big red barn. He loved to eat hay all day. One day, Bob saw a small mouse named Tim. Tim was hungry too.
Bob said, "Hi, Tim! Do you want to eat hay with me?"
Tim said, "No, Bob. I cannot eat hay. I eat cheese. But we can still be friends."
One day, Bob and Tim saw a dangerous snake. The snake wanted to eat Tim. Bob got scared, but he wanted to help his friend.
Bob said, "Tim, jump on my back! I will keep you safe."
Tim jumped on Bob's back, and they ran away from the dangerous snake. They were safe and happy. From that day on, Bob and Tim were best friends. They played together every day, and they always helped each other.

Once upon a time, there was a clever dog named Max. Max lived in a big house with a nice family. Max liked to play with his family and his dog friends in the yard. One day, Max and his dog friends found a big box with a lock on it. They did not know how to open it.
Max said to his friends, "Let's try to open the lock together!" Max and his friends tried to open the lock, but it was very hard. They tried and tried, but they could not open it. Max thought and thought, and then he had an idea.
Max asked his family to help him make a network of ropes. They tied the ropes to the lock and pulled together. Suddenly, the lock opened! Inside the box, they found lots of toys and treats for Max and his friends. They were all very happy and played together all day long.

Ben and Lily liked to play in their room. They had many toys and books and a big bed. Sometimes they pretended the bed was a boat or a castle or a rocket. They used pillows and blankets to make it fun.
One day, they had a new idea. They wanted to hang the mattress on the wall. They thought it would be like a big painting or a trampoline. They pushed and pulled the mattress off the bed and dragged it to the wall. They found some nails and a hammer in the closet. They tried to nail the mattress to the wall.
But the mattress was too heavy and the nails were too small. The mattress fell down with a loud thud. It knocked over a lamp and a vase and a picture. The lamp broke and the vase shattered and the picture ripped. Ben and Lily were scared. They heard their mom coming up the stairs.
Mom saw the mess and the mattress and the nails and the hammer. She was very angry and very serious. She said, "What have you done? This is very bad and very dangerous. You could have hurt yourselves or the wall or the floor. You are not allowed to play with nails and hammers. You are not allowed to hang the mattress on the wall. You have to clean up this mess and say sorry. And you have to go to bed early tonight. No more playing in your room."
Ben and Lily felt very sorry and very sad. They said, "We are sorry, Mom. We were just trying to have fun. We did not mean to make a mess or break things. We will clean up and go to bed. We will not do it again." They hugged their mom and helped her pick up the pieces. They put the mattress back on the bed and the pillows and blankets on top. They went to bed early and dreamed of better games.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. She loved to mix colors to make new ones. One day, she saw a black star in the sky. She wanted to make it shine brighter.
Mia asked her friend Tom, "How can we make the black star shine?" Tom thought for a moment and said, "Let's mix colors and paint the star!" So they took their paints and brushes, and started to mix colors.
They mixed yellow and blue to make green, red and blue to make purple, and red and yellow to make orange. They painted the black star with all the colors they had mixed. As they painted, the star began to shine brighter and brighter.
When they were done, the star was the most beautiful thing in the sky. All the other children saw it and wanted to paint stars too. Mia and Tom taught them how to mix colors and paint stars.
The moral of the story is that when we work together and share our ideas, we can make the world a brighter and more beautiful place.

Once upon a time, there was a powerful fisherman named Tom. He liked to catch fish in the big blue sea. One day, he saw a big bird fly high in the sky. The bird was very special because it could talk.
The bird said, "Hello, Tom! I can help you catch more fish. But first, you must help me find my lost baby bird." Tom agreed to help the bird because he wanted to catch more fish.
Tom and the bird looked high and low for the baby bird. They found the baby bird stuck in a tall tree. Tom climbed the tree and saved the baby bird. The big bird was very happy.
As a thank you, the big bird used its magic to make Tom's fishing net very powerful. Tom caught many fish, and he and the bird became good friends. They all lived happily ever after.

One day, a little girl named Sally wanted to organize a welcome party for her new friend, Tim. She was very excited and wanted all her friends to be there. Sally went to her friend, Annie, and asked, "Will you help me with the party?" Annie said, "Yes, I will help you, Sally."
On the day of the party, Sally and Annie worked hard to make the party look nice. They put up balloons, made cake, and played fun games. When Tim arrived, he was very happy to see the party. But then, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and blew all the balloons away!
Everyone at the party was sorry that the balloons were gone. Tim said, "It's okay, I'm still very happy that you made this welcome party for me." Then Sally had an idea. She said, "Let's all work together to find the balloons!" All the friends went outside and found the balloons. They brought them back to the party and had a great time.
The moral of the story is that even when something unexpected happens, it's important to stay positive and work together to fix the problem.

Once upon a time, there was an ancient house. Inside that house was a buckle.
One day, a little three-year-old girl wandered into the house and saw the buckle. She asked her mother, "What is that?"
Her mother smiled and said, "It's a buckle. See if you can open it!"
The little girl was very excited. She squatted down and carefully examined the buckle. After a few tries, she finally managed to open it. Inside, there was an old key.
She asked her mother, "What is this key for?"
Her mother smiled and said, "I don't know. Maybe you can try and find out where it fits!"
The little girl was full of joy and ran off to explore the ancient house.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tom. Tom did not like bugs. He would say, "I hate bugs!" One day, Tom saw a big bug in his room. He was not glad.
Tom called his mom and said, "Mom, there is a bug in my room! I hate it!" His mom came in and saw the bug. She said, "Tom, bugs are not bad. They help us. Some bugs eat other bugs that can hurt us."
But Tom did not want to hear it. He wanted the bug to go away. So, he tried to hit the bug with his shoe. The bug was fast and flew away. Tom chased the bug all around his room. He was very mad.
At last, Tom hit the bug with his shoe. The bug fell down and did not move. Tom was happy that the bug was gone. But then, many more bugs came into his room. They were mad that Tom hurt their friend. Tom was not glad anymore. He wished he had listened to his mom.

Once upon a time, there was a thoughtful girl named Lily. She liked to listen and learn from people around her. Lily had a big heart and always wanted to help others.
One day, Lily found a small, red box. Inside the box was a button that said "record". She didn't know what it did, so she pressed it. Suddenly, the box started to talk! It could record what people said and play it back.
Lily had an idea. She used the record box to remember the nice things her friends and family said. When someone was sad, she played the kind words to make them feel better. Everyone loved Lily's magic box, and they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a tidy mole. The mole liked to dig holes and keep them very clean. One day, the mole dug a new hole in the ground. He was very happy with his new hole.
The mole had a friend named Bird. Bird liked to play a game called "guess." Mole and Bird played the game together. Mole would hide in a hole and Bird would guess which hole Mole was in. They had a lot of fun playing the game.
One day, while they were playing the game, Bird guessed the wrong hole. Mole was not in the hole Bird guessed. Bird got very sad and flew away. Mole was sad too, because he lost his friend. They never played the game again, and Mole stayed in his tidy hole all alone.

Once upon a time there was a naughty jellyfish. His name was Frank. Frank wanted to have an adventure, so he decided to go to the beach.
When he got there, he saw lots of people enjoying the sun and sea. He wanted to join in, so he started swimming around. 
Suddenly, a big wave struck him. He went flying through the air! Frank was very scared, but he managed to get back in the water. He was so relieved and happy to be alive. 
That's when he heard a voice laugh and say, "You're so naughty, Frank!" Frank looked around and saw a big whale smiling at him. "That was a big wave," the whale said. "You have to be careful when you're in the big sea!"
Frank thanked the whale for the advice and swam away. He was going to remember that for sure. He was so happy with his adventure, even if it had been a bit naughty!

Once upon a time, in a big green forest, there was a small furry rabbit named Remy. Remy loved to hop around and play with his friends. One day, Remy and his friends were playing near the edge of the forest. They were laughing and having fun.
Suddenly, a big, scary wolf came from the east. The wolf wanted to catch the small furry animals. Remy's friend, a tiny bird named Tina, said, "Remy, we must escape! The wolf is coming!" Remy and his friends started to run away as fast as they could.
They ran and ran, but the big, scary wolf was getting closer. Remy and Tina tried their best to escape, but the wolf was too fast for them. In the end, the big, scary wolf caught Remy and Tina. The wolf was very happy, but Remy and Tina were very sad. And that was the bad ending of their day in the big green forest.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He loved to play with his toy computer. Tim liked to press the buttons and make it beep. He was very good at it.
One day, Tim saw a big, real computer. It was in his mom's room. He wanted to play with it too. He asked his mom if he could play with the big computer. His mom said no, but Tim was persistent. He asked again and again. Finally, his mom said yes.
Tim was so happy. He sat in front of the computer and waved at it, just like he did with his toy. He pressed the buttons and made it beep. Tim had so much fun playing with the big computer.

Once upon a time, there was a gentle cat named Ash. Ash loved to play with his soft ball. He would feel very happy when he played.
One day, Ash went to the park. He saw a big tree. He felt excited and climbed up the tree. Ash could see his house from the top.
But Ash got scared. He didn't know how to get down. His friend, a kind dog, came to help. The dog barked and Ash's mom heard. She came and helped Ash get down. Ash felt safe and happy again. They all went home and played together.

John was a young boy who liked to play all the time. One day, he wanted to play with his horse at the nearby stable. He went to the stable and saw the horse. He said to the horse, "Let's play, Horse!" 
The horse shook his head and said, "No, I can't play. I have to stay in the stable." 
John was embarrassed. He looked away and said, "Oh, sorry. I didn't know." 
The horse said, "That's okay. We can still be friends." 
John smiled happily. He patted the horse's head and said, "Yes! Let's be friends." 
They enjoyed being friends and the horse would come to the stable door whenever John visited. They played many games together until the sun set.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a big toy box with many toys. But Tim was a bit spoiled. He did not like to share his toys with his friends. One day, Tim saw a pretty kite stuck in a tree. He wanted to take it down and play with it.
Tim had an idea. He went to his dad's shed and found a ladder. Tim took the ladder and put it against the tree. He climbed up, up, up, until he could reach the pretty kite. He took the kite down and was very happy.
Tim played with the pretty kite all day. His friends saw him and asked if they could play too. Tim thought for a moment and decided to share his toys. They all played together, and Tim learned that sharing was more fun than being spoiled.

Once upon a time, there was a girl and a boy walking along a path. Suddenly, there was a loud horn. The sound was so weird! The boy and girl were scared. They didn't know what it was. Then, a big truck appeared and the horn was coming from the truck. It had been trying to prevent the children from crossing the street! The children were so happy and ran home, safe from harm. From that day forward, they always paid attention to the sounds of the weird horn before crossing the street. The End.

Once upon a time there was a smart girl named Sarah. She watched the airplanes fly with a twinkle in her eye. One day, Sarah said to her mom, "Can I go to the airport?". Her mom just shrugged and said, "Let's go!"
When Sarah and her mom got to the airport they were so excited. Sarah saw the airplanes flying way up high and the big airport building. She said, "I want to get closer!" Her mom said, "Ok, let's go."
When they got close to the airport, they saw the big airport cars driving around, and the people getting in and out of the airplanes. Sarah was fascinated and said, "Mommy I want to go in an airplane too!" Her mom just smiled and shrugged, "Maybe one day."
When it was time to go home, Sarah said, "I want to come back to the airport again!" Her mom said, "Of course." As Sarah and her mom drove home, Sarah looked out the window at the sky and saw the airplanes in the distance flying away. She smiled and knew that when the time is right, she'll go back to the airport again.

Once upon a time, there was a clever dog named Spot. Spot loved to play with his hose in the yard. One sunny day, Spot found a big puddle to splash in. He was so happy.
Spot saw a little bird who looked sad. The bird was thirsty and wanted a drink. Spot had an idea. He took the hose and filled the puddle with water. The little bird was able to drink and splash in the water too. The bird was very happy.
Spot learned that sharing is good. He made a new friend by being kind and helpful. The little bird and Spot played together every day after that. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little boat. The boat had a smooth sail. It loved to hug the waves as it moved. The boat lived in a nice harbor with other boats.
One day, a big storm came. All the boats were scared. The little boat was brave. It told the other boats, "Don't be scared. We can help each other." The boats all hugged each other tight in the harbor.
The storm went away. The boats were safe. They learned that when they hug and help each other, they can be strong. The little boat with the smooth sail was a good friend. And they all lived happily in the harbor.

Once upon a time, there was a nice bird named Bob. Bob loved to fly high in the sky. One day, he saw a sink in a yard.
"Hello, sink!" said Bob. "Do you want to fly with me?"
The sink said, "I can't fly, but you can play with me here."
Bob was sad, but he wanted to play with the sink. So, he flew down and they played together. They had so much fun, and Bob learned that even though the sink couldn't fly, they could still be friends.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a messy boy named Tim. Tim loved to mix things together. One day, he found a magic book in his room. The book had many fun things to do.
Tim wanted to make magic. He took a big bowl and started to mix. He mixed water, mud, and paint. The mix was very messy, but Tim was happy. He said, "I will make the best magic ever!"
Tim's mom saw the messy mix. She was not happy. "Tim, you must clean this up!" she said. Tim was sad, but he knew he must listen to his mom. He cleaned up the messy mix and put away the magic book. But Tim knew he would find more fun things to mix and make magic with another day.

Once upon a time, there was a clever bird named Bobby. Bobby loved to sing songs all day. One day, he met a little girl named Lucy. Lucy was sad because she could not unlock a big box she found in her yard.
"Hi Lucy, why are you sad?" asked Bobby. Lucy said, "I found this big box, but I can't unlock it. Can you help me?" Bobby thought for a moment and then had an idea. "I will sing a song and maybe the box will unlock!" he said.
So Bobby sang a beautiful song for Lucy. As he sang, the big box started to unlock! Lucy was so happy and thanked Bobby. Inside the box, they found lots of fun toys to play with. Bobby and Lucy played together all day and became best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to design things. One day, she decided to make a cushion. She took some soft cloth and cut it into two big squares.
Next, Lily sewed the squares together and put some soft, fluffy stuff inside. She made it very pretty with lots of colors. Lily was very happy with her cushion. She put it on her bed and it looked so nice.
Lily also had a dog named Max. Max was very obedient. He always did what Lily told him to do. One day, Lily told Max to sit on the cushion. Max did as he was told and sat on the cushion. Lily and Max were very happy. They loved the cushion and played with it every day.

Once upon a time, there was an ugly clock. It lived in a small house with a nice family. The family did not like the ugly clock because it was not pretty like the other things in the house.
One day, the ugly clock said to the family, "Please, let me help you. I can raise my hands to tell you the time." The family looked at the clock and said, "Okay, you can help us. But you must stay in the corner because you are not pretty."
The ugly clock was happy to help the family. It raised its hands every hour to tell the family the time. The family started to like the ugly clock because it was helpful. They moved it from the corner to the middle of the room.
The family learned that even if something is not pretty, it can still be good and helpful. They loved the ugly clock and it was happy to be part of the family. The ugly clock taught the family the moral value of not judging things by how they look.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys. She had a bin full of toys that she liked to touch.
One sunny day, Lily's friend, Tommy, came over to play. They both looked at the bin and thought it was the perfect day to play outside. "Let's take the toys outside!" said Lily. "Yes, let's do that!" said Tommy.
They took the bin outside and started to play. They touched the toys and had so much fun. After a while, they felt tired and sat down on the grass. "Today was perfect," said Lily. "Yes, it was," agreed Tommy. They smiled and continued to play until the sun went down.

Once upon a time, there was a lively little dog named Spot. Spot loved to play with his blanket. He would carry it around in his mouth and drop it in the grass.
One sunny day, Spot saw his friend, Bunny. Bunny looked sad. Spot asked, "Why are you sad, Bunny?" Bunny said, "I lost my blanket. I am cold." Spot wanted to help his friend.
Spot thought for a moment and then said, "Bunny, you can have my blanket." Bunny smiled and said, "Thank you, Spot!" They played together all day, and Bunny was warm with the blanket. Spot learned that sharing with friends is a good thing to do.

Once upon a time, in an ancient land, there was a big earth. On this earth, there were many animals. One day, a little rabbit and an old wise turtle were talking.
The rabbit said, "I want to gain something new. I want to be fast and strong."
The turtle said, "To gain, you must learn and grow. You can do it, little rabbit."
So, the rabbit ran and jumped all day. Every day, the rabbit got faster and stronger. The animals on the earth saw the rabbit and were happy.
The rabbit said, "Thank you, wise turtle. I gained what I wanted."
The turtle smiled and said, "You're welcome, little rabbit. Remember to always learn and grow."

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a vendor. The vendor sold sweet treats. One day, a little girl named Amy went to the vendor to buy a treat. She saw a big, dirty dog near the vendor. The dog looked sad.
Amy walked up to the vendor and asked, "Why is the dog dirty and sad?" The vendor said, "The dog has no home. No one wants to play with him because he is dirty."
Amy felt bad for the dog. She wanted to comfort him. She asked the vendor, "Can I give him a treat?" The vendor said, "Yes, you can."
Amy gave the dog a treat. The dog wagged his tail and smiled. Then, something unexpected happened. The dog started to glow! The dirty dog turned into a beautiful, clean dog with shiny fur.
Everyone in the town saw the change and wanted to play with the dog. The dog was happy and Amy felt proud. She learned that being kind can make a big difference.

Once upon a time there was a good boy named Peter. Peter was obedient. One day he went on a walk with his dog to find something special. As they walked, they scratched the ground and soon they found something. It was a score.
Peter stared at it. "What is this?", he asked his dog. His doggy barked once and then said, "It is a score Peter. It will help you find something greater". Peter couldn't understand what the dog said, so he just kept staring at the score. 
Eventually, he decided to take it home. When he came home he showed it to his mom. His mom smiled and then said, "Peter, this score is used when you need help to find something important. You must always remain obedient if you want to find it."
Peter smiled and then thanked his mom. Now he knew that the score was a sign of hope, and obedience was the key. He promised himself to always remember the moral lesson. 
The end.

Lily and her mom went to a restaurant for lunch. Lily liked the restaurant because it had big windows and colorful pictures on the walls. She saw a lot of people eating and talking. She also saw a lady in a white dress and a hat. The lady was walking around the tables and smiling. She looked graceful.
"Who is that lady, mom?" Lily asked.
"That lady is the owner of the restaurant. She is very nice and friendly. She likes to wave to the customers and make them happy," mom said.
"Can I wave to her too, mom?" Lily asked.
"Sure, you can. But wait until she looks at you, okay?" mom said.
Lily nodded and waited. She saw the lady coming closer to their table. She saw the lady look at her and smile. Lily smiled back and waved her hand. The lady waved back and said, "Hello, little one. You are very cute. What is your name?"
"Lily," Lily said.
"Lily, that is a lovely name. I am glad you came to my restaurant. Do you like the food?" the lady asked.
"Yes, I do. It is yummy. Thank you, lady," Lily said.
"You are very welcome, Lily. You are very polite. I hope you enjoy your lunch. Have a nice day," the lady said. She walked away to another table.
Lily felt happy. She liked the lady. She liked the restaurant. She liked the food. She liked the day. She hugged her mom and said, "I love you, mom."
"I love you too, Lily," mom said. They finished their lunch and left the restaurant. Lily waved to the lady again. The lady waved back and said, "Bye, Lily. Come back soon." Lily smiled and said, "Bye, lady. See you soon."

Once upon a time, there was a big purple cat. The cat liked to think a lot. One day, the cat saw some smoke. The smoke was coming from a small house.
The purple cat ran to the house. The cat wanted to help. But the smoke was too much. The cat could not see well. The cat tried to think of what to do.
The cat could not find a way to stop the smoke. The house burned down. The purple cat was sad. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little green frog named Tim. Tim lived in a dirty pond near a big tree. He had many friends like fish, bugs, and birds. They all liked to play together.
One sunny day, Tim met a new friend, a yellow duck named Daisy. "Hi, I'm Tim!" said the frog. "Hi, I'm Daisy!" said the duck. They played all day in the dirty pond. They swam, jumped, and splashed in the water. They had a lot of fun.
As the sun began to end, it was time for Tim and Daisy to go home. They said goodbye to each other. "Bye, Daisy! Let's play again tomorrow!" said Tim. "Bye, Tim! See you tomorrow!" said Daisy. And they both went back to their homes, excited to play again the next day.

One day, a little dog named Spot felt very lonely. He did not know why, but he did not want to be alone. Spot knew that on Wednesday, there would be a big party in the park. He thought that maybe he could make new friends there. So, Spot waited for Wednesday to come.
When Wednesday came, Spot went to the park. He saw many kids playing and having fun. Spot was happy to be there. He played with the kids and made new friends. They all laughed and played together.
At the end of the day, Spot was not lonely anymore. He knew that he had made many new friends. Spot learned that sometimes, all you need to do is go out and play to feel happy again. And he knew that every Wednesday, he could go to the park and play with his new friends.

Once upon a time, there was a boy and a girl who had a pet. The pet was unusual because it could make lightning. The boy and the girl were happy with their pet but one day a problem came. 
The pet wanted to make more lightning, but it was too small to do it. This made both the boy and the girl worried. 
So, they all decided to go on an adventure looking for things which could help them make more lightning. 
They looked everywhere, but nothing seemed to work. The pet was beginning to get sad. 
Then, one day, the pet noticed something unusual. It saw something shining on top of the mountain. They all went closer to see what it was. 
It was a crystal which glowed with lots of lightning! So, the pet was able to make more lightning and the boy and girl were happy. 
They all lived happily ever after with the pet's unusual lightnings.

Once upon a time, there was a mule named Max. Max was a little weird, but he had many friends. Max lived on a farm with his best friend, a girl named Sue. They liked to play together every day.
One day, Sue found a big paper. She had an idea. "Max, let's fold the paper and make a hat for you!" Max nodded his head and let Sue fold the paper. She folded it once, twice, and then one more time. Sue put the hat on Max's head. Max felt happy and proud.
Max and Sue went to show their friends the new hat. The other animals liked Max's weird hat too. They all played together and had a fun day. Max and Sue were very happy, and they knew they would always be best friends.

One day, a fireman wanted to sail on a boat. He was a tough fireman who liked to help people. He put on his red hat and went to the water.
The fireman got on the boat and started to sail. The sun was shining, and the birds were singing. He saw fish in the water and smiled. The fireman was having a fun day.
As he sailed, he saw a little cat stuck on an island. The tough fireman sailed to the island and saved the cat. The cat was happy, and the fireman felt good. They sailed back home together, and the fireman and the cat became best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a compassionate boy named Tim. He liked to help others and share his toys. One day, Tim saw a big sack in his room. He thought, "I can use this sack to help my friends."
Tim went to his friends' houses and filled the sack with toys. He wanted to give the toys to kids who did not have any. Tim knew that sharing was good and would make everyone happy.
As Tim walked, the day became hot. He found a cooler by the road. He filled it with cold water and shared it with his friends. They all felt better after drinking the cold water. Tim and his friends learned that sharing and being kind made them happy. They promised to be compassionate and help others from that day on.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny who loved to explore. He wanted to find the best camp with lots of things to see. On the way, he spotted a big, colorful camp with lots of different things to do. But, the bunny was scared because of a big, furry bear near the camp. 
The bunny said to the bear, "You won't bite me, will you?" The bear looked at the little bunny and smiled. The bear said, "No, I won't bite you. I'm just curious about the camp. I have been too scared to go inside." 
The bunny was very brave. He said to the bear, "Come on, let's go together and explore it. I don't think it's so scary."
The brave bunny and bear went inside the camp and had the most amazing adventure. They realized the camp was full of wonderful things and nothing was scary. In the end, the moral of the story was that things can look scary and uncertain, but if we take a chance, great things can happen.

Once upon a time, in a little town, there was a graceful cat named Bella. She liked to play with her friends in the park. One day, Bella found a shield. She did not know who it belonged to. So, she asked her friends, "Do you know who this shield belongs to?"
Her friends did not know. They all looked at the shield. It was shiny and big. They thought it was special. Bella and her friends wanted to find who it belonged to. They asked everyone in the town. But no one knew.
Then, something unexpected happened. A tiny bird flew down and said, "The shield belongs to me!" Bella and her friends were surprised. They did not think a little bird would need a shield. The bird told them a story. The shield helped him fly high and fast. Bella and her friends gave the shield back to the bird. They were happy to help. The bird flew away, fast and high, with the shield.

Once upon a time, there was a calm cat named Kitty. Kitty loved to play with her toys and sit in the sun. One day, Kitty's family went to a place where they could eat. They looked at the menu to choose what they wanted.
Kitty wanted to go too, so she followed her family. When they got to the place, Kitty saw a big dog. The dog reminded Kitty of her friend, Doggy. Kitty thought the big dog was her friend, so she went to say hello.
But, when Kitty got close, she saw it was not her friend Doggy. It was a different dog! The big dog was nice too, and they became friends. Kitty and her new friend played together while their families ate. In the end, Kitty was happy to have a new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a sweet little girl named Lily. She loved playing with bubbles. One day, she saw a big box in her room. She did not know what was inside, but she was very excited.
Lily opened the box and found a bubble supply! There were many bottles of bubble mix and a big wand inside. She was so happy. She took the bubble mix and wand outside to play.
Lily blew the biggest bubble ever. It was so big that it carried her up into the sky. She had a great adventure up there. She saw birds and clouds. In the end, the big bubble popped, and Lily floated gently back down to her yard. She knew that her bubble supply had given her a special day she would never forget.

Once upon a time, there were two cows, Bryanna and Melinda. 
Bryanna lived on a ranch and Melinda lived on a farm. 
Bryanna was feeling very envious of Melinda because her farm was much bigger and had lots of animals that she didn't have. 
One day, Bryanna decided to visit Melinda and asked, "Can I stay for the weekend and pretend that I am living on a farm too?"
Melinda smiled and said, "Sure. I think that's a great idea." 
So the cows pretended to be farmers and it was so much fun. 
However as the weekend went on, Bryanna realised how much hard work was involved in actually running the farm. She soon understood that being envious of someone else won't make her life any better.
By the end of the weekend, Bryanna was so glad she was back on her ranch and happy with her life. 
The moral of this story is to be content with what you have and not be envious of what someone else has.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a fierce dog named Max. Max liked to listen to the birds sing and play with his friends. One day, Max's family went on a holiday to the beach.
At the beach, Max saw the big blue sea and felt the soft sand under his paws. He played with the other dogs and chased the birds. Max loved the beach and the sun made him feel warm and happy.
As the sun went down, Max and his family sat by the fire. They ate yummy food and shared fun stories. Max was very happy and loved his holiday with his family.

Once upon a time, there was a big old hill. On top of the hill, there was a small house. In the house, there lived a kind mom, a strong dad, and a little girl named Amy.
One sunny day, Amy went outside to play. She saw a cute little cat near the old hill. The cat was sad and alone. Amy wanted to help the cat, so she gave it a big hug.
The cat was very happy after the hug. It followed Amy back to her house. Amy's mom and dad saw the cat and smiled. They all gave the cat a hug too. Now, the cat had a new home and a loving family. And they all lived happily ever after.

Tim and Lily were playing with their rubber ducks in the bathtub. They liked to make them swim and splash and quack. Tim had a yellow duck and Lily had a pink one. They pretended their ducks were friends who went on adventures.
One day, Tim had a new idea. He said to Lily, "Let's make our ducks soar in the air!" He showed her how to squeeze his duck and let it go. It flew out of the water and landed on the floor with a thud. "Wow!" Lily said. "That looks fun!"
Lily tried to do the same with her duck, but she squeezed too hard. Her duck soared out of the bathtub and hit the window. The window broke and glass fell everywhere. Tim and Lily gasped. They heard their mom coming up the stairs. They knew they were in trouble.
Their mom opened the door and saw the messy scene. She was angry and scared. She asked them, "What happened here? How did you break the window?" Tim and Lily looked at each other. They didn't know what to say. They felt sorry and ashamed.
Their mom told them to get out of the bathtub and put on their clothes. She said they had to clean up the mess and pay for the window. She said they couldn't play with their rubber ducks anymore. Tim and Lily cried. They wished they hadn't made their ducks soar. They learned their lesson.

One day, a big hippo named Bobo lived by a pond. He loved to jump and play with his friends. But today, Bobo felt frustrated because he could not jump as high as his friends.
"Bobo, why are you sad?" asked his friend, Birdy. "I can't jump high like you and the others," said Bobo. Birdy thought for a moment and said, "Let's ask Wise Owl for help."
Wise Owl listened to Bobo's problem and said, "Bobo, you don't have to jump high like your friends. You are good at other things. Be happy with what you can do."
Bobo felt better and thanked Wise Owl. From that day on, Bobo was happy being himself and did not try to be like his friends. The moral of the story is to be happy with who you are and not to compare yourself to others.

Once upon a time there was a lovely girl named Fiona. Every day Fiona worked hard to reach her goal.
One day Fiona's mom said, "Let's go to the park. You can play while I work."
Fiona replied, "Yay! I love the park, it's always so lovely." So Fiona and her mom went to the park and had a wonderful time.
They ran around, laughed and hugged each other. They stopped and watched a group of kids playing hide and seek. Fiona thought to herself, "It looks like so much fun! I want to play too!"
Fiona joined the group, and soon she was chasing and laughing with the other kids. The game went on for a long time, until it was time to go home.
Fiona felt so happy and satisfied. She had worked hard to reach her goal - to have a lovely time at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a big stadium. Many kids would go there to play and have fun. One day, a little frog named Billy came to the stadium. He loved to jump very high.
Billy saw the kids playing and wanted to join them. He jumped and jumped all around the stadium. The kids saw Billy and were very happy. They all played together and had a great time.
At the end of the day, the kids were grateful to Billy for playing with them. They all said "thank you" to Billy. Billy was happy to have new friends and couldn't wait to jump and play with them again.

Once upon a time there was a boy named Sam. He was very curious and loved to explore. One day, he saw a gray drum in the park. Sam wondered what was inside it and asked his mom if he could take a look. 
His mom said yes, and Sam used both his hands to open the small flap at the top of the drum. Inside, he found many shiny objects that made a rattling sound. He was excited to see what they were and asked his mom if he could play with them. 
His mom said yes, and Sam shook each one in the drum. Then he found a big gray drumstick and asked his mom if he could play it. She smiled and said yes. 
Sam was so happy. He used the drumstick to make music with the drum. And to his surprise, he could even make it sing! As he played, he clapped his hands and laughed. 
It was a wonderful day for Sam, thanks to the gray drum.

One day, a slow cat named Tom was playing with his ball. He saw a player named Sam. Sam was playing with a ball too. Tom wanted to play with Sam, so he walked up to him and said, "Can I play with you?"
Sam said, "Yes, you can play with me. Let's play catch!" They started to play catch with the ball. They threw the ball back and forth, having lots of fun.
Suddenly, Tom felt a sneeze coming. He tried to stop it, but he couldn't. "Achoo!" Tom sneezed so hard, the ball flew far away. They looked for the ball but couldn't find it. Sam was sad.
Then, a little girl found the ball and brought it back to them. "Is this your ball?" she asked. Sam and Tom were happy and said, "Yes, thank you!" They learned that it is good to help others, and they played together all day.

Once there was a girl. She was healthy and happy. One day, she ventured deep in the forest to explore. But she got lost! She walked and walked, but couldn't find her way out. 
Then, a kind rabbit appeared. He offered to help her. He told her to follow him, and he would guide her out. 
The girl followed the rabbit. As she walked on a path in the forest, it suddenly ended. The girl couldn't go any further. She turned to the rabbit and asked, "Where do I go now?".
The rabbit then told her to close her eyes and she would return home. The girl did as told and when she opened her eyes, she realised she was back in her front yard. 
The girl was so happy. But then, she got sick. Her health worsened every day and shortly after, the girl died.
She never realized that the rabbit was actually a magical creature and that the only way he could help her was to cast a dangerous spell that would help her return home, but at the cost of her life.

Once upon a time, there was a furry dog named Spot. Spot loved to play with his favorite toy, a ball. One day, Spot went outside to roll his ball.
As Spot rolled his ball, he saw a small black rock. Spot did not know it was a piece of coal. He thought it was a new toy. So, Spot rolled the coal too.
Spot played and played. He rolled the ball and the coal all day. At the end of the day, Spot was very happy. He had two toys to play with now. And that is how Spot found a new toy, the coal.

One day, a little ant named Tim was very nervous. He had to lead the big march for all the ants. This was the first time he had to do this job. Tim was scared that he would make a mistake.
Tim went to his friend, Bee. He said, "Bee, I am scared. I have to lead the march today. What if I do it wrong?" Bee smiled and said, "Don't panic, Tim. You can do it. Just take a deep breath and be brave."
Tim took a deep breath and started the march. All the ants followed him. Tim was still nervous, but he did not panic. He led the ants all the way to the food. The ants were happy and Tim felt proud. He knew he could do it, thanks to his friend Bee.

Once upon a time, there was a great big wall. A little boy named Tim and a little girl named Sue liked to play near the wall. They had a lot of fun running, jumping, and laughing together. Tim said, "Sue, let's race to the wall!" Sue said, "Yes, let's go!"
But one day, when they were playing, dark clouds came in the sky. Tim looked up and said, "Sue, I think it will rain soon. We should go home." Sue said, "No, I want to keep playing. The rain won't come yet." So they kept playing near the great big wall.
Then, the rain started to fall. It fell harder and harder. The ground became wet and slippery. Tim and Sue tried to run home, but they slipped and fell. The great big wall could not keep them dry. In the end, they were both very wet and cold. They wished they had gone home when the dark clouds came.

Once upon a time, there was a gray cat. The cat was very attractive. She liked to print her paw on the ground. One day, she saw a big box. The box had a picture of a cat on it. She thought it was a friend.
The gray cat went to the box every day. She would print her paw on the box. She hoped the cat in the box would come out and play. But the cat in the box never moved. The gray cat was sad.
One day, the gray cat saw a little girl. The little girl opened the box. Inside the box was a new cat friend! The gray cat was so happy. She printed her paw on the ground to show her new friend. They played together all day. The gray cat learned that sometimes, good things come from unexpected places.

John and his mom were walking home from the park, when suddenly they heard a loud noise. "What was that, Mommy?", John asked with a smile.
His Mom laughed and said, "It was probably just a careless bird, John! Don't worry!"
John nodded and peered up at the sky. Then he saw a sparkly trail of magic in the air. "Mommy! Look, what's that?", he asked.
His Mom smiled, her eyes twinkling. "It looks like someone just cast a spell! Isn't it beautiful?"
John grinned and nodded in agreement, his eyes sparkling with delight. He waved as the sparkles slowly disappeared into the sky. 
The two of them walked home, holding hands and smiling. John's mom was so relieved that he was safe, and he was so glad that his mom was being so careful.

Once there was a farmer. Every day he went to work on his farm. One day he woke up feeling very upset. He didn't know why, but he felt like crying. He took a deep breath and blinked back the tears that were forming in his eyes.
The farmer didn't know what to do. He took a walk around the farm, but nothing changed. He was still feeling upset.
Suddenly, a little bird flew down from the sky and perched on a tree branch beside him. "Cheer up," said the bird. "Things will get better soon. Just blink back your worries and everything will be alright."
The farmer smiled and did as the bird said. He blinked once, then twice and soon enough he was no longer upset. He said, "Thank you, little bird."
The bird flew away, happy that she had helped the farmer. From that day on, the farmer was no longer upset. Instead he smiled and thanked the little bird every time he blinked.

Once there was a clumsy caterpillar named Cal. Cal was so clumsy that he would trip over his own feet. One day, Cal met a wise old owl named Olive. Cal complained to Olive, "I don't like being clumsy. I always fall down."
Olive listened and said, "It's okay to be clumsy. We all have things we are not good at. You just need to try your best and be kind to others."
Cal thought about what Olive said. He tried to be kind to his friends and help them when they needed it. One day, Cal saw a little bird stuck in a bush. Cal used his long body to reach the bird and set it free.
The bird said, "Thank you, Cal! You are so kind!" Cal felt happy and proud. He learned that being kind is more important than not being clumsy.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max liked to play with his cardboard box. He would jump in and out of the box all day long. One day, Max saw a big hill and thought it would be fun to gain speed and slide down the hill in his box.
Max climbed up the hill with his cardboard box. When he reached the top, he was very tired. He looked down and saw that the hill was very steep. Max was a little scared, but he wanted to have fun. So, he got into his cardboard box and started to slide down the hill.
As Max gained speed, something unexpected happened. His cardboard box hit a bump and Max flew out! He landed on a soft, bouncy thing. It was a trampoline! Max bounced up and down, having so much fun. He forgot all about his cardboard box. And from that day on, Max loved to play on the trampoline even more than his cardboard box.

Once upon a time, there was a little candle. The candle lived in a cold room. It was sad because it missed its friend, the sun.
One day, the candle saw a little girl. She was cold too. The candle wanted to help the girl. So, it asked the girl to light it up. The girl was happy and did it.
Now, the candle was not cold anymore. The girl was not cold too. They became best friends. The candle did not miss the sun anymore. It was happy with the girl. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, a wise old dog and a small cat lived in a tiny house. They loved to eat pastry. One day, they found a big pastry shop. They went inside and saw many yummy pastries. They wanted to eat them all!
The wise old dog said to the small cat, "We must not eat too much. We must save some for later." The small cat agreed, but she really wanted to eat more. So, she tried to squeeze one more pastry into her little bag.
Suddenly, the pastry started to talk! It said, "Please don't squeeze me! I am a magic pastry. If you let me go, I will give you a big surprise." The wise old dog and the small cat were very shocked. They had never heard a pastry talk before.
They let the magic pastry go, and it turned into a big, beautiful cake! The wise old dog and the small cat were very happy. They thanked the magic pastry and shared the cake with their friends. And from that day on, they always remembered to not be too greedy and to share with others.

One day, a baby was in his crib. He felt crazy and wanted to play. His mom said, "Baby, it's time for sleep!" But the baby did not want to sleep. He wanted to play with his toys.
The baby started to cry. His mom came back and said, "Baby, please stop crying. It's time for sleep." The baby did not listen. He wanted to ignore his mom. He kept crying and crying.
Then, his big sister came in. She said, "Baby, if you stop crying, I will play with you tomorrow." The baby stopped crying. He felt happy. The baby went to sleep and dreamed of playing with his big sister.

Once upon a time, there was a hunter named Tom. Tom liked to play with his dog, Spot. They would run and jump in the big green park. One day, Tom and Spot saw a big, fake lion. They did not know it was fake.
Tom and Spot decided to catch the lion. They jumped and ran after the lion. The lion did not move. Tom and Spot were very brave. They got closer and closer to the lion.
Then, something unexpected happened. The wind blew very hard, and the fake lion fell down. Tom and Spot saw that it was not a real lion. They laughed and laughed. They were happy that it was just a funny trick. And they played in the park all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and run in the park. One day, she found a pretty box under her bed. She was very curious about what was inside the box.
Lily decided to open the box. Inside the box, she found a beautiful, shiny bracelet. The bracelet was very flexible, so it could fit on her small wrist. Lily was so happy to find the bracelet. She put it on and wore it all day long.
Lily showed her new bracelet to her friends at the park. They all thought it was very pretty. They played together, and the flexible bracelet stayed on Lily's wrist while she ran and jumped. At the end of the day, Lily went home and put the bracelet back in the box, so she could wear it again another day.

John was in his room, playing with his toys. He saw his mom in the kitchen. She was making lunch. He said to her, "Mommy, what are you doing?"
His mom smiled and asked, "Can you help me, sweetheart?"
John was so excited. He said, "Yes!"
His mom pointed to a small plate. She said, "Can you stretch the bread for me, please?"
John stretched the bread until it was thin. His mom put it on the plate. Then, she said, "Good job! Now let's have lunch!"
John smiled. He couldn't wait to eat the sandwich.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue was a regular girl who liked to play with her friends. One day, she saw a new girl in her class. The new girl looked sad and lonely.
Sue thought about her mom's advice to be kind to others. She decided to invite the new girl to her house to play after school. She made a big sign that said "You Are My Friend" and showed it to the new girl. The new girl smiled and they played together all afternoon.
Soon, more kids saw Sue and the new girl having fun. They wanted to join too. The new girl felt happy and loved. Sue learned that being kind and inviting others to play can make everyone feel good. The moral of the story is to be kind and include others, even if they are new or different.
