Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a man with a mustache. His mustache was big and terrible. The man's name was Bob.
One day, a little girl named Lily saw Bob. She said, "Your mustache is terrible!" Bob felt sad. He wanted to make his mustache nice.
Bob went to the store and bought a comb. He combed his mustache every day. Soon, it looked nice and neat. Lily saw Bob again and said, "Your mustache is nice now!"
Bob and Lily became friends. They played and laughed together every day. And Bob's mustache was never terrible again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He was very enthusiastic and loved to play outside. One day, he saw a big, shiny star in the sky. Tim thought, "I want to touch that star!" He had a wish to fly up and reach the star.
Tim asked his mom, "Can I fly to the star?" His mom said, "You can't fly, but you can try to make a tall tower with your blocks." Tim was excited and started to build a big tower. He thought if he made it tall enough, he could touch the star. 
As Tim built the tower higher and higher, he noticed the star seemed to get closer. He was so happy and thought his wish was coming true. But then, the tower got too tall and fell down. Tim was sad, but his mom said, "You tried your best, and that's what matters." Tim knew he couldn't really touch the star, but he was still happy he tried.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a well. The well was very deep and gave the people water to drink. The well was always happy to help.
One day, a little girl named Lily came to the well. She was very thirsty and wanted a drink. The well saw Lily and wanted to help her. The well gave her some water, and Lily felt happy and warm inside.
Lily thanked the well and ran back to her house. She told her mom and dad about the well that helped her. Her mom and dad were happy too. They all went to the well to say thank you. From that day on, the well and Lily's family were good friends.

One day, a little girl named Lucy found a key. The key was shiny and small. Lucy was excited. She did not know what the key would open, but she wanted to find out.
Lucy looked for a door to open with the key. She tried her room, but it did not fit. She tried the front door, but it did not fit. Lucy was sad, but she did not give up.
Finally, Lucy found a small box in her playroom. She put the key in the box and turned it. The box opened and inside was a new toy! Lucy was so excited. She played with her toy all day long.

One day, a little dog named Max saw a tall pole. Max wanted to play with the pole, so he ran up to it and began to shake it. As Max shook the pole, a small bird flew down from the top.
The bird said, "Why do you shake my pole, Max?" Max stopped and looked at the bird. "I just wanted to play," said Max. The bird looked at Max and thought for a moment.
"Okay, Max, you can play with my pole, but be careful not to shake it too much. It's my home," said the bird. Max and the bird played together, but Max was careful not to shake the pole too hard. After playing, Max and the bird ate some food. The food was a little bitter, but they didn't mind. They were happy to have made new friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Kate. She was only three years old. Kate's mom and dad took her to the grocery store one day. They all looked at the fresh, green cauliflower. 
"Look, Daddy!" Kate said, pointing to the cauliflower in the market. 
"Yes, sweetie," Daddy said. 
"It is so pretty. Can we buy it?" Kate asked. 
Daddy shook his head. "No, Kate. Cauliflower is too expensive."
Kate pouted. She wanted the cauliflower very badly!
"I have an idea," Daddy said. "We can buy a small piece of cauliflower, and cut it into little pieces. That way we can still buy it!"
Kate smiled. She loved cutting things!
So, they all went to the checkout counter to get the small piece of cauliflower, and took it home. 
Once they got home, Kate's mom and dad showed her how to use the big, sharp knife to cut the cauliflower. Kate watched attentively, and then carefully grabbed the knife and started cutting the cauliflower into small pieces. It was so much fun! 
At the end of the day, Kate had her own little bowl of yummy cauliflower, and she

Once upon a time, there was an elderly man named Grandpa Joe. He had a lot of equipment in his little house. Grandpa Joe liked to fix things for his friends and family.
One sunny day, a little girl named Sally came to visit Grandpa Joe. Sally was playing with her toy car. Suddenly, the toy car hit a big rock and it broke. Sally was very sad.
Grandpa Joe saw Sally's broken toy car and wanted to help. He took her to his house and showed her all his equipment. Together, they used the equipment to fix the toy car. Sally was so happy and thanked Grandpa Joe. They played with the toy car all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a loud dog named Spot. Spot had a big shield that he liked to play with. One day, Spot decided to clean his shield.
Spot took his shield outside and used water to make it shiny. He was very happy to see his shield looking so bright. Spot barked loudly and wagged his tail.
After Spot finished cleaning his shield, he played with it all day. He ran around the yard, making loud noises and having fun. At the end of the day, Spot was tired but happy. He went inside to sleep, dreaming of more fun days with his clean shield.

Once upon a time, there was a small bull named Bob. Bob lived on a farm with many friends. He liked to play with his friends all day.
One day, Bob and his friends were playing hide and seek. It was Bob's turn to find his friends. But Bob was not good at this game. He would always forget where his friends were hiding.
Bob looked and looked for his friends. He found them one by one. But he could not find his best friend, a small cat named Kitty. Bob felt sad because he forgot where Kitty might be hiding.
Then, Bob heard a soft sound. He looked around and saw Kitty hiding behind a big tree. Bob was so happy that he found Kitty. They both laughed and continued to play with their friends. From that day on, Bob tried not to forget where his friends were hiding, and they all had lots of fun together.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a mysterious box. Inside the box, there was a lot of paper and a big machine. Tim was very curious about the machine. He wanted to know what it could do.
Tim put a piece of paper into the machine. He pressed a button and the machine started to make noise. Suddenly, the machine began to print something on the paper. Tim was very excited to see what it was.
When the machine stopped, Tim looked at the paper. There was a picture of a big, happy sun. Tim showed the paper to his mom and dad. They all smiled and clapped. The mysterious machine had printed a beautiful picture for them to enjoy.

Lily was very sad. She had a bad dream last night. She dreamed that a big dog chased her and bit her. She woke up crying and ran to her mom.
"Mom, mom, I had a bad dream!" she sobbed.
Mom hugged her and kissed her. "It's okay, Lily. It was just a dream. It's not real. You are safe with me."
Lily felt a little better. She snuggled with mom and told her about the dream. Mom listened and nodded. She said, "Dreams are like stories in your head. Sometimes they are nice, sometimes they are scary. But they can't hurt you. You can make them go away by thinking of something happy."
Lily thought of something happy. She thought of her teddy bear, her favorite toy. She smiled and said, "I love my teddy bear. He is soft and cuddly. He makes me happy."
Mom smiled too. She said, "That's good, Lily. Why don't you go and get your teddy bear? He is waiting for you in your bed. You can play with him and forget about the bad dream."
Lily nodded and ran to her room. She saw her teddy bear on her pillow. She picked him up and hugged him. She felt happy and safe.
But then she heard a loud noise. She turned around and saw her brother, Tom. He was holding a toy car. He had a mean look on his face. He said, "Give me your teddy bear. I want to play with him."
Lily shook her head. She said, "No, Tom. He is mine. You have your own toys. Go away."
Tom got angry. He said, "No, I want him. He is better than my toys. Give him to me or I will slap you."
Lily felt scared and helpless. She held her teddy bear tight and said, "No, no, no. Please don't slap me. Please leave me alone."
But Tom didn't listen. He moved closer to Lily and raised his hand. He was about to slap her when mom came in. She saw what was happening and shouted, "Tom, stop! What are you doing? How dare you threaten your sister?"
Tom dropped his hand and looked at mom. He knew he was in trouble. He said, "But mom, I just wanted to play with her teddy bear."
Mom said, "That's no excuse, Tom. You can't take things that don't belong to you. You can't hurt your sister. You have to be nice and share. You have to say sorry to Lily and give her back her teddy bear."
Tom felt ashamed. He said, "Sorry, Lily. I was wrong. Here is your teddy bear. You can keep him."
Lily said, "Thank you, Tom. I forgive you. Maybe we can play together later."
Mom said, "That's better, Tom. I'm glad you apologized. Now, why don't you go and play with your toy car in the living room? And Lily, why don't you come and have some breakfast with me? You must be hungry after your bad dream."
Lily and Tom nodded and did what mom said. They both felt better. They learned that dreams can't hurt them, but words and actions can. They learned to be kind and respectful to each other. They learned to love their mom and their teddy bear.

Mum and her daughter Milly were walking in the dark. Milly was scared, but Mum brought a flashlight.
Milly asked: "Mum, can I ride the flashlight?"
Mum chuckled: "No, my love, but let's find something you can ride."
Milly looked around and spotted a little bike. She screamed: "Mum, look! I want to ride it!"
Mum smiled: "Of course you can, my love. Just remember to wear your helmet!"
Milly put on her helmet and hopped on the little bike. She rode it around in the darkness, with her mummy watching close by with the flashlight.
Milly was a very fine bike rider. Everyone clapped as she rode around.
Mum said: "You're a wonderful rider, Milly!"
Milly smiled brightly and said: "Yes, I'm a very fine rider!"

Once upon a time, in a small room, there was a shelf. On the shelf, there were toys. One toy was a fake bird. The bird could not fly. A boy named Tim lived in the room. Tim loved his toys.
One day, Tim's friend, Sam, came to play. They played with the toys on the shelf. Tim said, "Let's play with the fake bird." Sam said, "Okay!" They played with the bird, and it was fun.
Later, Tim had an idea. He said, "Let's release the bird outside!" Sam said, "But it's a fake bird." Tim said, "It's okay, it will be fun!" They took the bird outside and let it go. The wind blew, and the fake bird moved in the air. Tim and Sam laughed and clapped. The fake bird had a fun day outside, and so did Tim and Sam.

One day, a big dog named Max went for a walk on the road. He saw a weak little cat sitting by the road. Max wanted to help the cat, so he put some food near her. The cat ate the food and felt better. Max and the cat became friends and decided to play together.
As they played, Max and the cat found a big box on the road. They were curious to see what was inside. Max used his strong teeth to open the box. Inside the box, they found many colorful balls and toys.
Max and the cat were very happy to find the toys. They played with the toys all day long. But then, something unexpected happened. The weak little cat jumped very high and caught a ball in her mouth. Max was surprised to see the cat jump so high. The cat was not so weak after all. Max and the cat laughed and played together, having lots of fun with their new toys.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to play outside. One day, Sue went to the park. She saw a big slide. Sue wanted to go on the slide. But the sky was gloomy. Sue was sad.
Sue saw her friend Tom. Tom said, "Let's find a way to play even if it's gloomy." Sue smiled and said, "Okay, let's find something fun to do."
Sue and Tom found a big tree. They played hide and seek under the tree. The tree kept them dry from the rain. Sue and Tom had so much fun. The gloomy day became a happy day for Sue and Tom.

Once upon a time, there was a little kangaroo. It was very angry. It could not find a seat to sit on. It jumped around, looking for a seat.
One day, the kangaroo met a big bear. The bear said, "Why are you so angry, little kangaroo?" The kangaroo said, "I can't find a seat to sit on. Can you help me?" The bear nodded and smiled.
The bear and the kangaroo looked for a seat. They found a big rock. The kangaroo sat on the rock. It was happy. The bear and the kangaroo became good friends. They played together every day.

Anna and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big dog. The dog has a vest. The vest is red and blue. It says "help dog".
"Wow, look at the dog!" Anna says. "He is so big and nice. Can we pet him?"
Ben nods. They walk to the dog. The dog wags his tail. He likes Anna and Ben. They pet him and talk to him.
"Hello, dog. What is your name?" Anna asks.
The dog barks. He cannot talk. But he has a tag on his vest. The tag says "Rex".
"His name is Rex," Ben says. "He is a help dog. He helps people who are sick or hurt."
"That is very kind of him," Anna says. "He is a good dog."
They play with Rex for a while. They throw a ball and he fetches it. They give him treats and he licks them. They hug him and he snuggles them.
But then, a bad boy comes. He is bigger than Anna and Ben. He has a mean face. He sees Rex and his vest.
"Hey, that is a cool vest," he says. "I want it. Give it to me."
He tries to grab Rex's vest. Rex growls. He does not like the bad boy. He does not want to lose his vest. It is his vest. He needs it to help people.
"Stop it!" Anna and Ben shout. "That is Rex's vest. You cannot have it. You cannot steal it. That is wrong."
The bad boy does not listen. He pulls harder. Rex barks louder. He tries to bite the bad boy. The bad boy kicks Rex. Rex yelps.
Anna and Ben are scared and angry. They run to Rex. They try to help him. They push the bad boy away.
"Leave Rex alone!" they cry. "He is our friend. He is a kind dog. You are a bad boy. Go away."
The bad boy is surprised. He did not expect Anna and Ben to fight back. He is afraid of Rex's teeth. He is ashamed of his actions. He drops Rex's vest. He runs away.
"Sorry, Rex," he mumbles.
Anna and Ben hug Rex. They check his vest. It is not torn or dirty. They put it back on him. They say sorry to him too.
"Are you okay, Rex?" they ask.
Rex wags his tail. He licks their faces. He is okay. He is happy. He forgives them. He thanks them.
They smile. They are happy too. They are proud of themselves. They are brave and kind. They are good friends.
They play with Rex some more. They have fun. They are careful with his vest. They respect him and his job. They love him and he loves them. They are a happy team.

Once upon a time, there was a little bear named Bobby. Bobby was a naughty bear. He liked to play tricks on his friends in the forest. One day, Bobby saw a big red ball. He wanted to play with it, but his friend, Sammy the squirrel, said, "No, Bobby, it's not yours."
Bobby insisted, "But I want to play with it!" Sammy said, "You need to ask first. It's not nice to take things that aren't yours." Bobby didn't listen and took the ball to play with it. While he was playing, the ball popped. Bobby was sad.
Sammy came to Bobby and said, "It's okay, Bobby. We all make mistakes. The important thing is to learn from them." Bobby learned that it's not good to be naughty and take things that don't belong to him. From that day on, Bobby always asked before playing with something that wasn't his.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She had a toy magnet that she loved to play with. One day, she took her magnet outside to the open park. She liked to see what her magnet would stick to.
Amy saw her friend, Tom, in the park. Tom was playing with a ball. Amy went to Tom and said, "Look at my magnet. It can stick to things. Can I serve the ball with my magnet?"
Tom said, "I don't know. Let's try!" So, Amy tried to serve the ball with her magnet. But the ball did not stick to the magnet. Amy and Tom laughed.
They played together in the open park all day. They had so much fun. And even though the magnet could not serve the ball, they found many things that it could stick to. They were happy and tired when it was time to go home.

One hot day, a boy named Tim went to the beach. He saw the big blue sea and the hot yellow sand. Tim wanted to play in the water. He saw a surf board. Tim said, "I want to surf!"
Tim's mom said, "Be careful, Tim!" She helped him hang the surf board on his arm. Tim walked to the water. He was happy and excited. He did not see the big wave coming.
The big wave took Tim's surf board away. "Oh no!" said Tim. He was sad. But then, a friendly dolphin jumped out of the water with the surf board. The dolphin said, "Here you go, Tim!" Tim was very surprised and happy. He thanked the dolphin and they surfed together all day.

Once upon a time there was a little guard who lived in a big house. She was very organized and kept her house clean. Every day she zipped around the house cleaning up.
One day she heard a noise coming from outside. The little guard peeped outside to see who it was.
"Who is there?" she asked.
"It's me," said a big guard. "I've come to keep your house safe!"
The little guard was so happy to have the big guard helping her. They zipped around the house together, making sure it was nice and organized.
The little guard was so relieved to have a big guard to help her. Together they kept their house safe and organized.

Once upon a time, there was a big tiger in the woods. The tiger was sad and began to weep. He felt stupid because he could not find his way home. He sat under a tree and cried.
A little bird saw the weeping tiger and flew down. The bird said, "Why do you weep, big tiger?" The tiger said, "I am lost, and I feel stupid. I can't find my way home."
The little bird wanted to help the tiger. The bird said, "Don't be sad, big tiger. I will help you find your way home." The tiger stopped weeping and smiled at the bird. They went on a walk together, and the bird showed the tiger the way home. The tiger was happy again, and they became good friends.

Claire was playing in the park. She was having so much fun on the slide. After sliding down the slide a few times, her mommy said it was time to go home. Claire really didn't want to go home. She decided to guess what her mom would do next. Claire guessed that her mom would give her a cone.
So Claire started looking for a cone. She found a yellow cone in the sandbox and she was very excited. She ran over to her mom and asked if she could keep the cone. But her mom said, "No, that is not for you. That cone needs to stay organized and in one place."
Claire was so disappointed she started to cry. She just wanted the cone so badly. She begged her mom over and over again, but her mom wouldn't budge. She said the cone was not hers and she could not have it. 
Claire was very frustrated. She couldn't believe she was not allowed to keep the cone. But it was organized and that's what mattered most. Since she couldn't have the cone, Claire decided to play with some stuffed animals. She put them all in a neat line, so they were just like the cone!

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a smart cat named Tom. Tom loved to ask questions. He would question everything he saw.
One day, Tom saw a glass on the table. He had never seen a glass before. Tom asked his friend, a little girl named Sue, "What is this glass for?" Sue smiled and said, "We use the glass to drink water."
Tom wanted to try it. He jumped on the table and tried to drink from the glass. But the glass was too big for him. Sue saw Tom having trouble and helped him. She poured some water in a small bowl for Tom. Tom was happy and drank the water.
From that day on, Tom would always question new things he saw. And Sue would always help him learn. They were the best of friends, and they had lots of fun together.

Once upon a time, in a small room, there was a hidden guitar. It was very pretty and liked to sing. The guitar was sad because no one played with it. It wanted a friend to make music with.
One day, a little boy found the hidden guitar. The boy was happy to play with the guitar. They made sweet music together. The guitar was not sad anymore.
But one day, the boy tried to hang the guitar on the wall. The guitar was scared. It did not want to hang. The boy did not listen. The guitar fell and broke. The boy was sad, and the guitar could not sing anymore.

One day, a sweet dog named Spot went to his friend, Tom the cat. Spot wanted to borrow a hanger. Tom said, "Ok, you can borrow my hanger."
Spot took the hanger and went to play. While playing, a big wind came. The wind took the hanger and blew it far away. Spot was sad.
Spot went back to Tom and told him what happened. Tom was sad too. They both looked for the hanger, but they did not find it. The hanger was gone forever.

Once upon a time, there was a big, soft blanket. The blanket was very expensive, but it was special. It could provide warmth and love to anyone who used it. The blanket lived in a small house with a kind family.
One day, a little girl named Lily found the blanket. She was cold and needed something to keep her warm. She picked up the blanket and wrapped it around herself. The blanket was so soft and cozy that it made Lily feel happy and warm.
Lily loved the blanket so much that she took it everywhere with her. She shared the blanket with her friends, her family, and even her pets. The blanket provided warmth and love to everyone who used it. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a humble book. This book lived on a small shelf in a little room. The book had many friends like a ball, a doll, and a teddy bear. They all played together every day.
One day, the book wanted to tell a story to its friends. The ball, the doll, and the teddy bear sat down to listen. The book told a story about a big tree, a funny dog, and a happy sun. The friends loved the story and they all smiled.
When the story was at the end, the friends clapped and cheered. The humble book was very happy. It knew that it could make its friends happy with stories. From that day on, the book told a new story every day and they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tom. He had a big jar of money. He saved it for a long time. Tom was a reliable boy. He always did what he said.
One day, Tom saw a man with a big bag. The man said, "I can make your money grow if you trust me." Tom thought about it. He wanted more money, so he gave his jar to the man.
The man took the jar and ran away. Tom was sad. He thought he lost his money. But then, a big bird flew down. The bird had Tom's jar! The bird gave it back to Tom. Tom was happy. He learned to be careful with his money and who to trust.

Once upon a time, there was a lively dog named Spot. He liked to play and run all day. Spot had a neighbor named Tom. Tom was a little boy who liked to play with Spot.
One day, Spot said to Tom, "Let's play and have fun!" Tom said, "Yes, let's play!" They played all day long. But then, Spot started to suffer. He felt sick and couldn't play anymore.
Tom was sad and didn't know what to do. He called his mom for help. She came and looked at Spot. Mom said, "Spot ate too much candy. That's why he feels sick." Tom was surprised because he didn't know dogs shouldn't eat candy. Spot got better after a while, and Tom learned to be more careful with what he fed Spot. They continued to play happily every day.

Ben and Sam were brothers who liked to play with boats. They had many boats of different colors and sizes. They would take their boats to the harbor and sail them on the water. They would pretend to be pirates or explorers or fishermen.
One day, they had a big fight over a red boat. Ben said it was his boat, but Sam said he found it first. They both wanted to play with the red boat and did not want to share. They started to yell and pull the boat from each other.
"Give me the boat, it's mine!" Ben shouted.
"No, it's mine, I saw it first!" Sam shouted back.
They did not hear their mom calling them from the shore. She wanted them to come back and have lunch. She was worried that they would get too far from the land or get into trouble. She waved her arms and shouted louder, but they did not see or hear her. They were too busy fighting over the boat.
Suddenly, a big wave came and knocked them off their feet. The water was cold and deep and scary. They let go of the boat and tried to swim back to the shore, but the wave was too strong. It pushed them away from each other and from the land. They cried for help, but no one heard them. They were deaf to each other and to their mom.
The red boat floated away, empty and lonely. Ben and Sam never played with boats again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue lived in a small house with a big fence around it. One day, Sue saw a harmless cat outside the fence. The cat was soft and had pretty colors.
Sue wanted to play with the cat, but she didn't know how to open the fence. She asked her mom, "Mom, can you help me open the fence?" Her mom said, "I recommend you play inside the fence. The cat can come in if it wants to play."
So, Sue played inside the fence and the harmless cat came in to join her. They had lots of fun together. Sue was happy that her mom recommended the best way to play. And from that day, Sue and the cat became best friends.

Tom and Lily were playing in the park. They liked to swing, slide and run. But Tom was bored. He wanted to do something else.
"Let's go to the pond and see the ducks," he said to Lily.
"No, I don't want to. The pond is far and muddy. And the ducks might bite," Lily said.
"Come on, don't be a baby. It will be fun," Tom said. He pulled Lily by the hand and dragged her to the pond.
Lily was scared. She did not like the pond. It was deep and dark. And the ducks were loud and mean. She tried to pull away from Tom, but he was stronger.
"Look, there are the ducks. Let's feed them some bread," Tom said. He took out a piece of bread from his pocket and threw it to the water.
The ducks saw the bread and swam towards it. They quacked and snapped. They wanted more bread.
"Give me some bread too," Lily said. She was hungry and wanted to eat.
"No, this is mine. Go find your own," Tom said. He was greedy and did not want to share.
Lily was angry and sad. She did not like Tom. He was mean and selfish. She cried and cried.
The ducks heard Lily cry. They thought she had more bread. They swam to her and bit her. They bit her legs, her arms and her face. They hurt her a lot.
Lily screamed and screamed. She was in pain and fear. She fell to the ground and bled.
Tom saw Lily fall. He was shocked and scared. He ran to her and tried to help her. But it was too late. The ducks had killed her.
Tom cried and cried. He was sorry and sad. He wished he had been nice to Lily. He wished he had shared his bread. He wished he had not dragged her to the pond.
But it was too late. He had lost his friend. He had learned his lesson. But he had paid a high price.

Once upon a time, in a brilliant sunny land, there was a little boy named Tim. He loved to play outside when it was hot. One day, he saw a big tree with a lot of red balls on it. Tim wanted to get one of the red balls, so he started to climb the tree.
As he climbed, he heard a voice say, "Hey, don't quit! You can do it!" Tim looked around and saw a little bird on a branch. The bird was cheering for him. Tim smiled and kept climbing higher and higher.
Finally, Tim reached the top and got a red ball. He climbed back down and showed the bird. "Look, I did it!" he said. The bird was happy for Tim. They both knew that if you don't quit, you can do anything. And from that day on, Tim and the bird were best friends.

One day, a boy named Tim found a rope. He thought the rope was boring. He didn't want to play with it. He put the rope in his toy box and went to play with his other toys.
Tim's mom told him to go outside and play. Tim went outside, but he didn't take the rope with him. He started to play with his ball, but it got stuck in a tree. Tim didn't know what to do. He started to complain.
Then, Tim remembered the boring rope in his toy box. He went inside and got the rope. He threw the rope up and caught the ball. The rope wasn't boring anymore. Tim was happy and played with the rope all day.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park. He saw a huge flag on a tall pole. The flag was red, blue, and white. It was flying high in the sky. Tim looked at the flag and felt happy.
Tim met a girl named Lily at the park. She was playing with a toy flag. Tim said, "Hi, I like your flag." Lily said, "Thank you, I believe it can fly too." Tim and Lily played together, waving their flags and running around.
They pretended to be superheroes, flying with their flags like capes. They had so much fun, they did not want to go home. When it was time to leave, Tim and Lily said goodbye. They promised to play together again soon.

One day, a little squirrel found a big acorn. The acorn was mysterious. The squirrel wanted to bake the acorn to eat it. He put the acorn in a warm place under the sun. He waited and waited for the acorn to bake.
While the squirrel was waiting, a small bird came. The bird saw the acorn and wanted it too. The squirrel and the bird both wanted the acorn. They talked and talked about what to do. They decided to share the acorn after it was baked.
When the acorn was ready, the squirrel and the bird tried to break it open. But, something unexpected happened. The acorn was not a real acorn. It was a tiny house for little bugs. The squirrel and the bird were surprised. They did not eat the acorn. Instead, they became friends with the bugs and helped them fix their house.

One day, a little girl named Sue found a fork in her toy box. She did not know what it was for. She went to her mom to ask for help. Her mom was very smart and could explain many things to Sue. 
Sue said, "Mom, can you explain what this is?" Her mom looked at the fork and said, "That is a fork, Sue. We use it to eat food." Sue thought that was fine and wanted to try it.
At dinner, Sue used her fork to eat her peas. She was very happy to learn something new. Sue's mom was proud of her for asking and learning. They both had a fine time at dinner.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Anna. She had a toy named Gold. Gold was a small, soft bunny. Anna loved Gold very much.
One day, Anna and Gold went to the park. They played and moved around a lot. But when it was time to go home, Anna could not find Gold. She felt very sad.
Anna looked everywhere for Gold. She asked her mom and dad to help her. They moved around the park, searching for the bunny. Finally, they found Gold under a tree. Anna was so happy, and she hugged Gold tight. From that day on, she never let Gold out of her sight.

Once upon a time, there was a mighty dog named Max. Max was very strong and loved to help his friends. One day, Max saw a small cat stuck in a tree. The cat was scared and crying for help.
Max said, "Don't worry, little cat. I will save you!" He jumped high and caught the cat in his mouth. He gently put the cat down on the ground. The cat was happy and said, "Thank you, Max!"
Max's friend, a little girl named Lily, saw what happened. She gave Max a gift, a bar of soap. She said, "Max, you are so kind. This soap will help you stay clean and strong." Max and Lily learned that being helpful and kind to others is very important.

Chip was a little boy who wanted to explore the world. One day he saw a big bus passing by and thought it would be fun to take a ride! He ran outside and hopped on the bus just as it was about to leave. But then, all of a sudden, the bus stopped. Chip was confused. He looked around and noticed that everything was frozen. Nothing was moving! He was so troubled and didn't know what to do.
Then a kind looking lady walked up to Chip and asked him why he was so troubled. He told her about the bus that wouldn't move, and the lady smiled. She explained that the bus would freeze in one spot until it was ready to move again. Chip was relieved and happy to hear this.
The kind lady made sure Chip was safe and then hopped back on the bus as soon as it started moving again. From that day onwards, Chip was no longer troubled when he saw a bus freeze. He knew that it would soon be ready to take him on another adventure!

Once upon a time, there was a big tower. It was very tall and strong. Inside the tower, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the tower every day. One day, Lily saw a big bird near the tower. She was eager to make a new friend.
"Hello, big bird! Do you want to play with me?" Lily asked. The big bird looked at her and nodded its head. They started to play together. They laughed and had lots of fun. 
But then, something unexpected happened. The big bird flew too close to the tower and disturbed it. The tower began to shake and wobble. Lily was scared. The big bird was scared too. They didn't want the tower to fall down.
"Big bird, we have to save the tower!" Lily said. Together, they pushed the tower to make it strong again. The tower stopped shaking and wobbling. Lily and the big bird were happy that they saved the tower. They played together every day and became the best of friends.

One day, a little duck named Ducky wanted to go to the bathtub. He liked to play in the water with his friend, Froggy. Ducky walked slow to the bathtub, because he wanted to enjoy the nice day.
When Ducky got to the bathtub, he saw Froggy already there. Froggy said, "Hi, Ducky! Let's play in the water!" Ducky was happy and jumped into the bathtub with Froggy. They splashed and laughed together.
After playing for a long time, Ducky and Froggy got tired. They sat on the edge of the bathtub and talked. Ducky said, "I had fun today!" Froggy smiled and said, "Me too, Ducky! Let's play again tomorrow!" They both agreed and went home, excited to play in the bathtub again the next day.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Abi. She loved to go into the wild woods outside her village. 
One day, Abi asked her mummy if she could go and explore the woods by herself. Mummy wasn't sure - it was dangerous in the woods and Abi didn't have a jacket. 
But Abi was brave and said, "I can look after myself". 
So Mummy said, "Alright, you can go by yourself but remember to bring your jacket." 
Abi was so excited! She ran outside and started exploring the wild woods. She ran and ran, but the further away she went, the colder it became. 
Soon Abi started to get cold and she began to shiver. If only she had brought her jacket, she thought. 
She quickly ran back to her mummy and said, "Mummy, will you bring my jacket - I want to explore the wild woods but it is too cold without it!" 
Mummy smiled and said, "Yes, Abi - but next time remember to bring your jacket before you go to explore the wild woods - it is important to stay warm and safe". 
Abi nodded and thought about the moral of the story: always remember to bring what you need for your adventures!

Once there was a little girl named Lucy. She was only three years old, but she was very curious! 
One day, she was playing with her toys when her mom came in the room with a very unusual chess board. 
"What is that, Mommy?" asked Lucy. 
"This is a chess board," said Mommy. "Do you want to learn how to play it?"
Lucy nodded her head yes. So Mommy began to show Lucy how to play. 
Lucy loved playing chess. She practiced every day until she was a pro. But she also liked baking. 
One day, Lucy got the idea to bake a cake in the shape of a chess board. Lucy's mom was surprised, but she helped Lucy bake the cake. 
When they were done, they had a very unusual chess cake - and it tasted delicious!

Once upon a time, there was a clumsy cat named Tim. Tim always tried to do things right, but he would often fall or break things. One day, Tim saw a big tree with a bird on the tip of a branch. He wanted to catch the bird, so he started to climb the tree.
As Tim climbed, he slipped and almost fell, but he did not give up. He kept trying and trying, and soon he was very close to the bird. Just as he was about to catch the bird, something unexpected happened. The bird flew away and Tim saw a big, shiny star sitting on the tip of the branch.
Tim was so happy to find the star that he forgot about the bird. He carefully picked up the star and climbed down the tree. When he got to the ground, all of his friends were there to see what he had found. Tim showed them the star and they all cheered. Tim had succeeded in finding something even better than he had hoped for. And from that day on, Tim was not so clumsy anymore.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a pale boy named Tim. Tim had a toy train that he loved to play with. One day, he wanted to attach more cars to his train, but he did not have any yet.
Tim went to his friend, Sam, to ask for help. Sam said he had some cars that Tim could have. They both went to Sam's house to get the cars. Tim was very happy and excited.
But when they got to Sam's house, they found out that the cars were too big for Tim's train. Tim was very sad and cried. He could not attach the big cars to his train. Tim went home with no new cars, and his train stayed small.

Once upon a time, there was a little car named Zoom. Zoom was an obedient car who always listened to his driver. He had a friend named Patient, who was a small turtle. They liked to play together.
One day, Zoom and Patient had a race. Zoom was very fast, but Patient was slow. Zoom wanted to win, but he also wanted to be a good friend. So, he waited for Patient to catch up.
As they raced, a big truck came into their path. Zoom and Patient had to stop. The truck was not nice and did not want to move. Zoom and Patient worked together to find a way around the truck. They were brave and smart. In the end, they both won the race and were happy.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the store with his mom. They bought many things, but Tim's favorite was a big cookie. It was hot outside, so they walked home fast. Tim held the cookie tight in his hand.
At home, Tim saw his friend, Sam, playing outside. Tim ran to Sam and said, "Look, I have a big cookie!" Sam looked at the cookie and said, "Wow! Can I have some?" Tim smiled and broke the cookie in half. They both ate the cookie and it was very yummy.
Later, Tim and Sam wanted to mail a letter to their friend, Sue. They wrote a letter together and put it in a box. They walked to the mailbox and put the letter inside. Tim and Sam felt happy. They went back home and played until it was time for dinner.

Tom and Lily are hungry. They want to eat something yummy. But Mom is not home yet. She is at work.
"What can we eat?" Tom asks Lily.
Lily looks around the kitchen. She sees some bread, some cheese, some apples and some jam. She has a creative idea.
"Let's make cheese and jam sandwiches!" she says.
Tom likes cheese and jam. He thinks it is a good idea. He helps Lily cut the bread and the cheese. Lily spreads the jam on the bread. They put the cheese on top. They make four sandwiches.
They sit on the table and eat their sandwiches. They are very tasty. They drink some water too.
They hear the door open. Mom is home. She sees Tom and Lily eating their sandwiches. She smiles.
"Hello, my hungry kids!" she says. "Did you make these sandwiches by yourselves?"
"Yes, Mom!" Tom and Lily say. "We were creative!"
Mom hugs them. She is proud of them. She is happy they are safe. She joins them for a snack. She likes cheese and jam too.

Once upon a time, there was a young prince who lived in a castle. One day, the prince went to explore a new area behind the castle. He found a beautiful structure that was very attractive. He wanted to explore it, so he walked forward. Suddenly, he felt a sharp pain. He had stepped in a hole and hurt his foot. The prince was sad and didn't know what to do.
Then an old man appeared. He said he had a special power to heal. The old man placed his hands over the prince's foot and started chanting a magical word. Soon the prince felt the pain ease and his foot healed. The prince said thank you to the old man and looked around the structure. He was able to explore the place without any pain. 
The prince was thankful to the old man because he had healed his foot and let him explore the attractive structure. The prince also learned an important lesson: be careful where he stepped!

Once upon a time, there was a rich lady. She had a big house and a lot of toys. She liked to drink from a pretty glass. One day, she wanted to complete a puzzle with her friends.
While they were playing, a funny thing happened. A small bird flew in through the window. The bird saw the pretty glass and thought it was a flower. It tried to drink from the glass, but it was not a flower!
The rich lady and her friends laughed. They stopped playing with the puzzle and watched the bird. They gave the bird real water to drink. The bird was happy, and the rich lady and her friends became friends with the bird. From that day on, they all played together and had fun.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a stick in the park. The stick was enormous! He picked it up and started to play with it. He felt very happy to have found such a big stick.
As Tim was playing, he met a girl named Sue. "Look at my big stick!" said Tim. "Wow!" said Sue, "Can I play with you?" Tim said, "Yes, but be careful not to pinch your hand." Sue nodded and they played together with the enormous stick.
Later, Tim and Sue found a big box. They used the enormous stick to open it. Inside, they found lots of toys and games. They remembered Tim's warning about pinching and were very careful. Tim and Sue had a great time playing with the new toys and their enormous stick. They were so happy that they had found the big stick and the box of toys.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a nice boy named Tim. Tim was a dependable boy. He always helped his mom and dad. One day, Tim's mom asked him to go to the store and buy some rice. Tim said "Yes, mom!" and went to the store.
At the store, Tim saw a big box of candy. He wanted the candy, but he knew he had to resist. He had to buy rice for his mom. So, Tim picked up the rice and paid for it. He walked back home with the rice, feeling happy that he did the right thing.
When Tim got home, his mom and dad were so proud of him. They knew he was a good and dependable boy. They all had a nice dinner with the rice Tim bought. And as a special treat, Tim's mom gave him a small piece of candy for being such a good helper.

Once upon a time, there was a big bookcase. The bookcase had many books. Some books were not available. They were hiding.
One day, a little girl named Lily came to the bookcase. She wanted to find a book. She looked at the books and said, "Where are the hiding books?"
A small voice said, "I am here!" It was a book under a cover. Lily pulled the cover and saw the book. The book was special. It was a magic book!
Lily opened the magic book. The book took her to a fun place. She played with new friends. Lily was happy. She found the hiding book and had a great day.

One day, a little crab was walking on the beach. He found a big, cold shell. He thought it would be a nice place to nap.
"Hello, shell!" said the little crab. "Can I nap in you?" The shell did not say anything, but the crab went inside anyway. It was cozy and warm inside the cold shell. The little crab took a long nap.
When the crab woke up, he saw a small fish swimming by. The fish said, "Hi, crab! I like your shell. Can I nap in it too?" The crab said, "Yes, come in!" So the fish swam into the shell and they both took a nice nap together.

Once upon a time, there was a red ball. The red ball liked to play near the lake. One day, the red ball met a blue ball. The blue ball asked, "Do you want to play with me?"
The red ball said, "Yes! Let's play near the lake." So, they played together near the lake. They had lots of fun. They played catch and rolled around.
But then, the red ball and the blue ball saw a big problem. The lake was very dirty. They wanted to solve the problem. They thought and thought. They had an idea!
The red ball and the blue ball called all their friends. They all worked together to clean the lake. They picked up the trash and put it away. Soon, the lake was clean again.
The red ball and the blue ball were so happy. They did not know they could solve a big problem. Now they could play near the clean lake. And they made new friends too!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a modern house with her mom, dad, and dog named Spot. Lily loved to play with her toys and run in the park with Spot.
One day, Lily's mom said, "I have a surprise for you!" Lily was very excited. She loved surprises. She closed her eyes and waited. When she opened her eyes, she saw a big, colorful box. Lily opened the box and found a fun quiz game inside.
Lily played the quiz game with her mom, dad, and Spot. They all had a great time. The game had fun questions and they learned new things. Lily was so happy with her surprise. She played the quiz game every day and became very good at it.

Anna and Ben are twins. They like to help Mom and Dad with chores. Today, Mom asks them to clean the refrigerator. Anna and Ben say yes.
They take out all the food and put it on the table. They see milk, eggs, cheese, fruit, and vegetables. They also see some old bread and a smelly fish. They throw them in the trash.
They use a wet cloth and some soap to wipe the inside of the refrigerator. They make it shiny and fresh. They use a dry cloth to dry it. They are careful not to leave any water or soap.
They put the food back in the refrigerator. They arrange it neatly. They close the door and smile. They are proud of their work.
Mom comes and sees the clean refrigerator. She is very happy. She hugs Anna and Ben and says, "Thank you, my sweeties. You did a great job. How about some cookies as a reward?" Anna and Ben say yes. They love cookies. They love Mom. They love cleaning the refrigerator.

Once upon a time, there was a unique little crab named Pinchy. Pinchy lived in a big hospital near the sea. Pinchy liked to help the doctors and nurses by cheering up the sick kids.
One day, Pinchy saw a sad little girl named Mia. Mia was sad because she missed her mom and dad. Pinchy wanted to make Mia happy. So, Pinchy did a funny dance and pinched her nose gently. Mia laughed and felt better.
Every day, Pinchy would visit Mia and do funny things to make her smile. Mia and Pinchy became best friends. Soon, Mia felt better and could go home. Pinchy was happy that he helped Mia, and he continued to help other kids in the hospital.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to go to the river with her mommy. One day, they put on their tight shoes and went to the river.
When they got there, Lily saw a box. She asked her mommy, "What's in the box?" Her mommy said, "Let's unpack it and see." They opened the box and found a toy boat inside.
Lily and her mommy put the boat in the river. They watched it float away. Lily laughed and clapped her hands. They had a fun day at the river.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Tim. Tim had a tough cord that he liked to play with. He would pull it, swing it, and jump with it. Tim and his cord were best friends.
One sunny day, Tim took his cord outside to play. He was having so much fun that he didn't notice his cord was starting to disappear. Little by little, the tough cord was getting smaller.
Tim looked around and saw that his cord was almost gone. He felt sad and didn't know what to do. Then, he had an idea. Tim found some more cord and tied it to his old one. Now, his tough cord was back and they could play together again. Tim was happy and never let his cord disappear again.

Once upon a time, there were two friends called Eva and Francis. They wanted to build something special.
Francis said to Eva, "Let's build a sugar castle!"
Eva was excited. "Yes, let's do it!" She said.
So they found some sugar and they started to build their sugar castle. Eva carefully arranged the sugar bricks and Francis helped.
Soon the sugar castle was ready and it looked very beautiful.
"That's a really gentle sugar castle," said Eva. "I'm sure that the king and queen will be happy to live here."
Francis and Eva were proud of their beautiful sugar castle. They knew that it was a special place that they had built together.

One day, a boy named Tim went to ride his bike. He loved to ride up and down the street. His bike was red and shiny. Tim was the owner of the bike, and he took good care of it. He would clean it and make sure the tires were full of air.
As Tim was riding, he saw a tired dog lying on the grass. The dog was big and brown. Tim stopped his bike and walked over to the dog. He asked, "Are you lost, doggy?"
The dog wagged its tail and barked. Tim knew the dog needed help. He decided to find the owner of the dog. Tim and the dog walked around the street, asking people if they knew the dog.
Finally, they found the owner. She was a nice lady who was looking for her dog. She said, "Thank you, Tim, for finding my dog!" Tim felt happy that he could help. The lady and her dog went home, and Tim rode his bike back to his house, feeling tired but happy.

One day, a friendly dog named Spot went for a walk with his daddy. They walked in the park and saw many fun things. Spot liked to play with other dogs and run around. Daddy liked to watch Spot play and have fun.
"Spot, do you want to play with the ball?" asked Daddy. Spot disagreed, "No, Daddy, I want to play with my friends today." So, Spot played with his friends while Daddy sat on the bench.
While playing, Spot saw something big and strange. It was a big, colorful ball that moved on its own! Spot and his friends were surprised. They all played with the big ball and had a lot of fun. When it was time to go home, Daddy said, "Spot, that was a fun surprise!" Spot agreed and wagged his tail.

One day, a little boy named Tim looked up at the sky. He saw a big, icy comet. It was very pretty. Tim wanted to say hello to the comet.
Tim said, "Hi, comet! My name is Tim!" The icy comet looked down at Tim and bowed. It said, "Hello, Tim! I am Comet! Nice to meet you!"
Tim and Comet became friends. They played and had fun. They were both very happy. The end.

Lily loved to sing and dance. She wanted to be famous like the stars on TV. She practiced every day in her room, with her teddy bear as her audience. She dreamed of being on a big stage, with lights and music and people clapping for her.
One day, her mommy told her that there was a talent show at her school. She could sing and dance for everyone. Lily was very happy and excited. She picked her favorite song and dress. She asked her mommy to help her with her hair and makeup. She felt like a star.
When she got to school, she saw a big stage in the hall. There were many chairs for the people to sit. There were also many other kids who wanted to show their talents. Lily was a little nervous, but she remembered her dream. She waited for her turn, holding her teddy bear.
Finally, it was time for Lily to go on the stage. She heard her name and walked up the stairs. She saw her mommy and daddy and teacher and friends in the crowd. They smiled and waved at her. She felt happy and brave. She put her teddy bear on a chair and took the microphone. She sang and danced with all her heart. She felt the lights and music and people clapping for her. She felt like a star.
When she finished, she bowed and smiled. She heard a loud cheer and saw many flowers flying to the stage. She picked one and hugged it. She saw her mommy and daddy running to the stage. They hugged and kissed her. They told her she was amazing and they were proud of her. She felt loved and famous. She kissed her teddy bear and thanked him for being her audience. She felt like a star.

Once, there was a small shrimp who lived in the sea. The shrimp had an unusual color, like the sun. All of the other sea animals would tease the shrimp because of its color. The shrimp felt very sad and wanted to find a way to stop the teasing.
One day, the shrimp heard about a big fish who could help. The shrimp went to find the big fish and ask for help. The big fish listened to the shrimp's story and told the shrimp to wait for a special day.
The special day came, and the sun was hiding. All the sea animals were scared and missed the sun. Then, the unusual shrimp began to glow like the sun. The sea animals stopped teasing the shrimp and thanked it for bringing light to the sea. From that day on, the shrimp was happy and never teased again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy who was very eager. He wore his gear and went for a walk. He saw a big tree and decided to climb it.
As he climbed higher, he started to yawn. He was tired and wanted to take a nap. So he snuggled into a comfortable spot in the tree and fell asleep.
While he was asleep, a friendly squirrel came by. The squirrel liked the little boy, so it decided to give him a warm, snugly blanket.
The little boy was so happy that he jumped up and laughed. He thanked the friendly squirrel and hugged it. Then he used the blanket to have a cozy nap in the tree.
Once he was snuggled up, he yawned and fell asleep.

One day, a team of animals were playing a game in the forest. They had to find a hidden ball. The team had a big dog, a little cat, and a fast rabbit. They wanted to win the game and find the ball first.
The big dog said, "I will find the ball and we will win!" But the little cat and the fast rabbit were scared. They saw a big, mean bear near the hidden ball. The bear did not want the team to win.
The little cat said, "We have to be brave and not surrender to the bear." The team thought of a plan. The big dog barked loud, the little cat climbed a tree, and the fast rabbit ran around the bear.
The bear was so surprised that he ran away. The team found the hidden ball and won the game. They were happy they did not surrender and learned to work together.

Bob and his Dad were having a lot of fun. They were sliding down the hill. 
"Whee!" shouted Bob as he went down the hill again and again. 
"Look at me, Daddy!" said Bob. "I'm sliding so fast!"
His Dad smiled with pride. Bob felt like the luckiest kid in the world! 
After a few days of sliding down the hill, Bob and his Dad decided to try something new. They went to a spicy restaurant.
Bob looked around and was amazed. He loved the smells and the colors. 
"This looks amazing!" exclaimed Bob.
His Dad ordered a spicy dish for the both of them. 
"It looks so good," said Bob. He couldn't wait to try it. 
The food was delicious and Bob enjoyed every bite. It was definitely the spiciest food he had ever tasted! 
From that day on, Bob and his Dad knew which day was special. It was their slide and spice day!

Once upon a time, there was a little mouse who lived in a house. Every day, the mouse would run around and explore the house, looking for food and items to play with.
One day, the mouse heard a loud noise coming from the kitchen. He decided to investigate, so he slowly walked into the room. He was met with a deafening noise!
The mouse said, "What is that noise?" He saw a big metal machine in the corner and it was vibrating and making the noise. 
He asked, "What are you doing?" 
The metal machine said, "I'm making noise! Can't you hear?"
The mouse was surprised and said, "No, I'm deaf! Can you please stop?"
The machine quickly stopped the loud noise and the mouse jumped with joy. He was glad that his request was heard. He thanked the metal machine and he ran back home.
The end.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a huge bear. He was very strong and had a long staff. He loved to walk around the forest with his staff. One day, he met a small rabbit.
"Hello, rabbit!" said the huge bear. "Do you want to play with me and my staff?"
The rabbit was scared but said, "Okay, bear. What do you want to play?"
The bear said, "Let's finish building a big house with my staff. We can live there together."
So, the bear and the rabbit started to build the house. The bear used his staff to help. The rabbit was very tired, but the bear was happy.
In the end, the house fell down on the rabbit. The rabbit was hurt and cried. The bear was sad too. The moral of the story is to be careful when playing with big things, and always think about others' safety.

Once upon a time, there was a dependable cat named Tom. Tom liked to play with his best friend, a dog named Max. They played together all day long. One day, Tom wanted to borrow Max's ball to play with it. Max said, "Yes, you can borrow my ball."
While Tom was playing with the ball, he saw a wink of light in the sky. The light came closer and closer. Suddenly, a big bird came down from the sky and took Max's ball. Tom was very sad because he lost his friend's ball.
Tom and Max went to find the big bird to get the ball back. They looked everywhere, but they could not find the bird. Then, they saw the wink of light again. The big bird came down and gave the ball back to Max. The bird said, "I just wanted to play too." So, the big bird became their new friend, and they all played together. The unexpected thing was that the big bird wanted to be their friend, and they had lots of fun together.

Anna and Ben are twins. They like to play outside with their dog, Spot. One morning, they see a lot of fog outside. They want to go and explore.
"Can we go, Mom?" they ask. Mom nods and gives them their coats and hats. "Be careful and stay close," she says.
Anna and Ben run outside with Spot. They see the fog is thick and white. They can't see very far. They hear cars and birds, but they can't see them. They think it is fun and spooky.
They find a big tree and a bench. They sit on the bench and pretend it is a boat. They pretend the fog is the sea. They make boat noises and wave to each other. Spot barks and wags his tail.
Suddenly, they see a shape in the fog. It is big and dark. It is moving towards them. They feel scared. What is it? Is it a monster? Is it a bear?
Anna points to the shape and says, "Look, Ben! What is that?" Ben looks and says, "I don't know, Anna. Let's hide!" They jump off the bench and hide behind the tree. Spot hides with them.
The shape gets closer and closer. They hear a loud horn. They hear a voice. It is Dad. He is driving his truck. He is coming to pick them up.
"Dad!" they shout. They run to him and hug him. Dad hugs them back and smiles. He says, "I'm sorry, kids. I was late. I had to drive slowly in the fog. Are you okay?"
"We're okay, Dad," they say. "We were playing in the fog. It was fun and spooky. But we were scared of you. We thought you were a monster or a bear."
Dad laughs and says, "No, I'm not a monster or a bear. I'm your dad. And I'm glad you're safe. Come on, let's go home. Mom is waiting for us. She made pancakes for breakfast."
Anna and Ben are happy. They love pancakes. They get in the truck with Spot. They wave goodbye to the fog. They are not scared anymore. They are hungry and impatient. They can't wait to eat.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a little mouse. The little mouse was very clever. He had a lot of friends. One day, he found a mint. The mint smelled very good. The little mouse wanted the mint very much.
The clever little mouse had a plan. He put the mint far away from his home. He thought that if he put the mint far away, no one could find it. Then, the clever little mouse went home and told his friends about the mint. They all wanted the mint too. 
The next day, the clever little mouse and his friends went to find the mint. They walked and walked, but they could not find the mint. They walked so far that they got lost. The clever little mouse was sad. His plan did not work well. Now, the little mouse and his friends could not find their way home. They were lost in the big forest forever.

Once upon a time, in a big swamp, there lived a reliable frog named Fred. Fred loved to add rocks to his home. Every day, he would find new rocks and add them to make his home bigger and better.
One day, while Fred was out looking for rocks, he met a small fish. The fish said, "Hi, I'm Sam. Can I help you add rocks to your home?" Fred was happy and said, "Yes, Sam, let's add rocks together!"
As they were adding rocks, they found a big, shiny rock. They didn't know it was a magic rock. When they added the magic rock to the swamp, something unexpected happened. All the rocks in the swamp started to dance and sing!
Fred and Sam were surprised, but they laughed and joined the dancing rocks. From that day on, Fred and Sam were best friends, and their swamp was the most fun place to be.

One day, a playful dog named Max saw a big bag of oats. He wanted to hold the bag in his mouth and play with it. So, he took the bag and ran around the yard.
Max saw his friend, a little bird named Tim. Tim saw Max with the bag of oats and asked, "Can I have some oats, Max?" Max said, "No, I want to play with the bag." Tim was sad but flew away.
Max kept playing with the bag of oats, but he played too rough. The bag broke, and all the oats fell on the ground. Max was sad because he could not play with the bag anymore. Tim saw Max and said, "Now, no one can have the oats." Both Max and Tim were sad because they could not enjoy the oats together.

Once upon a time, there was a funny dog named Spot. Spot liked to play with a shiny gem. The gem was red and pretty.
One day, a big cat came and saw Spot with the gem. The cat wanted to tease Spot. So, the cat took the gem and ran away very fast.
Spot chased the cat and they had a fun race. In the end, Spot got his gem back. They both laughed and played together. Now, they are good friends who share the gem and have lots of fun.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big tree with many fruits. They are peaches. They are round and soft and sweet.
Lily and Ben want to pick some peaches. They ask their moms if they can. Their moms say yes, but be careful. Lily and Ben climb the tree. They are very happy. They pick some peaches and put them in a basket.
They see a lady on a bench. She is reading a book. She looks busy. Lily and Ben want to share their peaches with her. They go to the bench. They say hello. They offer her a peach. They say, this is for you. We picked it from the tree.
The lady smiles. She says thank you. She takes the peach. She says, you are very kind. She bites the peach. She says, it is very juicy and yummy. She says, do you want some of my book? She shows them the book. It has many pictures and words.
Lily and Ben say yes. They sit on the bench with the lady. They look at the book. They learn new things. They have fun. They are very happy. They make a new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a wealthy man who lived in a big house. He had many toys and a big garden. One day, he saw a small cat outside. The cat was wet because it had rained. The man felt sad for the cat and wanted to help.
The man brought the cat into his house. He dried the wet cat with a soft towel. The cat was happy and began to play with the man's toys. The man laughed and played with the cat too. They had a lot of fun together.
After a while, the man wanted to let the cat go back outside. But the cat did not want to leave. The cat insisted on staying with the man. The man smiled and let the cat stay. They became best friends and lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lucy. She loved to teach her little brother, Tim, new words. One day, they went on a safari with their mom and dad. They saw many animals like lions, elephants, and monkeys. Lucy and Tim were very excited.
On the safari, they met a deaf elephant named Ella. Ella could not hear, but she could feel the ground with her big feet. Lucy wanted to teach Ella some words, but she did not know how to do it. She thought and thought.
Then, Lucy had an idea. She would draw pictures in the dirt to show Ella the words. She drew a lion, an elephant, and a monkey. Ella looked at the pictures and started to copy them with her trunk. Lucy and Tim were very happy.
But then, something unexpected happened. A loud noise scared Ella and made her run away. She knocked over the safari car with her big body. Lucy, Tim, and their family were stuck in the car, and they could not get out.
The sun went down, and it was dark. The family was scared and sad. They had to wait until morning for help to come. The safari was not fun anymore, and they wished they were back home.

Once upon a time, there was a little cat named Kitty. Kitty was new in town and did not have any friends. One day, Kitty went to the park to play and have fun.
In the park, Kitty saw a big dog. The dog said, "Hi, I am Doggy. Do you want to play with me?" Kitty was scared, but she wanted to make friends. So, she said, "Yes, let's play together."
As they played, they heard a loud noise. Kitty and Doggy stopped to listen. They saw a big bird stuck in a tree. The bird cried, "Help me, please!" Kitty and Doggy worked together to help the bird. They pushed and pulled until the bird was free.
The bird said, "Thank you, Kitty and Doggy! You are my new friends!" Kitty, Doggy, and the bird played together all day. They were very happy and became best friends. And from that day on, Kitty was not scared anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a stubborn dog named Max. Max loved to play ball on the pitch near his home. Every day, Max would go to the pitch and play with his friends.
One sunny day, Max and his friends found a big box on the pitch. They did not know what was inside. They tried to open the box, but it was too hard. Max wanted to solve the problem. He thought and thought. Then, he had an idea.
Max asked his bird friend, Tim, to help. Tim was very smart. Tim looked at the box and saw a small hole. He put his beak in the hole and opened the box. Inside the box, there were many colorful balls. Max and his friends were so happy! They played with the new balls all day long. The unexpected surprise made their day even more fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia had a red notebook that she loved very much. She took her notebook with her everywhere she went. She liked to draw pictures and write her name in it.
One day, Mia saw a little boy named Tim at the park. Tim did not have a notebook, but he wanted one very much. He looked sad, and Mia wanted to help him. She thought about how grateful she was for her own notebook.
Mia went home and asked her mommy for another notebook. Her mommy said yes, and they went to the store to buy a blue notebook for Tim. Mia gave the notebook to Tim, and he was so happy. Tim said thank you, and they both played together at the park. Mia was grateful that she could help her new friend.

One sunny day, Tom and Sue went to play outside. They saw a big gray rock. It was very hot and dry. Tom said, "Look at the pretty rock!" Sue said, "Yes, it's nice!"
They walked around and found an empty box. It was under a tree. Sue said, "What can we do with this box?" Tom said, "We can put things in it!"
They picked up the gray rock and put it in the empty box. They found more rocks and put them in too. Soon, the box was not empty anymore. Tom and Sue were happy with their new rock collection. They went home to show their mom and dad.

Once upon a time, there was a chubby dog named Max. Max loved to play in the sand at the park. Every day, Max would run and jump in the sand, having lots of fun.
One day, Max saw a big pile of sand at the park. He wanted to work and make something fun. Max started to dig and push the sand with his paws. He worked hard and made a big sand hill.
Max was so happy with his sand hill. He ran up and down the hill, playing all day. Max's friends came to play with him too. They all had a great time playing on the sand hill that Max worked so hard to make.

One day, a thoughtful cat named Tom saw a big tree. He wanted to climb it. Tom tried, but he could not reach the top. He felt sad.
A kind dog named Max saw Tom. Max said, "Do you need help?" Tom nodded his head. Max had an idea. He told Tom to jump on his back. Tom jumped and they tried to reach the top together. It was a success!
But, oh no! A big bird lived in the tree. The bird was not happy. It said, "This is my tree! Go away!" Tom and Max were scared. They jumped down from the tree. Then, something unexpected happened. The bird said, "I am sorry. I was mean. Can we be friends?" Tom, Max, and the bird all became friends and played together.

One day, a little girl named Sally went for a walk. She saw a small box on the ground. "What is this?" she asked herself. She picked it up and opened it. Inside was a pretty watch. Sally put it on her wrist.
Sally walked to her friend Tim's house. She showed Tim the watch. "Look what I found!" she said. Tim looked at the watch and said, "Silly Sally, you have it on all stupid." Sally looked down and saw that the watch was upside down.
Tim helped Sally wrap the watch around her wrist the right way. Now they could both see the time on the watch. They laughed and played outside until it was time for dinner. Sally was happy she found the watch and had a fun day with her friend Tim.

Once upon a time, there was a unique little monkey named Momo. Momo loved to climb trees and play with his friends. One day, Momo saw a big tree he had never climbed before. He wanted to climb it and see the world from the top.
As Momo started to climb the tree, a big bird named Zuzu zoomed by him. Zuzu told Momo that he could not climb this tree because it was her special tree. Momo was sad, but he did not want to make Zuzu mad. So, he climbed down and went to find another tree to climb.
Momo told his friends about the big tree and Zuzu. His friends said they wanted to help Momo climb the tree. They all went to the tree and talked to Zuzu. They asked if they could all share the tree and play together. Zuzu agreed, and they all had fun climbing and zooming around the tree. The moral of the story is that sharing and working together can make everyone happy.

Tommy was a boy who liked to draw. He had many papers and crayons in his room. He drew animals, cars, houses and anything he could think of. He was very happy when he drew.
One day, he saw a new paper on his desk. It was white and shiny and had a gold sticker on it. Tommy wondered what it was. He picked it up and saw a note from his mom. It said: "This is a special paper for a special boy. You can draw anything you want on it and it will appear in real life. But be careful, you can only use it once. Love, Mom."
Tommy was amazed and excited. He thought of all the things he could draw and make appear. He wanted to draw a big cake, a rocket, a dinosaur, a robot and more. He could not decide what to draw first. He asked his teddy bear for advice.
"Teddy, what should I draw on this paper? It is magic and can make anything appear. But I can only use it once. What do you think?"
Teddy did not answer. He was just a toy. But Tommy pretended he could talk.
"Tommy, you are a very lucky boy. You have a magic paper. But you also have many other things. You have a nice room, a loving mom, a lot of papers and crayons, and me. You do not need more things to be happy. You should use your paper to draw something that will make someone else happy. That is the best way to use magic."
Tommy thought about what Teddy said. He realized Teddy was right. He did not need more things to be happy. He had enough. He decided to use his paper to draw something that will make someone else happy. He thought of his mom. She worked hard and was always kind to him. She liked flowers. Tommy decided to draw a big bouquet of flowers on his paper. He used all his crayons to make them colorful and beautiful.
When he finished, he saw the flowers appear on his desk. They smelled nice and looked charming. Tommy was proud of his drawing. He took the flowers and ran to his mom. He gave them to her and said:
"Mom, these are for you. I drew them on a magic paper. They are real. I love you."
Mom was surprised and touched. She hugged Tommy and thanked him. She said:
"Tommy, these are the most beautiful flowers I have ever seen. You are the most thoughtful and generous boy I have ever known. You used your magic paper to make me happy. I love you too."
Tommy and Mom smiled and kissed. They were very happy. Tommy learned that magic is not about having more things, but about sharing and caring. He also learned that his mom was the best magic of all.

Once there was a boy named Tim. Tim was not very smart. In fact, some people called him stupid. But Tim was very kind and always tried to help.
One day, Tim was walking when he saw a girl crying. She was holding a dirty toy. "Why are you crying?" Tim asked. "My toy is dirty," the girl said. Tim wanted to help, so he said, "I can wipe it for you!" Tim wiped the toy clean with his shirt. The girl smiled and thanked him.
A week later, Tim saw the girl again. This time, she was happy. She told Tim, "You are not stupid. You are very nice. Thank you for helping me." Tim smiled and felt happy too. From that day on, Tim and the girl were good friends.

One day, a sleepy cat named Tom went for a walk. Tom was very sleepy because he did not sleep well last night. He saw his friend, a bird named Sue. Sue was playing with her toys in the right order: red, blue, and green.
"Hi Sue," said Tom. "Can you change the order of your toys?"
Sue thought for a moment and said, "Okay, I will change the order." She put the toys in a new order: green, red, and blue. Tom liked the new order and smiled.
Just then, something unexpected happened. The toys started to dance and sing! Tom and Sue were surprised and laughed. They played with the dancing toys all day and had lots of fun. That night, Tom slept very well and was not sleepy at all.

Once upon a time, there was an ancient owner who lived in a huge house with her two cats. The cats were best friends and always played together.
One day, the cats started to quarrel. They chased each other all around the house, making a mess. The owner tried to stop them, but it didn't work.
Suddenly, the owner had an idea. She got out a box of toys and put them in the middle of the room. The cats stopped quarreling and went to play with the toys.
The cats were very happy and the owner was even happier. Soon, the cats and the owner were laughing and playing together.
The End.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Mary. Mary had a toy rabbit that she loved to hold. One day Mary asked her mom for a massage.
"Mommy, can you give me a massage?" Mary asked.
"Yes of course sweetheart," her mom replied.
Her mom called for Mary to come over to the bed and lay down. Mary lay down on the bed and her mom starting rubbing her back in circles. Mary enjoyed the massage so much. She asked her mom for regular massages.
"Mommy can I have a massage every day?" Mary asked.
"Yes, you can have a massage every day," her mom replied.
And so it was! Every day Mary would hold her rabbit tightly while her mom gave her a regular massage. Mary and her toy rabbit were very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a clever puppy named Spot. Spot loved to play outside with his friends. They liked to run, jump, and swing.
One sunny day, Spot and his friends went to the park. They saw a big swing. Spot wanted to try it. He jumped on the swing and started to move back and forth. His friends watched and clapped.
Spot had so much fun on the swing. He was a very clever puppy. His friends were happy to see him having fun. They all played together and had a great day at the park.

One day, a boy named Tim found a big hat. He liked the hat very much. He put it on his head and went to show his friend, Sue. Tim said, "Look at my new hat!"
Sue looked at the hat and saw that it was bad. She did not want to make Tim sad, so she said, "Let's read a book!" They read a book about a cat in a hat. The cat in the hat was very funny.
While they read the book, the hat on Tim's head started to move. It was not a good hat, but a bad hat! The hat jumped off Tim's head and ran away. Tim and Sue were scared, but they remembered the cat in the hat from the book. They knew what to do. They chased the bad hat and caught it. Tim and Sue were happy they read the book, and they were not scared of the bad hat anymore.

Once upon a time, in a big green forest, there was a lonely tree. The tree was sad because it had no friends. One day, a little boy named Tim came to the forest to play.
Tim saw the lonely tree and said, "Hi, tree! Why are you so sad?" The tree replied, "I am lonely. I have no friends to play with." Tim felt sad for the tree and wanted to help.
Tim looked around and saw a stream. He had an idea. He ran to the stream and asked, "Stream, will you be friends with the lonely tree?" The stream said, "Yes, I will be friends with the tree."
Tim went back to the tree and said, "Tree, I found you a friend! The stream will be your friend." The tree was so happy. It hugged Tim and said, "Thank you, Tim, for finding me a friend."
From that day on, the tree and the stream were best friends. They played together every day, and the tree was not lonely anymore.

Lila loved pink. She had a pink dress, a pink hat, a pink bike, and a pink doll. She wanted to show her pink things to her friend Mia, who lived across the street. But it was raining. Lila did not like rain. It made everything wet and gray.
"Mommy, can I go to Mia's house?" Lila asked.
"Not today, sweetie. It's raining too hard. Maybe tomorrow." Mommy said.
Lila was sad. She looked out the window and saw the raindrops falling. She wished they were pink. She wondered if there was a place where it rained pink.
She decided to ask her daddy, who knew a lot of things. He was in his office, working on his computer.
"Daddy, is there a place where it rains pink?" Lila asked.
Daddy smiled and looked at Lila. He knew she loved pink.
"Well, there is a very rare place where it rains pink sometimes. It's called the Pink Lake. It's in a faraway country, where the water has a lot of salt and algae. The algae make the water pink, and when it rains, the raindrops are pink too. It's very beautiful." Daddy said.
Lila's eyes widened. She imagined the Pink Lake, with pink water, pink rain, and pink sky. She wanted to see it.
"Can we go there, Daddy? Please?" Lila begged.
Daddy chuckled and hugged Lila.
"Maybe someday, Lila. Maybe someday. But for now, why don't we make some pink cookies? I think Mommy has some pink sprinkles in the kitchen. Would you like that?" Daddy asked.
Lila nodded and smiled. She liked cookies. And she liked pink. And she liked Daddy.
They went to the kitchen and made some pink cookies. They ate them with milk and shared them with Mommy. Lila was happy. She forgot about the rain. She thought about the Pink Lake. She hoped to see it someday. She thought it would be the most wonderful thing in the world.

Once upon a time, there was a king. The king was very dull. He did not like to play or have fun. His people were sad because the king was always serious.
