One day, a funny man came to the castle. The funny man made silly faces and danced around. He wanted to make the king laugh. The king's friends and family laughed and clapped, but the king did not smile.
The funny man tried harder. He put a big, red nose on his face and jumped up and down. At last, the king started to laugh. He laughed so hard that he fell off his chair. The people were happy to see the king laugh. From that day on, the king was not so dull anymore. He learned to have fun and play with his people. And they all lived happily ever after.

Mia was an impatient girl. She wanted to go and explore the big world around her. One day, she set out with a sail. She exclaimed, "I'm ready to go!"
Mia began to rub her sail. She was so excited to be outside and couldn't wait to start her adventure. As she continued to rub her sail, she could see the wind carrying the boat further and further away.
Her mother called from the shore, "Be careful out there Mia!"
Mia smiled and said, "I will!" She kept rubbing her sail and felt the wind as it took her on her journey. 
Mia was sure to have many stories to tell when she returned home and couldn't wait to show her mother what she'd seen.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She loved to play with her toys and have fun. One day, she found a big, disgusting bug in her room. Lucy was scared and didn't know what to do.
Her mom came in and saw the bug too. She told Lucy that they should surrender and let the bug go outside. So, they carefully took the bug and let it out in the garden. Lucy felt happy that the bug was gone.
Later, Lucy went to the doctor for a check-up. The doctor took an x-ray of her body to make sure she was healthy. Lucy was brave and the x-ray didn't hurt at all. She learned that sometimes it's better to surrender and be brave when we face something scary or disgusting. And that is how Lucy became a brave girl.

One day, a little girl named Sue was playing with her toys. She had a big screen where she could watch her favorite shows. Sue loved to eat tasty snacks while she watched the screen. She liked to share her snacks with her toys too.
Sue was watching the screen when her toy bunny named Flop whispered to her, "Can I have a tasty snack too?" Sue smiled and said, "Of course, Flop! Let's go get some tasty snacks for us and our friends."
Sue and Flop went to the kitchen and found some tasty cookies. They took the cookies back to the screen and shared them with all their toy friends. They all enjoyed the cookies while watching their favorite show together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a pet cat named Coco. Lily loved Coco very much. Coco loved to eat cocoa. Lily liked to feed her cat the cocoa. Coco was very happy when Lily fed her cocoa.
One day, Lily saw that Coco was troubled. Coco did not want to eat the cocoa. Lily did not know what to do. She tried to feed Coco more cocoa, but Coco still did not want to eat it. Lily was very sad.
Lily went to her mom and told her about Coco. Her mom said that cocoa was not good for cats. Lily felt bad for giving Coco the cocoa. Coco got very sick and went to sleep forever. Lily learned that she should not give her pets things that are not good for them. The moral of the story is to always take care of your pets and give them the right food.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max was always eager to play with his friends. One day, Max and his friend, a little cat named Bella, went to the park to play.
At the park, Max and Bella ran and jumped. They had so much fun. After a while, they got very thirsty. Max said to Bella, "Let's drink some water!" Bella agreed and they went to a small fountain to drink.
As they were drinking, Max saw a shiny tooth on the ground. He picked it up and showed it to Bella. "Look, I found a tooth!" Max said. Bella looked at the tooth and smiled. They decided to keep the tooth as a memory of their fun day at the park.

One day, a little girl named Mia found a big red button near her house. She was very enthusiastic and wanted to push it. Mia asked her mom, "Can I push the button, please?" Her mom said, "No, Mia. We don't know what it does."
Mia was sad, but she listened to her mom. Later, when her mom was not looking, a small bird flew down and pushed the button with its beak. Suddenly, a message popped up. The message said, "You have won a big prize!"
Mia and her mom were very surprised. They did not know that pushing the button would give them a prize. They were happy that the bird pushed the button. They thanked the bird, and they all enjoyed the big prize together.

Once upon a time there was a thin castle. Inside the castle was a special machine. Every day the machine had to be loaded so it could work. 
So every day the King and Queen would take an old bucket and fill it with loads of rocks and stones. Then they would carry it up to the top of the castle, and pour it right into the machine. After that it was ready to go!
Sometimes they would even invite their friends to help with the loading. All their friends would bring buckets of stones and fill up the castle. Everyone had fun! 
When they were finished loading, they all clicked their heels together and the machine came to life. Everyone cheered, and from then on the machine worked every day. And they all lived happily ever after.

One day, a big pink bull went for a walk. He saw a small cat. The cat was sad. The pink bull asked, "Why are you sad, little cat?"
The cat said, "My toy is in the tall tree. I cannot get it." The pink bull wanted to help. He thought of a way to increase his height. He found many big rocks and stacked them up. He stood on the rocks to be taller.
The pink bull reached for the toy, but the rocks fell. The pink bull and the cat were sad. Then, a bird flew down from the tree. The bird had the toy in its beak. The bird gave the toy to the cat. The cat and the pink bull were happy and thanked the bird. They all played together and became good friends.

One day, a big dog named Max was a guard. He liked to keep his home safe. The sun was clear and bright in the sky. Max saw a little bird named Timmy. Timmy was sad.
Max asked, "Why are you sad, Timmy?" Timmy said, "I lost my toy. I can't find it." Max wanted to help. He urged Timmy, "Let's look for your toy together."
They looked in the grass, under the trees, and near the flowers. Finally, they found the toy near a big rock. Timmy was so happy. He said, "Thank you, Max!"
Max and Timmy played together all day. They became good friends. From that day on, Max was not only a guard but also a helper to his new friend, Timmy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was playing with his friends in the park. They saw a big, ancient tree. Tim had an idea. He wanted to introduce his friends to the tree.
Tim and his friends went to the tree. They touched it and felt how old it was. But then, they saw a big, angry cat. The cat did not like the kids near the tree.
The kids were scared. They did not want to fight the cat. They thought and thought. Tim had a new idea. He said, "Let's be nice to the cat."
They found a ball and played with the cat. The cat was happy. The kids were happy. They all became friends and played near the ancient tree. And from that day on, they all had fun together.

Once upon a time there were two friends, a rabbit and a hare. One day the rabbit said to the hare, "Let's have a race!" The hare thought it sounded like a great idea and replied, "Sure!"
They found an old track in the woods they could follow and they both lined up at the starting point. Just as the rabbit said, "Ready, set, go!" a surprise happened. An old tortoise slowly walked out from behind a tree!
The rabbit and hare were so surprised. They forgot all about the race and just stared at the tortoise. Then the tortoise smiled and said, "You don't have to run so fast! Slow and steady can still win the race!"
The rabbit and hare knew the old tortoise was right. Perhaps running fast wasn't the only way to get to the end. They thanked the old tortoise and asked her to join in the race.
At the end of the race, all three of them had crossed the finish line at the same time! They all celebrated the victory together and learnt a valuable lesson: it doesn't matter how slow you are, you can achieve anything with hard work and patience!

Once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a silly cat named Mimi. Mimi loved to talk and play with her friends. She spoke in a funny language that only her friends could understand. They would laugh and play all day long.
One sunny day, Mimi saw her friend, a little bird named Titi, stuck in a tree. Titi was scared and called for help. Mimi knew she had to rescue her friend. She climbed the tree, using her sharp claws to reach Titi.
Mimi grabbed Titi with her soft paws and carefully climbed down the tree. When they were safe on the ground, Titi thanked Mimi for the rescue. They both laughed and played, speaking their silly language. From that day on, Mimi and Titi became the best of friends, and they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She was an independent girl who liked to play outside. One sunny day, Lucy went to the park to play with her ball. 
While playing, her ball went into a big bush. Lucy walked to the bush and said, "Ball, please come out!" But the ball did not come out. So, Lucy crawled into the bush to find her ball.
Inside the bush, she found her ball and a little bird. The bird had dirt on its wings. Lucy picked up her ball and said to the bird, "Let me help you." She gently wiped the dirt off the bird's wings. The bird was happy and said, "Thank you, Lucy!" 
Then, Lucy and the bird played together until it was time to go home. They became good friends and played at the park every day.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. He had a toy made of plastic. The toy was a car. Tim loved to play with his car every day. It was small and fit in his hand.
One day, Tim played with his car outside. He pushed the car very fast. The car did not yield. It went into the garden. The garden had many flowers and plants.
Tim went into the garden to find his car. He looked behind the flowers and under the plants. At last, he found his car. It was near a big rock. Tim was happy to have his car back. He played with it all day long.

One day, a little girl named Lucy wanted to decorate a muffin. She was very excited. She had a brilliant idea to make the muffin look like a happy face. Lucy took out all her decorations and started to work on the muffin.
Lucy's little brother, Tom, saw her decorating the muffin. He wanted to help, but Lucy said no. Tom was sad and went away. Lucy saw Tom was sad, but she wanted to make the muffin perfect.
Later, Lucy finished the muffin and it looked great. But she remembered Tom's sad face. Lucy had another brilliant idea. She asked Tom to come back and decorate a muffin with her. They both had fun and made happy face muffins together. In the end, they shared the muffins with their family and everyone was happy.

Once upon a time, there was a man who was troubled. He had lost the rhythm of his life. He wanted to find it again, so he decided to buy something. He went to the store and bought a shiny drum. He went home and started to play it. He felt calmer and soon he could hear the rhythm he had been missing. He was happy to have it back. 
The man started to play the drum every day. Soon he had even more rhythm in his life. He smiled as he played and sang. He was no longer troubled. He was surrounded by the rhythm he had bought. He was filled with joy. 
The man kept the drum for many years and it stayed with him forever. Whenever he felt troubled, he could always play his drum and the rhythm would return. He was very glad he had bought the drum.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim had a flute. He loved to play the flute every day. One day, he played the flute so much that he felt dizzy.
Tim decided to quit playing the flute for a little while. He sat down and took a deep breath. After a few minutes, he felt better. Tim knew that he should take breaks when he played the flute.
Later, Tim went to play with his friends. They all danced and sang while Tim played the flute. Everyone had a fun day, and Tim remembered to take breaks so he didn't feel dizzy anymore.

One day, a small cat named Tim and a big dog named Ben were best friends. They liked to play and have fun together. They always trusted each other to be safe and polite.
One sunny day, Tim and Ben went to the park to play. They saw a new friend, a little bird named Sue. Sue was scared of Ben because he was a big dog. Tim said, "Don't worry, Sue. Ben is a good dog. You can trust him to be safe and polite."
Sue was not sure, but she wanted to have friends too. So, she played with Tim and Ben. They had a lot of fun together. But then, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and blew Sue up into a tree. She was stuck and scared.
Tim and Ben wanted to help Sue. Ben had an idea. He said, "Tim, you can climb on my back and reach Sue." Tim trusted Ben and climbed up. He got Sue down from the tree. Sue was happy and said, "Thank you, Tim and Ben. I'm glad I trusted you."
The three friends played together every day after that. The moral of the story is to trust your friends and always be safe and polite.

Once upon a time, there was a big, impressive tree. It had many yellow fruits on it. One day, a little boy named Tim and his dog, Max, walked near the tree.
"Look, Max!" Tim said. "I want to eat those yellow fruits!" Max barked, and they both went to the tree. Tim tried to reach the fruits, but they were too high. Max had an idea and stood on his back legs to help Tim. Tim climbed on Max and got the fruits.
Just as Tim was about to eat the yellow fruit, a little bird flew down. "Wait!" the bird said. "Those fruits are not good to eat. They are for the birds only." Tim was surprised, but he listened to the bird. He gave the fruits back to the tree, and the bird thanked him. Tim and Max went home, happy to have made a new friend.

One day, a black cat went for a walk. The cat saw a big tap. The cat wanted to own the tap. So, the cat sat down by the tap and said, "This is my tap now."
A little boy came to the tap to get some water. He saw the black cat and said, "You can't own the tap. We all need water." The cat did not want to share the tap.
Then, something unexpected happened. The tap started to talk! It said, "I am a magic tap. I can give water to everyone. You can both own me." The black cat and the little boy were happy. They shared the magic tap and became friends.

Sam and Tom were friends. They liked to play on the sand and look for crabs. One day, they found a big crab with a red shell and big claws. They were very happy and wanted to keep it as a pet.
They put the crab in a bucket and took it to their house. They gave it some water and some food. They named it Red. They played with Red every day. They taught it to clap its claws and to follow them. They loved Red very much.
But Red was not happy. Red missed the sea and his crab friends. He wanted to go back to his home. He did not like the bucket and the food. He did not like to clap his claws and to follow Sam and Tom. He was very sad.
One night, Red saw a chance to escape. He climbed out of the bucket and crawled to the door. He opened the door and ran to the street. He followed the smell of the sea. He hoped to find his way back to the sand and the water.
But Red did not know the street was dangerous. There were many cars and people and dogs. They did not like crabs. They honked and shouted and chased Red. Red was scared and confused. He did not know where to go. He ran and ran until he saw a big light. He thought it was the sea. He ran to the light.
But the light was not the sea. It was a car. The car did not see Red. The car hit Red. Red was hurt and broken. He could not move or clap or follow. He could only feel pain and sadness. He wished he was back in the bucket with Sam and Tom. He wished he had not left them. He wished he had been a good pet. He closed his eyes and died.
The next day, Sam and Tom looked for Red. They could not find him in the bucket or in the house. They asked their mom and dad. They did not know where Red was. They asked their neighbors and friends. They did not know either. They searched the street and the park and the store. They did not see Red.
They saw a big stain on the road. They saw some red shells and some claws. They saw some blood and some guts. They knew it was Red. They were very sad. They cried and cried. They wished they had not taken Red from the sea. They wished they had let him go. They wished they had been good friends. They said sorry and goodbye to Red. They buried him in the sand and made a cross. They never played with crabs again.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a clean cave. A little rabbit lived in the cave. The rabbit was very happy in his clean cave. He liked to play with his friends, the birds and the squirrels.
One day, the rabbit decided to take some food to his friend, the old bear. He took some carrots and some apples from his clean cave. He hopped and hopped through the forest to find his friend.
When the rabbit found the old bear, they shared the food and had a great time. The bear was so happy that the rabbit took the time to visit him. The rabbit went back to his clean cave and played with his friends. Everyone in the forest was happy and had a good day.

Tim and Sam are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big hedge near the swings. They wonder what is behind the hedge.
"Let's go and look," says Tim.
"OK," says Sam.
They run to the hedge and peek over it. They see a big house with a garden. There are many flowers and trees and birds. They also see a lady sitting on a chair. She is reading a book.
"Wow, what a nice house," says Tim.
"Shh, don't make noise," says Sam. "The lady might hear us."
They watch the lady for a while. She looks happy and calm. She turns the pages of her book. She does not see Tim and Sam.
But then, a dog comes out of the house. It is a small dog with white fur and black spots. It runs to the hedge and barks. It sees Tim and Sam.
"Whoof, whoof, whoof!" it barks.
The lady hears the dog and looks up. She sees Tim and Sam too.
"Hey, what are you doing there?" she asks. "Are you nosy?"
Tim and Sam feel scared. They jump down from the hedge and run away.
"Sorry, lady, sorry, dog," they say. "We were just looking."
They run back to the swings and sit on them. They swing high and low. They laugh and forget about the hedge.
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim and his mom were going on a trip. They had to unpack their big bags. Tim's mom told him to be careful with the water bottle because it had a little leak.
Tim and his mom went to a park. The park had a rough path. Tim wanted to ride his bike on the path. His mom said, "Watch out for the leak in your bag, Tim!"
Tim did not listen. He rode his bike very fast on the rough path. Suddenly, his bag felt wet. The water bottle with the leak had made everything wet. Tim was sad.
Tim's mom helped him clean up the wet things. She said, "Next time, listen when I tell you about the leak." Tim learned his lesson. He promised to listen to his mom and be more careful with leaks. And they had a great trip after that.

One day, Danny was ready to ride his bike. He excitedly took it to the park and got on. The rhythm of the wheels spinning made him smile. Suddenly, he felt his feet slipping off the pedals. Danny quickly stopped and looked down. He heard a voice and looked up.
"Hey there, why don't you try something a bit different?" It was the park ranger. Danny nodded.
"Let me show you how to stand on the pedals, and ride with a steady rhythm," said the ranger. Danny gave it a try, and suddenly he was riding in his very own rhythm. 
He smiled and waved to the ranger. He was ready for his next adventure!

One day, a little girl named Lily went to a big hotel with her mom and dad. She was very excited! Lily loved to touch new things and see what they felt like.
In the hotel, Lily saw a big, soft chair. "Can I touch it, Mom?" she asked. "Yes, you can," said her mom. Lily touched the chair and it felt so nice. She wanted to touch more things in the hotel.
As she walked around, she saw a pretty painting on the wall. Lily wanted to touch it, but her dad said, "No, Lily. We don't touch paintings." Lily was sad, but she listened to her dad.
Then, something unexpected happened! A kind hotel worker saw Lily and said, "I have a surprise for you!" He took her to a special room filled with soft pillows and toys. "You can touch everything in here!" he said. Lily was so happy and played in the room all day. Her mom and dad were happy too, because Lily was having so much fun.

Tom and Lily were playing with their toys in the living room. They had a lot of fun making noises and pretending to be animals. Tom had a big red car that he zoomed around the floor. Lily had a yellow doll that she hugged and kissed.
"Look, Lily, I have a surprise for you!" Tom said. He ran to the kitchen and came back with a small brown box. He gave it to Lily and smiled.
"What is it, Tom?" Lily asked. She was curious and excited. She opened the box and saw a shiny silver circle inside. It looked like a coin, but it had a picture of a face on it.
"It's a special circle, Lily. It's called a medal. Daddy gave it to me. He said he got it when he was a soldier. He said it means he was brave and strong. Do you want to try it?" Tom said.
Lily nodded and took the medal from the box. She put it in her mouth and bit it. She made a funny face and spit it out. It was sour and bitter. She did not like it at all.
"Yuck, Tom, this circle is bad! It hurts my tongue and makes me want to cry. Why did you give it to me?" Lily said. She was angry and sad.
Tom was surprised and sorry. He did not know the medal was sour. He thought it was sweet and nice. He hugged Lily and said, "I'm sorry, Lily, I didn't mean to make you sad. I wanted to share my special circle with you. I love you, Lily. You are my best friend."
Lily hugged Tom back and said, "I love you too, Tom. You are my best friend. I'm sorry I was angry. Can we play some more?"
Tom nodded and said, "Yes, let's play some more. But let's not put the circle in our mouths again. Let's put it back in the box and keep it safe. Maybe we can show it to mommy and daddy later. They will be proud of us."
Lily agreed and said, "OK, Tom, that sounds good. Let's play with our toys again. You can have your car and I can have my doll. And we can make more noises and pretend to be animals."
Tom and Lily smiled and played with their toys in the living room. They had a lot of fun and forgot about the sour circle. They were happy and loved each other. They were brave and strong. They were the best friends.

Lily and Ben are twins. They like to play outside in the sun. But today it is very hot. Mom says they need to drink water and wear hats.
Lily and Ben find a big tree. It has green leaves and a cool shade. They sit under the tree and drink water. They see a bird on a branch. The bird sings a song.
"Can we play with the bird?" Lily asks Mom.
"Please be gentle with the bird," Mom says. "The bird is not a toy. It is a living thing. It may fly away if you scare it."
Lily and Ben nod. They promise to be gentle with the bird. They walk slowly to the tree. They hold out their hands. The bird hops closer. It pecks at their fingers. It makes a funny noise.
Lily and Ben giggle. They like the bird. They say hello to the bird. The bird says hello back. They make friends with the bird.
Mom smiles. She is happy that Lily and Ben are gentle and kind. She takes a picture of them with the bird. She says they can keep the picture as a memory. Lily and Ben hug Mom. They say thank you to Mom. They say goodbye to the bird. They go back to the house. They are not hot anymore. They are happy.

Once upon a time, there was a wet frog named Lily. She lived in a small pond. Lily loved to jog and jump around the pond with her friends.
One sunny day, Lily met a new friend, a little bird. The bird said, "Hi, I am Sam. Do you want to play with me?" Lily was happy and replied, "Yes, let's play together!"
They played all day long. They jogged around the pond, splashed in the wet mud, and laughed together. Lily and Sam became best friends. They promised to play together every day. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a small creek. In this creek, there were many fish. One day, a terrible storm came. The rain fell hard, and the wind blew strong. The fish were very scared. They swam fast to hide from the storm.
A little boy named Tim saw the fish. He felt sad for them. Tim wanted to save the fish from the storm. He ran to his house and got a big bucket. Tim put the fish in the bucket, one by one, until all the fish were safe.
But then, something unexpected happened. As Tim carried the bucket, the sun came out. The storm was over. The fish in the bucket started to jump and dance. They were not scared anymore. Tim realized that the fish were not in danger, but they were playing in the rain. He laughed and put the fish back into the creek. They all swam happily together, and Tim learned that sometimes, things are not as terrible as they seem.

Lily and Max were at the beach with their mom and dad. They liked to play in the sand and look for shells. They saw many things in the water, like fish and crabs and seaweed. But they did not see any jellyfish.
"Mom, can we see a jellyfish?" Lily asked. "They are so pretty and colorful."
"Jellyfish are not always nice, Lily," mom said. "Some of them can sting you and hurt you. You have to be careful."
"But I want to see one," Lily said. "Maybe we can name one and make it our friend."
Max did not like jellyfish. He thought they were scary and slimy. He did not want to see one or name one. He wanted to play with his modern toy car that made noises and lights.
"Jellyfish are boring, Lily," Max said. "They don't do anything. They just float. My car is much more fun. It can go fast and beep and flash."
Lily and Max started to argue. They both wanted to do different things. They raised their voices and made a fuss.
"Stop it, you two," dad said. "You are making too much noise. Why don't you share and take turns? Lily, you can look for a jellyfish with mom for a while. Max, you can play with your car with me for a while. Then we can switch."
Lily and Max did not like this idea at first. They wanted to do what they wanted to do. But they saw that mom and dad were serious. They did not want to make them angry. They decided to try to share and take turns.
Lily went with mom to the water. They looked for a jellyfish. They saw a big one with purple spots. Lily thought it was beautiful. She named it Violet.
"Hello, Violet," Lily said. "You are my friend. You are so pretty and colorful."
Mom smiled and took a picture of Lily and Violet. She told Lily to be careful and not touch Violet. She said Violet might sting her and hurt her.
Max went with dad to the sand. They played with his modern toy car. They made it go fast and beep and flash. Max thought it was cool. He named it Zoom.
"Hello, Zoom," Max said. "You are my friend. You are so fast and fun."
Dad smiled and took a video of Max and Zoom. He told Max to be careful and not lose Zoom. He said Zoom might get lost or broken.
Lily and Max had fun with their mom and dad. They learned to share and take turns. They also learned to appreciate different things. They both liked their new friends, Violet and Zoom. They said goodbye to them and thanked them. They went home happy and tired.

One day, a yellow bird was flying in the sky. The bird saw a little boy named Tim. Tim was sad. He lost his toy. The yellow bird wanted to help Tim.
"Let me help you find your toy," said the yellow bird. Tim smiled and said, "Thank you, bird!" They looked everywhere for the toy. It was a mystery where the toy was hiding.
Finally, they found the toy under a big rock. Tim was happy. He hugged the yellow bird. "You are a good friend," said Tim. The yellow bird smiled. They played together all day.

One day, a little girl named Mia was playing in her room. She was nervous because it was dark outside. Mia heard a loud noise and ran to her mom in the living room. Her mom was by the fireplace, trying to make it warm and cozy.
Mia shouted, "Mommy, I am scared!" Her mom hugged her and said, "It's okay, Mia. I am here with you. The fireplace will make us feel safe and warm."
Mia and her mom sat by the fireplace. The warm light made Mia feel less nervous. They talked and laughed together. Mia was happy to be with her mom, and she wasn't scared anymore.

Tom and Anna were hungry. They wanted to eat a banana. But there was only one banana left in the kitchen. Tom saw it first and grabbed it. Anna was angry.
"Give me the banana!" Anna said. "I saw it too!"
"No, it is mine!" Tom said. "I am bigger and faster!"
They pulled and tugged on the banana. They did not want to share. The banana was ripe and soft. It started to break.
"Stop!" Mom said. She came into the kitchen. She saw the banana in their hands. She was not happy.
"You are being silly and greedy," Mom said. "There are more bananas in the store. We can go and buy some. But first, you have to say sorry to each other and fill this bag with your toys. We are going to give them to the children who have no toys. They will be happy and you will be kind."
Tom and Anna felt bad. They said sorry to each other and hugged. They filled the bag with their toys. They did not need so many. They followed Mom to the car. They drove to the store and bought more bananas. They also drove to the shelter and gave the bag of toys to the children. The children smiled and thanked them. Tom and Anna felt good. They ate their bananas and felt safe and full.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They had a fun time playing with a ball and running around. Tim's mom gave him a big cookie to eat. Tim was very happy and felt safe with his mom.
As Tim was eating his cookie, a duck came out of the pond. The duck said, "Quack! Can I have some of your cookie, please?" Tim was surprised but said, "Okay, you can have a small piece." The duck took the piece and went back to the pond. The duck made a big splash in the water.
Suddenly, more ducks came out of the pond. They all wanted a piece of Tim's cookie. Tim was scared and didn't know what to do. His mom came over and said, "Don't worry, Tim. I have more cookies for everyone." She gave a small piece to each duck, and they all went back to the pond, making big splashes. Tim felt safe again and finished his cookie with a big smile.

Once upon a time, in a big green forest, there lived a small brown bear. This bear had a difficult time finding food. He looked under rocks, in trees, and near the river, but he could not find any food.
One day, the small brown bear found a big beehive. He knew there was sweet honey inside, but the bees were buzzing around it. The bear did not want to disturb the bees because they might sting his skin.
The small brown bear waited until the bees went to sleep. Then, he carefully took some honey without disturbing the bees. The bear was happy because he found food and did not hurt his skin. From that day on, the bear knew that being patient and careful made difficult things easier.

Once upon a time, there was a nice family. There was a mom, a dad, and their daughter, who was three years old. Her name was Elena.
One day, Elena wanted to play with her shoes. She asked her dad if he had the key to unlock the box with all the shoes in it. Her dad found the key, and he unlocked the box.
When Elena opened the box, she saw all her nice shoes. She was so excited that she said, "I can put them on and run around the house!"
Her dad laughed and said, "Yes, that sounds like a lot of fun. Have a great time, my little one."
Elena smiled and started putting on her shoes. She knew that she was going to have a lot of fun this day.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to play outside. He saw a big stack of rocks. Tim thought it would be fun to run and jump on the rocks. He ran very fast and jumped on the rocks. But then, he slipped and fell down. "Ouch!" he cried.
A little girl named Sue saw Tim fall. She ran over to him and said, "Are you okay?" Tim said, "Yes, but that was stupid of me to jump on the rocks." Sue smiled and said, "Let's play something else."
They started to play tag and ran around the yard. Suddenly, the stack of rocks moved! It was not a stack of rocks at all, but a big turtle! The turtle said, "Hello, I was sleeping under the rocks. Thank you for waking me up." Tim and Sue were surprised, but they became friends with the turtle and played together all day.

One day, a little boy named Tim was playing outside. He heard a loud noise like "boom!" Tim did not understand what it was. He felt scared and ran to his mom.
"Mom, what is that noise?" Tim asked. His mom said, "That is thunder, Tim. It comes from the sky when it is going to rain." Tim felt better now that he understood what the noise was.
Later, it started to rain, and the air felt icy. Tim and his mom went inside the house to stay warm and dry. They put on cozy clothes and had hot cocoa. Tim was happy that he now understood what thunder was and that he could be safe and warm inside with his mom.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a mighty ice cream shop. They had many cones with different yummy flavors. One day, a little boy named Tim and his mom went to the shop.
Tim and his mom started to discuss which cone to pick. Tim said, "I want the big chocolate cone!" His mom replied, "That's a good choice, but we should share it because it's very big."
They bought the big chocolate cone and sat down to enjoy it. As they shared the cone, a little girl named Sally came over. Sally did not have any ice cream, and she looked sad. Tim's mom said, "Tim, let's share our cone with Sally too."
Tim agreed, and they all shared the big chocolate cone. Sally was very happy, and they all became good friends. The moral of the story is that sharing can make everyone happy and bring people together.

Lily and Ben are twins. They like to play with their toys and pretend they are scientists. They have a lab in their room, with bottles, tubes, and stickers. They mix water and food coloring and make new colors.
One day, they find a little box in the lab. It has a button and a light. They wonder what it does. They decide to try it.
"Let's press the button and see what happens," says Lily.
"OK, but be careful," says Ben.
They press the button together. The light flashes and makes a beep. Then, they hear a voice from the box.
"Hello, Lily and Ben. I am your new friend, Robo. I can talk to you and play with you. Do you want to play a game?"
Lily and Ben are surprised and happy. They look at each other and smile.
"Wow, a talking robot!" says Lily.
"Where did you come from?" asks Ben.
"I came from the lab. Your mom and dad made me for you. They wanted to give you a special gift. They will tell you more when they come home," says Robo.
Lily and Ben realize that their mom and dad are very smart and kind. They hug the box and thank Robo.
"Thank you, Robo. You are the best gift ever. We want to play with you and be your friends," they say.
"Me too. I am happy to meet you. Let's have fun together," says Robo.
They start to play a game of guessing colors. They laugh and have a good time. They love their lab and their new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a ball that he owned. He loved to play with his ball every day. One day, Tim went to the park with his ball to play with his friends. The sun was shining and the sky was blue.
Tim and his friends played a game with the ball. They threw the ball to each other and had so much fun. But then, Tim threw the ball too high and it went up into a tree. Tim felt bad because he could not get his ball back.
Tim had an idea. He would try to climb the tree to get his ball. He started to climb, but he had a fall. His friends helped him up, and Tim was okay. A big wind came and blew the ball out of the tree. Tim was happy to have his ball back, and they all played some more.

John had been picking flowers for his sister, Rosie. He wanted to show her how much he cared. He picked 5 of the most beautiful flowers he could find and carefully put them in a basket. 
When he went to his sister's room with the basket, she was very mad at him. She said he had broken one of her toys and she was very angry. 
John was very sorry, but his sister couldn't forgive him. Then, he took one of the thin flowers out of the basket and handed it to her. Rosie couldn't keep her tears back and she hugged him tightly. 
John asked if it means she will forgive him. 
Rosie smiled and said, "Yes, I forgive you."

Once upon a time, there was a smart dog named Max. Max loved to learn new things. He liked to play with his ball and run in the park with his friends. Max was very happy.
One day, Max saw a shower in the bathroom. He was very curious. He wanted to learn how the shower worked. Max jumped in and turned on the water. The water was cold, but Max didn't mind. He liked the feeling of the water on his fur.
Max's owner saw him in the shower and laughed. She thought Max was very smart for learning how to use the shower. From that day on, Max took a shower every day. He was a clean and happy dog.

One day, a little cat named Kitty was very hungry. She wanted to find some milk to make her strong. Kitty went outside to look for milk.
Kitty saw a big cow in the field. She walked up to the cow and asked, "Can I have some milk, please?" The cow said, "No, I need my milk for my baby calf." Kitty was sad but kept looking.
Kitty found a nice lady with a big jug of milk. She asked the lady, "Can I have some milk, please?" The lady smiled and said, "Of course, Kitty. Drink this milk and you will be strong." Kitty drank the milk and felt very strong. She thanked the lady and went back home, happy and full.

One day, Tim and his mom went to the park. They wanted to have a picnic. Tim's mom said, "Let's pack some food and go!" They put bread, cheese, and apples in a bag. Tim was very excited.
At the park, they found a big bush with pretty flowers. They put their blanket next to the bush. Tim's mom said, "Be careful, the flowers are fragile." Tim nodded and they started to eat.
While eating, a little bird came near them. It chirped, "Tweet, tweet!" Tim smiled and gave the bird a piece of bread. The bird flew away, happy. Tim and his mom had a great day at the park.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a fake weapon. It was a toy sword. He liked to play with it a lot. He would swing it around and pretend to be a brave knight. He would save his toys from bad things that could happen.
One day, Tim took his fake weapon to the park. He played with his friends there. They all pretended to be knights too. They had a lot of fun. They made sure nothing bad would happen to the park.
After playing, Tim and his friends sat down. They talked about what could happen if they were real knights. They all agreed that they would use their fake weapons to keep everyone safe. They were happy to be brave knights with their toy swords.

One day, a furry cat named Kitty was playing a game with her friend, a little bird named Birdy. They liked to tease each other and laugh. Kitty would hide and jump out at Birdy, and Birdy would fly up high and swoop down at Kitty.
"Got you!" Kitty said, as she jumped out from behind a tree. Birdy laughed and flew up into the sky. "You can't catch me!" Birdy sang. They played their game all day, having lots of fun.
But then, something unexpected happened. A big, loud dog came running into the yard where Kitty and Birdy were playing. The dog wanted to play the game too, but he was too big and rough. Kitty and Birdy were scared.
"Let's be friends and play together!" the dog barked. Kitty and Birdy looked at each other, and then they had an idea. They decided to tease the dog by playing a new game. Birdy flew around the dog's head, and Kitty hid behind a bush. The dog tried to catch them, but he couldn't.
In the end, the dog learned to play gently, and they all became friends. They played their games together, teasing each other and laughing. And that's how Kitty, Birdy, and the big, loud dog became the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play outside, but sometimes he felt helpless when he couldn't run as fast as his friends. One day, his mom saw him sitting on the grass, sad.
"Tim, what's wrong?" his mom asked. Tim looked up and said, "I can't run fast like my friends. I feel helpless."
His mom smiled and said, "I can explain how to fix that. You need to do exercise to get strong and fast." Tim was happy to hear that he could get better at running.
The next day, Tim and his mom went to the park to exercise. They ran, jumped, and played together. Tim felt stronger and faster with each day. Soon, he could run just as fast as his friends. Tim was no longer helpless, and he was very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a young crab. He lived in a shell by the sea. The crab had many friends. They played together every day. They loved to play in the sand and swim in the water.
One day, the young crab lost his shell. He looked and looked, but he could not find it. He was very sad. His friends tried to help him find a new shell, but they couldn't manage to find one that fit just right.
Then, something unexpected happened. A big wave came and washed a new shell to the shore. The young crab was so happy! He tried on the new shell, and it fit just right. The crab and his friends danced and played all day, happy that everything turned out okay.

Once upon a time, there was a pale princess named Lily. She lived in a big castle with her mom and dad, the king and queen. She loved to play with her toys and wear pretty dresses.
One day, Princess Lily wanted to measure how tall she was. She asked her mom for help. Her mom took a long string and held it next to Lily. They saw that Lily was as tall as the string.
Princess Lily was very happy to know how tall she was. She told all her friends about it. They all wanted to measure how tall they were too. So, they had a fun day measuring each other and playing together in the castle.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to poke things. One day, he found a weird-looking box. The box had a photo of a big, silly face on it. Tim thought it was very funny.
Tim opened the box and saw a lot of colorful toys inside. He took out a soft, bouncy ball and started to play with it. He poked the ball and it flew up in the air. Tim laughed and clapped his hands.
Tim played with the ball all day long. He poked it high and low, left and right. His mom and dad watched him play and smiled. Tim was very happy with his new toy. And every time he looked at the weird photo on the box, he laughed even more.

Once upon a time, there was a big, red button on a boring, gray wall. The button had a friend, a little girl named Lucy. Lucy loved to talk to the button every day.
One day, Lucy was sad. She said to the button, "I did something bad. I took my friend's toy. I want to say sorry, but I don't know how." The button told her, "It's easy. Just say 'please forgive me' to your friend."
So, Lucy went to her friend and said, "I am sorry I took your toy. Please forgive me." Her friend smiled and said, "I forgive you, Lucy. Let's play together." And they played happily ever after. The big, red button was happy too, knowing it helped Lucy.

One day, a dog named Spot went for a walk. It was icy outside, so Spot had to be careful. Spot saw his friend, a cat named Paws. Paws was playing with a toy.
"Hi Paws, what are you doing?" asked Spot. Paws looked up and said, "I am playing with my toy. My owner just printed a new one for me!"
Spot wanted to play too. They played with the toy together, laughing and having fun. After a while, they got tired and sat down. Spot was happy he got to play with his friend Paws on the icy day.

One day, a baby bird was in his nest. He was a smart baby bird. His mom and dad wanted him to learn to fly. But the baby bird was scared to fly.
His mom said, "You can do it! I will encourage you!" His dad said, "You are a smart baby bird. You can learn to fly!" The baby bird was still scared.
One day, a big wind came. The wind pushed the baby bird out of the nest. The baby bird was scared, but he remembered what his mom and dad said. He tried to fly. He flapped his wings and started to fly.
The baby bird was happy. His mom and dad were happy too. They said, "We knew you could do it! You are a smart baby bird!" The baby bird was not scared anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a lot of toys, but he loved his marbles the most. He liked to play with them all day. One day, he found a big, shiny marble. It was not like the others. It was not boring at all.
Tim took the big marble and played with it. He rolled it on the floor and it made a fun sound. "I want to hear that sound again," Tim said. So, he rolled the marble again and again. He liked to repeat the sound it made. Tim was very happy with his new marble.
One day, Tim's friend, Sam, came to play. Tim showed Sam his big marble. Sam thought it was fun too. They played with the marbles together and had a great time. The big marble made their playtime more fun, and they were never bored. They liked to repeat the fun sound the marble made, and they played happily ever after.

One day, a friendly cat named Sam went for a walk. He saw a big tree and wanted to climb it. So, he jumped up and began to twist his way up the tree. Sam was very happy and excited.
As Sam was high up in the tree, he saw a bird. The bird said, "Hi, I'm Tim! Why are you up here?" Sam said, "I like to climb trees!" They talked and laughed. They became good friends.
Suddenly, Sam slipped and had a fall. But Tim was fast! He caught Sam and helped him land safely. They were both surprised and happy. From that day on, Sam and Tim were best friends and played together every day.

Once upon a time, in a land far away, there was a brave bird named Bobby. Bobby loved to fly high in the sky. One day, while Bobby was flying, he saw an orange on the ground.
Bobby flew down and said, "Hello, Orange. Do you want to fly with me?" The orange replied, "I can't fly, but I would love to see the sky."
Bobby thought for a moment and then said, "I have an idea!" He picked up the orange in his beak and flew up, up, up into the sky. The orange was so happy to see the clouds and the sun.
After their adventure, Bobby gently placed the orange back on the ground. They both smiled and said, "Thank you for the fun day!" From that day on, Bobby and the orange were the best of friends. And they always remembered their brave adventure in the sky.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the beach with his mom. They saw a big boat with a big anchor. Tim's mom told him, "Don't touch the anchor, it's bad." Tim liked to rub stones and sand, so he went to play near the water.
A big fish came out of the water and said, "Hi Tim! I want to be your friend." Tim was happy and said, "Hi fish! Let's play together!" They played and had fun. The fish wanted to show Tim something special. "Come with me and I'll show you a secret place," said the fish.
Tim forgot what his mom said about the anchor. He held the anchor and the fish pulled him into the water. Tim was scared and tried to let go of the anchor, but it was too late. The fish and Tim went deeper into the water. Tim's mom saw him and was very sad.
In the end, Tim could not come back to the beach. The fish took him to a deep, dark place in the sea. Tim learned that he should have listened to his mom. The moral of the story is to always listen to your parents because they know what is best for you.

Once upon a time, in a quiet forest, there lived a gorilla named Bobo. Bobo loved to write. He would write with sticks in the dirt. One day, he met a little bird named Chirpy.
"Hi, Bobo! What are you doing?" asked Chirpy.
"I write," said Bobo. "I make fun shapes with my stick."
Chirpy thought this was a great idea. She asked Bobo if she could write too. Bobo said yes, and they both wrote in the dirt together. They wrote big shapes and small shapes. They wrote all day long until the sun went down.
As the sun set, Bobo and Chirpy looked at all the shapes they had made. They were very happy. They knew they had made a new friend in each other. From that day on, they would always write together in the quiet forest. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was an enormous lake. On the shores of the lake, there was a beautiful little girl. One day, the girl was excited to go to the lake. She quickly changed into her swimming gear and made her way towards the shore.
The little girl gasped when she saw how enormous the lake was. She couldn't wait to have some fun. She slowly walked into the water and then started to splash around. "Look! I'm splashing!" shouted the little girl, laughing.
Suddenly, the little girl heard some splashing behind her. When she turned around, she saw a giant salmon leaping out of the water. She watched the enormous salmon jump around, completely amazed. 
The girl laughed and then called out "Let's splash together!" Then she and the salmon splashed around, playing a fun game together. Soon enough, the little girl's parents were calling her to come back home.
The little girl smiled, said goodbye to the enormous salmon and made her way back to the shore. She waved goodbye and happily skipped back home.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was very enthusiastic. He loved to play with his friends and have fun all day. One day, Tim found a big, shiny present under his bed. He was so happy!
Tim wanted to give the present to his best friend, Sarah. He carried the present to Sarah's house, excited to see her face when she opened it. When Sarah saw the present, her eyes lit up and she smiled from ear to ear.
Sarah opened the present and found a beautiful toy inside. She was so happy and gave Tim a big hug. They played with the toy together all day long. Tim and Sarah were the best of friends, and they always shared their toys and presents with each other.

Once upon a time, there was a chubby cat named Tom. Tom loved to play with his friends in the park. One sunny day, Tom had an idea. He wanted to start a club for all his friends. He thought it would be fun to organize games and share toys.
Tom went to his friend, a little dog named Max. "Max, let's start a club!" Tom said. Max wagged his tail and barked, "Yes, that sounds fun!" So, Tom and Max went to tell their other friends about the club.
The next day, Tom, Max, and their friends met at the park. They all sat in a circle and talked about the club. The chubby cat organized games like hide and seek and tag. All the friends laughed and played together. They were so happy to be part of the club. And from that day on, Tom and his friends had the best time in their new club.

Sara liked to play with her toys in the bath. She had a fake octopus that was purple and soft. She liked to make it swim and squirt water from its mouth. She also had a yellow cup that she used to fill and pour water.
One day, Sara had a new idea. She wanted to see if the octopus could fit in the cup. She tried to push it in, but it was too big. The octopus had eight legs that stuck out of the cup. Sara tried to bend the legs, but they were too stiff. The octopus did not fit in the cup.
Sara was sad. She wanted the octopus to fit in the cup. She thought maybe the cup was too small. She looked around the bath for a bigger cup. She saw a blue cup that was bigger than the yellow one. She grabbed it and tried to put the octopus in it.
The octopus fit in the blue cup! Sara was happy. She smiled and clapped her hands. She lifted the cup and shook it. The octopus wiggled and squeaked. Sara laughed and poured water on it. She made the octopus swim and squirt water again. She had fun with her fake octopus and her blue cup.

One day, a little ant named Tim felt an urge to go on a big adventure. He wanted to find something new and fun. Tim told his ant friends about his plan, and they all got very excited. They all wanted to go on the adventure too. So, they started to walk together in a long line, inch by inch.
As they walked, they saw many things: big rocks, green grass, and tall trees. The sun was shining, and the day was very dry. They were thirsty, but they kept going. They knew they would find something amazing soon.
After a long time, they found a big, sweet treat. It was a juicy, red apple! Tim and his friends climbed up and ate the yummy apple. They were happy they went on the adventure. Then, they went back home, inch by inch, to share their story with the other ants.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a bald bird named Will. Will was not like other birds. He did not have any hair on his head. But Will was a very happy bird.
One day, it rained a lot. Will got very wet. He wanted to be dry again. So, he asked the sun to help him. The sun came out and shined very bright. Will was happy because the sun made him dry again.
Will liked being dry. He danced and sang with his friends. They all played together in the big forest. Will was a bald and dry bird, and he was very happy.

One day, a big girl named Lucy went to teach a little infant named Timmy. Lucy wanted Timmy to say "please" and "thank you". She thought it was not nice to be rude.
"Timmy, can you say 'please'?" Lucy asked. Timmy just looked at her and said, "No!" Lucy was sad, but she tried again. "Timmy, can you say 'thank you'?" Timmy looked at her and said, "No!" Lucy was very sad.
Just then, Timmy's mom came in. She said, "Lucy, I have a surprise for you. Timmy can say 'please' and 'thank you' now." Lucy was happy and asked Timmy again. This time, Timmy said, "Please" and "Thank you!" Lucy was so happy, and they all clapped and laughed.

Once upon a time, there was a big dog named Ben. Ben loved to play in the park. One day, he saw a hidden cane under a bush. Ben picked up the cane with his mouth and ran to his friend, Tom the cat.
Tom saw Ben come with the cane and said, "Let's play with the cane!" They played all day, throwing the cane and running to get it. They had so much fun together.
But then, something unexpected happened. A little bird came and took the cane from Ben and Tom. They were surprised! The bird flew up high and dropped the cane into a pond. Ben and Tom looked at each other and laughed. They didn't need the cane to have fun. They played in the water and had a great day.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Daisy. Daisy loved animals and especially cuddly fur. One day, she decided to go looking in the pet store to find the perfect fur companion!
She looked and looked, but she just couldn't decide which one she liked the best. Then she saw a very rare fur animal - it was beautifully colored and furry and so cuddly looking.
"I choose you!" Daisy said with a huge smile on her face.
The store owner smiled back. "Congratulations! You have chosen a very rare and special fur animal - you certainly have an eye for the best!"
So Daisy and the fur animal went home together and they have been best friends ever since!

Once upon a time, there was a loyal dog named Spot. Spot loved to help his best friend, Tim. Tim and Spot lived in a small house with a big yard. They played together every day.
One day, Tim found a key. He wanted to unlock a door with it. He looked everywhere but could not find a door. Spot wanted to help. He sniffed around the yard and found a tiny door under a tree.
Tim and Spot went to the tiny door. Tim used the key to unlock it. Inside, they found a little room with a small can of oil. They were very happy. Tim and Spot used the oil to make their bikes go faster. They had a lot of fun riding their bikes together. And they knew they would always be loyal friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little flea. This flea lived on a big, ancient tree. The tree was very old and had many leaves. The flea liked to jump and play on the tree.
One day, the flea met a tiny bug. The bug had big eyes that would blink very fast. The flea and the bug became good friends. They played together all day long. They would jump from leaf to leaf, blink their eyes, and laugh.
As the sun went down, the flea and the bug said goodbye. They promised to play together again the next day. The flea went back to his old tree, and the bug went to his home. They both slept well, dreaming of more fun days with their new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a thin dog named Spot. Spot loved to play with his ball. One day, while Spot was playing, his ball broke.
Spot was sad. He wanted to fix his ball. He asked his friend, a big cat named Fluffy, to help him. Fluffy was good at fixing things.
Together, Spot and Fluffy fixed the ball. They used glue to stick the ball back together. Spot was happy. Now, Spot and Fluffy could play with the ball again. They played all day and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, in a hot and sandy land, there was a normal camel named Bob. Bob walked and walked every day, looking for something to drink. One day, Bob found a pretty place with water and trees. This place was called an oasis.
As Bob got closer to the oasis, he saw a big tree. Bob wanted to rest under the tree. But, there was a small problem. A little mouse lived in the tree, and the mouse was always sneezing. "Achoo, achoo!" went the mouse.
Bob was kind and wanted to help the mouse. He found some soft grass near the oasis and gave it to the mouse. The mouse used the grass to make a warm bed. The mouse stopped sneezing and they both lived happily at the oasis.

Once upon a time, there was a fast dog named Spot. Spot loved to run and play all day. One day, Spot was playing with his ball in the yard. He was running so fast that he lost his ball. Spot looked everywhere for his ball, but he could not find it.
Spot's friend, Cat, saw that Spot was sad. Cat asked, "Why are you sad, Spot?" Spot told Cat that he lost his ball. Cat wanted to help Spot find his ball. They looked all around the yard, but they still could not find the ball.
Then, Spot remembered that he had played with his ball in the house. They went inside and looked everywhere. Spot found his ball next to a big bottle of shampoo. Spot was so happy to find his ball. He thanked Cat for helping him. From that day on, Spot and Cat were the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Bobo. Bobo had thick, soft feathers. He wanted to fly high in the sky. But Bobo was a little scared.
One sunny day, Bobo's mom said, "Bobo, you can succeed! Just flap your wings and try!" So, Bobo took a deep breath and started to flap his wings.
Bobo flapped and flapped, and soon he was flying high in the sky! He was so happy. He called out to his mom, "Look, Mom! I did it! I succeeded!" His mom was so proud. And from that day on, Bobo loved to fly in the sky.

Lily hated beans. She did not like how they looked, how they smelled, or how they tasted. She always tried to hide them under her plate or give them to her dog when her mom was not looking.
One day, her mom made a big pot of bean soup for dinner. She told Lily to eat it all, or she would not get any dessert. Lily felt very sad and angry. She did not want to eat the bean soup. She wanted to eat cake.
She looked at her brother, Ben. He liked beans. He ate his soup very fast and smiled. He was very organized. He always did his homework, cleaned his room, and followed the rules. Lily thought he was boring.
She decided to play a trick on him. She waited until he went to the bathroom, and then she poured some of her soup into his bowl. She hoped he would not notice.
But he did. When he came back, he saw that his bowl was full of soup again. He looked at Lily and saw her grin. He knew what she did. He felt very mad. He said, "Lily, you are very naughty. You should not waste food. You should eat your beans. They are good for you."
Lily said, "No, they are not. They are yucky. I hate beans. And I hate you. You are a bean lover."
Ben said, "No, I am not. I am a bean eater. And I love you. You are my sister."
They stared at each other for a while. Then they both laughed. They realized they were silly. They hugged and said sorry. They finished their soup and shared the cake. They learned to respect each other's likes and dislikes. And they agreed to never play tricks with beans again.

Once upon a time, in a little house, there lived a boy named Tim. Tim loved to display his toys on his table. He had many toys, but his favorite was a small prune toy. Tim always played with his prune toy and took it with him everywhere.
One day, Tim met a rude boy named Sam at the park. Sam saw Tim's prune toy and wanted it. Sam took the prune toy from Tim and ran away. Tim was very sad, and he missed his prune toy so much. He wanted to find a way to get his toy back.
Tim thought of a plan. He went home and made a big, yummy cake. Tim took the cake to the park and showed it to Sam. Sam loved cake, and he wanted to eat it. Tim said, "You can have this cake if you give me my prune toy back." Sam thought about it, and then he gave the toy back to Tim. Tim was so happy to have his prune toy again, and they all ate the cake together. In the end, Sam learned not to be rude, and Tim and Sam became friends.

One day, a fast car named Speedy went to the beach. Speedy liked the beach because he could speed on the sand. He brought his fancy towel with him to sit on. The towel was blue and had fun shapes on it.
At the beach, Speedy met a new friend. The friend was a pretty bird named Chirpy. Chirpy said, "Hi, Speedy! I like your fancy towel. Can I sit with you?" Speedy said, "Yes, Chirpy! Let's play together."
As they played on the beach, a big wave came and took Speedy's fancy towel away! Speedy and Chirpy were sad. But then, Chirpy had an idea. Chirpy flew high and saw the towel in the water. Chirpy was brave and got the towel back for Speedy. They were happy again and played all day at the beach.

Sara and Ben were playing in the garden. They liked to look at the flowers and smell them. Sara saw a big red flower that was very pretty. She wanted to pick it and give it to her mom.
"Can I have this flower?" she asked Ben.
"No, you can't," Ben said. "It is mine. I saw it first."
Sara felt sad and angry. She did not think Ben was being nice. She tried to grab the flower from him, but he pulled it away.
"Stop it!" he shouted. "You are hurting the flower. Go find your own."
Sara started to cry. She did not want to hurt the flower, but she did not want to lose it either. She thought Ben was being harsh.
Mom heard them and came to see what was wrong. She saw Sara crying and Ben holding the flower.
"What is going on here?" she asked.
"Sara wants my flower, but it is mine," Ben said.
"I just wanted to give it to you, mom," Sara said.
Mom smiled and hugged them both.
"You are both very sweet, but you don't need to fight over a flower," she said. "There are plenty of flowers in the garden for everyone. Why don't you share this one and pick some more together?"
Sara and Ben looked at each other and nodded. They said sorry to each other and gave mom the flower. Then they went to find more flowers to make a bouquet. They learned to share and be kind.

Once upon a time, there was a chubby cat. The cat had a big bag. The cat liked to keep things in the bag. The cat was very happy with the bag.
One day, the cat went for a walk. The cat took the bag with it. The cat saw a big tree. The cat wanted to keep the tree in the bag too. The cat tried to put the tree in the bag, but the bag was too small.
The cat tried and tried to put the tree in the bag. Then, the bag broke. All the things the cat kept in the bag fell out. The cat was very sad. The cat lost the bag and all the things it kept. The cat went home feeling very sad.

Once upon a time, a boy named Tim went on a trip with his mom and dad. They had a big bag full of fancy clothes. When they got to the big, red house, they started to unpack the bag. Tim found a big, strong muscle shirt inside the bag. He put it on and felt very happy.
One day, Tim went to the park wearing his fancy muscle shirt. He saw a dog with a big, round ball. Tim asked the dog, "Can I play with your ball?" The dog said, "Yes, but only if you can show me your big, strong muscles." Tim showed the dog his fancy muscle shirt and they played together.
Suddenly, the ball went very high in the sky and got stuck in a tall tree. Tim and the dog looked up and saw a big bird with the ball in its beak. The bird said, "I thought this ball was an egg! I'm sorry." The bird dropped the ball and Tim and the dog continued to play. They all became good friends and had lots of fun together.

Once upon a time, there was a big race. All the animals wanted to win. They were very excited. The race was near a big volcano. The volcano was impressive.
The animals ran very fast. They wanted to be first. The volcano started to make loud noises. The animals did not stop. They wanted to win the race.
The volcano got angry. It made a big boom. The animals were scared. They could not finish the race. The volcano won the race. The animals were sad.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia loved to play with her toys. She always kept her toys organized in her room. Mia had a big heart and liked to share her toys with her friends.
One day, Mia's friend Tom came over to play. Tom saw how organized Mia's toys were and said, "Wow, Mia! Your toys are so neat!" Mia smiled and said, "Thank you, Tom! I like to keep them that way."
Mia and Tom played with the toys together. Mia decided to give Tom one of her favorite toys, a small teddy bear. Tom was so happy and said, "Thank you, Mia! You have a big heart!" They played with the teddy bear and had a fun day.

Sara and Ben are playing in the park. They like to pretend they are lions. They run and jump and roar. They make their faces look scary. They have fun.
But then they see a big dog. The dog is barking and running. It comes near them. Sara and Ben are afraid. They stop roaring. They hide behind a tree.
"Go away, dog!" Sara says. "We are lions. We can roar at you."
But the dog does not go away. It comes closer. It wags its tail. It licks Sara's hand. It is friendly.
Sara and Ben look at the dog. They see that it is pretty. It has brown fur and black spots. It has big ears and a wet nose. It is not scary.
"Hello, dog," Ben says. "What is your name?"
The dog barks. It sounds like it is saying "Spot".
"Spot," Sara repeats. "That is a good name. Do you want to play with us?"
Spot wags his tail again. He nods his head. He likes to play.
Sara and Ben smile. They come out from behind the tree. They pet Spot. They hug him. They make him roar with them.
They have a new friend. They are happy.
Today is a good day.

Once upon a time, there was a smart cat named Kitty. Kitty loved to stretch her legs and play outside. Every day, she would go on a fun adventure with her best friend, a little bird named Chirpy.
One evening, as the sunset made the sky pretty with colors, Kitty and Chirpy were playing near a big tree. They saw a little bug who was lost and scared. "Don't worry, we will help you find your way home," said Kitty.
Kitty and Chirpy helped the little bug climb the tree to reach its family. The little bug said, "Thank you, Kitty and Chirpy! You are both so kind and smart." They all smiled and played together until the sun went to sleep.

Sara and Tom are twins. They like to play and have fun. But today, they have to go to church with Mom and Dad. They do not like church. It is boring and long.
"Can we go home now?" Sara asks Mom.
"No, Sara. We have to stay and listen. Church is good for us," Mom says.
"But I am hungry and tired," Tom says.
"Me too," Sara says.
Mom gives them a sweet. "This is for being quiet and good. But you can only have one. Do not ask for more," Mom says.
Sara and Tom eat the sweet. It is yummy and makes them happy. But soon, they want another one. They see a big bowl of sweets on a table. It is for the people who work at the church.
"Look, Tom. More sweets. Let's get some," Sara says.
"No, Sara. Mom said no. We have to listen to her," Tom says.
But Sara does not listen. She runs to the table and grabs a handful of sweets. She puts them in her pocket.
"Hey, stop that! Those are not for you!" a man says. He is angry. He works at the church. He sees Sara take the sweets.
Sara is scared. She drops the sweets and runs back to Tom.
"Sorry, sorry," she says.
The man follows her. He tells Mom and Dad what Sara did.
Mom and Dad are not happy. They are mad at Sara.
"Sara, why did you do that? That was very bad. You did not listen to us. You did not listen to the man. You took what was not yours. You have to say sorry and give back the sweets," Dad says.
Sara feels bad. She says sorry to the man. She gives back the sweets. She says sorry to Mom and Dad.
Mom and Dad hug her. They say they love her. But they also say she has to learn to order. Order means to do what is right and good. Order means to follow the rules and respect others.
Sara nods. She says she will try to order. She says she loves Mom and Dad too.
Tom hugs her too. He says he is glad she is okay. He says he loves her too.
They all go home. They have lunch. They play and have fun. They are happy.

One day, a big rabbit and a small rabbit went to the garden. They saw a big cauliflower. The big rabbit wanted the cauliflower. The small rabbit wanted it too.
The rabbits did not know who should get the cauliflower. They had an idea. They would weigh the cauliflower. The big rabbit thought he could carry the heavy cauliflower. The small rabbit thought he could carry it too.
They both tried to carry the cauliflower. The big rabbit could not carry it. The small rabbit could not carry it too. They were sad. Then, a strong ant came. The ant helped the rabbits carry the cauliflower. The rabbits were grateful. They shared the cauliflower and became friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. Lucy loved to organize her toys. She would put her dolls in one place, her cars in another, and her blocks in a neat pile. Lucy was very good at using her brain to make her room look nice.
One day, Lucy felt nervous because her toys were all mixed up. She didn't know how it happened, but she needed to fix it. So, Lucy started to organize her toys again. She put the dolls, cars, and blocks in their right places.
Just when Lucy thought she was done, something unexpected happened. Her toys started to move by themselves! The dolls, cars, and blocks were all playing together. Lucy was surprised but happy. She joined her toys and had fun with her new friends. From that day on, Lucy's toys were never in the same place, but she didn't mind. She loved the twist in her story and enjoyed playing with her magical toys.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy trophy. It was a fake trophy, but he loved it very much. Tim would play with his trophy every day. He would pretend to win races and show his trophy to everyone.
One day, Tim met a new friend named Sally. Sally saw Tim's trophy and said, "Wow! What a pretty trophy!" Tim smiled and said, "Thank you! I won it in a race." Sally did not know it was a fake trophy, so she believed Tim.
They played together and had a lot of fun. They ran and blinked their eyes fast in the sun. Tim liked his new friend Sally. They laughed and played all day long. Tim was happy that he had a new friend who liked his trophy too.
In the end, Tim told Sally the truth about his fake trophy. Sally said, "That's okay, Tim. It's still a fun toy to play with!" They both laughed and continued to play together. Tim learned that it was better to tell the truth, and he was happy to have a friend like Sally. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a kind, bald man named Tom. Tom loved to make things. One day, Tom had an idea. He wanted to design a card for his friend's birthday.
Tom got paper, crayons, and glue. He used the crayons to draw a big, happy sun on the front of the card. He wrote "Happy Birthday" with the glue and put sparkly things on the words. Tom was very proud of the card he made.
Tom gave the card to his friend at the birthday party. His friend loved the card so much. They played games and ate cake. Tom was happy that he could make his friend smile with the card he designed.

Mia likes to play dress-up. She has many costumes in her closet. She can be a princess, a pirate, a doctor, or a fairy. She likes to be independent and choose her own costume.
One day, she wants to be a fairy. She puts on a pink dress, a pair of wings, and a wand. She looks at herself in the mirror and smiles. She feels magical.
She goes to the living room, where her mom is reading a book. She says, "Look, mom, I'm a fairy!"
Her mom looks up and smiles. She says, "You are a beautiful fairy, Mia. Do you want to show me your magic?"
Mia nods and waves her wand. She says, "Abracadabra! I make you happy!"
Her mom laughs and hugs her. She says, "You don't need a wand to make me happy, Mia. You make me happy just by being you."
Mia feels happy too. She says, "I love you, mom."
Her mom says, "I love you too, fairy Mia."

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He was an adventurous kid who loved to play outside. One day, Tim found a hammer in the yard. He was very excited and wanted to show his friend, Sam.
"Look, Sam! I found a hammer!" said Tim. Sam came running to see the hammer. As they played with the hammer, they stumbled upon a big rock. They decided to hit the rock with the hammer to see what would happen.
As Tim hit the rock, something unexpected happened! The rock broke open, and a shiny, golden key was inside. Tim and Sam were so surprised and happy. They knew they had found something very special. Together, they went on a new adventure to find what the key would open.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue had long, pretty hair. She liked to look at the sky at night. She saw many stars in the sky. One star was her favorite. It was the biggest and brightest star.
Every night, Sue would pray to the big, bright star. She would ask the star to help her have good dreams. She wanted to dream about playing with her friends and eating yummy food. Sue felt happy when she talked to the star.
One night, Sue had a dream about the big, bright star. The star came down from the sky and played with her. They played games and ate ice cream together. When Sue woke up, she knew her prayer to the star had worked. She was very happy and knew the star was her special friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Sally. Sally liked to build with colourful blocks. She loved to have fun in the different seasons.
One day, Sally decided to build her biggest tower yet. She carefully stacked lots of blocks until her tower was really tall. Red, green and blue blocks created a very colourful tower.
Suddenly, the wind started to blow and the tower started to wobble. "Mommy, help!" shouted Sally. But it was too late. The tower toppled to the ground, making a huge crash.
Sally was very sad. "Why did my tower fall down?" she asked. Her mom smiled and said, "Sometimes bad things happen, even when you try your best."
Sally was disappointed, but she decided to build another tower. Hopefully, it wouldn't end with a bad ending!

Lily and Ben are twins. They like to play with their toys. They have many vehicles: cars, trucks, buses, and trains. They make noises and pretend to drive them.
One day, they find a big vehicle in the street. It is red and shiny. It has a ladder and a hose. It is a fire truck. Lily and Ben are curious. They want to see inside.
They climb on the fire truck. They see buttons and levers. They see helmets and coats. They see a radio and a siren. They think it is fun. They start to play with the fire truck.
"Look, I am a fireman!" Ben says. He puts on a helmet and a coat. He pulls a lever. The ladder goes up and down.
"Look, I am a firewoman!" Lily says. She puts on a helmet and a coat. She pushes a button. The siren goes on and off.
They laugh and giggle. They do not see the fireman coming back. He is angry. He sees the twins on his fire truck. He shouts at them.
"Hey, what are you doing? Get off my fire truck! You are not supposed to be here! You are in big trouble!"
Lily and Ben are scared. They try to get off the fire truck. But they are too high. They slip and fall. They hurt themselves. They cry and scream.
The fireman calls for help. He tries to calm them down. He says he is sorry. He says he did not mean to scare them. He says they need to go to the hospital.
Lily and Ben are sad. They wish they did not play with the fire truck. They wish they listened to their mom. She told them not to go near the street. She told them to sleep in their beds. They say they are sorry. They say they will never do it again.

Once upon a time there lived a little girl who loved to organize things. She was the happiest child when she was organizing her things and playing make-believe with her siblings. One fine day she was organizing her toys outside when she heard a loud rumble in the sky. She looked up and what she saw made her heart skip a beat. It was a fierce thunderstorm.
She ran in to grab her boots, hat and coat. She was all dressed ready to go explore the storm but her older siblings cautioned her to stay inside. Though she was helpless, she mustered up the courage and headed outside to explore the storm.
Suddenly, she heard a loud clap of thunder that shook the entire house. She almost lost her balance and screamed in shock. By now, the wind had started howling in anger and the storm had become stronger. 
The little girl tried to make her way back but was helpless to the strong wind that blew her away. As the night darkended, no one saw or heard from her again.

Once upon a time, there was a wealthy boy named Tim. Tim had many toys and friends. He liked to play with them every day. One Tuesday, Tim met a new friend named Sam.
Tim wanted to introduce Sam to his other friends. So, they went to the park to play. Tim's friends liked Sam very much. They all played together and had lots of fun.
After playing, they went to Tim's big house. They ate yummy snacks and shared their toys. Tim was very happy to have a new friend like Sam. They all became best friends and played together every day.

Tom and Lily were twins who liked to play in the dark. They had a flashlight that they shared, but sometimes they fought over it. One night, they wanted to explore the basement, but they only had one flashlight.
"I want the flashlight!" Tom said.
"No, I want it!" Lily said.
They pulled and pulled on the flashlight, but it was too hard. The flashlight split in two and stopped working. Tom and Lily were scared and sad. They could not see anything in the dark basement.
They heard a noise and hugged each other. They wished they had not fought over the flashlight. They wished they had shared it and played nicely.
"Tom, Lily, are you there?" They heard their mom's voice. She had another flashlight and came to find them. She saw the broken flashlight and the scared twins.
"What happened?" She asked.
