"We broke the flashlight, mom. We were fighting over it." Tom said.
"We're sorry, mom. We were silly." Lily said.
Mom hugged them and said, "It's okay, my loves. I'm glad you're fine. But you should learn to share and be kind to each other. Fighting over things can hurt you and break things. Sharing and being kind can make you happy and keep things whole."
Tom and Lily nodded and said, "We understand, mom. We will share and be kind from now on."
Mom smiled and said, "That's good, my loves. Now let's go upstairs and have some cookies. And maybe we can fix the flashlight later."
Tom and Lily smiled and followed mom. They held each other's hand and said, "We love you, mom. And we love each other too."

Once upon a time there was a lime. It was really popular and lots of people liked it. One day, a little boy saw the lime and thought it was so special. He asked his mom what it was and she explained that it was a lime and it was special because it was valuable. 
The little boy was so excited! He ran back to his room and played with his toy cars and told them all about the lime he saw. He made sure to tell them that limes were valuable and that the best limes were popular. 
The little boy decided he wanted to get his own lime. He asked his mom if he could get one and she said yes. She took him to the store to buy the lime and the little boy was so happy. He took it home and kept it safe. He wanted to make sure he never lost it because it was so valuable. 
From that day on, the little boy always told people about limes, especially how they were special because they were popular and valuable.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a big building. It was a fine building with many colors. In the building, there were many things to play with. A boy named Tim and a girl named Sue liked to play there.
One day, Tim and Sue went to the building to play. They saw a big box. The box had many toys in it. They both wanted to pick the same toy. They both wanted the red ball. Tim and Sue did not want to share the red ball. They both wanted it for themselves.
Tim and Sue were not happy. They did not know what to do. Then, a nice lady came to help. She said, "Why don't you both play with the red ball together?" Tim and Sue thought about it. They decided to play together. They had a lot of fun. They learned that sharing is good. And they were both happy.

Anna and Ben are twins. They share a bedroom. They like to play with their toys and read books before bedtime. But sometimes, they hear noises outside their window. They think it is a monster.
One night, they hear a loud bang. They jump out of their beds and run to each other. They hug and cry.
"Ben, I'm scared!" Anna says.
"Me too, Anna!" Ben says.
They look at their window. It is dark and windy. They see a big shadow moving.
"Is it the monster?" Anna asks.
"I don't know. Maybe it is a tree or a bird," Ben says.
He tries to be brave, but he is shaking.
"Let's go to Mom and Dad. They will protect us," Anna says.
She grabs Ben's hand and pulls him to the door.
"Wait, Anna. We can't. Mom and Dad said we have to stay in our bedroom at night. They said it is the rule," Ben says.
He remembers what Mom and Dad told them before they kissed them goodnight.
"But we are scared, Ben. They will understand," Anna says.
She looks at Ben with big eyes.
"Please, Ben. Please, come with me," she says.
Ben thinks for a moment. He loves Anna. He does not want her to be scared. He does not want to be scared either.
"Okay, Anna. I will come with you. But we have to be quiet. And we have to promise to go back to our bedroom after Mom and Dad hug us," he says.
He makes a pinky promise with Anna.
"Promise, Ben. Promise," Anna says.
They nod and smile. They open the door and sneak out of their bedroom. They hope Mom and Dad will not be mad. They hope the monster will not follow them.

One day, a little monkey named Momo was playing in the trees. He liked to swing and jump from branch to branch. The tree bark felt rough under his hands and feet.
Momo saw some yummy bananas and decided to eat them. He picked the bananas and shared them with his friends. They all enjoyed the sweet taste.
After eating, Momo and his friends decided to play a fun game. They played hide and seek in the trees. The sun was shining and they were all very happy.

One day, Tom and Sue went to the park. They saw a path. They wanted to get to the end of the path. Tom said, "I will get there first!" Sue said, "No, I will get there first!" They both wanted to win.
Tom and Sue ran fast on the path. They were competitive. They did not see the big hole in the path. Tom fell into the hole. Sue stopped and said, "Oh no! Tom, are you okay?"
Tom was not okay. He was hurt. Sue tried to help Tom, but she could not get him out of the hole. They both cried. They did not get to the end of the path.

Once upon a time, there was a little goat. He lived on a farm with many other animals. The goat had a big sneeze that would scare the other animals. The goat did not like to scare his friends, but he could not help it. His sneeze was very loud.
One day, a man came to the farm. He wanted to buy a goat. The man thought the little goat was cheap because of his big sneeze. So, he took the goat to his home. The goat was sad to leave his friends, but he was happy to have a new home.
In his new home, the goat found out that his sneeze was good. His sneeze scared away the bad animals that wanted to eat the man's food. The man was happy, and the goat was happy too. The moral of the story is that sometimes things that seem bad can be good in the right place.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Billy. Billy loved to travel and see new things. One day, while Billy was flying, he saw a helpless baby squirrel on the ground.
"Hi, I'm Billy," said the bird. "What's your name?"
"I'm Sammy," said the squirrel. "I can't climb trees yet, and I'm scared."
Billy wanted to help Sammy. They both waited for sunshine to come, because it was too dark and cold. When the sun came out, Billy had an idea.
"I can help you learn to climb trees," said Billy. "I can fly up and show you the way."
Sammy was very happy. With Billy's help, he learned to climb trees. They became best friends and traveled together, enjoying the sunshine and playing all day.

One day, a girl named Lily wanted to introduce her new friend, Tom, to her dad. Tom was a very honest boy. Lily's dad was a judge. They all lived in a big town.
Lily said, "Dad, this is my new friend, Tom. He is very honest." Her dad, the judge, smiled and said, "Hello, Tom. It is nice to meet you." Tom said, "Hello, sir. It is nice to meet you too."
Then, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and blew off the judge's hat. Tom ran fast and caught the hat. He gave the hat back to the judge. The judge was very happy and said, "Thank you, Tom. You are a good friend to Lily and a very honest boy."

Once upon a time, there was a noisy dog named Spot. He loved to bark and make sounds all day long. His friends, the cat and the bird, did not like the loud sounds. They would cover their ears and hide.
One day, the cat and the bird decided to talk to Spot. They said, "Spot, your barking is too noisy. Can you please be quiet?" Spot felt sad because he did not want to upset his friends. He thought about what they said and decided to try to be quieter.
The next day, Spot did not bark as much. He played with his friends without making loud sounds. The cat and the bird were happy, and they all had a fun day together. Spot learned that it is important to think about how his actions affect others.
Moral: It is important to be considerate of others and think about how our actions affect them.

One day, a little boy named Tim saw a bright light in the sky. He saw a big comet flying up high. Tim was very happy and wanted to tell his friends. He ran to them and said, "I saw a comet! It was big and bright!"
His friends did not believe him. They said, "No, Tim, you did not see a comet." Tim felt sad. He wanted them to believe him. So, he thought of a game. He said, "Let's play a game. You have to guess what I saw in the sky."
His friends liked games. They started to guess. "Was it a bird?" one friend asked. "No, it was not a bird," Tim said. "Was it a plane?" another friend asked. "No, it was not a plane," Tim said. They kept guessing, but they could not guess the right answer.
Then, the warm sun began to set. The sky turned dark. Suddenly, the comet appeared again! It was even brighter than before. Tim's friends saw it too. They were so surprised and happy. They said, "Tim, you were right! You did see a comet!"
In the end, Tim and his friends watched the beautiful comet together. They all felt warm and happy inside. And from that day on, they always believed Tim when he told them about the things he saw in the sky.

Tom and Lily like to play pretend. They have a big box that they use as a truck. They take turns to be the driver and the helper. They make noises like a truck and go around the yard.
One day, they pretend to deliver flowers to their mom. Tom is the driver and Lily is the helper. They put some daisies and roses in the box and close it. They start the truck and say, "Beep beep, we are on our way!"
They drive to the porch where their mom is sitting. They stop the truck and say, "Hello, we have a delivery for you!" They open the box and show the flowers. Their mom smiles and says, "Thank you, what a lovely surprise! You are very dependable and kind."
Tom and Lily feel happy and proud. They hug their mom and say, "You are welcome, we love you!" They get back in the truck and say, "Bye bye, we have more deliveries to do!" They drive away and pretend to go to other places. They have a lot of fun with their truck.

Tom and Jen are playing with paper. They like to fold the paper and make shapes. Tom folds a paper into a hat. Jen folds a paper into a boat. They are happy.
But then, Jen sees a big red paper on the shelf. She wants to fold it too. She does not ask Tom. She is careless. She climbs on the chair and reaches for the paper. But the chair is wobbly. Jen falls down and hits her head. She cries.
Tom runs to Jen and tries to help her. He sees blood on her head. He is scared. He calls for mom. Mom comes and sees Jen. She is angry and worried. She takes Jen to the doctor. The doctor says Jen has a cut and an itch. He gives her a bandage and a cream. He tells Jen to be careful next time.
Tom feels sad and sorry. He wishes he could fold the paper with Jen again. He hopes Jen will be okay. He says he is sorry to Jen and mom. He learns to share and ask. He does not want to be careless anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a big, red ball he loved to play with. One day, he wanted to pass the ball to his friend, Sam.
Tim and Sam played near a door with a shiny knob. They laughed and had fun as they passed the ball back and forth. But then, the ball hit the knob and made a loud noise.
Tim's mom came to see what happened. She saw the knob was fake and not broken. Tim and Sam were happy they could still play. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a small toy named Ted. Ted was a proud toy who lived in a pocket. One day, Ted wanted to travel and see the world. So, he jumped out of the pocket and began his big adventure.
As Ted traveled, he met a big dog named Max. Max said, "Hello, little toy! Where are you going?" Ted said, "I am traveling to see the world. I am a proud toy!" Max smiled and said, "That sounds fun! Can I come with you?" Ted was happy and said, "Yes, let's go together!"
Ted and Max traveled far and wide. They saw many new things and made many new friends. They played in the sun and danced in the rain. At the end of their adventure, Ted and Max went back to their homes. Ted jumped back into the pocket, feeling proud of his big adventure.

One day, a boy named Tom wanted to play catch with his friends. He was very excited, but he felt a little embarrassed because he was not good at catching the ball. His friends always laughed when he missed the ball, but Tom still wanted to try.
Tom's mom told him to be careful while playing. She said, "If you are not careful, you might fall and go to the hospital." Tom listened to his mom, but he still wanted to play catch with his friends.
The next day, Tom and his friends were playing catch. Tom was trying very hard to catch the ball. Suddenly, the ball came right at him. He tried to catch it, but he fell down. His friends laughed, but Tom was hurt. His mom took him to the hospital, just like she said. Tom learned that he should be more careful when playing with his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a curious little boy named Tim. He loved to play outside on the ground. One day, Tim saw a big red car. He wanted to drive the car, but he was too small.
Tim asked his friend, the cat, for help. The cat had a magic trick. The cat said, "I will make you big, so you can drive the car." Tim was very happy. The cat did the magic trick, and Tim became big.
Now, Tim could drive the big red car. But something unexpected happened. When Tim started to drive, the car turned into a big red ball. Tim was surprised, but he still had fun. He played with the big red ball on the ground all day long.

Once upon a time, a little fish named Finn lived in the sea. Finn liked to play with his friends and swim with the waves. They would jump and spin in the water, feeling so happy and free.
One day, a big wave came and Finn got lost. He struggled to find his way back to his friends. Finn was scared and didn't know what to do. He swam and swam, hoping to see a friend or a place he knew.
Suddenly, Finn saw a beautiful, graceful fish. The fish swam up to Finn and said, "Don't be scared, I will help you find your friends." The beautiful fish was a magical fish and with a flip of her tail, she made a path in the water that led Finn back to his friends. Finn was so happy to see his friends again and they all played in the waves once more. And from that day on, Finn and the magical fish became best friends, always swimming and playing together.

Once upon a time, there was a big, modern kitchen. It was very clean and had many things in it. In this kitchen, there was a little cat named Kitty. Kitty loved to sit on the soft, warm rug in the kitchen.
One day, Kitty saw a little bug on the floor. The bug was very small and fast. Kitty wanted to play with the bug. So, Kitty jumped off the rug and tried to catch the bug. The bug ran away, and Kitty chased it all around the modern kitchen.
At last, Kitty caught the bug in her paw. She was very happy and proud of herself. Then, Kitty let the bug go, and it ran away. Kitty went back to her warm rug in the kitchen and sat down. She was tired from playing, but she had a lot of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird. The bird was fragile. It liked to sing. The bird lived in a big tree.
One day, the wind blew hard. The little bird was scared. It held on to the tree with its tiny feet. The wind made the leaves dance.
When the wind stopped, the little bird was happy. It started to sing again. The bird's song made everyone smile. And they all lived happily ever after.

Abby was very excited. She watched her mom unpack a box full of new clothes. Suddenly, Abby saw a cute skirt. She immediately wanted it and begged her mom to put it on.
Her mom smiled and agreed. She helped Abby put on the skirt and they both admired how it looked on her. Abby twirled around and laughed, loving how the skirt flared out when she spun.
Abby couldn't wait to go outside and show her skirt off to all of her friends. She waved good-bye to her mom as she ran outside. Everyone she saw had a wide smile on their face when they saw Abby's cute skirt. 
Abby's mom watched her daughter with a proud smile. Unpacking had been worth it after all.

Once upon a time, in a small house, lived a girl named Lily. She had a beautiful cloth. It was very original, with many colors. Lily loved her cloth so much.
One day, Lily wanted to prepare a surprise for her mom. So, she took her original cloth and made a pretty dress for her mom's doll. She worked very hard on it. When she was done, she put the dress on the doll and put the doll on the table.
When her mom came home, she saw the doll on the table. She said, "Wow, Lily! What a beautiful dress! Did you make it with your original cloth?" Lily smiled and said, "Yes, Mom! I wanted to prepare a surprise for you!" Her mom hugged her and said, "Thank you, Lily. This is the best surprise ever!"

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim loved to build things. He built with blocks, sticks, and even mud. One day, Tim had an idea. He wanted to build a car that could go very fast. He wanted his car to have a lot of speed.
Tim asked his friend, Sam, to help him. Sam was very good at building things too. They worked together and built a car. Tim said, "Our car is going to be so fast, everyone will want one!" Sam replied, "Yes, we will be very rich!"
One day, while Tim and Sam were testing their car, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and blew their car away! Tim and Sam were sad. They thought they would never see their car again.
But then, a bird brought the car back to them. The bird said, "I saw your car fly away. I knew it was special, so I brought it back to you." Tim and Sam were so happy. They thanked the bird and decided to share their car with everyone. They didn't become rich, but they made many new friends, and that was just as good.

Lily and Ben were playing in the garden. They liked to pretend they were farmers and had many animals. Lily had a toy cow and Ben had a toy horse. They made sounds like the animals and fed them grass and water.
One day, Lily said, "I want to make butter from the cow's milk. Do you want to help me?" Ben nodded and said, "Yes, I like butter. It is yummy on bread and pancakes." They took a small bucket and a spoon and went to the cow. They pretended to milk the cow and fill the bucket. Then they shook the bucket hard and said, "Churn, churn, churn!"
After a while, they saw some yellow stuff in the bucket. They were very happy and said, "We made butter! We are great farmers!" They took some bread and spread the butter on it. They tasted it and said, "Mmm, this is the best butter ever!"
They decided to share their butter with their friends. They wrapped some butter in a cloth and put it in a basket. They took the horse and said, "We are going to deliver the butter to our friends. They will love it!" They rode the horse around the garden and stopped at each toy house. They knocked on the door and said, "Hello, we are Lily and Ben. We made some butter for you. Do you want some?"
Their friends were very happy and said, "Thank you, Lily and Ben. You are very kind and generous. We love your butter. It is great!" They took some butter and gave them a hug. Lily and Ben felt very proud and happy. They said, "You are welcome. We are glad you like our butter. We had fun making it." They waved goodbye and rode the horse to the next house. They delivered the butter to all their friends and had a wonderful day.

Once upon a time, in an ancient town, there was a barber. The barber liked to cut hair. He had a big shop with a chair. People came to the barber to make their hair short and nice.
One day, the barber saw a flower. The flower was big and red. The flower did not bloom. The barber wanted to help the flower. He thought, "If I can cut hair, maybe I can help the flower bloom too."
The barber took his scissors and went to the flower. He tried to make the flower bloom with his scissors. But the flower did not bloom. The barber was sad. He wanted to help the flower.
A little girl saw the barber. She said, "Do not cut the flower. Let it grow. It will bloom soon." The barber listened to the girl. He let the flower grow. After some days, the flower bloomed. The barber was happy. He learned that sometimes it is better to let things grow than to cut them.

One day, a boy named Tim went to play outside. He saw a big, amazing tree. Tim wanted to climb the tree and play on its branches. As he started to climb, he saw a little bird sitting on a branch. The bird gave Tim a wink.
Tim and the bird became friends. They played all day in the amazing tree. They laughed and had so much fun. But then, something unexpected happened. The little bird started to grow bigger and bigger!
Tim was surprised. The bird was not a little bird anymore. It was a big, friendly dragon! Tim and the dragon played together in the amazing tree. They had even more fun than before. And that is how Tim found his new best friend, the dragon.

Lily liked to look at things with her microscope. She had a microscope that her dad gave her for her birthday. She could see tiny things that were too small for her eyes. She liked to look at leaves, flowers, bugs, and anything she could find.
One day, she wanted to look at something new. She asked her mom if she could look at some food with her microscope. Her mom said yes, but she had to be careful and not make a mess. She gave Lily a plate with some cheese, bread, apple, and lemon.
Lily took the plate to her room and put it on her desk. She picked up the cheese and put it under her microscope. She saw many holes and bumps on the cheese. She thought it looked funny. She said to herself, "Cheese has many holes. I wonder why."
Then she picked up the bread and put it under her microscope. She saw many tiny grains and fibers on the bread. She thought it looked soft. She said to herself, "Bread has many grains. I wonder how they make it."
Then she picked up the apple and put it under her microscope. She saw many cells and seeds on the apple. She thought it looked juicy. She said to herself, "Apple has many cells. I wonder how they grow."
Then she picked up the lemon and put it under her microscope. She saw many drops and crystals on the lemon. She thought it looked shiny. She said to herself, "Lemon has many drops. I wonder how they taste."
She was curious, so she licked the lemon. She made a face and spit it out. It was very sour. She did not like it. She said to herself, "Lemon is sour. I do not like it."
She heard her mom calling her for lunch. She put the lemon back on the plate and cleaned her microscope. She ran to the kitchen and told her mom what she saw with her microscope. Her mom smiled and said, "That's very interesting, Lily. You are a good scientist. What is the name of your microscope?"
Lily thought for a moment and said, "I name my microscope Zoomy. Because it makes things zoom bigger."
Her mom hugged her and said, "I like that name, Lily. Zoomy is a good name for your microscope. Now let's have some lunch. But no lemon for you, okay?"
Lily nodded and said, "Okay, mom. No lemon for me. But can I have some cheese, bread, and apple?"
Her mom said, "Of course, Lily. You can have some cheese, bread, and apple. And maybe some milk too. Milk is good for you."
Lily smiled and said, "Thank you, mom. I love you."
Her mom said, "I love you too, Lily. You are my sweet girl."

The fat human was sad. He slumped into a chair and held his head in his hands. "What's wrong?" asked his friend.
"I feel like no one is there to support me," he replied.
His friend put his hand on the fat human's shoulder. "I'm here for you," he said.
The friend stayed with the fat human until he felt better. Then they both went out into the park. 
The fat human smiled. He felt the support his friend had given him. Suddenly, he pointed to the sky and shouted, "Look!" He and his friend watched as a hundred colourful butterflies flew above them.
The fat human laughed. He knew that he always had the support of his friend and the other humans around him.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived a grumpy squirrel named Sam. Sam loved to collect cones. Every day, he would find cones and put them in his home. He had many cones and was very proud of them.
One day, Sam went out to find more cones. He saw a big cone on the ground and picked it up. But something unexpected happened! The cone began to shake and wiggle. Sam was very surprised and dropped the cone.
The cone opened up, and out came a friendly fairy. The fairy said, "Thank you for helping me, Sam. I was stuck in that cone! As a thank you, I will make your cones magic." Now, every time Sam collected a cone, it turned into a yummy treat. Sam was not grumpy anymore and shared his treats with all his friends in the forest.

Mike was very excited; today he was going to school for the first time. His mom said that he was going to learn a new game called "math". But when he arrived at the school, he saw all the other kids playing in the yard. He wanted to join them, but his mom said he had to go to his class. 
So, Mike slowly entered the classroom. Everyone stopped and looked at him. Mike felt very shy and he wished he could just go back to his mom. But the teacher smiled at Mike and told him to come sit down. 
Mike was very scared. He had no idea what math was. He didn't feel like math was a game. The teacher began to explain, but Mike couldn't understand it. After a while, he began to ignore the teacher. 
Mike's mom had said that school was important, so he tried to listen. But it was hard for him understand what math was. Finally, the teacher noticed that Mike was getting lost. She said sorry and explained to him in simple words. 
Finally, Mike began to understand what math is! He was so happy that he smiled. He realized that learning math was fun after all. He was glad he had not ignored the teacher!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was scared of the dark. At night, he would see scary things in his room. One day, Tim's mom had an idea to help him.
"Tim, let's hang a happy picture near your bed," said Mom. They found a picture of a funny cat and hung it on the wall. Now, when Tim looked at the cat, he would not feel scared.
One day, Tim saw a big sink in the kitchen. He had an idea. "Mom, can we wash the scary things away?" he asked. Mom smiled and said, "Yes, let's pretend to wash them away." They turned on the water and pretended to wash away the scary things. Tim felt much better and was not scared anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a tall farmer. He had a big farm with lots of animals. One day, the tall farmer went to see his animals. He saw a cow, a pig, and a sheep. He said, "Hello, cow! Hello, pig! Hello, sheep!"
The tall farmer was very tired. He let out a big yawn. The cow, the pig, and the sheep looked at the farmer. They saw how tired he was. The cow said, "Moo! Let's help the farmer." The pig said, "Oink! Yes, let's help him." The sheep said, "Baa! I want to help, too."
The cow, the pig, and the sheep worked together. They did the farmer's work. The tall farmer was very happy. He said, "Thank you, cow! Thank you, pig! Thank you, sheep!" The animals were happy, too. They all went to sleep after a long day.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there lived an incredible bird named Benny. Benny had many friends, but his best friend was a little squirrel named Sally. They loved to play together and listen to each other's stories.
One sunny day, Benny and Sally were playing near the big tree. Benny said, "Sally, I have an idea! Let's ask our friends what they think is the best game to play. I want to hear their opinion." Sally liked the idea and they started to ask their friends.
First, they asked Tommy the turtle. Tommy said, "I like to play hide and seek." Then they asked Freddy the frog. Freddy said, "I like to jump in the pond." Benny and Sally listened to all their friends' opinions and decided to play a new game. They mixed hide and seek with jumping in the pond. All the animals in the forest had an incredible time playing the new game. They were happy that Benny and Sally listened to their opinions.

Lily and Ben were playing with their toys in the living room. They liked to make cars and houses and animals with their blocks and dolls. But then, Lily saw a shiny roll of tape on the table. She wanted to use it for her car.
"Can I have the tape, please?" she asked Ben.
"No, it's mine!" Ben said. He grabbed the tape and ran away.
Lily was sad. She chased after Ben and tried to get the tape back. But Ben was faster and he hid behind the couch.
"Give me the tape, Ben! It's not fair!" Lily cried.
Ben stuck out his tongue and said, "No, it's mine! Go away!"
Lily was very sad. She felt like she had no friends. She sat on the floor and cried.
Mom heard the noise and came to see what was wrong. She saw Lily crying and Ben hiding.
"What's going on here?" she asked.
"Ben took the tape and he won't share!" Lily said.
"Ben, why did you do that?" Mom asked.
"Because I wanted it!" Ben said.
Mom shook her head. She said, "That's not nice, Ben. You made Lily suffer. You should share the tape with her. How would you feel if she took something you liked?"
Ben thought for a moment. He remembered how he felt when Lily took his favorite truck. He felt sad and angry.
He said, "I'm sorry, Lily. I didn't mean to make you suffer. Here, you can have the tape."
He gave the tape to Lily and came out from behind the couch.
Lily smiled and said, "Thank you, Ben. Do you want to play with me?"
Ben nodded and said, "Yes, please. Can we make a car together?"
Lily said, "Yes, we can. Let's use the tape and the blocks."
They hugged and went to play with their toys.
Mom smiled and said, "That's better. I'm proud of you, Ben and Lily. You learned how to share and be kind."
The end.

Mummy and Danny were walking through the park. Mummy was holding Danny's hand as they walked.
Suddenly, Danny saw something. He gasped and said, "What's that?" Mummy looked and said, "That's a tree with a large pill in it."
Danny looked excited and said, "Can I join the pill?" Mummy laughed and said, "That's a crazy idea! We can't join it."
Danny thought for a moment, then asked, "But can we hug it?" Mummy smiled and said, "That's a much better idea - let's do it!" So, Danny and Mummy hugged the large pill tree. Danny smiled and said, "That was nice." Mummy smiled and said, "Yes, it was."

Once upon a time, there was a pet. The pet was a great one. Its master loved it very much. Every day, its master would count how many times it played. But one day, the pet was very naughty and refused to do what its master said. The master was so angry that it shouted at the pet. It was so bad that the pet was scared and ran away.
The pet was so sad and scared that it ran and ran until it was far away from its home. It didn't stop running until it couldn't run anymore. sadly, the pet never found its way home again.
This sad story teaches a lesson. We should always treat our pets with kindness, respect and love. We should never count how many times it does something wrong, but just how many times it does something great. That way, our pet will always be happy and stay with us.

Once upon a time, there was a little red train. The train loved to go fast on the deep tracks. Every day, it went up and down the hills. One day, the train saw a big hill. It wanted to go up the hill very fast.
The little red train met a big blue train. The big blue train was very strong. The little red train asked, "Can you help me go up the big hill fast?" The big blue train said, "Yes, I can help you. Let's go up the hill together."
The little red train and the big blue train went up the big hill. They went faster and faster. When they reached the top, the little red train was so happy. It thanked the big blue train for the help. From that day on, they were the best of friends and went on many fun adventures together.

Once upon a time, in a distant land, there was a trail. On this trail, there lived a big cat and a small dog. They were friends who liked to play together. One day, the small dog said to the big cat, "Let's go find food to supply our home!"
As they walked down the trail, they saw a big box. The big cat looked at the small dog and said, "This must be a gift for us!" The small dog was very happy and wagged his tail. They pushed the big box all the way back to their home.
At their home, they opened the big box. Inside, they found lots of food! They were so happy and started to eat. But, suddenly, the food turned into rocks! The big cat and the small dog were very sad because they could not eat rocks. They had to go back to the trail to find more food, but they never found any. The end.

One day, a little girl named Lily found an old box in her room. The box was shut very tight, and it had a big bow on it. Lily was very excited to see what was inside the box.
Lily pulled the bow and opened the box. Inside, she found a small, old toy cat. The toy cat had a button on its back. Lily pushed the button, and the toy cat began to talk.
"Hello, I am Kitty," said the toy cat. "I am very old, but I am still a lot of fun. Do you want to play with me?"
Lily was so happy to have a new friend. She played with Kitty all day. They played with dolls, they played with blocks, and they even played hide and seek. At the end of the day, Lily put Kitty back in the box and shut it tight. She knew that tomorrow they would have more fun together.

One day, a colorful bird named Sunny came to play. Sunny loved to sing and dance. She had many friends in the big park. On Sunday, Sunny was very happy because she was going to meet her best friend, a little girl named Lily.
When Sunny saw Lily in the park, she said, "Hi! I am so happy to see you today!" Lily smiled and said, "Hi Sunny! I am happy to see you too. Let's play together!" They played in the park all day. They ran, jumped, and laughed.
As the sun began to set, Sunny said, "I had a lot of fun today. I will see you next Sunday, Lily!" Lily hugged Sunny and said, "I had fun too. I will miss you. See you next Sunday!" And with that, they said goodbye and went home.

One day, a little girl named Daisy went for a walk with her loyal dog, Spot. They liked to play in the park and look for fun things. Daisy saw a big tree and thought it would be a good place to find a surprise.
Daisy asked Spot to help her look around the tree. They looked and looked, but they could not find anything. Daisy was sad. She wanted to find a surprise so badly. Spot saw that Daisy was sad and wanted to help her.
Spot ran away from the tree and came back with a toy in his mouth. Daisy was so happy and surprised! She didn't know that Spot had hidden the toy there before. Daisy and Spot played with the toy all day. They had so much fun, and Daisy knew that her loyal friend Spot would always make her happy.

Once upon a time, there was a long horse named Bob. Bob lived on a farm with his friend, a little girl named Sue. They loved to play together every day. One day, while they were playing, Bob said, "Sue, let's run and jump!"
As they ran, Bob stumbled on a big rock. He fell down and hurt his leg. Sue was sad and said, "Oh no, Bob! Are you okay?" Bob said, "My leg hurts, Sue. I can't run and jump anymore." Sue hugged Bob and went to find help.
Sue found a kind doctor who came to look at Bob's leg. The doctor said, "Bob, I have a surprise for you. When you stumbled, you didn't hurt your leg. You found a magic rock!" The magic rock made Bob's leg better, and now he could run and jump even higher than before. Sue and Bob were very happy and played together all day long.

Lila loved dolphins. She wanted to see them and touch them and hold them. She asked her mom and dad to take her to the sea park, where they had dolphins in a big pool. They said yes, but they also said she had to be careful and listen to the trainers.
At the sea park, Lila was very excited. She saw the dolphins jump and splash and make funny noises. She clapped and laughed and pointed. She wanted to go closer. She saw a trainer with a whistle and a bucket of fish. She ran to him and said, "Can I hold a dolphin, please?"
The trainer smiled and said, "You can't hold a dolphin, Lila. They are too big and strong for you. But you can pet one, if you are gentle and quiet. Do you want to try?"
Lila nodded. She followed the trainer to the edge of the pool. He whistled and a dolphin came near. He gave Lila a fish and told her to hold it in her hand. He said, "This is Dora. She is very friendly and smart. She likes fish. If you give her the fish, she will let you pet her."
Lila held the fish and reached out her hand. Dora came closer and opened her mouth. Lila dropped the fish and Dora caught it. Then Lila touched Dora's smooth skin. It felt wet and slippery. Lila smiled and said, "Hi, Dora. You are so pretty and nice. Can I hold you?"
Dora made a squeaky sound and nudged Lila's hand with her nose. She wanted more fish. The trainer gave Lila another fish and said, "You are very persistent, Lila. But you can't hold Dora. She is not a toy. She is a living creature. You have to respect her and let her swim freely."
Lila understood. She gave Dora the fish and said, "Thank you, Dora. I'm sorry I wanted to hold you. I just like you a lot. You are my favorite dolphin. Can I come back and see you again?"
Dora made another squeaky sound and splashed Lila with her tail. She was happy and playful. The trainer said, "Of course you can come back, Lila. Dora likes you too. She likes people who are kind and curious. But remember, you can only pet her, not hold her. OK?"
Lila nodded. She said, "OK. I will remember. Bye, Dora. Bye, trainer. Thank you for letting me pet a dolphin. It was the best day ever." She waved and ran back to her mom and dad. She told them all about Dora and how she petted her. They hugged her and said they were proud of her. They said she was a good girl and a good friend to the dolphins.

Once upon a time, there was a stubborn boy named Tom. He liked to play with his toys and cables. One day, Tom's mom told him not to play with the big cable. But Tom did not listen.
Tom's friend, Sam, came to play. They saw the big cable and wanted to play with it. Sam said, "No, we should not. Your mom said no." Tom did not care. He was very stubborn. He pulled the cable, and it broke. Sam was sad and scared.
Tom's mom came and saw the broken cable. She was not happy. Tom said, "Sorry, mom." But his mom did not forgive him. She was very sad. Tom learned that being stubborn can lead to bad things.

One day, a little girl named Lily found a big book. The book had many pretty pictures inside. Lily loved to look at the pictures and make up stories about them. She wanted to design her own book with pretty pictures too.
Lily asked her mom, "Can I make a book like this with my own pictures?" Her mom smiled and said, "Of course! Let's get some paper and colors for you to draw with."
Lily drew many pictures of her friends, her toys, and her favorite tasty treats. She even drew a picture of her cat eating a tasty fish. When she was done, her mom helped her put all the pictures together to make her own book.
Lily was so happy with her new book. She showed it to all her friends and they loved it too. Every night, Lily would look at her book and remember how much fun she had designing it.

Once there was a small boy. He wanted to play, but he was embarrassed. He wanted to go deep into the forest. He thought he would be very brave in the deep forest.
So, the little boy went deep into the forest. He walked and walked until he got lost. He couldn't find his way back. He got scared and he started to cry.
Soon, an ambulance came to help. The ambulance drove him back home. But the little boy was still embarrassed. He had embarrassed himself by getting lost.
He never went deep into the forest again. He was embarrassed and sad. He was embarrassed and sad when he thought about getting lost in the deep forest.

Once upon a time, there was a big hill in a pretty landscape. On the hill lived a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to collect rocks. One day, Tim met a girl named Sue. Sue also liked to collect rocks. They decided to collect rocks together.
As they collected rocks, Sue said, "Tim, I found a big shiny rock! We should share it." But Tim was feeling selfish. He said, "No, I want it for myself!" Sue felt sad and went away.
Later, Tim felt bad for being selfish. He wanted to say sorry to Sue. As he walked to find her, he tripped on a rock and dropped the shiny rock. The rock broke in half! Inside, they found a treasure map. Tim found Sue and said, "I'm sorry, Sue. Let's share the treasure." They followed the map and found a big box of colorful rocks. They were happy to share the treasure and became best friends.

One day, a little boy named Tim was restless. He wanted to find a yummy dessert. He walked and walked, looking for something sweet to eat.
While walking, Tim stumbled upon a big, red apple. He thought, "This is not a dessert, but it is sweet." He took a bite and suddenly, the apple started to talk! It said, "Thank you for taking a bite. I am a magic apple."
The magic apple told Tim that it could turn into any dessert he wanted. Tim was so happy and surprised. He asked the apple to turn into a big, yummy cake. And just like that, the apple turned into a cake. Tim enjoyed his dessert and was not restless anymore.

Once there was a rabbit called Ben. He was hopping through the forest when he heard a strange noise. He looked around and saw that the noise was coming from a branch. He hopped closer and saw a tiny bird called Lucy. She had her wing caught in a pinch of the branch. Lucy was scared and worried.
Ben said, "Don't worry, Lucy, I'll help you." He hopped up and used his teeth to bite the branch and free Lucy. 
"Thank you, Ben," said Lucy. 
"You're welcome," replied Ben.
He helped Lucy get back to her tree and said goodbye.
Ben was happy that he had helped Lucy and hopped away with a smile on his face.

Once upon a time, there was a clever girl named Lucy. She liked to go to school and learn new things. Every day, she would sit in front of the big blackboard and listen to her teacher.
One day, Lucy's teacher asked her to wipe the blackboard. As she wiped the blackboard, she saw something strange. The blackboard started to show new words and pictures that no one had seen before.
Lucy showed her teacher the new words and pictures. The teacher was very surprised and happy. They found out that the blackboard was magic! Now, Lucy and her friends could learn even more fun things with the magic blackboard.

One day, a little boy named Tim was eager to touch a cauliflower. He had never seen one before. He went to the market with his mom. There, he saw a big pile of cauliflowers. He was very excited.
Tim asked his mom, "Can I touch the cauliflower, please?" His mom said, "Yes, but be gentle." Tim reached out and touched the cauliflower. It felt bumpy and funny. He liked it.
But then, a little girl named Lily came over. She wanted to touch the cauliflower too. Tim didn't want to share. They both started to cry. Their moms talked, and then Tim and Lily took turns touching the cauliflower. They became friends and played together at the market.

One day, a cool cat named Sam found a bottle of shampoo. He wanted to play with it. He thought it would be fun to cover his fur with the shampoo. So, he opened the bottle and poured it all over himself. He had a lot of fun playing with the bubbles.
But then, something unexpected happened. Sam started to feel very cold and wet. He didn't like it at all. He tried to shake off the shampoo, but it wouldn't come off. He was scared and didn't know what to do.
Just then, a big dog named Max saw Sam. Max knew what to do. He took Sam to a warm place and helped him wash off the shampoo. After that, Sam and Max became best friends. They played together every day, and Sam never played with shampoo again.

One day, a little girl named Mia went for a walk with her mom. The sun was shining and the air was mild. They walked down the street, holding hands and smiling.
As they walked, they saw a big screen in the park. There were many kids and their parents sitting on the grass, watching a funny movie. Mia and her mom decided to join them and watch the movie too.
Mia's mom said, "Look at the screen, Mia! The funny dog is walking on two legs!" Mia laughed and clapped her hands. They had a great time watching the movie together. After the movie, they walked back home, feeling happy and tired.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Sue. Sue loved the color orange. She had an orange dress, an orange hat, and even an orange cat. One day, Sue saw an orange shadow on the wall. She thought it was very pretty.
Sue asked her mom, "Mom, can I buy the orange shadow?" Her mom said, "No, Sue. Shadows are not for sale. They are just there when the sun shines on things."
Sue was sad, but she had an idea. She tried to catch the orange shadow in a box. But when she closed the box, the shadow was gone. Sue was very sad and cried. She wanted the orange shadow so much.
The next day, Sue saw the orange shadow again. She asked her dad, "Dad, can I buy the orange shadow?" Her dad said, "No, Sue. Shadows are not for sale. They are just there when the sun shines on things."
Sue was very sad. She tried to catch the shadow again, but it always went away. She never got to buy the orange shadow, and she was sad for a very long time.

Once upon a time, there was a normal cat named Tom. Tom loved to dance. Every day, he would dance in his yard. All his friends would come and watch him dance. They loved to see Tom dance.
One day, Tom's mom made a dessert. She made a big, yummy cake. She told Tom, "Share this dessert with your friends after you dance." Tom was very happy. He could not wait to share the cake with his friends.
Tom started to dance. All his friends were watching. But then, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and took the dessert away! Tom and his friends were sad. They did not know what to do. They all looked for the dessert together. They found the cake in a tree. Tom's friend, a tall giraffe, helped to get the cake down. They all shared the dessert and had a great time.
The moral of the story is that when we work together, we can solve problems and have fun.

One day a mommy and her little girl went to the park. The little girl was holding a bag of beautiful marbles. She was so excited to play with them.
The little girl sat on the grass and started to spread the marbles around. She worked hard to put the marbles in the right spots.
Suddenly, a scary dog came running up to them. The little girl was so scared that she ran away quickly.
"It's okay," said the mommy. "The dog won't hurt you. He just wants to play with us."
The mommy smiled at the little girl and held out her hand. The little girl was still scared, but she took her mommy's hand anyways.
Together, they went back to the marbles and the mommy helped her little girl finish her work. The little girl felt much better then, and she was no longer scared.
The two of them laughed and played with the marbles for the rest of the day.

Once upon a time there was a mighty dragon. He lived in a big, dark cave and had a lot of treasures and gold.
The dragon had an important job. He guarded a secret. He kept a big number inside the cave. It was the most important number ever!
One day, a brave knight came to the dragon's cave. He wanted the secret number. The dragon tried to fight him but the knight was too strong.
The brave knight took the secret number and ran away. The dragon was very sad.
But then something amazing happened. The knight returned to the cave. He had the number with him. He gave it back to the dragon, who was so happy.
The dragon thanked the knight and made him a special gift. The knight was very pleased and they both lived happily ever after. That is the story of the mighty dragon and his secret number.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird with a hurt wing. The bird could not fly. It was sad. A big, strong, and dependable dog saw the bird. The dog wanted to help the bird.
The dog said, "Trust me, little bird. I will help you." The bird was scared of the dog at first. But the dog was nice, so the bird trusted the dog. The dog took the bird to its warm and safe home.
In the dog's home, the bird's wing got better. The bird was happy and could fly again. The bird and the dog became best friends. They played together every day, and the bird knew it could always trust the dependable dog.

Once there was a helpless little bunny. She was looking for something yummy to eat. She hopped through the forest and soon found a ripe peach tree. The bunny was so excited. She hopped up to the peach tree, but she couldn't reach the peaches. She hopped around, hoping for a way she could get them. 
Then a friendly bird swooped down to help her. The bird had a sharp beak and he used it to cut down the peaches. The bunny thanked the helpful bird and hopped away with a yummy peach.
The rabbit nibbled on the peach and it was the best snack ever. She thanked the bird again in her mind and hopped away with a full tummy.

One day, a big cow and a little cow were in the barn. The big cow was hungry, so she went to grab some hay to eat. But, the hay was bad and it tasted yucky. The big cow said, "Oh no, this hay is bad! What do we do now?"
The little cow had an idea. He said, "Let's go find good hay to eat!" So, they went outside to look for good hay. They saw a big pile of hay near the fence. The big cow and the little cow were very happy.
But, there was a mean goat near the hay. The goat said, "This is my hay, you can't have it!" The big cow and the little cow were sad. They didn't know what to do. Then, the big cow had an idea. She said, "We can share the hay with you."
The goat thought about it and said, "Okay, we can share." So, the big cow, the little cow, and the goat all ate the good hay together. They were happy and full. The big cow and the little cow learned that sharing is good.

One day, a curious little girl named Lily wanted to watch a movie. She asked her mom, "Can I watch a movie, please?" Her mom said, "Yes, but first you have to clean your room."
Lily started to clean, but she found a big box under her bed. She kneeled down to look inside. The box was full of toys she had never seen before. Lily was very excited and started to play with them.
After a while, her mom came in and saw the toys. She was surprised and said, "These are not your toys, Lily. They belong to the boy next door." Lily felt bad and said, "I'm sorry, Mom. I didn't know." They decided to give the toys back and then Lily could watch her movie.

One day, a creative girl named Lucy went to the park with her friends. They wanted to play a fun game. Lucy had a great idea. She said, "Let's play a game on the pitch!" The pitch was a big, open space where they could run and play.
But her friend Tom didn't want to play on the pitch. He wanted to play on the swings. Lucy and Tom started to disagree. Lucy said, "I want to play on the pitch!" Tom said, "No, I want to play on the swings!" Their friends didn't know what to do.
Then, Lucy had a new idea. She said, "Let's play a game that uses both the pitch and the swings!" Everyone liked this idea. They played a game where they ran from the pitch to the swings and back. Lucy and Tom stopped disagreeing and they all had a great time.

Once upon a time, there was a small animal who had to hide. It was very scared. The animal was looking for a new home.
The animal looked everywhere, but it was too scared to find a safe place. Suddenly, the animal heard loud voices. He quickly hid behind a big bush, so that no one could see him.
The animal was very scared, because the voices were very harsh. He stayed hidden, until darkness came and it was safe to leave.
Finally, the animal spotted a small cave. He went inside and looked around. He found that it was the perfect home.
The animal was very happy to have found a safe place and he never had to hide again.

One day, Mama Bear took Baby Bear for a regular walk in the forest. As they walked, Mama Bear saw an ashtray on the ground. She turned to Baby Bear and said, "If you pick up the ashtray, you will succeed." Baby Bear was very proud, and he promptly went and picked up the ashtray.
On their way home, Baby Bear asked his Mama, "What does 'succeed' mean?" 
Mama Bear smiled and said, "Succeed means to do something well and make yourself proud. You picked up the ashtray, and now you should be proud of what you achieved."
When they got home, they told Papa Bear the good news. Papa Bear said, "Well done! I'm proud of you, Baby Bear!" 
Baby Bear learned an important lesson that day - that all actions have meaning, and you should always strive to be the best you can be. If you work hard, you can succeed!

Once there was a little girl called Emily. She was only three years old. She liked to play and explore. One day she was exploring in the garden and saw a big bee. Emily was frightened. She backed away and watched as the bee flew away. 
When Emily was feeling braver, she decided to touch the bee's nest. Suddenly a bee flew out and Emily started to cry. She was so frightened that she ran inside the house. 
Once she was safely inside, Emily looked around for something brave that she could do. She saw her dad's kind smile and she suddenly knew what she needed to do. Emily tiptoed outside and looked at the bee's nest. She watched for a while and suddenly realised how valuable bees are. 
Emily carefully looked at the bee, and saw it had two big eyes and a cute little nose. She had never seen something so small and precious. Emily knew she had to be careful so she backed away slowly.
When she was safely inside again, Emily held a hand on her beating heart. She was frightened but happy. Emily had learnt to value even the smallest of things.

Once upon a time, there was a little angel. She had light wings and a big smile. She lived in a pretty house in the sky. Every day, she played with her friends and had fun.
One day, the little angel met a small boy. The boy was sad and alone. The little angel wanted to help. She told the boy that she was his friend. The boy smiled and felt happy.
The little angel and the boy played together every day. They told each other stories and laughed a lot. The boy's heart was full of light and love. They were best friends forever.

Once upon a time there was a boy named Sam. Sam was excited because he was about to go on a big adventure. He waved goodbye to Mama and Daddy, who were standing outside the gate of their home.
Sam went to the forest. He saw so many things! He saw some tall trees, and some animals running around. He even saw a cell. Sam's eyes lit up because he had never seen a cell before. 
He approached the cell. It was very clean, with bars made of metal. Sam put both hands on the bar and kneeled down. He looked inside the cell and saw a little mouse. Sam smiled and waved to the mouse. 
The mouse smiled back, before hopping away into the fun and adventure of the forest! Sam smiled as he watched the mouse go, and then he ran off to explore more.

Once upon a time, there was a big, clean kitchen. In the kitchen, there was a dishwasher. The dishwasher was very good at washing dishes. Every day, it made the dishes clean and shiny.
One day, a little boy named Timmy came into the kitchen. He saw the dishwasher and wanted to help. He opened the dishwasher and put all the dirty dishes inside. Then, he pushed the button to make the dishwasher start.
While the dishwasher was working, Timmy played with his toys. He played with his cars and trucks. But then, he heard a noise. It was the dishwasher saying, "I surrender! I surrender!" The dishwasher was full and could not wash any more dishes.
Timmy opened the dishwasher and saw all the clean dishes. He was very happy. He took the clean dishes out and put them away. Now, the dishwasher could rest. Timmy knew that he and the dishwasher worked together to make the dishes clean. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a sleepy kitty who was sitting in a chair. The kitty was so tired that it couldn't keep its eyes open. 
Suddenly, the kitty jumped up in surprise when it heard a noise. It was mommy, pouring milk into a bowl. 
The kitty said, "Yum! Is that milk for me?" 
Mommy smiled and said, "Yes kitty, it is. Come sit in the chair and I'll give it to you." 
The kitty hopped up the chair and mommy poured the milk into the bowl. 
The kitty licked its lips and said, "Mmmm, this milk tastes so good! I'm not so sleepy anymore." 
Mommy nodded and said, "Good kitty, now let's get you to bed."

One day, a boy named Tim got some soap. He wanted to do something impressive. He thought hard. Then, he had an idea. He would blow big bubbles with the soap.
Tim started to blow bubbles. They were big and fun. But then, something unexpected happened. The wind blew the bubbles away. They flew up, up, up into the sky. Tim was sad, but he did not give up.
He tried again and again. Finally, he made the biggest bubble ever. Everyone saw the big bubble and clapped. Tim was happy. He learned that if you do not give up, you can do impressive things.

Once upon a time, there was a wealthy man. He had a pretty comb. He loved to whistle. Every day, he would whistle and comb his hair. He was very happy.
One day, he went for a walk. He saw a big tree. He sat under the tree and started to whistle. He put his comb on the ground. He did not see a little bird watching him.
The little bird liked the pretty comb. The bird flew down and took the comb. The wealthy man was sad. He looked for the comb but could not find it.
Then, he heard a whistle. It was the little bird! The bird had the comb in its nest. The man asked, "Can I have my comb back?" The bird said, "If you teach me to whistle like you, I will give it back." The man agreed. They became friends, and the man taught the bird to whistle. They whistled and played together every day.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a camp. In the camp, there were many animals. One day, a little bear named Ben felt helpless. He lost his toy and could not find it.
Ben's friend, a small bird named Tim, saw Ben's sad face. Tim asked, "Why are you sad, Ben?" Ben said, "I lost my toy and I feel helpless. Can you help me find it?" Tim insisted, "Yes, let's look for it together!"
They looked near the trees and by the river. At last, they found the toy under a bush. Ben was so happy and thanked Tim. From that day on, they became the best of friends, and they always helped each other at camp.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was a proud girl who loved to wear her shiny crown. Every day, she would put on her crown and dance around the house.
One day, Lily's mom said, "We need to pack for our trip!" Lily did not want to leave her crown behind. So, she put it in her bag with her clothes and toys. She was excited to show her friends her beautiful crown.
When they reached their friend's house, Lily put on her crown and said, "Look at my crown! Isn't it pretty?" Her friends loved it and they all played together, wearing their own crowns. They had a fun day and Lily was very happy.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a hairy bear. The bear had a lot of friends. They liked to play and have fun together.
One day, the hairy bear found a big stick. He decided to hold the stick and show it to his friends. The friends saw the stick and thought it was very cool.
The hairy bear and his friends played with the stick all day. They took turns to hold the stick and run around the forest. They were very happy and had a great time. And the hairy bear was glad he found the stick in the forest.

Once upon a time there was a girl called Betty. Betty was 3 years old and wanted to learn more every day. One day, Betty's mum took her to a peaceful vineyard. Betty learned that the vines were where wine was made. She enjoyed exploring the vineyard, looking at all the plants and the peaceful animals. 
The next day, Betty and her mum went back to the vineyard. This time Betty learned even more. She saw the farmers picking the grapes and crushing them to make the grape juice which would later become wine. Betty was so excited to learn about how wine was made. She couldn't wait to tell her friends at school. 
Every week, Betty and her mum went back to the vineyard to learn more about wine. Betty got to try some of the wine made there and it was delicious! She also saw how the farmers chose the best grapes to make the best wine. 
Soon, Betty became an expert on wines. She had learned so much and felt very proud. The vineyard was peaceful and Betty had learned something really special.

Once upon a time, there was a pretty bird. The bird had many colors. It liked to fly high in the sky.
One day, the bird saw a window. The window was in a small house. The bird wanted to see what was inside. It flew to the window and looked in.
Inside the house, a girl saw the bird. She was happy the bird arrived. She opened the window and gave the bird some food. The bird and the girl became friends. They played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim loved cookies. One day, he saw a poor old man with a big bag of cookies. Tim wanted the cookies, so he made a plan.
Tim went up to the old man and said, "Hi, can I help you with your bag?" The old man was happy and said, "Yes, thank you, Tim." As they walked, Tim thought about how he would take the cookies.
Then, something unexpected happened. The bag broke, and all the cookies fell on the ground. The old man was sad, and Tim felt bad too. He said, "I'm sorry, I wanted to take your cookies." The old man said, "That's not nice, Tim. We should share and help each other."
In the end, Tim learned that it's better to share and be kind than to take things from others. The cookies were all gone, and both Tim and the old man were sad.

Once upon a time, in a big castle, there lived a princess. She loved to play outside. One day, she saw a swing near a big tree. The princess was very happy.
The princess ran to the swing and said, "I want to swing high!" She sat on the swing and began to move back and forth. The sun was hot, and the ground was dry. The princess felt hot but she kept swinging.
A mean witch saw the princess on the swing. The witch said, "I will take the princess away!" She cast a spell on the swing. The princess could not stop swinging. She swung higher and higher, and then she was gone. The swing was empty, and the princess was never seen again.

Once upon a time, there was a little pink house. In the house, there was a girl named Lily. Lily liked to play with water. She played with the water from the faucet in the sink. She liked to splash and make a big mess.
One day, Lily's mom saw the big mess. She was not happy. She told Lily that she must clean up the water. Lily did not want to clean up the water. She wanted to keep playing. But her mom said, "No, you must clean up now."
Lily's mom said if she did not clean up, she would punish her. Lily did not want to be punished. So, she cleaned up the water. She was sad, but she knew it was the right thing to do. From that day on, Lily only played with water outside.

Once upon a time, there was a big, deaf frog who lived near a toilet. The frog liked to sit on the toilet and watch the bugs fly by. One day, a little bird came to visit the frog. The bird saw the frog sitting on the toilet and said, "Hello, frog! Why are you sitting on the toilet?"
The deaf frog could not hear the bird, so it did not say anything. The bird thought the frog was sad. The bird wanted to help the frog feel better. The bird saw some fruit on a tree nearby. The fruit was old and starting to rot. The bird picked up the fruit and gave it to the frog.
The frog did not like the rotten fruit, but it was happy that the bird wanted to help. The frog and the bird became good friends. They played together every day, even though the frog could not hear. They showed each other that being different is okay, and they were happy to have a friend who understood them.

Once upon a time, in a hidden place in the forest, there was a little insect. The insect had many friends. They were all very happy.
One day, a little girl named Lucy came to the forest. She saw the insect and said, "Wow! I admire you, little insect. You are so pretty!" The insect was very happy to hear this.
The insect said, "Thank you, Lucy! Do you want to meet my friends?" Lucy said, "Yes, I do!" So, the insect took Lucy to meet all of its friends in the hidden place. They all played and had a lot of fun.

One day, a little duck named Ducky went to find some tasty food. He saw a big tree with red apples. Ducky wanted to eat the apples, but he was too small to reach them. His friend, Bunny, came and said, "I will help you!" Bunny tried to encourage Ducky to jump high and get the apples.
Ducky and Bunny jumped and jumped, but they could not reach the apples. They felt sad. Then, something unexpected happened. A big flood came and water filled the land. The tree with the apples started to shake and the apples fell down.
Ducky and Bunny were so happy. They swam to the apples and ate them. The apples were very tasty. The flood helped them get the apples, and they were not sad anymore. They learned that even when things seem bad, something good can happen too.

Once upon a time, in a small village near the sea, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to imagine things. One day, he imagined an island far away. It was a big island with many trees and animals.
One day, Tim met a new friend, Sam. Sam was fearful of many things. Tim told Sam, "Let's imagine we go to the island together!" Sam said, "But I am fearful of the island. What if there are big animals that can hurt us?" Tim smiled and said, "Don't be fearful, Sam. We can imagine the island to be a safe and fun place."
So Tim and Sam imagined the island together. They played with the animals and climbed the trees. They had so much fun. Sam learned that he didn't need to be fearful when he used his imagination. Tim and Sam became best friends, and they went on many more adventures using their imaginations. The moral of the story is that when we imagine, we can make our fears go away and have fun with our friends.

Once upon a time, there was a mighty bird named Bobo. Bobo lived in a birdcage in a big house. He was not happy in the cage. He wanted to fly and see the world.
One day, a little boy named Tim came to the house. Tim saw Bobo in the birdcage and said, "Why are you in there, Bobo? You are a mighty bird, and you should be free." Bobo knew Tim was right, but he did not know how to get out.
That night, a bad cat came to the house. The cat wanted to eat Bobo. Bobo was scared, but he knew he had to fight. He used his mighty wings to push the birdcage door open. The cat was surprised and ran away.
Bobo was now free from the birdcage. He said to Tim, "Thank you for helping me see that I am mighty. Now I can fly and see the world!" And with that, Bobo flew away, happy and free.

Once upon a time, there was a pretty rose in a big garden. It was red and smelled very nice. Many bugs and bees liked to visit the rose.
One day, a little girl named Lily saw the rose. She wanted to grab it and take it home. But she felt uncomfortable because the rose had sharp thorns. Lily was scared of getting hurt.
So, Lily asked her mom for help. Her mom carefully grabbed the rose for her. They took the rose home and put it in a vase. Lily was very happy to have the pretty rose in her room.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was very eager to play. One day, he found a pipe in the garden. He picked it up and started to play with it. He pretended it was a sword to fight with.
Tim had a friend named Max. Max came to play with Tim. They both wanted to play with the pipe. They started to fight over it. They pulled and pushed, but no one would let go. Their faces turned red, and they were not happy.
Then, Tim's mom came out and saw them fighting. She told them to stop and said, "You both can play with the pipe together." Max and Tim looked at each other and smiled. They both played together, using the pipe as a sword to fight imaginary dragons. They had so much fun, and they learned that playing together was better than fighting.

Tim and Sue like to play in the sand. They have a big bucket and a small shovel. They dig and dig and make a big hole. They find a bottle in the sand. The bottle is old and dirty. They open the bottle and see a paper inside.
"What is this?" Tim asks.
"Maybe it is a map," Sue says. "Maybe it shows us where to find treasure."
They take out the paper and look at it. It has many lines and dots and words. They do not understand the words. They try to follow the lines and dots.
"Let's go this way," Tim says. He points to a big tree.
"OK," Sue says. She follows Tim. They leave the bucket, the shovel and the bottle in the hole.
They walk and walk and walk. They do not see the tree. They do not see the sand. They see only grass and rocks and bushes. They are lost.
They start to cry. They are hungry and thirsty and scared. They do not know how to go back. They do not see anyone. They are alone.
A big snake sees them. The snake is hungry and alert. It slithers and slithers and slithers. It comes closer and closer and closer. It opens its mouth and shows its teeth.
Tim and Sue scream. They try to run. But it is too late. The snake bites them and swallows them. They are gone.
The bottle is still in the hole. The paper is still in the bottle. The paper is a warning. It says: "Do not open this bottle. Do not follow this map. It leads to danger. It leads to death." But Tim and Sue did not read the warning. They did not listen. They did not bury the bottle. They did not stay in the sand. They made a big mistake. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a big bird called an ostrich. The ostrich had long legs and a long neck. It lived in a nice, warm place with many other animals. The ostrich was very happy.
One day, the ostrich went for a walk. It walked and walked until it got lost. The ostrich was sad and wanted to go back home. It did not know how to return.
Then, a small, friendly bird saw the lost ostrich. The small bird knew how to get back home. It said, "Follow me, ostrich!" The two birds walked and walked together. Soon, they returned to the nice, warm place.
The ostrich was very happy to be home with its friends. It thanked the small bird for helping it return. From that day on, the ostrich and the small bird were best friends. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to watch his favorite show on the television. But sometimes, he felt ashamed because he did not know how to tie his shoes.
One day, Tim's mom saw him struggling with his shoes. She wanted to help and encourage him. She said, "Tim, you can do it! Just keep trying and you will learn. I believe in you."
Tim listened to his mom and tried again. He felt better and not so ashamed. With his mom's help and encouragement, Tim finally learned to tie his shoes. Now, he could watch his favorite show on the television and play outside with his friends without worrying about his shoes.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. Amy liked to wander around her house. One day, she wandered into her mom's room. She saw a big, smooth bed. Amy thought it would be fun to jump on the bed.
"Mom, can I jump on your smooth bed?" asked Amy. Her mom said, "No, Amy. It is not safe to jump on the bed."
But Amy did not listen to her mom. When her mom left the room, Amy started to jump on the bed. She jumped high and laughed loudly. She was having so much fun.
Suddenly, Amy jumped too high and fell off the bed. She hit the floor and started to cry. Her mom came back and saw Amy on the floor. She felt sad for Amy, but she also knew that Amy should have listened to her.

Once, there had been an ancient wide river. All the animals and birds living around it had been happy, as they could borrow food from the river to eat.
One day, some bad people turned up and decided to borrow without asking. They started to borrow the food from the river, and soon took all the food away.
When the animals and birds saw this, they were very unhappy; they had no food left to borrow. They begged the bad people to borrow only a little bit, but they did not listen. The bad people kept borrowing until all the food was gone.
The river became empty, and the animals and birds had to find food from somewhere else. They never again borrowed from the ancient wide river.

Mandy was a 3 year old girl who loved the outdoors. Every day she would open her front door and head outside to explore. Today was different though - when Mandy opened the door she heard a quiet voice urging her to come out. She stepped onto the porch and looked around. There was nobody in sight but Mandy felt like something special was happening so she stepped off the porch. 
A few steps later she bumped into a magical fairy. She was quite surprised but the fairy smiled brightly. The fairy then urged Mandy to join her on a magical journey. 
Mandy was so excited that she ran back to the door to tell her mum and dad. She opened the door and shouted "Mum, Dad, I'm going on a magical journey with the fairy queen". But all was quiet - the family was fast asleep. 
Mandy knew it was now or never. She grabbed her coat, stepped out of the door and said goodbye to her sleeping family. Off she went, hand in hand with the fairy queen, never to look back.

Tom and Anna like to play with models. They have models of cars, planes, animals and people. They use glue and paint to make them look real. Sometimes they make models from clay or paper.
One day, Tom and Anna want to make a model of a boat. They find a big cardboard box and cut out a shape. They glue some sticks and paper to make a mast and a sail. They paint the boat blue and white.
"Look, our boat is ready!" Tom says. "Let's take it to the pond and see if it can float."
"Okay, but we have to be careful. The water might soak the cardboard and make it soft." Anna says.
They carry the boat to the pond and put it on the water. The boat floats for a while, but then it starts to sink. The cardboard gets wet and soggy. Tom and Anna are sad.
"Oh no, our boat is ruined!" Tom says.
"I'm sorry, Tom. I wish we had a better model." Anna says.
They see a man walking by with a dog. The man has a real boat in his hand. It is made of wood and metal. It has a motor and a propeller. The man sees Tom and Anna and their soggy boat.
"Hello, kids. What are you doing?" The man asks.
"We were playing with our model boat, but it soaked in the water and broke." Tom says.
"That's too bad. Do you like boats?" The man asks.
"Yes, we love boats. We want to be sailors when we grow up." Anna says.
"Well, why don't you try my boat? It is a real boat. It can go fast and make waves. It won't soak in the water. It is very fun." The man says.
"Really? Can we?" Tom and Anna ask.
"Sure, why not? You can borrow it for a while. I'll watch you from here. Just be careful and don't go too far." The man says.
He gives them his boat and shows them how to use the remote control. Tom and Anna are very happy. They thank the man and take the boat to the water. They make it go forward and backward, left and right. They make it splash and zoom. They have a lot of fun.
"Wow, this boat is amazing! Thank you, mister. You are very helpful." Tom says.
"Yes, thank you. You are very kind. We like your boat and your dog." Anna says.
They give the boat back to the man and pet his dog. The man smiles and says goodbye. He tells them to keep playing and learning. Tom and Anna wave and run back to their house. They tell their mom and dad about their adventure. They say they want to make a better model boat someday. They say they want to be like the helpful man with the real boat.

Once upon a time, there was a big lion who lived on a planet far, far away. This lion was incredible. He had a big mane and a long tail. He loved to run, jump, and play with his friends.
One day, the lion heard a loud noise. He did not know what it was. He looked around and saw a little bird trapped in a tree. The lion wanted to help the bird. He knew that if he roared very loud, the tree would shake and the bird would be free.
So, the lion took a deep breath and roared as loud as he could. The tree shook, and the little bird was free. The bird was so happy and thanked the lion. They became best friends and played together every day on their incredible planet. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a small stack of stones hidden in the forest. 
Jack and Max were two little boys who liked to explore the forest. One day, they found the hidden stack of stones and were so excited. They decided to learn how to use the stones to build a tower.
Jack started to move the stones, but Max wasn't too sure. He thought it could be bad luck. However, Jack did not listen and started to move the stones faster and faster.
 
Max became scared and told Jack that moving the stones too fast might be dangerous. But Jack kept going faster and faster. Suddenly, Max heard a loud rumbling sound.
Crack! The hidden stack of stones began to move and tumble as they hit the ground. The tower had collapsed and all the stones were now scattered on the ground.
Jack had not listened and now the hidden stack of stones was gone.
The moral of this story is to take time to learn before you act. Moving too quickly can have bad consequences.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Tim went to the barber with his mom. Tim was scared because it was his first haircut. The barber had a big chair and many tools. Tim's mom said, "It's okay, the barber will keep you safe."
The barber smiled and said, "Don't worry, Tim. I will be gentle and make your hair nice." Tim sat in the big chair and the barber put a cape around him. The barber started to cut Tim's hair. Tim felt the soft touch of the barber's hand and began to feel safe.
After the haircut, Tim looked in the mirror and saw his new hair. He smiled and said, "Thank you, barber! I like my hair now." Tim's mom hugged him and said, "I knew the barber would comfort you." They left the barber shop, happy and ready to come back next time.

Once upon a time there was a brave little bunny. His name was Sam and he always wanted to do something great.
One day it began to rain and Sam saw a deep puddle. He thought it was a perfect opportunity to jump in the water. He jumped in with excitement and he splashed around.
Just then, a tall officer walked by and saw what Sam was doing. "Stop that!", he ordered. "I can't let you do that! It's dangerous".
Sam looked at the officer, but didn't understand. "Why can't I do this?" he asked. "Sometimes things that seem like a lot of fun, can actually be dangerous," the officer replied.
Sam realized that in order to be successful and do something great, he had to think calmly and use his good judgement. He thanked the officer for helping him and promised to do the right thing. 
The moral of the story is that you should always use good judgement and think carefully before making decisions. It's the best way to be successful!

One day, a big red ball went bounce, bounce, bounce. It was a fun ball. A little girl named Mia played with it. She liked to bounce it high and catch it. But Mia was troubled. She was not allowed to play with the ball upstairs. Her mom said, "No bouncing balls upstairs, Mia."
One day, Mia's mom went to the store. Mia was alone. She thought, "I want to bounce the ball upstairs." So, she took the ball and went upstairs. Mia bounced the ball high, and it went bounce, bounce, bounce. It was so fun! But then, something unexpected happened.
