The ball bounced too high and hit a lamp. The lamp fell and broke. Mia was scared. When her mom came home, she saw the broken lamp. She was sad and said, "Mia, I told you not to bounce the ball upstairs." Mia felt bad and knew she should not have played with the ball upstairs.

One day, a little girl named Sue went to the store with her mom. She wanted to buy some jam. Sue saw a light blue jar of jam on a shelf. She asked her mom, "Can I have this jam, please?" Her mom said, "Yes, you can."
As they walked home, a small cat started to follow them. The cat saw the light blue jar of jam and wanted some too. Sue looked at the cat and said, "Do you want some jam, little cat?" The cat meowed, and Sue knew the cat wanted the jam.
When they got home, Sue opened the jar of jam. But instead of jam, they found a magic wand inside! The cat meowed again and waved its tail. Sue realized the cat was a magic cat, and the wand belonged to it. The cat turned the wand into a big jar of jam for Sue and her mom. They all enjoyed the jam together, and the magic cat became their new friend.

Once there was an interesting pitch. On the pitch was a little boy and he was poking the grass with a stick. He found it very fun to poke the grass and he was very excited. Then, he heard a noise coming from the pitch. It was a small bird! The little boy was so happy and he started to poke at the bird with his stick. He tried to be careful but the bird flew away. He was disappointed but still enjoyed poking the grass. It was so interesting! He kept poking until he heard his mom calling him home. So he left the pitch, excited to come back the next day and continue poking.

One day, a bright sun was shining in the sky. A man had a job to deliver a toy gun to a little boy named Tim. The man put the toy gun in a box and went to Tim's house.
When the man got to Tim's house, he knocked on the door. Tim's mom opened the door and said, "Thank you for bringing the box. Tim will be so happy!" The man gave her the box and left.
Tim opened the box and saw the toy gun. He was very happy. But then, something unexpected happened. The toy gun started to talk! The toy gun said, "Hello, Tim! I am a magic toy gun. I can make your wishes come true!" Tim was surprised, but he was also excited to have a magic toy gun as his new friend.

Mummy brought home a yummy cone. She said to her three-year-old daughter, "Do you want some ice cream?" The girl said yes and ran to see the cone. She giggled with delight. 
Mummy did make two scoops of ice cream. One scoop was strawberry and the other was vanilla. Both scoops looked yummy. 
The girl asked, "Can I have the cone?" Mummy said, "Yes, you can have it." 
The girl smiled and ate the cone. She said, "It's so yummy!" Then, she went to the park to do some more playing. 
Mummy said, "The cone was a treat, and now remember to always do your best!"

One day, a furry cat named Kitty walked near a big oak tree. Kitty saw a bird sitting on the tree. The bird was singing a nice song. Kitty liked the song, so she stopped to listen.
Kitty said, "I like your song, bird. Can you sing it again?" The bird was happy and began to sing the song again. Kitty started to clap her paws to the beat of the song. The bird liked that Kitty was clapping.
As Kitty clapped and the bird sang, more animals came to listen. A dog, a rabbit, and a squirrel all joined in. They all clapped their paws and enjoyed the music. The oak tree became a happy place for all the animals to sing and clap together.

Lily and Sam were bored. They could not go outside and play. It was raining hard. The rain was harsh. It made loud noises on the roof and the windows. Lily and Sam looked at the rain and felt sad.
"Can we do something fun?" Lily asked her mom.
"Sure, honey. Why don't you and Sam draw something with your crayons?" Mom said. She gave them a big book of paper and a box of crayons. "You can use any color you want."
Lily and Sam smiled. They liked to draw. They took the paper and the crayons and sat on the floor. They started to draw their favorite things. Lily drew a flower. Sam drew a car. They used many colors. They made their drawings bright and pretty.
"Look, Mom, look what I drew!" Lily said. She showed her mom her flower. It had red petals and a yellow center.
"That's beautiful, Lily. I love your flower." Mom said.
"Look, Mom, look what I drew!" Sam said. He showed his mom his car. It had blue wheels and a green body.
"That's awesome, Sam. I love your car." Mom said.
Lily and Sam felt happy. They did not mind the rain anymore. They had fun with their crayons. They drew more things. They drew a sun, a house, a cat, and a cake. They filled the book with their drawings. They showed their mom all their drawings. Mom praised them and hugged them.
"You are very creative, Lily and Sam. You made your own fun with your crayons. I'm proud of you." Mom said.
Lily and Sam hugged their mom back. They thanked her for the crayons and the paper. They loved their mom. They loved their drawings. They did not feel bored anymore. They felt cozy and warm. They did not care about the harsh rain. They had each other.

Once upon a time, there was a gentle bunny named Ben. He loved to hop and play on the soft ground. One day, Ben found a big, red ball. He was so happy and loved to play with it.
As Ben played with his new red ball, he saw a big tree. He wanted to wrap the ball around the tree. So, he pushed the ball with his little paws. The ball went around the tree and came back to him. Ben was very proud of himself.
Ben played with the red ball all day. When the sun went down, he was tired. He went to his warm, cozy home and lay down to sleep. Ben had a big smile on his face, thinking about his fun day with the red ball.

One day, a new cat named Part came to live in a big house. In the house, there was a small girl named Sue. Sue was very happy to have a new cat friend. She played with Part all day and they had lots of fun.
One day, Sue's mom gave her a pill. She told Sue, "This pill will help you feel good." But Sue did not want to take the pill. She was scared. Part looked at Sue and said, "Don't worry, I will take the pill too."
Sue and Part took the pill together. After a while, they both felt good and happy. They played and laughed all day. Sue was glad that Part was there to help her with the pill.

One day, a little girl named Mia found her mom's makeup. She thought it looked like fun, so she put it all over her face. Mia then went to show her friend, Max, what she had done. Max laughed and said, "You look funny!"
Mia felt sad and wanted to take the makeup off. She went to her mom and asked for help. Her mom said, "Mia, you must surrender the makeup to me, and I will help you take it off." Mia gave her mom the makeup, and her mom helped her clean her face.
Later, Mia and Max had a snack. They ate some delicious cookies that Mia's mom made. While eating, Mia's mom told them, "It's important to ask for help when you need it and always be honest." Mia and Max learned a lesson that day, and they promised to always ask for help and be honest with each other.

Once upon a time, there was a chubby snake named Sam. Sam was a friendly snake who lived in a big forest. He had many friends, like the birds, the bugs, and the other animals. Sam liked to play with them every day.
One day, Sam saw a little bird who was stuck in a tree. The bird was scared and called for help. "Help me, please!" the bird cried. Sam wanted to help his friend, so he tried to climb the tree. But Sam had a hard time because he was a chubby snake.
Sam did not give up. He tried and tried until he managed to reach the little bird. With a big smile, Sam said, "Don't worry, friend. I will help you." He carefully moved the bird's wing and set the bird free.
The little bird was so happy! "Thank you, Sam!" the bird said. They played together for the rest of the day. From that day on, Sam and the little bird became best friends. The other animals in the forest learned that even a chubby snake like Sam could be a hero.

One day, a little dog went to the park. This dog had an incredible itch on his back. He tried to scratch it, but he could not reach it. The itch was very bad, and the little dog felt sad.
In the park, the little dog saw a big tree. He had an idea. "I will rub my back on the tree to make the itch go away," he thought. But the tree was too big, and the itch did not go away.
Then, the little dog saw a small bush. He tried to find a way to use the bush to help with his itch. He rubbed his back on the bush, and the itch went away! The little dog was very happy. He played in the park all day without his itch.

Once upon a time, there was a fancy cat named Kit. Kit loved to play with ink. One day, Kit found a big jar of ink in a room. Kit was very happy.
Kit jumped in the jar and played with the ink. Kit's fur became all blue. Kit's friend, a little bird named Pip, saw Kit and said, "Wow, you look so fancy with blue fur!" Kit said, "I know, I love this ink!"
After playing, Kit and Pip went to close the jar. They pushed and pushed, but the jar was too big. Kit asked Pip, "Can you help me close the jar?" Pip said, "Yes, let's do it together!" They pushed together, and finally, the jar was closed. Kit and Pip were very happy and played together all day.

Lily and Ben were best friends. They liked to play together every day. They liked to go to the park and swing on the swings. They liked to slide and run and laugh.
One day, Lily was very tired. She wanted to nap. She told Ben, "I want to nap. Can you watch me?" Ben nodded. He was a dependable friend. He said, "I will watch you. You can nap on the bench. I will stay here and swing."
Lily smiled. She thanked Ben. She lay down on the bench and closed her eyes. Ben swung on the swing. He sang a song to Lily. He made sure no one bothered her.
Soon, Lily woke up. She felt better. She saw Ben still swinging. She ran to him and hugged him. She said, "You are a good friend. You watched me while I napped. You are dependable." Ben smiled. He said, "You are a good friend too. You trust me. You are kind."
They played some more. They had fun. They learned that being dependable and kind makes friendship strong.

John was frightened when he realised he was lost. He had been playing in the woods when he had got too distracted and now he couldn't find his way back home. He started walking, when suddenly he saw something shiny. He ran over to see what it was, and realised it was a strip. He touched it and it started to zip around really fast. John was scared but he stayed still and waited. Suddenly the strip stopped zipping and hovered in front of him. 
John said "Hello?".
The strip replied "Hello. What are you doing here?".
John replied "I'm lost."
The strip said "Don't be frightened, I can help you find your way home".
John was happy and relieved. He followed the strip and in no time the familiar sights of his home town started to appear. He waved goodbye to the strip and ran home. From that day onwards, John never got so distracted and never got lost in the woods again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sarah. One day, she and her mommy were walking through the wood, when Sarah looked up and saw something terrible. There was a big cobweb hung in the trees, and it looked very creepy!
"Oh my!" said Sarah's mommy. "That cobweb looks terrible. We had better stay away from it!"
But Sarah wanted to look closer, so she stepped closer to the cobweb. As she came near, she noticed a big black spider hanging in the middle of the cobweb. She gasped with fear.
"Mommy!" cried Sarah. "There's a spider in the cobweb! It looks so terrible!"
Her mommy laughed and said, "Don't be afraid, Sarah. The spider won't hurt you. It just wants to be left alone."
Sarah smiled and slowly backed away from the cobweb. She knew she was safe now, and her mommy had been right. The spider was just hanging in the cobweb, minding its own business.

Once upon a time there were two friends called Tom and Sam. Tom wanted to show Sam something really amazing. He said to Sam, "Let's go to the park." Sam liked the idea and off they went. 
When they got to the park, Tom said, "We have to wait for a minute." He had to wait for the park keeper to give them permission to enter. 
Eventually the park keeper said, "Yes, you can come in. But be careful!" Tom and Sam thanked the park keeper and dashed into the park. It was amazing! They ran around and laughed, jumped on the swings and slides, and played catch with Tom's ball. 
They had a lovely time and it was great fun. They felt so happy and the day was just amazing. Eventually they had to leave, but they each had a big smile on their face.

Lily was very happy. Tomorrow was her birthday. She wanted to have a cool party with her friends. She had a big cake, balloons, and a new dress.
But she also had a special gift. Her mom gave her a shiny necklace. It was very pretty. Lily loved it.
"Thank you, mom!" Lily said. She hugged her mom.
"You're welcome, sweetie. But you have to take good care of it. It is very old. It was your grandma's necklace. She gave it to me when I was your age." Mom said.
Lily nodded. She wanted to make her mom and grandma proud. She wanted to keep the necklace shiny and clean.
She went to her room. She found a soft cloth. She started to polish the necklace. She rubbed it gently. She made it sparkle.
She looked at herself in the mirror. She smiled. She felt very cool. She couldn't wait to show her friends her necklace. She knew they would like it too.
She put the necklace in a safe place. She went to bed. She dreamed of her birthday. She was very happy.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Jane. Jane loved to play outside and one day she saw a hoop in the grass. She was so excited that she ran over and grabbed it.
Jane laughed happily as she spun the hoop around her waist. Then, her brother, Bill, came over.
Bill: "Hey, can I take turns with the hoop?" 
Jane: "Sure!"
So they both took turns with the hoop. After they were done, Bill said,
Bill: "I think it's time to make the hoop more difficult!"
Then Bill made a whole bunch of rules. He said the hoop had to go higher and lower, back and forth and even in a circle.
Then Bill challenged Jane. But Jane was a bit nervous and said,
Jane: "Wow, that looks difficult! Are you sure I can do it?"
But Bill was patient and helped her practice until she could do it perfectly. Jane was so proud of herself when she was done.
The End

Once upon a time, there was a big bull. He was very dependable. He lived on a farm with many animals. They all knew the bull was strong and could help them.
One day, a mean wolf came to the farm. All the animals were scared. They did not know what to do. The bull saw the wolf and knew he had to help his friends.
The bull ran towards the wolf. The wolf tried to fight, but the bull was too strong. The wolf ran away, and the animals were safe. They knew the dependable bull would always help them.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Anna. She had a toy kayak that she loved to play with in the water. One sunny day, she went to the park with her mom and dad. They were going to have a fun day by the lake.
Anna played with her kayak in the water. She saw a spoiled dog that was barking at the ducks. The dog's owner said, "Stop barking, dog!" But the dog did not listen. It kept barking and running around.
Then, something unexpected happened. The spoiled dog knocked over Anna's kayak and it floated away. Anna was very sad. But her mom and dad told her to remain calm. They got into a real kayak and paddled to get her toy back. Anna was happy again and they all had a great day at the park.

One day, a girl named Lily found a big thing in her room. It was called a microscope. She did not know what it did. She looked at it and thought, "What can this do?"
Lily put a small bug under the microscope. She looked through it and saw the bug. It was very big now. She realized the microscope made things look big. She was happy to see the big bug.
Then, Lily went to the kitchen. She saw a yummy cake on the table. She took a small piece and put it under the microscope. She looked at the cake and it was very big too. Lily liked the microscope and the yummy cake.

Lily and Max were very happy to go to Grandma's house for the weekend. They packed their bags with toys, books and clothes. They said goodbye to Mom and Dad and got in the car with Grandma.
"Are we there yet?" Max asked after a while.
"Soon, my dear," Grandma said. "We have to cross the big bridge first."
Lily looked out the window and saw the water sparkling under the sun. She liked the bridge. It was long and high and had many cars on it. She wondered what was on the other side.
But then she heard a loud noise and felt the car shake. Grandma stepped on the brakes and pulled over. Lily and Max were scared.
"What happened, Grandma?" Lily asked.
"I think we have a flat tire, sweetie," Grandma said. "Don't worry, I have a spare one in the trunk. You stay here and I'll be right back."
Grandma got out of the car and opened the trunk. She took out the spare tire and the tools. But when she looked at the flat tire, she saw a big nail sticking out of it.
"Ouch!" she said, as she tried to pull it out. She cut her finger on the sharp metal and blood came out.
Lily and Max saw Grandma holding her finger and ran to her.
"Are you okay, Grandma?" Max asked.
"I'm fine, honey," Grandma said. "But I need a bandage for my finger. Can you help me?"
Lily and Max nodded. They went back to the car and looked for a bandage. They opened their bags and unpacked their toys, books and clothes. They made a big mess on the back seat. But they could not find a bandage.
"Maybe there is one in Grandma's bag," Lily said.
They opened Grandma's bag and unpacked her things. They found a scarf, a hat, a book, a sandwich and a bottle of water. But they could not find a bandage.
"Maybe there is one in the glove box," Max said.
They opened the glove box and unpacked the papers, the map, the sunglasses and the keys. But they could not find a bandage.
The glove box was empty.
"Grandma, we can't find a bandage!" Lily shouted.
Grandma looked at them and smiled. She saw the scarf in Lily's hand and said, "That's okay, sweetie. We can use the scarf as a bandage. It's soft and pretty. Can you wrap it around my finger?"
Lily and Max nodded. They wrapped the scarf around Grandma's finger and tied a knot. Grandma thanked them and kissed them.
"You are such good helpers," she said. "Now let's fix the tire and go to my house. I have a surprise for you there."
Lily and Max wondered what the surprise was. They packed their bags and got in the car. They crossed the bridge and drove to Grandma's house. They were very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a normal boy with a big brain. He loved to play with his toys and have fun with his friends.
One day, Tim went to the park. He saw a girl who didn't have any friends. Tim wanted to help her, so he walked up to her and said, "Hi, my name is Tim. Do you want to play with me?" The girl smiled and said, "Yes, I would love to play with you. My name is Lily."
Tim and Lily played together all day long. They had so much fun playing on the swings, climbing on the jungle gym, and running around in the grass. They became best friends and learned that everyone has a special brain, even if they're not normal. And that's what makes everyone so special.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Billy. Billy loved to sing. He sang all day long. One day, Billy decided to go on vacation. He wanted to find a new place to sing.
Billy flew and flew until he found a big tree. The tree was very attractive. It had many pretty leaves and strong branches. Billy thought it was the perfect place to sing. So, he sat on a branch and started to sing.
A little girl named Emma heard Billy singing. "What a pretty song!" she said. "Who is singing?" Emma looked up and saw Billy in the attractive tree. "Hello, bird!" she said. "I like your song!"
"Thank you, Emma!" said Billy. "I am on vacation, and I love to sing in this pretty tree." Emma smiled and listened to Billy sing. They became good friends and enjoyed the vacation together.

Once upon a time, there was a cool frog named Bob. Bob liked to swim in a big pond. The pond was near his home. The water was nice and cool. Bob was very happy.
One day, Bob found a pen in the pond. He did not know what it was. He showed his friends the pen. They all looked at it and thought it was fun. They played with the pen in the water.
Soon, it was time for Bob to go home. He took the pen with him. He put the pen in his room. Bob liked his new toy. He could not wait to swim and play with it again.

Once upon a time, there was a big lion named Leo. Leo had a loud roar. He lived in a small house with a chimney. The house was in a rare, quiet place.
One day, a little bird named Bella came to visit Leo. Bella said, "Hi, Leo! I like your chimney. It looks nice." Leo smiled and said, "Thank you, Bella. I like my chimney too."
Leo wanted to show Bella how loud he could roar. He took a deep breath and roared, "ROAR!" Bella was surprised but happy. They both laughed and played all day. They became good friends and had many fun days together.

Jake and Jim were the best of friends. Every day they would play together. One day, they were playing with a pretty ornament when they started to fight. 
"Give it back to me!" yelled Jake.
"No!" shouted Jim, very loudly. 
The two boys kept on fighting, until they heard their mom calling them. 
"What is going on?" she asked, looking very angry. 
Jake and Jim went quiet. Jake gave the ornament to Jim.
"It's time to stop fighting," said their mom.
They both nodded, and agreed to put the ornament away so they wouldn't fight again. From then on, Jake and Jim were the best of friends again. They were careful to never fight again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim lived in a small house with his mom, dad, and dog, Spot. One day, Tim and Spot were playing outside when they saw a big box. They wanted to see what was inside, but the box was locked.
Tim went to his mom and said, "Mom, can you help me unlock the box?" His mom looked at the box and said, "Yes, Tim. Let's find the original key." So, they looked all around the house and found the key on the roof. Tim's dad helped them get the key down.
With the key, Tim and his mom unlocked the box. Inside the box, they found lots of colorful toys! Tim and Spot were very happy to play with the new toys. They thanked Tim's mom and dad for helping them unlock the box and find the original key.

Once upon a time, there was a smart little girl called Lucy. She was about three years old, and she loved to wear pastel colored clothes.
One day, when she was playing outside, Lucy saw a frog. She was so excited and wanted to play with it. She asked the frog, "Can I play with you?"
The frog said, "Yes, but first, you must be polite. Can you say 'please?'". Lucy said, "Please!", while clapping her hands. The frog was very happy and said, "Let's play together!".
They played together for hours. Lucy had a lot of fun, and the frog was very clean. When it was time to go, the frog gave Lucy some special advice. He said, "Remember, always be polite with people, and repeat 'please' when asking for something." Lucy said, "Okay, I will! Bye, frog!"
Lucy felt so proud of herself for being polite to the frog. She thanked him, saying "Thank you for teaching me about being polite."
Being polite is an important virtue which is required to build strong relationships with friends and family. Lucy learned from the frog that being polite and repeating 'please' was a smart thing to do.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They took a big tent with them. Tim felt very happy.
In the park, Tim saw a girl named Sue. Sue looked sad. Tim asked Sue, "Why are you sad?" Sue said, "I lost my toy." Tim wanted to help Sue find her toy.
They looked and looked. Finally, they found the toy under the tent. Sue was so happy. She said, "Thank you, Tim!" Tim said, "You're welcome! Let's play together." They played in the tent and had a fine time.

Little Emma lived in a village. She was three years old and she was very excited today because she was going to visit the field! She ran out of her house and ran to the field. "It's so big and green!" Emma said to her mom. 
They started running through the field. Emma's mom said, "Let's pick some flowers for the house!" But Emma said, "Let's pick apples instead! They look so tasty!"
Mom and Emma picked the apples and lay down in the grass. Mom said, "It's time for a nap!"
So, Emma and her mom snuggled up next to each other and fell asleep in the field with the sun shining down on them. 
When Emma woke up, she looked around and saw the tasty looking apples all around her. She smiled and said, "This has been the most wonderful day ever!"

Once upon a time, there was a little squirrel named Sam. Sam loved to find nuts and eat them. One day, Sam found a big nut. It was the biggest nut he had ever seen. Sam was very happy.
Sam wanted to improve his home with the big nut. He tried to take the nut up to his tree house. But the nut was too big. Sam was a persistent squirrel, so he tried again and again. He tried many times, but the nut was still too big.
One day, Sam tried to take the nut up to his tree house again. This time, Sam lost his grip on the nut. The big nut fell down and broke Sam's tree house. Sam was very sad. His home was broken, and he could not fix it. The big nut did not help Sam improve his home, but it made things worse.

One day, a man and his wife were in their house. The man said, "I will bring you something interesting from the store." The wife was happy and waited for him to come back.
The man went to the store and looked for something interesting. He found a big, colorful box. He thought his wife would like it. He brought the box home and gave it to his wife. She was excited to see what was inside.
The wife opened the box and found a small cat inside. The cat was very interesting because it had two tails! The wife and the man were very surprised. They laughed and said, "This is the most interesting cat we have ever seen!" They decided to keep the cat and named it Twix. Twix became a part of their family and they all lived happily together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Cara. She was so excited because it was the first day of school! She went outside to walk to school and the sky was blue, but the wind was cold. She wrapped her jacket around her, but it did not help much.
When Cara arrived at school, she was shaking from how cold it was outside. Everyone else was more warmly dressed, and they teased her for not wearing her hat and gloves. Cara was feeling sad.
The teacher noticed Cara was upset and asked her what was wrong. Cara explained she was cold and the other kids had teased her. The teacher smiled and said "Everybody is different, and that is ok". She let Cara wear her coat while inside the classroom to keep warm.
Cara learned it's not nice to tease others just because they look different. We should all be kind, no matter what.

Once upon a time there were two friends, Sam and Tom. Sam was very stubborn and always wanted to play his way. Tom was more easy-going and didn't like to fight. 
One day they were walking in the park and they saw a big slide. Sam wanted to race up the slide, but Tom didn't. Sam got really angry and started to yell at Tom. 
Tom got angry too and he yelled back at Sam. They stood there yelling and getting madder and madder. 
Suddenly Sam's mom came running over. She held each of them in her arms and said "enough fighting! Come give each other a hug". Sam and Tom looked at each other and then hugged. Their mom smiled. 
From that day on, Sam and Tom stopped being so stubborn and realized that it was better to play together.

One day, a helpful boy named Tim saw a little lizard in his room. The lizard was on his toy box. Tim wanted to remove the lizard, but he did not know how.
Tim asked his mom, "Mom, how do I remove the lizard?" His mom said, "Be nice to the lizard and it will go away."
Tim went back to his room and said to the lizard, "Hi, lizard! You are nice, but please go away." The lizard did not move. Tim was sad.
Then, something unexpected happened. The lizard started to talk! The lizard said, "Thank you, Tim. I will go away if you help me find my family." Tim was surprised but happy to help. Together, they found the lizard's family and the lizard left Tim's room.

Ben and Mia liked to play with their toy yacht in the pond. They made it sail and splash and pretend to be pirates. One day, a big boy came and saw their yacht. He wanted to play with it too, but he did not ask. He just took it from Ben and ran away.
Ben and Mia were sad and angry. They ran after the big boy and shouted, "Give it back! That is our yacht!" But the big boy was faster and he did not listen. He went to the river and threw the yacht in the water. He laughed and said, "Now it is mine!"
But the river was not like the pond. It was deep and fast and scary. The yacht was too small and it sank. The big boy tried to get it back, but he could not. He got wet and cold and scared. He cried and said, "Help! Help!"
Ben and Mia saw what happened. They felt sorry for the big boy, even though he was mean. They ran to get help from a grown-up. The grown-up came and pulled the big boy out of the river. He was safe, but he was sorry. He said, "I am sorry. I should not have taken your yacht. It was wrong and mean. Can you forgive me?"
Ben and Mia nodded. They forgave the big boy, but they were still sad about their yacht. The grown-up said, "Don't worry. I will buy you a new yacht. And maybe you can teach the big boy how to play nicely and share." Ben and Mia smiled. They learned that it is not good to take things that are not yours, and that it is good to help others who are in trouble.

Once upon a time, there was a big house with an enormous door. In that house lived a kind girl named Mia. Mia loved to play with her toys and make things with tape. One day, she decided to use the tape to make a beautiful picture on the door.
Mia's friend Tom came to visit her. Tom saw the door and thought it was very pretty. But Tom did not know that the door was locked. He tried to open it, but it would not move. Tom was sad because he wanted to play with Mia.
Mia saw Tom outside the door and remembered that she had locked it. She quickly unlocked the door and let Tom in. They played together and had lots of fun. Mia learned that it is important to always unlock the door for her friends. And Tom learned to ask for help when he needed it. They both knew that they could always count on each other.

Once there was a quiet little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and equipment. She had a big toy box filled with fun things to play with.
One day, Lily's friend Tom came over to play. They decided to build a big tower with their toy blocks. They worked together to support each other, making the tower taller and taller.
As they placed the last block on top, they looked at their tower and smiled. They were so happy they could support each other and play with their equipment in the quiet room. And from that day on, Lily and Tom always helped each other and played together.

One day, Ben and Lily went to a big event with their mom and dad. It was a fair with many rides, games and animals. Ben and Lily were very excited to see and do everything.
They saw a big wheel that went round and round in the sky. They wanted to go on it, so their mom and dad bought them tickets. They got on a seat that looked like a basket and put on a belt. The wheel started to move and they went up and up and up.
Ben and Lily felt happy and scared at the same time. They could see the whole fair and the people and cars below. They felt the wind in their hair and the sun on their faces. They shouted and laughed and waved to their mom and dad.
But then, the wheel stopped. Ben and Lily were at the very top. They did not know why. They looked around and saw that some people were working on the wheel. They heard a loud noise and saw sparks. They felt worried and confused.
They waited and waited and waited. They felt bored and hungry and thirsty. They wanted to get off the wheel and go to their mom and dad. They felt sad and angry and tired.
Finally, the wheel started to move again. It went down and down and down. Ben and Lily felt relieved and happy. They got off the wheel and ran to their mom and dad. They hugged them and told them what happened. Their mom and dad felt sorry and proud. They said they were very brave and gave them a big treat.
Ben and Lily felt better and smiled. They said they liked the wheel, but it was too crazy. They wanted to see the animals instead. They went to the farm and saw cows, pigs, sheep and chickens. They felt calm and curious. They had fun and learned new things.
They had a good day at the fair, but they never went on the wheel again.

Once upon a time, there was a big lion. He was very old. The lion lived in a big forest with many trees.
One day, the old lion was hungry. He needed food. He looked for food in the forest. He saw a little rabbit. The rabbit was fast, but the old lion was faster.
The old lion caught the rabbit. He was not hungry anymore. The old lion was happy. He went back to his home in the forest. And he lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a fast boat named Speedy. Speedy loved to speed through the water. He liked to race with his friends in the big harbor. The harbor was where all the boats lived. 
One day, Speedy saw a big fish. The fish was very hungry. Speedy wanted to help the fish find some food. He knew where to find the most delicious food in the harbor. 
Speedy and the fish raced to the delicious food. The fish ate the food and was very happy. They became good friends. From that day on, Speedy and the fish had many fun days speeding through the harbor together.

Once upon a time, in a small pond, there was a crab named Tim. Tim was a crazy crab who loved to play all day. He had many friends in the pond, and they all liked to have fun together. One day, Tim's mom told him to stay near the pond and not go too far away.
Tim and his friends were playing near the edge of the pond. They saw a big, shiny rock far away. Tim wanted to go see the rock, but he remembered what his mom said. His friends went to the rock, but Tim decided to stay near the pond. He felt sad but knew he had to listen to his mom.
After a while, Tim's friends came back from the rock. They told him that there was a big, scary bird near the rock. The bird tried to catch them, but they ran away just in time. Tim was happy that he stayed near the pond, and his friends were safe too. They all learned that it's good to listen to their moms and dads. And they played near the pond happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a big black dog named Max. Max lived in a small house with a nice porch. He loved to sit on the porch and watch the cars go by.
One day, Max saw a little girl named Lily walking down the street. Lily looked sad, so Max walked up to her and said, "Why are you sad?"
Lily said, "I lost my toy car. It was my favorite and it was black like you." Max wanted to help Lily feel better. He thought if he could find her toy car, her smile would increase.
Max looked around and saw a black toy car under the porch. He picked it up with his mouth and gave it to Lily. Lily's face lit up and she said, "Thank you, Max! You found my toy car!"
From that day on, Max and Lily were best friends. They played together every day and their happiness continued to increase.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the beach with his mom and dad. Tim loved to play in the water and build sand castles. The sun was hot and the sand was dry. Tim was very happy.
While Tim was playing, he saw a big fish in the water. Tim yelled, "Shark! Shark!" His mom and dad ran to see what was going on. They looked at the water, but they did not see a shark. They saw a big, friendly dolphin.
The dolphin jumped out of the water and splashed Tim. Tim laughed and clapped his hands. His mom and dad were happy too. They all played with the dolphin and had a fun day at the beach. The shark was really a dolphin, and they made a new friend.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Sally. 
One Wednesday, Sally was feeling very curious. She wanted to guess something. So she went to her mom and said, "Mommy, I want to guess something!" 
Mommy thought for a moment. "Well, Sally," she said, "I think you should guess what color the sun will be tomorrow."
Sally thought about it and then said, "I guess it will be yellow!"
Mommy smiled and said, "That's a great guess, Sally!" 
The next day, Sally was very happy to see that her guess had been correct - the sun was yellow! From then on, Sally always tried to guess things, and was often right!

One day, a little boy named Tim went to play in the park. He saw a big, red ball and wanted to play with it. He ran to the ball and kicked it very hard. Suddenly, Tim felt a sharp pain in his foot. "Ouch!" he cried, as he sat down on the grass.
A girl named Sue heard Tim's cry and came to help him. "What's wrong, Tim?" she asked. Tim looked at his foot and said, "I kicked the ball and now my foot hurts bad." Sue wanted to help him, so she called for her mom to come over.
Sue's mom came and looked at Tim's foot. She saw that it was very red and swollen. "I think your foot is hurt very bad, Tim. We need to take you to the doctor," she said. Tim started to cry because he didn't want to go to the doctor. But Sue's mom took him anyway.
At the doctor's office, the doctor looked at Tim's foot and said, "You have a big bruise, Tim. You need to rest and not play for a while." Tim felt sad because he wanted to play with his friends. He went home and had to stay in bed, while his friends played outside. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little kid named Tim. Tim had a big red ball that he loved to play with. One day, he saw a helpless baby bird on the ground. The baby bird could not fly. Tim wanted to help the baby bird.
Tim had an idea. He remembered that his mom would kiss his boo-boos to make them better. He thought maybe a kiss would help the baby bird too. So, he picked up the baby bird and gave it a gentle kiss. The baby bird still could not fly, but it seemed happier.
Then, Tim had another idea. He used his big red ball to make a soft nest for the baby bird. He put the baby bird in the nest and waited. Soon, the baby bird's mom came and saw the nest. The mom bird was so happy to see her baby safe. She gave Tim a little bird kiss on his cheek to say thank you. Tim smiled and knew he had helped the helpless baby bird.

Once upon a time there was a man. He was happy and kind. Every day he would wake up and do a special task to support other people. He helped people with their work and took them places.
One day he was very sad because he had made a mistake. He had forgotten to do something really important and he felt really sorry.
He wanted to talk to someone to tell them how sorry he was. So he found a kind person to talk to and he opened up his heart and shared everything he was feeling. 
The kind person looked at him and said: "It's ok. I understand how you are feeling. You were just trying to do your best to support others and that is a good thing."
The man smiled and felt better. He knew he could count on the kind person for support and friendship.

Once upon a time, there was a charming little mouse. He lived in a tiny house near a big farm. One day, he saw a big cauliflower hanging on a tree. The mouse wanted to eat the cauliflower.
The mouse thought of a plan. He would climb the tree and get the cauliflower. He tried to climb, but he was too small. He asked his friend, the bird, for help. The bird said, "I can help you, but be careful. The big cat lives near the tree."
The mouse and the bird went to the tree. The bird flew up and got the cauliflower. They were very happy. But then, the big cat saw them. The cat chased the mouse and the bird. The mouse and the bird tried to run away, but the cat caught the mouse. The bird flew away, but the mouse was not so lucky.

Once there was a little girl who was eager to join in the fun with the other children in the playground. She was always very shy and she stayed away from the other children because she was always to embarrassed to join them.
One day, the little girl saw a large green slide in the playground. She was so eager to take a slide down the slide so she went over to the other children. She asked them if she could join in and everyone said yes!
After taking the slide with the other children, the little girl felt much more confident. She realised that if she was brave, she could make lots of new friends. All she had to do was tell the other children that she wanted to join in.
So from then on, the little girl was brave and whenever she saw the other children doing something fun, she would go straight over to them and join in.
The moral of the story is that if we are brave, we can make lots of friends. All we have to do is be eager to join in!

Once upon a time, there was a family who lived in a small village. They were very generous and always gave to others when they needed it.
One day, a powerful tornado came through the village. The wind was so strong it blew away the family's house. Everything was lost!
The family was very sad but luckily, their generous neighbours came to the rescue. They gave the family food, clothes and a new home.
The family was so thankful and they were very happy in their new home.
The end!

Once upon a time there was a man who had to fight in a war. He was very scared, but he had to be brave. He grabbed his sword and went to the battle. He fought very hard, but eventually he won.
The man was so happy, he jumped and cheered. He thanked his friends for helping him, saying "You all were so brave!" He even got a prize for doing a good job in the war.
Now, the man wanted to tell everyone about the war and his victory. So he grabbed a piece of paper and wrote about it. He had written about how hard it was, but also about how he never gave up. He was so proud of himself.
When the man finished his story, he stuck it on the wall for everyone to see. Now, every time someone sees it they remember how brave the man was.

Anna likes to play with her yellow key. She found it in a box of old things. She does not know what it opens, but she likes to pretend it is a magic key. She puts it in her pocket and goes outside.
She sees a big dog in the park. The dog is brown and furry. It barks at Anna. Anna is scared. She runs away from the dog. She drops her yellow key on the grass.
The dog sees the yellow key. It thinks it is a toy. It picks it up with its mouth and runs away. Anna cries. She wants her yellow key back.
She sees a boy in the park. The boy is nice. He has a red ball. He sees Anna crying. He asks her what is wrong. Anna tells him about the dog and the yellow key. The boy understands. He wants to help Anna.
He sees the dog in the corner of the park. The dog is still holding the yellow key. The boy has an idea. He throws his red ball to the dog. The dog likes the red ball. It drops the yellow key and chases the ball. The boy runs to the yellow key and picks it up. He gives it to Anna.
Anna is happy. She hugs the boy and thanks him. She puts her yellow key back in her pocket. She plays with the boy and the red ball. The dog plays with them too. It is not mean. It just wanted to play. Anna, the boy, and the dog are friends. They understand each other.

Once upon a time, there was a smart cat named Sam. Sam lived in a big house with his friend, a wise old owl named Olly. They loved to play and talk together.
One day, Sam and Olly were playing in the yard when they saw a big, scary dog. Sam started to panic. "What do we do, Olly?" he cried. Olly used his wisdom and said, "Don't worry, Sam. Just be calm and think."
Sam took a deep breath and had an idea. He picked up a stick and threw it far away. The big, scary dog ran to get the stick and didn't bother them anymore. Sam and Olly smiled and went back to playing.
The moral of the story is: When you're scared, use your wisdom and stay calm to find a smart solution.

Jenny was playing with her doll in the garden. She liked to pretend that her doll was sick and she was a doctor who could heal her. She had a small box with some bandages, a spoon and a bottle of water. She wrapped the bandages around her doll's arm and said, "Don't worry, you will be better soon."
But then, a big shadow came over her. It was Tom, her older brother. He was mean and ignorant. He did not like Jenny's doll. He grabbed the doll and threw it on the ground. He said, "This is a stupid doll. It can't talk or move. It's not a real friend."
Jenny was very sad and angry. She ran to her doll and picked it up. She saw that the bandages were torn and the doll's arm was broken. She cried, "You are a bad brother. You hurt my doll. You don't know anything. My doll is my friend. She can talk to me in my head. She loves me and I love her."
Tom laughed and said, "You are a silly girl. You have no friends. You only have a doll. You are lonely and dumb."
Jenny felt a pain in her heart. She wished that her mom or dad were here. But they were at work. She had no one to help her. She hugged her doll and ran to her room. She locked the door and put the doll on her bed. She said, "I'm sorry, doll. I will try to heal you. I will find some glue and fix your arm. You are my best friend. I don't need Tom. He is mean and ignorant. He doesn't understand us."

Once upon a time, there was a driver named Tom. Tom was sometimes impatient. One day, he was driving his big, red car. He saw a big tree in the road. He could not go around it.
Tom said, "Oh no, what do I do now?" A little girl named Sue walked by. She saw the big tree too. Sue said, "I can help you remove the tree!" Tom was happy. They both pushed the tree together. With a big push, the tree moved.
Now, Tom could drive again. He said, "Thank you, Sue!" Sue smiled and said, "You're welcome!" Tom was not impatient anymore. He learned that with help, he could fix problems. Tom and Sue became good friends. They played and laughed together, and they always helped each other.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a friend named Tom. One day, Lily and Tom meet a big dishwasher. The dishwasher was gifted. It could talk!
The dishwasher said, "Hello, I can wash your dishes fast and clean." Lily and Tom were happy. They gave the gifted dishwasher their dirty dishes.
But, the gifted dishwasher did not wash the dishes. Instead, it made a big mess! Lily and Tom were sad. They thought the dishwasher was their friend.
Then, the dishwasher said, "I am sorry, I did not mean to make a mess." The gifted dishwasher cleaned up the mess and washed the dishes. Lily and Tom were happy again. The dishwasher became their good friend.

One day, a little ant went for a walk. The little ant was naughty. He liked to play tricks on his friends. Today, he saw a big bug sleeping. The naughty ant thought it would be fun to wake the big bug up.
The little ant went close to the big bug and shouted, "Wake up!" The big bug woke up and sighed. He was sad because he wanted to sleep more. The naughty ant laughed and ran away.
Later, the little ant was tired and wanted to rest. But now, his friends did not want to play with him. They were upset because of his naughty tricks. The little ant felt sad and alone. He learned that being naughty was not good. From that day on, the little ant decided to be kind and play nice with his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to ride his red bike. He rode it up and down the street every day. It was his favorite thing to do.
One day, Tim had to go to the bathroom. He left his red bike outside and went inside his house. When he came back out, he saw that his bike was gone! Tim felt very sad. He looked for his bike everywhere, but he could not find it.
Tim's mom saw him looking sad and asked what was wrong. Tim told her about his missing bike. His mom gave him a big hug and said they would look for it together. They walked around the neighborhood and finally found Tim's red bike near a big tree. Tim was so happy, and he thanked his mom for helping him. From that day on, Tim always put his bike away safely before going to the bathroom.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Millie who loved to joke around. One day, she decided to go for a walk in the snow. She walked and walked until she finally saw an igloo! Millie thought it was so cool and went to see it up close. The igloo was very deep, and she couldn't see to the bottom.
Millie wanted to explore, so she started to take a few steps into the igloo. Suddenly, she heard someone giggle! Millie was very surprised and wondered who was in the igloo. Then, she heard the sound of laughter. She realised it was a big group of penguins who had been laughing and playing jokes together. Millie was so happy that she started to laugh too.
The penguins were very kind to Millie, and they all decided to play together. They ran around in the snow and joked around until they were all exhausted. Then, Millie said goodbye and went on her way. She never forgot the great time she had with the penguins, and she promised herself that she would go back soon to play jokes and explore the deep igloo again.

Once upon a time, there was a big ocean. In the ocean, there were many fish. One day, a little fish named Finny decided to organize a party for all his friends. He wanted to make sure everyone had tasty food to eat.
Finny swam to his friend, a crab named Snippy, and said, "Hi Snippy! I am organizing a party in the ocean. I need your help to find tasty food for our friends. Will you help me, please?" Snippy smiled and said, "Of course, Finny! Let's go find some tasty food together."
Finny and Snippy swam around the ocean, looking for tasty food. They found some yummy seaweed and small fish for all their friends to eat. They also found some pretty shells to decorate the party. Soon, all their friends came to the party and everyone had a great time. They all thanked Finny and Snippy for organizing such a fun and tasty party.

One day, Sally was in her backyard. She saw something very exciting. There was a broken drain in the ground. It was curved like an upside-down U.
Sally decided to fold it. She was very curious to see what would happen. She put both hands underneath it and pushed it up. It folded into a large triangle.
Sally was very proud of what she had done. She continued to fold it, over and over again. It eventually become very small, like a paper airplane.
Sally was very excited. She ran inside to show her mom what she had done. Her mom was amazed by her creativity. She praised Sally for her hard work.
Sally smiled proudly and took the broken drain inside. She placed it on a shelf in her room, where she could admire it every day.

Tim and Sam were brothers who liked to play with toys. Tim had a big rubber ball that he loved to bounce and throw. Sam had a small rubber duck that he liked to squeeze and splash. One day, they were playing in the garden when Tim saw Sam's duck.
"Give me your duck!" Tim demanded. "I want to play with it!"
"No!" Sam said. "It is my duck! You have your ball!"
But Tim did not listen. He ran to Sam and snatched the duck from his hand. Sam cried and tried to get it back, but Tim was stronger and faster. He ran away with the duck and laughed.
Sam was very sad and angry. He wanted his duck back. He looked around and saw Tim's ball lying on the grass. He had an idea. He picked up the ball and ran to the fence. He threw the ball over the fence as hard as he could.
"Ha!" Sam shouted. "Now you have no ball!"
Tim heard Sam and stopped playing with the duck. He looked for his ball and saw it flying over the fence. He ran to the fence and tried to climb it, but it was too high. He could not reach his ball.
"Give me back my ball!" Tim cried. "You are mean!"
"No!" Sam said. "You are mean! You took my duck!"
They both shouted and cried, but no one helped them. They had no toys and no friends. They were both unhappy and lonely. They wished they had not been so greedy and lazy. They wished they had shared and played nicely. But it was too late. The end.

One day, a big bear and a small rabbit were talking in the forest. The bear said, "I am ready to protect the forest in any season." The rabbit said, "I am ready too!"
In the hot season, the bear and the rabbit worked together to protect the forest. They made sure all the animals had water to drink and stayed cool. One day, they saw a big cloud in the sky. The cloud was getting closer and closer.
As the cloud came closer, the bear and the rabbit saw that it was not a cloud at all. It was a big group of butterflies! The butterflies said, "We are lost. Can you help us find our way home?" The bear and the rabbit were surprised but happy to help.
The bear and the rabbit worked together to guide the butterflies back to their home. The forest was safe, and the butterflies were happy. The bear and the rabbit learned that they could protect the forest and help their friends, no matter the season.

Once upon a time, there was a famous dog named Spot. Spot was famous because he could do many tricks. He could jump high, run fast, and even dance. Everyone loved Spot.
One day, Spot wanted to go on a big trip. He needed a passport to go on the trip. Spot did not know how to get a passport. He asked his friend, a clever cat named Whiskers, for help. Whiskers told Spot that they needed to go to a big building to get the passport.
Spot and Whiskers went to the big building. It was hard for Spot to find the right room, but he managed to do it. Spot got his passport and was very happy. Now Spot could go on his big trip. He thanked Whiskers for helping him. They were the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a big dog named Jazz. Jazz loved to cook in his little kitchen. He would cook all day and make yummy food for his friends.
One day, Jazz felt uncomfortable. He didn't know why. He tried to cook, but he couldn't make the food taste good. His friends came to his house to eat, but they didn't like the food. Jazz was sad.
Then, a nice bird came to help Jazz. The bird sang a happy song and Jazz felt better. They cooked together and made the best food ever. Jazz and his friends were happy again.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. He saw a cold ice cream truck and said, "Mom, can I have some ice cream?" His mom said, "Yes, but don't go too far. I need to take a call."
While Tim was eating his ice cream, he saw a little bird in a cage. The bird looked sad. Tim thought, "I want to help the bird escape." He looked around and saw that no one was watching. So, he opened the cage door.
The bird flew out and said, "Thank you, Tim! I am so happy to be free!" Tim smiled and said, "You're welcome, little bird!" The bird flew away, high up in the sky.
Later, Tim's mom came back and said, "It's time to go home." Tim knew that he did a good thing by helping the bird escape. He felt happy and proud as they walked home. And he knew that the little bird was happy too, flying free in the sky.

Once upon a time, in a regular little town, there was a big garden. In the garden, there was soft soil. Every day, the sun would shine and the flowers would grow tall.
One day, a small boy named Tim went to the garden. He wanted to plant a seed. He dug a hole in the soil and put the seed in. Tim was very happy. He went home and told his mom, "I will have a big flower soon!"
The next day, Tim went back to the garden. He saw a big door where he put the seed. It was not a flower! Tim was surprised. He opened the door and went inside. The door closed behind him. Inside, Tim found a magical world with talking animals and trees that could walk. The animals and trees became his friends. They all played together every day.
In the end, Tim learned that even in a regular garden, magic could happen. He was happy to have his new friends and his big secret. His mom never knew about the door, but she saw how happy Tim was every time he went to the garden. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a big cat and a small mouse. They lived in a house. The cat and the mouse did not like to be together. They wanted to separate.
One day, the cat and the mouse had a look outside. They saw a big cake. They both wanted the cake. But, they were uncomfortable to share it. They decided to have a race. The winner would get the cake.
The cat thought he would win. He was bigger and faster. But, the mouse was smart. He took a shortcut and won the race. The cat was surprised. They both learned that working together is better than being apart. And they shared the cake happily.

One day, a pretty raven flew into the town. Everyone stopped to admire its beauty. Even the mayor couldn't take his eyes off it. 
"I think I'll pick it for my own," said the mayor.
One little girl who had been playing nearby spoke up.
"No, you can't! The raven is mine," she said.
The mayor looked down from his horse and smiled.
"We'll see. We'll just have to have a contest. Whoever can pick the prettiest flower will win the raven," he said.
The little girl eagerly went off to search for the prettiest flower she could find. The mayor watched her go, laughing to himself.
The next day, the mayor announced the winner was the girl. She had found the most beautiful flower of them all!
The mayor reluctantly handed over the pretty raven to the girl, while everyone else gasped in surprise. The little girl hugged her new feathered friend and smiled.
Foreshadowing the mayor's defeat, the girl had unknowingly set herself up for success in the contest. Her hard work had paid off.

Once upon a time, there was a big toe named Timmy. Timmy was a very guilty toe because he always got dirty. He would play in the mud and make a mess. Timmy's friends, the other toes, did not like this.
One day, the big foot decided to teach Timmy how to stay clean. The foot showed Timmy how to wash with soap and water. Timmy liked the bubbles and the way it made him feel clean.
After learning how to wash, Timmy was not a guilty toe anymore. He was a happy and clean toe. Timmy and his toe friends played together and had lots of fun. They all stayed clean and had a great time.

Once upon a time, there was a little cat named Kitty. Kitty loved to climb trees. One sunny day, she saw a big tree and decided to climb it.
Kitty started to climb the tree. She climbed higher and higher. A little bird saw Kitty and asked, "What are you doing, Kitty?" Kitty replied, "I want to reach the top of the tree. I will feel success!"
Kitty kept climbing, and finally, she reached the top of the tree. She was so happy and proud. She said, "I did it! I am at the top!" The little bird cheered for Kitty, and they both smiled. Kitty climbed down the tree and went home to tell her friends about her success.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a toy named Switch. Switch was a very interesting toy. It could change colors when Tim pressed a button. Tim loved to play with Switch all day long.
One day, Tim and Switch went to the park. They saw a girl named Sue. Sue was playing with a ball. Tim wanted to improve his ball skills, so he asked Sue if he could play too. Sue said yes, and they all played together. Tim and Switch had lots of fun with Sue.
As they played, Tim had an idea. He pressed the button on Switch and it changed colors. Sue was amazed! Tim showed Sue how Switch could change colors. They all laughed and played with Switch until the sun went down. Tim and Sue became good friends, and they all played together every day.

Once upon a time, in a big castle, there lived a kind king. The king had many friends. One day, the king wanted to sell some of his things. He wanted to sell his hot soup. 
The king asked his friend, Tom, to help him. "Tom, can you help me sell my hot soup?" the king said. Tom was happy to help. "Yes, king! I will help you sell your hot soup," Tom said with a big smile.
They went to the town and sold the hot soup to the people. Everyone loved the hot soup. The king and Tom were happy. They went back to the castle and had a fun day. The End.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was an old restaurant. The restaurant had many colors on its walls, but they were fading away. The owner of the restaurant, Mr. Brown, wanted to make it look nice again. So, he decided to paint the walls.
Mr. Brown asked his friend, Mr. Green, to help him paint. They picked up their paintbrushes and started to paint the walls. They painted the walls red, blue, and yellow. As they painted, they talked and laughed.
One day, a little girl named Lucy walked by the restaurant. She saw Mr. Brown and Mr. Green painting the walls. "What are you doing?" she asked. Mr. Brown replied, "We are painting the walls to make the restaurant look pretty again."
Lucy smiled and said, "I like the new colors! Can I help you paint?" Mr. Brown and Mr. Green agreed, and Lucy joined them. Together, they painted the old restaurant until it looked bright and new. When they finished, they all stood back and admired their work. Everyone in the town loved the new look of the old restaurant, and they all lived happily ever after.

One day, a boy named Tim found a green toy in his room. It was a microscope. He was very happy. He ran to his friend, Sue, to show her his new toy.
"Look, Sue! I found a green microscope!" said Tim. Sue looked at the microscope and said, "That's not green, it's blue!" They both disagree. They didn't know what to do.
Just then, a talking bird flew into the room. The bird said, "I can help you! The microscope is magic! It changes color when you look at it." Tim and Sue looked at the microscope again, and it was now purple! They both laughed and played with the magic microscope all day.

Once upon a time, there was a big, bright ship. The ship was on the water. The sun was shining. The ship was going to a fun place. Many people were on the ship. They were happy.
One day, a little boy named Tim decided to play on the ship. He saw a big red ball. He kicked the ball. The ball went far away. Tim ran to find the ball. He found the ball near a door. The door was closed.
Tim opened the door. He saw a room full of toys! It was a secret toy room. He was very surprised. Tim played with the toys all day. He had so much fun. At the end of the day, Tim told his friends about the secret toy room. They all played together and had a great time.

Once upon a time, in an ancient big tree, there lived a tiny ant named Andy. Andy was a very hard worker, but he was also very stubborn. One day, his ant friends asked him to help them carry food back to their home.
"No, I refuse," said Andy, crossing his little ant arms. His friends were sad and did not know why Andy would not help them. They knew that carrying food was important for their family.
Andy saw his friends were upset and felt bad. He decided to help them after all. Together, they carried the food back to their home. Andy learned that helping his friends was more important than being stubborn. From that day on, Andy never refused to help his friends again. And they all lived happily in their ancient tree home.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He liked to play with his toy car and ball. One day, Tim was very hungry. His mom gave him a plate of yummy food. She said, "Eat up, Tim!"
Tim looked at his plate and saw the food rise like a small hill. He was grateful for the food his mom gave him. He said, "Thank you, Mom. I am grateful." Tim ate all the food on his plate.
Later, Tim went to the park and saw a girl who was hungry. She didn't have any food. Tim remembered how grateful he was when his mom gave him food. He went home and asked his mom for another plate of food. Tim gave the plate to the girl and she was very happy.
The girl said, "Thank you, Tim. I am grateful." Tim felt good for helping the girl. He knew it was important to share and be kind to others. The moral of the story is to always be grateful and share with those in need.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his basketball. He played every day in his yard. Tim was deaf, but he was very good at playing basketball.
One day, something big happened. A new family moved in next door. They had a boy named Sam. Sam saw Tim playing basketball and wanted to play too. Tim was happy to have a new friend.
Tim and Sam played basketball together every day. They did not need to talk because they both understood the game. They became the best of friends and had lots of fun. And they both loved their basketball.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot had no owner. He lived in a park and played with the other dogs. He was happy, but he wanted to join a family.
One day, a kind lady named Sue came to the park. Spot ran up to her and wagged his tail. Sue smiled and patted his head. She thought Spot was very cute. She wanted Spot to join her family and be safe. Spot was excited to have an owner!
But, there was a twist! When Sue took Spot home, there were already ten dogs there! Spot was surprised but happy. He had not only joined a family, but he also had many new friends to play with. Now, Spot felt safe and loved with his new owner and dog friends.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a cheerful musician. He loved to play songs for everyone. The town people liked to listen and dance to his music.
One sunny day, the musician went to the park to play his songs. The grass was dry, so he sat under a big tree. He played happy songs and everyone danced. The musician was very happy too.
But then, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and blew his music away! The musician was sad, but the town people helped him. They all looked for his music together. They found the music under a bush. The musician was happy again and played more songs for everyone to dance.

One day, a boy named Tim and his dog, Max, were in the house. Tim was at the table, drawing a big tree. Max was on the floor, calm and quiet. Tim was happy.
Suddenly, the table started to shake. Tim was scared. "What is happening?" he asked Max. Max did not know. They looked around to see what was making the table shake. 
They saw a little cat under the table. The cat was playing with the table leg. Tim said, "Oh, it's just a cat!" Max barked at the cat. The cat ran away, and the table stopped shaking. Tim and Max were happy again.

Once upon a time, there was a nosy cat named Kitty. Kitty loved to celebrate her birthday with her friends. One day, Kitty decided to visit her best friend, Bunny, to invite her to the birthday party.
When Kitty got to Bunny's house, she saw Bunny's toy was broken. Bunny was very sad. Kitty wanted to help, but she was too nosy and kept asking Bunny about the toy. Bunny got mad and told Kitty to go away.
Kitty went home feeling sad. She knew she had to say sorry to Bunny. The next day, Kitty went back to Bunny's house with a new toy. Bunny was happy to see Kitty and the new toy. They both said sorry and hugged each other.
They learned that sometimes it is better to help friends and not be too nosy. Kitty and Bunny celebrated Kitty's birthday together and had lots of fun.

Sara was sad. She had a big cut on her knee from falling off her bike. It hurt a lot and she could not play with her friends. Mommy put a band-aid on it and gave her a hug.
"Will it heal soon?" Sara asked.
"Yes, my dear, it will heal soon. You just need to be careful and not touch it too much. It will get better every day," Mommy said.
Sara nodded, but she still felt bored. She wanted to do something fun. She looked around her room and saw her toy bus. She had an idea.
"Mommy, can we play tour?" she asked.
"Play tour? What is that?" Mommy asked.
"It is when we pretend we are on a big bus and we go to different places and see different things. Like the zoo, or the park, or the museum. You can be the driver and I can be the guide. Please, Mommy, can we play?" Sara said.
Mommy smiled. She thought it was a good idea. She picked up the toy bus and sat on the floor with Sara.
"Sure, we can play tour. Where do you want to go first?" Mommy asked.
Sara thought for a moment. She wanted to see something that would make her happy.
"Let's go to the farm. I want to see the animals. They are cute and soft and they make funny noises," Sara said.
"Okay, let's go to the farm. All aboard the tour bus!" Mommy said.
Sara and Mommy played tour for a long time. They saw cows, and pigs, and sheep, and horses, and chickens. They made animal sounds and learned their names. Sara forgot about her cut and had a lot of fun. She laughed and clapped and thanked Mommy for playing with her.
"Mommy, you are the best driver and the best Mommy. I love you," Sara said.
"I love you too, Sara. You are the best guide and the best daughter. And you know what? Your cut is healing very well. It is not so red and it is not so hard. Soon, it will be gone and you can play with your friends again," Mommy said.
Sara looked at her knee and saw that Mommy was right. Her cut was healing. She felt happy and proud. She gave Mommy a big hug and a big kiss.
"Thank you, Mommy. You made me feel better. You are the best healer too," Sara said.

One day, a big dog named Max and a small cat named Luna were playing in the park. They loved to play together, but sometimes they would have a little fight. They would chase each other and play with their toys, but Max always wanted to chew on Luna's toy mouse.
One day, Max said to Luna, "I want to chew your toy mouse. It looks so fun!" Luna did not like this idea. She said, "No, Max! That is my toy. You have your own toys to chew." Max felt uncomfortable because he did not want to make Luna sad.
Max and Luna decided to find a new toy that they could both chew and play with together. They went to the store and found a big, soft ball. They both liked the ball and took turns chewing it. Now, Max and Luna play happily together without any fights. They learned to share and be good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a new drum. The drum loved to make rhythm. It would go "boom, boom, boom" all day long. Everyone in the town liked to dance to its rhythm.
One day, the drum made a very loud noise. It went "BOOM!" and it scared everyone. The people in the town were mad at the drum. They wanted to punish the drum for scaring them.
But then, they found out that the loud "BOOM!" was not the drum's fault. It was a big rock that fell from the sky. The rock made the loud noise, not the drum. The people felt bad for wanting to punish the drum. They were all happy to dance to the drum's rhythm again, and they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He loved to play outside with his toys. One day, Tim found a hose in his yard. He liked the hose because it was long and he could use it to water the plants.
While he was playing, Tim saw a big, sharp rock. He was curious and wanted to touch it, but he knew sharp things could hurt him. So, he decided to use the hose to spray water on the rock instead. The water made the rock shiny and clean.
Later, Tim's mom called him inside for a snack. She gave him a delicious apple. Tim was very happy. He ate the apple, thinking about his fun day with the hose and the sharp rock. He couldn't wait to play outside again tomorrow.

Once there was a big bird named Bob. Bob loved to sing. He would sing all day long. His songs were very original. All the other birds liked his songs too. They would dance and play while Bob sang.
One day, Bob met a small bird named Tim. Tim was sad because he could not sing. He asked Bob, "Can you supply me a song to sing?" Bob thought for a moment and said, "Yes, I can help you."
Bob taught Tim a simple song. Tim practiced the song with Bob. Soon, Tim could sing the song very well. Tim was happy and said, "Thank you, Bob, for supplying me a song!"
Now, Bob and Tim sang together every day. The other birds loved their songs even more. They all danced and played happily in the sun. And that is how Bob and Tim became the best of friends.

Once, there was a boy named Tim. He liked to play outside. One day, it rained a lot. Tim saw lots of mud in his yard. He put on his boots and went outside to play.
Tim saw a thin stick in the mud. He picked it up and drew pictures in the mud. Tim had fun making shapes and lines. Then, he saw a ball near the mud. Tim had an idea.
Tim decided to kick the ball into the mud. He ran and gave the ball a big kick. The ball flew through the air and landed in the mud with a splash. Tim laughed and clapped his hands. He loved playing in the mud.

Lily and Mom went to the shop. Lily saw a big teddy bear. She wanted it very much. She had an urge to hug it and take it home.
"Mom, can I have the teddy bear?" Lily asked. "Please, please, please!"
Mom looked at the price tag. It was too much money. She shook her head. "No, Lily, we can't buy the teddy bear. It is too expensive. We have to save money for other things."
Lily felt sad. She started to cry. She did not want to leave the teddy bear. She wanted to be its friend.
A gentle voice spoke to her. "Hello, little girl. Why are you crying?" It was the shop lady. She had a kind smile.
Lily sniffed. "I want the teddy bear, but Mom says no."
The shop lady nodded. "I see. Well, I have an idea. How about you help me in the shop for a little while? You can dust the shelves, sort the books, and greet the customers. And then, maybe, I can give you a discount on the teddy bear. What do you say?"
Lily looked at Mom. Mom nodded. "That sounds fair. If you really want the teddy bear, you have to work for it. Do you agree, Lily?"
Lily wiped her tears. She nodded too. "Yes, I agree. Thank you, shop lady."
The shop lady smiled. "You're welcome, Lily. Come on, let's go to work. And don't worry, the teddy bear will wait for you."

One day, a little girl named Lucy went to the grocery with her mom. The grocery was big and full of food. Lucy felt peaceful and happy.
At the grocery, Lucy saw a big red apple. She wanted the apple, but it was too high for her to reach. Lucy said, "Mom, can you help me get the apple?" Her mom was busy and did not hear her. Lucy started to struggle to reach the apple.
Lucy tried and tried but could not get the apple. Then, she saw a big box. She thought, "I can stand on the box to get the apple." But when Lucy stood on the box, it broke. Lucy fell down and cried. The apple stayed high up, and Lucy was sad.

Lily likes to teach her toys how to eat. She has a big banana that she wants to share with them. She puts the banana on a plate and cuts it into pieces.
She gives one piece to her teddy bear and says, "This is a banana. It is yellow and sweet. You can peel it and bite it. Try it, teddy." But teddy does not move or eat. Lily feels sad.
She gives another piece to her doll and says, "This is a banana. It is soft and yummy. You can mash it and lick it. Try it, doll." But doll does not move or eat. Lily feels angry.
She gives another piece to her robot and says, "This is a banana. It is healthy and good. You can chew it and swallow it. Try it, robot." But robot does not move or eat. Lily feels frustrated.
She looks at the last piece of banana and says, "This is a banana. It is mine and I love it. You can have it if you want, but you have to ask me nicely. Do you want it, toys?" But toys do not move or talk. Lily feels lonely.
She decides to eat the banana herself. She peels it and bites it. It is yellow and sweet, soft and yummy, healthy and good. She enjoys it very much. She says, "This is a banana. It is the best. I wish I had someone to share it with."
Then she hears a knock on the door. It is her friend Max. He says, "Hi, Lily. Can I play with you? I brought some grapes. They are green and sour, crunchy and juicy, fun and tasty. Do you want to try them?"
Lily smiles and says, "Yes, please. Come in, Max. I have a banana. It is yellow and sweet, soft and yummy, healthy and good. Do you want to try it?"
Max smiles and says, "Yes, please. Thank you, Lily. You are very kind. Can you teach me how to eat a banana?"
Lily says, "Of course. I can teach you how to eat a banana. It is easy and fun. Let me show you."
They sit on the floor and share the banana and the grapes. They peel and bite, mash and lick, chew and swallow. They laugh and talk. They are happy and full. They are friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia had a sad face because she lost her toy. It was a shiny copper key. She looked everywhere, but she could not find it. She asked her mom for help. Her mom said, "I promise, we will find it."
They looked in Mia's room, the kitchen, and the yard. They still could not find the copper key. Mia felt very sad. Her mom hugged her and said, "Don't worry, we will find it."
Just then, their dog, Spot, came running up. Spot had something in his mouth. It was the copper key! Mia was so happy and hugged Spot. She thanked her mom for her promise. But when Mia tried to use the key on her toy box, it did not fit. Mia was confused.
Her mom looked at the key and smiled. "This is not your toy key, Mia. This is the key to a special treasure box!" Mia's eyes grew wide. They used the key to open the treasure box and found lots of toys and treats inside. Mia was not sad anymore. She was very happy and shared her new toys with Spot.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a black microscope in his room. He liked to look at things with it. He enjoyed seeing the small things become big. Tim showed his friend, Sam, the black microscope.
"Wow! Can I try?" asked Sam. Tim said, "Yes, but be careful."
Sam and Tim looked at a small bug. They liked how it looked big. But then, they started to fight over who gets to use the black microscope. Sam wanted to use it more, but Tim said it was his.
Tim's mom came in and saw them fighting. She said, "You need to share the black microscope. Both of you can enjoy it." They listened and took turns. They both enjoyed looking at things and stopped fighting. They were happy friends again.

One day, a little squirrel named Tim went to the store. He wanted to buy nuts for his tree. Tim was an obedient squirrel and always did what his mom told him to do.
On his way to the store, Tim met a big cat. The cat said, "Hello, little squirrel. Where are you going?" Tim said, "I am going to the store to buy nuts for my tree." The cat said, "I like nuts too. Can I come with you?"
Tim and the cat went to the store together. They bought nuts and took them back to the tree. Tim's mom was happy to see them. She said, "Thank you, Tim, for being an obedient squirrel and going to the store." Tim and the cat shared the nuts and had a fun day.

Once upon a time, there was a very stubborn mouse. He wanted to feed on the lumber he had found, but it was too difficult for him to reach.
The mouse tried and tried, but he just couldn't get the lumber. Frustrated, the mouse yelled out, "I will never give up!"
Just then, a kind old hedgehog stepped forward. She said, "I can help you, little one."
Gratefully, the mouse thanked her and the hedgehog fed him the lumber, which was delicious and crunchy.
The mouse quickly gobbled it all up and thanked the kind hedgehog. "I am so full!" he exclaimed.
