Sue's friend, Tom, came over to play. They sat at the table and had a tea party. "This is a nice table," said Tom. Sue agreed and said, "Yes, it is just right for us." They played together and had a lot of fun.
As the sun went down, Tom went home. Sue looked at her regular table and smiled. She knew that the table was perfect for her and her friends to play. And every day, she wondered about new things and had fun with her regular table.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a smart cat named Kitty. Kitty loved to play with her toy mouse and nap on her soft bed. One day, Kitty saw a big mess on the floor. She wanted to clean it up.
Kitty went to her friend, Doggy, and said, "Please, can you help me clean this mess? We need a napkin to make it clean." Doggy nodded his head and wagged his tail. He was happy to help his friend.
Together, Kitty and Doggy found a big napkin. They used it to clean the mess on the floor. When they finished, the floor was clean and shiny. Kitty and Doggy were proud of their hard work. They sat down and took a nice, long nap.

Once upon a time, there was a large box in the middle of the park. All the kids wanted to see what was inside the box. They were very excited.
One day, a wise old man came to the park. He saw the large box and the kids playing around it. He warned the kids, "Do not open the box. It is not safe." But the kids did not listen to him. They wanted to see what was inside the large box.
One brave kid decided to open the box. All the kids gathered around to see. When the box was opened, a big wind came and took all the kids away. They were never seen again. The old man was sad, but he had warned them.

Once upon a time, in a small pond, there was a fair duck named Daisy. Daisy loved to play with her friends. One day, Daisy saw a kayak on the pond. She wanted to try it.
Daisy called her friends to help her mix the water to make the kayak move. They all splashed their wings and feet in the water. The kayak started to move slowly. Daisy was so happy.
Daisy and her friends played with the kayak all day. They took turns riding in it. They had so much fun mixing the water and making the kayak go fast and slow. When the sun went down, they all went home, tired but happy.

Once upon a time, there was a kind old man. He was deaf, but he was very happy. He had a big cane to help him walk. The old man lived in a small house near the woods.
One day, the old man saw a big pot outside his house. He thought, "I will make something sweet for the kids in the village." So, he started to stir the pot. He put in some sugar, some fruit, and some water. He stirred and stirred, and soon it was ready.
He took the sweet mix and went to the village. The kids were very happy to see him. They all came running to get some of the sweet treat. But, just as the old man was giving out the sweets, a big wind came and blew the pot away. The sweets were all gone, and the kids were sad. The old man felt bad too.
The moral of the story is that sometimes, even when we try to do good things, bad things can still happen. But we should not let that stop us from trying to be kind and helpful to others.

One day, a little ant was walking in the forest. The ant saw a big log. The log was very long and thick. The ant wanted to go to the other side of the log.
The ant started to climb the log, but it was not easy. The ant felt a little panic. The ant knew it was a serious job to get to the other side. The little ant did not want to give up.
The ant kept trying and trying. Finally, the ant got to the other side of the log. The ant was very happy and proud. The ant knew that even when things are hard, it is important to keep trying.

Once upon a time, there was a cute little fish named Fin. Fin lived in a big pond with his family. He loved to swim and play with his friends all day long.
One day, Fin saw a net in the water. He was curious about it. He asked his friend, Bubbles, "What is that?" Bubbles said, "That is a net. We should stay away from it." But Fin wanted to take a closer look.
As Fin swam closer to the net, he saw a sign. The sign said, "Do not touch." Fin was a good fish and listened to the sign. He swam back to his friends and told them about the sign. They all stayed away from the net and played together happily ever after.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play with blocks and make houses. One day, they find a big box of nails in the garage. They think nails are cool. They can make their houses stronger and taller.
"Can we borrow some nails, please?" Lily asks her dad.
"Sure, but be careful. Nails are sharp and can hurt you. And don't make a mess," her dad says.
"Okay, thank you, dad!" Lily says. She and Ben take some nails and go to the backyard.
They start to hammer the nails into the blocks. They make a big house with a roof and a door. They are very happy.
"Look at our house! It's the best house ever!" Ben says.
"Yes, it is! Let's go inside and pretend we live there," Lily says.
They crawl into the house and sit on the floor. They pretend they have a sofa, a TV, and a fridge. They have fun.
But then, they hear a loud noise. It is the wind. It blows very hard. It shakes their house. Some nails fall out. Some blocks fall down. Their house is breaking.
"Oh no! Our house!" Lily cries.
"Quick, let's get out!" Ben says.
They run out of the house. They see their house collapse. They are sad.
"I'm sorry, Lily. I wanted to make a cool house for us," Ben says.
"It's okay, Ben. It was a cool house. But maybe nails are not good for blocks. Maybe we can use something else next time," Lily says.
They hug each other. They go to the garage and put the nails back. They say sorry to Lily's dad. He is not mad. He hugs them too.
He says, "It's okay, kids. You can borrow nails again, but only if you want to help me fix something. Nails are for fixing, not for playing. Do you understand?"
"Yes, dad. We understand," Lily and Ben say.
They smile. They are still friends. They go to the kitchen and have some cookies. They are happy.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Grace. Grace was very curious and wanted to know more about the world. One day she asked her Mom, "Where is the best place to go and know more about the world?" Her Mom replied, "Well, there is a very special place that can answer all your questions. It's very peaceful and calm and people come here to learn about new things." Grace was excited and wanted to go explore this place her Mom was talking about. 
So the next day, Grace and her Mom drove to the special place. When she got there, Grace was amazed. It was a place full of trees, colorful flowers, and friendly animals. There was a feeling of peace and calm all around. Grace was in awe of this beautiful place and said to her Mom, "This looks like the perfect place to learn more about the world." 
"Yes it is!" replied her Mom, "This is called nature and it is full of things to explore and learn. You can look at the animals, listen to the birds, and lay among the trees. There is something new to discover every day here. You can come here whenever you want to know more." 
Grace was so excited and filled with joy. She knew this was the perfect place for her to learn more about the world. She thanked her Mom for bringing her here and ran off to explore this magical place.

Lily was a cat who liked to play with her ball. She would chase it, catch it, and roll it with her paws. She was very good at playing with her ball, and she was proud of herself.
One day, she saw a new thing in the yard. It was long and thin and shiny, and it moved by itself. Lily was curious and wanted to play with it. She ran towards it and tried to catch it with her paws.
But the new thing was not a toy. It was a snake, and it did not like Lily. It hissed and bit Lily on her tail. Lily felt a sharp pain and let out a loud meow. She ran away from the snake and hid under the porch.
Lily's tail hurt a lot, and she was scared and sad. She did not want to play with her ball anymore. She just wanted her mom to come and make her feel better.
Her mom heard her meow and came to find her. She saw the snake and chased it away. Then she saw Lily's tail and licked it gently. She told Lily that she was brave and that she loved her. She carried Lily inside the house and gave her some milk and a soft bed.
Lily felt safe and warm with her mom. She still felt some pain in her tail, but it seemed to get better with her mom's care. She snuggled with her mom and thanked her for saving her. She was glad that her mom was proud of her, and she was proud of her mom too.

One day, a wise cat named Tom found a radio. Tom was very happy because the radio played fun songs. He danced and sang along with the songs. Tom wanted to show his friend, a little dog named Max.
Tom said, "Max, look at my radio! It plays fun songs. Let's dance and sing together!"
But Max was busy playing with his ball. He did not want to stop. Max said, "No, Tom. I want to play with my ball. I will ignore your radio."
Tom was sad. He wanted Max to dance and sing with him. So, Tom thought of a plan. He put the radio near the ball. When Max heard the fun songs, he could not ignore the radio anymore. Max started to dance and sing with Tom.
Now, Tom and Max were both happy. They danced and sang together, and sometimes played with the ball too. They learned that it was more fun to play together and not ignore each other's toys.

Once upon a time, there was a lovely goose. He was walking in the meadow when he suddenly noticed something. It was a bit of string lying on the grass. He was excited and quickly picked it up. 
He then saw a tree a little bit further away. He thought it would be a good idea to tie the string to it. The goose walked over to the tree and started to tie the string around it. But as he was trying, a naughty fox came along. 
The fox tried to snatch the string away from the goose. But the goose was not going to give up. He kept tying the string around the tree. The fox and the goose were in a tug-of-war with the string until the goose won. 
He quickly tied the string to the tree, making sure it was secure. The fox was very grumpy, but the goose was happy. He had tied the string successfully! The goose continued to walk around the meadow, feeling very proud of himself and being thankful to have the lovely string to play with.

Once upon a time, there was a farm with many animals. The animals were happy and played together all day. One day, a clever fox came to the farm. The fox wanted to take the animals away from their home.
The animals were scared of the fox. They did not want to leave the farm. So, they made a plan to escape from the fox. The animals worked together and hid in a big barn. When the fox came to find them, they all ran out of the barn and locked the door. The fox was trapped inside!
The animals were safe and happy again. They learned that by working together, they could escape danger. The moral of the story is that teamwork can help us in difficult times.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Quick. Quick had a new red ball. He loved to play with his red ball every day.
One day, Quick could not find his new red ball. He started to search for it. He looked under the bed, in the box, and behind the door. But he could not find his red ball.
Quick asked his friend, the cat, to help him search. They looked in the yard, under the tree, and by the pond. At last, they found the new red ball near the big rock. Quick was so happy! He played with his red ball all day long.

One day, a little cat named Hope went for a walk. She saw a fancy stand with many toys. Hope wanted a toy, but she had no money. She felt sad and walked away.
Hope's friend, a dog named Max, saw her looking sad. Max asked, "Why are you sad, Hope?" Hope said, "I want a toy from the fancy stand, but I have no money." Max had an idea. "Let's do a show and make people laugh! They will give us money, and you can buy a toy!"
Hope and Max worked together to make a funny show. They danced, sang, and made silly faces. People laughed and gave them money. Hope was happy and went back to the fancy stand.
She picked a toy she liked and paid for it with the money they made. "Thank you, Max!" Hope said. Max smiled and said, "You're welcome, Hope! We did it together." They were both happy and played with the new toy all day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to drink cocoa. One day, it was very cold and harsh outside. Lily wanted to share her cocoa with her friends to make them warm.
Lily went to her friends, and they all sat together. They started to discuss who should get the cocoa first. Everyone wanted to be first, but they were all good friends. They knew they had to find a fair way to share the cocoa.
So, Lily and her friends decided to take turns. Each friend got a chance to drink the cocoa, and they all felt warm and happy. They learned that sharing is the best way to make everyone happy. The moral of the story is that sharing with friends is a kind and loving thing to do.

Once upon a time there lived a family. Every Sunday they paid a visit to their grandmother. She loved to show them her special cupboard that contained rare things. 
One Sunday when they arrived, the grandmother could hardly contain her excitement. She whispered to the children that she had something special to show them. She opened the cupboard and the children's eyes widened. Inside the cupboard was a rare toy. 
The grandmother said with a big smile, "This toy is for you children if you can pay for it."
The children looked at her with confusion. "What do you mean, pay?" they asked.
"Well, if you clean up the cupboard, you can have the toy. Would you like to do that?" she replied. 
"Yes!" they answered eagerly and began to tidy up the cupboard. When they were done, the grandmother handed them the rare toy to take home. 
The children were thrilled and thanked the grandmother for the toy. Ever since, the children pay for their toys by tidying up the cupboard every Sunday.

One day, a little girl went to the beach. She was feeling very lonely.
She looked out across the sea, and saw a dolphin swimming around. She said to herself, "I wish I could join that dolphin out there."
She waded into the water, but the dolphin was too fast for her. She was about to give up, when the dolphin turned around and looked at her.
The little girl smiled and said, "Can I join you?"
The dolphin smiled back and floated closer. It said, "Yes, please join me!"
The little girl was so happy, and they swam together in the sea until the sun set. She was not alone anymore, and they were the best of friends.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play together. Sometimes they go to the gym with their moms. The gym has a big room with toys and mats. Lily and Ben can jump, roll, slide and swing there.
One day, Lily's mom is sick. She cannot drive Lily to the gym. Lily is sad. She wants to see Ben and play. She calls Ben on the phone.
"Hi, Ben. I cannot go to the gym today. My mom is sick. She cannot drive."
"Oh, no. I am sorry, Lily. I want to play with you. Can you ask your dad to drive you?"
"My dad is at work. He cannot drive me either. I have to stay home."
Lily and Ben are quiet. They do not know what to do. Then, Ben has an idea.
"I know. I can ask my mom to drive you. She is reliable. She always drives me to the gym. She can pick you up and bring you back. Do you want to come?"
"Yes, please. That would be nice. Thank you, Ben. You are a good friend."
"OK. I will tell my mom. She will be there soon. Bye, Lily."
"Bye, Ben. See you at the gym."
Lily and Ben are happy. They can go to the gym and play together. They have fun. They thank Ben's mom for driving them. They hug and say goodbye. They are glad they have reliable moms and friends.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a persistent dog named Buddy. Buddy loved to play and help people. One day, while playing near the river, he saw a small bird stuck in a tree. The bird was scared and cried for help.
Buddy barked and said, "Don't worry, little bird, I will rescue you!" He jumped and tried to reach the bird. But the tree was too tall. Buddy did not give up. He found a big stick and pushed it against the tree. The stick helped the bird get free.
The bird was very happy and said, "Thank you, Buddy, for saving me!" Buddy wagged his tail and smiled. From that day on, the bird and Buddy became best friends. They played together every day and made many happy memories. And the village people loved their brave, helpful dog Buddy.

One day, a little girl needed to get dressed for the day. She put on her pretty dress, like she did every morning. Today, though, she needed something new to make it look even better. So, she went to the park and looked around.
She saw an old oak tree and was excited. She thought it had something special. She searched along the trunk and found a fake leaf. She studied it for a moment then smiled. She picked it up and put it on her dress. She felt very prettty and even danced around the tree.
The fake leaf was perfect. The green colours were just like her dress. Even the shape matched. The little girl looked so happy that day. The fake leaf sparkled in the sun and made her dress even more beautiful. She had finally found the perfect accessory!

Once upon a time, there was a thin little girl named Sarah. She was so curious and always wanted to wander. 
One day, Sarah decided to take a walk in the woods. As she wandered, she found an old cabin. It was filled with history!
Sarah opened the door and stepped inside. It was dark and damp, but she could still see. Sarah walked slowly around the cabin, gazing at all the old things. 
Suddenly, she saw a big book! She opened it and began to read. Every page told stories of adventure and exploration. Sarah read for hours until it was time to go. 
That night, Sarah went to bed happy. She had experienced history first hand, and it had been wonderful!

Once upon a time, there was a barber who loved to swim. He swam in the lake near his home every day. He was very proud of how good he was at swimming.
One day, the barber took his young daughter swimming with him. The barber was excited to show his daughter how to swim! He showed her how to float, and then showed her how to do a very simple stroke. She was so excited, and soon she was swimming around the lake all by herself.
The barber was so proud. He watched as his daughter splashed and paddled around, smiling the whole time. He was so proud of her progress. 
After a while, the barber and his daughter swam together. They swam around the lake, holding hands. The barber told his daughter how proud he was of her, and how her swimming made him very happy. 
The barber and his daughter went swimming every day. The daughter grew up to become a strong swimmer, and she never forgot the day when her proudly father showed her how to swim.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a famous cat. The cat loved to play with a net. One day, the cat saw a big ball. The cat wanted the ball. The cat said, "Give me the ball!" The cat was demanding.
A little boy heard the cat. The boy wanted to help. The boy took the net and tried to get the ball. But the net got stuck. The boy and the cat pulled the net. The net did not move.
Then, a big bird came. The bird saw the boy, the cat, and the net. The bird wanted to help. The bird pulled the net with its beak. The net moved! The ball rolled out. The cat was happy. The boy was happy. The bird was happy. But, the bird was not a bird. It was a famous dog in a bird costume! The boy, the cat, and the dog laughed and played together.

Tom and Lily were playing in the park with their ball. They saw a big statue of a man on a horse. The statue was very high and had a long sword in his hand.
"Who is that?" Tom asked Lily.
"I don't know. Maybe he was a king or a hero," Lily said.
"Can we go and touch him?" Tom said.
Lily felt fearful. She did not like the statue. He looked angry and scary.
"No, Tom. He might hurt us. Let's stay away from him," Lily said.
But Tom was curious. He wanted to see the statue up close. He ran towards the statue and climbed on the base. He reached out his hand to touch the sword.
"Tom, come back! It's dangerous!" Lily shouted.
But Tom did not listen. He touched the sword and felt a sharp pain. He cut his finger on the edge. He cried out loud and jumped down. He ran back to Lily with blood on his hand.
"Lily, Lily, help me! It hurts!" Tom said.
Lily hugged Tom and tried to calm him down. She took out a tissue from her pocket and wrapped it around his finger.
"Tom, you should have listened to me. The statue was not a toy. It was a weapon. You could have hurt yourself more," Lily said.
"I'm sorry, Lily. You were right. I was foolish. I should have asked a question before I touched something I did not know," Tom said.
Lily smiled and kissed his cheek.
"It's okay, Tom. I forgive you. You learned your lesson. Next time, be more careful and respectful of things you don't understand," Lily said.
They held hands and walked to their mom, who was sitting on a bench. She saw Tom's finger and took him to the nurse. The nurse cleaned his wound and put a band-aid on it. She gave him a lollipop and told him to be more careful next time.
Tom and Lily thanked the nurse and went back to their mom. They told her what happened and said they were sorry. Their mom hugged them and said she was glad they were okay. She said they should always ask questions and learn from their mistakes. She said she was proud of them for being honest and brave.
Tom and Lily felt happy and loved. They learned a valuable lesson that day. They never touched the statue again, but they always looked at it with wonder and respect.

Once upon a time, there was a nice dragon. The dragon flew up high in the sky.
One day, the dragon met a little boy. The boy said "May I put my hat on you?" The dragon liked the hat, it looked so nice. So the dragon said "Yes, sure!"
The boy said "Now I'm going to put something else on you!" The boy put a big bag on the dragon. The dragon couldn't fly anymore. The dragon was so sad and asked "What did you put in the bag?" 
The little boy said "It's a surprise! I'm taking you back to my house!" The dragon didn't want to go, but the boy carried it away.
When they got to the house, the boy opened the bag and out came too many cats. The cats all chased the dragon. The dragon tried to fly away but it was too late. The cats ate the dragon and it never returned.

Once upon a time, there was a thin butterfly. The butterfly lived in a big garden with many flowers. It loved to fly and play with its friends all day long.
One day, the butterfly met a nice lady who liked to cook. She was making yummy food in her little house near the garden. The lady saw the butterfly and smiled. She wanted to be friends with it.
The butterfly and the lady became good friends. Every day, the lady would cook and share her food with the butterfly. They were very happy together, and the garden was always full of laughter and love.

Once upon a time, there was a big, wide tree in a small park. A little boy named Tim and a small bird named Blue lived near the tree. Tim and Blue were best friends. They loved to play together in the park.
One day, Tim saw Blue sitting on the tree with a sad face. Tim asked, "Blue, why are you sad?" Blue said, "I can't find my way home. My nose can't smell my home." Tim wanted to help Blue. He said, "Let's try to find your home together."
Tim and Blue walked and walked. They looked high and low. Tim used his wide eyes to see, and Blue used his nose to smell. They tried very hard. At last, Blue's nose smelled his home. They found Blue's home near the big, wide tree.
Blue was very happy. He said, "Thank you, Tim, for helping me find my home." Tim smiled and said, "You're welcome, Blue. We are best friends, and we help each other." From that day on, Tim and Blue played together every day and had lots of fun.

Lily and Tom were playing in the garden. They saw a big green lime on a tree. Lily wanted to eat the lime. She said to Tom, "Let's pull the lime from the tree. It looks yummy."
Tom nodded and climbed on a stool. He reached for the lime and pulled hard. But the lime was too high and too heavy. Tom lost his balance and fell off the stool. He landed on the ground and hurt his knee. He cried, "Ow, ow, ow! My knee hurts!"
Lily ran to Tom and hugged him. She said, "I'm sorry, Tom. Are you okay?" She looked at his knee and saw a small cut. She said, "Let me get a band-aid for you. It will make you feel better."
She ran inside the house and came back with a band-aid. She put it on Tom's knee and kissed it. She said, "There, all done. Does it still hurt?"
Tom smiled and said, "No, it doesn't hurt anymore. Thank you, Lily. You are a good friend."
Lily smiled and said, "You're welcome, Tom. You are a good friend too. Do you still want the lime?"
Tom shook his head and said, "No, I don't want the lime anymore. It's too sour and too hard to get. Let's play something else."
Lily agreed and said, "Okay, let's play something else. How about we play with the ball?"
Tom nodded and said, "Yes, let's play with the ball. That sounds fun."
They picked up the ball and ran to the grass. They forgot about the lime and played happily.

Once upon a time, there was a little rabbit named Bobby. Bobby loved to eat carrots. One day, Bobby went to the market to order more carrots.
On his way, Bobby felt very cold. It was an icy day. He put on his warm hat and kept walking. He saw other animals wearing their warm clothes too.
Finally, Bobby reached the market. He ordered lots of carrots. The carrot seller put them in a big bag for him. Bobby carried the bag home, feeling happy and excited to eat his carrots.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had long hair that she liked to keep tidy. Every morning, she would ask her mom to help her brush her hair. "Mom, can you please brush my hair?" Lily would request.
Her mom would smile and say, "Of course, Lily! Let's make your hair tidy and pretty." They would sit down and her mom would gently brush Lily's hair until it was neat and shiny. Lily loved how her hair looked when it was tidy.
One day, Lily's friend, Sam, came over to play. Sam's hair was messy and not tidy at all. Lily asked her mom, "Can we help Sam make his hair tidy too?" Her mom agreed, and they all worked together to make Sam's hair neat and tidy, just like Lily's. They had a fun day playing together with their tidy hair.

Once upon a time, there was a brilliant party. All the children were excited to wear their nicest outfits to the party. There was one little girl who didn't have a new dress to wear. She felt sad and put on an old dress from home. 
When she arrived at the party, the other children laughed at her dress. The poor girl felt embarrassed and wanted to run away. But, one kind little boy noticed her troubles and said, "Your old dress is just as nice as my new one. Not all new things make us look better." 
The little girl was happy to hear this. She learned that it's what's on the inside that counts, not what we wear! So, the moral of this story is to remember to always be kind, no matter what others wear.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Annie. She was three years old, and full of wonder. 
One morning, she went for a walk in the woods near her house. Everything was warm and inviting. Annie couldn't help but touch the soft, velvety petals of the flowers as she passed. 
But soon, Annie was stopped by a big tree with a trunk so wide she couldn't reach around it. 
Annie spotted a small door in the tree's trunk. She reached out and touched it with her tiny fingers. 
Suddenly, a voice spoke up from the tree. "Welcome, Annie," an old witch said. "I have been expecting you."
Annie was scared, but she was also filled with wonder. She asked the witch why she had been expecting her. 
The witch told Annie to come closer and touch the door again. When she did, the door opened, revealing a magical room full of wonders. 
Annie couldn't believe her luck. She had stumbled upon a magical world of warm surprises. 
From then on, Annie's life was filled with mysterious adventures. Whenever Annie was feeling sad or lonely, she would just touch the door, and the magical world would make her happy again. 
 
The end.

One day, a little girl named Amy went to visit her dad at his work. He worked in a big room called a lab. In the lab, there were many things to see and do. Amy loved to go there and learn new things.
In the lab, Amy saw a big box. Her dad told her that they just received it today. Amy was excited and asked if they could open it. Her dad said yes and they opened the box together. Inside the box, there were many colorful balls.
Amy and her dad started to play with the balls. They threw them in the air and laughed. They had a silly time playing with the balls in the lab. They played until it was time for Amy to go home. Amy couldn't wait to come back to the lab again and have more fun with her dad.

One day, a soft cat and a dog were playing outside. They saw dark clouds and heard loud sounds. The cat said, "I don't like this. I want to go home." The dog did not complain. He was brave.
They saw lightning in the sky. The dog said, "Wow, pretty lights!" The cat was scared. She ran away to hide. The dog stayed and watched the lightning.
Then, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and took the dog far away. The cat came back, but she could not find her friend. She was very sad. The dog was gone forever.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there was a humble cat named Catty. Catty loved to mix things in a big bowl. One day, she wanted to make a cake for her friend, Bunny.
Catty went to the well to get water for the cake. At the well, she met Froggy. Froggy said, "Catty, don't mix too much water in the cake!" Catty listened but did not do as Froggy said. She thought she knew better.
Catty finished the cake and gave it to Bunny. But the cake was bad because it had too much water. Bunny said, "Catty, you should have listened to Froggy. Now the cake is bad and we can't eat it."
Catty felt sad. She learned that it is important to listen to others, even if you think you know better.

One day, a boy named Tom went to the store with his mom. They wanted to buy some candy. Tom was very happy. But Tom's mom realized she forgot her wallet at home. Tom felt sad because he could not get the candy.
Tom's mom had an idea. She told Tom to go ask his deaf grandpa if he had any money. Tom went to his grandpa and asked him. Grandpa could not hear Tom, so he did not know what Tom wanted.
Tom tried again. This time, he showed his grandpa a picture of a wallet. Grandpa understood and gave Tom some money. Tom and his mom went back to the store and bought the candy. They were very happy and shared the candy with grandpa.

The little girl was excited! She had a special job to do. The girl was going to climb the window. It was a unique window because it was the highest window in the neighborhood. 
The girl started to climb, using her two little hands and feet. She moved up slowly, but she could do it. The girl felt so proud of herself. She was getting higher and higher. 
Finally, the girl reached the top of the window. She looked out and saw the whole town below her. She felt so proud of herself, she had climbed something unique. With a big smile, the girl started her journey back down the window.

One day, a boy named Tim and his dad went for a ride in their red car. They drove down the street and had a lot of fun. Tim loved the car so much, he felt very happy.
Suddenly, a big, fearful dog ran in front of the car. Tim's dad tried to stop, but he could not. The car hit the dog and it made a loud noise. Tim was scared and said, "Dad, did we break the car?"
Tim's dad looked at the car and saw that it was broken. He was sad and told Tim, "Yes, the car is broken. We need to find help." They walked to find someone to fix the car, but they could not find anyone.
In the end, Tim and his dad had to leave the broken car on the street. They walked home, feeling very sad. The car was not fixed, and they could not have fun rides anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a squirrel. The squirrel liked to dress up. One day, it found a big red hat. The squirrel was very happy.
The squirrel met a bird. The bird said, "Can I wear the hat too?" The squirrel said, "No, it's mine!" The squirrel was selfish.
Then, it started to rain. The hat was too big and heavy. The squirrel fell down. The bird flew away. The squirrel was sad and wet.

Once upon a time there was a cat called Stretch who loved to explore. He was always looking for new things to do and places to go. One day he decided to go and explore a big, cold mountain. When he got there he saw a strange object. It was a thermometer! Stretch was very curious, so he decided to touch it. But it was too cold and he had to stretch to reach it. He tried again but he still couldn't get it.
Suddenly, a helpful deer came to Stretch's rescue. The deer used its long neck to reach the thermometer and then gave it to Stretch. Stretch was very happy and thanked the deer for being so helpful. He thanked it by giving it a big hug.
Stretch took the thermometer home and he was so happy that he went exploring. He discovered a lot of new things, but he never forgot about the helpful deer.

One day, Mary was very sad. She had suffered an injury to her foot and wasn't able to move around very easily. So, her parents decided to take her to the park.
At the park, Mary's parents saw a pick laying on the ground. It was bright and shiny, so they let her pick it up. She was so excited, she carried the pick everywhere.
Whenever Mary got tired, her parents would walk her home. On the way, they would give her tasks to complete. They asked her to be obedient, and she always was.
At the end of the day, Mary was happy. She had a pick to show everyone and she had not suffered anymore. Even though she was sad about being in pain, she was still able to find joy.

One day, a polite cat named Sam went for a walk. Sam liked to gaze at the pretty flowers in the park. He was a very patient cat and would wait for the flowers to open.
In the park, Sam saw a big dog. The dog did not like Sam. The dog barked and ran at Sam. Sam was scared, but he was patient. He waited for the dog to get close.
Sam thought of a plan. He jumped high into a tree. The dog could not reach him. The dog barked and barked, but Sam just gazed down at him. The dog got tired and went away.
Sam was happy he was safe. He climbed down from the tree and went back to gazing at the pretty flowers. From that day on, Sam was always patient and polite, even when he faced trouble.

Lily and Ben were playing in the park with their ball. They liked to kick the ball to each other and run after it. Sometimes the ball went too far and they had to chase it.
One time, the ball rolled into the street. Lily ran after it without looking. She did not see the big car coming fast. The car honked loudly and tried to stop, but it was too late. It hit Lily and she fell down.
Ben saw what happened and screamed. He ran to Lily and tried to wake her up, but she did not move. He was very scared and sad. He cried and hugged Lily.
A cop saw the accident and came to help. He called an ambulance and tried to calm Ben down. He said, "Don't worry, little boy. The doctors will take care of your sister. She will be okay."
But he was lying. Lily was not okay. She was very hurt and did not breathe. The ambulance came and took her away, but she did not wake up. She died.
Ben was alone. He did not have his sister or his ball anymore. He felt very cold and lonely. He wished he could go back to the park and play with Lily. He wished he could hear her laugh and talk. He wished he could make her comfortable and happy. But he could not. He could only cry.

Once upon a time, there was a creative boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his toys. His favorite toy was a spear. He would play with it all day long.
One day, Tim was playing with his spear when his big sister, Sue, came into the room. Sue wanted to play with Tim's spear, too. But Tim did not want to share. They both wanted the spear and did not know what to do.
Then, Tim had an idea. He ran to the kitchen and got a big cup. He filled it with water and poured the water into two smaller cups. He gave one cup to Sue and said, "Let's pretend the water is magic. If we share the magic water, we can both play with the spear." Sue liked the idea and they both drank the magic water. Now, they could share the spear and play together happily.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived an unusual dog named Mark. Mark was very different from the other dogs. He had big ears and a long tail. All the people in the town loved him because he was kind and helpful.
One day, Mark saw a little girl crying near a tree. He went to her and asked, "Why are you sad?" The little girl said, "I lost my toy and can't find it." Mark wanted to help her, so he used his big ears and long tail to look for the toy. He looked under the tree, behind the bushes, and in the grass. Finally, he found the toy and gave it back to the girl. She was very happy and thanked Mark.
From that day on, the people in the town learned that being different is not bad. Mark taught everyone that being kind and helpful is more important than how you look. And the town became a happier place, where everyone helped each other, no matter how unusual they were.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She had a shiny waist. All her friends were envious of her shiny waist. They wanted to have shiny waists too.
One day, Lucy went to the park. She saw her friend, Tom. Tom said, "Wow, Lucy! Your waist is so shiny! How did you do that?" Lucy smiled and said, "I have a magic belt that makes my waist shine."
Tom asked, "Can I try your magic belt, please?" Lucy said, "Sure, Tom!" She gave Tom the magic belt. Tom put the belt on his waist. His waist started to shine too.
Now, Lucy and Tom both had shiny waists. They were very happy. They played in the park all day, with their waists shining brightly. All their friends saw them and wanted to have shiny waists too.

Sara loved her doll very much. She named her doll Lily and took her everywhere. She played with Lily, hugged Lily, and talked to Lily. Lily was Sara's best friend.
One day, Sara and her mom went to the park. Sara brought Lily with her and put her on a bench. She saw some kids playing with a ball and wanted to join them. She ran to the kids and asked, "Can I play with you?"
The kids said yes and Sara had fun playing with the ball. She forgot about Lily for a while. She did not see a big dog that came to the bench and sniffed Lily. The dog liked Lily and picked her up with his mouth. He ran away with Lily.
Sara did not notice until it was time to go home. She ran back to the bench and looked for Lily. She did not see Lily. She saw a hole in the bench where Lily was. She felt very sad and scared. She cried, "Mom, mom, where is Lily? I can't find Lily!"
Her mom came and hugged her. She said, "I'm sorry, Sara. I think a dog took Lily. He must have liked her too. Maybe he will take good care of her."
Sara shook her head. She said, "No, no, I want Lily back. Lily is my doll. Lily is my friend. I miss Lily. Please, mom, find Lily."
Her mom said, "I know, Sara. I miss Lily too. But I don't know where the dog went. He left very fast. Maybe we can look for another doll that looks like Lily. Would you like that?"
Sara thought for a moment. She said, "No, mom. I don't want another doll. I want Lily. Lily is not normal. Lily is special. Lily is mine."
Her mom said, "I understand, Sara. I'm sorry. I love you. Maybe we can make a picture of Lily and hang it on your wall. Would you like that?"
Sara nodded. She said, "Yes, mom. I would like that. Maybe Lily will see it and come back. I hope so."
Her mom said, "Me too, Sara. Me too."

Once upon a time, there was a little mole. The mole was grumpy. He lived in a small hole in the ground. He had no friends. He would wonder why no one liked him.
One day, the grumpy mole heard a sound. It was a small bird. The bird was stuck in a tree. The grumpy mole wanted to help. He dug a tunnel under the tree. He made the tree fall down. The bird was free.
The bird was happy. The bird said, "Thank you, mole!" The grumpy mole was not grumpy anymore. The bird and the mole became friends. The mole did not wonder why no one liked him anymore. They lived happily ever after.

One day, a red bird was flying in the sky. The bird saw a shiny pin on the ground. The red bird wanted to show the pin to his friend, the cat. The cat was sitting under a big tree.
The red bird said to the cat, "Look at this pretty pin I found!" The cat looked at the pin and said, "Be careful with it, it can hurt you." The red bird did not listen and flew away with the pin in his beak.
Later, the red bird was playing with the pin and it poked him. He felt pain and began to shout, "Ouch! Ouch!" The cat heard the shout and came running to help. The cat said, "I told you to be careful with the pin." The red bird learned that he should listen to his friends when they give him good advice.

Once upon a time, there was a polite penguin named Pip. Pip lived in a cold place with lots of ice and snow. Pip had many friends who liked to play with him.
One day, Pip and his friends wanted to have a big party. They needed food to supply for everyone to eat. Pip put on his warm hat and went to find food for the party.
Pip found fish and brought them back to the party. All his friends were happy and said "Thank you, Pip!" They all ate and played together. The polite penguin, Pip, had a great time with his friends at the party.

Once upon a time, there was a little cart. The cart had four wheels and could carry many things. It was red and blue and loved to roll around the town.
One day, the cart saw a dangerous hole in the ground. The hole was very big and deep. The cart wanted to help, so it went to find its friends. The cart asked the ball, the block, and the car to unite and work together. They all agreed to help the cart.
The ball, the block, the car, and the cart worked together to fill the dangerous hole. They took turns carrying dirt and rocks to make the hole smaller. Soon, the hole was gone, and the town was safe again. The cart and its friends were very happy that they united to help. They knew that working together made them strong.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She liked to grow plants in her garden. One day, she found a big seed. She dug a hole and put the seed in it. Then, she covered it with dirt and watered it.
After some days, a big plant grew. It had a huge trap on it. Lily was very surprised. She called her friend Tim and said, "Look at my big plant! It has a trap on it!" Tim looked at the plant and said, "Wow, that's amazing! What can we do with the trap?"
Lily thought for a moment and said, "Let's use the trap to catch bugs. We can help the other plants grow better." Tim agreed, and they both looked for bugs. They found some bugs and put them near the trap. The trap caught the bugs, and the other plants were happy. Lily and Tim were proud of their big plant and the help it gave to the other plants.

Once upon a time, there was a little duck. The duck liked to speak a lot. One day, the duck went to the park. In the park, there were many friends to play with. The duck was happy because friends were available.
The duck saw a big dog. The duck said, "Hello, do you want to play?" The dog looked at the duck and said, "Yes, I want to play!" So, the duck and the dog played together all day.
But then, something unexpected happened. The dog started to speak like a duck! The dog said, "Quack, quack!" The duck was surprised and laughed. Now, the duck and the dog could speak the same way. They became best friends and played together every day.

One day, a girl named Lily went with her mom to a restaurant. The restaurant was big and had many tables. They sat down at a soft chair near a big window. Lily looked around and saw many people eating and talking.
Lily's mom asked, "What do you want to eat, Lily?" Lily thought for a moment and said, "I want a big, soft cookie!" Her mom smiled and said, "Okay, let's ask for a big, soft cookie."
When the cookie came, it was very big! Lily looked at the cookie and wanted to examine it. She touched the cookie and it was very soft. But then, something unexpected happened. The cookie started to talk! "Hello, Lily!" said the cookie.
Lily was surprised but she talked to the cookie. They became friends and had a fun time at the restaurant. In the end, Lily didn't eat the cookie, because they were friends now. She took the cookie home and they played together every day.

Sara was a gifted girl. She could do many things well. She could sing, draw, and read. She also had a big wish. She wanted to fly.
One day, she found a file in her dad's office. It had many papers with pictures of planes and birds. Sara liked the pictures. She wanted to fly like them. She took the file and ran to her room.
She opened the file and looked at the papers. She saw how planes and birds had wings and tails. She thought, maybe I can make wings and a tail too. She got some paper, scissors, and tape. She cut and taped the paper to make wings and a tail. She put them on her arms and back.
She felt happy and excited. She ran to the window and opened it. She saw the sky and the clouds. She thought, now I can fly. She jumped out of the window and flapped her wings.
But she did not fly. She fell. She screamed. She was scared. She hurt her leg and arm. She cried.
Her mom and dad heard her scream and cry. They ran to the window and saw her on the ground. They were shocked and worried. They ran to her and hugged her. They asked her what happened. She told them she wanted to fly. They looked at her wings and tail. They felt sad and sorry.
They took her to the doctor. The doctor fixed her leg and arm. He gave her a bandage and a sticker. He told her she was brave and smart. He also told her she could not fly. He said, only planes and birds can fly. He said, you are gifted, but you are not a plane or a bird. He said, you have other ways to fly. He said, you can fly with your imagination, your dreams, and your talents.
Sara listened to the doctor. She felt better. She understood. She thanked the doctor. She hugged her mom and dad. She said, I love you. She said, I'm sorry. She said, I still want to fly. They said, we love you too. They said, it's okay. They said, you can fly in your own way. They smiled. She smiled. They went home. She still had her wings and tail. She kept them in her room. She looked at them and remembered. She did not try to fly again. But she still sang, drew, and read. She still had her big wish. She still flew with her imagination, her dreams, and her talents. She was a gifted girl.

One day, a funny mosquito named Buzz went to play with his friend, a little boy named Tim. They liked to play tag and hide-and-seek in the garden. Tim laughed as Buzz tickled his nose with his wings.
"Buzz, you are so funny," said Tim. They played all day, but then they started to disagree about what game to play next. Tim wanted to play tag, but Buzz wanted to play hide-and-seek.
"Let's play tag!" said Tim. "No, hide-and-seek!" said Buzz. They couldn't agree, so they decided to take a break and eat a snack. Tim had a sandwich, and Buzz drank some nectar from a flower.
As they were eating, something unexpected happened. A big wind came and blew Tim's hat away. Tim and Buzz stopped disagreeing and decided to work together to catch the hat.
They ran and flew as fast as they could, and finally caught the hat. Tim put it back on his head and smiled. "Thank you, Buzz," he said. "We make a good team." From that day on, they always agreed to work together and have fun.

Tom and Mia like to play with their kayak in the lake. They take turns to paddle and steer. Sometimes they race with other kids who have boats. They have a lot of fun.
One day, a big duck swims near their kayak. The duck is angry and loud. It wants the kayak to go away. It bites the kayak and makes a hole. Water comes in the kayak. Tom and Mia are scared.
They paddle fast to the shore. They yell for help. They want to stop the duck and the water. They see their mom and dad on the beach. They wave and shout.
Mom and dad run to the lake. They see the duck and the kayak. They are worried. They get a rope and a net. They throw the rope to Tom and Mia. They pull them to the shore. They catch the duck with the net. They put it in a cage.
Tom and Mia are safe and wet. They hug their mom and dad. They are happy. They say thank you. They look at their kayak. It has a big hole. They are sad. They say sorry.
Mom and dad say it's okay. They say they can fix the kayak. They say they can find a new home for the duck. They say they love Tom and Mia. They say they are proud of them. They say they are brave and fast. They say they can play with the kayak again. They say they can have more fun.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park. He saw a big, heavy box with a note on it. The note said, "Count to ten and you will get a surprise." Tim was excited and started to count. "One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten!"
With a loud "pop," the box opened, and out came a big, colorful balloon. Tim was so happy and surprised. He played with the balloon all day, running and jumping with it. But then, something unexpected happened. The balloon started to grow bigger and bigger!
Tim was scared. The big balloon lifted him off the ground and carried him high up in the sky. Tim closed his eyes and wished for help. Suddenly, a friendly bird came and popped the balloon with its beak. Tim started to fall, but the bird caught him and flew him back to the park.
When they got back to the ground, Tim thanked the bird for saving him. The bird smiled and said, "You're welcome, Tim. Remember, not all surprises are good, but friends are always there to help you." Tim hugged the bird and they played together until the sun went down.

Tim and Jen are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big dog. The dog is brown and has a long tail. The dog looks nice.
"Can we pet the dog?" Tim asks Jen.
"I don't know. Maybe we should ask the owner first," Jen says.
They look around, but they do not see anyone. The dog is alone. Tim and Jen walk to the dog. The dog wags its tail and licks their hands. Tim and Jen smile.
"You are a kind dog," Tim says. "What is your name?"
The dog barks. Tim and Jen think it is saying hello. They pet the dog some more. They are happy.
But then, they hear a loud noise. It is a car. The car is coming fast. The car is not looking. The car is going to hit the dog.
"Look out, dog!" Jen shouts.
But it is too late. The car hits the dog. The dog yelps. The dog falls to the ground. The dog does not move. Tim and Jen are scared. They run to the dog. They try to help the dog. But the dog is not breathing. The dog is dead.
Tim and Jen cry. They are sad. They are sorry. They wish they had asked the owner first. They wish they had been more careful. They wish the dog was alive. But the dog is gone. The car is gone. Tim and Jen are alone. They hug each other. They do not know what to do. The end.

Once upon a time, in a small house, lived a polite rabbit named Bob. Bob loved to eat salad every day. He would hop around the garden and pick the best lettuce, carrots, and tomatoes for his salad.
One sunny day, while Bob was eating his salad, a hungry squirrel named Sally came to visit. Sally saw the salad and thought it looked yummy. She asked Bob if she could have some. Bob wanted to remain polite, so he shared his salad with Sally. They ate the salad together and became good friends.
The next day, Sally came back with nuts to share with Bob. They learned that sharing is caring, and remained friends forever. The moral of the story is to always be polite and share with others.

Once upon a time, there was a giant. The giant was big and strong. He lived in a big house on top of a hill. The giant had a big garden with pretty flowers. He liked to pour water on the flowers to help them grow.
One sunny day, the giant found a little, adorable cat in his garden. The cat was lost and hungry. The giant felt sad for the cat. He decided to help the cat. He poured some milk into a bowl for the cat to drink. The cat was happy and drank the milk.
The giant and the cat became good friends. They played together in the garden every day. The giant poured water on the flowers, and the cat chased the butterflies. They were happy and had lots of fun. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a gifted little elephant named Ella. Ella was very good at playing with her round ball. She loved to roll it, kick it, and toss it high in the air. One day, her friend, Tommy the turtle, came over to play.
"Hi Ella! Can I play with your round ball too?" asked Tommy. Ella smiled and said, "Of course! Let's have fun together!"
They played all day long, laughing and having a great time. After a while, they got tired and sat down to rest. Tommy looked at Ella and asked, "Ella, how much do you weigh?" Ella thought for a moment and said, "I don't know, but I know I'm bigger than you!"
They laughed and continued playing until it was time to go home. Ella and Tommy were happy they had spent the day together, and they knew they would always be best friends.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there lived a girl named Mia. She loved to write about winter. Mia was very enthusiastic about writing stories with snow, cold air, and warm clothes.
One day, Mia was writing a story about a snowman. She wrote that the snowman was big, with a hat and a scarf. But as she wrote, something unexpected happened. The snowman in her story came to life and jumped right out of the paper!
Mia was so surprised, but she was also very happy. The snowman played with Mia in her house, and they had a lot of fun. Then, Mia had an idea. She wrote a story about the sun coming out and melting the snow. As she wrote, the snowman started to feel warm and began to melt. Mia was sad, but she knew that she could always write another story and bring the snowman back again.

Once upon a time, there was a tall tree. It lived in a big green park. The tall tree had many friends. It liked to give shade to people under it. The tall tree was very happy.
One day, a little girl came to the park. Her face was red and hot. She had some cream on her nose. Her mom put the cream on her nose to keep her safe from the sun. The little girl sat under the tall tree to cool down. She removed the cream from her nose. She did not want it anymore.
The tall tree saw the little girl remove the cream. It felt sad. It knew the cream was important. The tall tree talked to the wind. It asked the wind to blow the cream back on the little girl's nose. The wind helped the tall tree. The little girl learned that the cream was there to protect her. She felt thankful for the tall tree and the wind. The moral of the story is to trust what helps us and to be thankful for our friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to draw and play with her toys. She liked to be independent and do things all by herself. One day, Sue found a broken toy with a missing circle.
Sue wanted to fix the toy, so she looked around her room to find a circle. She found a small, round button that was just the right size. Sue was happy that she could fix the toy all by herself.
With a big smile, Sue put the circle button on the broken toy. It looked perfect, and the toy could play and dance again. Sue felt proud that she was independent and could fix the toy on her own. And from that day on, Sue knew she could do anything she set her mind to.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the store with his mom. He saw a big jar filled with lollipops. Tim really wanted one, but his mom said, "No, not today."
Tim felt angry but he did not want to be bad. So, he thought of a plan. He asked his mom, "Can I get a lollipop if I help you fill the bags with food?" His mom smiled and said, "Yes, if you help me, you can have one."
Tim was very happy. He helped his mom fill the bags with food. They filled the bags with apples, bread, and milk. When they were done, Tim's mom let him pick a lollipop from the jar. Tim picked a big, red lollipop and said, "Thank you, Mom!"

One day, a little girl named Amy went to the park with her mom. The park was very busy with many kids playing and laughing. Amy saw a big tree with a cut on it. She wanted to find out what made the cut.
Amy asked her mom, "Mom, what made the cut on the tree?" Her mom said, "A big bird with a sharp beak made the cut, Amy."
Amy wanted to watch the big bird, so she sat under the tree and looked up. After a while, she saw the big bird come back to the tree. The bird was busy making the cut bigger to build a nest. Amy watched and smiled as the big bird worked hard to make a home for its family.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a smart raven. The raven liked to help his friends. One day, he saw a small bird trying to fly. The small bird was sad because it could not fly high.
The smart raven had an idea. He told the small bird to wait and not rush. The raven went away and came back with a big leaf. The raven put the leaf on the ground and told the small bird to jump on it.
The small bird jumped on the leaf and tried to fly again. This time, the small bird could fly high! The raven was happy to help his friend. The small bird thanked the raven for being patient and not rushing. The moral of the story is to not rush and take your time to learn new things.

Once upon a time there was a girl called Alana who loved to explore. Every day she would look for new places to go. One day Alana spotted something glittering in the woods. It was a glass! She raced to it and decided to take it home with her.
When she got home, she showed her mom the glass. But her mom disagreed. She said,"No, Alana. You can't have this glass." Alana was sad and she wanted the glass very much. 
Each day Alana asked her mom if she could have the glass and each day her mom disagreed. But then one day her mom said,"Alana, if you can find five more glasses like this one, then you can have this one." Alana was so excited! She looked everywhere but she couldn't find five more glasses. They weren't available anywhere.
Until one day Alana went to the beach and she saw that the tide had left lots of little glass pieces in the sand! She started collecting them, one by one until she had five more glasses! She was so happy! She showed them to her mom and her mom agreed that it was enough. 
Alana was so pleased that she could finally have the glass she wanted. She was also so proud of herself for finding the five little pieces of glass that made her dream come true.

Once upon a time, there was a mosquito named Max. Max was very serious about his job. His job was to mail letters to all the animals in the forest. One day, Max met a big bear named Ben.
Max said, "Hi Ben! I have a letter for you." Ben smiled and said, "Thank you, Max!" Max gave Ben the letter and flew away to mail more letters.
As Max was flying, he saw a little girl named Lily. Lily was sad because she had a letter to mail but didn't know how. Max said, "Don't worry, Lily! I can help you mail your letter." Lily smiled and said, "Thank you, Max!" Max took the letter from Lily and flew away to mail it.
Max was very busy, but he always made time to help his friends. All the animals and people in the forest loved Max, the serious mosquito mailman. And they all lived happily ever after.

One day, a boy named Tim found some gum. He was very happy. Tim loved gum a lot. He wanted to eat the gum right away. But then, he saw his friend Sue. Sue looked sad.
Tim asked Sue, "Why are you sad?" Sue said, "I lost my gum. I can't find it." Tim thought about the gum he found. He wanted to eat it, but he didn't want Sue to be sad.
Tim decided to give the gum to Sue. He said, "Here, you can have my gum." Sue was very happy. She said, "Thank you, Tim!" Now, both Tim and Sue were happy. They played together all day.

One day, a small gray cat named Kitty was walking in the park. She saw a little boy named Timmy playing with his toys. Timmy looked sad, so Kitty walked up to him.
"Hi, Timmy. Why are you sad?" asked Kitty.
"I can't count my toys," Timmy said, feeling ashamed. "I want to know how many I have, but it's too hard."
Kitty smiled and said, "I can help you count your toys. Let's do it together."
So, Kitty and Timmy counted the toys together. They counted one, two, three, four, five toys. Timmy felt happy now, and Kitty felt good for helping her friend.
From that day on, Kitty and Timmy played together in the park every day. They counted toys, leaves, and even the clouds in the sky. They were best friends and always had fun together.

Ben and Mia are friends who like to play with toys. Ben has a big robot that can attach different parts to its body. Mia has a small doll that can change its clothes. One day, they go to the park and bring their toys.
"Look at my robot!" Ben says. "It has a muscle arm that can lift anything. And a rocket leg that can fly. And a laser eye that can zap. It is the best toy ever!"
"Wow, your robot is cool," Mia says. "But my doll is pretty. It has a pink dress and a blue hat and a yellow bag. And it can smile and wink. It is the best toy ever!"
Ben and Mia start to play with their toys. But soon, they get bored of their own toys. They look at each other's toys and feel envious. They want to have both toys.
"Can I play with your doll?" Ben asks.
"Can I play with your robot?" Mia asks.
They agree to swap their toys for a while. But they are not careful. Ben tries to attach the robot's parts to the doll's body. Mia tries to change the doll's clothes with the robot's parts. They break their toys.
"Oh no!" Ben cries. "You broke my robot! You ripped off its arm and leg and eye!"
"Oh no!" Mia cries. "You broke my doll! You smashed its dress and hat and bag!"
They are angry and sad. They blame each other for breaking their toys. They start to fight. They push and pull and bite and scratch. They hurt each other.
They are not friends anymore. They go home with their broken toys. They are unhappy. They wish they had not been envious. They wish they had been nice. They wish they had played together. But it is too late. The end.

One day, a little bird named Tim was flying in the peaceful sky. He saw a big tree with red berries. Tim was hungry, so he went to the tree to eat the berries. But there was a big cat named Bob under the tree. Bob saw Tim and smiled.
"Hi, Tim!" said Bob. "Do you want to eat the berries? I will help you. Trust me!" Tim looked at Bob and thought about it. He was hungry, but he knew that cats sometimes catch birds. He decided to trust Bob and let him help.
Bob helped Tim get the berries. Tim was happy and ate them. But then, something unexpected happened. Bob did not catch Tim! Instead, Bob and Tim became friends. They played together and had fun. From that day on, Tim learned that not all cats are bad, and sometimes it's good to trust others.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park. He saw a big rock and thought it was a cool mineral. Tim picked up the rock and showed it to his friend, Sally. "Look at my big mineral!" he said. Sally looked at the rock and said, "Wow, that is big!"
As they played with the rock, a magic fairy appeared. The fairy said, "I can change your rock into something fun!" Tim and Sally were alert and excited. They said, "Please change our rock, fairy!"
The fairy waved her wand, and the rock changed into a bouncy ball. Tim and Sally were so happy. They played with the bouncy ball all day long. The magic fairy had made their day fun and full of surprises.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there was a well. The well had a big lock on it to keep everyone safe. The well was very important because it had water that everyone needed.
One day, a little girl named Lily went to the well with her mom. "Mom, can you open the lock?" asked Lily. "Yes, my dear," said her mom. She opened the lock and they got some water. They were very careful to close the lock when they were done.
One day, a big wind came and blew the lock away. The people in the village were scared. They did not want anyone to fall into the well. So, they all looked for the lock. Lily found it under a tree. She gave it to her mom, who put it back on the well. Everyone was happy and felt safe again.

One day, a little girl named Mia went to school. She wore her bright uniform and was very happy. She gazed at the big tree near her school and saw a little bird sitting on it. The bird was singing a sweet song.
"Hi, little bird!" Mia said. "I like your song. Can you be my friend?" The bird looked at Mia and nodded. They became friends and played together every day.
One day, Mia went to school and saw her friend the bird wearing a bright little uniform too! "Wow! You have a uniform like me!" Mia said. The bird smiled and they went to school together. Everyone was surprised to see a bird in a uniform, but they all loved it. Mia and the bird were the best of friends.

One day, a little girl named Amy went to her garden. She saw a mysterious hole in the ground. She thought, "What could be in there?" Amy felt excited and wanted to find out.
The next day, Amy went back to the garden. She kneeled down by the hole. She saw something red poking out. It was a radish! Amy pulled the radish out of the hole. She was very happy to find it.
Amy showed the radish to her mom. Her mom smiled and said, "Good job, Amy! You found a radish in our garden!" They ate the radish for dinner. It was very yummy. Amy knew the mysterious hole was a special place where radishes grew.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a tape. He did not know what it was for. He asked his mom, "What is this?"
His mom replied, "That is a tape. We use it to stick things together."
Tim wanted to use the tape, but his mom said no. She told him it was a spoiled tape and it would not work well. Tim was sad, but he put the tape away.
Later, Tim saw his mom's pretty art fall off the wall. He wanted to help. Tim got the spoiled tape and used it to stick the art back up. To his surprise, the tape worked! His mom saw what he did and was so happy.
"Thank you, Tim!" his mom said. "I was wrong about the tape. It was not spoiled after all." Tim smiled and was glad he could help his mom.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to play outside. It was a wet day, and there were puddles everywhere. Tim liked to jump in the puddles and make a big splash.
Tim saw his friend, Sue, with her new brush. Sue loved her brush because it was pink and had soft bristles. Tim wanted to try the brush, but Sue said, "No, you can't. It's my brush."
Tim was sad and angry. He wanted to use the brush, but Sue wouldn't let him. So, Tim grabbed the brush and tried to take it away from Sue. They both pulled on the brush, and it broke in half.
Sue cried, and Tim felt bad. He said, "I'm sorry I broke your brush." Sue said, "It's okay. Let's be friends again." They both agreed to share their toys from now on, so they wouldn't break anything else.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the garden with her friends. One day, she found a fragile, tiny thing hidden under a big rock. Lily was very curious, so she decided to reveal what it was.
Under the rock, Lily found a small blueberry plant. It was so little and needed help to grow. Lily was very happy and wanted to take care of the blueberry plant. She gave it water and sunshine every day. She talked to it and sang songs to make it feel loved.
As the days went by, the fragile blueberry plant grew bigger and stronger. It had many pretty green leaves and soon, it had lots of yummy blueberries. Lily was so proud of her plant. She picked the blueberries and shared them with her friends. They all loved the sweet taste and had a great time eating them together. And that's how Lily and her friends enjoyed a summer full of fun and yummy blueberries.

Sam and Lily went to the zoo with Mom and Dad. They saw many animals, like lions, monkeys, and birds. But Sam and Lily wanted to see the seals. They liked how they jumped and splashed in the water.
"Can we go to the seals now?" Sam asked.
"OK, let's go," Mom said. "But first, we have to quit the snack. Put your cups and wrappers in the bin."
Sam and Lily did as Mom said. They were glad to go to the seals. They ran to the pool where the seals were. They saw one seal with a ball on its nose. It tossed the ball in the air and caught it again.
"Wow, look at that seal!" Lily said. "It is so smart and funny!"
"Can we play with the seal?" Sam asked.
"No, we can't," Dad said. "The seal is not a toy. It is a wild animal. We can only watch and enjoy."
Sam and Lily nodded. They understood. They clapped and cheered for the seal. The seal seemed to like them too. It waved its flipper and made a loud noise.
"Hello, seal!" Sam and Lily said. "We are happy to see you!"
The seal smiled and threw the ball again. Sam and Lily smiled too. They had a lot of fun at the zoo.

Once upon a time, there was a strong boy named Tim. He liked to play outside in the cold. One day, he saw a big ice block. He wanted to touch it.
Tim put his hand on the ice block and said, "Wow, this is so cold! It feels like it could freeze my whole body!" Just then, his little sister, Sue, came running over. She was curious and wanted to touch the ice block too. But when Sue touched the ice block, her lip got stuck to it!
Tim tried to help Sue, but he didn't know what to do. Then, a nice bird flew over to them. The bird said, "I can help you both. Just hold my wings and we will fly up. The warm sun will make the ice block melt." So, Tim and Sue held onto the bird's wings and they all flew up into the sky.
As they flew higher, the sun began to melt the ice block. Sue's lip was free! Tim and Sue thanked the bird and they all flew back down to the ground. From that day on, Tim and Sue were more careful when playing outside in the cold. They never forgot their new bird friend who saved the day.

One day, a little girl named Lily went to the park. She saw her friend Tom. Lily wanted to play with Tom, so she said, "Let's skip and play!" Tom had a big smile on his face. They started to skip and play together.
But then, Tom became stubborn. He wanted to play his way and not share. Lily was sad and asked, "Can we play together and share?" Tom said, "No, I want to play my way!" This made Lily very upset.
Lily decided to go home because Tom was not nice. On her way home, she met a new friend named Sam. They played and shared together. Tom saw them and was sad because he was alone. The moral of the story is to always share and be kind to your friends.

One day, a little dog named Max went for a walk. He saw a big cone on the ground. It was different from the other things he saw. Max was curious and wanted to play with the cone.
Max tried to move the cone with his nose. It rolled and he chased after it. He was having so much fun! "Woof, woof!" he barked, as he played with the cone.
Soon, his friend, a cat named Luna, came to play too. They took turns moving the cone and chasing after it. They played until they were tired. Max and Luna were happy they found the different cone to play with.

Once upon a time, there was a sad little bird. The bird lived in a chimney on top of a house. The bird was sad because it had no friends.
One day, a little girl named Emma saw the sad bird. She wanted to help the bird be happy. Emma thought, "I will bring the bird a gift."
Emma found a pretty flower and said, "Bird, I bring you this flower to make you happy. Will you be my friend?" The bird looked at the flower and chirped happily. It was not sad anymore.
The bird and Emma became very good friends. They played together every day. The bird was happy to have a friend who cared, and the chimney became a home full of joy.

Once upon a time, there was a little train. The train liked to go on the track. One day, the train saw a different track. The train wanted to try the new track.
The train met a big truck near the different track. The truck said, "Hi, little train! Do you want to mix with me and try the new track?" The train said, "Yes! Let's mix and try the different track together!"
So, the little train and the big truck mixed and went on the new track. They had a lot of fun. They went up and down, and around and around. The little train was happy to try the different track with the big truck. And they became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little mixer named Mixie. Mixie was a very brave mixer. She loved to zoom around the kitchen, helping everyone she could.
One day, Mixie saw a big bowl of cake mix. She wanted to help mix it up. So, she went over to the bowl and started to mix. As she mixed, she began to zoom faster and faster. The cake mix was getting nice and smooth.
Just then, a little boy named Timmy walked into the kitchen. He saw Mixie zooming around the bowl. "Wow, Mixie! You're so brave and fast," Timmy said with a big smile. Mixie felt very happy and proud. She knew she was a helpful and brave mixer. And from that day on, Mixie and Timmy became the best of friends, zooming around the kitchen and making many tasty treats together.

One day, a boy named Tim wanted to play a game. He thought of a cool game with his friend, Sue. They wanted to decorate their playroom and make it look fun.
Tim said, "Let's play a game. We can decorate the room with fun things!" Sue was excited and said, "Yes, let's do it!" They found pretty things like paper, crayons, and stickers. They started to make the room look nice.
As they played the game, they found a big box. Tim said, "What's in the box? Maybe it's a surprise!" They opened it and found more fun things to decorate the room. They laughed and had a great time. The room looked amazing, and they were happy they played the cool game.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. He loved to play sport. His favorite sport was to swim in the deep water. One day, Tim went to the park to play with his friends.
As they played, they saw a big pool of water. Tim was excited and wanted to swim. He jumped in the deep water. But something unexpected happened. The water was not real water. It was blue jelly!
Tim's friends laughed and helped him out of the jelly. They all had fun playing in the blue jelly. The deep water was not real, but they still had a great day at the park. And from that day on, Tim always checked if the water was real before he jumped in.

Robot was very selfish. He never wanted to share his toys with his friends. One day, Robot was feeling bored. He wanted to do something fun.
He decided to go to the library to read some books. When Robot stepped into the library, he saw lots of books and some of his friends. Robot said hello to them but they didn't answer.
Robot felt sad. He thought they were mad at him because he was so selfish. Then one of his friends said, "Hey Robot, why don't you join us and read together?".
Robot was surprised. He smiled and said yes. So, Robot and his friends sat down together and read some books. Robot was so happy to spend time with his friends. From then on, Robot made sure to always be kind and share with his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a pretty bird named Betty. Betty loved to whistle. She would whistle all day long. Her whistle was very nice to hear. Her friends liked it too.
One day, Betty had to do some work. She had to build a nest. She found sticks and leaves to make her nest. It was hard work, but Betty kept whistling while she worked. Her friends came to help her. They all worked together.
When the nest was done, it was very attractive. All the other birds liked it. They said, "Betty, your nest is so nice!" Betty was happy. She whistled a happy song. Her friends joined her, and they all whistled together.

One day, it started to rain. A little girl named Amy was sad because she wanted to play outside. She looked out the window and saw a small, wet piece of paper on the ground. Amy felt sorry for the paper because it was all wet and dirty.
Amy put on her rain boots and coat. She ran outside to get the wet piece of paper. She brought it inside and dried it off with a towel. The piece of paper was very happy to be warm and dry.
Amy drew a big, happy face on the paper. She hung it on her wall to remember the day she helped the sorry, wet piece of paper. Now, every time it rains, Amy looks at the happy face and smiles.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a boy named Tom. Tom liked to throw a red ball. He would throw the ball up and down, left and right. Tom felt a lot of wonder when he played with his ball.
One sunny day, Tom went to the park with his ball. He saw a poor dog with no home. The dog looked sad and hungry. Tom felt bad for the dog and wanted to play with it. He thought maybe the dog would feel better if they played together.
Tom started to throw the ball for the dog to catch. The dog was happy and ran fast to get the ball. But then, Tom threw the ball too hard. The ball went far, far away. The dog ran after it but did not come back. Tom was sad and now he had no ball and no new friend.

Tom likes to test things. He likes to see what happens when he does something. He likes to learn new things.
One day, Tom finds a big board in his room. The board is white and has many colors on it. Tom wonders what the board is for. He picks up a color and draws on the board. He makes a circle, a square, and a star. He likes how the colors look on the board.
But then, Tom sees a button on the board. He does not know what the button does. He wants to test it. He pushes the button and waits. He hears a sound and sees the board change. All his colors are gone. The board is white again.
Tom is surprised. He does not like that his colors are gone. He wants them back. He pushes the button again and again. But nothing happens. The board stays white.
Tom is sad. He thinks he broke the board. He does not want to test things anymore. He puts the board away and goes to play with his toys. He hopes the board will have colors again. He likes colors.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a thief. The thief liked to take things that were not his. One day, he saw a big, red ball in a yard. He wanted the ball, so he took it.
A little girl saw the thief take her ball. She was sad and wanted her ball back. She told her big brother about the thief. The big brother wanted to help his sister, so they made a plan to catch the thief.
The brother and sister hid behind a bush and waited for the thief to come back. When they saw the thief, they jumped out to catch him. But the thief was too fast. He ran away, and they could not catch him. The brother and sister were embarrassed and sad. They never got the big, red ball back, and the thief kept taking things from the town.

One day, a dog named Max went to the park with his friend, a cat named Lucy. Max was a patient dog, always waiting for Lucy when she took her time. At the park, they saw a new animal friend. Max said, "Lucy, let's introduce ourselves."
Lucy and Max went to the new animal and said, "Hi, we are Max and Lucy. Who are you?" The new animal said, "I am Sam, a soft bunny." They felt Sam's fur and noticed the texture was very soft and nice.
