Max, Lucy, and Sam played together all day. They had a lot of fun. Then, suddenly, Sam jumped very high and flew into the sky. Max and Lucy were surprised. Sam was not just a bunny, but a magic bunny! They learned that being patient and making new friends can lead to fun and unexpected surprises.

Once upon a time, in a big garden, there was a pretty rose. The rose was very happy because it could grow fast. All the other flowers in the garden loved the rose because it was so nice.
One day, a little girl came to the garden. She saw the rose and wanted to take it home. But the rose did not want to go. It wanted to stay in the garden with its friends. So, the rose thought of a way to delay the girl. It asked the girl to play a game of hide and seek. The girl agreed and started to count.
The rose hid very well, and the girl could not find it. She looked and looked, but the rose was too good at hiding. The girl started to feel tired and sad. The rose felt bad for the girl and decided to come out of hiding. The girl was happy to see the rose again. They both learned that it is not nice to take things away from their friends. The girl let the rose stay in the garden, and they became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a helpful dog named Binky. Binky loved to celebrate with his friends. One day, Binky and his friends wanted to see an opera.
At the opera, they saw people sing and dance. Binky and his friends clapped and had fun. They liked the opera a lot. 
After the opera, Binky and his friends went home. They were happy and tired. They talked about the opera and how helpful Binky was. They all went to sleep, dreaming of the next time they could celebrate together.

One day, Tim and his mom went to the train station. Tim was very glad. He loved trains. He wanted to see the big engine. Mom said, "The train will be here soon."
A man near them said, "I disagree. The train is late." Tim was sad. He wanted the train to come now. But then, something unexpected happened. A big, red fire truck drove by the station. The fire truck had a big engine too.
Tim looked at the fire truck and smiled. He said, "Mom, I like the fire truck's engine too!" Mom laughed and said, "I'm glad you do, Tim. Let's watch the fire truck go by while we wait for the train."

Anna and Ben are playing hide and seek. Anna counts to ten and then says, "Ready or not, here I come!" She starts to search for Ben in the house. She looks under the bed, behind the sofa, and in the closet. But she cannot find him.
She goes to the kitchen and sees a big box. She thinks, "Maybe Ben is hiding in the box." She opens the box and sees a lot of toys. She says, "Wow, this is a fun place!" She starts to play with the toys and forgets about Ben.
Ben hears Anna playing in the kitchen. He thinks, "She found me!" He comes out of his hiding place, which is the bathtub. He runs to the kitchen and says, "Boo!" He scares Anna and makes her jump.
Anna sees Ben and says, "You are a good hider, Ben! You were in the bathtub?" Ben nods and says, "Yes, I was. You are a good seeker, Anna! You were fast!" Anna smiles and says, "Thank you, Ben! You are a good friend!"
They hug and decide to play again. They take turns hiding and seeking in different places. They have a lot of fun.

Lily and Ben were playing in the kitchen. They saw a huge jar on the shelf. It was full of cookies. They wanted some cookies.
"Let's get the jar," Ben said. "We can have a snack."
"Okay," Lily said. "But how do we reach it?"
Ben had an idea. He got a chair and climbed on it. He stretched his arm to get the jar. But the jar was too far. He pushed the chair closer to the shelf. He tried again.
"Be careful, Ben," Lily said. "The jar might fall."
Ben did not listen. He wanted the cookies. He pulled the jar hard. But the jar did not yield. It was stuck. Ben pulled harder. The jar wobbled. Then it fell.
CRASH!
The jar broke on the floor. Cookies and glass flew everywhere. Lily and Ben were scared. They heard footsteps. Mom was coming.
"What happened here?" Mom asked. She saw the mess. She was angry.
"Ben tried to get the jar," Lily said. "But it did not yield. It fell and broke."
"Ben, that was very naughty," Mom said. "You could have hurt yourself or Lily. You should have asked me for help. And you should not take things without permission."
"I'm sorry, Mom," Ben said. He felt bad. He liked cookies, but he did not like to make Mom angry.
Mom sighed. She got a broom and a dustpan. She cleaned up the mess. She threw away the broken jar and the cookies.
"Next time, if you want a snack, just ask me," Mom said. "I have some fresh fruit for you. Do you want some?"
"Yes, please," Lily and Ben said. They followed Mom to the table. They ate some fruit. They said sorry to Mom again. Mom hugged them. She was not angry anymore. She loved them.

Once upon a time, there was a clever cat named Tim. Tim loved to visit his friend, Sam the dog. They liked to play and have fun together. One day, Tim went to visit Sam. They decided to have a picnic in the park.
Tim and Sam looked at the menu of food they could eat. The menu had yummy things like apples, cheese, and bread. They picked their favorite food and put it in a big basket. Tim and Sam were excited to eat at the park.
At the park, they found a nice spot under a big tree. They ate their food and played games. Tim and Sam were happy to spend time together. After a fun day, they went back home. They couldn't wait for their next visit and adventure.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue had a big closet in her room. She loved to play with her toys and put them in the closet when she was done.
One day, Sue could not find her favorite toy, a small, soft bear. She looked everywhere, but she could not find it. Sue felt bad and started to cry. Her mom heard her and came into the room. "What's wrong, Sue?" her mom asked.
"I can't find my bear!" Sue said, still crying. Her mom hugged her and said, "Let's settle down and look together." They looked in the closet and found the bear hiding under a pile of clothes. Sue was happy again, and they both laughed. From that day on, Sue always put her toys away nicely in the closet.

Once upon a time, there was a pretty flower. The flower was red and yellow. It lived in a big garden with many other flowers.
One day, the sun came out. The pretty flower wanted to display its colors for everyone to see. So, it opened its petals wide and stood tall in the garden.
All the other flowers saw the pretty flower display its colors. They thought it was very nice. They all wanted to be like the pretty flower. So, they opened their petals too. The garden was full of pretty flowers displaying their colors. Everyone was happy.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park. He saw a big, hairy dog. The dog was very nice and wanted to play. Tim and the dog played with a ball. They had a lot of fun.
Tim saw a toy car on the ground. He picked it up and said, "Zoom!" The toy car went very fast. The dog ran after the car, and Tim laughed. They played with the toy car for a long time.
After playing, Tim and the dog were tired. They sat under a tree. Tim gave the dog a tip of his ice cream. The dog was happy. Tim and the hairy dog became good friends.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They had a fun time playing with a ball and running around. After a while, they got hungry and decided to eat the sandwiches and sauce that Tim's mom had made.
"Mom, can I have some sauce with my sandwich?" asked Tim. "Of course, here you go," said his mom as she gave him the cold sauce. Tim liked the cold sauce because it made his sandwich taste better.
Just then, a squirrel came and took Tim's sandwich with the cold sauce. Tim was sad, but his mom said, "Don't worry, we can accept that the squirrel was hungry too." Tim smiled and they continued to play at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play outside in the sun. One day, he saw a small box on the ground. It was a surprise! He picked it up and opened it. Inside the box, he found a clean, shiny toy car. Tim was very happy.
Tim played with the car all day. He shared his surprise with his friends. They all loved the clean, shiny toy car too. They took turns playing with it. Tim felt good sharing his surprise with his friends.
As the sun went down, Tim and his friends put the car back in the box. They put the box back on the ground where Tim found it. The next day, another child found the surprise box and was happy too. The surprise box taught everyone that sharing can make everyone happy.

Once upon a time, in a normal town, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to have fun with her friends. They would play games, laugh, and sing songs together. Lily was very happy.
One day, Lily started to worry. She thought her friends didn't want to play with her anymore. She felt sad and didn't know what to do. She sat under a big tree and cried.
Lily's mom saw her crying and asked, "Why are you sad, Lily?" Lily told her mom about her worry. Her mom gave her a big hug and said, "Don't worry, Lily. Your friends still like you. Go and have fun with them." Lily smiled, wiped her tears, and went to play with her friends. They all had a lot of fun together, just like normal.

One day, a cheerful girl named Lucy was playing outside. She saw her mom doing laundry. Lucy wanted to help, so she picked up a shirt and tried to put it on the line. As she did, she felt a pinch on her finger. "Ow!" she yelled.
Her mom came over and asked, "What happened, Lucy?" Lucy showed her finger and said, "I got a pinch, Mom!" Her mom looked and saw a little green bug on the shirt. "That's a friendly bug, Lucy. It didn't mean to pinch you," her mom said.
Lucy looked at the bug and decided to be friends with it. She named the bug Pinchy. They played together while her mom finished the laundry. Suddenly, Pinchy started to change. Lucy was surprised when Pinchy turned into a beautiful butterfly! Pinchy had been a caterpillar all along. Lucy and her mom watched as Pinchy the butterfly flew away, happy to have made a new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Kate. She was only three years old. She loved to skip everywhere she went. It made her feel so happy! One day, Kate was skipping through a field of hay. It was so nice and soft. Suddenly she started to giggle and couldn't stop. She was embarrassed when her mom saw her and started laughing too. But she didn't mind, it was just too much fun! They stayed there for a while, skipping and laughing together. It was the best day ever!

One day, a little girl named Amy was very excited. She was going to see a show with her mom and dad. They all got in the car and drove to the big building where the show was.
When they got there, they sat down in big chairs. Amy saw a big curtain on the stage. She was so excited to see what was behind it. She held her mom's hand and waited for the show to start.
The curtain opened and the show began. There were people singing and dancing. One man was so loud, he shouted when he sang. Amy laughed and clapped her hands. She loved the show and had a great time with her mom and dad.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a bald bird named Billy. Billy was sad because he could not fly like the other birds. He tried and tried, but he always fell to the ground. One day, Billy saw a big tree with a nest on top. He wanted to get to the nest to see what was inside.
Billy had an idea. He asked his friend, a kind squirrel named Sammy, to help him get to the nest. Sammy agreed and started to climb the tree. When they got to the nest, they saw a big egg inside. Billy was very happy and wanted to stay with the egg.
The egg started to crack and a baby bird came out. The baby bird had no feathers, just like Billy. They became best friends and played on the ground together. Soon, they learned that they were both bald because they were a special kind of bird that could not fly. Instead, they could run very fast.
Billy and the baby bird raced through the forest, happy that they could run so fast. The other birds watched and cheered for them. In the end, Billy learned that being different is not bad. It can be special and fun, too. And the moral of the story is that everyone has something special about them, even if it is not what we expect.

Once upon a time, there was a creative little girl named Lucy. She loved to make things with her hands. One day, Lucy found a piece of cloth and some thread. She had an idea!
Lucy asked her mom, "Can you teach me how to make a stitch?" Her mom smiled and said, "Of course! I will show you how to make a stitch, and you can make something beautiful." Lucy was very happy.
Lucy's mom suggested that they make a pretty dress for Lucy's doll. They worked together, making many stitches. The dress was very colorful and pretty. Lucy was proud of her work, and her doll looked lovely in the new dress.

Once upon a time, in a mighty big forest, there lived a tiny mouse named Mimi. Mimi liked to play with her friends under the big trees. They ran, jumped, and turned around all day long.
One day, Mimi met a big lion named Leo. Leo was sad. "Why are you sad, Leo?" asked Mimi. "I can't turn around fast like you," said Leo. "I want to play with you and your friends, but I am too big and slow."
Mimi had an idea. "Let's try a new game, Leo," she said. "You can be the big tree, and we will run around you!" Leo liked the idea. So, Mimi and her friends ran and turned around Leo, and he felt happy.
From that day on, Mimi, Leo, and their friends played together under the mighty trees. They learned that big or small, fast or slow, they could all have fun together.

Once upon a time, there was a funny volcano. The funny volcano could talk and laugh. One day, a little boy named Tim came to visit the funny volcano.
"Hello, funny volcano!" said Tim. "Can I drink some water from the river near you?" The funny volcano laughed and said, "Yes, Tim, you can drink the water, but be careful not to drink too much!"
Tim was having fun, but he did not listen to the funny volcano's warning. He drank and drank and drank from the river. The funny volcano started to look worried.
As Tim drank more and more water, he began to feel sick. The funny volcano said, "I told you not to drink too much, Tim!" But it was too late. Tim felt very sick, and he could not play with the funny volcano anymore. The funny volcano was sad, and Tim learned a lesson about listening to his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little ant named Andy. Andy lived in a big, rough hill with his family. The hill was rough, but it was their home. They loved their home very much.
One day, Andy wanted to play outside. He asked his mom, "Mom, can you let me play outside?" His mom said, "Yes, Andy, I will let you play outside. But be careful and don't go too far away from the hill."
Andy was so happy! He went outside and started to play. He saw a big rock and a small stick. He played with the rock and the stick for a long time. He had so much fun.
After playing for a while, Andy felt tired. He said, "I want to go back to my rough hill now." So, he walked back to his home. His mom saw him and said, "I'm glad you had fun outside, Andy."
From that day on, Andy's mom would always let him play outside. Andy loved his rough hill and his family. They all lived happily ever after.

Anna and Ben are going on a trip with their mum and dad. They are very excited to see the big aeroplane that will take them to the beach. They pack their bags with toys, books and clothes. They say goodbye to their grandma and grandpa, who will look after their dog, Spot.
At the airport, they wait in a long line to show their tickets and passports. Anna and Ben are careful to hold their mum's and dad's hands, so they don't get lost. They see many people with different bags and clothes. They hear many noises, like loudspeakers, carts and engines.
"Look, there's our aeroplane!" Ben says, pointing to a big white and blue plane with a red tail. "It's so big and shiny!"
"Wow, it's amazing!" Anna says. "Can we go inside now?"
"Yes, we can, but we have to wait for our turn," their dad says. "When we get inside, we have to find our seats and buckle our seatbelts. Then the aeroplane will go very fast and fly up in the sky."
Anna and Ben are a little nervous, but also curious. They follow their mum and dad inside the aeroplane. They find their seats and put their bags under the seats. They buckle their seatbelts and listen to the lady who tells them what to do in case of an emergency.
"Are you ready for take-off?" their mum asks them.
"Yes, we are!" Anna and Ben say together.
The aeroplane starts to move and then goes faster and faster. Anna and Ben feel a push in their backs and their ears pop. They look out of the window and see the ground getting smaller and smaller. They see clouds and birds and the sun.
"Wow, we're flying!" Anna says.
"It's like a dream!" Ben says.
They play with their toys and books for a while. They eat some snacks and drink some juice. They talk to their mum and dad and ask them questions about the beach. They are very happy.
After a while, they start to feel tired. Their eyes get heavy and their heads get sleepy. They cuddle with their mum and dad and close their eyes.
"Good night, Anna," their mum says.
"Good night, Ben," their dad says.
"Good night, mum and dad," Anna and Ben say.
They sleep and dream of the beach. They don't hear the aeroplane landing or the people getting off. They only wake up when their mum and dad gently shake them and say:
"Welcome to the beach, Anna and Ben! We're here!"

Once upon a time, there was a mummy and a daddy who loved to gather yummy things. One day, mummy and daddy wanted to go on an adventure out into the forest. 
As they walked, mummy and daddy gathered yummy fruits and nuts. They shared them and said that they were so tasty! All of a sudden, daddy shouted, "Look! I see a flame! Let's go over and see!" 
When mummy and daddy reached the flame, it was so warm and cozy. They went over and gathered up more yummy fruits and nuts. They decided that this was the best place to take a break from the adventure. 
Mummy said, "What a wonderful place! We should gather even more and have yummy snacks!" Daddy agreed and they both laughed as they gathered and ate their tasty snacks. They were having so much fun! 
"We should come back here next time!" exclaimed mummy. Daddy smiled and said, "Of course! This is a great place to gather yummy things!" 
And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a fancy cat named Tom. Tom loved to play with his toy, a small bag of powder. One day, Tom saw a group of ants. The ants were marching in a long line.
Tom thought it would be fun to join the ants. So, he put down his powder and started to march with the ants. They marched up and down, left and right, all around the yard.
After a while, Tom got tired of marching. He went back to his powder and played with it. The ants kept marching, and Tom watched them go. He was happy to have had a fun day with his new friends.

Once upon a time there was a wise bear who lived deep in the woods. One day, he decided to take a walk through the forest. As he was walking, he came across a small cottage. He thought to himself, "I wonder who lives here?".
The bear knocked on the cottage door and an old lady appeared. She had bright eyes and a big smile on her face.
The bear asked the old lady, "What is this place?". She smiled and said, "This is my home! Would you like a treat?". The bear smiled back and said, "Yes, please!".
The old lady gave the bear a big bowl of honey and said, "Thank you for visiting". The bear said, "This seems like a nice place. I'm glad I stopped here".
The old lady smiled and said, "You are very wise. Come back anytime for a treat". The bear thanked her and said goodbye.
He felt happy as he walked through the forest. He knew he had learned something important from his visit to the old lady's cottage.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a kind boy named Tim. Tim loved to help people. One day, he found an orange on the ground. The orange was very sad because it was not with its family.
Tim wanted to make the orange happy. He thought and thought, and then he had an idea. He would restore the orange to its family. He picked up the orange and started to look for its family.
Tim walked and walked, and finally, he found the orange tree. The tree was very happy to see the orange. Tim put the orange back with its family, and they all were happy again. The orange thanked Tim for being so kind. And from that day on, Tim and the orange became good friends.

Tom and Lily were playing in the garden. They had a big bucket of sand and some toy cars. They made a road with the sand and drove the cars on it. They had fun making noises and pretending to go fast.
Then they saw a big worm in the sand. It was brown and wiggly. Tom and Lily were curious. They picked up the worm and looked at it. They wondered what it was doing in the sand.
"Maybe it is looking for food," Tom said.
"Maybe it is hungry," Lily said.
They decided to help the worm. They looked around the garden for something tasty. They saw some apples on a tree. They picked one and broke it in half. They gave one half to the worm and kept the other half for themselves.
The worm was happy. It ate the apple and thanked Tom and Lily. It said it was full and sleepy. It asked them to bury it in the sand so it could rest.
Tom and Lily were kind. They dug a hole in the sand and put the worm in it. They covered it with more sand and patted it gently. They said goodbye to the worm and wished it sweet dreams.
Then they ate their apple and played some more. They had a good day in the garden.

Once upon a time, there was a green kayak. The kayak belonged to a young boy named Jack. One day, Jack was out playing in the park, and he decided to poke the kayak. Jack thought it would be funny to poke the kayak, but soon he found himself pushing the kayak harder and harder.
Soon the kayak started to roll away. Jack chased the kayak and before he knew it, the kayak was floating down the river! Jack couldn't reach it in time, and with each wave, the kayak went further and further away.
Jack felt very sad. He had lost his green kayak, and he didn't know what to do. He had to say goodbye to his green kayak, and he never saw it again.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max was a restless dog who loved to play all day. He liked to run, jump, and make a lot of noise. Max was always happy and had a big smile on his face.
One day, Max went to the park with his best friend, a little girl named Lucy. They played together, making lots of noise and having fun. Lucy was happy to see Max's big smile, and she smiled back at him. They played and played until the sun went down.
When it was time to go home, Max and Lucy were very tired. They walked back to their house, still smiling and making little noises. As they got ready for bed, Max and Lucy knew they had a great day. They fell asleep, dreaming of more fun days together.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a big party. Everyone was happy and excited. They all wanted to hear jazz music. Jazz was important to them, because it made them want to dance and have fun.
One day, a new friend named Tom came to the town. Tom loved jazz music too. So, he decided to play jazz for everyone at the party. Tom played the drums, and all the people danced and clapped their hands. They were very happy that Tom had come to their town.
At the end of the party, everyone thanked Tom for the fun jazz music. They told him how important it was to have him there. Tom was happy that he had come to the town and made new friends. They all promised to have more parties with jazz music and dancing.

One day, a little boat named Bob wanted to sail. Bob was very alert and saw a pin on the ground. He picked up the pin and said, "I will take this pin with me on my trip."
Bob went to the water and started to sail. He met a big fish named Tom. Tom said, "Hi Bob! What is that in your hand?" Bob said, "This is a pin I found. I am taking it with me on my trip."
Tom said, "Can I come with you?" Bob said, "Yes, we will have fun together!" So, Bob and Tom sailed away. They were happy and alert, looking for more fun things to find on their trip.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to play with dough. She had many colors of dough to make fun things.
One day, Lily's mom said, "Lily, I have an important job for you. Can you remind me to buy more dough at the store later?" Lily was excited and said, "Yes, Mommy! I will remind you!"
When it was time to go to the store, Lily remembered her important job. She said, "Mommy, don't forget to buy more dough!" Her mom smiled and said, "Thank you, Lily, for reminding me."
At the store, Lily and her mom bought more dough in many colors. They went home and made lots of fun things with the new dough. Lily was happy that she could help her mom with an important job.

One day, a girl named Amy wanted to create a big fort. She found a table and put a soft blanket over it. Now, she had a fun place to play under.
Amy was ready to play in her new fort. She brought her toys and friends inside. They had a lot of fun playing games and telling stories.
But then, something unexpected happened. A big dog came and pulled the blanket off the table. The fort was gone! Amy and her friends were sad. But the dog was happy, because now he had a new, soft blanket to sleep on. Amy and her friends decided to create a new fort using chairs, and they let the dog keep the blanket.

Jill and Jack were playing in the park. It was a sunny day and the sun was shining on them. Jill clapped her hands and said, "Look at the desk!"
Jack looked at the desk and said, "Wow, it looks so cool!"
Jill smiled and said, "Let's have a race around the park. I'll go first!" Jill ran around the park laughing and clapped her hands loudly when she made it back to the desk.
Jack followed behind her, but it had gotten colder. He stopped and said, "My hands are so icy!"
Jill laughed and said, "Don't worry! We can finish the race later. Let's just clap our hands to keep warm."
So they did. Together they clapped their hands and laughed as they felt the warmth coming back to them. Finally, they finished their race together and hugged to celebrate.

Ben and Lily went to the zoo with Mom and Dad. They saw many animals, like lions, monkeys, and birds. But Ben and Lily wanted to see the gorilla most of all. They ran to the gorilla house and looked for the big, black, hairy animal.
"Where is the gorilla?" Ben asked.
"Maybe he is hiding," Lily said.
They looked and looked, but they could not see the gorilla. They felt sad and bored. They wanted to see the gorilla do something fun, like swing, jump, or roar.
Then, they heard a loud noise. They turned around and saw a big, orange, furry animal. It was not a gorilla, but a tiger. The tiger had escaped from his cage and was looking for food. He saw Ben and Lily and licked his lips.
"Run!" Mom and Dad shouted.
Ben and Lily were scared. They ran to Mom and Dad and hugged them. Mom and Dad took them to a safe place. The zoo workers came and caught the tiger. They put him back in his cage.
"Are you okay?" Mom and Dad asked.
"Yes, we are okay," Ben and Lily said.
"But we did not see the gorilla," Ben said.
"Maybe next time," Mom said.
"Or maybe we can see a different animal," Lily said.
"Like what?" Ben asked.
"Like a panda, or a penguin, or a kangaroo," Lily said.
Ben and Lily smiled. They still wanted to see the gorilla, but they were happy to see other animals too. They had a fun day at the zoo. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She loved to eat soup. Her mom made the best soup in town. One day, her mom made a new kind of soup. It was a spicy soup. Amy had never tried spicy food before.
Amy's mom told her to try the spicy soup. At first, Amy was scared. She thought it would be too hot. But her mom said, "If you try new things, you might find something you love." So Amy took a little bite of the spicy soup.
At first, it was hot in her mouth. But then, Amy started to like it. She ate more and more of the spicy soup. She loved it! Amy learned that trying new things can be good. From that day on, she was not scared to try new things. And she always loved her mom's spicy soup.

Once upon a time, there was a lively boy called Jack. He lived in a big house with lots of rooms. Every day, he watched out of the window and dreamed of playing in the garden.
On sunny day, Jack's mum said to him: "Can you go to the bathroom, Jack?" Jack said yes and ran to the door. But his mum said: "No, Jack, I don't permit you to go alone. I must come with you."
So Jack's mum came with him and they went to the bathroom. It was a very lively room with lots of colourful tiles. Jack looked around and smiled. Then his mum said: "OK Jack, you may go and play outside now."
Jack said: "Thank you, mum" and ran happily outside. Outside the garden was full of brightly-coloured flowers and buzzing bees. Jack saw a butterfly and chased it until he was too tired to run anymore. Then he flopped down onto the grass and smiled. It had been a very lively day!

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a helpful girl named Sally. Sally liked to help her mom and dad with many things. One day, Sally's mom asked her to prepare her little brother's clothes for the next day.
Sally went to her brother's room and saw many clothes on the floor. She picked up a blue shirt and red pants. Sally said, "These will look nice on my brother!" She took a hanger from the closet and hung the clothes on it. She was very proud of her work.
The next morning, Sally's brother saw the clothes on the hanger. He smiled and said, "Thank you, Sally, for being so helpful!" Sally felt happy that she could help her family. From that day on, Sally always helped her mom and dad with many things, and they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to play with his toy cars outside on the ground. One sunny day, he took his cars out to race them on the ground.
As he was playing, Tim saw a big, red apple on the ground. He picked it up and thought it looked delicious. He took a big bite and it was so yummy. Tim smiled and continued to play with his cars.
Then, Tim had an idea. He decided to match his cars with fruits. He found a yellow banana to match his yellow car, a green pear to match his green car, and a purple grape to match his purple car. Tim was so happy with his matching game that he played all day, eating the delicious fruits and racing his cars on the ground.

One day, a little girl named Mia found a small bird with a hurt wing in her yard. The bird could not fly, so Mia wanted to help it heal. She took the bird inside her house and put it in a box with a soft cloth.
Mia's mom saw what she was doing and said, "That's very impressive, Mia. You are a kind and caring girl." Mia smiled and said, "Thank you, Mom. I want to help the bird get better."
Every day, Mia gave the bird food and water. She also changed the cloth in the box to keep it clean. Mia even gave the bird some of her doll's clothes to keep it warm. Slowly, the bird's wing healed, and it could fly again. Mia was so happy to see the bird fly away, and she knew she had done a good thing.

Once upon a time, there was a child who loved to explore the world around them. One day, the child was in a large, comfortable field and noticed a special spirit. The spirit was small and seemed lonely, so the child waved hello to it. 
The spirit was so happy; it flew around the child singing and giving away hugs. The child felt so excited that they wanted to keep visiting the spirit and share its joys.
So, every morning the child would come back to the same field and the same spirit. Then one day, the spirit told the child it needed to send them away. The child felt sad, so they asked the spirit why.
The spirit smiled and said they were no longer alone. There were many other spirits waiting for them, so they needed to be sent to join their new friends. The child hugged the spirit good-bye and promised to come back and visit soon. 
The child was sad at first, but soon realized the spirit had sent them to a new, exciting place. Everywhere the child looked there were spirits dancing around and singing with joy. The child was suddenly filled with a comfortable and warm feeling, knowing that the spirit had sent them somewhere special.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys. One sunny day, Lily decided to play a game with her toys. She wanted to match the objects she had in her toy box.
Lily opened her toy box and saw many colorful objects. There was a red ball, a blue car, and a yellow duck. She took out all the objects and put them on the open floor. Then she started to match them by their colors.
She found a red car and matched it with the red ball. She found a blue ball and matched it with the blue car. And she found a yellow boat and matched it with the yellow duck. Lily was so happy that she matched all the objects. She clapped her hands and laughed. Then, she put all the objects back into the toy box and closed it.

Once upon a time, there was a wise old owl. He lived in a big tree in the forest. He knew many things and all the animals came to him when they had a question.
One day, a little rabbit came to the owl with a question. He asked, "How do I become wise like you?" The owl thought for a moment and then said, "You must do something you regret, so you can learn from it."
The little rabbit did not understand, but he wanted to be wise. So, he went to the river and jumped in, even though he could not swim. He started to sink and was very scared. But then, a big twist happened! A kind turtle saw the rabbit and swam over to help him. The turtle carried the rabbit back to the shore.
The little rabbit was very thankful to the turtle. He went back to the wise owl and told him what happened. The owl smiled and said, "Now you have learned from your regret. You are wiser now." The little rabbit was happy and knew he would never jump into the river again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia was very restless. She always wanted to play and run. One day, Mia's mom told her that if she could improve and be good, she would have a surprise.
Mia tried very hard to improve. She listened to her mom and dad. She played quietly and did not run inside the house. Mia's mom and dad were happy to see her being good.
Then, the big day came. Mia's mom said it was time for the surprise. Mia was so excited! She thought it would be a new toy. But when they opened the door, there was a new baby sister! Mia was so happy to meet her. She knew she would be a great big sister, and they would play together when her sister grew up.

Once upon a time, a boy and his mom went to the beach. The sun was not bright. It was a dull day. The boy felt sad because he wanted to play in the sun. His mom said, "Let's prepare a sand castle."
They started to make the castle. The boy was still sad. Then, something unexpected happened. The sand began to move. The boy and his mom watched in surprise.
Out of the sand came a little crab. The crab wore a hat. The boy laughed. The crab danced and made the boy happy. The dull day at the beach became fun. The boy, his mom, and the crab played all day.

Once upon a time, in a cheerful little town, there lived a curious boy named Tom. Tom loved to wonder about all sorts of things. One sunny day, he saw a big, red ball in the park. "I wonder who this ball belongs to?" he thought.
Tom asked his friend, Sue, for her opinion. "Sue, do you know whose ball this is?" Sue shook her head. "No, Tom. But maybe we can find out!" They decided to ask around the town to see if anyone was missing a big, red ball.
As they walked, they met a sad little girl named Lily. Lily was crying by the swings. Tom and Sue asked her, "Why are you sad, Lily?" Lily sniffed and said, "I lost my big, red ball." Tom smiled and showed her the ball they found. "Is this your ball, Lily?" he asked.
Lily's face lit up. "Yes, that's my ball! Thank you, Tom and Sue!" The three friends played with the ball for the rest of the day. As the sun set, they knew they had made a new friend and had a great adventure. And Tom learned that sometimes, wondering can lead to happy surprises.

One day, Sam and his dad went to the park. The sun was shining brightly and Sam saw a beautiful yellow flower. He asked his dad, "What is this flower?"
His dad smiled and said "This is a sunflower, Sam. It is very useful to us."
Sam was surprised. "What can it do?" he asked.
Dad replied, "It can help us by shining. That's why it's called a sunflower. The yellow color is from the sun. It helps us by giving us light and warmth."
Sam was amazed. He said "The sunflower is so useful! It's amazing that something so small can do so much."
His dad smiled and said "Yes, Sam. It's truly amazing." Sam was glad he was able to learn something new at the park.

Ruby and her mom went to the store. Ruby saw a big candy and asked for it. Mom said she could get it if she was good. Ruby was very good and got the big candy. On the way home, she was so excited that she accidentally tore the candy wrapper. Ruby started to cry and her mom said, "Don't worry! We can get you another one." So, they went back to the store and Ruby got an even bigger candy. She tore the wrapper, bit into the candy, and smiled. She was so happy!

Anna liked to play with her blocks. She had many blocks of different colors and shapes. She liked to build towers and bridges and houses with her blocks. She was very good at making things with her blocks.
One day, Anna wanted to make a big network with her blocks. A network is when many things are connected together. She wanted to connect all her blocks with strings and sticks and make a network that covered her whole room. She thought it would be fun and pretty.
She started to work on her network. She tied strings to her blocks and stuck them to the walls and the ceiling and the floor. She used sticks to make bridges and arches and loops. She used all her blocks and all her strings and all her sticks. She worked very hard and very long.
But Anna did not think about how much her network weighed. Weigh means how heavy something is. Her network was very heavy because it had many blocks and strings and sticks. Her network was too heavy for the walls and the ceiling and the floor. Her network was not regular. Regular means normal or usual.
Soon, her network started to fall apart. The strings snapped and the sticks broke and the blocks crashed. Her network made a big mess and a big noise. Anna was scared and sad. She cried and cried.
Her mom and dad came to see what happened. They saw Anna and her network. They were not happy. They told Anna that she was not careful or smart. They told her that she should not make things that are too heavy or too big or too different. They told her that she should make things that are regular and safe and easy.
Anna felt sorry and ashamed. She said she was sorry and she would not do it again. She helped her mom and dad clean up the mess. She put away her blocks and her strings and her sticks. She learned her lesson.
The moral of the story is: Do not bite off more than you can chew.

Max was walking in the park. He was having a good day. He saw a big bright lollipop and was very excited. He ran to it and sat down. He was so happy he made a loud laugh. He ate the fun lollipop and it was yummy. He looked around and saw lots of other fun things. He saw a swing and hopped off the seat and ran over to it. He sat in the seat and started to swing. Max was having so much fun it was almost too loud to hear. Max kept playing until it was time to go home. He gave the swing a big hug goodbye and ran back to the seat to pick up his lollipop. It was a fun day in the park.

One day, a dog named Sam went for a jog. He liked to run in the park. The sun was up and the sky was blue. Sam was happy.
While jogging, Sam found a big bone. He picked it up and started to chew it. It was very hard. He chewed and chewed. His teeth were strong.
A girl named Lily saw Sam. She said, "Hi, Sam! You are loud when you chew that bone." Sam wagged his tail and smiled. They both played in the park all day long.

Once, there was a little girl named Lucy. Lucy had a wish. She wanted to own a big, red ball. But she was too shy to ask her mom and dad. She felt embarrassed.
One day, Lucy went to the park with her mom. She saw a big, red ball near the swings. Lucy wanted to play with the ball, but she was still too shy to ask. She just watched other kids play with the ball.
Then, a nice boy named Tim saw Lucy looking at the ball. He asked her if she wanted to play with him. Lucy felt happy and not so shy anymore. They played with the big, red ball together. Lucy's wish came true, and she was not embarrassed anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a friendly girl named Sam. She was only 3 years old and was very polite. One day, Sam skipped to the park with her mother. She was so excited to see what kinds of things she would find. As Sam and her mother walked around the park, they noticed a computer in the center.
"Mom, what's a computer?" Sam asked.
"It's a machine that can do lots of things," her mother replied.
Sam's eyes lit up and she started to skip excitedly around the computer.
"Can I play on it?" she asked.
"Yes, but remember to be polite," her mother said.
So Sam politely said "please" and "thank you" each time she did something on the computer. She was having so much fun that she didn't want to leave. After a few hours, her mother said it was time to go and Sam reluctantly skipped home.

One day, a girl named Sue wanted to cook. She went to her bedroom to get her toy pots and pans. Sue was very fit and liked to run around the house.
Sue asked her mom, "Can I cook with you?" Her mom said, "Yes, but we need to go to the store to get some food first." So, they went to the store and bought some food.
When they got home, they started to cook. Suddenly, they heard a loud noise from the bedroom. They ran to see what it was. There was a big mess! Sue's toy pots and pans were all over the floor. Sue's dog, Max, had knocked them over while trying to play. Sue and her mom laughed and cleaned up the mess. Then, they went back to the kitchen and finished cooking their meal together.

Once upon a time, there was a bald man named Bob. He worked at a station. The station had a big number on the wall. The number was five. Bob liked his job at the station.
One day, a mean boy came to the station. He saw the big number on the wall. The boy did not like the number five. He wanted to change it. The boy tried to take the number off the wall. This made Bob sad.
Bob did not want the boy to take the number. He stood in front of the number. The boy tried to push Bob away. But Bob was strong. The boy could not move him. The boy got tired and went away. Bob was happy. The number five stayed on the wall. The station was safe.

Sam was a small boy and he heard a huge noise. He looked around to see where the sound was coming from, but he could not see anything. He was a bit nervous, so he asked his mom what it was. His mom told him it was the truth. Sam was relieved and he asked what that meant.
His mom explained that the truth was like a big promise. It was something that you could always count on no matter what. Sam felt better knowing that the truth was always there, even if he couldn't see it. He said thank you to his mom and went on his way.
From that day on, Sam was never scared of loud noises or unknown things because he knew the truth was always there. No matter what, it was always huge and safe.

John and Joe were best friends. They were 3 years old and loved to play. One day, they decided to play a game. Joe said, "Let's go outside and play a game". John smiled and said, "Yes! That's a great idea". 
They went outside and talked about all the different games they could play. Joe suggested a running race and John thought it was interesting. They started the race, but in the middle, John and Joe stopped. They couldn't help but laugh at their silliness. 
John asked Joe to keep playing the game with him. Joe smiled and said, "Yes, let's play something more interesting". They decided to play hide and seek. They had a lot of fun and laughed every time one of them was caught. 
When the game was over, John and Joe were tired but happy. They looked around and saw the beautiful day they had spent together, playing and laughing.

One day, a boy named Tim went to a food place with his mom. They sat at a table and looked at a menu. The menu had many healthy foods like fruits, veggies, and more. Tim's mom said, "We should eat healthy food today."
While they were waiting for the food, Tim saw a big box near the door. He went to the box and took a peek inside. There was a big cake with lots of colors! Tim was very happy and said, "Mom, look! There is a big cake in the box!"
His mom came over and saw the cake too. She was surprised and said, "Wow! That is a big cake!" Just then, a man came out from the back of the food place. He said, "This cake is for a special party. But we made an extra one. Would you like to have it?"
Tim and his mom were very happy. They took the cake home and ate it after their healthy meal. The big cake was a fun surprise at the end of their day.

Once upon a time, there was a swan. The swan was very thirsty. It wanted to drink some water. The swan looked around for a lake to drink from.
The swan found a lake, but the water was harsh. The water did not taste good. The swan did not want to drink the harsh water. It wanted to find better water to drink.
The swan kept looking and found another lake. This lake had nice water. The swan was happy. It drank the water and was not thirsty anymore. The swan swam in the nice water and played all day.

Pete was very excited. He had just gotten a big box with a present inside. He opened it and saw a mirror. It was so shiny and beautiful. Pete smiled and decided to write on it with a pen. He wrote his name on it. 
Suddenly, something strange happened. It got really hot. He reached out to touch the mirror and he screamed. The mirror was burning him.
Pete's mom rushed in and asked him what happened. He told her the whole story. She shook her head and said, "Pete, you shouldn't have written on the mirror. Now you broke it." Pete's face dropped. He was so sad. He promised to never write on anything ever again.

Anna and Ben were playing in the park. They saw a dove on a tree. The dove was white and pretty. They wanted to touch the dove.
"Hello, dove!" Anna said. "Can we be your friends?"
The dove looked at them and cooed. It did not fly away. Anna and Ben smiled. They walked slowly to the tree.
But then a big dog came. The dog barked and ran to the tree. The dove was scared. It flew away, but the dog jumped and bit its wing. The dove fell to the ground. It was hurt.
"Bad dog! Go away!" Ben shouted. He threw a stick at the dog. The dog ran away.
Anna and Ben ran to the dove. The dove was bleeding. It made a sad sound.
"Oh no, dove! You are hurt!" Anna said. She picked up the dove gently. She hugged it.
"Can we help you, dove?" Ben asked. He looked for a bandage.
The dove looked at them and cooed softly. It understood that they were kind. It felt a little better.
Anna and Ben took the dove to their home. They cleaned its wing and put a bandage on it. They gave it some water and seeds. They made a nest for it.
"Thank you, Anna and Ben," the dove said in its own way. "You are good friends."
Anna and Ben smiled. They were happy to help the dove. They hoped it would heal soon. They loved the dove.

Once upon a time, there was a big box called a computer. The computer was very fair and always told the truth. It lived in a small room with a little boy named Tim.
One day, Tim's mom told him to clean his room. Tim did not want to clean his room, so he asked the computer for help. The computer recommended that Tim should listen to his mom and clean his room. Tim did not want to listen and thought he could trick the computer.
Tim told the computer he would clean his room later, but he wanted to play now. The computer knew Tim was not telling the truth. So, the computer did something unexpected. It turned off, and Tim could not play any games!
Tim was very sad and realized he should have listened to the computer. He cleaned his room, and then the computer turned back on. Tim learned that it is important to be fair and tell the truth, just like the computer.

One day, a boy named Tim had a sack. He put his toys in the sack. He liked to play with his toys. Tim's mom told him the truth. She said, "Tim, we are going to eat sour food today."
Tim did not like sour food. He had a plan. He put the sour food in his sack with his toys. He thought his mom would not find it there.
Later, Tim's mom found the sack. She saw the sour food with the toys. Tim was very sad. But then, his mom said, "I know you do not like sour food. I will make sweet food for you." Tim was happy and learned that telling the truth is better.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his toy gear. One day, Tim's toy gear got very dirty. It was so disgusting that Tim didn't want to touch it.
Tim asked his mom to help him clean the gear. His mom said, "I will send it to the toy doctor to make it clean again." Tim was happy to hear this and waited for the toy doctor to fix his gear.
After a few days, the toy doctor sent the gear back to Tim. It was clean and shiny again! Tim was so happy that he played with his gear all day long. And from that day on, he promised to keep his gear clean and never let it get disgusting again.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a weird toy. The toy was green and had big eyes. Tim loved his toy very much. He called his toy his friend.
One day, Tim and his friend went to play outside. They saw a big rock. Tim wanted to lift the rock. He tried to lift it, but it was too heavy. Tim asked his friend to help him. Together, they tried to lift the rock.
With a little help from his weird friend, Tim could lift the rock. Under the rock, they found a pretty, shiny stone. Tim and his friend were very happy. They took the shiny stone home and played with it all day. From that day on, Tim and his weird friend had even more fun together.

One day, a lively dog named Spot went for a walk. He saw a hedge and wanted to play. Spot ran to the hedge and tried to jump over it. But he could not jump over the hedge. Spot felt sad.
Spot met a small bird named Tweet. Tweet said, "Why are you sad, Spot?" Spot said, "I can't jump over the hedge." Tweet thought for a moment and said, "Maybe you weigh too much. Let's find a way to help you."
Tweet had an idea to help Spot. They found a big balloon. They tied the balloon to Spot, and something unexpected happened. Spot started to float up in the air! Now, Spot could go over the hedge.
Spot felt happy and thanked Tweet. They played together all day and became good friends. From that day on, Spot and Tweet always helped each other when they needed it.

Once there was a fair little girl. Every day she would go outside and have lots of fun. She went to the park and sang songs with her friends. She ate ice cream under the sun. But, one day, she found out something very sad. Her skin was getting dry and rough.
The little girl felt worried, so she asked her mom what to do. Her mom said to get some lotion. She got the lotion and started to wipe it on her dry skin. It felt soothing and felt like it was working.
The girl kept wiping her skin with lotion every day. Then one day, she looked in the mirror and saw something wonderful. Her face was back to being fair like it was before! She smiled and was so happy to have all of her soft skin back.

Once upon a time, there was a wild fish. This fish lived in a big pond. The fish liked to swim all day and play with his friends.
One day, the wild fish felt very tired. He wanted to rest under a big green plant. As he closed his eyes, he saw something big and shiny. The fish was curious, so he swam closer to see what it was.
The big shiny thing was a huge treasure chest. The wild fish was so happy! He called his friends to show them the treasure. But when they opened the chest, they found it was full of yummy fish food. They all laughed and enjoyed the tasty surprise. From that day on, the wild fish and his friends had lots of food to eat and fun times in their big pond.

Once upon a time there was a big rabbit named Bob. Bob had a big, shiny, red nose. Every day he would go into the woods with his friends and they would jump and run around. On one particular day, they heard a loud, strange noise. The friends were scared and stopped what they were doing to investigate.
Bob bravely stepped up towards the noise. He went closer and closer until he could see what was causing the noise. It was a dead bird! Bob felt sad and started to cry.
His friends noticed Bob, and went over to check on him. "What's wrong Bob?" they asked. Bob pointed to the dead bird and said, "The noise disturbed me".
His friends were sad, too. "Let's plant a beautiful sign near the dead bird to remember it," said Bob's friends. They all agreed and when they were finished, they left the woods. Bob's friends were happy that Bob wasn't scared anymore and decided to always remember his big, shiny, red nose.

Once upon a time, there was a little cat named Tom. Tom loved to climb. One sunny day, Tom went outside to play. He saw a big tree and decided to climb it. He climbed up, up, up, until he was very high.
While Tom was in the tree, he saw a big bird. The bird was alert and saw Tom too. The bird flew down and landed under the tree. Tom was curious and wanted to play with the bird.
Tom climbed down the tree carefully. When he got to the bottom, he went under the tree to find the bird. They played together all day long. Tom was so happy to have a new friend. In the end, Tom and the bird went home to rest after a fun day of playing.

Tim and Liz were twins who loved to bounce. They bounced on their beds, on the sofa, on the trampoline, and even on their dad's belly. They bounced so much that their mom called them the bounce twins.
One day, it was very cold and snowy outside. Tim and Liz wanted to bounce, but they could not go out. They were sad and bored. Their mom saw them and had an idea. She said, "Why don't you bounce in the kitchen? I have a surprise for you."
Tim and Liz followed their mom to the kitchen. They saw a big pot on the stove. It was steaming and smelled good. Their mom said, "This is cocoa. It is a warm and sweet drink. You can have some if you bounce with me."
Tim and Liz were happy and curious. They bounced with their mom in the kitchen. They bounced high and low, fast and slow, and made funny noises. They had a lot of fun. Their mom smiled and poured some cocoa into four mugs. She gave one to each of them and one to their dad, who came to join them.
Tim and Liz tasted the cocoa. It was hot and yummy. They felt warm and cozy. They thanked their mom for being so generous and making them cocoa. They hugged their mom and dad and said, "We love you and we love cocoa." They drank their cocoa and bounced some more. They were the bounce twins and they were happy.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park. He saw a mysterious box under a tree. Tim felt excited and wanted to touch the box. But his friend, Lily, said, "No, don't touch it!"
Tim and Lily started to argue. Tim wanted to know what was inside the box. Lily was scared and wanted to leave. Tim said, "I will open it!" and Lily said, "No, don't do it!"
Finally, Tim decided to open the box. Inside, he found many toys. The toys include cars, dolls, and balls. Tim and Lily were happy and played with the toys together. They learned that sometimes, it's okay to be curious and explore new things.

One day, a bossy cat and a little dog lived in a house. The cat liked to watch the dog play. The dog liked to watch the cat sleep.
One day, the cat said, "Dog, make some soup for me." The dog said, "Okay, cat. I will make soup for you." The dog made the soup and gave it to the cat.
The cat ate the soup and said, "This is good soup, dog. Thank you." The dog smiled and said, "You're welcome, cat. I like to make soup for you." Then, they played together and were happy.

Once upon a time, there was a popular farm. On this farm, there were many animals and plants. One day, a little girl named Lucy came to visit the farm. She saw a big red radish in the garden. Lucy wanted to show her friends the radish. So, she asked her mom to record her with the radish.
"Mom, can you record me with this big red radish?" Lucy asked. Her mom smiled and said, "Of course, Lucy!" Lucy held the radish and her mom recorded her with a camera.
Lucy was so happy. She showed the video to her friends. They all liked the radish too. The big red radish made everyone happy. And that is the end of the story of Lucy and the popular radish on the farm.

One day, a little girl named Sally went to the park. She wore her brown dress and her favorite sunglasses. Sally loved to play at the park.
At the park, Sally met a boy named Tim. Tim was wearing a brown hat and sunglasses too. They both laughed and said, "We look the same!"
Sally and Tim played all day. They went on the swings, the slide, and played in the sand. They had so much fun together. At the end of the day, they said goodbye and went home. Sally and Tim were happy to make a new friend at the park.

One day, a cat and a dog were on a road. They wanted to find something important. They walked and walked. The cat said, "I hear something. What is that?" The dog said, "I hear it too. Let's go see!"
They walked to where the sound was coming from. They saw a big box. The box was moving and making noise. The cat and dog were scared, but they wanted to know what was inside. They opened the box together.
Inside the box, they found a little bird. The bird was singing a pretty song. The cat and dog were happy. They had found the important thing they were looking for. They became friends with the bird and they all lived happily together.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to look at old photos in his family's big photo book. One day, he found a very old photo of a kind looking lady. He showed the photo to his mom and asked, "Who is this, Mom?"
Mom smiled and said, "That's your grandma, Tim. She was a very nice lady who always helped others. She would be very happy if you did the same."
The next day, Tim saw a girl at the park who was sad because she could not find her toy. Tim decided to help her look for it. After a while, they found the toy under a bench. The girl was very happy and said, "Thank you, Tim!"
Tim felt proud and happy that he could help someone, just like his grandma. From that day on, Tim always tried to help others whenever he could. And every time he did, he would think of the old photo of his grandma and remember to be kind and helpful, just like her.

Once upon a time, there was a small girl named Lily. She loved to play with her mom's makeup. One day, she saw her mom store the makeup in a big box. Lily wanted to play with the makeup, but her mom said no.
Lily had a plan. When her mom was not looking, she took the makeup out of the box. She put the makeup on her face and her doll's face. She was having so much fun! But then, something unexpected happened.
Lily's doll started to talk! The doll said, "Thank you for the makeup, Lily! Now, I can be pretty like you!" Lily was very surprised but happy. From that day on, Lily and her talking doll were the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Daisy. She was three years old and loved to pretend. One day, Daisy decided to play at being a princess. She put on her mom's bathrobe and waited for her prince to arrive.
Daisy waited and waited, and soon grew bored and impatient. Then, just when she was about to give up, she heard a knock at the door. Daisy ran to open it, only to find a mouse standing there. Daisy was helpless. The mouse had come to take her away!
Daisy tried to get away, but the mouse was too fast. She kept trying, but nothing worked. Just when the mouse was about to take Daisy away, the door opened again. This time it was Daisy's mom.
Mom spotted the mouse and shouted, "Go away! You can't have my Daisy!" The mouse was scared and quickly ran away. Daisy was so relieved and hugged her mom tightly.
Her mom smiled and said, "You can play princess again any time you want, just not with strangers!" Daisy nodded and pretended to be a princess for the rest of the day.

Once upon a time, in a little house, there was a hungry dog named Spot. Spot had a big friend named Sam. Sam was a tall boy with a big smile. They liked to play together every day.
One day, Spot and Sam went to the park. They saw a red ball stuck in a tree. Spot barked and Sam said, "Oh no! How can we get the ball down?" Spot had an idea. He found a long stick and gave it to Sam.
Sam took the stick and tried to pull the ball out of the tree. "I will pull the ball down," said Sam. He pulled and pulled, and the ball came down. Spot was so happy! They played with the red ball all day long. And they went home tired but happy.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to a wide park with his mom. They saw many kids playing and having fun. Tim's mom said, "Let's introduce you to the other kids, so you can play with them."
Tim walked up to a girl named Sue. He said, "Hi, I am Tim. Do you want to play?" Sue smiled and said, "Yes! Let's play on the swings." They played and laughed for a long time.
After playing, they felt hungry. Tim's mom brought a big pizza for them to eat. Tim and Sue sat down and ate the yummy pizza together. They became good friends and promised to play at the park again soon.

Once there was a young girl, who went on an adventure. She shook her head and set off, with an organized plan of where to go.
Along the way, she encountered a friendly old lady. The old lady asked her, "Where are you off to?"
The young girl smiled and said, "I'm shaking up things. I'm going to have an adventure!"
The old lady laughed and wished the young girl good luck. The young girl thanked her and continued her journey.
When she finally arrived at her destination, the young girl was amazed. Everywhere she looked, things were perfectly organized. She had never seen anything like it in her life.
The young girl felt proud of her accomplishments. She hadn't expected to find such an organized place on her adventure, but she was glad she had. She shook her head and wished she had started her adventure sooner.

One day, Bob and his mom went to the park. Bob was so excited as he wanted to go on the slide. He ran over to it, but then he stopped and looked around.
"Where's the slide?" he asked. 
His mom smiled and said, "We don't have enough money to use the slide, honey. But look over there! That quiet hill looks like a lot of fun."
Bob smiled and said, "Let's go there!" 
The pair walked to the top of the hill and Bob looked down. He smiled, his eyes wide. His mom said, "Ready, set, go!"
Bob pushed off with his feet and he began to rise. He felt so light and free as he slid down the hill. By the time he reached the bottom he was full of joy. 
He and his mom smiled at each other and then he said, "Let's do it again!"

One day, a polite cat named Tom went to bathe in a big tub. He liked to play with his toy duck while he bathed. Tom's friend, a dog named Max, liked to watch him play.
"Can I play too?" Max asked. Tom said, "Yes, you can play with my toy duck."
As they played, they heard a loud "zoom" sound. They looked up and saw a big red car zoom by their house. They were very surprised and excited.
"Let's go see the car!" Max said. Tom agreed, and they both ran outside. But when they got there, they saw that the car was just a toy car. They laughed and played with the toy car instead.

Once upon a time, there was a yellow dog named Spot. Spot liked to run and play all day. One day, Spot joined a race with other dogs. He ran very fast and won the race. Spot was so happy!
Spot got a trophy for winning the race. The trophy was shiny and big. Spot showed the trophy to all his friends. They were very proud of him.
One day, Spot was playing near a fire. He was careful not to get too close. But, the trophy was near the fire and it started to burn. Spot was scared, but he got help from a grown-up. They put out the fire and saved the trophy. Spot learned to be more careful and he kept his trophy safe.

One day, a boy named Tim went to a big place called a stadium. He was with his mom and dad. They were there to watch a game. Tim was very excited.
Tim saw a hidden door near the seats. He asked his mom, "What is behind the hidden door?" His mom said, "I don't know. Imagine what could be there!"
Tim closed his eyes and imagined. He saw a big room with lots of toys and games. He told his mom and dad about it. They all laughed and had fun talking about what could be behind the hidden door.
At the end of the game, they walked past the hidden door again. Tim said, "I had fun imagining what was behind the door." His mom and dad smiled and said, "We had fun too."
They left the stadium and went home. Tim always remembered the fun they had at the stadium and the hidden door that made them imagine.

Danny had a bone in his hand. He looked at it and wondered what it could be. He asked his mom, "What is this?"
His mom said it was a bone. Danny was excited. He asked, "Can I bite it?" His mom said, "Yes, but it won't taste like usual food. It won't taste normal."
Danny was brave. He closed his eyes and took a bite of the bone. It was very hard. He opened his eyes and said, "This does not taste normal!"
His mom smiled and said, "That's because bones are for dogs, not for people. They should only be eaten by dogs, not by us." Danny thought about it for a moment and nodded. He put the bone back down and said, "I won't bite it again!"

Once there was a pond in the middle of a park. In the summer time, all the kids would come and dive in. Summer was the favorite season of them all.
One day, Danny and Lisa came to the pond.
Lisa said, "Let's dive!"
Danny said, "Yes!"
Danny and Lisa jumped in and started diving. They were very good and moved around the pond very fast. They were so competitive that they didn't even take any breaks.
Soon, other kids noticed how good Danny and Lisa were and started competing against them. It seemed like every day more and more kids were joining in on the fun.
At the end of the summer, Danny and Lisa had become the most well-known divers in the park. They were so proud of how far they had come and couldn't wait to start diving again next season!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She was very curious and wanted to see what the world around her looked like. So, she took a peek outside her window. She saw a long, brown belt lying in the grass. She had never seen it before. So, she decided to explore this unknown belt.
The little girl slowly walked towards it and carefully touched the belt. She was very surprised at how soft it felt against her fingertips. She started wondering who owned the belt and where it came from. She bent down to take a closer look but she couldn't find any answers.
The little girl didn't know it then, but the belt belonged to an old, wise man who lived in the woods. He had left it there as a gift for all curious kids. The girl thanked the unknown man for the wonderful belt and brought it home with her.

Tom and Sam are brothers. They like to play in the woods. They pretend to be hunters and look for animals. One day, they see a big wolf. The wolf has sharp teeth and a long tail. The wolf growls at them.
"Run, Sam, run!" Tom says. He is scared of the wolf. He grabs Sam's hand and they run back to their house. The wolf chases them. It is fast and angry.
"Help, help!" Tom and Sam shout. They see their dad. He has a big stick. He is ready to fight the wolf. He swings the stick at the wolf. The wolf dodges and bites the stick. The stick breaks.
"Go inside, boys!" their dad says. He picks up a stone and throws it at the wolf. The wolf yelps and runs away. He is hurt and afraid.
Tom and Sam hug their dad. They are safe and happy. They thank their dad for saving them.
"Are you OK, boys?" their dad asks. He checks them for wounds. They are not hurt.
"We are OK, dad," Tom says. "But we are sorry. We should not have played in the woods. It was dangerous."
"That's right, boys," their dad says. "The woods are not a place for children. There are wild animals there. You have to be careful and listen to me. Do you understand?"
"Yes, dad, we understand," Sam says. "We will not play in the woods again. We will play in the yard. It is safe and fun."
"Good, boys," their dad says. "Now, let's go inside and have some lunch. You must be hungry."
Tom and Sam nod. They are hungry. They follow their dad inside. They finish their adventure. They learn their lesson. They love their dad.

One day, a big, bossy cat put on a suit. He walked outside and saw a little dog. The dog was sad and began to cry. The bossy cat said, "Why do you cry, little dog?"
The little dog looked up and said, "I lost my toy. Can you help me find it?" The bossy cat thought for a moment and said, "Yes, I will help you."
They looked under a tree, behind a bush, and in a hole. The dog was still sad, but then something unexpected happened. The bossy cat found the toy in his suit pocket! The dog stopped crying and was very happy. The bossy cat smiled and said, "I am glad I could help you, little dog." From that day on, the bossy cat and the little dog were good friends.

One day, a little girl named Mia found a bar of soap. She did not know what it was. She saw her mom and asked, "Mom, what is this?" Her mom smiled and said, "Mia, that is soap. We use soap to get clean."
Mia wanted to know more. So, her mom said, "Let me explain. When we are dirty, we use soap and water. The soap makes us wet and helps wash away the dirt." Mia liked the idea of getting clean with soap.
The next day, Mia and her mom took a bath. They used the soap and got all wet. Mia said, "Mom, I like the soap. It makes me feel clean and happy!" Her mom hugged her and said, "That's right, Mia. Soap is very good for us."

One day, a sleepy cat named Tom was walking down the road. He saw a big, red jeep. The jeep was shiny and new. Tom wanted to come closer and see the jeep.
As Tom came near, he heard a loud noise. A dog named Max jumped out of the jeep! Max was a big, happy dog. Tom was scared, but Max just wanted to play.
Max asked Tom, "Do you want to play with me?" Tom thought about it and said, "Okay." They played all day and became best friends. The sleepy cat and the big dog had lots of fun together, and the red jeep was their favorite place to play.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They saw a big, loud dog. The dog liked to play with a red ball. Tim stared at the dog and wanted to play too.
Tim's mom said, "Be careful, Tim!" But Tim did not listen. He ran to the dog and fell down. Tim hurt his knee and started to cry.
Then, the loud dog did something unexpected. It brought the red ball to Tim and licked his knee. Tim stopped crying and laughed. The dog was not so scary after all. They played together and became friends.

One day, a little bee went out to play. The bee saw a wide flower with pretty colors. The bee wanted to play on the flower. So, the bee flew to the flower and landed on it.
While the bee played on the wide flower, a little girl came to see. The girl liked the bee and wanted to play too. She sat down next to the flower and watched the bee play. They both had fun together.
Soon, it was time for the bee to go home. The bee said goodbye to the girl and flew away. The girl waved goodbye and went home too. The bee and the girl were happy they got to play together.

Once there was a boy named Pete. He was three year old, and always wanted to explore. One day, he saw a dry tree. He wanted to poke it, so he ran over to it.
Pete poked the tree and suddenly a zero appeared! He was so excited that he shouted, "I found a zero!"
His mom heard him and came over to see what was going on. She smiled and said, "Well, that's amazing! What are you going to do with it?"
Pete was so excited that he couldn't decide. He then said, "I think I'm going to poke it again!"
So Pete poked the zero and suddenly a magical rainbow appeared! He ran over to it and shouted, "Look, Mommy! I found a rainbow!"
His mom laughed and said, "That's wonderful, Pete! You're so brave and curious. I'm so proud of you."
Pete felt proud and smiled. He had found his own zero and made a magical rainbow. What a wonderful day.

Once upon a time, there was a famous dog named Spot. Spot had a wide smile and loved to play with his ball. Every day, Spot would run outside, drop his ball, and wait for his owner to throw it.
One sunny day, Spot went to the park with his owner. They played with the ball and Spot dropped it many times. Spot's wide smile made everyone happy. People would stop and watch Spot play, because he was so famous.
After a fun day at the park, Spot and his owner went home. Spot was tired but happy. He dropped his ball by his bed and went to sleep. Spot had the best dreams of playing with his ball and making everyone smile with his wide, famous grin.

One day, a girl named Amy found a screen. The screen was big and shiny. Amy liked to watch things on the screen. She saw a funny cat and a big dog. They made her laugh.
Then, something spicy happened. A red pepper came on the screen. The pepper was very spicy. The cat and dog tried to eat the pepper, but it was too spicy for them. They jumped and ran away.
Amy laughed and clapped her hands. She liked the spicy pepper on the screen. She wanted to see more spicy things happen. So, she watched the screen every day and saw many funny things.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a mighty pumpkin. This pumpkin was so big and round that everyone loved it. One day, a little boy named Tim saw the pumpkin and wanted to use it for something fun.
Tim had an idea. He went to his friend, Sue, and said, "Let's make a big pumpkin house!" Sue was happy and said, "Yes, let's do it!" So, they started to make the pumpkin house together. They cut a door and windows in the pumpkin. It was a lot of work, but they had fun.
Just as they finished the pumpkin house, something unexpected happened. A tiny mouse came out of the pumpkin! The mouse looked at Tim and Sue and said, "Thank you for making my new home!" Tim and Sue were surprised, but they laughed and said, "You're welcome, little mouse!" From that day on, the mighty pumpkin was the best home for the tiny mouse, and Tim and Sue had a new friend to play with.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Mia. Mia loved to design things. She could make things look nice. One day, she wanted to make something special with cocoa. She had a heavy bag of cocoa. Mia was excited to make something yummy.
Mia started to mix the cocoa with other things. She was making a big cake. But then, something unexpected happened. A little bird flew into the window. The bird was hungry and wanted to eat the cocoa. Mia was surprised and didn't know what to do.
Mia had an idea. She gave some cocoa to the bird. The bird was happy and flew away. Mia was happy too. She learned that sharing can make others happy. So, she finished her cake and shared it with her friends. They all loved the cocoa cake Mia designed.

Once upon a time, there was a nosy little dog named Spot. Spot loved to know everything about everyone. One day, Spot found a big hole in the ground. He thought it might be an underground place.
Spot went into the hole to see what was underground. He found a small, lost kitten. The kitten was very scared. Spot knew he had to help the kitten find its way back home.
Spot and the kitten walked and walked until they found the kitten's home. The kitten's family was so happy to see them. They thanked Spot for being a good friend. From that day on, Spot was not as nosy, but he still loved to know about his friends.

Once upon a time, there lived a young boy named John. John loved to ride the bus. Every day after school he hopped on the bus and went to the park where he would play with his friends. 
One day, the bus driver was an elderly man. He had the kindest face John had ever seen. As John got on the bus, the elderly man looked at him and said, "I believe you will make a difference in this world someday."
John was so surprised at what the elderly man said. He smiled at the man and stuck his tongue out - something he always did to show that he believed what someone said.
The elderly man was so touched by John's gesture that he decided to give him a ride all the way to the park for free.
John was so grateful for the kind act of the man and promised him that he would try his best to live up to his belief.
The moral of the story is that no matter how small or insignificant your actions may seem, they can have a big impact when done with kindness and sincerity. It also teaches us to believe in ourselves and in the goodness of others.

Once upon a time, there was a kind girl named Lily. Lily had a small kitten named Mimi. They loved to play together in the garden. One day, a big dog came into the garden. The dog wanted to play too, but he was not kind. He ran around and tried to spoil their fun.
Lily and Mimi were scared of the big dog. They wanted him to go away. Lily thought of a plan. She picked up a ball and threw it far away. The big dog saw the ball and ran after it. He forgot about spoiling their fun.
Lily and Mimi were happy again. They played together in the garden all day. The big dog learned to be kind and did not spoil their fun anymore. They all became good friends and played together every day.

Anna and Ben are friends. They like to play with toys and run in the park. Sometimes they tease each other. They say funny things and make silly faces. They do not mean to be mean. They just want to have fun.
One day, Anna and Ben find a big box. They wonder what is inside. They open the box and see a puppy. The puppy is brown and fluffy. It has a wet nose and a wagging tail. It barks and licks them. Anna and Ben are very happy. They hug the puppy and give it a name. They call it Coco.
Anna and Ben take Coco to the park. They play fetch and tug-of-war. They teach Coco to sit and roll over. Coco is very smart and cute. He makes Anna and Ben laugh. He also makes friends with other dogs and people. Everyone likes Coco. He is a lovely puppy.
Anna and Ben love Coco very much. They share their toys and food with him. They take good care of him. They brush his fur and clean his ears. They take him to the vet and give him shots. They make sure he is healthy and happy.
Coco loves Anna and Ben very much. He follows them everywhere. He protects them from danger. He comforts them when they are sad. He teases them when they are bored. He makes their life more fun and exciting. He is a good friend.

Once upon a time, there was a clever boy named Tim. He liked to play with his toys and make things. One day, Tim found a screw on the floor. He picked it up and thought about what he could do with it.
