Tim had an idea. He wanted to own a toy car that could go very fast. He took his toy car and the screw, and he put the screw on the car's wheel. Tim was very happy because he made his toy car better.
Now, Tim's toy car was the fastest in the whole town. All the other kids wanted to play with Tim and his clever toy car. Tim was very proud of what he made and was happy to share his toy car with his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a chubby bird named Bobo. Bobo loved to soar high in the sky. He would fly up and down, fast and slow, and all his friends would watch him.
One day, while Bobo was soaring, he saw a big, round thing on the ground. He flew down to see what it was. It was a brain! Bobo didn't know what a brain was, but he thought it would be fun to play with it.
Bobo picked up the brain with his beak and started to play. He threw it up in the sky, and it began to soar, just like Bobo! The brain could fly! Bobo and the brain became best friends and soared together every day. The other birds were surprised and happy to have a new friend to fly with. And they all lived happily ever after.

Sam loved to ride his bike. He always wore his helmet to keep his head safe. His helmet was red and shiny, with a picture of a rocket on it. Sam felt like he was flying when he pedaled fast.
One day, Sam saw a big hill near his house. He wanted to go down the hill on his bike. He thought it would be incredible. He told his mom he was going to try it. His mom said, "Be careful, Sam. The hill is very steep. And don't forget your helmet."
Sam put on his helmet and rode his bike to the hill. He looked down and felt excited. He pushed his bike to the top of the hill and got ready to go. He said to himself, "Here I go!"
But as soon as he started to go down, he saw something that made him stop. There was a big truck coming up the hill. It was very loud and fast. Sam was scared. He tried to brake, but his bike was going too fast. He couldn't stop.
He closed his eyes and hoped for the best. He heard the truck honk and swerve. He felt a bump and a crash. He opened his eyes and saw his bike on the ground, broken and twisted. He saw his helmet on his head, cracked and scratched. He saw the truck driver get out and run to him. He said, "Are you okay, kid? That was a close one. You're lucky you had your helmet on."
Sam felt his head and realized he was okay. He was shaken, but not hurt. He said, "Thank you, mister. I'm sorry I was in your way. I was trying to do something incredible."
The truck driver smiled and said, "You did do something incredible, kid. You survived. But next time, be more careful. And always wear your helmet." He helped Sam get up and gave him a hug. He said, "Come on, let's go find your mom. She must be worried sick." He took Sam and his bike to his truck and drove him home. Sam learned a lesson that day. He still loved to ride his bike, but he never went down the big hill again. He always wore his helmet and looked both ways. He knew his helmet saved his life. He was glad he had it. It was his incredible helmet.

One day, a wide cat named Tim had a plan. He wanted to make a sandwich. He went to the kitchen to find bread, cheese, and ham. Tim was very happy because he loved to eat sandwiches. He put the bread, cheese, and ham together to make his sandwich.
Tim took his sandwich to the park to eat. At the park, he saw his friend, a dog named Max. Max was playing with a ball. Tim asked Max if he wanted to share the sandwich. Max said yes and wagged his tail.
Tim and Max sat under a big tree and ate the sandwich together. They both liked the sandwich a lot. After they finished eating, they played with the ball. Tim and Max had a great day at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a playful cat named Kitty. Kitty loved to play and run around the house. One day, Kitty found a bottle of perfume on the table. She sniffed it and it smelled very nice. Kitty wanted to show her friend, Doggy.
Kitty went to Doggy and said, "Doggy, smell this nice perfume!" Doggy sniffed the perfume and wagged his tail. He liked the smell too. They wanted to make a picture to remember the perfume.
Kitty and Doggy found some paper and paint. They used their paws to print a picture of the perfume bottle. They were very happy with their picture. They put it on the wall to remember the nice smell of the perfume. And they played together all day long.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a sleepy bird named Blue. Blue lived in a small cage that hung from a tree. Every day, Blue would sing and laugh with his friends.
One day, Blue's friend, Red, came to visit. "Hi Blue!" said Red. "Why are you in that cage? Come out and play with us!" Blue shook his head and said, "I can't, Red. I don't know how to open the door."
Red thought for a moment and said, "Don't worry, Blue. I will find a way to help you." Red flew away and came back with a big stick. He pushed the stick through the bars of the cage and lifted the door. "There you go, Blue! Now you can come out and play."
Blue was so happy that he laughed and laughed. He flew out of the cage and played with Red all day. From that day on, Blue and Red were the best of friends, and they laughed and played together in the big forest every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Jack. He loved to play with his friends and was always having so much fun. One day, he got a little too rough and tripped, scraped his knee and started to cry. Jack's mother came to his rescue and cleaned the wound. She then said to him, "You need a bandage, Jack. This will help your knee heal."
Jack looked up and said, "I don't want a stupid bandage." His mother replied, "It doesn't matter what you want, you still need to wear one so that your knee can get better. It's important to own up to our responsibilities."
Jack understood and allowed his mother to put a bandage on his knee. He realized that owning up to his responsibilities was more important than getting his own way.
Jack's mother smiled and said, "That's my good boy!". From then on, Jack always followed the rules and was happy to put a bandage on his knee whenever he scraped it.
The moral of the story is: Believing that you're right every time isn't always the best route to take. Own up to your responsibilities and accept it as part of life.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a girl named Amy. She had a birdcage with a bird named Blue. Amy loved Blue very much. One day, Amy saw that the birdcage was dry. She thought, "I need to give Blue some water."
Amy went to her friend Tom's house. She said, "Tom, can you help me give Blue some water?" Tom said, "Yes, I can help you." So, Amy and Tom went back to her house. Tom had a good idea. He said, "Let's invite our friends to help, too."
Amy and Tom invited their friends, and they all helped to give Blue some water. Blue was very happy. The friends felt good because they helped Amy and Blue. They learned that helping others is a good thing to do. And from that day on, they always helped each other when someone needed it.

Once upon a time, there was a cheerful girl named Lucy. She loved to play and discover new things. Lucy was a pupil in a small school with many friends.
One day, Lucy and her friend, Tim, were playing in the park. They saw a big box under a tree. "What is in the box?" asked Lucy. "I don't know. Let's open it!" said Tim. They opened the box and found many colorful balloons inside.
Lucy and Tim were very happy. They started to blow up the balloons and play with them. Suddenly, the balloons lifted Lucy and Tim up into the sky! They were flying high above the park. "Wow! This is so much fun!" said Lucy. "Yes, it is!" agreed Tim. They flew around for a while and then, the balloons gently brought them back to the ground. Lucy and Tim laughed and hugged each other. They knew they had discovered a magical adventure that they would never forget.

Once upon a time, in a small village, there was a naughty boy who caused lots of problems. Everyday he made a mess or did something wrong. The other people in the village were really tired of him. 
One day, the villagers got together to figure out how to solve the naughty problem. They thought and they thought, but they couldn't agree on anything. 
Finally, one of the wise villagers had an idea. She suggested they should give the naughty boy a job to do. He could help with the village chores and in return, he would get something nice.
The villagers liked this idea. So they gave the boy a job of watering the village plants every day. The boy was so excited and he worked very, very hard. Soon the village plants started looking big and strong. 
The villagers were so pleased with the boy, they decided he was no longer naughty. Everyone was happy and they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a beautiful cat. She loved to play hide and seek with her friends. One day, she found a big case to hide in. She thought it was the best hiding place ever.
Her friends looked for her everywhere. They called her name, but the beautiful cat did not come out. She thought it was funny that they could not find her. She stayed very quiet inside the case.
After a long time, her friends stopped looking. They were sad and went home. The beautiful cat did not know they left. She was still hiding in the case. It got dark and cold, but she did not come out. In the end, she was all alone and could not find her way home.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a big flood. The water came up high and made it tough for people to walk outside. The animals were scared and tried to find a safe place to hide.
One day, a little girl named Anna saw a tired cat yawn. The cat was wet and cold from the flood. Anna felt sad for the cat and wanted to help. She took the cat home and dried it with a soft towel. Anna gave the cat some warm milk to drink, and the cat stopped yawning.
The cat was so happy that it started to purr. Anna's mom and dad saw how kind she was and felt proud of her. The flood went away, and the sun came out. The cat became Anna's best friend, and they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sally. Sally loved to eat delicious apples from the tree in her yard. One sunny day, she saw a red bird sitting on a branch. The bird looked hungry, so Sally wanted to share her apple with it.
Sally asked the bird, "Do you want some apple?" The bird did not answer her question. Sally thought maybe the bird did not hear her, so she decided to repeat her question. "Do you want some apple?" she asked again.
This time, the bird said, "Yes, please!" Sally broke off a small piece of the delicious apple and gave it to the bird. They both enjoyed the sweet treat together under the warm sun. From that day on, Sally and the bird became the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little black cat named Kitty. Kitty had a big surprise for her friend, Doggy. She wanted to send Doggy a fun toy in the mail.
Kitty put the toy in a box and went to the mailman. She said, "Please send this box to Doggy's house." The mailman smiled and took the box.
The next day, Doggy saw the mailman at his door. The mailman said, "I have a box for you, Doggy!" Doggy opened the box and found the fun toy inside. He was so happy and said, "Wow, what a nice surprise from Kitty!"
Kitty and Doggy played with the toy together all day. They laughed and had lots of fun. And that is how Kitty's surprise made both of them very happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy who was very lucky. One day, he decided to take a walk. As he was walking, he saw something that made him very happy: an alligator! He wanted to play with it, so he went closer. The alligator seemed friendly, but suddenly it appeared to be angry and started to move towards him! The boy felt scared and ran away as fast as he could. Unfortunately, the alligator was faster and chased him until it caught him. It was a horrible ending for the lucky little boy!

Once upon a time, there was a smart dog named Buddy. Buddy liked to play and be with his friends. One day, Buddy saw a big step in front of him. He wanted to go up the step to see what was on the other side.
Buddy tried to jump up the step, but it was too high. He thought and thought about how to be smart and get up the step. Then, he had an idea. Buddy found a small box and pushed it to the step.
With the box in front of the step, Buddy jumped on the box and then up the step. Buddy was so happy that he could be smart and find a way up the step. On the other side of the step, he found a big park to play in with his friends. And they all had a fun day together.

Once upon a time, there was an ordinary cat named Tom. Tom was a quick cat who loved to run and play all day. One day, while playing outside, Tom saw his friend, a little bird named Tim.
"Hi, Tim! Do you want to play with me?" Tom asked. Tim loved playing with Tom and said, "Yes, let's play together!" So, they ran and played in the sun all day.
Then, something unexpected happened. Tom tripped on a rock and fell down. Tom felt embarrass because he fell in front of his friend. Tim flew to Tom and said, "It's okay, Tom. We all fall down sometimes. Let's keep playing!" Tom smiled, and they played until the sun went down.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her friends and include them in all her games. One day, Lily and her friends decided to play a dizzy game called "Spin and Run."
"Let's all spin around and then run to that tree!" Lily shouted to her friends. They all agreed and began to spin around. They spun and spun until they felt very dizzy. Lily laughed and said, "I feel so dizzy, but it's so much fun!"
After they spun around, Lily and her friends ran to the tree. They were still dizzy, so they fell on the soft grass and laughed. They played the game again and again until it was time to go home. Lily and her friends had so much fun playing "Spin and Run" in their little town.

Lily and Ben were best friends. They liked to play on the big hill near their house. The hill had a lot of grass and flowers and a big tree. Sometimes they would roll down the hill and laugh. Sometimes they would climb the tree and look at the sky. Sometimes they would pick flowers and make crowns.
One day, they saw a new boy on the hill. He had a red bike and a blue hat. He looked cool and fun. Lily and Ben wanted to play with him. They ran to him and said hello. The new boy looked at them and smiled.
"Hi, I'm Max. Do you want to ride my bike?" he asked.
Lily and Ben nodded. They liked bikes. Max let them take turns on his bike. They rode up and down the hill and had a lot of fun. Max was very nice and shared his bike. Lily and Ben thought he was popular.
But then, something bad happened. When it was Lily's turn to ride the bike, she lost her balance and fell. She scraped her knee and it hurt a lot. She started to cry. Ben ran to her and tried to help her. He said sorry and gave her a hug.
Max saw what happened and got angry. He ran to Lily and Ben and yelled at them.
"Hey, you broke my bike! Look, the wheel is bent and the chain is loose. You are bad and mean. Go away, I don't want to play with you anymore!" he shouted.
Lily and Ben were scared and sad. They didn't mean to break the bike. They said sorry and tried to fix it. But Max didn't listen. He took his bike and left. He didn't say goodbye or thank you.
Lily and Ben felt bad. They didn't have a new friend anymore. They had a new enemy. They wished they never met Max. They wished they stayed on the hill and played by themselves. They learned a lesson. They learned that some people are not nice and not popular. They learned that they had each other and that was enough. They hugged and walked home. They hoped that Max would be nicer someday.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat delicious fruits. Her favorite fruits were apples, bananas, and grapes. Lily's mom always told her that eating fruits was good for her life.
One day, Lily saw a boy who did not know about delicious fruits. He only ate candy and chips. Lily wanted to help the boy. She said, "You should try these fruits. They are delicious and good for your life."
The boy tried the fruits and he liked them. He said, "Thank you, Lily. I did not know fruits were so delicious. I will eat them more now." From that day on, the boy ate more fruits and felt much better. Lily was happy that she could help someone learn about the good things in life.
The moral of the story is that it is important to share what we know with others. By doing that, we can help them live a better life.

Once upon a time, there was a messy dog named Spot. Spot liked to play with his red ball. One day, Spot saw a big top on the ground. He wanted to play with it, too.
Spot went to his friend, Cat. "Look at this top," said Spot. "Do you want to play with me?" Cat looked at the top and said, "I don't like messy things. But I will play with you if you bow to me first."
Spot bowed to Cat, and they started to play with the top. They spun it around and around. It was so much fun! But then, the top went too fast and hit a big cup of juice. The juice spilled everywhere.
"Oh no," said Spot and Cat. "Now everything is messy!" They tried to clean up the mess, but it was too hard. In the end, their play area was still messy, and they couldn't play anymore.

Once upon a time, there was a grumpy old cat named Tom. He lived in a small house with a nice girl named Sue. Sue loved magic and always tried to make Tom happy.
One day, Sue found a magic wand in her room. She wanted to make Tom happy, so she waved the wand at him. Suddenly, Tom turned into a big, happy dog! Sue was so surprised, but she liked the happy dog.
The happy dog was sorry for being grumpy before. He wanted Sue to forgive him. Sue smiled and said, "I forgive you." They played together and had lots of fun. From that day on, Tom stayed a happy dog and they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a clever little dog named Buddy. Buddy lived with his family in a small house. They loved to play and have fun together.
One day, Buddy wanted to find a big stick for his family to play with. He looked everywhere but could not find one. Then he saw a big tree with a stick high up. Buddy thought, "I will succeed and get that stick for my family."
Buddy jumped and jumped, but he could not reach the stick. His family saw him trying and said, "Buddy, you are so clever! We can help you get the stick!" They all worked together, and finally, they got the stick.
Buddy and his family were so happy. They played with the big stick all day long. Buddy knew that with his family, they could succeed in anything they tried.

Once upon a time, a big cat named Tom and a little mouse named Jerry lived in a house. They liked to play and run all day. One day, Tom and Jerry decided to march in the house. They marched up and down the stairs, through the rooms, and around the kitchen.
As they marched, they saw a weird toy on the floor. It was a little car with the word "zoom" on it. They had never seen this toy before. Tom and Jerry decided to play with the zoom car. They took turns pushing it around the house. The zoom car went fast and made them laugh.
Suddenly, the zoom car started to move on its own! Tom and Jerry were very surprised. The zoom car raced around the house and then stopped in front of a secret door. Tom and Jerry looked at each other, then opened the door. Inside, they found a room full of toys they had never seen before! They played with the new toys and had lots of fun. The zoom car had shown them a secret playroom in their house!

Once upon a time, there was a helpful cow named Daisy. Daisy lived on a farm with her friends. Every day, Daisy would give milk to the farmer. She liked to help and be nice to everyone.
One day, a new animal came to the farm. The farmer said, "Welcome!" to the new animal. The new animal was a goat named Billy. Billy was very shy and did not talk to anyone. Daisy wanted to be friends with him.
Daisy decided to give some of her milk to Billy to make him feel welcome. She thought it would make him happy. But something unexpected happened! When Billy drank the milk, he started to jump high and run very fast. He was not shy anymore! All the animals on the farm were surprised and happy. Daisy and Billy became best friends, and they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, in a large house, there was a big bowl of fruit. The fruit was very yummy. There were apples, bananas, and oranges. The family loved to eat the fruit every day.
One day, the fruit started to separate. The apples went to one side, the bananas to another side, and the oranges to another side. The family did not know why this happened. They thought it was very strange.
Then, they saw a tiny mouse. The mouse was moving the fruit! He wanted to eat the fruit too, but he liked to eat them one by one. The family laughed and let the mouse eat the fruit with them. The mouse was happy, and they all became friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big folder with many colors. Lily liked to draw pictures in her folder. One day, she saw a small, harmless bug on the ground. She thought it was cute and wanted to keep it.
Lily put the bug in her folder and went to show her friend, Tim. Tim did not like bugs, but he knew that it was harmless. He did not want to hurt Lily's feelings, so he tried to accept the bug. Lily could see that Tim was scared, but she wanted to show him that it was okay.
Lily took the bug out of the folder and put it on her hand. Tim saw that the bug was not scary. He touched the bug and smiled. Lily and Tim learned that sometimes things that look scary are not scary at all. The moral of the story is to not judge something by how it looks, but to accept it and learn more about it.

Once upon a time, there was a brilliant sun in the sky. It was bright and shiny. The sun liked to send shapes to the clouds. The clouds would change into many fun shapes, like a cat, a dog, or a big ball.
One day, the sun sent a new shape to the clouds. It was a big, scary monster shape. The monster shape was not nice. It made the people in the town feel sad and scared.
The sun tried to change the monster shape back into a fun shape, but it could not. The monster shape stayed in the sky, making everyone feel sad and scared. The sun felt bad for sending the monster shape, but it could not fix it. The town was never happy again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. Mia lived in a small house with her mommy, daddy, and her big, heavy dog named Buddy. Mia loved Buddy very much. One day, Mia's mommy told her that they were going to have a fun party at their house. Mia was very excited and hoped all her friends would come.
On the day of the party, Mia's mommy and daddy worked hard to make the house look nice. They put up pretty decorations and made yummy food. Mia helped by putting some wood in the fireplace to make the room warm and cozy. She hoped her friends would like it.
Soon, Mia's friends started to come to the party. They all played fun games and ate the yummy food. Mia's friends loved the warm fireplace and they all sat around it, talking and laughing. Buddy, the heavy dog, lay by the fireplace too, enjoying the warmth. Mia was so happy that her friends liked the fireplace and she knew the party was a big success.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to eat rice. One day, he saw a high hill near his home. He thought it would be fun to go up the hill with his rice.
Tim put his rice in a bag and started to walk up the high hill. As he walked, he met a big bird. The bird said, "Can I eat some of your rice?" Tim nodded and shared his rice with the bird. They ate together and became friends.
After eating, the big bird had a surprise for Tim. The bird said, "Hold on tight!" Tim held on to the bird's back, and they flew up into the sky! Tim was so excited and happy. He never thought he would fly high in the sky with a bird friend. And that was the best day of Tim's life.

One day, a little player named Tim went to the park. He felt confused because he did not see his friends. Tim looked around and saw a big tree. He thought his friends might be hiding there.
Tim walked to the tree and saw a small bug. The bug said, "Hi, I am Bug. Do you want to play with me?" Tim said, "Yes, let's play hide and seek." Bug agreed and started to hide.
Tim closed his eyes and counted. When he opened them, he saw Bug on a leaf. He tried to catch Bug, but Bug pinched Tim's finger. Tim said, "Ouch! That hurt!" Bug said, "I am sorry, I was scared."
Tim and Bug became friends and played together until Tim's friends came back. They all played together and had a fun day at the park.

Once there was a wise old owl. He lived alone in a tree. Every day he watched patiently as the animals went by. He saw the rabbit pushing the leaf around. He thought it was so much fun. So the owl decided to join in. He flew down and hovered over the leaf. With a great big push the owl flew back up into the tree and the leaf scuttled away. The owl smiled and thought this was a wonderful game. He vowed to come back and do it again tomorrow.

Once upon a time, in a little town, there lived a polite automobile named Speedy. Speedy was very friendly and always said "please" and "thank you." All the other cars liked Speedy because he was so nice.
One day, Speedy's friend, a little red car, said, "Speedy, let's have a race to see who is the fastest!" Speedy thought it would be fun, so he agreed. They went to the starting line and got ready to speed away.
As they raced, Speedy was very fast, but he made sure to be polite and not bump into his friend. In the end, Speedy won the race. His friend said, "Wow, Speedy, you are very fast and very polite. You are a great friend!" And they both drove off into the sunset, happy to have had a fun race.

Once upon a time there was a wise cook who lived in a small home. He loved to cook delicious food for all of his family and friends. The wise cook always wore a special apron when he cooked. It was made from cloth, and it was very soft. It had special pockets to keep all of his cooking utensils in. 
The wise cook's family and friends would often come to his house to help him while he cooked. They all wore their own aprons, and they did their best to support the wise cook. There were times when the wise cook's recipes were not turning out quite right, but his family and friends would always help him until the food was perfect. 
The wise cook was very happy with the support he received each time he cooked. He was so happy that he decided to make special aprons for each and every one of them. Now whenever they come over to help Cook they wear a special apron made just for them. 
The wise cook enjoyed cooking his special dishes with the support and help of his family and friends, and he was so Very Glad for their help.

Once upon a time, there was a king. The king was amazing. He had a big, shiny crown. Everyone liked the king. The king liked to explain things to people. He was very good at it.
One day, the king went for a walk. He saw a big, red ball. The king kicked the ball. The ball went very high. The king was happy. He wanted to explain to his friends how he kicked the ball.
But when the king went to find his friends, they were gone. The king was sad. He looked everywhere for his friends. Then, he saw them. They were hiding. They wanted to surprise the king.
The king's friends jumped out and yelled, "Surprise!" The king was very surprised. He laughed and laughed. Then, the king explained how he kicked the big, red ball. Everyone was amazed. They all played with the ball and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim loved to play basketball. He was very good at it. He had a dependable friend named Sam. Sam and Tim played basketball together all the time. They were very happy.
One day, Tim and Sam found a magic basketball. Tim said, "Wow! Let's play with it!" Sam agreed. They started to play with the magic basketball. But then, something unexpected happened. The basketball made everything freeze!
Tim and Sam were scared. They didn't know what to do. Tim said, "We need to fix this!" Sam thought for a moment and said, "Maybe if we say 'please' the basketball will make everything normal again." So, they said, "Please, magic basketball, make everything normal again!"
The basketball listened to them. Everything went back to normal. Tim and Sam were happy again. They decided to put the magic basketball away and play with a normal one. They learned that sometimes, magic can be too much.

One day, Tommy wanted to play outside in the sun. But his mom said "No, Tommy, it's too hot outside. Go inside and sit in the shade!"
Tommy was sad and so he started to cry. His mom sighed and said "No more tears, Tommy. Take your medicine and rest." 
She gave him some light green liquid and Tommy scrunched up his face. He didn't want to drink it. His mom said in a stern voice, "Tommy, take your medicine or I'm gonna give you a slap."
Tommy gulped the medicine down and ran to the couch in the living room. He laid down and felt a cool sensation in his body as the medicine began to work it's magic.
He soon felt better and smiled as he heard his mom say, "See? That medicine was light on your tummy, wasn't it?"
Tommy grinned and nodded. He knew that his mom had been right about the medicine and that the slap he had been threatened with had been a warning for him not to moan about taking his medicine.

Sara and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. Sara has a new toy. It is a small clock. It can show the time. Sara wants to show Ben her clock.
"Look, Ben, I have a clock!" Sara says. She holds the clock in her hand. "It can show you when it is noon."
"What is noon?" Ben asks. He does not have a clock. He does not know the time.
"Noon is when the sun is high in the sky. It is when we eat lunch. See, the clock has a big hand and a small hand. When the big hand and the small hand are both on the twelve, it is noon." Sara explains.
"Oh, I see. That is cool. Can I hold your clock?" Ben says. He wants to see the clock better.
"Sure, you can hold it. But be careful. It is small and fragile. Do not drop it or break it." Sara says. She gives the clock to Ben.
Ben takes the clock. He looks at it closely. He sees the big hand and the small hand. He sees the numbers. He sees the twelve. He thinks it is noon. He is hungry.
"Can we eat lunch now?" Ben asks. He forgets to be careful. He drops the clock on the ground. It breaks. The big hand and the small hand fall off. The numbers get mixed up.
"Oh no! You broke my clock!" Sara cries. She is sad and angry. She picks up the broken clock. "Now it cannot show the time. Now it cannot show noon. Now it is useless."
"I am sorry, Sara. I did not mean to break it. I was hungry. I thought it was noon." Ben says. He is sorry and scared. He does not want to lose his friend.
Sara looks at Ben. She sees his sorry face. She remembers that he is her friend. She remembers that he does not have a clock. She remembers that he is hungry. She feels sorry for him.
"It is okay, Ben. I forgive you. You are my friend. Friends share and help each other. Maybe we can fix the clock later. Or maybe we can get a new one. But now, let us eat lunch. I am hungry too. Come on, I will show you where we can get some sandwiches." Sara says. She smiles at Ben. She holds his hand. She takes him to the sandwich shop.
Ben smiles back at Sara. He is happy. He has a friend. He does not need a clock. He can see the sun. He can see the sky. He can see noon.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max was a new friend to a boy named Tim. They liked to play and have fun together. Max was a very good dog and always listened to Tim.
One day, Max and Tim were outside playing near a big tree. Tim's mom called them in for a meal. Max and Tim were very hungry. They ran fast to the house to eat. But, they saw a little bird stuck in the tree. The bird needed help.
Tim and Max wanted to rescue the bird. Max barked at the tree and Tim tried to reach the bird. They worked together and saved the bird. The bird was happy and flew away. Max and Tim were happy too. They went inside to eat their meal and had a great day.

Once upon a time, there was a compassionate girl named Lily. She loved to help her mom in the kitchen. One day, they decided to make a yummy meal with potatoes. Lily was so excited!
Lily's mom washed the potatoes and gave them to Lily. Lily used a spray bottle to make the potatoes a little wet. She liked to see the water spray on the potatoes. It was fun!
After the potatoes were wet, Lily and her mom cooked them. They made a big plate of tasty potato snacks. Lily and her mom shared the snack with their family. Everyone was happy and said "Thank you, Lily!"

Once upon a time, there was a big bright sun. It was very hot. Under the sun, there was a little house. In the house, a nice lady lived. She liked to cook.
One day, she found a soft feather on the ground. She picked it up and took it home. She wanted to make something fun with the feather.
The nice lady thought and thought. Then she had an idea. She cooked a big yummy cake. She put the feather on top of the cake. It looked very pretty. The lady was very happy.

Once upon a time there was a farmer named Joe who had dependable wheat fields. Every day he would work hard and take care of the wheat. 
One day Joe went to the fields and found a little donkey there. He said to the donkey, "Where did you come from?"
The donkey said, "I came to help you gain more wheat. I can run faster and pull the wheat out of the ground." 
Joe was skeptical, but he gave the donkey a chance. He said, "Let's give it a try." 
So the donkey ran around the field faster than Joe ever could. In no time at all, the wheat was all pulled out of the ground and loaded into the cart. Joe smiled and said, "Thank you so much, you are dependable!" 
The donkey smiled and said, "You're welcome!" And from that day on, Joe and the donkey worked together every day to gain more wheat.

A boy and his mom drove to the store. The boy wanted to buy a chicken. His mom said they only had enough money to buy a cheap one. 
When they got there, the mom looked at all the chickens. But none of them were cheap. 
Suddenly, a strange man appeared. He had a chicken in his hands.
The man said, "I have a chicken here. It is very cheap. Would you like to buy it?" 
The mom said no and she and the boy drove away. 
But when they got home, the mom realised the chicken was not a real chicken. It was made of plastic. They had been tricked by the man who had appeared at the store.

One day, a judge named Mr. Brown lived in a big house. He had a dog named Max. Max was a careless dog. He always made a mess in the house. Mr. Brown did not like the mess, but he loved Max.
One day, Max saw a big ball outside. He wanted to play with it. He ran out of the house to get the ball. Mr. Brown saw Max run out and said, "Max, be careful! You might get lost!"
Max did not listen. He just wanted to play with the ball. He played and played until it was dark. Max was lost and scared. He did not know how to go home.
Mr. Brown went out to look for Max. He called out, "Max, where are you?" Max heard Mr. Brown and ran to him. They were both happy to see each other.
From that day on, Max was more careful. He did not want to get lost again. Mr. Brown and Max played with the big ball together, and they had lots of fun.

Lily likes to play in the snow. She makes a big snowman with a hat and a carrot nose. She gives him a scarf to keep him warm. The scarf is red and soft.
But then the sun comes out and the snow starts to melt. Lily is sad. She does not want her snowman to go away. She runs to him and tries to wipe the water from his face. But it does not help. The snowman gets smaller and smaller.
Lily cries. She hugs the snowman and says goodbye. She takes the scarf and the hat and the carrot. She goes back to her house. It is dark and cold outside. She is still sad.
But then she sees her mom and dad. They smile and hug her. They say they are proud of her for making a snowman. They say they have a surprise for her. They take her to the living room. There is a big fire in the fireplace. And on the couch, there is a new toy. It is a stuffed snowman. He has a hat and a carrot nose. And he has a scarf. The scarf is red and soft.
Lily is happy. She hugs the toy snowman and says hello. She puts the scarf around his neck. She says he is her friend. She says he will not melt. She thanks her mom and dad. They cuddle on the couch and watch the fire. Lily feels warm and cozy. She smiles.

Once upon a time, there was a humble cat named Yet. Yet loved to play with his friends in the warm sun. They would run, jump, and laugh all day long.
One day, Yet found a soft toy that he could squeeze. He loved to squeeze it with his little paws. Squeezing the toy made Yet so happy, he wanted to share it with his friends.
Yet showed the toy to his friends, and they all took turns squeezing it. They loved it too! They all played together, squeezing the toy and having fun. And that is how Yet and his friends had a great day with the new toy.

Once upon a time, there was a sweet little bird named Blue. Blue liked to fly high in the sky. One day, Blue saw a big tree and wanted to fly to the top.
Blue said to his friend, "I want to fly to the top of that tree. Can you help me?" His friend said, "Yes, let's start at the bottom and fly up together."
They started at the bottom and flew up, up, up. They were tired, but they did not give up. They reached the top and saw the beautiful view. They were happy they did it together.
The moral of the story is that when you work together with friends, you can reach great heights.

Once upon a time, in a big pond, there lived a green alligator. He liked to swim and play with his friends, the fish and the frogs. One day, the alligator found something new in the pond. He wanted to discover what it was, so he swam closer to take a look.
As the alligator got near, he saw that it was a big, shiny thing. He thought it was a toy, so he tried to play with it. But the shiny thing was not a toy, and it made a loud noise that scared all his friends away. The alligator felt very stupid for playing with something he did not know.
Later, the alligator's friends came back, and they all talked about the shiny thing. They learned that it was not safe to play with things they did not know. From that day on, the alligator and his friends were always careful and never played with unknown things again. And they all lived happily ever after. The moral of the story is to be careful and not to play with things you do not know.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was playing outside with her ball. Lily was very happy, but she was sometimes careless. She did not look where her ball went.
One day, a stranger came to the park. He had a big bag with him. The stranger saw Lily's ball go far away. He went to get it for her. Lily did not know the stranger, but she wanted her ball back.
The stranger said, "Here is your ball, Lily. Do you want to play with me?" Lily remembered what her mom told her. She should not accept things from strangers. Lily said, "No, thank you. I have to go home now."
Lily went home and told her mom about the stranger. Her mom was proud of her for not being careless. From that day on, Lily was more careful when she played outside. She never talked to strangers again.

One day, a big red tomato was sitting in the garden. It was very impressive. All the other fruits and vegetables looked at the tomato and wanted to be like it. The tomato was happy, but it felt lonely.
The tomato had an idea. It wanted to unite all the fruits and vegetables to make a big party. It talked to the apple, the banana, and the carrot. They all liked the idea and wanted to help. They went to tell everyone in the garden about the party.
On the day of the party, all the fruits and vegetables came together. They played games, danced, and had lots of fun. The tomato was not lonely anymore. They all became friends and promised to have more parties in the future.

One day, a dog named Bob saw a grill. The grill was big and black. Bob thought it smelled good. He wanted to find out what was on the grill. So, he walked closer to it. He saw a man standing by the grill. The man was cooking something. Bob could not see what it was. 
Bob said, "Hello, man. What are you cooking on the grill?" The man looked down at Bob and smiled. He said, "I am cooking something very special. You will see soon." Bob was excited. He wanted to know what the special thing was. He decided to wait and see.
After a while, the man took the food off the grill. It looked disgusting! Bob did not want to eat it. He decided to bow to the man and say thank you anyway. The man laughed and said, "You are a very polite dog, Bob. I will give you a treat instead." Bob was happy, and he enjoyed his treat.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She loved to play outside in the sun. One day, Sue wanted to make a big sand castle. She took her bucket and shovel and went to the sandbox.
Sue started to dig and found some dry sand. But she needed wet sand to make her castle strong. So, Sue went to get some water. She poured the water on the dry sand and mixed it to make it wet.
Sue used her hands to rub the wet sand and make it smooth. Then, she put the sand in her bucket and flipped it over. The sand castle came out perfect! Sue was so happy with her castle. She played in the sun all day with her new sand castle.

Once upon a time, there was a clever cat named Tom. He lived in a small house with a garage. Tom loved to play in the garage. One day, Tom was playing in the garage when he saw something new appear. It was a big, shiny box. Tom was very curious about the box.
Tom said, "What is this?" He went closer to the box and tried to open it. Inside the box, Tom found a magic hat. He put the hat on his head and suddenly, he could talk like a person!
"Wow, I can talk!" said Tom. He was very excited. Tom went to show his new trick to his friend, a little girl named Lucy. Lucy was very surprised to hear Tom talk. "How did you learn to talk?" she asked.
Tom told Lucy about the magic hat he found in the garage. Lucy was amazed. They decided to show the magic hat to their other friends. But when they went back to the garage, the hat was gone! Instead, they found a note that said, "Thank you for finding my hat. I hope you had fun. Love, the Magic Hat Fairy."
Tom and Lucy were sad that the magic hat was gone, but they were happy that they had a fun adventure together. They knew they would always remember the day Tom was a clever talking cat.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big, loud dog named Max. Max liked to bark and play all day. Lily and Max were best friends.
One day, Lily had a test at school. She was scared. But Max was there to help her. Max barked loud and made her laugh. Lily felt better and went to school.
Lily did well on her test. She was so happy. She ran home to Max and they both jumped and played. They had a party to celebrate. Lily and Max were so happy together.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. Tim liked to wear a big blue hat. His hat was very special. It was a modern hat that had a little box on it. The box was full of oxygen.
One day, Tim went to play with his friend, Sue. Sue saw Tim's hat and wanted to wear it too. But Tim did not want to share his hat. This made Sue very sad.
Tim saw Sue was sad and thought about it. He wanted to be a good friend. So, he let Sue wear the hat for a little while. They both felt happy and played all day. They learned that sharing can make everyone happy.

Once upon a time, in a little town, there was a boy named Tim. Tim had a little red bike with a tire that was not good. One day, Tim went for a ride with his friend, Sam. Sam said, "Tim, be careful! Your tire does not look good."
Tim and Sam went down the road and saw a big hill. Tim wanted to go fast down the hill, but Sam said, "No! Your tire is not good. It might end bad." Tim did not listen to Sam and went down the hill very fast.
As Tim went down the hill, his tire popped! He fell off his bike and felt sad. Sam came to help him. Tim said, "You were right, Sam. I should have listened." They walked back home, and Tim learned to listen to his friends.

One day, a little bird was worried. A big storm was coming. The wind was blowing and the sky was dark. The bird needed to find a safe place to stay.
The bird saw a big tree. The tree said, "Little bird, I will accept you. Come and stay with me." The bird was happy and went inside the tree. The tree kept the bird safe from the storm.
The storm went away and the sun came out. The bird was not worried anymore. The bird said, "Thank you, tree, for keeping me safe." The tree was happy to help the little bird.

Once there was a bear. He was a very sleepy bear. He lived in the forest and he liked to nap in his cozy bed. 
One day, the bear was packing up his things. He wanted to go on a journey. He asked his friend, the rabbit, to come with him. 
"I want to go and explore different places," the bear said. 
"Where do you plan to go?" asked the rabbit.
"I want to go far away and see lots of new things. We'll find the highest mountain. From the mountain peak you'll be able to see distant points," the bear replied. 
The rabbit thought this sounded like a lot of fun, so he agreed to come along.
So the bear and the rabbit packed their bags and set off on their journey. They hiked for days, chasing points on the horizon. The bear was tired and sleepy, but he kept going. 
Finally, they arrived at the peak of the highest mountain. The view was incredible! The sleepy bear was thankful he kept going. He and the rabbit had an amazing adventure.

Lily was a little girl who liked to play in the garden. She loved to smell the flowers and watch the bees and butterflies. One day, she saw a big flower that was very pretty. It had many colors and a long stem. Lily wanted to pick the flower and take it home.
But when she reached for the flower, it opened its mouth and showed its teeth. It was not a flower, but a plant that could bite. It made a loud noise and tried to scare Lily. Lily was very afraid and ran away. She cried and told her mom what happened.
Her mom hugged her and said, "I'm sorry, Lily. That was a terrible plant. It is called a pitcher plant. It eats insects and sometimes small animals. It pretends to be a flower to trick them. You should never touch it or go near it. It is very dangerous."
Lily nodded and said, "I understand, mom. I will be more careful next time. I will only pick the flowers that are nice and friendly. And I will not scare the bees and butterflies. They are good for the garden and the plants."
Her mom smiled and said, "That's right, Lily. You are a smart and kind girl. You learned a valuable lesson today. Always respect nature and its creatures. And never judge by appearances. Some things that look beautiful can be harmful, and some things that look scary can be helpful."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mandy. She was only three years old, but she was already a hard worker. Every day, Mandy would help clean the house and carry out other tasks. She had a pet dog, Spot, and she would always clean his fur and comb his tail. 
One day, Mandy and Spot went for a walk in the park. Spot barked and ran in circles around Mandy. Spot was so happy that he was running very fast and he didn't notice the slippery surface. Suddenly, he slipped and fell on his right heel. Mandy looked horrified as Spot howled in pain.
Mandy scooped Spot up in her arms and ran home as fast as she could. When she got home, her Mom took a look at Spot's heel and said, "I'm sorry, Mandy. Spot has broken his heel. We need to take him to the vet." 
Mandy felt sad and scared. What would the vet say? Would Spot ever be able to run and play in the park again? She took a deep breath and entered the vet's office. After a few minutes, the vet emerged with an apologetic look on his face. He shook his head and said, "I'm sorry, Mandy. You were very lucky that Spot only broke his heel. But it looks like he won't be able to play in the park or go for walks

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Billy. Billy loved to sing. He sang all day long. One day, while Billy was singing, he saw his friend, Kitty, looking sad.
"Kitty, why are you sad?" asked Billy. Kitty said, "I lost my toy and I need it to feel comfortable." Billy wanted to help his friend. So, they went to look for the toy together.
While they were looking, they heard a loud sound. It was an emergency! A little mouse was stuck in a hole. Billy and Kitty stopped looking for the toy to help the mouse. They worked together and saved the mouse.
After saving the mouse, they found Kitty's toy. Kitty was so happy and comfortable again. Billy, Kitty, and the mouse became best friends. They played and sang together every day.

Once upon a time, in a big palace, there lived a king and queen. They had a little girl named Lily. Lily liked to play outside in the sun. One day, it was very cold outside, but Lily still wanted to play.
Lily put on her warm coat and went outside. She saw many pretty leaves on the ground. She decided to gather the leaves to make a big pile. She picked up the leaves one by one and put them all together. Soon, she had a big pile of leaves.
Lily jumped into the big pile of leaves and laughed. She had so much fun playing in the cold. When she was done, she went back inside the palace to get warm. The king and queen gave her a big hug and they all had a happy day.

Jimmy was a 3 year old boy who was so excited to visit the park. He grabbed his penny, put it in his pocket and ran out.
When he arrived, he saw a big swing set. He jumped right in and started swinging. Then, he heard a yawn. He looked around and saw an old, scary man.
Jimmy got scared and tried to leave the swing but he couldn't. He started to cry. 
Suddenly, the old man stepped forward and smiled. He pushed the swing gently, while singing a soothing song. Jimmy still felt scared, but felt better after a while.
After a few minutes, the man stopped pushing the swing and handed him his penny back. Jimmy thanked him, jumped out of the swing and went back home.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the store with his mom. Tim saw some pants that he liked. They were red and had a picture of a spicy pepper on them. Tim said, "Mom, I want those pants!"
His mom looked at the pants and said, "Okay, Tim. We can get those pants for you." Tim was so happy. He put on the pants and went to the park with his mom.
At the park, Tim saw a big dog. The dog saw Tim's pants and thought the spicy pepper was a toy. The dog ran up to Tim and tried to grab the pepper on his pants. Tim was scared, but then the dog's owner came and said, "No, dog! That's not a toy!"
The dog stopped, and Tim was safe. The owner said, "I'm sorry, Tim. My dog likes spicy toys." Tim was not mad. He said, "It's okay. My pants are cool, and I like dogs too." Tim made a new friend, and they all played at the park together.

Once upon a time, there was a shy little girl named Lily. She loved to listen to stories. But she was too shy to ask for help when she needed it. One day, she saw a big book with a beautiful picture on the cover. She wanted to hear the story inside the book, but it was too high for her to reach.
Lily saw her friend, Sam the cat, walking by. She wanted to ask Sam for help, but she was too shy. Sam saw Lily looking sad and asked, "What's wrong, Lily?" Lily looked at the big book and said, "I want to hear the story, but it's too high for me." Sam looked at the book and said, "I can help you get the book!"
Sam jumped up and pushed the big book down. It fell on the floor, and Lily picked it up. She was so happy that Sam helped her. They sat down together, and Lily read the story out loud. They both loved the story, and Lily learned that it was okay to ask for help. From that day on, she wasn't shy anymore, and she always asked her friends for help when she needed it.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He loved to play with his big, round basketball. Tim was very gifted at playing with the basketball. He could make it go up and down, and he could throw it far away.
One day, Tim met a little girl named Sue. Sue did not like playing with the basketball. She said, "I hate basketball. I like to play with dolls." Tim was sad because he wanted to play with Sue, but he loved his basketball.
So Tim and Sue thought of a way to play together. They took the basketball and put it in a big box. Then they put Sue's dolls in the box too. Now they could play with the basketball and the dolls at the same time. Tim and Sue were happy and became best friends.

One day, a cat and a dog were playing near a big tree. The cat saw a spicy red fruit up in the tree. The cat said to the dog, "I need that fruit! Can you help me find a way to get it?"
The dog thought for a moment and said, "I have an idea! I will lift you up with my back, then you can reach the fruit." So the cat climbed on the dog's back and tried to get the fruit. But it was still too high.
Just then, a big bird flew by and saw them. The bird said, "I can help you get the fruit!" The cat and the dog were happy. The bird picked up the cat and flew up to the fruit. The cat grabbed the spicy red fruit and the bird flew back down.
But when they got back to the ground, the cat didn't want to share the fruit with the dog and the bird. The cat said, "I don't need you anymore. I have the fruit now!" The cat ran away with the spicy red fruit.
The dog and the bird were very sad. They didn't expect the cat to be so mean. They decided to not play with the cat anymore. The cat was alone with the spicy red fruit, but had no friends to share it with.

One day, a beautiful girl named Lily wanted to mail a letter to her friend, Tom. She put the letter in a blue box near her house. As she walked back, she saw a big hose on the ground. It was long and green.
Lily asked her mom, "Can I play with the hose?" Her mom said, "Yes, but be careful not to get wet!" Lily was happy and started to play with the hose. She made water come out and it went all over the grass.
But then, Tom came running and said, "Hey, my letter is all wet!" Lily was sad and said, "I'm sorry, Tom. I didn't mean to get your letter wet." Tom was upset, but he knew it was an accident. They both decided to dry the letter under the sun and then read it together.

Once upon a time, there was a strong girl named Mia. Mia had many toys and gears to play with. One day, Mia saw a big box. She knew something fun was inside.
Mia tried to open the box, but it was stuck. She asked her friend Tom for help. Tom did not know how to open the box, so he just gave a shrug. Mia and Tom tried to think of a way to open the box.
Then, Mia remembered her strong gears. She used the gears to open the box. Inside, they found more toys to play with. Mia and Tom were very happy. They played with their new toys all day long.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a bald tree. The bald tree was sad because he had no leaves. All the other trees had many leaves, and they were happy. The bald tree wanted to have leaves too.
One day, a little leaf was walking in the forest. The little leaf saw the bald tree and said, "Hi, bald tree! Why are you sad?" The bald tree said, "I am sad because I have no leaves. Can you help me?" The little leaf said, "Yes, I can help you. I will drop on you, and you will have one leaf."
The little leaf dropped on the bald tree, and the bald tree was very happy. But then, a big wind came. The wind blew the little leaf away. The bald tree was sad again because he was bald and had no leaves.
The other trees in the forest laughed at the bald tree. They said, "You will always be bald and have no leaves." The bald tree was very sad, and he cried. The little leaf tried to come back, but the wind was too strong. The bald tree stayed sad and bald, and the other trees kept laughing at him.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was always anxious when he played outside. One day, while playing, he found a knife on the ground. He picked it up and ran to his mom.
"Mom, I found a knife!" Tim said. His mom was worried and told him to be careful. "We must change what we do with it," she said. They decided to put it in a safe place so no one would get hurt.
Later, Tim's friend, Sam, came over to play. They were running and laughing when Sam tripped and fell on the knife. Sam cried out loud, and Tim's mom came running. She saw what happened and called for help. But it was too late, Sam was hurt very bad. Everyone was sad, and they wished they had been more careful with the knife.

Once upon a time, there was a messy boy named Tim. Tim loved to eat cereal every morning. His mom would always tell him to be careful, but he would always make a mess.
One day, Tim's mom gave him a big sack to put his cereal in. She thought it would help him be less messy. Tim was very happy and put all of his cereal in the sack.
The next morning, Tim tried to eat his cereal from the sack. But it was still messy! Cereal spilled all over the floor. Tim's mom laughed and helped him clean up. They decided to keep trying new ways to make Tim's breakfast less messy.

Once upon a time, there was an enormous monkey. He lived high up in the trees of the jungle. Every day he would perform amazing tricks to show off his skills.
One day, a little three-year old girl came to watch the monkey. She was so amazed by his performance that she clapped her hands.
The little girl said, "Monkey, that was so great! Can you do more?"
The monkey smiled and jumped from tree to tree. He did somersaults and backflips, and even flipped off the branches of the trees.
The girl gasped in amazement. She said, "Monkey you are the best performer in the jungle!"
The monkey smiled and thanked her for her kind words. He wished her a goodbye and disappeared into the jungle. The little girl knew she had seen an enormous monkey perform some of the most amazing tricks she had ever seen.

Once upon a time, a little seed was in a hole. The sun was up, and the rain came down. The seed wanted to bloom and be a big flower. But the ground was hard, and it was not easy for the seed to grow.
One day, a small worm came to the hole. The worm said, "I can help you bloom." The seed was happy. The worm made the hard ground soft, and the seed started to grow. The seed grew and grew, and soon it was a beautiful flower.
But then, something unexpected happened. The flower did not look like the other flowers. It was big and had many colors. All the other flowers were small and had only one color. The big flower was sad. But the worm said, "You are special. You are not like the other flowers, and that is good." The big flower smiled and knew that being different was not bad. The big flower and the worm were happy and became best friends.

One day, a little boy named Tim went to the doctor with his mom. Tim was not feeling well. The doctor was a kind man who made it easy for Tim to talk to him.
The doctor asked Tim, "What is wrong, Tim?" Tim replied, "My head hurts and I feel hot." The doctor checked Tim's head and gave him some medicine.
Soon, Tim felt better. He thanked the doctor and said, "You are the best doctor ever!" The doctor replied, "Thank you, Tim! I am happy to help you feel better." Tim and his mom went home, and Tim played with his toys all day.

Once upon a time there was a King. He was very honest and he always tried to do the right thing. He leaned out of his window every day to listen to the people in his kingdom. He wanted to keep their lives happy and safe.
The King asked for advice from wise people. But he often found himself leaning on the children for answers. They were always so full of ideas and so honest in their views. 
One day the King asked a young girl what she thought he should do. She leaned in close and with a serious face she said "Make everyone happy". The King was so surprised at her answer, he thanked her and promised to do his best. 
He spent the days and weeks doing his best to make all the people in his kingdom happy. The King was leaning on all of them to work together, to help one another and to be honest to each other.
In the end, the King was able to make the kingdom a happy place to be. People were kind, honest, and full of hope for the future. The King was grateful for the advice of the little girl, who had helped him to make his kingdom a better place.

Once upon a time, in a big city, there was a small dog named Max. Max was always excited to play with his friends. They would run and jump in the park every day.
One day, Max saw a big red ball. He wanted to keep it and play with it. He picked it up in his mouth and carried it to his friends. They were so happy and excited to play with the new ball.
Max and his friends played with the ball all day. They would throw it and catch it, and Max would keep bringing it back. They had so much fun in the big city park. And from that day on, Max and his friends were even more excited to play together.

Once upon a time, there were two best friends, Sam and Emily. Sam was a playful little girl and Emily was a little mouse.
One morning, Sam decided to take Emily on an adventure. Together, they set off into the maze that was in the woods.
They had lots of fun exploring the paths. Emily even showed Sam her secret hiding spot! However, as the day was winding down, Sam got tired and wanted to settle down for the night.
But Emily did not want to go yet. Instead, she wanted to play longer. She begged and pleaded with Sam to let them stay longer.
"No, Emily," said Sam. "We must go now."
But Emily kept pleading, so Sam gave in. Together, they stayed in the maze until late at night. Suddenly, they heard a loud noise. It was a ferocious bear! 
The bear growled as it approached Sam and Emily. The two friends were very scared. They had no way to escape the angry bear.
The bear attacked both of them and they were never seen again. The maze was no longer a playful place to explore.

Tim and Lily were friends who liked to play outside. One day, they found a kite in the park. It was modest, with blue and yellow colors and a long tail. They wanted to fly the kite together.
"Can I hold the kite first?" Tim asked.
"OK, but only for a little bit. Then you have to give it to me," Lily said.
They took turns holding the kite and running with it. The wind made the kite go high in the sky. They felt happy and laughed.
But then, a big dog came to the park. It saw the kite and wanted to play with it. It barked and ran after the kite. Tim and Lily got scared.
"Let go of the kite!" Lily shouted.
"No, the dog will get it!" Tim said.
They pulled the kite hard, but the dog was faster. It jumped and bit the kite. The kite ripped and fell to the ground. The dog ran away with the tail.
Tim and Lily were sad. They looked at the broken kite.
"I'm sorry, Lily. I should have let go of the kite," Tim said.
"It's OK, Tim. It was not your fault. The dog was bad," Lily said.
They hugged and decided to leave the kite in the park. Maybe someone else could fix it. They went home and played with their toys. They were still friends.

Lily and Tom were friends. They liked to play in the park. One day, they saw a new boy sitting on a bench. He had a blue hat and a blue bike.
"Who is he?" Lily asked Tom.
"I don't know. Let's say hello," Tom said.
They walked to the bench and smiled at the boy.
"Hi, we are Lily and Tom. What is your name?" Lily said.
"Hi, I am Ben. I just moved here with my mom and dad," Ben said.
"Welcome to our park. Do you want to play with us?" Tom said.
"Yes, please. I like to play," Ben said.
They took turns riding the bike and playing on the swings. They had fun and laughed a lot. Ben was happy to make new friends. Lily and Tom were happy to have a new friend.
"Ben, you are very nice. And your bike is very reliable. It doesn't break or fall," Lily said.
"Thank you, Lily. You are very kind. And your hat is very pretty. It has flowers and ribbons," Ben said.
"Thank you, Ben. You are very sweet. And your hat is very cool. It has stars and stripes," Tom said.
They hugged and smiled. They were friends. They liked the park. They liked the blue. They liked the reliable.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He liked to collect rocks. One day, he found a big, shiny rock. It was so shiny that it looked like a flashlight. Tim was very happy.
Tim showed the shiny rock to his friend, Sam. Sam said, "Wow! That's not a bad rock, Tim! It's a great rock!" Tim smiled and said, "Thank you, Sam. I love to collect rocks. Do you want to help me find more?"
Sam and Tim went to the park to look for more rocks. They used Tim's flashlight to see in the dark. They found a lot of rocks, but none were as shiny as the first one. They put all the rocks in a big bag.
At the end of the day, Tim and Sam were tired but happy. They had a lot of fun collecting rocks together. The shiny rock was still the best rock they found. They couldn't wait to go on another adventure together.

Once upon a time, there was a kind bear. The bear wanted to go to the party and so he went to the store to buy a costume. 
When he got inside, he saw lots of colorful costumes and was so excited! He wanted to buy the most beautiful one. He asked the storekeeper, "How much does it cost?" 
The storekeeper smiled and said, "It costs seven sweet apples." 
The bear thought it was a lot, so he went away sadly. He was too poor to buy the costume. 
Just then, a friendly fox came up to him and said, "I know you don't have enough money to buy the costume, so let's eat some apples and make our own costume!" 
The bear was so happy that he hugged the fox. Together, they made a beautiful costume using apples! 
At the party, everyone was amazed by their costume - it was a hit! 
The moral of the story is that sometimes, when you don't have enough money, you can still be kind and come up with creative solutions.

One day, a little girl named Amy wanted to act like a big girl. She saw her mom light a candle at night. Amy thought, "I can do that too. I will be independent."
Amy found a candle and a box of matches. She tried to light the candle. But, it was hard. She did not know how to use the matches. Her big brother Tom saw her and said, "Amy, you should not play with matches. It is not safe."
Amy felt sad. She wanted to be independent. Tom hugged her and said, "It's okay to ask for help. We can light the candle together." So, they went to their mom and asked for help. Their mom showed them how to light the candle safely. Amy was happy. She learned that it's okay to ask for help and still be independent.

Once upon a time there was an old man called Grandpa Joe. Grandpa Joe was walking through a forest when he heard a sound. He stopped to see what it was and he was surprised to see a little bird.
"Hello there!" said Grandpa Joe.
The bird said nothing but hopped closer to Grandpa Joe. It had something in its beak.
"What have you got there?" Grandpa Joe asked the bird.
The bird opened its beak and Grandpa Joe saw that it was a rub. He opened his hand and the bird dropped the rub into his hand. Grandpa Joe closed his hand to keep it safe.
The bird hopped over to a bush and pointed to some berries. Grandpa Joe reached to pick one but the bird shook his head.
"These are too spicy for you," the bird said. "But I like them very much."
Grandpa Joe smiled and thanked the bird for the rub. Then he started walking back home and the bird watched him go.

Once upon a time, there was a fat cat who liked to play with puzzles. Every day, the cat would take one of her puzzles and try to solve it. One day, the cat was playing near a big, glowing light. It was so pretty that the cat just had to try and make the light part of her puzzle. 
She brushed it off the ground and put it into the middle of her puzzle. Then, the cat moved the pieces around, matching the shapes and colors. Suddenly, the light started to shine even brighter. It was so beautiful that the cat was amazed.
The cat quickly finished her puzzle and the light made the whole thing glow. It was like a magic puzzle! The cat was so happy that she laughed and danced. She wanted to show everyone her special puzzle so she took it with her wherever she went. 
The cat was so proud of her puzzle that she kept it forever. It was full of puzzles and glowing things, and it made her happy every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside with her friends. They had a lot of fun running, jumping, and laughing.
One day, Lily's friends were upset because they couldn't find the ball they used to play catch. They looked everywhere, but the ball was nowhere to be found. Then, Lily had an idea. She said, "Maybe the ball is in the shed. Let's look there!"
Lily and her friends went to the shed, but it was locked. They didn't know what to do. Then, Lily's dad came outside and saw the sad faces. He asked, "What's wrong, kids?" Lily told her dad about the lost ball and the locked shed.
Lily's dad smiled and said, "Don't worry, I have the key!" He unlocked the shed, and there was the ball! Lily and her friends were so happy. They thanked Lily's dad and went back to playing catch. They had lots of fun for the rest of the day.

Once upon a time, there was a smart cat named Tom. Tom lived in a big house. One day, Tom saw a ghost in the house. The ghost was white and had a big smile. Tom was not scared, but he paused to think.
Tom had an idea. He went to find his friend, the dog named Max. Tom told Max about the ghost. Max was scared, but Tom said they should play a game with the ghost. They both went to find the ghost and play with it.
When they found the ghost, they saw it was not a ghost at all! It was a white bed sheet with a smiley face on it. Tom and Max laughed and played with the sheet. They had fun and were not scared anymore. The smart cat and the brave dog had a great day together.

One day, a boy named Tim saw a big aeroplane in the sky. He liked the aeroplane very much. He told his mom, "I want to fly in an aeroplane one day." His mom said, "I promise, you will fly in an aeroplane when you are a big boy."
Tim was very happy. He waited and waited to be a big boy. One day, he met a generous man. The man said, "I have a toy aeroplane. Do you want to play with it?" Tim said, "Yes, thank you!"
But then, something unexpected happened. The toy aeroplane turned into a real aeroplane! Tim was so surprised. The generous man said, "I am a magic man. I can make your wish come true. You can fly in the aeroplane now." Tim was very happy and flew in the aeroplane. The magic man kept his mom's promise.

One day, a little boy named Tim was excited to eat his breakfast. He had a big sausage on his plate. Tim loved sausages more than anything. He could not wait to take a big bite.
As he was about to eat, a big bird flew into the window. The bird saw the sausage and wanted it too. It tried to take the sausage away from Tim. Tim did not want to share his sausage with the bird. He was sad and angry.
Tim had an idea to save his sausage. He made the sausage rise high in the air with a big balloon. The bird could not reach it anymore. Tim was happy and excited again. He ate his sausage and enjoyed his breakfast. The bird flew away, still hungry.

Little Cookie was a three year old girl who had never experienced anything quite as special as her aunt's garden. She marveled at the plants, shrubs and trees as if they were truly alive. As she walked around she noticed a big mound of dirt near the entrance. She ran up to it and looked over it, finding a little creature hiding inside. 
"What is it?" Little Cookie asked, excitedly.
"That's a mole," her aunt replied. "He lives in the ground and likes to dig around in the earth." 
Little Cookie was amazed. She wanted to learn more about the mole and asked her aunt teach her. Her aunt agreed and used her shoulder to help Little Cookie get down to the mole's level. Little Cookie was quickly impressed by the mole's impressive digging skills. 
But it didn't end well. A few minutes later the dirt collapsed on top of them and the mole escaped. Little Cookie was sad and had learned a valuable lesson.

One day, a boy named Tim and his dog, Spot, went to the park. They wanted to have a fun day outside. Tim had a big tent in his bag. He thought it would be fun to put it up in the park. The sun was hot, so the tent would give them shade.
Tim and Spot found a nice spot to put up the tent. As they worked, Tim said to Spot, "I hope nothing sour happens today." They finished putting up the tent and went to play. They played catch and ran around. They were very happy.
After a while, they went back to the tent. But, oh no! The tent was gone! Tim was sad and said, "I knew something sour would happen." They looked around and saw a man with the tent. The man said, "I thought this was mine. I am sorry." Tim was happy again. They all had a fun day at the park.

One day, a curious little girl named Lily went for a walk. She saw a big tree with round green things. Lily wanted to see what they were. She tried to jump and raise her hand to touch them.
Lily's mom came and said, "Those are avocados, sweetie!" Lily smiled and wanted to have one. Her mom helped her to pick an avocado from the tree. They took it home to eat.
At home, Lily and her mom cut the avocado. They shared it and ate it. It was yummy! Lily was happy she found a new food she liked. She couldn't wait to tell her friends about the avocado.

Once upon a time, there was a big bear and a little bird. They were best friends who lived in a nice, warm cave. One day, it was very cold and icy outside. The big bear and the little bird wanted to play, but they knew they had to wait.
The big bear had some work to do. He had to find food for them to eat. The little bird wanted to help, but the big bear said, "No, you sit here and stay warm." The little bird did not want to sit. He wanted to help his friend.
The little bird thought of a plan. He went outside the cave and found a big tree with lots of berries. He flew back to the cave and told the big bear. The big bear was happy and they both went to the tree. They ate the berries and were full. The big bear thanked the little bird for helping him with his work. They both went back to their warm cave and played all day.

Once upon a time, in a big sea, there was a little shrimp. The shrimp had a lot of friends. They all played together and had fun. But there was one fish who did not like to play. This fish was not nice. He would say, "I hate playing with you, shrimp."
One day, the shrimp and his friends were playing. They were having a lot of fun. But then, something unexpected happened. The mean fish got stuck in a big net. He could not get out. The shrimp saw the fish and felt bad.
The shrimp wanted to be compassionate. He went to the fish and said, "I will help you get out of the net." The shrimp and his friends worked together. They got the mean fish out of the net. The mean fish was surprised. He said, "Thank you, shrimp. I am sorry for hating you." After that, the mean fish was nice, and they all played together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She loved to play with her toy kitchen. One day, Lucy wanted to make a cake. She took her fake toy cake and wanted to make it look real. So, she found some powder in the kitchen.
Lucy took the powder and put it all over her fake cake. She was so happy to finish her cake. She showed it to her mom and said, "Look, I made a real cake!" Her mom smiled and said, "That's a great cake, but that's not real powder."
Lucy looked at the powder on her cake. It was not sugar like she thought. It was baby powder! Lucy and her mom laughed. They cleaned up the mess and made a real cake together. And that's when Lucy learned that even fake cakes can make real fun.

Once there was a little girl named Mary. She wanted to join the birds playing in the sky, but she was too small. The birds told her to come over, but she could not find them in the sky. 
The birds asked her why she was so confused. Mary told them she just wanted to join them in the sky. The birds then said to look under the tree. Mary looked and saw the birds playing together. 
She was so happy that she asked them to join her on the ground. She was so excited to have the birds join her. They all had a wonderful time playing together. 
Mary was not confused anymore because she knew that she could join the birds, no matter how small she was.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a very easy life. He played with his toys, ate his favorite food, and had a lot of fun with his friends. Tim's mommy and daddy always told him to mind his manners and be kind to others.
One sunny day, Tim went to the park with his mommy. He saw a small bug on a leaf. Tim was very curious about the bug's life. He asked his mommy, "What does the bug do all day?" His mommy said, "The bug works hard to find food and take care of its family, just like we do."
Tim wanted to help the bug. He decided to mind the bug and make its life easy. He gave the bug a small piece of his apple. The bug was very happy and thanked Tim. From that day on, Tim always tried to help others and make their lives easy too.

Once upon a time, there was a big cow. The cow had a friend named Tim. Tim and the cow liked to play in the mud. They were always messy.
One day, Tim and the cow found some beef. They did not know what to do with it. They decided to eat it. But, they did not know it was cow food. They thought it was just a yummy snack.
As they ate the beef, something unexpected happened. The cow started to talk! "Oh no!" said the cow. "I can talk now! We should not eat beef anymore." Tim and the cow were very surprised. They decided to eat other food from then on. They were still messy, but they were happy.

There was a yellow jellyfish named Jilly. She lived in the big blue sea with her family. Jilly loved to play with her friends, the little fish.
One day, Jilly's mom told her to send a message to her grandma. She said, "Jilly, please go and tell grandma we will visit her tomorrow." Jilly was happy to help her mom and go on an adventure.
Jilly swam through the sea, passing her fish friends along the way. She finally reached grandma's house and told her the message. Grandma was very happy to hear that they were coming to visit. Jilly went back home, excited to see grandma again tomorrow.

Eric and his mom went to the beach. They put on their bathing suits, and Eric jumped into the water. He held his nose and dove down deep, looking for something special.
Eric's mom yelled after him, "Be careful Eric! Watch out for sharp rocks!"
Eric kept looking, and he finally found something buried near the bottom. He grabbed it and brought it back to his mom. It was a treasure chest!
When they opened the chest, they found lots of soft stones, with beautiful colors shimmering inside. Eric's mom held them up, and smiled at Eric.
"Thank you for diving to the ocean floor," she said. "These stones are full of truth. They can give us all the answers we need if we take the time to listen and watch."
