Eric was happy to find the stones, but the trip to the ocean floor left him feeling a bit hurt. He had scraped his elbow on a sharp rock.
Eric's mom hugged him and said, "No matter what, remember that the truth will always set you free. Now let's go back to the beach and enjoy the sun!"

Once upon a time, in a big green forest, there was a little red bird named Polly. Polly was a polite bird who loved to help her friends. One day, she decided to go on a long journey to find a new home for her family.
On her journey, Polly met a big, strong bear named Benny. Benny was sad because his home was destroyed by a storm. Polly wanted to protect Benny, so she asked him to join her journey. Together, they looked for a new home.
While they were looking, they found a beautiful tree that was perfect for both of them. But, there was a twist! The tree was already home to a friendly squirrel named Sammy. Instead of being upset, they all decided to share the tree and protect each other. The moral of the story is that sharing and helping others can make everyone happy.

Once upon a time, there was a modest girl named Lucy. She liked to enjoy her time outside. Lucy loved to watch the cars go by in the traffic. She would clap and laugh as the cars zoomed by.
One day, Lucy sat by the road to watch the traffic. But, something unexpected happened. A big, red car stopped right in front of her. Lucy was very surprised. She had never seen a car stop like that before.
Out of the car came a big, fluffy dog. The dog ran to Lucy and gave her a big, wet kiss. Lucy laughed and played with the dog. They became best friends. From that day on, Lucy and the dog enjoyed watching the traffic together.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Luis. He was very stubborn, and rarely listened to anyone. One day, Luis wanted to pick a new house to live in. He looked around the neighbourhood, and chose a beautiful house. 
"This is the one!" he said.
But then, his little brother Tommy disagreed. He said they should choose a different house instead.
"No, I like this one!" said Luis, determined to stay with his choice.
Tommy grew frustrated and argued, but Luis was too stubborn to change his mind. 
So, Luis and his family moved into the house. But the house was not safe - it was full of mice and spiders! The family had to move out, and Luis never got to choose his house ever again.

Once upon a time, there was a strong bird named Bobo. Bobo lived in a cage in a little girl's room. The little girl, named Lily, loved Bobo very much. Every day, she would open the cage and let Bobo fly around the room.
One day, when Lily was at school, Bobo saw the window was open. He thought, "I want to see the outside world!" So, he flew out of the window. But, when he was outside, he started to panic. "Oh no! How do I get back to Lily?" he cried.
Just then, a kind dog named Max heard Bobo's cries. Max said, "Don't worry, Bobo! I will help you." Max was very smart and knew how to open doors. He led Bobo back to Lily's house and opened the door for him. Bobo flew back into his cage, feeling very happy and safe. When Lily came home, she was so surprised to see Max in her room. "Thank you, Max, for helping Bobo!" she said. From that day on, Max, Lily, and Bobo became the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a big blue ball. It was the perfect size to play with. A little boy named Tim and his friend, Sam, loved to play with the blue ball. They would push the ball to each other in the park.
One sunny day, Tim and Sam were playing with the blue ball. Tim said, "Let's see who can push the ball the farthest!" Sam agreed and said, "OK, I will go first!" Sam pushed the ball as hard as he could.
Just as the ball was about to stop, a big gust of wind came. The wind pushed the blue ball even farther! Tim and Sam were surprised. They laughed and said, "Wow, the wind helped us push the ball! Let's try again and see if the wind will help us again!" And they continued to play with the big blue ball, having lots of fun.

Once upon a time, in a distant land, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big thumb. One day, she met a boy named Tom. Tom had a small thumb. They became friends and played together.
One day, they saw a big tree with pretty red fruits. Lily said, "I want to have fruits. Can you help me?" Tom said, "Yes, let's try!" Lily tried to reach the fruits with her big thumb, but she could not. Tom tried to reach the fruits with his small thumb, but he could not, too.
Then, they had a good idea. They stood on each other's shoulders, and Tom reached the fruits with his small thumb. They were so happy and shared the fruits. The moral of the story is that we can do things together that we cannot do alone.

Once upon a time, there was a chubby bunny named Bobo. He lived in a big forest with his family. They liked to play and hop around all day.
One day, Bobo saw a big carrot lying on the ground. He ran to his mommy and said, "Look, mommy! A big carrot!" His mommy looked worried and said, "Bobo, be careful. It could be a trap." But Bobo didn't listen and went to get the carrot.
As Bobo tried to take the carrot, he got caught in the trap. He was very scared and called for his mommy. His mommy came running and tried to help him, but she couldn't open the trap. Bobo was stuck in the trap, and he was very sad.
The moral of the story is to always listen to your mommy and daddy, because they know what is best for you.

Lily likes to help her mom cook. She likes to stir the sauce in the pot. She likes to smell the sauce. It smells good. Mom says the sauce is for pasta. Lily likes pasta.
Mom gives Lily a spoon. She says, "Taste the sauce, Lily. Tell me if it is fine." Lily puts the spoon in her mouth. She tastes the sauce. It is hot and sweet and sour. Lily makes a face. She does not like the sauce. She says, "No, mom. The sauce is not fine. It is yucky."
Mom laughs. She says, "Don't worry, Lily. The sauce will be fine when we add some cheese and herbs. Do you want to help me?" Lily nods. She likes cheese and herbs. She hopes they will make the sauce fine. She says, "Yes, mom. I want to help you. Maybe the sauce will be fine then."

Once upon a time, there was a loyal dog named Buddy. Buddy loved to play with his best friend, a little girl named Anna. They played all day, running and jumping in the warm sun.
One day, Anna and Buddy were playing a game of catch. Anna threw the ball far, and Buddy ran very quick to get it. As Buddy was running back, he saw a big door start to close. Anna was on the other side of the door, and Buddy knew he had to get to her.
Buddy ran as fast as he could and made it through the door just before it closed. "Wow, Buddy!" said Anna. "You are so fast!" As they hugged, they heard a soft meow. They looked down and saw a little lost cat. The cat was scared, but Buddy and Anna took her home and made her part of their family. The cat was very thankful, and they all became best friends.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a long string. He wanted to play with it. He decided to tie the string to his toy car. "Now my car can go fast," he said.
Tim went to his friend Sue's house. Sue had a toy car too. She saw Tim's car with the string and said, "Wow! Your car is cool." Tim felt happy.
They played with their cars and raced them. After a while, they felt hungry. So, they went inside Sue's house and asked her mom for a snack. Sue's mom gave them a zip bag with cookies inside. They ate the cookies and played with their cars again, having a fun day together.

Once upon a time, there was a ranch. On this ranch, there were many different animals. There were cows, pigs, chickens, and even horses. They all lived together and played together.
One day, a little cow named Daisy did something bad. She ate all the apples that the other animals wanted to eat. The other animals were mad at Daisy. They did not want to play with her anymore.
Daisy felt sad and said, "I am sorry. Please forgive me." The other animals thought about it. They knew that everyone makes mistakes. They decided to forgive Daisy. They all played together again and lived happily on the ranch.

Once upon a time, in a big zoo, there was a lively rhinoceros named Remy. Remy loved to play with his friends. They would run, jump, and have lots of fun together.
One day, Remy saw a big tree with yummy leaves. He wanted to eat them, but they were too high for him. Remy called his friend, a tall giraffe named Gabby. "Gabby, can you help me pick the leaves?" Remy asked.
Gabby was happy to help. She stretched her long neck and picked the leaves for Remy. They both ate the leaves and had a great time. After that, Remy and Gabby played with their friends in the zoo. They were very happy and had a fun day together. The end.

Ben and Lily are playing a game. They have cards with animals on them. They take turns to pick a card and show it to the other. Then they have to make the sound of the animal. If they make the right sound, they get a point. If they make the wrong sound, they lose a point.
Ben picks a card with a lion on it. He shows it to Lily and says "Roar!" Lily nods and says "Good, Ben. You get a point." She points to a jar where they keep their points. Ben smiles and puts his card in a pile.
Lily picks a card with a duck on it. She shows it to Ben and says "Quack!" Ben shakes his head and says "No, Lily. That is not a duck. That is a goose. You lose a point." He points to a jar where they take away their points. Lily frowns and puts her card in another pile.
They keep playing until they have no more cards. Then they count their points. Ben has six points and Lily has four points. Ben says "I win! I have more points than you." He jumps up and down and claps his hands. Lily says "No fair! You had easier cards than me." She crosses her arms and pouts.
Their mom comes in and sees them. She says "What are you doing, kids? Are you having fun?" Ben says "Yes, mom. We are playing a game. I win!" Lily says "No, mom. We are playing a game. He cheats!" Their mom says "Oh, dear. How about we play another game? A quiet game. A game where you have to guess what I am thinking. Do you want to play?" Ben and Lily say "Yes, mom. We want to play." They sit down and listen to their mom. They hope they will win the new game.

Lily and Tom were brother and sister. They liked to play together, but sometimes they fought. One day, they wanted to cook a cake for their mom, who was at work. They found a recipe book and some ingredients in the kitchen.
"Let's make a chocolate cake. It's mom's favorite," Lily said.
"No, let's make a lemon cake. It's more yummy," Tom said.
They argued and argued, and did not listen to each other. They mixed chocolate and lemon and flour and eggs and sugar and butter in a big bowl. They poured the batter into a pan and put it in the oven. They did not set the timer or check the temperature.
Soon, the kitchen was full of smoke. The cake was burned and black. The oven was hot and red. Lily and Tom were scared and ran to the living room. They heard a loud beep. It was the smoke alarm. They heard a knock on the door. It was the fireman.
"What happened here?" the fireman asked.
"We wanted to cook a cake for mom, but we fought and made a mess," Lily and Tom said.
The fireman helped them turn off the oven and open the windows. He gave them a hug and a glass of water. He told them to be careful and to work together.
"Mom will be home soon. You can still make her happy. Why don't you draw her a lovely picture or write her a nice card?" he suggested.
Lily and Tom nodded. They felt sorry and ashamed. They thanked the fireman and went to their room. They found some paper and crayons and markers. They drew a lovely picture of their mom and wrote a nice card. They said they were sorry and they loved her.
When mom came home, she saw the smoke and the burned cake. She was worried and angry. But then she saw the lovely picture and the nice card. She smiled and hugged Lily and Tom. She told them she loved them too.
She said, "Cooking a cake is a nice idea, but you have to follow the rules and respect each other. Fighting and making a mess is not good. Next time, let's cook together and share our ideas. OK?"
Lily and Tom said, "OK, mom. We're sorry. We learned our lesson."
They all went to the sofa and cuddled. They watched a funny movie and ate some cookies. They were happy and cozy. The end.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a boy named Tim. Tim had a toy that he loved to play with every day. One day, Tim met another boy named Sam. Sam also had a toy. Tim wanted to play with Sam's toy, but Sam said no.
Tim and Sam began to fight over the toy. They pulled and tugged on it, but neither of them would let go. Tim's mom saw the fight and came to stop it. She told the boys that fighting was not nice and that they should share their toys. Tim and Sam felt ignorant for fighting over the toy.
Tim's mom put a bandage on Sam's hand because he got a small ouchie from the fight. Tim said sorry to Sam and Sam said sorry to Tim. They both learned that sharing is better than fighting. From that day on, Tim and Sam became best friends and always shared their toys with each other. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a cord. It was a very long cord. The cord was not happy. It felt terrible. It wanted to be free and wave in the wind.
One day, the cord saw a tree. The tree had big, strong arms. The cord had an idea. It asked the tree for help. The tree said yes.
The tree took the cord and threw it up high. The cord waved in the wind. It was so happy. But then, something unexpected happened. The wind carried the cord far away from the tree. The cord was now free and could wave all the time.

Once upon a time, there was a jolly cat named Pinky. Pinky was a pink cat who loved to play with her friends. They would run, jump, and play all day long.
One day, Pinky and her friends played a game called "surrender". To play, one friend would try to catch the others. When they caught someone, that friend would say "surrender" and join the catcher. Soon, everyone was playing and having fun.
In the end, all of Pinky's friends said "surrender" and they all laughed. They were happy to play together. Pinky and her friends were the best of friends, and they played many more games after that day. The jolly pink cat and her friends lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was an elderly dog named Max. Max was very old and sometimes had a leak when he was sleeping. He lived in a small house with a little girl named Lily.
One day, Lily saw the leak on the floor and said, "Max, you had a leak again!" Max felt sad and said, "I'm sorry, Lily." Lily looked at Max and said, "I forgive you, Max. You are old and it's okay."
From that day on, Lily and Max played together and had lots of fun. They knew that sometimes leaks happen, but they always forgave each other and stayed best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. He had a big book with many pages. Tim loved to read his book every day. One day, he saw a cheap toy in the store. He wanted to buy it, but he didn't have any money.
Tim had an idea. He could raise money by selling some pages from his book. So, he tore out a few pages and went to the park. There, he met a girl named Sue. Sue wanted to buy a page, but she didn't have any money too.
Tim and Sue were sad. They both wanted something, but they couldn't buy it. Then, they had an idea. Tim gave Sue a page from his book, and Sue gave Tim her toy. They were both happy and became good friends.

One day, a little girl named Sue went to the park with her mom. She saw a big rock with a small crack in it. Sue wanted to lift the rock and see what was under it. Her mom said, "Be careful, Sue. You might find something under there."
The next day, Sue went back to the park with her dad. She wanted to lift the big rock with the crack again. Sue's dad said, "Maybe we can find a tool to help you lift it." They found an empty box and put it under the rock, but it was still too heavy.
On the third day, Sue went to the park with her big brother. He was very strong. Sue asked him to help her lift the big rock with the crack. Together, they lifted the rock and found a hidden treasure under it! Sue was so happy that she never gave up. And from that day on, Sue knew that if she tried hard, she could do anything.

Once upon a time there was a chicken named Claire. She was very nice and gentle. Claire loved to eat yummy food.
One day, Claire was walking in the park when she saw a small kitten. It was meowing loudly in search of food. Claire had compassion for the little kitten and decided to share her food. She bit off a small piece of her food and fed the little kitten.
The kitten thanked Claire by purring and licking her beak. They became friends.
The next day, the kitten was back. This time, it had a surprise for Claire. It had found a piece of cooked chicken from the kitchen. The kitten offered it to Claire as a thank you for the kindness that she had shown it.
Claire was so surprised and happy. She bit into the chicken and enjoyed it. From then on, the kitten and Claire were best friends. The kindness of Claire's heart was a blessing to the little kitten.

One day, Mommy and Daddy decided to go to the market. En route, they began to discuss something quietly.
When they arrived at the market, Daddy went to the fruit stall and filled a few bags with apples and oranges. Then, Daddy and Mommy went to the vegetable stall and bought some potatoes, carrots and onions.
When the shopping was done, Mommy and Daddy thanked the vendor and left the market. 
On the way back, the couple discussed how grateful they were for the fresh vegetables and fruits. They were excited to use them to make a delicious dinner. 
When they got home, they packed away the vegetables and fruits in their kitchen. With the ingredients they bought at the market, they knew they'd have a scrumptious dinner. 
The family sat down and enjoyed the dinner that Mommy and Daddy cooked. They felt so grateful for the market, which allowed them to have such a hearty meal. 
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little penguin named Pippin. Pippin lived in a cold place with ice and snow. He had many friends, but he was sad because he was very heavy. He could not run and play like the other penguins.
One day, Pippin met a big, strong penguin named Max. Max saw that Pippin was sad and asked, "Why are you sad, little penguin?" Pippin told Max, "I am heavy and cannot play with my friends."
Max wanted to help Pippin, so he had an idea. Max told Pippin, "Let's part the ice and make a slide!" They worked together and made a big, fun slide. Pippin went down the slide very fast because he was heavy. All the penguins laughed and clapped.
Now, Pippin was happy. He could play with his friends and have fun on the slide. Max and Pippin became best friends. They played together every day, and Pippin was never sad again.

Once upon a time, there was a kind and compassionate girl named Lily. She lived in a small house with a big yard. In the yard, there was a long hedge that went all the way around it.
One day, Lily wanted to measure the hedge to see how long it was. She took her little ruler and went outside. She started at one end of the hedge and measured all the way to the other end. It took her a long time, but she was happy to do it.
When she finished, she found out that the hedge was very long. Lily was proud of her hard work. She went back inside her house and told her mom and dad how long the hedge was. They were proud of her too. From that day on, Lily knew that she could do anything if she put her mind to it.

Once upon a time there was a little boy called Luke who was three years old. He sat on the grass with his friend Jackie, who was rubbing a pitch together. Jackie wanted to make a fire, but Luke was feeling very frustrated. 
"No!" he shouted. "I don't want to make a fire!" 
Jackie tried to be patient but she was getting tired. "Why don't you want to help?" she asked.
Luke looked down, not wanting to answer. He was getting angry because he didn't understand how rubbing the pitch together could make a fire. 
Jackie could tell he was feeling frustrated, so she stopped rubbing and said, "It's okay. I can help us make a fire without your help." She gave him a big smile, which made him feel better.
Luke smiled back. He watched as Jackie rubbed the pitch together until it caught on fire. He was very impressed and decided that playing with fire wasn't so bad after all.

Once upon a time, in a big sea, there was a little fish named Tuna. Tuna liked to dress up in her favorite clothes. She had a big day ahead, and she wanted to look her best. She put on her red hat and her blue scarf, and she swam away to find her friends.
Tuna swam past a lot of fish, but she could not find her friends. She felt sad and alone. Then, she saw a big sign. The sign said, "Party here! All fish welcome!" Tuna was very happy. She knew that her friends would be at the party. She swam as fast as she could to the party.
When Tuna got to the party, she saw all her friends. They were all dressed up too. Tuna was so happy that she had dressed up in her favorite clothes. She danced and played with her friends all day. At the end of the party, Tuna won a prize for the best-dressed fish. She was very proud and knew that her big day was a success.

Once upon a time, there was a bald man named Tom. He lived near a train station. Every day, he would go to the station and watch the trains go by. He loved the trains very much.
One day, a big wind came and blew Tom's hat away. He was sad because he valued his hat. The hat was a gift from his mom. He looked and looked for his hat, but he could not find it. He was very sad.
Then, something unexpected happened. A bird found Tom's hat and brought it back to him. Tom was so happy! He thanked the bird and learned that even when things seem bad, good things can happen too. And now, Tom and the bird were friends, and they went to the train station together every day.

Once upon a time, there were two friends. They really liked luxury things and wanted to print something special. They decided to buy a special slow printer.
The two friends carried the slow printer to their house. They were very excited and wanted to see what they could print.
They set up the slow printer and then carefully added the paper and dye. When the slow printer finished printing, the two friends saw a beautiful picture. It was a picture of a castle with a luxurious door. 
The two friends were happy with their slow printer. They decided to print many more pictures and use it to make their house even more luxurious. And that was how their slow printer turned their house into a castle.

Once there was a little girl called Lizzie who wanted to play with her friends. But Lizzie didn't have any friends and felt very lonely.
She decided to go sit in the park and look for some new friends. As she was sitting there, she saw another girl playing. Lizzie went up to her and said hello.
The girl was very friendly and gave Lizzie a beautiful bracelet as a gift.
Lizzie was so happy to have a friend and thanked her. However, when she came back the next day, the girl wasn't there. Lizzie was so sad, thinking she had lost her new friend.
Lizzie was determined to find her new friend, so she continued to sit in the park every day until she saw the same girl wearing her bracelet! Lizzie was overjoyed and the two girls quickly became the best of friends. 
From then on, Lizzie always had someone to play with and they are still best friends to this day.

Anna and Ben were playing with their hoops in the park. They liked to roll them, spin them, and jump through them. They had fun with their hoops, but they also felt very hot and tired.
"Let's go home and nap," Anna said to Ben. "We can play with our hoops again later."
"OK," Ben said. "But I want to take my hoop with me. It is my favorite hoop. It is red and shiny and big."
Anna nodded. She also liked her hoop, but it was just a regular hoop. It was blue and round and small. She did not mind leaving it in the park. She put it on the grass and followed Ben.
They walked home with their mom, who carried Ben's hoop for him. They drank some water and ate some cookies. Then they went to their room and lay down on their beds. They closed their eyes and fell asleep.
While they were napping, a dog came to the park. The dog saw the hoops and wanted to play with them. He ran to them and sniffed them. He liked the red and shiny and big hoop. He grabbed it with his teeth and ran away. He did not see the blue and round and small hoop. He left it on the grass.
When Anna and Ben woke up, they wanted to play with their hoops again. They put on their shoes and ran to the park. They looked for their hoops, but they only saw one.
"Where is my hoop?" Ben cried. "Someone took my hoop!"
Anna saw her hoop on the grass. She picked it up and gave it to Ben.
"Here, you can have my hoop," she said. "It is a regular hoop, but it is still fun. Maybe we can find your hoop later."
Ben smiled and hugged Anna. He took her hoop and thanked her. He rolled it, spun it, and jumped through it. He had fun with her hoop, but he also missed his hoop.
Anna watched him and felt happy. She did not need a hoop to play. She had her brother, and he was her best friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a big, smelly desk in his room. He liked to draw and paint on the desk. One day, Tim wanted to find his favorite toy car. It was under the desk.
Tim walked to the desk and looked down. He saw the toy car under the smelly desk. He bent down to get the car. But as he did, he started to stumble. He fell on the floor with a soft thud.
Tim got up and laughed. He picked up his toy car from under the desk. He played with it all day long, having lots of fun. Tim was very happy he found his favorite toy car. And he didn't mind that his desk was smelly.

One day, a big whale was in the sea. The whale was gifted. He could do many things that other whales could not do. He could jump very high and make big splashes. He could also sing very loud. All the fish and sea animals liked to watch him.
One day, the whale saw a little girl on a boat. She was sad. The whale wanted to make her happy. So, he jumped high and made a big splash. The girl saw the whale and smiled. The whale nodded to the girl, and she nodded back. They were friends now.
But then, something unexpected happened. The little girl jumped into the water and turned into a mermaid! She was a gifted mermaid who could change into a girl. Now, the whale and the mermaid were best friends. They played and sang together in the sea, making everyone happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. Amy loved to look for shells on the beach. One day, she found a big, pretty shell. It was hiding under the sand. The shell was very special.
Amy was very good at finding shells because she was persistent. She never gave up. She would look and look until she found a shell. When she found one, she would show it to her mom and dad. They would say, "Wow, Amy, good job!"
Amy took the special shell home. She wanted to reveal what was inside. She opened the shell and found a tiny, shiny pearl. Amy was very happy. She showed the pearl to her mom and dad. They were very proud of her. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, in an ordinary town, there lived a boy named Tim. Tim loved to run and play outside with his friends. One sunny day, Tim went to the park to play with his friends.
At the park, Tim saw a big jar of jam. It was on a table, and no one was around. Tim loved jam, so he decided to take the jar and share it with his friends. But as he picked up the jar, a big dog came running towards him. The dog wanted the jam too!
Tim was scared, but he didn't want to give up the jam. So, he started to run very fast with the jar of jam in his hands. The dog chased him, barking loudly. Tim ran faster and faster until he reached his friends. They all helped Tim to scare the dog away. In the end, Tim and his friends enjoyed the jam together, and they were all happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sally. Sally was very selfish. She was not willing to share her things with her friends.
One day, Sally was walking down the street when she saw a muffin on the ground. She was so excited and quickly picked it up. She was about to eat it when her friend Anne came running down the street.
Sally was so selfish that she did not want to share her muffin with Anne. So, she quickly put it in her pocket so no one else would see it.
But then, when Sally was walking away, she tripped and fell over. The muffin fell out of her pocket and she never saw it again. Sally was so sad and had learned her lesson. She knew that it was not nice to be selfish.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. The park was big and had many fun things to play with. Tim liked to run and jump in the park.
In the park, there was a thick bush. Tim saw a little bird in the bush. The bird was sad because it could not find its mom. Tim wanted to help the bird.
Tim said to the bird, "Don't be sad, little bird. I will help you find your mom." The bird was happy and said, "Thank you, Tim." They looked around the park and found the bird's mom near a tree. The bird and its mom were very happy. Tim went home with his mom, feeling good because he helped a friend.

One day, a boy named Tim found a bicycle. The bicycle was in a distant place, far from his home. It was a big bicycle, with red and blue colors. Tim wanted to ride the bicycle, but he was too small.
Tim saw his friend, Tom. Tom was a big boy who could ride the bicycle. Tim asked, "Tom, can you help me ride the bicycle?" Tom said, "Yes, Tim. I will help you."
Tom held the bicycle while Tim tried to ride. They went to a tree and saw a mark on it. The mark was a big red heart. Tim and Tom smiled and kept riding the bicycle together, having fun all day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play outside in the rain. Every time it rained, he would put on his boots and go splash in the puddles. 
One day, the rain was very heavy. Tim wanted to measure how much rain was falling. He took a big cup and put it outside to catch the rain. Tim thought this was a tough job, but he was excited to find out.
After a while, Tim checked the cup. It was full of rain! He smiled and thought, "Wow, that's a lot of rain!" Tim loved playing in the rain and measuring it too. And from that day on, he always tried to measure the rain when it fell.

Once upon a time, there was a penguin named Pippin. Pippin had a new friend, a seal named Sammy. They liked to play in the cold snow and swim in the icy water. They were very happy friends.
One day, Pippin met a pretty penguin named Polly. Pippin and Polly liked each other a lot. They wanted to be more than just friends. So, Pippin asked Polly to marry him. Polly said yes, and they were very happy.
Sammy the seal helped Pippin and Polly get ready for their big day. They had a fun party with all their friends. Everyone danced and ate yummy fish. Pippin and Polly were now married and they were very happy. And with their new friend Sammy, they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Bobo. Bobo was a regular bird who lived in a big tree. Every day, he would fly around and play with his friends.
One day, as the sun was going down and the sky turned pretty colors, Bobo and his friends saw the sunset. It was so beautiful that they all stopped to look at it. They were very happy to see the colors in the sky.
Suddenly, a big, scary cat came out from behind a bush. The cat tried to catch Bobo and his friends. They all screamed and flew away as fast as they could. The big cat could not catch them, and they were safe. After that, Bobo and his friends went back to their tree and told everyone about the sunset and the scary cat. They all laughed and played until it was time to sleep.

Once, there was a boy named Tim. Tim had a toy with a hook. He liked to play with it a lot. Tim's friend, Sam, saw the toy and felt jealous. Sam wanted a toy with a hook too.
One day, Sam went to Tim's house to play. They played with the toy with the hook, but then the toy broke. Sam was sad and scared because he broke Tim's toy. He thought Tim would be mad at him.
But Tim was not mad. He said, "It's okay, Sam. I have another toy with a hook." Tim showed Sam the new toy, and they played together. Sam was happy, and they were good friends again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a pale boy who loved to run and play with his friends. One day, Tim's mom told him to listen. She said there was going to be a big race in the park. The winner would get a shiny medal.
Tim was very excited about the race. He wanted to win the medal. So, he practiced running every day. He ran in the morning and in the evening. He ran until his legs were tired. Tim's friends saw him practicing and wanted to join too. They all practiced together, getting ready for the big race.
Finally, the day of the race came. Tim and his friends lined up at the starting line. The race began, and they all ran as fast as they could. Tim remembered to listen to his mom's advice and paced himself. In the end, Tim won the race! He got the shiny medal and showed it to his mom. She was very proud of him. Tim learned that if you work hard and listen, you can achieve your dreams.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Billy. Billy loved to fly high in the sky. One day, while flying, Billy saw dark clouds. He felt scared. It was his first time seeing a storm. 
Billy's mom saw him and said, "Billy, come back! You need to learn about storms. They can be scary and make you dizzy." Billy listened to his mom and flew back to their nest. His mom taught him how to stay safe in a storm.
From that day on, Billy always listened to his mom. He learned that storms can be scary, but if he listened and learned from his mom, he would be safe. The moral of the story is to listen and learn from those who care about you.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a very creative boy. He loved to draw, sing, and play with his toys. One day, Tim was playing in his room when his mom called him.
"Tim!" she shouted, "Come here, please."
Tim ran to his mom. She had a test for him. It was a fun test with colors and shapes. Tim was excited to do the test.
"Okay, Tim," said his mom, "Can you find the red circle?"
Tim looked at the test and found the red circle. He was happy and shouted, "I found it, mom!"
His mom smiled and said, "Good job, Tim! You are so creative and smart."
Tim finished the test and went back to playing in his room. He knew that being creative was a good thing and he was proud of himself.

Sara and Ben are twins. They like to play with their toys. One day, they find a big box in the garage. They want to make a fort with the box.
"Can we use this box, Mom?" Sara asks.
"Yes, you can, but be careful. Don't break it or hurt yourself," Mom says.
Sara and Ben drag the box to the living room. They put a blanket over the box. They cut a hole for a door. They lay some pillows and books inside the box. They have a cozy fort.
"Wow, this is a good fort!" Ben says.
"I know, right? We can read and nap here," Sara says.
They crawl into the box and close the door. They read some stories and giggle. They are happy and warm. They lay down and close their eyes. They fall asleep in their good fort. Mom smiles and watches them. She is proud of her twins.

Sara and Tom were friends who liked to play outside. One day, they saw a big fence with a sign that said "Keep Out". Sara wanted to climb the fence and see what was behind it. Tom thought it was a bad idea.
"Sara, we should not climb the fence. It is not ours. The sign says no. Maybe there is something scary or dangerous behind it," Tom said.
But Sara did not listen. She said, "Tom, you are a baby. I am not afraid. I want to have fun. I want to see what is behind the fence. Maybe there is a treasure or a castle or a unicorn."
Sara started to climb the fence. Tom tried to stop her, but she refused. She said, "Tom, you are crazy. You are boring. You are no fun. I am going to climb the fence and you can stay here."
Sara climbed the fence and jumped to the other side. She was happy for a moment. She looked around and saw a big yard with a lot of flowers and trees. She thought it was beautiful. But then, she heard a loud bark. She turned around and saw a big dog running towards her. The dog was angry and had sharp teeth. Sara was scared. She screamed and ran back to the fence. She tried to climb the fence, but it was too high. She was stuck.
Tom heard Sara scream and ran to the fence. He saw the dog and Sara. He was worried. He shouted, "Sara, are you okay? Hold on, I will get help. Stay calm, do not move."
Tom ran to the nearest house and knocked on the door. A nice lady opened the door. Tom told her what happened. The lady said, "Oh no, that is my dog. He is very friendly, but he does not like strangers. He thinks they are intruders. I will go and get him. Do not worry, he will not hurt your friend."
The lady went to the yard and called the dog. The dog stopped chasing Sara and came to the lady. The lady put a leash on the dog and apologized to Sara. She helped Sara climb the fence and gave her a hug. She said, "I am sorry, my dear. You must have been very scared. You should not have climbed the fence. It is not safe. The sign is there for a reason. You should always respect other people's property and privacy. You should also listen to your friend. He was right. He was trying to protect you. He is a good friend."
Sara felt ashamed and sorry. She said, "I am sorry, too. I was wrong. I was silly. I wanted to have fun, but I did not think of the consequences. I did not listen to Tom. He is a good friend. He is not crazy. He is not boring. He is not a baby. He is brave and smart and kind. I am lucky to have him as a friend."
Sara and Tom hugged and thanked the lady. They walked back to their homes and promised to never climb the fence again. They learned a valuable lesson that day. They learned to be careful, respectful, and grateful. They learned that sometimes, fun is not worth the risk. They learned that friendship is more important than curiosity.

One day, a little red car was driving down the road. The little red car had four wheels. One of the wheels was very lucky. The lucky wheel always helped the little red car go fast and safe.
As the little red car drove, it started to feel tired. "I need to rest," said the little red car. So, the little red car stopped near a big tree. The tree had lots of green leaves. The little red car and the lucky wheel took a nice rest under the tree.
After the rest, the little red car felt good again. The lucky wheel was ready to help the little red car go fast and safe. They drove down the road, happy and full of energy. The little red car and the lucky wheel had a fun day together.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a silly tire in his yard. He didn't know where it came from. He had a question in his mind. "Whose tire is this?" he thought. He decided to ask his friend, Sally, who lived next door.
Tim went to Sally's house and knocked on her door. Sally came out and saw the tire. "Sally, is this your tire?" Tim asked. Sally looked at the tire and shook her head. "No, Tim. That's not my tire," she said.
Tim and Sally thought about who else they could ask. They decided to ask their friend, Jack. They went to Jack's house and showed him the tire. Jack laughed and said, "That's a silly tire! But it's not mine." Tim and Sally were sad because they couldn't find the owner of the tire.
Finally, they decided to ask their teacher, Mrs. Brown. They brought the tire to school the next day. Mrs. Brown smiled and said, "Oh, that's the tire from our playground! Thank you for finding it!" Tim and Sally were happy that they solved the mystery of the silly tire.

Molly and Andy were playing in the garden. Molly pointed to the sky and said "Look, Andy! What's that?" Andy looked up and saw a big white bird flying above them.
Andy said excitedly, "I want to send the white bird a message!" Molly asked, "What message?" Andy thought carefully and then said, "Let's send it 'Happy days!'" 
Molly smiled and they waved up at the white bird as it flew away. Suddenly, something came falling down from the sky. It was filthy and a bit smelly. 
Andy laughed and said, "The white bird sent us a present. Let's open it!" Molly picked it up and was surprised to find a small box inside. She opened the box to find a pencil and a small card. The card said "Happy days!" 
Molly and Andy laughed and hugged each other in excitement. They waved goodbye to the white bird and ran back inside to write a message that they planned to send it.

One day, a little bird was soaring high in the sky. It had a pick in its beak and a powerful wings that could lift it up and down. The bird was searching for food for its nest. Suddenly it saw a mouse scurrying amongst the trees. 
The bird flew down and landed near the mouse. The mouse saw the bird and said, "What do you have there?"
The bird replied, "I have a pick. I'm using it to find food for my nest."
The mouse smiled and said, "That's very powerful! Here, you can use this."
The mouse gave the bird an acorn. The bird was so happy and thanked the mouse. It soared off into the sky with the pick in its beak and the acorn in its claws. From then on, the little bird used the pick to find food and the acorn to eat.
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a black cat named Kitty. Kitty liked to play with her friend, a little girl named Sue. They had a lot of fun together.
One day, Sue wanted to make a cake. She asked Kitty, "Can you help me with the cake?" Kitty said, "Yes, I can!" They went to the kitchen to get the things they needed. Sue mentioned, "We need some flour, sugar, and eggs."
Sue took a measure of flour and put it in a bowl. Kitty helped by adding sugar and eggs. They mixed it all together and put it in the oven. Soon, the cake was ready.
Kitty and Sue were so happy with their cake. They shared it with their friends and family. Everyone loved it and said it was the best cake ever. And they all lived happily ever after.

Lily likes to play with her toys in her room. She has dolls, cars, blocks and books. She makes a lot of noise when she plays. She does not like to clean up her toys. She leaves them on the floor, on the bed, on the table. Her room is very messy.
One day, her mom comes to her room. She says, "Lily, it is time to clean up your room. You have too many toys everywhere. You can trip and fall. You can break your toys. You can hurt yourself. Please put your toys in the box."
Lily does not want to clean up. She says, "No, mom. I want to play. I like my toys. I do not want to put them in the box. They are happy here."
Mom says, "Lily, you have to listen to me. Cleaning up is good. You can find your toys easily. You can make more space for new toys. You can be proud of your room. I will help you. Come on, let's start with the cord."
Lily looks at the cord. It is long and thin. It is from her lamp. She likes to turn it on and off. She says, "What is wrong with the cord, mom?"
Mom says, "The cord is dangerous, Lily. If you leave it on the floor, you can step on it. You can pull the lamp down. You can make a big noise. You can break the lamp. You can cut yourself. You can start a fire. You do not want that, do you?"
Lily shakes her head. She says, "No, mom. I do not want that. I do not want to be hurt. I do not want to break the lamp. I do not want to make a fire. I am sorry, mom. I will clean up the cord."
Mom smiles. She says, "That's good, Lily. I am proud of you. You are a good girl. You can hear me. You can learn. You can be safe. Let's clean up the cord together. Then we can clean up the rest of your toys. Then we can have a snack. How does that sound?"
Lily smiles too. She says, "That sounds good, mom. I love you, mom. Thank you for helping me. Thank you for teaching me. Thank you for caring for me."
Mom hugs Lily. She says, "I love you too, Lily. You are welcome, my sweet. You are my precious. You are my joy."

Once upon a time, a small bird was looking for something to eat. He hopped around in search of food, but found only rocks and stones. Suddenly, the bird saw a sight that lifted his spirits - a small bowl filled with seed! 
He hopped over to it and eagerly began to feed on the seed. But as the bird approached, he noticed that the bowl was not harmless. There was a sneaky cat lurking in the bushes who wanted to catch the bird for its supper.
The little bird was scared and quickly flew away from the scene. As he flew over the meadow, he plucked a few seeds and rested in a nearby tree. From that day on, the little bird always searched for seeds with care and caution before he started to feed.
The moral of the story is that we should always take care to make sure the things we do are harmless.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max loved to play outside in his yard. There was a big fence around his yard to keep him safe. Max was always ready to play with his ball.
One sunny day, Max saw a little bird on the fence. The bird looked sad. Max asked the bird, "Why are you sad?" The bird replied, "I lost my way home." Max wanted to help the little bird. He said, "Don't worry, we can find your home together."
Max and the bird went on a walk. They asked other animals if they knew where the bird's home was. Finally, they found the bird's home. The bird was so happy and said, "Thank you, Max!" Max replied, "You're welcome, friend!"
Max and the bird became good friends. They played together every day. The moral of the story is to always help others when they need it.

Once upon a time, in a small place, there was a red ball. The red ball liked to play with a little boy named Tim. Tim and the red ball would play every day in the park. They liked to play catch, and Tim would throw the red ball high up in the air.
One day, Tim threw the red ball very far away. The red ball was lost, and Tim was sad. He looked for the red ball all over the place, but he could not find it. Tim's mom said, "Don't worry, we will find the red ball."
The next day, Tim saw a big dog with the red ball. The dog was playing with the red ball, and it looked happy. Tim asked the dog, "Can I have my red ball back, please?" The dog liked Tim and gave him the red ball. Tim said "Thank you!" and the dog wagged its tail.
Tim and the red ball were happy to play together again. They would repeat their fun games every day in the park. The red ball and Tim became the best of friends, and they played in the same place, making sure to never lose each other again.

Once upon a time, there was a soft, velvet cat named Fluffy. Fluffy lived in an empty house. One day, Fluffy met a new friend, a little bird named Chirpy.
Fluffy said, "Hi, Chirpy! Why don't you come to my empty house? We can play there." Chirpy was happy and said, "Yes, Fluffy! Let's go to your house and play."
As they played, Fluffy tried to strike a ball with her paw. But she missed the ball and hit a big pot. The pot made a loud sound. Both Fluffy and Chirpy laughed.
They played all day and had lots of fun together. From that day on, Fluffy and Chirpy were best friends and the empty house was not empty anymore. It was filled with love, laughter, and fun.

Once upon a time, there was a lovely little toy pistol. It was a very nice toy. One day, the toy pistol saw a big ball. The toy pistol thought it would be fun to play with the big ball. So, the toy pistol went to the big ball and said, "Can I play with you?"
The big ball was happy to play with the toy pistol. They had lots of fun together. Then, the toy pistol had an idea. It said, "Why don't we invite more friends to play with us?" The big ball liked the idea. So, they went to find more friends.
They found a toy car and a doll. The toy pistol said, "Let's all play together!" They all played and had a great time. But then, something strange happened. The toy pistol turned into a real pistol! Everyone was scared. But the real pistol said, "I am still your friend. I just look different now." The toys understood and they all played together, still having a great time.

Once upon a time, a wolf lived in the forest. He was very thoughtful and always thought about how he could help the animals that lived in the forest. He was always looking for ways to help them out and bring them joy.
One day, the wolf was walking through the forest and he saw that a little rabbit was lost. He ran over to the little rabbit and asked her why she was lost. 
The little rabbit said, "I'm lost and I don't know how to get home." 
The wolf thought for a moment and then offered to take the little rabbit home. The little rabbit thought it would be okay to accept his help and so off they went.
As they walked, the wolf shared stories with her and showed her how to find her way home. Finally, they reached the little rabbit's home. 
The little rabbit was so grateful that the wolf had accepted her request for help and took her home safely. The wolf was happy to have helped and thought he had made the forest happy. 
The end.

One day, a cheerful boy named Tim went to a big hill near his home. He wanted to play on the hill. He saw his friend, Sue, at the top of the hill.
"Hi Sue! Can I play with you?" Tim asked. Sue said, "Yes, but my mom does not allow me to play with boys."
Tim was sad. He wanted to play with Sue, but her mom would not let her. Tim had an idea. He ran back to his home and talked to his mom.
"Mom, can you talk to Sue's mom? I want to play with her on the hill," Tim said. His mom agreed and went to talk to Sue's mom.
After a little while, Tim's mom came back with a smile. "Sue's mom will allow you to play with her now," she said. Tim was happy and ran back to the hill. He and Sue played together all day, and they had lots of fun.

One day, a brave little bird named Bob lived in a big tree. Bob loved to sing songs all day long. He sang when the sun came up and when the sun went down. His friends liked to hear his songs.
One day, while Bob was singing, he saw a big pot. He did not know what was in it. He wanted to find out, so he flew down to the pot. He used his beak to stir the pot. When he stirred the pot, something unexpected happened.
As he stirred the pot, a big cloud of colors came out. The colors were so pretty! The colors went up to the sky and made a big rainbow. Bob and his friends were very happy to see the rainbow. They sang a new song about the rainbow and the day they found the big pot.

Toby put his milk on the table. It was his favorite thing to drink. He was so proud that he had put it there all by himself. 
Suddenly, a loud noise scared him. He was very frightened. He quickly jumped and hid behind his chair. 
"Who's there?" Toby shouted. 
"It's just me - your mom." she answered. 
Toby felt relieved - he knew it was his mom's voice. He came out from behind the chair and smiled.
"Why did you put your milk on the table, Toby?" she asked. 
Toby explained that he was proud of himself for doing it all alone. His mom smiled and hugged him. 
"I'm so proud of you for being brave and putting the milk up on the table. You did a great job!" she said. 
Toby was so happy. He didn't feel frightened anymore - he felt proud and excited.

Once upon a time, there was a colorful bird named Lola. She loved to fly above her tree and explore the world around her. But Lola's wings were too small and she struggled to fly very high.
One day, Lola decided to set a goal. "I'm going to fly higher than my tree!" she declared. 
But her goal seemed so high. Lola tried and tried, but she kept falling back to the ground. She felt discouraged.
Just then, Luna, a butterfly flew by. "Lola! Why don't you try flapping your wings a bit slower?"
Lola listened to Luna's advice and tried again. This time, she kept flapping her wings slower and slower. Finally, she soared higher and higher until she was above her tree!
She was so proud of herself! Lola looked down and the world around her seemed so much bigger with the help of her colorful wings.

Once upon a time, there was a small bird named Timmy. Timmy was a normal bird who lived in a small shelter in a big tree. One day, Timmy saw a big storm coming. He was scared.
Timmy went to his friend, Sammy the squirrel. "Help me carry my things to a safe place," Timmy said. Sammy agreed to help. They both carried Timmy's things to a new shelter in another tree.
As they moved the last thing, the storm came. It was very strong. The wind blew hard and the rain fell heavy. Timmy and Sammy tried to hold on, but the wind was too strong. The storm broke the tree and their shelter was gone. Timmy and Sammy were sad. They wished they had stayed in their old shelter.

One day, a little dolphin named Dolly was swimming in the sea. She saw a big, tough fish. The fish looked sad. Dolly wanted to help the fish, so she swam up to him and said, "Hi, I am Dolly. Why are you sad?"
The tough fish said, "I lost my way home. I can't find my family." Dolly thought for a moment and said, "I will help you find your family!" The fish was happy and they swam together.
As they swam, they saw a big rock. It reminded Dolly of a place she knew. She said, "I know this place! Your family is near!" They swam around the rock and found the fish's family. The fish was so happy and said, "Thank you, Dolly!"
The unexpected thing was that the tough fish was really a gentle and kind friend. Dolly learned that you should not judge someone by how they look. The moral of the story is to always be kind and help others, no matter how they look.

Once there was a little girl named Lizzie. She was three years old and loved to explore the world. One day, she was playing in the backyard when she found a gray rock. She picked it up and thought it was very useful. She was so happy that she smiled.
Just then, a little bird came to visit her. He saw the rock and said, "That's a very nice rock! What are you going to do with it?"
Lizzie smiled and said, "I'm going to use this rock to make a secret garden!" The little bird smiled as he flew away.
Lizzie was excited and started to gather some other useful things. She collected a few sticks and leaves to help make her secret garden. Soon, she was smiling again. 
The next day, Lizzie spent the whole day outside, using her gray rock to make a beautiful secret garden. She was so proud of her work and she smiled with delight.

Once upon a time, a boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. Tim saw a weird bug. He wanted to catch it with his net. So, he started to follow the bug.
"Mom, look at the bug!" Tim said. "Can I catch it with my net?" His mom said, "Yes, but be careful."
Tim followed the bug and tried to catch it with his net. The bug moved fast, but Tim was faster. He caught the bug in his net! Tim showed his mom and she smiled.
They took the bug home and let it go in their garden. Tim and his mom watched as the bug flew away. They had a fun day at the park.

Once upon a time, in a small village on Earth, there lived a generous boy named Tom. Tom liked to share his toys and food with his friends. One day, Tom saw a new boy named Sam sitting alone. Sam looked sad.
Tom walked up to Sam and asked, "Why are you sad?" Sam said, "I don't understand the game the other kids are playing." Tom wanted to help Sam, so he said, "I can teach you the game."
Tom showed Sam how to play the game. At first, Sam did not understand, but Tom was patient. They played together until Sam learned the game. Soon, Sam was happy, and they became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a woman. She lived in a small house near a big tree. She loved to eat delicious apples from the tree. But the apples were too high for her to reach.
One day, the woman had an idea. She found a long stick. She used the stick to reach the apples on the tree. She was very happy because now she could eat the delicious apples.
The woman shared the delicious apples with her friends. They all loved the apples too. They played and laughed under the big tree. From that day on, they used the long stick to reach the apples and always had fun together.

One day, a big lion named Leo was walking in the forest. He had a very serious look on his face. He was looking for something very special.
Leo found a bottle of lotion near a tree. He picked it up and looked at it. Leo thought it might help his dry skin. He put the lotion on his paws and rubbed it all over his body. It felt good and made his fur soft.
As Leo walked back to his family, he felt happy and strong. He let out a loud roar that everyone could hear. His friends all came running to see the soft, happy lion. They all wanted to try the lotion too.

Once upon a time, there was a big dog named Sam. Sam had long hair that would get all over the floor. Sam's family did not like the hair, but they loved Sam very much.
One day, Sam saw a cat outside. The cat was not big and did not have long hair like Sam. Sam wanted to play with the cat, but the cat would ignore Sam. This made Sam very sad.
Sam's family saw how sad Sam was. They decided to give Sam a big hug and play with him. Sam was happy again. Even though the cat would ignore him, Sam knew his family loved him and his big hair.

Once upon a time, in a peaceful little town, there was a big blackboard. It stood in a small park where kids liked to play. One sunny day, a boy named Tom and a girl named Sue were playing near the blackboard.
Tom said, "Let's draw on the blackboard!" Sue agreed and they started to draw. They drew a big sun, a house, and some flowers. They were having lots of fun!
Suddenly, Tom felt a pinch on his arm. He looked around and saw a small crab holding a piece of chalk! The crab walked to the blackboard and drew a big smiley face. Tom and Sue were surprised, but they laughed and clapped. The crab became their new friend, and they all drew on the blackboard together.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a popular plant. This plant was very pretty and everyone liked it. The plant lived in a big, green park where kids liked to play.
One sunny day, a little boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. Tim saw the popular plant and said, "Mom, look at that pretty plant! Can we open it?" Tim's mom smiled and said, "Yes, Tim. We can open it and see what's inside."
Tim and his mom opened the plant and found a tiny, shiny key. Tim took the key and they went on a walk. They found a small box under a tree. Tim used the key to open the box. Inside, there was a note that said, "Thank you for opening the plant. You are now its friend!" Tim was very happy and he took care of the popular plant every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Spot. Spot had a new ball to play with. He loved to take the ball and run around in the park.
One day, Spot met a big dog named Max. Max saw Spot's new ball and said, "Can I play with your ball, please?" Spot was happy to share and said, "Yes, let's play together!"
They played and played until they were tired. After playing, Max's mom gave them a treat for being good friends. Spot and Max were happy and shared the treat. They became best friends and played together every day.

One day, a cheerful little dog went for a walk. He saw a big tire on the ground. The dog wanted to play with the tire. He barked and jumped around the tire. The tire was very big and fun to play with.
A little boy came to watch the dog play. He laughed and clapped his hands. The dog was happy to have a friend. The boy and the dog played with the tire together. They rolled the tire and chased after it.
The sun went down and it was time to go home. The boy and the dog were tired but happy. They had a fun day playing with the tire. The boy hugged the dog and said, "See you tomorrow, my friend!" The cheerful dog wagged his tail and went home.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big box of toys, but her favorite toy was a photo of her with her best friend, Tom. They played together every day, and Lily loved to look at the photo and smile.
One day, Lily saw Tom playing with another friend, Sue. Lily felt jealous because she wanted to play with Tom too. She sat down and started to weep. Her tears fell on the photo, making it wet.
Lily's mom saw her weeping and asked her why she was sad. Lily told her mom about Tom and Sue. Her mom hugged her and said, "It's okay to feel jealous, but Tom can have more than one friend. Why don't you go and join them?" So, Lily wiped her tears, picked up her photo, and went to play with Tom and Sue. They all had fun, and Lily was happy again.

One day, a little girl named Sue went to the store with her mom. They needed to buy some beef for dinner. Sue was very excited to help her mom. 
At the store, Sue's mom said, "Sue, please leave the beef here while I go get some other things." Sue did what her mom asked and waited by the beef. But then, she saw a hidden toy aisle and wanted to look at the toys. Sue thought, "I will just leave the beef here for a minute and come right back."
While Sue was looking at the toys, a boy named Tom came by and saw the beef. He thought someone left it by mistake. So, he took the beef to his mom. When Sue came back, the beef was gone! She was very sad and worried.
Sue found her mom and told her what happened. Her mom said, "Don't worry, we will find the beef." They looked around the store and saw Tom and his mom with the beef. Sue's mom said, "Excuse me, that beef is ours. My daughter left it here by mistake." Tom's mom said, "Oh, I am so sorry!" and gave the beef back to Sue.
Sue was happy to have the beef back and learned to never leave things alone. From that day on, she always stayed with her mom at the store.

One day, an elderly man named Tom went to the beach. He took his spade with him. He wanted to dig in the sand and make a big sandcastle. He walked slowly because he was old.
Tom met a little boy named Tim. Tim had a small spade too. Tim said, "Let's race to see who can dig the biggest hole!" Tom smiled and said, "Okay, let's race!"
They started to dig. Tom dug slowly with his big spade. Tim dug fast with his small spade. They dug and dug until they were tired. They looked at their holes. Tim's hole was bigger! Tom laughed and said, "You win! Good job!" They were both happy and played in the sand together.

Once upon a time, there was a playful dog named Spot. Spot loved to run and play with his friends in the park. One day, Spot saw a pretty belt on the ground. It was red and shiny. He wanted to show his friends, so he picked it up with his mouth.
Spot ran to find his friends, but they were not at the park. He felt sad, but he did not give up. He looked and looked until he found them. They were playing near a big tree. Spot ran to them with the belt in his mouth.
His friends saw the belt and were very happy. They took turns wearing the belt and playing with it. Spot was proud that he found the belt for his friends. They all played together and had lots of fun. Spot gained new friends because of the pretty belt.

Once there was a little girl and she wanted to go for a walk. She went outside and saw a big river. It was so smooth and it glimmered in the sun. She wanted to explore but she was scared.
So the girl asked her mom for help. Her mom found a long rope and dropped one end into the river. She told the girl to hold the other end and said, "Now, pull."
So the little girl grabbed the rope, and as she pulled, she started to go down the river. She felt the smooth rope glide through her hands and took in the beautiful scenery.
Soon she was back where she started, happy and smiling. She had a great adventure without leaving her backyard. From then on, she went river-pulling all the time.

Tom and Sam were friends. They liked to play with toys. One day, they found a big magnet in the garage. It was shiny and strong.
"Look, Tom, I have a magnet!" Sam said. "It can pull things to it. Watch!"
Sam held the magnet near a screw. The screw jumped to the magnet. Tom was amazed.
"Wow, that is cool, Sam!" Tom said. "Can I try it?"
"Sure, Tom, here you go." Sam gave the magnet to Tom. Tom smiled.
Tom looked around. He saw a car. It was his dad's car. It was red and shiny.
"I wonder if the magnet can pull the car," Tom said. "Let's act like we are driving it."
Tom ran to the car with the magnet. He put the magnet on the door. The magnet stuck to the door. Tom tried to open the door. He could not.
"Help, Sam, I can't open the door!" Tom shouted. "The magnet is too strong!"
Sam ran to the car. He tried to pull the magnet off the door. He could not.
"Help, Tom, I can't pull the magnet off!" Sam shouted. "It is stuck!"
They heard a loud noise. It was Tom's dad. He was angry.
"What are you doing with my car?" Tom's dad yelled. "You scratched the door with the magnet! You are in big trouble!"
Tom and Sam were scared. They wished they had not played with the magnet. They wished they had a reliable friend to help them. But they did not. They had a bad ending.

One day, a girl named Sue found a vase. It was not shiny. Sue wanted to make it impressive. She thought, "I will polish it!"
Sue got a soft cloth and started to polish the vase. As she polished, it got shinier and shinier. Sue was very happy. She showed her friend, Tom. Tom said, "Wow, that is a very impressive vase!"
Later, Sue and Tom played near the vase. They were careful not to break it. Sue said, "Let's be careful with our impressive vase!" Tom agreed. They played and had lots of fun.
In the end, Sue and Tom put the vase in a safe place. They were proud of their impressive vase. And they knew that they could make things beautiful by polishing them.

Once upon a time, in a far away valley, there lived a man named Tom. Tom liked to sell things. One day, he found a big rock. Tom thought the rock was very special, so he wanted to sell it.
Tom went to his friend, Sam, and said, "Sam, do you want to buy my big rock? It is very special." Sam looked at the rock and said, "No, Tom. That rock is bad. I do not want it."
Tom was sad, but he did not give up. He went to another friend, Ann, and said, "Ann, do you want to buy my big rock? It is very special." Ann looked at the rock and said, "No, Tom. That rock is bad. I do not want it."
Tom was very sad. He went back to the valley with his big rock. He sat down and cried. The big rock was not special at all. It was just a bad rock. And so, Tom never sold the rock, and he stayed sad in the valley.

John had a puppy. It was cute and fluffy, and he loved it. But lately it had been behaving strangely. It was very troubled.
One day, John's mom asked him why his puppy was so troubled. John shook his head and said, "I don't understand."
Then, mom said, "Maybe if you try talking to it, it will understand what it's feeling."
That night, John knelt down by the puppy. He looked into its eyes, and he told it how much he loved it. He asked why it was so worried.
The puppy barked and wagged its tail, and John finally understood. It was scared of the thunder! John hugged the puppy and it seemed to feel a little better.

One day, a little girl named Lucy went to the store with her mom. They needed to buy some sugar to make a cake. Lucy was excited because she loved cake.
In the store, Lucy saw a big bag of sugar. She said, "Mom, can we get this one?" Her mom said, "Yes, let's get that sugar." Lucy was grateful and gave her mom a big hug.
As they walked home, Lucy saw a cat. The cat was running fast, but Lucy wanted to pet it. She said, "Stop, cat! I want to pet you!" The cat stopped, and Lucy petted it gently. The cat was happy, and so was Lucy. They went home and made the cake, and it was the best cake ever.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue was a regular girl who liked to play with her toys. One day, she saw a new toy figure on her shelf. She wondered where it came from.
Sue asked her mom, "Mom, where did the new toy come from?" Her mom smiled and said, "It's a surprise for you, Sue. Let's play with it!" So, Sue and her mom played with the new toy figure all day.
But at night, something unexpected happened. The toy figure started to glow and talk! It said, "Hello, Sue! I'm a magic toy here to be your friend!" Sue was so happy to have a magic toy friend. They played together every day and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Tim. He was flying in the sky when a strong wind came. The wind made Tim feel helpless. He could not fly well because of the wind. Tim was sad and scared.
Then, a big bird named Sam saw Tim. Sam asked, "Why are you sad?" Tim said, "The wind is too strong. I feel helpless. I want the wind to vanish." Sam wanted to help Tim.
Sam had an idea. He told Tim to fly close to him. Tim did what Sam said. Together, they flew through the strong wind. Soon, the wind started to vanish. Tim was happy and thanked Sam for his help. From that day on, Tim and Sam were best friends.

Once there was a special machine. It was very delicate and was used to heal people who were hurting. People were very happy to use the machine because it helped make their pain go away.
One day a 3 year old saw the machine and wanted to play with it. He didn't know it was delicate and pulled a few of its parts off. He felt very sad but tried to put the pieces back on.
Unfortunately, the machine was too delicate to be fixed. The 3 year old cried and told his parents what happened. His family was so sad but they tried to make him feel better. They knew the machine couldn't be healed.

Once upon a time, there was a little fish named Finny. Finny lived in a big pond with his fish friends. One day, Finny saw a girl named Sally near the pond. Sally was painting a pretty picture of the pond and the fish.
Finny swam up to Sally and said, "Hi! Can you paint me too?" Sally smiled and said, "Yes, I can paint you, Finny!" So, Sally painted Finny in her picture. Finny was very happy to see himself in the painting.
But then, a big wind came and blew the painting into the pond. Finny and Sally were both very sorry. The painting was wet and the colors were all mixed up. Sally said, "I can paint a new picture, Finny." Finny smiled and said, "Thank you, Sally!" And they were both happy again.

Once upon a time there were two friends, Jake and Sophia. They were both very excited.
"Come on, Jake! Let's go to the park and play," said Sophia.
"Yeah! Let's go!" said Jake excitedly.
They ran to the park together and saw something amazing. There was a big, wide rocket sitting in the middle of the park.
"Wow! A rocket! Can we go inside it?" asked Jake. 
"Yeah, let's go!" said Sophia.
So they went inside the rocket, and they explored its big, wide rooms. 
"This is so much fun! Let's play pretend!" said Sophia excitedly.
So Jake and Sophia spent the day playing inside their big, wide rocket. They had so much fun that day!

One day, a cat and a dog went to play near a river. The cat, named Kitty, saw a big fish in the water. She wanted to catch it. The dog, named Buddy, saw that the river was moving fast. He knew it was not safe.
Buddy said, "Kitty, don't go near the water. It's not safe. The water is very fast. It can take you away." Kitty listened to Buddy and stayed away from the river. She did not want to be in serious trouble.
To prevent Kitty from going near the river, Buddy found a ball to play with. They played catch and had lots of fun. They forgot about the fish in the river. They were happy playing together and being safe.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Jane. She had a pet bird, it's name was Peep. One day, Jane was playing in the garden and she saw something in the grass. It was a lime. 
Jane was very excited and brought the lime over to show Peep. She said, "Look Peep, I found a lime!" But Peep didn't look so happy. Jane asked him, "What's wrong Peep?" 
Peep said, "Jane, I'm worried that if we eat the lime, it won't spread and give us more limes. We should leave it so it can grow." Jane agreed and they decided to leave the lime in the empty garden. 
Jane and Peep went inside and Peep said, "I'm glad we left the lime in the garden, now more will grow!" Jane smiled and gave Peep a hug.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who wanted to find an oasis. She and her mom had been travelling through the hot desert for days, and the little girl was very thirsty.
"Mom, can we find an oasis soon?" she asked hopefully.
"I hope so," her mom replied. "Until then, we have to keep walking."
Just then, the little girl spotted a shimmering pool of water off in the distance. "Look Mom, it's an oasis!" she said excitedly. 
The little girl ran towards the pool, but her mom shouted, "Stop! That could be dangerous."
But the little girl kept running. 
Unfortunately, it wasn't an oasis after all. It was just a mirage. The sands swallowed the little girl, and she was never seen again. 
The mom was heartbroken and never stopped looking for her daughter.

Once upon a time, a little fish was swimming near the shore. The fish felt helpless because it was lost. It did not know how to get back to its family.
One day, a kind bird saw the fish and wanted to help. The bird said, "Don't worry, little fish. I will help you find your family." The bird put the fish on its back and flew high up in the sky.
As they flew, the bird and the fish talked. The fish said, "Thank you for helping me." The bird said, "You're welcome. I am happy to help." They flew until they found the fish's family near the shore. The fish was so happy to be home and thanked the bird again. From that day on, the fish and the bird were the best of friends.

Once upon a time, there was a friendly pigeon. The pigeon liked to play with kids in the park. One day, the pigeon saw a boy with a toy that could spray water. The pigeon wanted to play with the boy and the toy.
The boy saw the friendly pigeon and started to spray water at it. The pigeon was wet and flew away. The boy was sad because he wanted to play with the pigeon. But then, something unexpected happened.
The pigeon came back with more friendly pigeons. They all started to spray water at the boy with their wings. The boy laughed and played with all the pigeons. They all had fun and became good friends.

Tom and Sue were playing with blocks. They liked to make big buildings with the blocks. They had many colors of blocks: red, blue, yellow, green.
"Look at my building!" Tom said. "It is very tall and strong. It has a door and a window and a roof."
"Your building is ugly!" Sue said. "It has too many colors. It looks like a mess. My building is better. It is only blue and yellow. It is very pretty and neat."
Tom felt sad and angry. He did not like what Sue said. He wanted to quit playing with her. He had an idea. He waited for Sue to look away. Then he pushed her building with his hand. All the blocks fell down. Sue's building was gone.
"Hey!" Sue shouted. "What did you do? You broke my building! That was mean!"
Tom laughed. He felt happy. He thought he had won. He did not see what was behind him. Sue had another idea. She picked up a big red block. She threw it at Tom's building. The block hit the roof. Tom's building also fell down. Tom's building was also gone.
Tom and Sue both looked at their broken buildings. They both felt sad and angry. They both wanted to quit playing with blocks. They both started to cry. They had no fun. They had no friends. They had learned a lesson.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to play outside. One day, it was very wet. Sue put on her boots and went to play in the puddles.
As she played, Sue found a shiny gem. She picked it up and said, "Wow, what a pretty gem!" A frog hopped out of the puddle and said, "That gem is mine. Can I have it back?" Sue looked at the frog and said, "Yes, you can have your gem back."
The frog was very happy to receive his gem. He said, "Thank you, Sue!" Sue felt good helping the frog. She played with the frog and the gem until the sun came out. Then, they said goodbye and Sue went home.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He liked to play outside with his friends. One day, dark clouds came and it started to rain. Tim was sad because he could not play outside. He looked out the window and saw deep puddles in his yard.
Tim's mom saw him looking sad. She said, "Don't worry, Tim. You can still have fun inside." Tim nodded and smiled. He decided to build a fort with his toys and blankets. He made a cozy space where he could hide and play.
As Tim played in his fort, he heard a loud noise. It was the sound of thunder and lightning. Tim was scared, but his mom came to sit with him. She said, "It's just the storm, Tim. It will go away soon." Tim felt better with his mom by his side. They read stories and played games until the storm was over.

One day, a healthy cat named Sam went on a walk. He saw a big drain on the side of the road. Sam was very curious about the drain. He wanted to look inside it and see what was there.
Sam jumped up and down to see inside the drain. He could not see anything. Sam had an idea. He would number his jumps to see how high he could go. One, two, three, four, five! Sam jumped five times and finally saw inside the drain.
Inside the drain, Sam saw a little mouse. The mouse was scared and wanted to get out. Sam helped the mouse by using a stick. The mouse was very happy to be out of the drain. Sam and the mouse became good friends and played together all day.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He was very eager to play with his friends outside. But his mom said, "You must wash your hands with soap first." Tim did not want to wash his hands. He wanted to play right now!
Tim went outside to play without washing his hands. He and his friends played and played. They had so much fun! But then, Tim started to feel sick. He remembered that he did not use soap to wash his hands.
Tim went back home to his mom. He told her he felt sick because he did not listen to her. His mom gave him some medicine and told him to rest. Tim learned that it is important to always remember to use soap. From that day on, he never forgot to wash his hands again.

Once upon a time, in a small pond, there was a frog named Fred. Fred was a spoiled frog because he always wanted things his way. One day, Fred saw a big, red ball near the pond. He wanted to play with it.
Fred's friend, a fish named Finn, saw the ball too. Finn was a smart fish and he warned Fred, "Don't play with the ball. It might be dangerous." But Fred did not listen to Finn. He jumped out of the pond and went to the ball.
Fred played with the ball all day long. The ball rolled into the woods and Fred followed it. When he got to the woods, he saw a big, scary wolf. The wolf saw Fred and wanted to eat him. Fred was scared and he remembered Finn's warning.
Fred quickly jumped back to the pond and told Finn everything. Finn said, "I told you it was dangerous. You should listen to your friends." From that day on, Fred learned to listen to his friends and not be a spoiled frog. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time there were two best friends. One day, the two decided to explore a mysterious cave near their home.
The two friends ventured toward the dark cave and entered the entrance. As soon as they stepped in, they felt cool air on their faces. 
"What's this?" asked the first friend.
"It looks like a laundry," replied the second.
